Reviews.Title: “Do not stay at this hotel”
Reviews.Author: moonbounce1
Reviews.Content: I was in Puerto Rico and stayed at this hotel April 17 thru April 21st. This hotel is dirty. Our shower had mold and there was hair in the corners of the bathroom that housekeeping could never seem to get up. Housekeeping is severely lacking at this hotel. There was a bed pillow on the floor when I left the room for it to be cleaned. When my husband and I came back to the room after it had been "cleaned", the pillow was still there - on the floor. Housekeeping would not change out our coffee cups. The same dirty coffee cup was there until we checked out. They also did not want to change the sheets on the bed. Finally, I decided to take the sheets off of the bed, along with the comforter and put them in a pile on the floor. Housekeeping got the hint and changed our sheets. In regards to the mold on the shower, I get fed up with that too and I finally just took a towel and started cleaning some of the mold off. Pretty gross!!!The corridors and hallways needed vacuuming as well. My husband arrived a couple of days before I did, and the room he was originally checked into was dirtier than the second room. He could not take it. He moved to the second room and was charged a 25.00 additonal rate per night because the second room had a view of the ocean. The hotel never took into consideration that the reason my husband had to move was because of the filthiness of the room. Also, in the first room my husband saw the bug called the silverfish. There were a couple of them crawling around on the floor. Needless to say, please don't stay at this hotel.....it was utterly filthy!! We would have moved, but it was the chosen conference hotel and we had already paid. Other attendees were complaining about the conditions of their rooms as well. So again, stay clear.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay!!!”
Reviews.Author: Nina132
Reviews.Content: Hotel is great. It's close to Old San Juan. Bus stop is in front of hotel and cost $ 0.75 . Bus comes every 30 minutes. Beaches are nice in this area. My husband and me really like it here.We also got upgrade room cause it was our honey moon and we didn't needed to pay any extra for that. Room was so clean and nice. Everybody there make us to feel really welcome.

Reviews.Title: “Business trip, perfect spot”
Reviews.Author: redserpent
Reviews.Content: Great location, near enough the tourist spots and old city but not too close. Make a note of USD 20 for most cab fares to surrounding shopping mall, industrial areas with corporate office space, and to the old city. Standard service, not extraordinary but a safe pick. There's a Denny's an a Starbuck's a few paces from the front desk so you will always have comfort food and a nice late nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great amenities”
Reviews.Author: Cook27
Reviews.Content: Very attentive staff adds to the value of this hotel. Wonderful restaurants within. Nice pools with beach access on site. Room was clean, comfortable. Would recommend Conrad San Juan Condado!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel with a few areas for improvement”
Reviews.Author: Widetraveler
Reviews.Content: Beautiful common areas, rooms, restaurants, easy access to highway, pleasant employees. A few hiccups: checked in, carried my luggage all the way across the skyway, up the elevator in the other tower, just to find a room with unmade bed. Back down again, waited 15 mins while another guest argued with the front desk about their reservation (and nearby another argued over a bill), then finally got a new room - but they did give me a nicer room on a higher floor. The second note is that the skyway smells like an armpit (or worse) - I noticed this during a previous stay a year ago. Surely they must be able to correct this. Other than that, a very nice place. However, Caribe Hilton is nicer, as it has a beach.

Reviews.Title: “Best place to stay in San Juan”
Reviews.Author: Sofocona
Reviews.Content: I travel a lot, and have been in San Juan many times. This hotel is trylynthe best,- it has few restaurants, casino, beach, couple bars, great spacious rooms, and great design. I always come back here.

Reviews.Title: “Interesting decor.”
Reviews.Author: brian61982
Reviews.Content: Large rooms. Clean. Great location. You can walk up and down the street and there are several nice places to eat. The hotel has a casino if you like to gamble. Decor looks like something from the 60's, like something from a movie. Nice though. Watch out for the parking charges and resort fees.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel on the Water”
Reviews.Author: ToolbeltDiva_23
Reviews.Content: The room is wonderful. King soze bed with a cityview that includes a view of the llagoon. The room has a shower only and no tub. The ammenities are nice as well. I am not giving a higher score for this hotel as the front desk staff is lacking. The hote has activities all day long for all ages. Watersports are avalable as well as equipment rental. This is a good home base for your next trip to San Juan

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay + extra information on area...”
Reviews.Author: 33xtina
Reviews.Content: We arrived in San Juan on a Saturday morning after a red eye flight from the West Coast. We arrived a day early to enjoy San Juan before our cruise departed on Sunday night. I booked 1 night at the Conrad based on it's location, looks, price and previous reviews. We have a family of 4 so 2 beds in the main tower with city views. We could see the port and the bay from our balcony. I didn't feel the need to pay extra for an ocean view for 1 night and we were not going to be in our room much anyway, so why bother? The room was comfortable and nice modern decor. Comfy beds, cool bathroom with a fully glass enclosed shower, a balcony and no bedbugs (yes I checked). I saw 2 pools, both were nice, we went to the small (very small) beach and let the youngest play in the sand, it was nice and calm and relaxing. Beach chairs are free with hotel bracelet from the towel stand. We were starving so played it safe and easy at Dennys for our first meal, it's in the hotel (other side) so with kids, we knew it was safe. Starbucks (a must for me) was in the hotel, so that was our #1 stop!!! Saturday night we did the bioluminescent bay tour in Fajardo. I booked it 4 weeks ago on line and would highly recommend doing that...you can't wait till you are there, they sell out fast. It's far, about 1.5 hour drive, so pay extra for the transportation they offer instead of a taxi. I booked with Kayaking Puerto Rico (.com) and had a great experience and we all loved it, kayaking in moonlight in dark mangroves to see the water slowly start to glow as you glide through the water is a very memorable experience! Only 5 in the world, and 3 are in Puerto Rico...this should not be missed! On sunday morning we checked out and had the hotel hold our bags while we walked down Ashford till we found a Puerto Rican restaurant that we could try. We found a good one about a good mile or so down on the opposite side of the road, and of course I can't recall the name of it (sorry) But I tried the Mofongo with white fish and it was so delicious!!! A safe first taste of a Puerto Rican dish. Took a taxi from the hotel to the port in old town and checked in at the ship and dropped off our bags then left the ship to tour old town and El Morro for a few hours. Walked to El Morro...it's a distance, but doable...just have water or stop and buy some icy drinks along the way! So tasty!! ABSOLUTELY BEAUTIFUL old city! We were back to the ship by 5 p.m. got our luggage and explored the ship, ate, saw the ship leave and we were off to a fabulous trip. I would recommend this hotel for a stay in San Juan...next time I think I will try a hotel in old town for the experience for one night and then travel to the Caribbean side of the island and stay at a resort for a few more days...mix it up. I hear the rainforest is really cool...but no time to see on this trip, next time for sure!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good for the business traveller”
Reviews.Author: Kavita D
Reviews.Content: This hotel is nicelt situated between the airport and San Juan. It also allows for great views, and great dining options nearby - within walking distance. The recently opened 24 hour Denny's on the property is quite useful for late night snacks, or early breakfast take aways before leaving for the airport. The Starbucks on the compound also provides excellent quick fix options. The locks on room doors were being repaired during my stay, and I did have some reservation about safety. But I did not experience any untoward events. The check in process was a bit engthy for me, some of the hotel staff are certainly trained better, and have more experience than others. The bulb on the night lamp at my bed was not working.

Reviews.Title: “Be careful of your hotel reservation”
Reviews.Author: peachesma
Reviews.Content: American Airlines had this special with air/hotel and continental breakfast. I took the city view supposedly overlooking the lagoon instead of ocean view. It was raining when I got there. After checking in at the front desk, luggage was brought to the room by a hotel worker. We had to go through a catwalk (covered over) from main bldg to the one I was staying in. After getting into the room, looked out the window and saw that I was looking over the catwalk into the bldg across where I checked in. Called the front desk and was told "it was a city view". I stated this was not what I had booked. They retorted, yes it was. As it was raining almost the entire stay, I didnot care. I, thank goodness, had booked the hotel with a casino. Needless, to say, I was there every day.

Reviews.Title: “not for beach lovers !!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: fellacher
Reviews.Content: Paid for an upgrade to ocean front..worth the money ....Found the property and room to be clean and maintained..The housekeeping staff were always busy shampooing carpet etc etc.Our room was nice beds very comfortable.It had a nice sheeting cover/duvet covered goose down .a BUSY CASINO which was quite large.The two main pools near the water were a bit noisy, so we opted for the third pool outside the gym. small but quiet.......The beach is nonexistent....We have traveled the Caribbean extensively and this was quite a let down....

Reviews.Title: “Loved our stay!”
Reviews.Author: NatalyaVqs
Reviews.Content: We lucked out selecting this place, it's a great hotel! Well located, the rooms are spacious and cute, bright orange curtains, clearly recently renovated, balcony with views of Condado lagoon. The bathroom is a treat - huge, with glass shower in the middle, a rush of hot water, awesome!!! The lobby is modernistic, not my fave, but cute nonetheless.

Reviews.Title: “Not Up to Par for a Hilton Property”
Reviews.Author: M J
Reviews.Content: I am writing this review while I am staying at this property. I typically stay at Hilton properties and I am a HIlton Honors member. The property appears dated and not very well maintained. The shower is just gross. For nearly $400/night including the 16% resort fees, I expect a shower that appears clean and without visible mildew/mold. Neither television worked properly and we had to put a call into maintenance. I booked a city view junior family suite. I guess I have a different vision of what a city view should be. It should not be a view of the ocean tower of the same property. I am staying on the third floor and the road below is very noisy. If you think that you might want to enjoy the beach, forget it. It really is not a beach. It is a small strip of sand next to the main drag and it certainly is not private in any way. Stopped at Aqua for lunch at around 2:30pm. Not many patrons but there sure were plenty of tables--all of them dirty. Waited several minutes for someone to remove dirty plates and utensils. Waited another 20 minutes for someone to actually clean the table. Went for two drinks and some appetizers, finally left nearly 1.5 hours later, not because we took our time but because the service was terribly slow. Perhaps they were short staffed due to Good Friday. Perhaps the service is just poor. I also don't appreciate the resort fee add-on when we did not use any of the amenities. Overall, it is hard to believe that this is a Hilton property. I will not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “cape cod traveler”
Reviews.Author: yankeeboy28
Reviews.Content: great view of ocean and sounds from 9th floor,very clean..huge room,huge bathroom.staff were all very nice and polite,got an hour later check-put,couldn't check in early,but still used all the facilities.fantastic value,great location

Reviews.Title: “Just OK”
Reviews.Author: limegreen28
Reviews.Content: My best friend and I stayed here for 4 nights this March (we're 29) and I would not rush to come back. The hotel lobby is very outdated- looks like it hasn't been remodled since the 70s. We had a very long line to check-in and were not told how to access pool towels or given any helpful information. The staff isn't the friendliest. We were told that we would be called when our room was ready and we were not, we had to wander back and wait on the line all over again. The room was nice- I would DEFINITELY request the main building with an ocean view. We were on the 8th floor and hear no noise, but the view of the street/roof is ugly. The shower was very relaxing and the beds very comfortable. Our room was cleaned daily. The pools are the best part- it is very pretty outside, but if you are looking for a beach, there really isn't one. It is right by the road/ bridge and the sand is very orange and not smooth. The larger pool with the slide has a younger atmosphere with very loud party music. Luckily you can't hear the music from the back pool if you want more of a relaxing reading environment. The hotel food was not good, and the drinks were not mixed- they hand you a pina colada and all the rum is at the top- how hard is it to mix it for a second? If you go I would definitely walk left out of the building for food or go to Starbucks for breakfast. There is no night life at the hotel, I would recommend going into Old San Juan. This hotel was OK, it ended up being fine because we met some fun people and really just hung out by the pool. We had a great time but I would stay in Old San Juan if I were to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous, but there were some real problems”
Reviews.Author: Prreader
Reviews.Content: When you come into the lobby, you are struck with a very nice resort feel. Check in was a breeze and the room was quite nice and clean. I recommend an ocean view because the street view is less than spectacular. This was our third time staying at this hotel. We reserved through priceline each time. The Mezzanine level has an ice cream store which was reasonably priced and the kids really enjoyed. There is a Starbuck's downstairs and Chili's is within an easy walking distance. There is a small beach at which you can swim or snorkel on the property. The pool is really fun. There was a very large one with a waterslide that looked like El Moro and then another pool. There was also a large hot tub. None of the pools was crowded and we could always find a lounge chair when we went swimming. The kids had a great time. You can check out towels for free until 6pm. After 6pm, you are on your own. The beds were incredibly comfortable and they come with four pillows each. The sheets were a high thread count and were clean. My problem was that my room was never cleaned. I found out that because my room was done through priceline's (name your own price), they made back to back reservations instead of one continuous, so the hotel had actually put us in another room on their computers. So, when our room still wasn't clean by 3 pm it was because housekeeping's computers showed our room as unoccupied. Understandable mistake. So, when I talked to housekeeping at 3pm, I expected our room to receive some attention. By 4:30, no one had come. I went down to the front desk and talked with them. They called housekeeping. 5:30, no cleaning. Ok, we are going to dinner. I went by the desk again and told them we were going to dinner and could they clean the room. Of course. We got back at 8pm and the room still hadn't been cleaned. I called the desk and talked to them again and asked at least if they could bring up towels. They said of course and that a manager would call me. No manager called and I had to call again for the towels. This was SO unacceptable for a resort hotel, especially a Hilton. The bathrooms in the swimming area had 3 out of 4 locks broken off and the door was filthy with dust. It was not what I expect for a Hilton. If I priceline "name your own price" for a resort, I will be sad if Conrad Condado is picked again for us. Upon check out, I did speak with a manager and he apologized and took off the two days of our parking charge. That was nice, but I would rather have had my trash emptied.

Reviews.Title: “Good for business stay”
Reviews.Author: LoveToVacateMichigan
Reviews.Content: Stay here occasionally for business. 15 minutes from airport. I have had rooms by ocean (street side) and rooms across streat (facing ocean North). Both were big, modern. Hotel has nice bar/food/options. Walk East a couple blocks for nice dining and name brand shopping.

Reviews.Title: “Great Suite - resort - eh..”
Reviews.Author: KellyGL2012
Reviews.Content: We booked a Jr Suite and Loved the room! It was almost like we had our own condo with living room, hallway, huge bedroom with a jacuzzi tub, and a large restroom. I would give the room 4 stars if I could. We did not like how low to the ground the bed was and that the balcony was so small (city view). the resort itself was just ok. When we first walked in we were slightly impressed. the lady at the check in was SO nice. wish I could say the same for the two ladies during check out - wow - they were VERY RUDE! everyone else was extremely helpful and nice. as we ventured around the resort it was less impressive.. the casino is a joke. I think our room might have been bigger? ;-) it did not look as if anyone was winning in there, and the staff inside (dealers and cashiers) seem to HATE their job. The nigtlife was nonexistent which was fine, since it was just the two of us, but it seemed the only people enjoying themselves were from a wedding party. The pools were nice. We were in the tower so it was nice to have a totally separate pool, right on the lagoon as well. The hotel hallways need to be renovated. There were stains all over the carpet. I wish I could say that we would return, however, I'm not sure that we would, just because of what we paid for it. If we got a good deal, yes, but I would not pay what I did for this hotel. Their are much nicer hotels in the area that I could have dropped little more on and had a better overall experience.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed in Hilton.”
Reviews.Author: Colorado-ean
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Conrad while on family vacation in San Juan, Puerto Rico. Arrived at hotel at 11:30pm (most people do travel all day & arrive at night). Only thing we were given upon checking in was room key cards in a card holder, no facility info guides given. Next day, stopped at concierge desk, asked for facility map, met with blank stares by staff. Finally given a "layout" map that only showed half of the facility, so my family just had to wander around & find stuff on our own. Room was two double beds, bedding was nice, nicely decorated, with a stupendous view of the Atlantic from 8th floor. Bathroom looked really cool, with its box-style shower in the middle of bathroom with clear walls. Wasn't functional when trying to shave my legs, as there was no bench in shower & the acrylic walls were too slick & water from shower head sprayed entire shower area. Also, shower leaked from under the door, and had to keep many towels down to soak up the water. Security bar on door was loose. Went to private beach/lagoon, was acosted by staff on beach when I tried to use a lounge chair, told were for hotel guests only, informed staff that I was a guest, then told that I needed to go & get a wrist band that let them know I was guest. Explained that I was given no instructions upon checking in, & could they please point me in direction to get this taken care of. At this point, staff realized that I had no clue, wasn't given one upon check-in, & became friendlier & helpful. Spoke to another guest who complained that she endured same confussion. Just too let people know, this is not a kid-friendly resort, besides the pools & lagoon. Ate at Eight Noodles restaurant in the hotel, wasn't impressed. Tried the sushi, not good, then tried the low mein & kung pao chicken, figuring that those were pretty easy asian dishes, & those didn't have any flavor, & was overly, overly expensive! Facility was clean, staff seemed less than helpful. We did receive $100 room credit, which helped to pay the Eight Noodles bill! For the price, I expected better customer service.

Reviews.Title: “Move on down the street”
Reviews.Author: scott0506
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this property for one night after our cruise on March 19th. We had noticed the property on previous trips to San Juan. We arrived early (they always kick you off the ships by 10AM) and even though the hotel seemed empty, we couldn't check in until 4PM so we pretty much had a wasted day. Walked the "beach" for a few minues but it turned out to be a small strip of sand with rocks at one end and a busy bridge and traffic at the other. As well, the beach was crowded with locals with loud boom boxes and a couple guys trying to sell us drugs. The hotel lobby area looks tired and almost appears under construction. The whole property just looks "tired". When we finally got to our room, it was strangly configured with the toilet, shower (no tub), closets, bar fridge etc all in one room and the beds in another. So if the toilet was busy, forget about someone else getting clothes, ice or anything else. Our son jumped in the shower,only to find that the shower drain was plugged, flooding the room. We had to use all the towels to soak up the water. Called the front desk but no one seemed to care. Called again and still nothing. Finally gave up..no towels, no shower for the rest of our stay. The room faced the street and the street noise was unbelievable. Must be single pane glass which provided little noise protection. All in all, far, far below what one wouild expect from a Conrad property. Go on down the street to the Marriott, the Ritz or any one of the beautiful hotels that are "actually on the beach". Forget this place, its not worthy of the Conrad name or your money!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing for a Conrad.”
Reviews.Author: Susan7425
Reviews.Content: Checked in last night. Room is small and not as well-appointed as I would expect for a Conrad hotel--clean but sparse. TV looks like a computer monitor, no real desk or table, no bathrobe. Tile floor makes it look very utilitarian. Bathroom is very tight--just barely enough room for 1 person. Common areas very retro looking (or just old) and not to my taste. Here on business so did not check out other amenities. Good points here--Pikayo restaurant and Starbucks near entrance. I will try someplace else next time.

Reviews.Title: “Good, but could be better”
Reviews.Author: GabrielRFritz
Reviews.Content: Good hotel, good location. The facilities are good, with a good pool, parking is not difficult. First I stayed in a lake side room, which had a very good view of the lake and a balcony to sit and enjoy the landscape. The bad about this room is the television system that does not permit to connect any other device like a laptop or videogame. I was very frustated because I was staying there for one month with a new PS3 and I coulndÂ´t test it. The room also does not have microwave. I also stayed in a corner room with a city view which was bigger and had a better television and microwave. Pro: Location, facilities Cons: TV (canÂ´t connect laptop or videogame, and it is small), only few rooms have microwave.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel...the quality of the maid service is questionable.”
Reviews.Author: JetSetterz2012
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this property as this was our first trip to PR. We frequently stay at the Hilton chain of hotels whenever we travel. It has a great location and lots of things to do in the area. Not as busy as the Isla Verde area. My only recommendation is that you make sure the Maid staff does their job appropriately. We felt the showers and bathrooms should have been cleaned as part of the daily maintenance when requested. This was lacking! However, when brought it to the managerâ€™s attention (Jean) he was understandable and made sure our stay was enjoyable. You will find the front desk and other employees that you interact with to be friendly and knowledgeable. I would visit there again is given the opportunity.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad/not great. When a resort fee is charged...”
Reviews.Author: FamilyOfFour08
Reviews.Content: Conrad San Juan is a decent hotel. The staff is generally polite, but untrained with regard to superior service. If a resort fee is collected, I expect superior service, not just a view. We arrived early to the hotel and were told that no rooms were available to check in to and that we would be telephoned as soon as the room was ready. So, we tried to use the "locker room" to change into beach wear, but it was being cleaned. A snarky employee suggested we use the shower area (which was at the public beach and is out in the open). No other option was made available other than the bathroom. They also didn't tell us about the towels we could borrow for the beach, nor that there was a pool/hot tub on both sides of the street/buildings. Or that you could walk across the street to access the other building and that you did not have to wait for the (slow) elevators to use the connector. Four hours later we checked back to find that no room was ready and that we were told we would definitely have a room by 4PM. At 415pm, we approached the desk again and the man said, I called people, I don't know if I called you. He gave us a room on the fourth floor and a lagoon view. While I also understand that there are security procedures in place, they asked for ID ever single time we approached the desk even before the keys were disbursed. I second credit card did not suffice, so a trip the to the car was necessary on each occasion. (we eventually learned to carry it 24/7) The room was very small. Nicely furnished but small and the view was mostly of the roof of the building. I called and requested a different room. We were accommodated and were told that this was a nicer room. (Why not give us that room in the first place?) The 8th floor room was much bigger and nicer. The maid service was great. We found our rooms adequately clean and restocked each day upon returning. The food at the cafe (we had burgers) was very good. Reasonably priced for a "resort" Aside from the many missed opportunities to shine for guest services, my biggest complaint was the resort fee AND a parking fee for each day totaling over 30 dollars additional per day. C'mon folks stop the fee junk. Rate your room accordingly. Oh and my Facebook account was hacked while I was there despite the desk assuring me that the connection was safe. Not cool. Thankfully it was not my banking/business accounts.

Reviews.Title: “good stay”
Reviews.Author: thinkn333
Reviews.Content: Stayed here the night before leaving on a cruise. Very nicely decorated. Good view from our very clean room. Within walking distance to many local restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “A breath of luxury and relaxation!”
Reviews.Author: Amanda S
Reviews.Content: After an extensive renovation, this hotel is highly recommended for vacationing in Puerto Rico. Its located at the entrance to Condado, where there are restaurants for everybody's taste (italian, japanese, peru.. you name it!). The rooms are nicely decorated, and the beach, although small is very nice. The lobby bar is a great place to hang out, and there are additional lounges with great music and great ambience. You will not regret your stay here

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: mackpav
Reviews.Content: While the price would be a bit much for me, I booked it on priceline for a great price. Asked for a balcony room with an oceanview and got it at no additional cost. Did have to pay a resort fee upon checking out, but it wasn't that much. We had a beautiful room with one of the nicest hotel bathrooms ever. The grounds were lovey and so were the employees. Cold flavored waters in the lobby each day. The only problem I had was getting an inflatable bed that was promised to be at 4pm. Called 4 times, before saying I wanted to go to bed, but didn't have it. Then it was there in minutes.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Puerto Rick”
Reviews.Author: trisiebell
Reviews.Content: Hotel is a little out of the way if you do not have a car, but it is beautiful, well kept and has great customer service. We had a sea view room which was spacious and we saw our cruise ship leaving San Juan. I would not recommend going out of the area on your own at night without car as it did not feel very safe. Lovely hotel to stay at post cruise.

Reviews.Title: “A past gem in decline”
Reviews.Author: JKDA
Reviews.Content: The Conrad San Juan is a satisfactory hotel, generally clean, and a retro-yet-trendy style. The staff is typically helpful but less than responsive. The property is huge, in two buildings spanning Ashford Ave. The building closer to the lagoon has nicer rooms, in general, than the original building that houses the casino. The room I stayed in last was in the building closer to the ocean. It was well appointed, with mini fridge and glass shower enclosure in the middle on the room. Internet worked flawlessly. Bed was comfortable. However, there were some elements that did not live up to the Conrad brand. In my room, the bolt lock did not work (desk answer: "None of them do!") , the curtains were torn (from being caught in the sliding door lock), and were dirty as if a small child with chocolate smeared hands had grabbed them. In addition, two lights were out in the bathroom. I made the front desk aware of these issues on day 1 of my 3 day stay, and absolutely nothing was done about them. The common areas are also showing their wear, but do not detract so much from the visitor experience. Hilton advertises the Conrad brand as "...upscale hotel rooms & suites in a resort setting..." and as " a world of style, service, and connection for today's sophisticated traveler." This property has potential, but does not deliver.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay. Will be back.”
Reviews.Author: Drewindc
Reviews.Content: Really enjoyed my 4 nights here. Staff was very friendly and helpful. Special thanks to Katisha at the front desk for her help with the early check in and a great room facing the ocean and for just be over all pleasant to deal with. Room was clean and spacious, with a large balcony. Pools were very nice. Fitness center has everything including whirlpool an sauna and more machines than you find at most. the beach is nice enough, one tip though..walk just across the bridge plus a couple blocks by the baseball stadium is a really nice public beach with a reef blocking the waves. worth the walk.

Reviews.Title: “Loved my room and the restaurant Pikayo”
Reviews.Author: CanadaRockiesgirl
Reviews.Content: Very modern redo of a 60's hotel. Get a room facing the water specifically ocean worth the extra$$$ Pikayo restaurant is not to be missed! Cucumber wrapped Lobster/Crab roll appetizer.... Heaven in your mouth! Fabulous wine list Attentive service

Reviews.Title: “Great place”
Reviews.Author: Catherine M
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel - lots going on late at night, and many people. The room was really nice - spacious and very clean! Had a view of the lagoon to one side and the ocean out the other way. Would stay here again! (I used priceline though so I did not pay as much as their rates are published...don't think I would for that price) Only complaint is that there is only a tiny beach nearby that was very crowded - but it was great for a 1 night stay!

Reviews.Title: “Another solid visit...”
Reviews.Author: gary7272
Reviews.Content: A friend and I won the Conrad on a priceline bid. Despite the priceline bid, they honored my diamond status on Hilton and gaves us breakfast vouchers...Bravo to the Conrad San Juan Condado...As for the room, we did get a room facing the street, but it was totally satisfactory. All of the personnel at the hotel were friendly and efficient. Despite the inclement weather for part of the time, the grounds were well kept and the pool area was fine. We also appreciated the mango water in the lobby after a day of sight seeing. The casino is quite small and I did not see many people winning.. My only complaint is while there was wifi in the room, you had to pay if you wanted to use the computers and printer in the business center..Overall, a solid hotel for the Condado region, though most of the action is a few blocks away as the hotel is the last on Ashford...

Reviews.Title: “Awesome views of city & lagoon”
Reviews.Author: Sawwhetowls2
Reviews.Content: The decor was supreme! We were greeted by valet. We had a wait to check in but the staff especially Carla was very pleasant and made check in easy. There was Mango water in the lobby in for guests which was delicious and refreshing, especially after a long flight. Our room was supposed to have a king bed and when we got to it, it was barely a queen. We called the desk and they immediately changed our room to a king room. It had a great view although somewhat obscured by the corner building column and the balcony was facing the street. We didn't mind though since we rarely spend much time in a room except for sleeping. The decor was high style modern with a large glass enclosed center shower. It was gorgeous! The bathroom alone is a reason to visit this hotel. The self-parking lot was flooded recently so we opted for the valet parking only a few dollars more per night plus tipping of course. The pool area was lovely with lots of seating available and low lights at night added drama. The palm trees were plentiful and the grounds finely manicured. All in all an excellent choice. Breakfast there was okay, but the waiter made us laugh! We'll stay there again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Very good location”
Reviews.Author: gcbctc
Reviews.Content: The hotel is much too big for more than 1 or 2 nights. By this I mean, hotel is on two different sides of street and not all the facilities are located in each building. The rooms were large and clean. We had a bay view, which is a man made body of water and was quite peaceful at night to look out at the city lights beyond the bay. Gym was great, and well appointed. Casino was always busy. Front desk very accommodating, we wanted to change room to higher floor, we waited in line again, and the floor change was made with no problem.

Reviews.Title: “Cafe Caribe”
Reviews.Author: Grahamarb
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at this hotel several times. Of note is the restaurant, the Cafe Caribe. It is not pretentious but does what it does well. It has standard hotel restaurant food with a levening of Puerto Rican specialties. I particularly liked the Cesar Salad and the Chicken Parmesan. The wine list is OK. Most important is the staff. They are uniformly nice. We were there with our young grandchildren and the staff looked after them. If you are interested in honest food with good service this is a very good place. With respect to the hotel, it is OK. We had two rooms. The keys on both refused to work on three occaisons, really a bit much. But, all in all, it is fine for a big standard tourist hotel. The location is fine with a good view. We have stayed there before and hope to again.

Reviews.Title: “Eh...”
Reviews.Author: ldtc2
Reviews.Content: I told myself I would never stay here again after my credit card information was stolen by a bartender in the hotel bar back in Feb '10. As fate would have it, we were in town for the San Sebastian Festival, en route to Vieques, got a good deal....and went back. Still, eh. If you're looking for luxury - look elsewhere. If you're looking for individualized service - look elsewhere. If you're looking for clean rooms - looks elsewhere. If you're looking for a place to stay, that is perfectly fine and got a great deal or will be drunk the entire time...stay! Honestly, I tried the place again, thought the first time was just a fluke - two years later, same issues. The food in the poolside restaurant - awful. I ordered a simple chicken wrap with guacamole. I was given rubbery chicken, likely cooked the day before, refrigerated and then microwaved and gooped with prepackaged guacamole that likely came directly from a bag. The pool area is very nice, but over run with people and when you retreat to the beach, it's public - no escape, no privacy. Service at the pool bar was slow and the drinks were expensive and mediocre. Rooms were updated a few years back, look fine - but just pick up the rug, filthy! I saw an exterminator walking the halls and I assume its normal to have preventative care, but a part of me thinks this place probably has a higher rate of unwanted "guests" than others. Get the ocean view rooms, well worth the upgrade - we got our rate on Priceline (think it was 125 a night) we then paid another 25 upon check in for an ocean view upgrade. $150 for a waterfront room during peak season...its like making a deal with the devil, you willing to take the gamble?

Reviews.Title: “Would be 5 stars but...”
Reviews.Author: alley3898
Reviews.Content: I was very pleased with the appearance of this hotel from the lobby to the rooms and grounds. The quality of the furnishings, towels and toiletries, etc were excellent. The service at the front desk was friendly and helpful. The food and service at the Denny's and Starbucks were great too. It is walking distance to a nice strip of bars and restaurants as well. Although the property is waterfront, I could not find the "beach section." If you are looking for a beach getaway, you'll want to stay in Carolina or Isla Verde on the nice beach. My only complaint about this hotel itself is that it charges $16.05 for parking per night, and after check-out I was charged and additional $15.26, which they still have not explained what for. I am contesting the charge on my credit card.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in a good area”
Reviews.Author: Kerawala
Reviews.Content: Me my wife & my 5 year old & my 18 month old baby stayed here for six days & let me just say that the hotel was in a Very safe area, they a baby crib for my toddler & their family suit that we got had a microwave & a frige. Starbucks & Denny's in the hotel made my mornings very convenient, beautiful view of ocean & lagoon. We very much enjoyed the eight noodle bar & cafe carebe located in the hotel was a delight w/ a beautiful view. Staff was very friendly, but the room service was a bit slow. I will definetly go back to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Don't expect Conrad quality”
Reviews.Author: vaildiner19
Reviews.Content: While I don't have any horror stories for this hotel I will tell you that it is more on par with a Hilton Garden Inn than any Conrad Hilton I've stayed in before. This is probably due to the fact that the hotel used to be a Wyndam. When I arrived there was only 1 staff member at the check in counter (who happened to be busy with about 15 airline crew members). That should be your first tip that you've probably paid too much for this "4" star hotel. Airlines don't like to pay very much for rooms. The hotel just feels tired from the casino to the Denny's that's located on the ground floor. If you're here one night on business it's fine but I wouldn't vacation here. For the money, stay down the street at the La Concha Renaissance - no brainer decision if it's within 20-30 per night of this place.

Reviews.Title: “A very beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: IndyCruiseLover
Reviews.Content: The Conrad Condado is a very beautiful hotel. The rooms are very nice, the view is spectacular, and the restaurant is delicious! The staff is very courteous and helpful! The only complaints I had is 1) the time it took to check in was VERY LONG! and 2) when asked to bring up our bags, not all the bags were brought up. We had to go down and find our missing bag.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, comfortable room, ocean facing property!!!”
Reviews.Author: Ani J
Reviews.Content: Before you book this hotel, be informed that this is an ocean facing property, NOT a beach facing hotel. There is a small beach in the corner of the hotel (not private). So if having a private beach is imperative, then this is not the hotel for you. We just came back from a 4 day trip to Puerto Rico for our anniversary. We had booked this hotel through our Hilton Points, so couldn't reserve an ocean view room. I called multiple times to ask for an ocean view room (even emailed Leah who email address I found on one of the reviews on Trip Advisor). But when we got to the hotel, we were given a Lagoon view room. This hotel has two towers - Ocean Tower and Lagoon Tower. Once we got to the room, we found a champagne bottle with a note from Leah for our anniversary. We were touched (thanks Leah!!!). I still didn't want to give up and went back the next day to the Front desk to see if an ocean view room was possible. To our surprise, we were told that an ocean view room was already reserved for us and we would get it that day (not sure why the manager who checked us in the first day didn't tell us that). Either way - we were super grateful and excited. The ocean view is simply amazing. Hearing those waves when waking up in the morning is something so serene. The bathrooms are bigger in the ocean tower and 2 bottles of water are provided everyday (something missing in the Lagoon Tower). The room decor is very contemporary. The walls are very thin - we could hear the noise from the adjacent rooms till the wee hours of the morning. The hotel has 4 restaurants - Pikayo (super expensive and doesn't seat you without reservation), Noodle Bar (average food with awful service), Carife Cafe (ocean facing), and Aqua Bar (near pool side). The pools are fairly small. Since there is no beach, its super crowded near the pools. We ate breakfast at the Carife Cafe and dined at Noodle Bar twice. Other nights we chose to walk to restaurants near the hotel. As you get out of the hotel, take a left and you will come across several restaurants, some of them ocean facing. We dined at Hacienda and Waikiki and enjoyed a meal while listening to the ocean waves. The hotel has free AT&T wifi. There is also a machine for check-in and printing boarding passes. There is a Starbucks right outside the hotel. There is also a casino inside the hotel. In addition, the hotel is only 5 minutes away from Old San Juan. Get the ocean view room at this hotel....that was the highlight of this hotel for us. Thank you Leah for helping us with the ocean view room and making our anniversary trip so special.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed opinions”
Reviews.Author: Liam F
Reviews.Content: From the exterior the hotel is quite stunning with a great location. Check-in was fine, it was noted that as Hilton Honours customer and I was told we would receive 2 bottles of water, free oc charge ($7.00 at the bar) free of charge and given $50.00 in tokens to use in the casino; so far all is going well. We never got the water so went to Walgreens and got a 5 litre bottle for $1.39 (plus tax)! The room, on first galnce looked very nice, however on looking into the bathroom we noticed that the skirting boards (not sure what the American equivalent would be) was not attached to the wall at all and the general finsh was rather poor. The next task, how to get into the shower - the best way we found was to almost wedge oneself between the basin and the toilet, allowing the door to to the shower cubicle to open, it had to be the smallest bathroom I have ever seen. The Aqua Bar, poolside. You shoul allow yourself plenty of time here, not becuase of the location but the time it takes to get served, up to 30 minutes between ordering and the drinks arriving. We did ask why it had taken so long and we were met with indifference and informed that the person who had taken our order had left to get more limes. Later we were told that we could not order Mojitos or Margharitas as they had ran out of limes! Also, plan your departure well in advance, then the wait for the bill (check) will not come as a shock to you. Check said bill when it arrives, thankfully I did. As expected there was a space to leave a tip, however on inspection I noticed that 15% had already been added. Being a Brit I though that a tip was a way of showing gratitude to a server for good service, you won't get this here, I could go on but won't! The bar staff could do with customer service training! Room cleanliness was less than expected, it was serviced but still dusty. Not overly impressed with the choices on-site for breakfast, Denny's managed to serve bacon and sausage depsite being asked to leave these off the plate, becuase that's how the meal was served - great for a vegetarian! On reflection I would choose to stay at one of the other Hilton hotels in San Juan than stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely stay here!”
Reviews.Author: ViaJoey
Reviews.Content: Definitely stay here! The hotel has everything! Friendly staff, clean and well decorated rooms and many amenities. Casino isn't the loosest, so don't play too much lol. Pool and beach are gorgeous!

Reviews.Title: “Don't Stay Here”
Reviews.Author: Utcajh
Reviews.Content: Your room will not be ready until hours after check in time. They will give you the run around in order to provide a room claiming the one reserved has not been cleaned when you've waited 4 hours to check in. Nice accommodations, but crap service. Don't waste time at the bar. You'll never get your tab even after you've asked for it five times.

Reviews.Title: “great stay”
Reviews.Author: IluvEurope
Reviews.Content: Spent 5 nights here over a long Presidents weekend. originally had booked at the Hilton,changed last minute as wanted a quieter hotel with hopefully an older/more mature clientele. Had a end room in the lagoon bldg. Had a view of the ocean from the balcony. Room was of good size, recentlynupdated. Nice view of Condado. Short cab ride to OSJ. Overall hotel is great, staff was all helpful. used the pool daily and found it not loud and very relaxing. Easy walk to restaurants and other hotels along the Condado strip. would not hesitate to stay here again as found the location to be close enough but still quiet at the same time. Overall I would rate the Hotel a 4 on a 5 pt scale. found everything to be nice,clean and enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “Human Rights Violations”
Reviews.Author: Elina C
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed at the Conrad San Juan Condado Plaza March 1st through March 4th, even though we paid for a package via Priceline through March 5th. A very unpleasant incident caused us to leave early, and we believe this is a major issue with the hotelâ€™s customer service and human rights violations. To summarize the incident, my partner and I were having lunch at the Aqua Bar and Grill by the pool. At the beginning, we were enjoying ourselves, until one of the bartenders started behaving overly sexually towards me â€“ looking and making comments about my breasts and touching my arm. At the time, I decided to disregard this in order to have a good time with my partner. Sometime later, we decided to swim in the pool, and come back to have a drink at the bar, which is connected to the pool. We were behaving generally like everyone around us â€“ not doing or wearing anything inappropriate. At some point, it appears that the male staff was able to infer that we, as two women, were a couple, and that is when we were treated very poorly. Another bartender approached us and asked us to leave the area, without much explanation. He implied that we were being asked to leave because we are gay. Once again, we did not touch inappropriately or even kiss. He said that another guest made a complaint, but there was no evidence or witness to step forward. At that point, we were very offended and walked to the front desk to inquire more about the reason why we were being asked to leave the bar, since no clear explanation was given. The concierge took a very long time to get one of the manager. The manager who came up to talk to us was Victor Diaz, Front Office Manager. He was being very disrespectful, also not offering a clear explanation or presenting any evidence that backed up our claim. Next, it seems like he was searching for any explanation to get rid of us, only saying that someone said that one of our body parts was exposed, which was completely untrue, since the swimwear we were wearing covered up everything very well. Since the manager was being very disrespectful, my partner wanted to get a clearer explanation and touched his arm to hear him better. At that point, he acted as if we violated some kind of hotel rule and called a security manager, saying that we would also need to vacate the premises. The security managerâ€™s name is Jesus Mesa, Assistant Security Director. At that time, they also called the police and said we needed to get our things and leave. Once the police arrived, the officers did not seem to treat this as an event of any importance and did not give us much of an explanation either. The main thing to note is that the police officers acted as if we really were nowhere near as culpable as the managers were making it out to be. At that point, we were offered no refund for the last night that we already paid, and we were charged extra for the service at the bar. We were not given any consideration about leaving the hotel and any accommodations we might need to make, since we did not know the area well and are two young women who appeared as easy targets to take advantage of. Overall, it is outrageous that we would be targeted and treated so poorly by hotel staff that is located in a U.S. territory. We were given very little explanation and were obviously singled out as two female lesbians. The main point is that we were not acting inappropriately, we were not told to leave because we were intoxicated or behaved in any way against the rules presented to us at the time we were at the bar. Also, there is no evidence present of any witnesses making complaints against us. Overall, this is an offensive human rights violation â€“ we are two paying customers with highly respected jobs in Washington, DC, USA. We are a U.S. citizen and a permanent resident, and to be treated this poorly in a U.S. territory at a highly rated hotel is an outrage. Ultimately, we will be pursuing legal action against Conrad San Juan Condado Plaza, Victor Diaz and Jesus Mesa. This is not simply an example of extremely poor customer service of which further customers should be warned, but an example of injustice and a human rights violation.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, staff, location...”
Reviews.Author: Selena R
Reviews.Content: Just spent 5 night here for a girls get away. We arrived after midnight after a long flight. The girl checking us in was pleasant and efficient. We unloaded our luggage and immediately went to the Moon Bar located in between then front desk and the escalators going to the casino level. Our bartender was very nice and attentive. We brought our drinks out to the HUGE covered deck overlooking the sea side of the hotel. The breeze was great. The tropical air was welcome after leaving New England cold. It was a perfect welcome. The next morning the girls all met down at the pool, some on the beach. Towels are provided for you at the activity desk. Umbrellas on the beach are an $11 charge. Plenty of chairs available by the pool and in the beach area. Other than poor pool manners by kids and some adults, the main pool with the pool bar was wonderful. Some of the girls had a grand time going down the water slide. Frozen drinks were enjoyed. The hotel is walking distance to many restaurants and bars. Please don't be lured in by the American chains, explore the local stuff. One of our best meals was at Waikiki a few steps away. The staff was amazing, the food was unbelievable. We took a cab into Old San Juan and had a great meal and experience at Punta De Vista. It's locate near the pirate ship. It's a locals spot. Looks like a dive bar, but the food is amazing and the staff are GREAT. All in all, a wonderful experience for my first time in San Juan. I would go again and I would recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “I have mixed feelings”
Reviews.Author: nopoodles
Reviews.Content: Spent a week here over the Christmas holidays, and our experience was mixed. The positives: Pools are very nice, as is the shady play and lounging area facing the ocean The hotel staff is cheerful, pleasant, and go out of their way to be helpful at every juncture The rooms were nice, clean, reasonably spacious, and our ocean view room in the original hotel building had a lovely view You can get coffee, fruit, and little tidbits at breakfast time in the lobby. Having the Starbucks attached to the hotel is insanely helpful The negatives During this very busy time of year, the main pool at the original hotel was constantly mobbed The pool in the annex has a southwestern exposure, so there was no relief from the sun and heat there at all. It was like a science fiction novel! I really didn't like being blasted with House music from the bar at the pool. Not only was it extremely loud, even 50 feet from the bar, but there were a bunch of lyrics in the music that were not suitable for my 6-year old. Later in the day, they changed to salsa and merengue, but it was still amazingly loud. Damn. The hotel was at times overrun with short-stay cruise ship passengers. One of them gave us all a Norovirus. We were extremely ill, and needed to see the hotel doctor multiple times. On the other hand, both doctors were pleasant, helpful, had excellent english, and seemed very sharp indeed. And the hotel staff was great about bringing us broth and sliced ginger and cleaning up our vomit and such (sorry.) So, I have really mixed feelings. I wish I could summarize to give you an overall recommendation, but I really can't. One thing I know is that this hotel would be better at any time other than the week between Xmas and New Year's!

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: Kdaddy53
Reviews.Content: The property itself was pretty nice, but I've never had a worse experience. We arrived just after midnight on a Thursday for a long weekend. We booked the first night with Hilton points, the next two nights with AMEX points and the last two nights with a credit card. I called in advance to make sure they would be able to keep us in one room, and again after it was all booked. They assured me both times that it wouldn't be a problem. When we arrived, the person at the front desk said that she couldn't assure us that we would be in the same room, despite the fact that we booked all five nights in the same room type and had received assurances that they had made notes and that it wouldn't be a problem. We agreed to follow up with a manager the next morning and headed off to our room in a bad mood. When we got to the room, there was dried urine and a public hair on the toilet (the toilet seat was loose and my wife sat down on it before it slid sideways to reveal this fact). We were tired and waited to address it until the morning on our way out the door to a zipline adventure (Campo Rico - awesome). The person at the front desk was dumbfounded that it was an issue whether we would be allowed to stay in the same room for all five nights and promised to have housekeeping clean the room immediately. We got back at 2:00 pm and the room still hadn't been cleaned. We stopped someone in the hall who again promised that he would have someone clean the room and toilet right away. We then left for a couple of hours and came back at 4:00 pm to find that the room still hadn't been cleaned. We changed and stopped again at the front desk to complain, and were again told that it would be handled right away. As with each other person, I specifically mentioned that there was dried urine and a pubic hair, thinking that this would cause immediate action. We then left to spend the evening in Old San Juan and came back around 11:00 pm. When we walked through the door, my wife was thrilled that they had finally cleaned the room. However, I walked over and raised the toilet seat just to confirm that they had cleaned the toilet. No such luck, as it still had dried urine and a pubic hair. I immediately went down stairs and asked for a manager. I was very upset, but he seemed responsive and immediately sent someone to clean the toilet. He asked what he could do for me, and I told him that I wasn't looking for any comps and just wanted the bathroom to be cleaned. While we were waiting for housekeeping, I called downstairs to inquire about the rates for long distance calls (Verizon Wireless had no cellular plan for Puerto Rico) and they put the same manager on the phone. He told me that they would comp the phone calls and that despite my statement that I wasn't looking for any comps, my wife and I could use the hotel services free of charge. I felt much better, although we did not take him up on his offer to use the hotel services. However, when I went to check out two days later, the phone call was on my bill. Now, I didn't ask for the free phone call and didn't really mind paying for it, but was infuriated that they had offered up the free phone call and had still charged me. More incredibly, my wife reminded me that we couldn't get through and had left a message. Her dad had called back a few minutes later and we had talked for about 15 minutes. The same thing happened the next day. So, they were actually charging us for incoming calls. Now, none of this was meaningful financially. However, the complete lack of customer appreciation was infuriating and partly runied my long weekend with my wife away from the kids. My wife ultimately stayed for the last two days for work and managed to track down the manager, who removed the phone charges and a few other charges as well. Nevertheless, I will never get back the time that I spent stressing over the horrendous service in that hotel (We also went to the well reviewed on-site restaurant - "Pikayo" - and it was equally terrible). I wouldn't wish this place on my worst enemy and will be taking the time to let the Hilton know my feelings as well. San Juan was fabulous, but this hotel was terrible. Just don't do it!

Reviews.Title: “Not to Shabby”
Reviews.Author: Thayer P
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed overnight after our Cruise before heading home. The hotel was full as this was a Sunday and we had to wait until 3 PM to get into our room. We were relegated to a room across the street (using the Mezzanine level walk over) just slightly inconvenient. The room was on the 9th floor overlooking the street and partial water-view. The room was hurriedly cleaned but nicely appointed with great windows. The bathroom door is a sliding door that affords very little privacy. We would stay there again but just as an (over night).

Reviews.Title: “Best view ever”
Reviews.Author: Joyce E
Reviews.Content: Ocean view room on the 9th floor. Best view ever! Great staff -- special thanks to Leah. Centrally located for restaurants, taxi to airport or Old San Juan. I would recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Overall Nice Stay”
Reviews.Author: Jenna C
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel two weeks for work in Feb 2012. I stayed in an ocean view on the 7th floor. Check-in went smoothly (around 7pm) without a wait. My first room was on the 3rd floor and was very very noisy due to a wedding in the lobby area. I changed rooms the next night up to the 7th floor without a problem. The rooms were modern and clean. There is a safe, mini-fridge, coffee maker in each room. Omel/Otel? at the front desk is very great, friendly and eager to assist. I dined at the Caribe cafe for breakfast and service is quick and the coffee is good (better than Dennys). The Denny's located in the hotel opened 1 week prior to my arrival so I dined here quite a bit (and for a lot cheaper) too! The Denny's is REALLY nice and new with a full-bar (cheaper drinks without the view). The servers are all BRAND new and very uneasy--it's pretty obvious. I cut them some slack because the place just opened a week prior. The pool bar (bartender David) is great and very friendly but drinks are a littly pricy. I loved the swim up bar option too. The lobby bar (bartender Chris) is nice 'swanky' vibe and has happy hour in the afternoons! Eight Noodle Bar has pretty good food. The service is not friendly...but the sushi is pretty good. The gym is very nice and has everything you could want including a sauna and jacuzzi! Free weights, dumb bells, kettle bells, bozu balls, medicine balls, treadmills, etc etc Pools are nice--salt water pool, 2 other pools, 2 jacuzzis. Servers also walk around taking orders. The one issue was the towels. You cannot get a towel after 6pm at the pool and you must return them to the towel attendant by 6 or you will be charged 25.00 to your room. (Thus, you have to take the towel back to the pool the next day to turn it back in to avoid the charge.) The beach is pretty small and is right off of the main road (Ashford). Casino is open 24hrs but not all the tables are open all the time. They have one or two tables operating in 'off-peak' times. (before noon) There is no shuttle from the airport. (It's about 15 mins away from airport) Old San Juan is just over the bridge a few miles and is a great place to eat and walk around. A taxi will take you for 14.00/each way. Parking in the hotel is 16.00/day to self-park. Checkout was the worst part of my trip. Having stayed for two weeks I had a LONG bill and decided to go to the desk early to get a print-out to review the bill before checking out. I reviewed over breakfast and noticed a charge for the in room water (7.00) that I did not consume. The front desk removed the charge once I told them--no problem. Everything else seemed accurate and I decided to pay and check-out. I asked if possible to put 'incidentals(food) on one bill and the room + tax on another bill' with two forms of payment for work voucher reasons. She told me it was not a problem--It took 45 mins for me to get checked out. There was an issue separating the charges into different folios and apparently was much more complicated than I thought it would be. The girl became visible agitated and annoyed with the whole process. Her co-worker (Oneida?) helped her and figured out the issues. Once printed I noticed a charge that should not have been on the food bill, it was a room fee. I showed her and they fixed it but at this point everyone was frustrated. If they told me it was THAT difficult to split the charges I would not have done it. As I walked away and said 'thank you' she didn't say a word and her acted highly annoyed at me for something that she couldn't figure out. After spending that amount of money I would expect a 'thank you' in reply from the front desk check out staff. Overall, I enoyed the hotel property and all the amenities. I enjoyed most of the staff with the exception of the front desk (morning) group. The lines were always extremely long and they were not trying very hard to be nice.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Property, Poor Management”
Reviews.Author: tanfasticAZ
Reviews.Content: I have traveled here on business at least 5 times over the last 2.5 years. The hotel is very nice, the rooms are beautiful, the grounds are spectacular but Management is horrendous! Service is good on the most part, but I don't like waiting to check in for close to an hour when there are 6 people in line and only one person working the desk. I watched at least 3 managers come out from the back, answer a question and then disappear again. Maids were very good, dining service was a little slow but for the most part I enjoyed the property. I mentioned something to one of the Managers, he looked at me like I was crazy! The Hilton chain needs to do something about this group running the hotel. I don't know if I will be back to this proprty.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: DaveMow
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Conrad hotel from Jan 21-28 and stayed in room 740. We really enjoyed the hotel and the staff. We found the staff was the friendliness of ANY Caribbean island we have stayed. The grounds we so clean it was impressive, they detailed everything absolutely the cleanest hotel I have stayed in years and we stay in nice hotels. The hotel could use an update but it was not run down in any way. We utilized the bars and restaurant at the hotel and enjoyed it all. We liked the Noodle and Italian restaurants; there is a high end restaurant as well. One thing we also liked was that we could safely walk to restaurants and even a small liquor store that had all one could need. There was shopping a little further down the road. The Casino was large enough and had a nice assortment of gaming activities and slots. My wife and I stay somewhere in the Caribbean every winter. We both agreed we would come back to this hotel. Some of the reviews we read could not be real, this is an honest review. We stayed here and we really enjoyed the visit. The photo we posted was taken from our room balcony. You will enjoy the hotel we did.

Reviews.Title: “Heavenly Bliss”
Reviews.Author: kish m
Reviews.Content: All I can say is I am reserved for 2 additional stays this year!!! 3 if I can get more time off! AMAZING rooms amazing customer service, amazing MANAGEMENT!! My fiancÃ© and I went for a romantic getaway and our expectations were exceeded tremendously! Everything was perfect; room service & food, restaurants, drinks in hotel bars, room design creativity and comfort; cleanliness, views; STARBUCKS customer service!! We even received a "welcome to the hotel" call when we woke up after checking in the past evening! 100% A+ and extra credit! I will NEVER stay elsewhere when I go to Puerto Rico. They have earned my respect and loyalty!

Reviews.Title: “Clean & Good Location; Not a "Luxury" Hotel”
Reviews.Author: katensteve
Reviews.Content: My family and I booked this last minute trip about a month before Christmas, so as expected many hotels were booked up. The Conrad was one of our best available options, so we took it. However, as clean and comfortable as the property was, I think I'd opt for another hotel for future SJ visits. The hotel has two buildings - one right on the waterfront and one across the street. Due to our last minute booking, both of our rooms were across the street. However, we were lucky to have a corner room facing the lagoon which still had a beautiful view. Be sure to ask for a corner room if you can if you're relegated to the other side of the hotel. Our room was moderate size, average furnishings, but very clean (and the bed was extremely comfortable.) Because my husband and I had a corner room, we also had a large bathroom but my family members on a higher floor in a suite had a tiny bathroom. I wouldn't say that's a make or break. The hotel pool is very nice, and the little tiny lagoon/beach has warm water (hotel guests also get a wrist band for free lounge chairs.) The hotel itself is also in a great location - short cab ride to Old San Juan and the airport, and walking distance to shops and restaurants down the street if you're looking to get off the hotel property. The biggest cons are these - for the price, this is by no means a luxury property. I wasn't "wowed" by the property, decor, rooms or facilities by any means. But the biggest down side is by FAR the poor service. We tried to use the concierge several times, to no avail. Once they booked us on a trip, charged our credit cards, and then literally 5 seconds later told us the trip had been sold out. Then, they referred us to local restaurants and promised we didn't need a reservation - and then we showed up to a long line. Every time we asked for towels or local tips, we were meant with very rude hotel staff (the towels were never even delivered.) We also asked on New Year's if we'd be able to see fireworks, to which a manager at the front desk told us she had "no idea." And then at midnight we could see not 1 but 3 fireworks shows (and would've been in a better position to see them had we known!) Overall - definitely clean, comfortable, great pool, safe and nice location. But we met a couple at the airport who stayed at the Hotel Hilton Caribe across the water - and had a much better experience.

Reviews.Title: “New, Nice Hotel... Overpriced & Bad Service”
Reviews.Author: AKB0arder
Reviews.Content: I stayed here back in December 2010/ January 2011 for a 10 day stretch and besides the nice clean modern room I had a horrible experience! WAY overpriced at $300 + a night with taxes and fees plus the service was horrible at the front desk. They double billed my stay ($3000 x 2!) and weren't able to return the money to my account for almost 2 weeks! The lady I dealt with was completely incompetent and could care less that my account was missing $3000 and wouldn't even let me check in at first even though I had paid in advance. The casino is very dark and outdated compared to the more trendy, younger crowd at La Conche down the street. There are a lot of other options in the area for a fraction of the price so look at other before choosing this one.

Reviews.Title: “Nice renovated hotel, good for conventions”
Reviews.Author: Marie R
Reviews.Content: It consists of 2 buildings, one in front of the door. Just renovated, very modern. Not a 5 star like they claim. Very nice pools, in the Condado area, close to El viejo San Juan Vey limited area to public beach. Nice views, beach breeze and good ambiance. It has a new Dennis 24 hours open on lobby of one of the towers. Starbucks near by. Parking is 15 plus tax. Internet is free. Casino

Reviews.Title: “Great Time”
Reviews.Author: macmami
Reviews.Content: My review is super late but I wanted to write anyway. We used the Conrad San Juan as our home base for our destination wedding. We had 100 guests who all stood at the property with us. The contract process was easy although you do have to chase down your sales person at times. It was easy to add rooms to our block and they accommodated our requests easily. Our stay was great. The majority of our guests had no issues with their room or check in. Any issues they did have were quickly remedied. The property itself had a decent casino and a great pool area. They do not allow you to bring your food or drinks to the pool so we moved our cooler an party to their make believe beach which was also on property. Note all beaches are public so although it was connected to the property anyone can stay on the beach. THe beach is more of a niche they created for guests. Definitely no where as nice as some of the beaches in Puerto RIco. Honestly all the beaches in the Condado area are often not fit for swimming and are average as best. The beach in Isla Verde is much nicer but if you rent a car whcih I would suggest you can visit some of the prettier beaches like Bocaron and Cana Gorda. We ate at Veritas and El Piakyo famous Puerto Rican chef Wilo Benet's restaurants. Veritas was good although you can get traditional Puerto RIcan food down the block for half the price! El Pikayo which is their fine dining option was good as well although very loud. I had went to El Pikayo when it was in the Museum of Art and it seemed that both the food and the ambiance was nicer there. My familly and friends frequented the noodle bar which they say was yummy. The nightlife wasnt happening on the property so we would walk over to La Concha which was a couple of blocks away. We hadn't chosen La COncha to stay because they werent very accommodating. We were very pleased with our experience at the Conrad and if we were to stay in the Condado are we would choose it again.

Reviews.Title: “Just average”
Reviews.Author: C T
Reviews.Content: The room was great. Private balcony with ocean view. Could hear the ocean throughout the night. The service was just okay. Areas where they met expectation: (1) The room was sufficiently cleaned in a timely manner. (2) The front desk and lobby personnel were polite and courteous. (3) The associates at the desk to help plan excursions were friendly and efficient. Areas where they did not meet expectation: (1) Room service screwed up my dinner order the first night, twice (Forgot my beverage and under cooked my entree.) I didn't notice the errors at the same time. So, I had to wait approx 40 mins (total time) for both errors to be fixed. The wait time seemed unusually long to me. (2) I called the concierge line 4 times - only once did someone answer. (3) One day the main elevators were "out of order" for over 8 hours. It took more than 3 hours for the staff to put signage up providing alternatives (stairs, other elevators, etc.) (4) The kiosk provided in the lobby area for the printing of boarding passes was out of paper the morning before and the morning of my flight. The fact that it didn't work turned the hotel's unexpected offer from a "delighter" to a "disappointment" for me. And, it was my last experience as I left the hotel. The location was convenient (almost everything I wanted/needed was within a 10 min walk) but bad (had to walk by a vacant lot and a couple abandoned buildings to get to high-end shopping boutiques, non-hotel restaurants, and other establishments.) For the right price (40-50% off published nightly rates), I would consider staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Thank you Conrad Hotel for making us miss Puerto Rico a little less”
Reviews.Author: szavost
Reviews.Content: Our eagerly awaited six-day holiday in San Juan was nearly ruined by staying at the Conrad. It wasn't the price (which was allegedly lower than average for the season because of a package deal), nor the poorly designed room (one of those inexplicably stupid design choices that put the closet IN the bathroom), nor even the joke of a beach at the foot of the building. No. It was the appalling way in which we were treated by the staff every single day we were there. I'll only post these two examples so as not to bore the reader: I had made the reservation nearly three months in advance because we needed a crib for our baby daughter and I know these things can be tricky if you fail to ask for one with some anticipation. Morover, I called the hotel the week and then the day before our arrival to ensure we'd have the crib ready for the baby to sleep off the long trip there. We get to the hotel at four in the afternoon and, of course, there's no crib to be found. We waited and called the front desk and then called again and waited some more until, finally, at 8:30pm, we received the ugliest, most jail-cell-like contraption for infants we'd ever seen. A bunch of other annoyingly mundane stuff happened and then came time to check out. After waiting for 45 minutes for the bellboy to arrive at our room I gave up, burdened myself with our luggage and made it to the front desk where my wife was checking us out. A snippet of the conversation with the clerk: My wife (trying very hard to maintain her composure): We waited 45 minutes for the bellboy to show. What happened? The clerk (with insulting non-chalance): Yes, do you need help now? The only salvageable part of the hotel was the valet parking guys: They were very helpful and courteous all around. A little over two years ago we moved away from San Juan after spending three magical years living there so this trip was supposed to have been magical as well. Thank you Conrad Hotel for making us miss Puerto Rico a little less

Reviews.Title: “Nice location but service was poor”
Reviews.Author: bills_pix
Reviews.Content: Stayed 5 nights but even though we told them 5 times the air conditioning was not working they didn't fix it. We did get 2 free bottles of water each day and wonder if that was to make up for the room being warm. The first night the a/c made a loud thump every 20-30 minutes and scared the heck out of us. We called the front desk 5 more times and I think all they did was to disconnect the a/c unit. Consequently the room was pretty warm at night. Room was $200 a night plus resort fee, plus tax, plus parking (yikes!) and seemed a bit tired. Walls were a bit dirty in the bathroom, seemed like cheap paint was used that couldn't be cleaned to get the dirt off the wall around the light switch. Good location but some run-down or abandoned buildings next door and across the street. Was told it was not safe to walk on the street late at night.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous Hotel Great Location Stunning views Great staff ****”
Reviews.Author: Caligirl35
Reviews.Content: I would highly reccomend this hotel i feel i am kind of a snob when it comes to my accomadations this hotel met all my needs and expectaions don't hesitate to stay here splurge for the ocean view you will not be dissapointed . the restaraunts were good especialy loved the breakfast with a view . concierge was helpful parking is easy i can't say one thing bad about this place .

Reviews.Title: “great decor and pool”
Reviews.Author: SaZimTanz
Reviews.Content: Great modernist/minimalist decor, very comfortable rooms, nice garden with beach-side pool with slide for the kids and swim-up bar for parents.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Wedding”
Reviews.Author: Alana C
Reviews.Content: Besides celebrating my ocean view wedding at this hotel, I stayed in one of the best suites I've been in; it had a spectacular ocean view and fabulous accommodations.

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel in san juan!”
Reviews.Author: Naomita17
Reviews.Content: Has a spectacular ocean view, modern decoration, rooms are super comfy and great service...everything you need for having a wonderful stay! I fully recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Just Amazing!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: fifa23
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Conrad Condado Plaza and it never siezes to amaze me!!! First of all i always search for location on when planning a trip. It is well centered between Old San Juan and Condado. It is next to the new "Puente dos Hermanos", which takes straight to Old San Juan, beautiful to walk on, not only during the day but wonderful at night. To the other side it takes you to the Ashford Avenue, which is filled with wonderful restaurants of all tastes and budgets, from caribbean, korean, mexican, italian to fusion food. The hotel is well furnished, the rooms are fully renovated and beautifully decorated and super comfortable. The beds are super comfortable, if going with a couple, a great king size bed, with lots of pillows. If going with kids, there are some rooms that have a separtae room with a door with a queen size bed and another with 2 twin beds, separated by the hall were the bathroom and closet is. They have mini refrigerators and microwaves. Free Internet service, great range, no matter were you are if you're traveling for business.
