Everyone is very nice and willing to make you as comfortable as possible, and to help if you need anything. The pool area is great, they have a ocean water pool, and a normal pool which has a bar in it, and also a cool slide for the kids. The area is beautiful, how it is arranged. Very a relaxing with all the palm trees, the sound of waves crashing, and if needed a nice hammock nap. Great views for pictures. You're also steps from the beach, where you can rent surf boards, kayaks, go paddle boarding. Great activities for friends, couples and families. Also has a fun Casino always filled with activities. If you like to exercise, the gym is amaaaazing, lots of machines from treadmills each with incorporated tv, elliptical and bikes , another area for weights with a TV. Another area with mats, if you want to stretch, do yoga or work out with kettle balls. The best part of the gym, is it has it's own sauna, and small spa pool after a great work-ot.Suits everybody. Trust me you won't be disappointed. To din, Starting inside the Hotel you have "Pikayo", which is on the expensive side, but well worth it for a nice night out. "Casa Lola", is fun restaurant, latin fusion, great cocktails and very close to the hotel. There is also "Ropa Vieja" which is also latin food, and more relax than Casa Lola. Others that would recommend, Budatai, Jose Jose, Bar Gitano. All are great for a fun night out if your traveling with friends or couple because they have music and get trendy starting on thursdays. They all have websites so check them out. If you love to walk around, Condado is great. Condado never sleeps, lots of people walking, great atmosphere with open "plaza" leading to the beach like "Ventana al Mar", also surrounded with open bars. So you can enjoy the cool breeze with a nice cocktail. Condado also has little shops, if you enjoy a vacation shopping spree for shoes, clothes and bags. This is only Condado, but Old San Juan has so many things to do, from visiting the fort "El Morro" or "San Cristobal". "El Morro" you can start by visiting the fort inside, then after sit around the nice grass plains and fly a kite with the kids, while enjoying a "piragua'(sort of like a frozen drink, it's crushed ice, with whatever flavor you like). Also visit the beautiful Churches like "Iglesia San Francisco" or the cathedral "Catedral de San Juan", the different plazas were you can feed the pigeons, great restaurants after all the walking around and getting a feel of Old San Juan. Taking a walk, on the "Camino de la princesa" which is a trail were you walk behind the fort next to the water, very nice too. The best way is to ask locals, and they'll be happy to guide you to where you want to go, from restaurants or salsa dancing. Hope you enjoy your stay and this review will help in your decision

Reviews.Title: “Beware!! They will steal your money!!”
Reviews.Author: Priya B
Reviews.Content: I stayed there in June, 2011 and I booked two rooms. Some of us from the party were traveling standby. When I called the hotel that morning to book, I did mention that fact to the reservation agent. He said if we had to cancel one of the rooms, there should not be any issues. As it turned out, we had to cancel one of the rooms that same day. The agent who checked us assured us that they would cancel the room with no charge. We were not even given any keys to the room, did not even know what the room looked like but instead of crediting us our $259 they charged us for the extra room. Management is no help at all because if you don't double check to make sure you get your money back, they will rip you off! I've been in contact with them repeatedly but they will not return my hard earned money. And, I've made sure to let everyone know about this since I work for a major airline that has about 5-8 flights a day to San Juan. I would never recommend this hotel to anyone since they stole my money. And, I was within the 24hr cancellation policy.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Expierence!”
Reviews.Author: ziva b
Reviews.Content: We went for the weekend and had a great , amazing and relaxing time. Front desk was a great help, service was great ! Location was really good, quite area and close walking, and cab distance to the old city as well as San juan! Would deffiently take another trip and recommended to others! Highly recommonded Hotel ! :) Rooms were newly renovated and the Bathrooms are deffiently very cool!!

Reviews.Title: “Good location. Convenient to old San Juan and condado.”
Reviews.Author: Alicia R
Reviews.Content: The hotel is conveniently located. We were able to tour old San Juan on foot as the hotel is just across the bridge. The walk was less than 30 minutes to the fort. The service is not exceptional or even very good. Average is the best description. We had trouble with the front desk and our room "wasn't on the list" for maid service so we had to ask for service. This could be isolated to our stay though. If I were in PR again, I would stay GIn but only if there were no options within a reasonable price range.

Reviews.Title: “Lessons Learned”
Reviews.Author: Adjutorium
Reviews.Content: Conrad San Juan Condado Plaza is composed of two similarly constructed buildings which face each other across Ashford Avenue. An elevated walkway across Ashford connects the buildings. We opted to stay in the â€œlagoon-facingâ€� building which appeared to be the older of the two buildings We had booked only one night as our cruise departed th next day. The check-in desk is in the newer building. We checked in without event and walked across the elevated walkway to the other building, took the elevator to the 10th floor and found are room quickly. We were fortunate to have been assigned a corner room which overlooked Condado, with views of the rushing waters crashing through the rocky inlet from the ocean. Further, the room had a very large wrap-around balcony, which was quite impressive. The room had been renovated probably some years ago, and was appointed in a somewhat modern dÃ©cor, but it was very clean and neat with plenty of natural window light. The bathroom was relatively small, but manageable. So overall we were happy with the room and its location. Thatâ€™s when things began to deteriorate. When we first entered the room, we had noticed the personal safe which was located in the open on a shelf in a built-in wooden cabinet about thigh high, a few feet from the entrance. The LED on the safe was blinking in bright red â€œCall Serviceâ€�. A working safe was important to us because we didnâ€™t want to carry our assortment of cameras, kindles, laptops, jewelry and other valuables with us when we explored Old San Juan. We called the front desk and the receptionist promised that someone would be there in 10-15 minutes to address the issue. An hour later two gentlemen showed up to look at the safe: the safe technician, and a security person. After 15 minutes of diagnostic activity, the safe technician concluded that the safe couldnâ€™t be repaired and that if I wanted a working safe, I would have to change rooms. I asked why couldnâ€™t the safe be replaced and was told that it wasnâ€™t possible to do spontaneously because it was very involved and wasnâ€™t something they do on a week-end. So now I started to become annoyed. I called the front desk and asked for the Hotel Manager. I was annoyed because the cleaning staff must have seen this blinking LED and did nothing about it. The Hotel Manager listened to my rant quite sympathetically. First she offered to move us to a business suite set up with printers, fax machines etc. but it had no view, was industrial-looking and we were in no need for office services. So we turned it down. Next she suggested we move to the vacant room directly across the hall. We agreed. The new room was a corner room somewhat similar to the one we left but it didnâ€™t have the wrap around balcony and had much less natural light. I checked the safe, and it worked OK. Then I headed to the small balcony which appeared to have a great view of Old San Juan. I opened the door to the balcony, stepped out and immediately submerged my right foot in about five inches of water which had collected on the balcony. I pulled back quickly and stepped back into the room, but my right sneaker was completely saturated with water and as I stepped back I tracked water all over the place. My wife noticed immediately and said the apparent: â€œYouâ€™re getting water all over the place; take the sneaker off and get it to the bathroomâ€�. So I mightily pulled the saturated sneaker off and hopped to the bathroom, depositing the sneaker in the shower. I was beyond angry at this point, the broken safe, changing rooms, Lake Balcony. My wife pulled me back to my senses when she reminded me that we were only there for one night, just forget about it and letâ€™s go to dinner. So I pulled on my soaked sneaker and headed off to Old San Juan with the sneaker making a â€œka-swish-wushâ€� sound at every step. Later, when we returned that night we found the room to be very hot. I cranked up the AC and immediately heard this tremendous sound. It was the sound a metal garbage can makes when it rolls down a driveway, but constant. It was 11PM and I really didnâ€™t want to call the front desk and start another room change. So I left the AC on for as long as we could stand it and, when the room had cooled down, I turned it off for the night. In the morning the room was sweltering but when I put the AC on the noise was gone. Unbelievable! After Breakfast we went back to the lobby in the main building to check-out. I went to the first available staff but as I approached the counter he said rudely that his position was closed and that I should wait in line on the other side of the pillar. So he gave me all these hand signals so that I would stand in exactly the right place, in this imaginary line. I looked for a sign saying â€œLine Starts Hereâ€� or something like it, but there was nothing. No valor ropes, nothing. As I waited other guests were walking right up to check out as the position became vacant completely ignorant that I was standing in line. The check-out counter was so long that I couldnâ€™t get to the open positions quickly enough. I should have been angry but I wasnâ€™t. I was at peace and I thought there was no need to get upset because Iâ€™m never coming back to this place again. Finally, a position opened directly in front of me. As I approached the agent he said with a big smile: â€œGood Morning, Sir. How was your stay?â€� I replied wryly: â€œIt was unbelievable. Simply unbelievableâ€�

Reviews.Title: “Nice spot”
Reviews.Author: Pgem17
Reviews.Content: Clean, stylish, good location. Balcony overlooking ocean is very nice. Noisy toilet, not ideal shower head but bearable.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel with a few minor flaws.”
Reviews.Author: ChicagoDude69
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay at the Conrad (I stayed here in Jan 2011 as well). The Conrad is definitely a beautiful four-star hotel, but there are a few problems with its location (which I'll get into later) The interior of this hotel is beautiful. The lobby and rooms are designed in a ultra modern style. Check-in took all of 5 minutes, there was no one in line when I arrived at around 3:00pm. I belong to the Hilton Honors program with Gold status, so I was given a free upgrade to an ocean-view room as well as four $7 vouchers for breakfast. The hotel provides free WiFi to everyone (with password). The ocean-view side is the best side. The views are beautiful, with waves crashing against rocks below, boats floating by on the horizon, and, during the day, small planes and helicopters buzzing by from the small airport nearby. I even briefly saw a manatee surface (which is rare). Try to get an ocean view room, or pay for an upgrade if you have to. The Conrad is actually two separate towers for the hotel connected by a walkway over Ashford Ave. I've never stayed on the other side, so I can comment on the quality over there. The double-bed room was huge. The bathroom had a lot of space. You can literally walk around in the bathroom as opposed to just shuffling a few feet back and forth like most hotels. There was a walk-in shower with glass walls, a large sink, and roomy area for the toilet. On the other side are the small fridge, coffee maker, shelves, iron and ironing board. The hotel has a nice pool area. There are actually two pools, one saltwater, one fresh water. There is a heated jacuzzi by the saltwater pool. They give you fresh towels for the pool for free, and you can rent various water toys, paddleboats, snorkling gear, etc for a fee as well. There is a third, smaller pool on the hotels other tower. It has a jacuzzi has well. In the main pool area, there is an in-pool bar that serves food and drinks. There is a lagoon area with a beach connected to the primary pool area. This lagoon is pretty cool, as it's created by a huge row of rocks that block it off from the ocean. It's fed by water crashing over the rocks into the lagoon. I appreciated the lagoon more this year than last. The lagoon's tiny beach is located next to a road, and a (finally) finished bridge that looks nice now that it's done. The lagoon beach wasn't at all noisy or obtrusive. The hotel provides free beach chairs to hotel patrons. The best thing about the lagoon is that there are lots of exotic fish in the water. I saw 5 different kinds just walking around. Rent snorkeling gear and you'll see lots more. The biggest problem with the lagoon is that seafloor is covered with rocks that'll hurt your feet walking around. It's not a great swimming area. Still, I enjoyed spending an afternoon here. But for a real beach experience, either walk down to Conado beach (for big waves) or take the bus to Isla Verde (for small waves). My main complaint about the Conrad is its poor location. You have to walk 20 minutes to get to a nice tourist area. My suggestion for the immediate area: eat at Ropa Vieja for dinner and get desert at the Cold Stone Creamery close by, but travel elsewhere for food. The hotel is also surrounded by abandoned hotels, making the immediate area look a little slum-like. I would stay here again (I have twice won this hotel through Priceline for between $110-$135 plus $15/day Resort fee).

Reviews.Title: “Great location, very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: MikeEGrandIsland_NY
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel. Quite old but well kept. Staff was well organized and friendly. Ocean front setting was wonderful. Pools were nice. Only ate at the breakfast restaurant which was nice. Nice variety of bars and casino.

Reviews.Title: “front desk”
Reviews.Author: dianedi
Reviews.Content: This hotel is pretty nice, and for the most part, the staff is somewhat friendly. However, the people at the front desk are rude and not helpful at all. I had a special pillow with me that I use for back problems. It disappeared from my room on day 2 of my stay. I reported the problem to the front desk every day there after (5 more days), and though they told me they would talk to housekeeping, I never heard from anyone, and never got past anyone at the front desk telling me they would talk to housekeeping. I even wrote an email to the manager upon my return, and never heard back. This was a big problem for me, and the staff couldn't have cared less. Hopefully nothing more serious happens to anyone, because you will be totally on your own with no help from the hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: 2IslandDreamers
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Conrad Condado pre-cruise. It was a nice, clean hotel in a decent location. There were previous reviews talking about safety concerns but our group of 4 felt just fine walking at night, on the main streets. About the hotel: we had drinks at the pool bar- beware, they are expensive! Roughly $10 for a mixed drink. We had one and went to look for less expensive food & drinks. The room was pleasant. Two things I did not like were the bathroom door was simply a sliding door. People on the outside could hear and see in. The other thing was the air conditioner was up along the ceiling. I felt the cold air blowing on me all night and woke up with a stiff neck. Other than that, the room was decent.

Reviews.Title: “BEAUTIFUL hotel, wish it was more on the beach”
Reviews.Author: EDoug
Reviews.Content: Just returned from 5 days at the Conrad San Juan and had a really great time. The good: The rooms here were amazing, we heard they're some of the best in San Juan. The ocean view king room had a view of nothing but ocean and they face the bed towards the wall of windows which is a fabulous view to wake up to. The hotel lobby and gym area were wonderful and well maintained. The not so good: The hotel is NOT on Condado beach - you have to walk about 10 minutes to get there. They have a little strip of sand on an inlet but other than that, the ocean front property is all rocky and you can't go in the water. Also, the main pool is in desperate need of a renovation. We were told they had renovated essentially all of the hotel except the pool and that would be next so make sure to check before you book a stay that it won't be closed! Lastly, the service was kind of average. I expected more since this is an upscale hotel but nobody seemed overly friendly or welcoming. To be honest, it's what we experienced throughout all of Puerto Rico so I'm not sure if that's typical. Overall, it was a wonderful stay and we were very happy. I would recommend as long as you know what you're getting yourself into!

Reviews.Title: “I wanna go back!”
Reviews.Author: Kayellejaye
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Conrad on a birthday trip with the ladies. There was PLENTY of room for the four of us. Loved the room. Loved the location. GORGEOUS views. I can't wait to go back! No complaints whatsoever.

Reviews.Title: “Here now...Jan 22, 2012”
Reviews.Author: tnsbull68
Reviews.Content: The hotel is amazing for the price! Pools, jacuzzis, bars, restaurants, casino! This is our third night and we must leave tomorrow but we really enjoyed our stay. The rooms are small but clean. We only really used the room for sleep (so much to do). The area is great for couples, and the resort itself has a great beach area and pool for kids. Within a few blocks are great views and more restaurants, old San Juan, and more casinos.

Reviews.Title: “not 4 stars...”
Reviews.Author: Hope E
Reviews.Content: this hotel is rated 4 stars on most places we checked before we booked our stay. it has a good location and that is the best thing you can say about the place... It is VERY in need of some funding from the Hilton chain. it has been redone a bit(painted,flashy chandeliers) but still has a musty smell and is dirty. we were upgraded to an ocean view room which was the strangest room ever. the closet and bathroom were one in the same. so when you showered in the "modern" glass shower the moisture from the shower went all over the clothing. who designed that? the place is enormous and most areas not even used. the restaurants were overpriced and just mediocre. This was my 5th trip to PR and the Condado area is just rundown and old. there are street people and police on the corners. not what I want to see on my vaca. I would never stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value compared to other hotels on Ashford Avenue”
Reviews.Author: AMR3008
Reviews.Content: I've been staying at this property for many years and this last stay was great. The room was spacious and quiet (815). My gripes about long check-in times in the past have improved significantly. The front desk staff were very accommodating. I'm not sure why other hotels on Trip Advisor List rank higher compared to this property which is completely refurbished, has decent casino and convenient location. I certainly hope Hilton / Conrad staff continue the good work. I look forward to another stay in the spring.

Reviews.Title: “Needs a fluff... reminds me of Las Vegas in the 70's”
Reviews.Author: natalia64
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Conrad San Juan on a family trip for New Year's. The hotel needs a fluff, it looks tired... the carpets in the hallways are old, the hallways themselves all crooked...even though we were in the "new tower". Rooms are average and noisy. When my brother in law checked in he found out the 2 room suite he had requested for him and his family had plumbing problems, so he had to change to one room, because that was all there was available, which made his stay uncomfortable. We had lunch one time at the hotel cafeteria, only a sandwich, which was mediocre. Several of the hotel restaurants were closed, like the hotel had better days. The only restaurant we enjoyed was the bar at Pikayo where we had excellent service. We were told upon arrival that we had a 50 dollar credit for every two days of stay, but we were never told it was a resort credit...we found out when we checked out, and had not used it! So we had to spend it on candy and trinkets so we could use it. Not very good information from the people at reception.

Reviews.Title: “Post cruise stay”
Reviews.Author: 111wings
Reviews.Content: After reading some of the posts, I'm wondering if I stayed at the same place. We had wonderful front desk staff, wait staff in the bar/restraunt and a clean room. After not getting a "city view" room, the staff provided us with an lagoon/ocean view with a price reduction. The room was spacious, large balconly. It looked like the people before us had a christmas party with cocktail mixings left in the refer. But other than that, the location was perfect after a cruise and the ammenities on the day of our late departure, exceptional. We checked out at 1 p.m. and were allowed to use the pool/showers before our 6:30 p.m. exit. The housekeepers were polite and spoke/understood basic English. Lots of other places to eat, a few casinos nearby and in the main lobby. It was fun. I would go back. The only drawback for me was there was no ocean-swimming access, only at the lagoon which was fairly calm. Overall it was a great trip..

Reviews.Title: “Bumps in the Road - Just FYI's”
Reviews.Author: Wererunow
Reviews.Content: Room was dirty at check in. Food crumbs on small table. Toilet would flush strongly on its own numerous time per during day. Toilet seat & floor needed to be wiped because of powerful self flushing. Bed was worn. My butt was in a hole. No pun intended. I don't have a bad back but I was stiff from sleeping on that mattress. Asked specifically to shop on Sunday morning at Louis Vuitton and Guicci. I walked there and they were closed Sundays (for the entire day - every sunday). I thought they should have know that. I thought the prices, taxi's, drinks, food and excursions were very expensive. Our food room service was $130, but charged almost $178 with taxes and hotel delivery room fee, was 35%+ in total taxes & fees. (does not include tip expense) Took excursion to ziplining, hiking & kayaking for $189 per person. They canceled, rescheduled, then only took us ziplining but charged entire fee. We were told it would be from 8:30 to 4:00. We were back at 12:30. When asked concierge to help because they booked it, they said they would call us after they conferred with company. They called us back and told us they would refund us $10 total for both people ($5 each person) and we paid $378. We said that is totally unacceptable. Concierge said they would call us back. We never heard from them again. Our flight was next afternoon, but our cell phone is the same number. Most of the bar and wait staff didn't speak good english and I think it made us feel a bit excluded, a bit avoided, because couldn't really communicate well and it was awkward. It ended up being very expensive and we really didn't do anything but the pool and eat. Pool drinks were $12 mixed drink each. Our pool bill for 10am to 4pm (6 hours) 4 mixed drinks each (my husband & me) was $96 without tip. 5 days that was $500+ ouch. I couldn't imagine bringing a family here. Next vacation we are going to look into all inclusive. Travel agent says US hasn't caught on to that yet. Passports here we come! Then we are going to try Mexico.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad, but missing something I can't quite explain”
Reviews.Author: KainePeter
Reviews.Content: The Conrad is a nice hotel and we stayed on the side facing the lagoon. View was nothing short of spectacular. Nothing like waking up in the morning to the smell of fresh air with a tinge of sea salt. The gym was my favorite and I was there three times a day...probably to compensate for the Lobster egg Benedict they served in the downstairs restaurant, as well as Mojitos I indulged in at the various restaurants. So why the average review...the staff, they can make or break any business. They had an aloofness about them that suggested they were doing me a favor, a tad curt even. I could shrug it off one day, but three days...I think not. My wife and I enjoyed PR, we even enjoyed the location surrounding our hotel, we just think it wise to try other hotels on for size, after experiencing this one.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place but felt taken advantage of”
Reviews.Author: JFGainesville
Reviews.Content: After much online searching, we booked five nights here for a family vacation between Christmas and New Years. We paid $1,700 for a "special rate" in advance with Expedia and got confirmation for a 2-Queen Oceanside room. But at check-in, they had none. How could that be possible when I paid and booked in October? We reluctantly accepted a $50 credit and were told we could go oceanside in two nights. But on the third day, we were disappointed again. In this large hotel, the oceanside room given to us on the second floor was one of about 10 that didn't have a sit-on balcony like all the other floors! We also couldn't access the room from the hotel lobby elevators -- we had to go to the end of the halls by the outdoor pools. Discovering this at 10 p.m. didn't help--we gave in. But overall, we felt like perhaps our prepaid special rate status let them NOT provide the best value. The hotel itself is nice and modern with trendy decor. Wi-Fi worked better in a lobby than in the room. We had a small fridge, but after taking leftovers back the first night discovered there's no microwave. One outdoor pool is 6-feet deep only which keeps kids away. The other pool is large, with a slide and has a swim-up bar for drinks or eating on stools in the water. The hot tub was hot and large, about 14-feet by 20-feet. The small beach shown in the photos is actually public, but the chairs are from the hotel. They have a couple cruiser bikes to rent at $25/day but I'm not sure where you'd ride them on narrow streets. We had one meal in the Caribe Grill and it was fine. Self-Parking is tricky. You have to get your ticket validated at the valet station in the driveway 10 minutes before you leave. No one told us this, so we held up the line on Day 1 and everyone had to back down (it's underground) because there's no attendant at the exit. There is renovation going on down the street, so the area doesn't look first class. But we felt safe walking around and there were restaurants to walk to. Ropa Vieja Grill is nearby and had a full house every night. Although we had a rental car, we took a taxi to Old SJ for $15 (three people) because we read parking was a nightmare (yes, it looked awful). Except for the poor situation with our prepaid room, the hotel was a good place to stay in. Perhaps we should have demanded more than the $50 overall credit they gave us with an apology. It was our big-time family Christmas trip and put a damper on an otherwise fun time.

Reviews.Title: “When in San Juan... Stay Here!”
Reviews.Author: Excentrique
Reviews.Content: My sister, friend and I stayed here last month for nearly a week. We really enjoyed our trip! It's not far from the airport (only ~$20 cab right) and upon check in I was given an upgraded room with an ocean view. Let me tell you, the view was gorgeous! The room had two double beds, a balcony overlooking the ocean and a very large bathroom. (Did find it odd that the wardrobe and dresser were both located in the bathroom). Did not come with a tub, but had a wonderful see-thru (sexy! although not when traveling with a friend and your sister) shower. The toiletries smelled really good and the towels were high quality. I did not order any room service, so I cannot comment on that, however I did eat at one of the resaturants during the first night while I waited for my friend and sister to arrive. I had some tuna sushi from the noodle bar. A few days later my sister and friend ate there, but didn't really like their food. But the portions are really large and they're open very late into the morning. I loved that they had a casino on premise. They also have many pools to choose from, although I think that the workers should tell parents that their kids are not meant to be playing in the hot tub. It's a bit gross. The location was really nice - right in Condado. Many restaurants are within walking distance and a cab ride to Old San Juan takes only 10 minutes or so. I would stay here again if I ever return to San Juan!

Reviews.Title: “Very Good!!”
Reviews.Author: Lici3
Reviews.Content: Nice Place,clean room with beautiful view, If you like Casino, their is one with a feast atmosphere. The restaruant was good. The service can improve .

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: thelexusgirl
Reviews.Content: The hotel was everything you need for a 24 hour stay and more. There are multiple restaurants on property, a casino (the tables were good), and its a short cab ride to Old San Juan (although the taxis can be pretty pricey, $20 for a 10 minute ride). We had dinner in OSJ where there are many great choices.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing weekend!”
Reviews.Author: ElieTraveler_pr
Reviews.Content: This was a last minute reservation since I finally had 3 days off consecutive. I'm a HHonors member and decided to stay in this property for the first time just because of the brand and location. My overall stay was ok. Check-in was a breeze I arrived at 2pm (Check-in time is @4pm) but Maria quickly gave me a room just as I had requested it. Maria was very nice and helpful. The was spacious for the three of us, although I didn't like much the layout of the bathroom, but no biggie. We asked for towels and laundry bags and were sent promptly to our room. The bathroom was very clean, but the bedroom area needed a lot of dusting. The maid didn't clean the tables nor under and around the sofa area, it was full of dust! I really enjoyed the 24 hour pool area. The jacuzzi and water slide were great! The staff at the towel stand were very friendly. The beach, even though is small, is beautiful cristal clear water and very clean. The hotel is the last one on the Condado strip but is very safe to just walk around Condado and enjoy the shops and restaurants around for all tastes. We ate on our last day at Cafe Caribe for breakfast and it was very good; service, food, view were awsome! I just wanted to get away for a couple of days and the Conrad did the job! I would recommend to start fixing a couple of things on the outside of the hotel that are starting to get run-down. Little things like broken seats at swim up bar, missing tiles, mold on pool stairs and other things that shouldn't be seen at a Conrad.

Reviews.Title: “Great 1 night expereince”
Reviews.Author: Sergio M
Reviews.Content: Guys, I just completed the Princess Caribbean Cruise, and needed 1 night in San Juan. I was able to get the Conrad Hotel, and overall the experience was great! Check-in process was smooth, I was able to get all my question answered. We have children, so i wanted to make sure we can a room with enough space. They also offered me a upgrade for 30$ which wsa very reasonable for 2 twins, and 1 king with private room. Public Transportation is great. It cost my family aprx 5$ in coins (no bills), to get to Old San Juan. Adult is 75 cents, and kids is 50 cents (not sure). The premises was excellent, I had no time to enjoy the pools and near-by beach, but I took a quick walk, and really enjoyed their layout. We had lunch in old San Juan, Vaca Brava, and wow, it was really good. My kids had hard time to appreciate all that meat, so I wsa stuck with a few left-overs. I asked waiter for Doggy bag, and my wife gave me dirty look. When we walked out of resto, I saw some fellow, who looked hungry, and took my food with a big smile!!!!!! I have not done supper yet, so cannot comment. I'm planning to walk on Ashford Ave, and find a kid friendly resto. I would definetely come back!!!!!!! Thanks! Sergio

Reviews.Title: “Happy with our Experience at the Conrad”
Reviews.Author: Karen C
Reviews.Content: 2 adults and 2 children (13 & 10) vacationed over the Christmas holiday in 2011. We arrived on 12/21 and departed on 12/27. We originally reserved a family suite but was unhappy with the room/view. We requested and was given the same suite on a different floor. Unfortunately, the shower did not work. When I went to the front desk, my goal was simply to expedite the fixing of the shower; however, the manager gave us a room upgrade to an oceanview room in the main tower. We were very happy with that. The rooms were clean and the beds were comfortable. We thought it was a bit odd that the closet/drawers were located in the bathroom but we got over it quickly. We had one dinner and one breakfast at Cafe Caribe. The food was pretty much what we expected - good but not great. We had Christmas dinner at Pikayo which was very good but a bit of a waste for our 2 children. Even with a $100 comp from the Casino it still cost $300.00 and we only ordered 1 glass of wine. The Aqua Bar was good - Ricky waited on us several times and we were very happy with him. The Noodle Bar was very good. We visited the Casino nightly and did well. We only wish they had another Poker Table open and that they upgraded their Game King Poker slot machines (they are only $0.25). Marie was the activities coordinator and WE LOVED HER. She was even able to get our 13 year old daughter involved in activities such as cookie decorating. The pool area was lovely and our children enjoyed the slide. We participated in Yoga and Zumba and had a blast. The beach was cozy and has a traveling ice cream man that was a favorite with our children. There was also a man serving BBQ and drinks (a bottle of water was $1.00 compared to $2.50 at the hotel). The trip coordinators were all lovely. We booked the "New San Juan/Old San Juan" tour. We don't advise it since the New San Juan tour included a drive by the new mall!!?? Just go directly to Old San Juan - it was wonderful to explore the forts and walk on the cobblestone streets. We loved that Starbucks was right outside the hotel. There are many places to eat if you don't mind walking along Ashford Avenue. We ate at Ropa Viega (sic) which was excellent and we would definitely go back but with reservations this time even though the wait wasn't that long. We also ate at Subway and Mike's Pizza with the children. Further down on Ashford are several high end retail stores such as Cartier. We were very happy with this trip especially since the year prior we vacationed at Atlantis in the Bahamas which cost 4x more than this trip, the food was astronomically expensive and, even worse, it was too cold to enjoy the water rides. We plan on returning to the Conrad and making plans to visit the Rainforest and the luminescent bay.

Reviews.Title: “Lagoon View”
Reviews.Author: markfromaustin9876
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a week with a lagoon view in a suite. The hotel was immaculately clean, the view was great, and it was very quiet on the lagoon. Omel and Christopher at the front desk were very helpful, as were most of the staff. There are nice restaurants within 3 minutes walk (Pururiccan, Ropa Vieja, etc.). The Old Town is about 3 miles away, either an easy taxi or bus or a bit of a walk. Don't miss a trip to the rain forest

Reviews.Title: “Rooms are clean, nice, but not what I would consider "4-star"”
Reviews.Author: lisacat l
Reviews.Content: Maybe it's just me, but I feel like the hotel room that we were in is very comparable to other "3 star" places I've stayed at. Our room was clean and spacious, and I loved the white tiled floors, light colored walls, minimal dark furnishings. I am not a fan of carpet, dark colored floors, and walls because I am bedbug paranoid. The City View room had your typical queen bed, two dressers, desk, desk chair, chaise lounge, small closet, balcony and small fridge. The free electronic safe was very cool and useful. The location is awesome - super-duper close to the Beach, Walgreens, restaurants/bars, bus stop, and 15 minutes from the airport. We stayed at the tower where the pool is. The walls were a bit thin because some nights we could hear music pounding from one of the corporate event rooms down on the first floor (our room was on the third floor). As a gym rat, I was very impressed by their fitness facility. They had nice commercial grade elliptical machines, stationary bikes, and treadmills. They had weight machines, free weights, medicine balls and even kettlebells! There's a steam room, sauna room, and even indoor jacuzzi. Interesting thing to note is everything inside their fitness faciltiy is co-ed. The indoor jacuzzi was awesome to have because the outdoor one was too freakin' hot! We asked the pool guy working there if he could turn down the temp on the outdoor jacuzzi and he told us he couldn't and that it was just one temperature. Hmm..odd...since it was perfect the first day we were there. Just glad there was an alternative. The best thing about our hotel deal was the $30 a day voucher for two people for breakfast at the Cafe upstairs. Technically you could be very well fed and just pay the tip! Food in PR is expensive and having a free hearty breakfast is a great way to start off the day and allows for a light lunch (which can be bought a nearby Subway)!

Reviews.Title: “Lagoon View...”
Reviews.Author: TexasTravelChic
Reviews.Content: It was my second stay at the Conrad...... this time, on the Lagoon side. It was just as beautiful, as the ocean side! Sunrise was gorgeous. And the different water sports... were fun to watch. I enjoy this hotel, for many reasons.. There's so much to do, on the property! Great pools, restaurants, decks on the Lagoon side, excellent snorkling on site, gorgeous scenery, excellent service, great lobby bar, nice gym, casino, gift shop... you never have to leave! But if you do... you're close to everything!

Reviews.Title: “Great service and location, but some significant flaws.”
Reviews.Author: bmartin94
Reviews.Content: The pros: Excellent service, very clean rooms, great views (we had an ocean view and it was gorgeous), large casino, modern design, convenient location. Excellent restaurant in Pikayo. The cons: Our room had no drawers! The hotel only has two main elevators per tower, and they broke down often. We had to factor in elevator waiting time when making plans.

Reviews.Title: “The Real Review of the Conrad Condado Plaza-A Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: brad7815
Reviews.Content: Before you read this review I wanted ti give you some background information. I traveled to this property from Christmas day until New Years Day with my wife and two year old daughter. I am also from a "snob" town in NJ and I own several vacation clubs with 5 star resort company's hence when I travel I expect only the best. My family and I were beyond apprehensive/afraid to travel to this hotel after reading the comments that have been posted by previous guests. By writing this review I intend to provide you with the real truths about this property and the area so you can travel with some ease. Understand that people who review hotels on this or any site come from various areas of the country where the dollar goes farther and some who are not used to traveling at all. I have also learned and witnessed first hand that certain individuals will write a really poor review because they did not get something that they wanted from the hotel such as an upgrade. Having visited this hotel I can clearly say that I really cannot validate any of the comments that were listed by disgruntled unhappy guests. Understand that this property is at the far end of Condado Beach so you do have to walk approx 10 mins to get to the main area where the restaurants are. Keep in mind that several restaurants are within 3 mins of the hotel including Ropa Vieja and Chilis which I provided more information on below. If walking is an issue that you need to stay at a hotel that will better service your needs. Also understand that Puerto Rico is an Island and that almost everything needs to be brought in. Hence the fact that things cost more! See food area below. I attempted to give you a background on my trip and I also hi-lighted key areas below. When we arrived at the Condado Plaza we were greeted promptly by Andres(bell hop) who said they he would take care of our bags and have them up to our room in no time. Andres had a smile the entire week and was always there for us opening the door as we came back to the hotel from our daily walks. Next, we had the pleasure of meeting/dealing with Jaminelly who checked us in immediately(bare in mind we arrived on Christmas day and it was packed). I asked if we were able to get an upgrade and Jaminelly was able to take care of that for us without question. Her personality and willingness to help was infectious. We checked into the room and were pleasantly surprised and happy to be at this property. We stayed across the street in the building that sits on the lagoon side. The buildings are connected via a sky walk across the roadway. I still had an ocean view and a lagoon view. The room we were given was tremendous to the tune of a NYC apartment. We did not have the glass enclosed shower however we did have a tub and an enormous bathroom. This suited us better as we had a two year old with us who only takes baths. The room had two rooms for lack of a better description each of them with flat screen TV's. We had a fridge and microwave and enough closet/draw space for a huge family. All of the individuals we encountered during our vacation were polite, had smiles on their faces and went out of their way to ensure we had a great week. We always felt welcomed no matter where we were in the hotel. The hotel was manicured perfectly and members of the staff were always cleaning the various areas of the property on a daily basis. It seems as if others complained about the aesthtics of the building. When I travel I never have taken aesthetics into account. Yes the building is older. Yes they have completely redone the lobby and other areas. But who cares what the building looks like? Are you buying a condo or office across the street? No your their for a vacation and only should worry about service and amentities, not the fact that the building is getting worn. Activities/Amenities: As for activities, my wife and daughter loved the morning zumba and the activities for the kids were a nice thought including the movie by the pool, the feeding of the fish and the jump/bounce castle. Even the little things such as the ice pops and the starbucks samples were a great addition to a warm afternoon. The hotel also had great hammocks right by the ocean wall to lay on in the afternoon. I am not sure what else people would want from the resort. The hotel has three pools. The main pool is a huge L with a swim up bar (that has 20 seats) and a water slide. No its not typhoon lagoon at disney but it has several turns and is still fun. The beach is small and borders the road however, that is what you get where the location is in Condado. The beach had approx 250 people on it the day I was there, if thats not enough space for you I am not sure what is. I never had a problem with towels or chairs. In addition, the hotel instituted a security bracelet system to avoid anyone coming up from the beach that did not belong. The casino is small but has over 200 machines and 10-12 tables. Since you can only occupy one sit I am not sure why there is an issue. Cab ride to Old San Juan is $18-20 or you can take the bus for .75 Yoou can't blame the hotel for the bus not coming on time. Ashford ave gets backed up hence the buses get backed up. Food: Everything will cost you more in Puerto Rico. Even starbucks and dunkin donuts will be approx 50 cents to 1.00 more at least per item. There is a Walgreens approx 10 min walk down Ashford Ave. Walgreens is 24 hours and has everything from bottled water to liquor to a grocery section that has frozen aunt jemima pancakes etc. Go there get some basics to avoid having to get nailed for it everyday. The first day in we went to Chilis as we arrived late. What I can tell you for at least lunch there was only a difference of approximately $2 dollars per dish. To me it was worth it to just eat at the hotel for $2 more. The hotel was in line with every other restaurant in the area of the same quality. Yes, it is expensive for a burger 12.95 but its inline with other restaurants. It seems as if an average lunch will cost two people $30 with a tip. Dinner with two drinks, appetizer, two entrees and a desert in most restaurants will cost $100-110. Ropa Vieja: a must go to. 3-5 minute walk from hotel. Puerto Rican cuisine. Order the sampler platter and a must have is the ropa vieja which is shredded steak. I also had the seafood risotto which was amazing. Miro: Seafood approx 10 min walk from hotel. This was one of the best meals I have eaten and I am from the NY area. we had the calamari which was amazing and seafood paella for two. The profiterole we ordered were all eaten by my two year old before we could get to it. Tijuanas: 10 minute walk down ashford one block past miro. This is the best mexican food in the area and great prices. Be careful if you order the madre magarita as it will cost you more than your entire bill and will make you so drunk that you will not get home. Its a huge huge punch bowl! However the meals here are within $14 to $20 range. Voga: this is located 5-7 minutes down ashford ave in the renaissance hotel. It was an upscale italian meal. I ordered the lasagna which was pasta noodles made fresh. My wife had the chicken marsala which was huge. We ordered spinach dip as an appetizer and sharerd the cheesecake lollipops. This restaurant was really good. Service was great and food quality was very good. Al Dente: We originally tried to eat at Raices both of these are in Old San Juan. Unfortunately Raices was way too busy but if you have the opportunity go eat there. Al Dente was great food, reasonable prices but slightly high. Service was great. Dannys International and Mike's Pizza good for lunch or pizza. Breakfast we ate twice at the hotel and it was approxiamtely $30 for two omlettes and juices and a muffin. slightly expensive but if you eat off site its approximately $10 per dish plus tax and tip. The only issue that we had was that Aqua the restaurant by the pool was unable to handle to amount of people that came into the patio restaurant one day and it take forver to get food. However, Julio took care of our bill because we waited too long. This problem was corrected the next day and food and beverage managers were onsite to make sure things were going smooth. The following individuals made our stay: Aqua: Ninatoshka was a great server who always went out of her way to see my daughter Maya whether we ate at the restaurant or not. She always had a smile on her face and spent time talking to me and my wife while we sat down to eat. Housekeeping: Norma who serviced the room was great. She made sure we had anything we needed and the room was always in perfect clean order. Activities Staff: Both of the activities personnel who conducted Zumba(I donâ€™t remember their names)were great. They always went out of their way to ensure guests were having a good time. One morning our chairs were in the way of Zumba and needed to be moved. These individuals did not let us move our chairs, they insisted that they took care of it. They also made sure to come and get my two year old daughter to do zumba as they saw she really enjoyed it. Again, going above and beyond. Bell Hop: Andres Pool: Locastra was always asking how she could make things better. Monica at the towel desk always had a smile on and made sure to tell every guest to have a great day and enjoy the weather. We will definitely be coming back to the Condado Plaza in the near future. You will not be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: canuckx3NewBrunswick
Reviews.Content: Spent New Years Eve - Dec 31 - Jan 2 here in an ocean view room. We asked for a high floor and we were on the 9th floor (10 floors in hotel) We loved our room! there were 4 of us travelling together and all found the room to be very spacious and most importantly the room had great air conditioning and comfortable beds. Will stay here again - felt very safe here, great pools and a snorkeling beach on site plus we were close to Old San Juan. Even though it was New Years Eve, with a big party going on downstairs, the room was quiet. Would recommend this hotel to anyone

Reviews.Title: “Run, don't walk, away from this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: texasswerve
Reviews.Content: We had booked this hotel for a one night stay before boarding a cruise ship in San Juan. When we checked in, the front desk was understaffed and the noise coming from the lobby made check-in very frustrating. Once we finally got to our room, we found the room to be adequate at best. The furnishings were of poor quality and the bathroom was tiny! Parts of the wall were chipped away around the bathroom door. This was a $300/night room! The restaurant quality was subpar at best. The food was terrible and the service was even worse. At the restaurant by the pool, it took 30 minutes for the waiter to even come take our order and by the time we got our food, it was barely edible. This hotel is definitely not up to Hilton's standards! Find another hotel in San Juan!

Reviews.Title: “The Worst Possible Service”
Reviews.Author: Taddy_23
Reviews.Content: I am an avid traveller and stood at the Conrad San Juan Condado Plaza from 12.26.11 - 12. 31.11 and it was a terrible experience. First off we booked an ocean view room and when we checked in the lady at the front desk proceeded to check us in without telling us we would be overlooking a roof and the other side of the hotel. When we went to complain, we were told that there were no more rooms available. They suggested we wait until tomorrow and then move. When we explained how inconvenient this was, they said nothing could be done. We were not comfortable with wasting a day moving as we would have to vacate our temporary room by the noontime checkout and not move into the new room until after 3 PM at the earliest. We told them we would not move but wanted an adjustment for the room. I guess to front desk managers William Ibhern and Victor Diaz they felt I was asking them to find a cure for cancer. Their incompentence level was amazing!!! Not only did I have to spend an hour inquiring about my adjustment each day, but ultimately I had to get another manager to resolve the problem. That manager only resolved the problem because it was my last day and I was refusing to settle my bill. The worst part was that we had booked three roooms at this hotel and they did this to each of us. One of the days when I was arguing with Victor Diaz another guest was having it out with the front desk because she made the mistake of trying to switch the next day and was moved to another non ocean view room. The entire staff at this hotel could get nothing right. My room was never made before 5 PM, each day at breakfast they consistently got our orders wrong and we had to wait over a half hour for them to bring it after ordering, the bartenders at the pool bar would never bring our food orders and then when we cancelled they tried to charge us and finally the waitress tending to us at the beach showed up twice over a 4 hour period (once to take our drink orders and 40 minutes later to drop them off). I wouldn't reccomend this hotel to anyone, friend or enenmy!!!

Reviews.Title: “A Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: dinningforfun
Reviews.Content: Perfect location - Safe, wonderful beach, pools and accessability. Lots of families and children, and a bit more informal than some other Hilton sites we've stayed at. Ocean side is a bit more expensive, but personally the Condado view was perfect. The rooms are pretty good - but standard. Cleaning of rooms and floors was just OK,but this was over the New Years. The casual restaurants were expensive and not great food - so get out of the hotel for a decent meal - there are so many other options for resonably priced food. Though not rating it super high - We would consider staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Christmas at the Conrad”
Reviews.Author: callieq
Reviews.Content: I called the front desk prior to our arrival and asked if we could PAY for an upgrade (ocean view room), since we received a lagoon/city view through a â€œname your own priceâ€� website. The woman at the front desk first told me to call the website I booked through to discuss the matter with them, which clearly didnâ€™t make sense since I wanted to just pay the hotel for an upgrade. The website stated I needed to call the Conrad and figure it out with them. After calling back and forth, a Conrad employee then told me that whomever was working the front desk upon my check in could grant me an upgrade if they wanted to. I continued to tell her that I wanted to pay the hotel for an ocean view not chance a possible "free" upgrade. At that point the conversation seemed to dwindle. I then called and emailed Leah Rossi, the Concierge Guest Services Manager, whose name I found on other Trip Advisor reviews and asked the same question. She personally called me back in a couple of days (she was on vacation- emailed stated) and after I explained my previous encounter with the front desk, she granted us a free ocean view upgrade. Arrival/Rooms: Flawlessâ€¦ we checked in within 2 minutes and were given our keys to a 9th floor ocean view room. The style of the reception floor is contemporary and was nicely covered with Christmas decorations. The Conrad hosts a couple of bars on the first floor as well as an overpriced gift shop which sells from t-shirts, to shaving cream, to beer, to chips, jewelryâ€¦ etc. Our room was quite nice. Shades of orange and red throughout complemented each other nicely. The standup shower was fully see- through, but there were doors to the bathroom. The bathroom was very large with dark mahogany- like closets/ drawers that also hosted a coffee machine and refrigerator. We especially liked how we could hang our wrinkled clothes and the steam from the shower took them right out. The marble sink countertop was nice as well as the large mirror that hosted great light. The room had a red couch, a comfy king bed and a desk with a slim new television. The balcony at the foot of the room overlooking the ocean was amazing and highly recommended. Was the room the nicest room weâ€™ve ever stayed in? No, but I will stress weâ€™re not very picky people. Pools/ Beach: Talk about saving your seat at the pool! I will let you in on some secrets. The main hotel hosts a salt-water pool, a Jacuzzi and a large swim up pool with a small slide to the right. The trees around these pools can really block the sun, so if youâ€™re not looking to get your tan on- I would suggest finding a shady seat around here. The beach is attached to the main hotel and has chairs as well. It is definitely not the best beach youâ€™ll ever encounter, but a nice alternative to the pools. Towels are found at the little doorway to your right as your go down the stairs exiting the hotel- you just have to return them within a certain time. Now the secretâ€¦ the lagoon side of the hotel hosts a quiet sunny pool, which you can access by going to the casino floor and through a tunnel across the street, or at street level. There is more sun, less of saving seats and peacefulness. Here you will also find the tennis counts, paddle boarding and kayaking (minimal fee). Activities: On the first day, we were approached by a woman named Mari who seemed to be the activities director. We went on the power walk, which was very informative and Mari did a great job showing us different beaches and pointing out other restaurants. There was also Zumba and Yoga being offered that day. We used the gym once in our 2 -day stay. Itâ€™s located on the lagoon side and is a decent size. It has many machines and weights for just about anyone. There are bathrooms and towels as well. The casino, located on the second floor is quaint and has tables and slot machines. We didnâ€™t win anything. Dinner: Well we missed our first dinner in Old San Juan (Marmalade) due to our late flight, so we ordered room service. Room service is room service to us. We really ate it and went to bed. The second night we ate at the hotelâ€™s restaurant Pikayo, which has excellent reviews. I will interrupt the review here and state that we are people that have eaten at 5 star restaurants and also enjoy a nice cheeseburger on any given day. Some of the two person tables are very close other couples. Other tables although are very spaced out. The lighting is on the darker side and the table clothes are crisp and clean. We started off with two sangrias. For a cold appetizer we decided on the tuna, which we didnâ€™t really enjoy. The tuna was layered on something that tasted like a rice cake- no flavor. We also had the mofonguitos, which weâ€™re well seasoned and pretty tasty. We split a salad with feta cheese, which was very light and nothing special. I had the salmon, which was nicely textured and cooked well and my husband had the beef tenderloin with blue cheese, which he thought was cooked perfectly and tasted awesome. For dessert my husband had crÃ¨me bruleee and I had some chocolate dish. They both were very sweet and good. The service was really good, but almost too overwhelming. It seemed like there was always someone at our table doing something. What happened after dinner though was a little rough. Right at the exit of the restaurant as we were leaving a huge cockroach came from the outside wall of Pikayo running on the ground in front of many people. A woman started yelling for my husband to get it and he most certainly did. He stayed around it as I went back in to the restaurant to tell the maÃ®tre de that there was a dead cockroach that we just killed outside the restaurant. Three minutes later a man came and swept it up, but no one from the restaurant apologized or thanked us. In addition, the hotel has a noodle restaurant, a deli/sandwich cafÃ© that has similar food to the poolside restaurant, a pizza establishment and a Starbucks outside the hotel. There is a little coffee bar in the middle of the hotel also that serves light pastries in the morning and then switches to a bar. Extra: Santa made a visit to the hotel; there was a bouncy house out back, bingo and a big checkerboard were available by the pool. Upon leaving the hotel a very nice employee took care of our check out as we exited the elevator and so we didnâ€™t have to wait in line. The hotel went all out for Christmas, with a huge party. The music could be heard all the way in our room â€“ 9th floor. The elevators overall were a tad slow in general, but there is an elevator by the pools which seemed to be faster. Overall, would we stay here again- yes! The location is great and very central which we prefer. There are definitely some hit or misses with the hotel, but itâ€™s a nice place to lay your head and be on vacation.. Enjoy your trip!

Reviews.Title: “Lacking service”
Reviews.Author: Tjj9020
Reviews.Content: When we first checked checked into our room it hadn't been cleaned and wreaked of smoke despite a nonsmoking room. The service workers seemed reluctant to serve you, often waiting several minutes to be recognized despite plenty of available workers. We had to haul all of our stuff back down to the lobby, no upgrade was offered. The second room was much nicer but the rooms are small. The bathroom doesn't have a real door do you are kind of out there. The bed was comfortable so that was a plus.

Reviews.Title: “spectacular view of ocean”
Reviews.Author: Annbongio
Reviews.Content: We stayed here last year from 10/15-10/20 and it was amazing! The weather was perfect and the the oceanview room was breathtaking. I will list the pros and cons of the conrad: Pro: The staff was wonderful and upgrated our room (upon request, you do have to ask though) to the 10th floor oceanview room. The view from the balcony was truely amazing. The room was quaint and clean but smaller than I was expecting for it being "one of the best rooms in the hotel" as was told to us. It was decent enough, just not what I was invisioning. I expected wow and was ok. The location is great, just a hop outside on the local bus (DO NOT drive here, its absolutley crazy) and it takes you right into old San Juan. Con: The doors to the patio were very heavy and don't stay open by themselves at all. You either have to go out or come in, no enjoying the ocean air while in bed. The noise was obtrusive to say the least. There was a wedding being held that evening and the loud music was blaring well into the next morning, we could not sleep it was so loud and we were on the top floor, I can't imagine what the guests on lower floors were thinking. We did not have a room service menu and requested one 3 times and never did get one. Don't waste your time at the hotel fru fru overpriced restaurant, not worth the money, There are plenty of great little mom and pop type places that are well worth the quick walk down the street. The beach area was very small and they charge you to use the many umbrellas there. The pool is nice but the hotel was more of a party type spot for the younger 20 something crowd, not very romantic for couples. Overall it was a nice place to stay, a bit on the small side and not extravagant. If it was not for the ocean view it would not have been worth the money to stay here. If I go to PR again, I will check out a different hotel for the price, I liked the red decor, but it was not a 4 star hotel, more like a suped up holiday inn, only smaller and the rooms had a dampness feel about them. If you are going to PR to see old San Juan, I suggest actually staying right in Old San Juan.

Reviews.Title: “Not up to Conrad reputation”
Reviews.Author: IADDutch
Reviews.Content: A nice hotel, with many restaurants and bars within walking distance. Lobby is very nice, the rooms are ok but not up to Conrad standards. All in all, this is basically a high-end Doubletree hotel. It does not have the Conrad amenities or sophistication, but if your expectations are for a Doubletree, it is enjoyable. Some of the nits: - Nearly every meal, there was something they did not have and needed to substitute. - The only beach area is right next to the highway - Staff is friendly, but often less than competent - The menu selections nickle and dime to death (you want fries with your burger, that will be $2 more) - The bathrooms by the pool have defective locks on all stalls - the room balcony is rusted badly I can go on and on.....

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Views but Very Noisy”
Reviews.Author: HeartTraveling15
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a few days after a cruise. The hotel and rooms are very beautiful. Our rooms had an ocean view, which was stunning! It wasn't just a view, the ocean was so close that it looked like we were in the ocean. There is one thing to be careful of. We were on the second floor, which meant that we got to hear all the music that is played throughout the night in the lobby quite well. I'm a very sound sleeper, but I had a lot of trouble sleeping due to the noise. I called down to the front desk, but they did not care. Also, we had two rooms that were not joining. One of the rooms joined another room. Consequently, we could hear everything that went on in the joined room. Otherwise, it was a great stay. Oh, and the beds are amazing!

Reviews.Title: “Nice get away”
Reviews.Author: morganmosley327
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed my trip to San Juan in general...we saw all the basic sights forts, museums and what not while we were there and it was a lot of fun! The hotel was awesome just beware of the casino...i didnt win one cent!!!! Other than that the food, atmosphere, and room were all very nice. THe ocean view room is small but nice and the balcony makes for an amzing view when you wake up! I say try it out :)

Reviews.Title: “Best view of the water!”
Reviews.Author: PooksChicago
Reviews.Content: I was initially nervous about this hotel as I had seen some negative reviews on TripAdvisor; but, it was the cheapest hotel for the weekend we were headed to San Juan, so we went for it. I was traveling with my fiance, parents, and future mother/father in order to do some planning for a destination wedding this spring. Staff were helpful with bags when we pulled up and then the front desk was friendly and accommodating. The lobby bar had slow service but the best mojito I had during the whole trip! Our room was clean and bright. Housekeeping came early in the morning each day which worked for us as we were usually out by 9. My biggest complaint was how tiny the bathroom is...it was reallllly hard to have 2 people in there at once (you can't open the shower door and have someone brushing their teeth)! The casino was fun. Most of the dealers were laid back and friendly to guests (I lived at the $5 Black Jack table). My favorite part about the Conrad was the view of the ocean from the grounds. There is a huge rock wall and the waves splash against it constantly. So pretty! You can only go on the beach on one tiny square on the side of the hotel but even that was enough. The pools near the water were nice and wait staff was attentive. Overall, we had a great experience at the Conrad. Not as modern as some of the other hotels in the area but I think we will highly recommend to the guests at our wedding!

Reviews.Title: “Nice vacation experience”
Reviews.Author: AStieber
Reviews.Content: This was our first time , though staying at this hotel. Checking in was efficient, though not very warm. The room was excellent: attractive, comfortable, spotlessly clean, and with a great view of the lagoon and the city. On the second night (a Friday), there was a party on our side of the building, with a very noisy band. The party stoped at 11 p.m., though, and the hotel gave us a $40 credit. The rest of the stay was uneventful.The service personnel were constantly at work cleaning and getting rooms ready. Room service was prompt and friendly, and the food was excellent. On the last night, which was our wedding anniversary, we had front row seats watching fireworks launched from a barge almost in front of our balcony: a nice end to our stay. Incidentally, there are several excellent restaurants within walking distance of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: troopman5073
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Conrad San Juan Condado Plaza overnight on Friday, 12/2/11 prior to our cruise. The hotel is in an excellent location very close to the pier and on the ocean front. We asked for and received an complementary upgrade to ocean front. This was the second time in two years we have stayed here prior to a cruise. We were very pleased with the cleanliness and hospitality of the staff. There are several restaurants close by and we ate breakfast at their cafe which was very good. There is a casino on site and the pools were used by many patrons. Our room was plenty large with an enclosed large shower area, coffee maker and refrigerator. We will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Should have used the money they spent on the lobby to train their staff”
Reviews.Author: wanderlustinwithsun
Reviews.Content: Came here on a quick holiday break. Nice facilities, but the location and staff are seriously sub par. Room: Got a city view room that basically faced the road. Despite this fact, it was actually quiet. The room was modern and clean. Though the bathroom was tiny, it was still nice. The bed was comfortable. Facilities & location The gym is very nice with several treadmills, weight machines and circuit training accessories. The pool was big with plenty of lounge chairs --- some of which faced the ocean while others faced a nearby highway. The beach is a dinky patch of sand directly underneath the overpass. The hotel is underneath an airport route, so be prepared for the plane roar as you are relaxing outside. Luckily, you can't hear it in the rooms. Staff: The staff are disinterested and incompetent. Tired after a late night flight, we arrived to an empty front desk. This is a huge hotel, really? Ended up having to call the main line and wait for 20 minutes for someone to check us in. Downstairs bartender just ignored us when we ordered a drink. Â  Atmosphere: This is a very active hotel. During our visit we encountered a large conference and two weddings. Not sure if there is any relevance , but the patrons were somewhat trashy. I saw a man eating fried chicken while sitting in the hot tub. Â I'm sorry, but that is an unsavory sight. Definitely Â do not recommend and will not be back.

Reviews.Title: “Need to keep up with competing neighboring hotels”
Reviews.Author: Philasian
Reviews.Content: The location is great: rooms with view of Atlantic Ocean or overlooking the Condado Lagoon; convenient driving access to Old San Juan while connecting to the bustling and hustling touring neighborhood. However, the room needs upgrade, especially the sound proof feature. We can easily hear other guests slamming doors and chatting in the hallway when we sleep. The breakfast menu is very limited. We have hard time not to repeat what we had in previous days. Although the table waiting is excellent. There are always plenty servers and they are very responsive. The TV set also needs upgrade. There is no HD programming at all. There are other newer looking hotels and resorts just blocks down the road. And there are new ones under construction. Conrad needs to keep up.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: NYC York City, New York, USA
Reviews.Title: “wish we stayed longer”
Reviews.Author: martyna b
Reviews.Content: Just came back from the Conrad yesterday, and the feeling to be back in NYC was sad.. =( This was our 2 time in PR but our first trip was nothing compared to this one. My boyfriend and I stayed at the Conrad for 3 days and had an awesome experience. We originally booked for the King Lagoon Room.. Ended up in room #666 (yikes) with a not so wonderful view. We went downstairs and spoke with Fernando to see if there was any other room avaiable.. He told us there was nothing available at the moment but to come back in 30 mins or so, by the time we came back, he was nice enough to upgrade us to an Ocean View Room.. It was breath taking. It was just the most specatular view and the sound of the waves splashing on the rocks in the morning was just amazing. The room was very sexy.. Perfect for couples who are there for a romantic get-away. We ate at the Eight Noodle Bar, the food was great.. a little pricey.. but for the quality and quantity it was totally worth it =) we also enjoyed a wonderful breakfast at Cafe Caribe with a window view of the ocean..they also serve lunch and dinner. We wanted to visit the Bacardi Factory so we took the local bus (#53) that stops infront of the hotel for 75c into Old San then a ferry for 50c and cab from the ferry to the Factory for $3. Totally worth the experience and the Factory tour is free and you also get 2 free drinks =) The hotel is conviently located to restaurants outside the hotels for much cheaper dinners and DRiNKS... The Aqua bar by the pool area was very friendly but expensive, felt like we were being charged for ViP service in NYC nightclub. (1 beer and 1 jack & coke $18) The hotel is very clean, staff was very helpful and kind. Anything you need they can help you with =) We will definitely be back to the Conrad for our next trip to PR.

Reviews.Title: “Nice”
Reviews.Author: hamlet20
Reviews.Content: Our room was nice and clean. Close to the airport but not too close. Easy drive to Old Town. Good bistro next to Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Don't Stay Here”
Reviews.Author: catnsyd
Reviews.Content: Not impressed at all. Very disappointing for the price. Room was not clean. Tile floor felt sticky, long dark hair around the edges of the room. Stayed 2 nights pre-cruise and housekeeping never came to clean our room. We did finally get clean towels after 2 phone calls. Needed towels as the shower leaked all over the VERY tiny bathroom floor. Pretty view from the back. Other than that the surrounding area needs lots of work. Would not stay here again, will advise our travel agent of the poor service. Too bad that it gave us a generally poor feeling about ever visiting San Juan again at all. We work too hard for our vacation money to spend it where people could care less.

Reviews.Title: “Business Lodging at Conrad”
Reviews.Author: Carlos T
Reviews.Content: Anyone staying at the Conrad and wants to have that special attention, please ask for Omel. I often travel on business and have specific needs for guests I entertain. Omel will go out of his way to make sure the Conrad experience is unforgettable.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Pre-Cruise stay”
Reviews.Author: terryg4766
Reviews.Content: We stayed here 2 nights before cruising from San Juan. We booked several months ahead. I e-mailed to hotel a couple months ahead and asked to be upgraded to an ocean-view room. We received a very nice room on the ninth floor with wonderful views. The room was very quiet and comfortable. I found to staff very nice and helpful. There are several reasonably priced restaraunts within walking distance. The public transit goes right by the front door. 75 cents (EXACT CHANGE REQUIRED) will get you to Old San Juan on either bus 21 or 53. Luggage is not allowed however as we tried to take it on embarkation day since our ship was docked 100 yards from the bus station. All in all we were very pleased with this hotel

Reviews.Title: “All inclusive resort at a comparatively reasonable price”
Reviews.Author: ajb_2008
Reviews.Content: The Conrad Condada Plaza is a full-service resort located on the western edge of Condado. It's conveniently located just off highway 26 coming from the airport, but a little ways from the main Condado resort/shopping area. It's not a huge inconvenience (we did the 10 minute walk nightly for dinner), but it's something to keep in mind compared to some of the neighboring (and more expensive) resorts. On site services: there is on-site parking ($16/day self-pay), three pools (one salt-water, one across the street in the lagoon-side tower), two hot tubs (again, one in the lagoon tower), a 24-hour casino, a pool-side bar/cafe and several restaurants. There is a same-day laundry service, and AT&T wi-fi throughout the hotel, including pool-side and at the adjacent beach. Staff service: Overall, exceptional staff service between the front desk, housekeeping, the concierge and the food/bar wait staff. The rooms: We stayed in an ocean view king. The rooms were spacious, well-appointed, and recently renovated. The bed was quite comfortable, a little soft but still supportive, and came with down pillows and comforters. Linens/towels were of high quality. Room appointments include a flat panel tv, mini-fridge, microwave, coffee-maker, safe and ironing board. A few issues: - Our room had no storage space for clothes aside from the closet. (of note, we were traveling with friends who stayed in a city-view room and they DID have drawers). - Ocean view rooms come with an expansive, solid, well constructed floor-to-ceiling window with locking glass door. By contrast, our friends in the city-view room had a rickety sliding glass door that didn't fully close and rattled with the wind. - Some rooms come with a full glass shower in the middle of the bathroom. Some people think this is weird. - The bathroom doors are sliding doors which provide visual privacy but offer no sound barrier. May be an issue if you have guests over. Beach access: There is a small sandy public beach adjacent to the hotel, and the hotel provides free beach chairs and the bar will deliver food/drink to the beach area. The water is protected by a breakwater, which is safer than the unprotected Condado beach a few minutes away, but the sand here is rockier than Condado. The food: There are several restaurants to choose from, including a couple of standard-fare operations that provide decent, acceptable but not spectacular fare (we ate at these places a couple of times for breakfast and lunch), along with a higher-end new american restaurant, as well as an asian fusion noodle bar, neither of which we tried. Overall: We really enjoyed our stay here. If we were staying in San Juan again, we might pick a place with better access to one of the better local beaches, but otherwise was not disappointed in the least and would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Resort style hotel in good location”
Reviews.Author: Co_MeathEvie
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights before a cruise. Large hotel, rooms well equipped and comfortable. Hotel can be noisy so hard to find a place for a quiet drink. Also bars and restaurnats expensive so just take a short walk and you will find plenty of local choice which was very good

Reviews.Title: “So glad we stayed here!”
Reviews.Author: BMac2005
Reviews.Content: We just returned from the Conrad in San Juan and were VERY pleased. Service: Very good service. 5 mins after we checked in, they brought up a free bottle of champagne. Hector was very nice - he stayed and chatted with us about the history of San Juan. It was a great way to start our stay! Staff would always call up to our room to follow up on any requests we made. Hotel Overall: I really liked it. Cool, chic lobby, wonderful views, clean, great bars, pools, amenities. Hotel Rooms: One of the best rooms I stayed in. Ocean view w/ balcony, cool colors / decor, good sized bathroom, safe, bathrobes and slippers, turn-down service with chocolates, safe. Casino: Overall it was nice. Staff were friendly. Drink service was good. The only negatives: 1) the hotel is at the very end of the strip. The first few blocks, while they seemed safe, were pretty run down / unimpressive. 2) unless you're there on business don't use the business center - over $10 just to print my boarding passes - it took all of 3 mins. I really didn't experience ANY of the issues of some other travelers (issues with maids, loud door closing, run down look, parking, etc). I did stay in the nicer tower so maybe there's wear and tear - but I didn't see ANY signs of it. There were two items in particular I heard people complain about that I didn't understand: there were some that for some unknown reason actually traveled to the Carribbean in late August (the worst time to go for storms - trying to save a few $$?) and then they blamed the Conrad when there were power outages. Also, people complained about the parking charge - $16 is NOTHING if you travel a lot. Chicago it's $35-50, South Beach $25, San Francisco - $50 - $60 per night. People need to get a clue.
