My wife found the hotel very enjoyable as well. We would return.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but constant morning airshow”
Reviews.Author: argosy
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel during the Thanksgiving break. Urban setting. Was in a lagoon-side room, necessitating a skywalk trip to the main hotel, which wasn't bad as long as you don't mind walking past the casino each way. The big complaint is that part of the hotel is in the take-off path of a nearby airport such that all the single- and two-engine planes roar right over our room, pretty much guaranteeing a 6:00am wake-up time. Location otherwise was decent: a cheap taxi ride to Old San Juan, and the major tour companies pick up right at the hotel lobby. Plenty of dining opportunities within walking distance east of the hotel, in addition to the on-site restaurants. Adjacent to the main hotel is a token (public) beach about about two-hundred feet wide. Towel location hidden and non-obvious. Remember to get your hotel wristband when you get your towel so that the beach personnel will know you from the riff-raff and set up your lounge chair. View at the beach was across the bay of... other hotels. Nice pools with one having a poolside bar that nobody used. The hot tub of the main building was a cold tub while we were there (no obvious switch to warm it, so I'll assume it was broken). The lagoon-side building had its own pool, and a hot tub that was hot. Staff was very friendly, and the concierge even offered us towels for our Bioluminescent Bay tour. Small bar on mezzanine had very friendly bartenders. Staff passing us in hallway always greeted us. Cleanliness-wise, it was good, though when we got there the soap in the shower was obviously used with a hair on it. Aside from that, no complaints. Rooms have a laptop-accommodating size safe where you set the four-number combination. For those of you that need your Starbucks fix, there's one right outside the lobby door (but they don't take Starbucks cards; they'll give you a 10% discount card instead). If you walk a couple blocks further east there's a neat local place that serves breakfast with an oceanside view. Another note: if you're going to go on tours of bioluminescent bay, rain forest, snorkeling, etc., you're in the wrong location, since a lot of that stuff is on the east side of the island. While the tour companies pick you up, you're in for a 45-60 minute bus ride each way. I would stay here again, modulo the aircraft noise, if I needed to be in the same area. Otherwise I would choose a different location since the nature stuff I perceive as being far away. Site note: I would have submitted photos, but the site turned them sideways, so I removed them.

Reviews.Title: “Did I check-in to Conrad or Motel 6?”
Reviews.Author: CecibelB
Reviews.Content: I donâ€™t know where to begin so letâ€™s start with the pro: my request of staying away from the elevator and high floor were met. The room was cleaned and no deficiencies, expect for the remote control at the beginning. The size of the room and balcony and pool were decent. Location of the hotel and grounds were ok. Cons: the service or lack of it. I stepped out of the cab and the doorman literally held the door of the taxi cab and did nothing to helped me with my carry on (not even to get off the taxi, which was a van so the step to get out was bigger). The same happened every time I wanted to take a cab from/to the hotel. The agents at the concierge desk sometimes were front office agents???? Confused, yes me too. At one point the Concierge Desk closed at 4pm on a Sunday. I saw the bellman sitting at their desk and decided to ask some questions which I knew they were not going to be helpful and they proved me right. There were a few more incidents with the lack of service providedâ€¦â€¦but what really intrigued me was the design of the bathroom. I stayed at the new/renovated tower and the bathrooms in those rooms have the closet, coffee maker and fridge in the same room. This is kind of tough when I am taking a shower in the nice glass shower and my friend wants to get in the bathroom to get dressed or the ironing board. I was expecting for a Conrad to have higher service standards and have their staff always with a friendly smile, but I found a too much laid back attitude and no courtesy at all. the other people with average reviews were correct.

Reviews.Title: “First Trip to San Juan”
Reviews.Author: skinner67
Reviews.Content: We were on a trip with our Basketball club to the San Juan Shootout. What I will say about the Conrad is this: Extremely clean, very friendly, very good food, and the cost was under what I would have expected for this clean/high standard hotel. Some people I talked to that stayed down the street at the La Concha said they enjoyed that hotel and the long ocean beach.. until they visited us at the Conrad. They had a constant "sewer" odor throughout their hotel and outside and they thought it was normal for San Juan....wrong. They loved the Conrad and especially when they visited our room overlooking the ocean. IF and when you book... definately book the oceanview for a few dollars more, there isn't much to look at if you don't. The Conrad does have a beach.. but it's on the cove, which is made up of a reef that seperates it from the ocean, but no ocean beach.. a short walk down towards the La Concha is a public beach which borders the La Concha. The only bad thing that we experienced about the Conrad.. was the service down by the pool, very slow if they stopped by you at all.

Reviews.Title: “Super sexy and excellent service!”
Reviews.Author: Aida R
Reviews.Content: Satff was beyond helpfull, they were able to help with directions and reccomend us places. Stay away from the gift shop and their restaurants as they are overpriced. I loved the view from our room, we had an ocean view room, 7th floor, and the view was breath taking, We walked form thehotel to the old San Juan it was about a 30 minute walk, and a 16 cab ride back to the hotel. over all a bit pricey but worth the penny. My only complaint was that the bathrooms door don't lock

Reviews.Title: “Good”
Reviews.Author: nefty
Reviews.Content: Yes is good hotel to stay i recommend to my friend.

Reviews.Title: “Average...Only Average.”
Reviews.Author: LMN730
Reviews.Content: Service was only average, but the staff was nice. Glad it was a business trip, because if I had to foot the money for what was provided, I would have been HOT! Not quite sure why the conference decided to use that hotel; the hot tub was broken, towels were in short supply, and their continential breakfast was beyond basic, thank God Starbucks was next door. Tours were over-priced and were canceled at the last minute due to the marathon... we ended up renting a car and had a ball doing the same tour for a 1/3rd of the cost...really? Yes, really! Floors were not mopped daily, and I agree with another review...Closet, coffee maker and refrigerator in the bathroom? Why? but to say the least the ocean view was absolutely BEAUTIFUL! Overall...average.

Reviews.Title: “Really Nice Place”
Reviews.Author: Ebobee
Reviews.Content: We stayed overnight in preparation for a cruise, and found the hotel and location to be quite nice. The room we stayed in was in a tower across the street from the main hotel but within easy walking distance to everything the hotel had to offer. The grounds were beautiful with remarkable views, and the staff went out of their way to make us feel welcome. What a great way to start our cruise. While we loved everything about the place, the one item holding me back from a maximum rating was the room decor. The room was just a bit too plain for the grounds and surrounds. It had a modern look that just didn't work for us - a lot of white and glass. That said, we didn't spend too much time in the room anyway - there was just too much to do at the hotel and the area surrounding it. We especially liked the pool area and the grounds around it; hammocks for guests to lounge in were really special. We would stay here again in a heart beat - but would make our own arrangements rather than going through the cruise line. Rooms seemed to be cheaper that way, and you really didn't get anything special for going through the cruise line. The port is just a few minutes away and the cabs to get there are cheap. Same goes for the ride from the airport - no need to involve the cruise line. There are plenty of places to eat along the water just down the street from the hotel - that's what we did, and had a great time.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't have asked for more”
Reviews.Author: ChicagoCop009
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed in the Conrad for 7 days and absolutely loved it. I booked the room through orbitz and had a city view room. When we arrived at check in we were given a free upgrade to an ocean view. The view was incredible. The location was perfect as it was just a 5 min drive to old san Juan. The bars in the hotel were very hip, and many famous people stay in the hotel. While we were there I met "big papi" David Ortiz from the Boston Red Sox, and Christian Castro (some Mexican singer). The staff was very friendly and the rooms were very nice. All the people who have complained about this hotel are probably the people that nothing is ever good enough for. One more thing, you can see el morro from your balcony in the ocean view rooms. I usually stay with family every time I go to Puerto Rico, but the next time I stay at a hotel it will definitely be the Conrad. My wife and I absolutely loved it.

Reviews.Title: “It was a pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: Marthaceleste
Reviews.Content: Very busy hotel good location for view of the ocean room was clean shower in the middle of room was a bit strange? Closet in bathroom?coffee maker and refrigerator in bathroom? A bit odd, the restaurants on site are good. Plenty of room by pools ocean view beautiful.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful resort hotel but didn't feel safe”
Reviews.Author: citygirlinsuburbia
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in April 2011 for one night before our cruise left. The place was really hopping with nightlife when we checked in at 11pm. After a long flight the kids were hungry at 11pm local time. The hotel suggested a Subway down the street that was still open but that we shouldn't take the kids out and not to carry too much money on us. That didn't make me feel safe having to stay in this hotel room while my mom and husband went to get a couple sandwiches. Then when the sun rose we got to really see outside and one direction was beautiful with the ocean but the building next to this view was a gutted hotel that looked like a bomb had hit it. I have traveled quite a bit but have never felt so nervous for our safety. Couldn't wait for the cruise to leave. The hotel did have a great view and the room while small had nice amenities though.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, amenities, and service in San Juan”
Reviews.Author: ambassadortm
Reviews.Content: The Conrad San Juan is an excellent hotel to stay at in San Juan. While attending a business conference, I was pleased by the friendly staff and rooms - spacious, marble minimalist, art deco style motif, nice bathrooms with glass shower - nice water pressure and temperature. Restaurants are convenient both in and out of the hotel. You are less than 2 blocks away from the excellent Cuban-Puerto Rican Restaurant Ropa Vieja, San Juan's best NY style pizzeria, Mike's Pizzeria, and just up ahead is the La Concha Resort - affectionately called South Beach in San Juan. You can avoid all the noise and still be close to all the action staying at the Conrad. Pool facilities are nice too and the views of the ocean are spectacular from your room. The conference I attended was once held in a hotel on the Isla Verde side of San Juan in the past and this year, attendance was up by 100 percent with the Conrad sold out... Everyone had a great time. You will too when you choose the Conrad. Also for you business travelers, the Conrad includes hi-speed internet in their rates! A big plus and avoids that annoying $12-$15 daily upcharge that other hotels apply in San Juan. Business center is useful but can be expensive, so plan accordingly to be efficient when you use business center services.

Reviews.Title: “Amaaaazing!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Tampadiva
Reviews.Content: I was extremely pleased with my stay at the Conrad. My ocean view room had an amazing view of the Atlantic that was worth every penny. The decor of the room was very chic. From the moment I entered the dazzling lobby and was greeted by the friendly staff, I knew I made a great hotel selection. They have a nice variety of onsite restaurants for casual and fine dining. The beach was quaint and I enjoyed hanging out at the pool. The Eternal Bar is a great place to meet up before/after dinner and the ginger martini was amazing. The hotel is in a great location from the airport and minutes from Old San Juan. The staff gave great recommendations for me to explore the Puerto Rico! I had a blast and look forward to my next visit!

Reviews.Title: “Good location and good service”
Reviews.Author: Angie B
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a great location within walking distance of many shops and restaurants. We had a nice art deco room with an ocean view. The staff was very friendly and efficient. Check out the pool bar aqua a night quiet and great place to have a drink ask the bartender David Hernandez to make you special drink you won't be disappointed!

Reviews.Title: “Art Deco, Comfortable and Good Amenities”
Reviews.Author: Flyairhost
Reviews.Content: The name of this hotel is the Conrad Condado Plaza. Since I was a child, I've seen this hotel change names many times over but always kept the Condado Plaza part. As we walk in, we found a nice modern and bright lobby. It is quite modern and very art deco. It has a very big fish tank, funky red lighting, interesting seating and bar. It is a little confusing to get your bearings the first time in the lobby but after a while, we got used to it. The hotel consist of two buildings across the street from each other and connected by a skybridge. The main building faces the ocean and the other one a lagoon. Prices are based if you have ocean, lagoon or street view. The check-in process was smooth with a very professional staff. The concierge were very friendly and attentive. The main building has a great pool with a slide, volleyball net, poolbar and plenty of seating around. There is a smaller 'salt' pool as the beach area is small and it is for those who do not want to deal with the sand. Finally there is also a whirlpool. The beach is quite small but never crowded. There is also a Starbucks next door where you can charge your purchases to the room. Massages by the pool are offered but it is very expensive. The room is quite nice with a nice big bed facing the ocean. All rooms have balconies to sit outside and enjoy the ocean view and listen to the waves breaking against the coral reef and feel the nice warm breeze. There is also a nice couch to watch tv. The only problem is that the tv is very small and was quite disappointing. The bathroom was one of the biggest I've seen with a huge shower, a refrigerator, coffee machine and a big mirror and sink. In fact, the bathroom was almost as big as the bedroom! Nice closet size and decor makes this room quite an enjoyable one. Free internet for guests. There are plenty of restaurants in the hotel. One is a tropical cafe style with lots of latin food offerings and a great view of the beach. This one opens for breakfast and opens until alte afternoon with light and main entrees offerings. There is also a sushi bar next to the casino, Pikayo and a few other ones. (Pikayo Restaurant in separate review). As for entertainment, the casino is, for San Juan standards, small but has live music so it is enjoyable to sit at the sushi bar and listen to the nightly band. The lobby had a DJ but no one dancing and two of the three bars, and what it seems the dance area were closed. Bartenders did a good job at making great martinis and friendly staff. The fitness center is located in the second/across the street building. It has good machines with televisions on each. All equipment worked well. This smaller hotel has the business center which is attended during business hours and offers all types of business necessities. It also has a smaller and more private pool for those who do not want to go to the main hotel building. Every night we were offered two complimentary bottles of water. The poolbar made fantastic drinks and the food was very good too. Our overall experience was great. Do not have a complaint at all. This is a hotel I would love to come back to and spend more time relaxing and enjoying the many amenities offered here.

Reviews.Title: “Downsides on the perimeter, but perfect interior”
Reviews.Author: Alison S
Reviews.Content: After a full day of travel from San Diego...and a gazillion different reviews online...we had no idea what to expect from the Conrad Condado. So far the outside/public areas still need some work...looking a bit 70sish...but the room we have is fantastic.Tile floors, perfect balcony, flatscreen TV.

Reviews.Title: “Good and Bad”
Reviews.Author: frequentflyer430
Reviews.Content: OK going to start with the bad. Arranged a trip to the biolumescent bay through the hotel concierge the day before arriving to the hotel. We arrived at the hotel about 12:30 in the afternoon. We get to the receptionist and we are informed that check-in is not until 4:00. We inform her that we have a trip planned to the bay at 4:15, could we possible check-in early, she said she would see what she could do. We were with another couple, she took both our phone numbers and promised to call when the rooms were ready. We never received any calls. We checked back at 3:45 with a long line ahead of us. We get to the receptionist to find out we have rooms at about 4:10. Run up to our rooms with our luggage, change clothes very stessed out and barely made it to our tour. All of this could have been avoided with the phone call they promised. Also after the first check-in they gave us a folder, telling us we could use any of the facilities until we got checked in. Our friends asked about beach towels for our tour and was refused because they "needed a room number"! Took the trip to the bay, then got back to the hotel about 11:30 p.m. They put us in the rooms across the street that is nothing like the pictures you see on their website. These rooms are very old and tired looking, nothing like we expected out of a Conrad. I think what they have done is bought a different hotel across the street and added a walkway. We went back to the receptionist and asked for a different room in the original Conrad. She replied that there was nothing available, which I responded that I would like to talk to a supervisor. All of sudden a room was available. Once we got into the new room we were happy with it, but as has been the case with this hotel all day, another small problem...no tv remote. We just went to bed and didn't worry about it. We were glad we were only staying one night. I did say good and it was the probably the best beds we have slept in on vacation. The hotel is beautifully decorated and they finally did move us to another room. The only restaurant that we ate in was the Eight Noodle Bar. DO NOT RECOMMEND this restaurant. We had a roll that was way below average. My husband had the lo mein and said it was good, I had the shrimp fried rice which was shrimp, white rice, maybe one scambled egg and some scallions thrown in it. I thought I was going to have to use a whole bottle of soy sauce just to give it a little flavor. This meal w/3 beers cost $60.00. Not worth it! The location of the hotel is good, but there are other hotels nearby that are much better. I have stayed at the Caribe Hilton many times and would definitely recommend it over this hotel. A friend has stayed at La Conche a couple of times and raved about the hotel and customer service there. It is just down the street.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: Dahlquist
Reviews.Content: The Conrad offers a great variety of resort-style services, at a reasonable rate. We (two guests) stayed in the Lagoon tower, and our room was well-appointed and modern, with an ample balcony. The decor in much of the hotel is a bit on the Austin Powers side, but they own it. There's a legit bar in the lobby, and one in the wading pool outdoors (drinks are about twice as expensive in the pool). On the lagoon side, they offer rentals of kayaks, paddle boards, and all sorts of man-powered vessels. The casino gets moderately busy in the evening, but we never saw it get packed. They offer blackjack and some other table games, craps when there is enough action, roulette, and of course lots of slots. Dealers were friendly and gracefully accepted my horrendous Spanish. We ate at the pan-asian/sushi bar, which was superb, though it is open to the casino. The "fancy" restaurant downstairs in the lagoon tower offers amazing meals, and the cafe-style restaurant above the lobby is good for a tasty bite. Dining on Condado is pricey, and the hotel's restaurants are no exception. We went to the Starbucks on the ground floor each morning for breakfast. Outstanding service everywhere in the hotel. The doormen will summon a cab for you in a hurry, and the day trip concierge was exceptionally helpful. We were tempted to spend our whole ten days in the hotel. The only negative about the Conrad is its location. It's isolated from downtown (which may be a plus for you). It has a little beach adjacent to the pool area, but you have to walk a mile or so to the "real" beach. The little beach is perfect for small kids, though; it's in a natural harbor, so there's shallow water with no surf.

Reviews.Title: “Treated like a rock star!!!”
Reviews.Author: K9Christyne
Reviews.Content: I went to Puerto Rico to celebrate my birthday. I cannot say enough about how exceptional EVERYONE and EVERYTHING was!!!! From the time we checked in, our room was upgraded to a stunning ocean view. They suggested local restaurants, arranged a last minute horseback ride along the beach, and even had chocolate cake delivered to my room for my birthday. I felt like a rock star!!!! Omel (front desk) was fantastic!!! Again, words cannot convey how wonderful this place is!!!

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay here!!”
Reviews.Author: Robbierob49
Reviews.Content: I don't even know where to begin...I am a working middle class married gay man...my Partner and I save up for months to go On a dream vacation..I chose puerto rico as we both enjoy the beach...I decided On a Hilton owned hotel because I had always heard they have impeccable customer service...I couldn't be more incorrect...I will begin with the worst and work my way down..the hotel here (I am still here as I write this)..is partnered with enterprise car rentals (it is in the hotel) so as I needed A car for a day of course I was recommended to use them..I took the car literally 500 ft fr

Reviews.Title: “Girls Getaway”
Reviews.Author: dance_machine
Reviews.Content: I went to here in November and I so enjoyed my stayed, We fell in love with the restuarants there and dined there every day. The rooms were wonderful and so were pools. Everyone was very helpful and the hotel was not far from the airport. Nightlife wa also not far from our hotel either, which was also a plus.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice surprise!”
Reviews.Author: ltorres93
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel under a package that included the air. I got a good price and was not expecting much. When we were approaching the hotel. It looked a little dated from outside, but inside the lobby it is very nice and modern. Our check in was ok, our room was not ready and they told us they will call my cell when it was ready, well lets say that never happened, I had to call and find out. Our room was spacious, clean and with a gorgeous view to the ocean. Staff were a little slow in the pool area, but it was a nice area with pools, slide and beach. Security was good. Staff in general was attentive and friendly. Would definitely stay there again. Location was very convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: leese69
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a week in October 2011 with my husband and had a lovely time. Have stayed in many hotels whilst travelling and dont agree with the negative remarks that some people have put. We went out of season and the staff couldnt do more for us. The room was lovely and clean and had a nice bathroom. There is a airport nearby and you can hear small planes pass overhead but nothing that stopped me from having a good nights sleep everynight.

Reviews.Title: “Very good with some minor setbacks”
Reviews.Author: nirya
Reviews.Content: Good location and nice decor. Several pools and restaurants. The main pol is good for family, has slide. I'll come again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Stay at Conrad San Juan”
Reviews.Author: Bmoresfinest124
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this property from October 07-10th with friends. Hotel is a short taxi ride from the Luis Munoz Marin International Airport. The hotel was very clean and the staff was friendly. Enjoyed the close proximity to restaurants and shops along Ashford Avenue. Hotel is also a short taxi ride to Old San Juan and the Plaza las Americas shopping mall.

Reviews.Title: “FREE INTERNET !”
Reviews.Author: Cathy M
Reviews.Content: I stayed a the Conrad on business and was most impressed by the free Internet in my room and in the lobby and other areas; as a business person this made my work easier and less expensive. Most hotels in San Juan charge for this service. The hotel is very clean and the staff is very friendly; I will come back!

Reviews.Title: “Ok stay in SJ”
Reviews.Author: ctinaluca
Reviews.Content: The hotel was ok. Nothing remarkable but nothing too bad at the same time. It is in a good location, starbucks within the hotel and a few steps from a small beach area. The rooms were clean on the surface but they can definitely use some tlc to create a more clean cozy feeling. The hotels grounds were meh.. but the view was great. My fiance and I had a good time walking through Condado and took the bus to Old San Juan. For a overpriced cab ride you can go to the mall which is incredible! Also if you are not impressed by the small beach on the side of the hotel, take a walk through Condado and there is a great hidden gem of a beach on the side.

Reviews.Title: “Average”
Reviews.Author: dad2noah
Reviews.Content: Ok Hotel, nothing great about it. Just got back last week after spending 5 days there. All and all, it's an average hotel.It's definately not "great". The hotel needs work. You can tell it's been around a while. The pool was nice, but it desperately needed to be cleaned. Not the water, but the pool itself. Steps were dirty, almost looked list rust? The pool bar needed to be fixed. Just needs alot of of TLC. The staff was fine. Not overly friendly, but no complaints about them, just ask them, they will help you. Drinks are over priced.. $10 for a frozen drink that comes in a small plastic sup. Look for the happy hour deals. Beach was small, but nice. Bring the water shoes, you will need them. It's kind of rocky out there. Plenty of room in the pool area. I stayed in a king suite they called it. ( I think ). Big room, nice bed, with a private balcony ( ok, sort of private. People in the next balcony can see their neighbors) My room was on the 3rd floor, lagoon view. The higher up you are, the better view. You can walk a mile along the ocean, and hit just about every kind of eatery, and shop you can think of, so the location is good. There is a Walgreens about .75 miles away. Take a cab, go shopping, and stock up. Save some cash at the resturaunts in the hotel. We only ate at the "Cafe Carib" in the hotel. Food was moderately priced, and tasted moderate as well. If you want soda, or water, there is a soda machine at the bus stop outside the hotel. $1 for a bottle. Best deal in town. Load up, bring em back to your room. If you want to go to "Old San Juan", take the bus. It's .75 cents one way, exact change, coins only). They run about every 45 minutes. Ask the bellman which bus to take. As I mentioned, the bus stop is right outside the hotel. A cab will cost you a flat rate of $15. If you can get the ocean view room, go for it. That is, if you plan on spending more time in the room as opposed to going out often. Free WIFI in the hotel. The lobby was VERY nice. Clean, and modern with a huge aquarium. Cab ride from the airport is $15 plus $1 for each bag. Keep your receipts for the room charges. We found something that we were charged for, that we didn't order. We weren't the only ones. On Saturday, by far the busiest day, there was only 1 person working the pool bar. I counted 100 people in the pool area. Way too many people, for 1 person. We waited forever for drinks. Alot of our view was looking at the back of the attached building. I definately wasn't "disappointed" Maybe I was expecting too much from a hotel on the ocean in Puerto Rico, I travel frequently, so I know a little about hotels. This was was definately as average as average can get. It's not like I would cringe if my next meeting was scheduled there again. Oh, the casino sucks ( only because I lost as usual ) Hotel room doors are freakin noisy. Metal on metal clanking when they close. Maid service was fine, no complaints. Bathroom was FANTASTIC. Maybe it was because I had a king suite, but the shower was huge. Senior Frogs in Old San Juan is really fun. Music, dancing, and good drinks. This is where you want to go party. There's also a brewery ( forget the name). great local beer, and the food looked good (although we didn't eat there)

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Weekend Stay”
Reviews.Author: SFC1976
Reviews.Content: The mixed reviews of this property almost led me to cancel and book elsewhere - I'm glad I didn't. Prior stays at El San Juan and Caribe Hilton were disappointing for the price paid, but this stay at Conrad Condado Plaza went some considerable way to repairing my low expectations from San Juan hotels. The hotel is well located at the end of the Condado strip. It is formed of two buildings either side of Ashford Ave. The Lagoon Tower on one side and Ocean tower on the other. We received a complimentary upgrade to an ocean view room on the 7th floor. The proximity to the shoreline provided excellent views over the ocean and a peaceful vantage point from which you could enjoy the sounds of the waves crashing against the rocks. The room, as with the hotel itself was modern and contemporary in design. The decision to put all the storage in the bathroom was odd though - they could easily have made the bathroom smaller and put the closets and drawer space in the room itself. Housekeeping was adequate but not thorough with glasses and cups left dirty. Staff throughout the hotel were helpful and friendly, though the service at the pool bar could be slow - even though it didn't seem that busy. Noise from other rooms was minimal, but perhaps carpeted floors in the rooms would help when the guests in the room above are walking around in stilettos. Wi-Fi access in the rooms worked well and was fast enough to stream Netflix movies with only minor interruptions. The main pool was great for the kids with a small water slide and volleyball net. The beach is not private, but was never crowded. It benefits from some shelter from the waves being at the entrance to the lagoon, but beware the black sea urchins if you venture too close to the rocky area. A cabana overlooking the ocean was the location for massages at $45 per 30 mins. We didn't indulge, but spoke to someone who thoroughly enjoyed his massage. Loungers were plentiful and we had no problem finding a good spot at any time of day. Breakfast at the Cafe Caribe offered generous servings and the pricing was reasonable by hotel standards - don't bother with the so-called 'Continental Breakfast' offering though. Self parking below the hotel was $15 per day and there is a Starbucks right outside the front entrance. A good selection of restaurants is available within a few minutes walk.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay for Honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: Shawn237
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Conrad Condado in San Juan on Sept 10 prior to our cruise. I wanted to say thank you to Raul Bustamante and his staff for making the first night of our honeymoon better than we could have expected. They went above and beyond our expectations. The hotel was beautiful and clean. I would highly recommend this property to anyone traveling to San Juan.

Reviews.Title: “Great service very clean”
Reviews.Author: Coco L
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Conrad San Juan last week. I was very impress with the service, the staff was very friendly and the rooms were amazing. The ocean rooms are very chic red and big, especially the bathrooms. I love the shower. The room was very clean. I ate at Pikayo and the food was so great. I met the General Manager, Mr. Bustamante, he was very professional. I highly recomend this hotel. You will love to have a massage with Ivan.

Reviews.Title: “Chic in San Juan”
Reviews.Author: RubenNYC
Reviews.Content: This is a very chic hotel, with trendy dÃ©cor all over. All public areas -lobby, bars, restaurants, pools- were lovely appointed. All these beautiful spaces were mostly underutilized, with very few customers/guests lingering around. Rooms were beautiful, with a contemporary look -- ocean view rooms are highly recommended! Service, however, was not as friendly/useful as it could be expected from this type of facility. The valet parking staff was generally indifferent; they will not approach arriving guests and/or offer to help w/ luggage. Only tried two of their restaurants; Pikayo and CafÃ© Caribe. The first one, Pikayo, offers world class cuisine and service w/ Latin flavor; highly recommended. Complimentary breakfast was provided at CafÃ© Caribe, which was just OK. Very little offered in terms of environmental sustainability; just a card by the bathroom towers talking about reusing towels. Given the location in the Caribbean, by the beach, it would be nice if this hotel provided at least for some recycling!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Views, centrally located”
Reviews.Author: SabseTez
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Conrad for 5 days in August. Our room was an ocean view room, with stunning views as advertised. We booked through the JetBlue Getaways program and got the room upgrade for free, though we had to wait from 2:15 till about 4:30PM for the room (in all fairness, our checkin was mean to be 4PM). Though the price was steep, the room was clean and modern. The biggest advantage we would reckon is the location -- we went to Old San Juan frequently for food. It is also centrally located in the island, easy enough to drive west for e.,g to the Rio Camuy Caves and east to Fajardo. We had breakfast at Cafe Caribe throughout our stay, it was decent and had an ocean view, and we could redeem our $6 continental breakfast vouchers for anything on the menu. The only disadvantage with hotels in the area is the parking fee, but the convenience of having your own car cannot be beat!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful time”
Reviews.Author: christine h
Reviews.Content: We stayed there 9/21-9/25 and had a great time. I was a little leary, having read some of the reviews but couldn't have been more pleasantly surprised. We stayed in Tower 1 and had a breathtaking ocean front room with a balcony. The bathroom was super large and the shower was awesome--exactly what you needed after the end of a long day, and the beds/pillows are really comfortable! The staff were all very helpful and nice and we never had any issues with the elevators, as others had written before. My only complaint would be that we didn't have a fan in our bathroom (or if we did, it didn't work), and there are little colonies of mold growing on the ceiling of the shower.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Place”
Reviews.Author: lpz22fa
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a wonderful place to be at. You have the choice to view the relaxing ocean, or the laguna (lake) on the other side of the property. Once you have had enough of the beach, you can still relax on one of the three pools (make sure to check out the poolside bar). It has a very sufficient gym, with relatively new (or very well kept) equipment, and both a sauna and a steam room. If you are an adventurer, there is the sporty rental place by the laguna that rents paddle boats, kayaks and other water sports equipment! It is a very short distance from Old San Juan, and in Condado, a very lively side of the city at nights. There is also an awesome jazz festival on the 4th sunday of every month where locals go and enjoy themselves, literally a 5 minute walk. Public transportation is kind of a hassle so I strongly suggest a rental car, or patience with Puerto Rican taxi drivers!

Reviews.Title: “Returning Guest”
Reviews.Author: World_Traveler83
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at is hotel several times a year for the past 4 years on business travel. I've found the staff to be very accommodating. The rooms have always been clean. I love the shower products. The hotel is centrally located for travel to old San Juan or the city center. There are several lovely restaurants within walking distance and tons in old San Juan which is only a 5 minute drive away. if you have a choice when booking, the ocean view is a must.

Reviews.Title: “Magical hotel”
Reviews.Author: BilboSouthOrange_NJ
Reviews.Content: I had a couple of teens in tow for a business meeting, so it was important for me to be able to leave them with plenty of entertainment all day. Was this ever THE place! There were so many pools we couldn't count them all, 2 different hot tubs, a small private beach, a saltwater lagoon, a cool little water slide, a place where they could get tennis lessons, a ping pong table, an amazing work-out room. Plus, the staff was friendly and the interior decor was really eye-poppingly modern & beautiful. It's expensive to eat at the hotel, so we didn't. There were plenty of interesting places down Ashford Ave to choose from. My greatest complaint was that it's a $20 cab ride to old San Juan. (In fact, every single time you hail a cab in PR, it's gonna cost $20...a real racket that!) Take the bus for $1.50 instead! It's just a shame that the bus doesn't run on a designated schedule...therefore, you have to be willing to camp out for half an hour waiting at the bus stop. But the hotel itself is GREAT!

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel in San Juan”
Reviews.Author: Jermina J
Reviews.Content: Spent 3 night at condado and i must say this is the best hotel i've ever been to. The room was sapcious and clean not forgetting how comfortable the beds were. omg. The staff was real friendly also. this is just an ideal hotel... didnt really like the area except for the restaurant where we had breakfast and lucn while looking at the ocean. would definitely recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “liked our stay but not happy”
Reviews.Author: gonna_be_a_jetsetter
Reviews.Content: we stayed at the conrad at the beginning of september 2011, our stay was very pleasent, our room was a city view room but we could still see the lagoon on one side and the ocean on the other from the balcony. we ate at super noodle 8, the food was lovely...i love the lobby area of the hotel. starbucks is close by as is car rental enterprise. we had no issues with our stay at all at the conrad. but unfortunately when we came back home i was disappointed to see that they had debited my credit card for a charge i dont recognise. the resort fee we paid for which was debited and fine then a few days later they took out another charge from my credit card, they issued us with a folio of our charges which was just the resort charge. have tried calling the hotel countless number of times, they transfer me to the finance department but no one answers! very frustrating and very disappointed that the conrad would con me like this

Reviews.Title: “Hot Fun”
Reviews.Author: PinoSpringTime
Reviews.Content: This hotel was in a great location, had a lot of extras. I loved spending time on their semi-private, small beach, and at the pools. The rooms were spacious, updated, yet VERY cold. There were a lot of places to sit, relax, have a glass of wine, etc. Good choice if you're staying in San Juan.

Reviews.Title: “Not ideal for business travel”
Reviews.Author: ocean35
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for four nights for work. The good: free internet, cheap valet parking, good service, good conference space. The bad: spooky neighborhood, dark self parking, expensive boring hotel food. Overall: would try something else next time.

Reviews.Title: “Great reasonable hotel”
Reviews.Author: als149
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 4 nights to attend a wedding held in Old San Juan. The Conrad San Juan is great! Really neat lobby/bar, awesome pools, and spacious rooms. Location is good, there are some restaurants and stores within walking distance, and it's a reasonable cab ride to Old San Juan (where we highly recommend going for evening dinner/drinks) Employees were friendly and so helpful. We were with a larger group that had rented a house with no pool and they were able to come to the Conrad to swim; we were there during off season and it was pretty empty. We ate at the pool bar/cafe, Aqua, twice. Food was good but very expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Wasnt what I expected!”
Reviews.Author: cookiegirlacosta
Reviews.Content: I had flew to San Juan with my husband and mom for a pre-cruise stay. The hotel is very nice but not really in a nice location. The street had a few abandoned hotels and graffiti and you didnt really feel safe walking around at nite like you did in Isla Verde. The grounds of the hotel are beautiful without question. The servers in the pool area were nice and they had a cute small intimate little private beach with a barrier reef that protected you from the waves. The food was ok and I mean just ok. Also by surprise the mojitos were terrible. We went to 3 different restaurants and for some reason they crush the mint leaves and leaving you choking on every sip. Yeah that was pretty funny. Now for the bad part the room OMG, the balcony overlooking the beach was the best out of the whole entire room. For 200 plus a night you would expect better like a suite at the Embassy. Anyway this hotel has there kitchen area set up in their bathroom. It was a long sink toilet stand up shower then on the other side of it was the fridge, coffeemaker and microwave plus a closet for clothing REALLY!! Who thought of this design? Who wants to go to the bathroom and drink coffee at the same time. I will never go back there again. It was a mess.

Reviews.Title: “Great”
Reviews.Author: lordiluv
Reviews.Content: I stayed in August 2011 and stayed in the City Vista room - and the acccomodations were great. The customer service was very good and the hotel was beautiful. Would return again!

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Debra0183
Reviews.Content: I would definitely stay here again. The rooms were very comfortable and the right size for me with a queen size bed, sofa and study area. It would have been useful to me to have had more lighting near the bed as I like to read in bed but the lighting was poor.

Reviews.Title: “San Juan, Puerto Rico Trip”
Reviews.Author: lrosa99
Reviews.Content: The Conrad Condado Hotel is a nice hotel despite the layout of the rooms and the noise. We stayed in room #660. The bathroom was tight and poorly designed. The sink, toilet and bath tub were inches from each other, making it difficult to move around. The most annoying detail was the bathroom's sliding opaque door. Each time someone used the bathroom, the entire room smelled. Overall, it was ok. The location and pool area was fabulous.

Reviews.Title: “I will come back!”
Reviews.Author: Enrique M
Reviews.Content: I spent four nights here and enjoyed very much; this was after the recent storm that hit Puerto Rico and we really did not notice anything negative. The staff was very friendly and acommodating; I will come back. Thank you all.

Reviews.Title: “Modern Hotel, very Friendly Staff.”
Reviews.Author: Hugh D
Reviews.Content: My company booked me at this hotel for the first time, I have to say I was so pleased they did! The hotel was modern and offered free WIFI, which is great for us business travelers. The staff was also very nice and friendly and even called me to make sure I was pleased with my room! They have 24 hrs pools, fitness center and casino. I am strongly considering going back with my family! Iâ€™m sure they will love it as much as I did!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it,be back again.”
Reviews.Author: maroto1063
Reviews.Content: It was awesome,excellent service and very polite ,still don't get other reviews....i had a wonderful time!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!.pool sevice and all the restaurants were fantastic,if you go there try Pikayo is a plus,you have the option to go to different withen a short walk at any time of the day,there are several restaurants around,but don't go to Casa Lola....very dissapointing.The hotel was clean,not loud whatsoever,i will recommend this hotel to all my friends.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed with Managements lack of Consideration”
Reviews.Author: friendsconnect
Reviews.Content: I was surprised with the overall condition of the surrounding area of the Conrad San Juan Condado Plaza. But it does appear that some renovations are taking place. We stayed on the 3rd floor and upon arrival noticed a tray of old dishes sitting outside the room across from us. What ever it was had been there for quite some time as it was full of mold. The tray stayed for two additional days, and then our room service attendant removed it. The hall carpet is stained in several areas. The ice machine on the 3rd, 4th and 5th floors were not in operation. The Room itself was very nice and the VIEW was amazing, I am sure this is the reason for the 4.5 star rating. I would Like to offer a pat on the back to Victor, Hector S. and YoMare ALL whom were amazing. We can not thank them enough for all of the help that they offered. I suggest you seek each of them out and introduce yourself upon arrival, they are three assects to the Conrad Hilton Plaza! As for the management, we were so disappointed with the Hotels poor communicaiton. Hurrican Irene hit the Island on our third day, the hotel lost power and it was down hill from there. We found out that the tower on the lagoon side had power, yet we were not moved as the hotel was saving it for the guests they were taking in from a cruise ship. The main elevator was shut down but the service elevator was in operation. Unfortunately after we began using the service elevators or stairs the Hotel set up signs outside of the main elevator to explain where food could be found, yet no one knew. We found out room service was available via word of mouth, but you had to go to the front desk to order. I would assume a Hotel of this calibur would have emergency instructions set in place, yet it seemed that No one knew what was going on. One guest said "it's amazing, it appears that the only thing working in this entire Hotel is your BILLING"! The Hotel did not so much as offer a Free cup of coffee to compensate for the lack of air conditioning or electricity. We lost 4 of the 6 days of our stay due to Hurrican Irene. We felt the Hotel could have offered comp time if we returned or a discount to our room rate.But opted to tell everyone, "you used a room". Such a poor attitude for such a huge hotel. This Hotel failed miserably within the guest relations sector! Make sure to talk to Victor about the Bio Bay tour and if you book make sure you book through the Enchanted, they run the oldest, most organized tour, and they offer guide "lights' believe me that makes a huge difference.

Reviews.Title: “Shame on Hilton for granting his dive the Conrad Brand!”
Reviews.Author: MommaCheung
Reviews.Content: Don't be mislead. This is not a Conrad. It in no sense embodies what Conrad patrons expect from the brand. I paid nearly $200/night to find an old building, filthy bathroom, tiny beach property, rude bar waiters, line-ups at the front desk & concierge. The only thing that saved our stay was the pool was OK.

Reviews.Title: “No Power = No Vacay”
Reviews.Author: yesnomaybe213
Reviews.Content: We arrived Monday, August 22nd after a long-delayed and re-routed flight from DC that lasted 5 hours instead of the usual 3.5 hours. Hurricane Irene was supposed to be off the island by mid-day Monday. Irene was still lingering over Puerto Rico by the time we fled the island Tuesday. The hotel was INCREDIBLY nice about our sudden cancellation of the remaining 3 nights of our reservation. The Conrad San Juan Condado Plaza might have been a nice hotel, but there is no way to evaluate this property as power was out in all areas except the upstairs hallways and the guest rooms. None of the dining amenities had power, hence dining consisted of venturing out into the saturated streets in search of takeout food from the limited restaurants that had back-up generators. The staff bent over backward to cheerfully deal with a bad situation not of their making. Power remained out in San Juan for several days after we left the island, so it was a good call for us to get out of there 20 hours after arriving.

Reviews.Title: “Expected The Unexpected”
Reviews.Author: ape22
Reviews.Content: Nothing was as I knew it 5 years ago, very run down, empty .poor check in reception and power goes on and of as frequent as the casino closes and unfortunatly its quite often. casino was shut down for 3 days of my visit due to problems with electricity then they tried to hide it by saying it was out in all of Condado yet I walked to the Sheraton and it was open and full. as well a others in the area .suites are very big but beware of rain for water drips into the room and I was moved to 3 rooms in a 4 day stay.551,951,752,all suites, nice jacuzzis in room but very dirty water.restaurants not worth the money.No shops,1 small bar in lobby .very sad stay for what used to be a great fun hotel and casino.Excellent internet acess.

Reviews.Title: “Worst trip ever!”
Reviews.Author: slmgdy4u
Reviews.Content: I concur with what the previous person. This hotel is surrounded by rundown buildings which is very unappealing. My family and I ended up at this hotel because Carnival Cruise left us at the Port because of the Hurricane that was appoaching on August 21, 2011. Check-in was fine no problems there, the room was nice, now the first problem was the MOLD in the beautiful bathroom. The front desk never picked up the phone. When room services tried to wipe it but it was still noticable. The sheets were ripped or burned. It took an hour and a half to get food from the chinese rest. Due to the hurricane the lights went out and it was hell to pay. No air and the food was the worst. The oatmeal was loop warm, muffins tasted like bad cake mix and the fruit salad was horrible. Lunch was a little better but by the time we got to dinner it was down hill again. No restur. were open all closed and low on resources. They served leftover lunch for dinner and thought people didn't know. Charged $15 for breakfast and it was the worst. Watery eggs, dried Ham, Saugages and cold homefries. Overall, this was the worst experience at a suppose to be 4 star hotel. My family and I are stiil here and it's Wednesday. The breakfast is the same as Monday and Tuesday, I can't take it anymore. The lights finally came back on in all the buildings which I believe that they waited for Carnival Cruise guest to leave. I would never pay to come to a place like this ever.

Reviews.Title: “Very Accomodating - Convenient Location”
Reviews.Author: kaz334
Reviews.Content: Booked this trip through cheap Caribbean. We stayed for 6 days 5 nights 1. Stayed in an ocean view room on the 4th floor â€“ highlight watching the sunrise from the large windows over the ocean also great balcony 2. Clean rooms and efficient daily cleaning service 3. Told the lobby staff that it was my significant others birthday and they surprised us with a chocolate cake in our room! Thanks Jean Pierre it made our stay extra special 4. Daily breakfast in CafÃ© Caribe with the vouchers helped to keep us on budget as dining out is kind of pricey. We are from NY so the prices were the same, although drinks were most definitely CHEAP 5. Most money was spent on cabs getting to and from the hotel to other beaches and restaurants 6. Staff always pleasant and helpful â€“ happy hour in pool bar area from 5-7! Bartenders very very friendly and made excellent drinks! 7. Must advise that the hotel sits on a smaller lagoon type beach area but Ocean Park is just a 10 minute walk and is beautiful with waves for boogey boarding 8. Must try Ropa Vieja restaurant not far from the hotel ate there two nights, they have live music some nights as well 9. Hotel scene picks up Thurs â€“ Sun we were leaving when it seemed that the san Juan area was starting to Hotel is next to an abandoned, run down hotel, few buildings in the area Took a day trip to Isla Icacos and Palominito with East Island Excursions! Highly recommend incorporating that trip into your visit. Truly unspoiled beauty.

Reviews.Title: “Not Even close to Bermuda, Bahamas or Aruba...”
Reviews.Author: jtilds
Reviews.Content: The island: Just recently got back from Puerto Rico. Let me just say it was definetly an eye opener. The island is tired, not well kept and needs a major face lift. In other words it was dirty, scary at times and needs a good paint job. The airport: The airport was hassle free but just remember u need the usda to check your bags before you stay in line and get told to get back out and got check them. The hotel: When we first arrived we were pleasantly suprised. The grounds are fairly well kept but again this place is tired. I bet back in the 70's this was a gem of the caribean. The room was very nice which was a king facing the ocean. The problem we had was the staff. I will repeat the staff. The staff had to be the worst accomodating people we ever ran into. They would answer questions with attitude they would never even want to help you. 20 min at the bar to get a drink. On other islands you have to beg for the waiters and bartenders to leave you alone. The cleaners forget to clean your room and the parking is a joke that you have to pay. Dont valet you can get your car quicker on your own. The beach or what they call it is right next to a bridge with trucks and back hoes repairing it, was tiny. The pools were fithly and the fitness center awful. The reason I gave it a 3 star was the room which was ocean view if you are across the street you are in the projects literally. The food: Cafe Caribe and the noodle bar were excellent. Cafe Caribe has an awesome breakfast and the noodle bar great chinese and sushi. The casino: Another reason it gets a 3 star. The casino dealers and waiters were the best around. So helpful and accomodating. They would check on your free drink every 3 min to make sure you had one. They also had free sandwiches and soup delivered right to the tables. The casino was awesome. Small minimums and awesome perks if you gambled with a players card. Make sure to get a rewards card. We got 75 dollars worth of beverage and food. Overall: I dont want to seem all negative. The vacation was nice but just scary. The streets at night are scary and the whole island needs a face-lift. I would try a new island next time. Maybe virgin islands or somewhere cleaner. Not what expected.

Reviews.Title: “Stay Away!”
Reviews.Author: hkljr
Reviews.Content: My college age nephews just returned from Puerto Rico and stayed for a week at this hotel. The very first night, they were exhausted. The next morning they found the front door to their room open and their Iphones were missing! They reported to "security" who basically just went through the motions of their "investigation"? It seems like this is the norm down there, just take advantage of the mailanders and everyone splits the loot! Management was useless, and they don't have cameras in the hallways! For a 4 star Hilton property, theshould be ashamed! Calls and e-mails to Hilton and hotel have been ignored!

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, nice stay!”
Reviews.Author: courtneyesunshine
Reviews.Content: Me and my husband stayed here and were very happy with our experience. The staff was VERY nice and helpful, from front desk to the pool , ALL very nice! Rooms were pretty and clean and location was very close to everything. We took the bus in town a few times, walked around Condado and found everyone super helpful. For the price of this hotel, it was an excellent value and contemporary. We are in our early 30's and there were many other couples around the same age.

Reviews.Title: “Fun trip, great views but not really Conrad level”
Reviews.Author: nyctraveler300
Reviews.Content: As a frequent traveler and someone who also works in the industry, I'm the one usually booking our getaways. This time, my hubby surprised me with a brithday trip to Puerto Rico for a few days and it was awesome. He booked it on Priceline (he just wanted a quick and easy package deal) and I def felt that influenced the room we were assigned once at the hotel. The package really wasn't that cheap either. I've stayed at Conrads before and they can rival Four Seasons properties...and I have to agree with previous posters...that this was not a true Conrad. Maybe an older Marriott or refurbished Radisson. We faced the lagoon in the second building - view was lovely but the room was so-so. Lots of noise, not very new, sunken bed. I called for turn-down service (we had sand everywhere) and they never showed up. Hallways were really dirty. And then part of the main pool's bar came off in my hand while we were sitting near the swim up part! And trust me, I'm never a complainer and I'm not that hard to please! Now that said...our stay was fun...just not what we expected. Location is great, small beach was super clear and tropical fish were everywhere. The pools were a lot of fun. The food at all the restaurants were delicious. Lobby was modern and always had stuff going on. We'd probably stay here again but in the main building with an ocean view and we'd know what to expect. P.S. Bring water shoes to explore the reef on the beach! That said - the

Reviews.Title: “Great staff.....”
Reviews.Author: Scastaneda218
Reviews.Content: When arrived there was a bell hop who took my bags out of the car and into concierge. Where we were then greeted and checked in. There was a problem with our first room, where there was some broken glass from the previous people. My husband went to front desk and he spoke to the manager j.p, he apologized for that and changed our room and upgraded us free of charge. The room was smaller but for that ocean front room it made up. In our room we did not hear any noise. We were on the 7th floor. The 3 pools are 24 hrs. Which was great. The breakfast was included also and it was delicious we had different wait staff each day they were all friendly and fast. Yeah the main lobby is loud but once you enter towards the ocean side its piece and quite. It was exciting for my two little girls we did do other things from the hotel. All in all the hotel was beautiful. I recommed either the ocean view or the laguana view. The hotel casino was fun too. We had Never been to a casino before but this was the place to learn. The staff thaught us the games and, we ended up staying up all night having fun. Complientary water also. This was really a 5star expierence.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ray M
Reviews.Content: I made a recent trip to San Juan via CheapCaribbean.com. My wife and I were celebrating our anniversary and chose Puerto Rico. Overall, the hotel was very nice. The staff was very accommodating, and my room was great. We were given an ocean view room and the view was incredible. When we arrived our room was ready and very clean. That first night we checked out the 24-hour fresh and salt water pools. In addition to the hot tub. The pools are also conveniently close to the public beach. There's also the casino where we lost $10. We don't really gamble so that was a lot of fun. During the course of our stay we were even given a wonderful bottle of champagne to celebrate our anniversary. The hotel offers a lot of fun things to do and the concierge and the front desk are always helpful. The only drawbacks to the hotel were the extremely high prices of the food. It really prompted me to go eat anywhere else except in the hotel. The only other issue we had was the noise level. You can hear the doors slam at all hours of the day and at night sometimes your neighbors may want to party. I think the room's doors need better sound-proofing. Overall, though the hotel is a nice one to stay at, relax, and enjoy yourself.

Reviews.Title: “Conrad Hilton's name shouldn't be on this property.”
Reviews.Author: AtlRoadWarrior
Reviews.Content: I am a Hilton Honors Diamond member and travel extensively for work and stay almost exclusively at Hilton Properties. On vacations, such as this trip to San Juan and around Puerto Rico, I also stay at Hilton properties. On the night of August 10th, 2011 I thought I would be treating my family to a special experience on our last night in Puerto Rico. Conrad hotels are supposed to be a gem in the Hilton family. I've stayed in Conrads before and been wow'd by the accommodations and amenities. Then there was the Conrad San Juan - what a disappointing and utterly underwhelming experience. Poorly appointed room, shabbily made beds, no amenities in the room beyond the ordinary soap and towels. Mildew in the bathroom that I didn't find until the morning shower prior to departure. The ceiling plaster in the bathroom also mildewed and moldy and falling down in chunks. The noise level in the hotel was unbelievable. Hallways and corridors smelled of insecticide. And since I had my wife and children with me we were put in a section of the hotel that I believe was punitive. Attempting to address the disappointment with the staff at the desk was an exercise in futility. I was given a dismissive gesture no apology for the disappointing experience. Then a swipe of my card and sign here. Shame on Hilton for allowing this property to bear the Conrad branding. Perhaps they can come back and put up Homewood Suites signage.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!!”
Reviews.Author: Jessicamm78
Reviews.Content: Staff were nice, rooms are large and the location is fantastic. Several pools and restaurants for everyone's personal taste. Did not visit rhe casino but it seemed nice. The best part, it has a semi private beach with service from the hotel (food, drinks, ...) And it's a bay so it's quiet and safe for children (no huge tides) and tones of different kinds of beautiful fish!!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, Enjoyable and I can't wait until I return in January 2012”
Reviews.Author: Peekaboo912
Reviews.Content: I've read the previous negative reviews - and Im shocked to say the least. When we arrived, we were greeted by the doorman who took our luggage right away. We checked in at 10am but weren't able to go to our room till 3pm. This was fine for us, we took the bus to Old San Juan (right in front of the hotel .75 each way) We visited EL Morro, did some shopping, had some drinks, and a bite to eat. By the time we returned to the hotel we went right to our beautifully appointed room - very clean, very modern, ocean view. The hotel has 2 pools (1swim up bar, water slide) a small beach area which is open to the public, that didnt bother us - since there were alot of beach chairs, and the locals are the nicest people who you would ever want to meet. We only ate one time at the hotel from the Noodle Bar @ about 1am - it was delish !!! but expensive but hey you're at a resort - what else would you expect. There are 2 spirit stores down the strip and a ton of local restaurants - so if you dont want to buy expensive drinks or food, then keep a bottle and food in your room (you have a fridge). There is alot in the area to do -- we rented a car for one day to visit the El Yuniqe Rainforest & The Bacardi Factory (much cheaper than the tours) Enterprise is right next to the hotel and a compact car is $25pr day ... Everyone at this hotel is extremely nice and accomadating.. This trip was just for my hubby and I .. we will be returning in Janaury with the kids.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel but not a beach resort”
Reviews.Author: Joe C
Reviews.Content: A modern hotel with very comfy beds and gorgeous views of the Atlantic. Quite clean with an accommodating housekeeping and desk staff. It is centrally located in the Condado section of San Juan, but it is not a 15 minute walk to Old San Juan, as their web site states, , more like 15 min. bus ride, (#23 or 51) which one can catch just outside the hotel for 75 cents. However this is not a hotel you want to go to if you are thinking of beach. The other problem is that our family rented a car with the intention of not booking side trips through the hotel. When getting information at the desk we were told that all the trips were booked (we are talking about low season here) but no other options were given. After quite a bit of Internet research and a few phone calls we got to do all the side trips that we had planned.

Reviews.Title: “PORQUERIA, (One star hotel)”
Reviews.Author: juliza b
Reviews.Content: I am totally disappointed. When I first arrived to the hotel, there was nobody to greet me and get my luggage, nobody to take me to the service desk. The hotel looks dirty, the hotel is in desperate need of an exterior and interior upgrade. They charge for parking is $16.05 per day, a simple alcoholic drink $12.00 plus tax plus tip around $15.00, poor service at the bar, waiting for 15 min and they dont event tell you "wait" they totally ignore you. If you plan to visit this hotel expect poor service, poor dining, poor plumbing, high prices and NO ENTERTAINMENT AT ALL. Waste of my money and It is not cheap!!!!

Reviews.Title: “I didnt want to leave”
Reviews.Author: RickyNTee
Reviews.Content: I gotta say everything I expected I got! The room was great! Very clean and modern. The view was also wonderful, I ate my breakfast there almost every morning. My wife and I stayed a week and it just never got old. The choice of pools (3) two had a jacuzzi the other had a slide and swim up bar, very nice. The small beach area was steps from the main pool, my second stop after breakfast on the balcony. The service and staff were great, everyone was very helpful. The cleaning staff was extra helpful and so pleaslant they all went out of their way to ablidge the guest. Actually my wife was passing through the hotel and struck up a conversation with a hotel manager Maria Villa and mention we were staying for a week in celebration of her birthday the manager asked if we were enjoying our stay and if we needed anything to contact her personally. My wife and I went out that day and upon our return to our room there was a card and a gourmet piece of chocolate cake waiting for her wishing her a Happy Birthday. I already thought highly of the hotel but that took the cake! Theres just so much to say... they have plenty of lounge areas, music, casino, amazing views, and restaurants. There are a few more places to eat a short walk down the street. Overall I loved it and was sad to go, they had to pry the room key from my hands when I left. I would absolutely stay there again and advise everyone to stay at the Conrad!!! Also the hotel was gay friendly which made my stay even more comfortable.. Thanks again Conrad!

Reviews.Title: “Terrible”
Reviews.Author: 42Eyes
Reviews.Content: Nothing like the description or photos. First check-in was delayed 2-3hrs. No, extra accomodations were offered. Had to wait for a crib until 10pm. Most babies party all night.. The room was not clean, had previous persons clothes, cups laying around. Phones never got fixed, safe didn't work. The restaraunt upstairs had worst food. Sandwiches & chicken plate cost $80. It was a very casual atmosphere, old, nice waiter. Family jr. Suites are across the bridge up the elevator in other words across the street. Pool on our side closes at 7pm. Pool bar closes early on other side. Lots of bugs!!! Would not recommend to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Do not come here for the beach!”
Reviews.Author: dimitri7777
Reviews.Content: I don't know how this hotel can rate so high. From the pictures of the hotel, it looks like it is on a great beach, but all it has is a lagoon beach that is rather shallow. Across the lagoon is the Caribe Hilton. To the left of the "beach" is the street and bridge over the lagoon with construction equipment, though nothing was going on when I was there. To the right of the lagoon is a rock wall separating the lagoon from the ocean, so the waves hit the rocks and dissipate so the lagoon is nice and calm. The hotel faces north and the ocean but there is no beach at all and you can't swim there. So aside from the misrepresentation of the beach, the hotel has been renovated but not 100%. Some of the public areas show their wear and tear; canopy covering the ocean facing balcony had enough holes so that when it was raining you could not sit and watch it rain without getting wet yourself. Another issue is that the walls must be pretty thin because you can hear the traffic if you are staying in a street facing room. Plus any time a door closed on your floor you would hear it and it was loud because the doors do not gently close due to the locks. Finally my colleague's room was not cleaned any of the three days there. When a complaint was lodged at the front desk, the front desk asked for a phone number to call after discussing with the manager, but instead of calling the cell number provided, the colleague's home number was called instead offering a credit which was not realized until the colleague returned home. How the credit could not have been simply applied to the bill is beyond reason. Some good things: The staff was pretty friendly and helpful. Some of the bars and restaurants are pretty nice. Concierge very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: bahamamama222
Reviews.Content: We had a room with a fabulous ocean view. Staff was accomodating , pleasant and friendly. More than enough pools; active ones and quiet ones. The only disappointment was their beach. It was a shallow lagoon however all beaches were public so we walked 5 minutes to the Renaissance where you could rent chairs and umbrella's $5.00 per day at a beautiful gorgeous beach. Would highly recommend the hotel .

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for the price, but location could be better”
Reviews.Author: tomcal731
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Conrad for two nights prior to going on a cruise. The hotel location was perfect to get easy access to the ports, but I am glad we only stayed here two nights. If you are planning to vacation in Puerto Rico this is not where you want to stay. The ride to Old San Juan is about a 15-20 min cab ride if I remember. The location of the hotel is fairly odd. The hotels around it are completely abandon, and look horrible. I stayed on the lagoon side of the hotel, and my room overlooked the street and the main hotel. The room was in EXCELLENT condition. Extremely clean, and very modern looking. Getting checked into the room was another story in itself. I don't know where all these people come from, but there was always a line of 10-15 people waiting at the front desk. The pool area is nice, if you can block out that you are sitting right next to a major road, just over the fence and tree area. The beach access here was kind of nasty. It's a public spot, that feels like you're swimming in a construction zone, and not the ocean. As for food, the prices are insaine. Very expensive in the hotel, but if you walk a ways down the road you can get some really good authentic meals for a decent price. Hit up happy hour in the hotel lobby. The drinks are cheap and the place is setup like a fancy nightclub. All employees that I met were very nice, and always would suggest a place to eat or somewhere to go visit. If this hotel could pick itself up and move to a different location, it would easily be 5 ummm... circles.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed this hotel immensely and would definitely go back!”
Reviews.Author: JOJO_Leawood_Kansas
Reviews.Content: My husband was informed of an immediate business trip to San Juan, Puerto Rico. We live in Kansas, so when he asked if I'd like to come along I jumped at the chance. Since he'd be at work every day, we wanted a hotel where I would have choices on restaurants and activities and just an enjoyable place to relax and enjoy the view. We found it in the Conrad San Juan Condado Plaza. This hotel was absolutely perfect for my needs. We arrived Tuesday, July 26, 2011 and checked out on Sunday, July 31. Upon arrival, I was a little surprised. This was my first trip to San Juan and I had an expectation of a Caribbean blue/green color scheme. Not here. The primary color is a bold, fiery, bull-fighter red and it's everywhere. I'd read here at TripAdvisor to spend the extra money for an ocean view room and boy was that good advice! The view is amazing. In fact, beyond words. All ocean view rooms have a private balcony and I spent lots of time just sitting out there, listening to the ocean beating the sea wall below, and reading a book or drinking my morning coffee. It was unbelievably relaxing. The hotel staff was extremely friendly even recognizing me by my room number after only a few days. The staff at the restaurants were very friendly too. Everyone speaks English, so we had no translation problems and staff members were always willing to give advice on how to get around, where to go, what to do, etc. Even suggestions to restaurants off site. We ate breakfast everyday at the Caribe Cafe. The food is great and the view is awesome. There are three swimming pools to pick from and the main pool with the swim-up bar had the most activity. There is a slide for the kids, staff members walked around and ask for participants in pool volleyball, a wide variety of music playing, and the outdoor restaurant, Aqua, was there for food. I also found myself going to the casino on a regular basis. I'm not much of a gambler, so the penny slots was my major attraction, although a couple evenings my husband and I did play the roulette table. I can't say I was a big winner, but I had lots of fun. Off the main pool, there is an entrance to a public beach. It's in a cove, so the waves are not too rough. Weekends are really busy here. I thought I would spend more time here, but as it turned out, I only swam at that main pool. My husband and I did take a walk on the beach and wriggle our toes in the sand. If you do love salt water, one of the three pools is a saltwater pool. If you do leave the hotel, there are a number of restaurants nearby. If you want to walk further -- maybe 1 mile -- there is a Walgreen's, an American fast-food (Wendy's, I think ... maybe Burger King), and lots of local shops. For those on the business side, there is free internet service. Overall, this was a wonderful experience and I'm glad we chose this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “"Your Room Is Not Ready"”
Reviews.Author: ZiftD
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel for before and after a cruise, so we had to already paid to stay there twice. The first time, we waited until 9:30 PM because the clerk kept saying the room was not "ready." To compensate for the inconvenience, the clerk said to go to the hotel restaurant and they would deduct 50% of the cost of dinner from the bill (when we checked out, they hadn't done this, but they did finally fix it). I eventually decided to ask a different clerk, and found out the room had been ready. The lobby is extremely loud at night, with disco music blasting from the bar, and you will be spending a lot of time waiting in that lobby. I would not have returned, but as I said, we had already paid for the second stay a week later. Again, we received the same line "your room is not ready." This time, I knew enough to ask a different clerk and we got into a room. The problem I think is just the desk clerks knowing what they're doing. Same thing with the supposedly free breakfast included in your rate. The first time, they gave us a $15 voucher for each of us. The second time, the clerk said only one person could get a voucher. $15 in that restaurant won't cover much. In any case, that is not what was advertised, and different clerks should not have different policies. Last, as mentioned, the restaurant at this hotel is very overpriced and very slow. Expect 2 hours for breakfast, most spent waiting, and even with breakfast vouchers, you will pay out of pocket. There is are Subway and Chili's nearby, so there's no reason to eat in the hotel. On the positive side - free wifi. Works very well.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it we will definately be back!!”
Reviews.Author: summer0221
Reviews.Content: We arrived on a Thursday left on Tuesday I do not have one bad thing to say about the resort...smooth check in beautiful oceanview room...overall services were great! We were amazed at the cleanliness of the entire resort we would recommend it to anyone...We had dinner at Varita and met with chef Wilo Benet who signed our cookbook Yay!! amazing food and it was a bonus to meet and chat with him! This was an A plus vacation for us and we will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Nice, Clean”
Reviews.Author: enatal
Reviews.Content: The hotel is good for meetings and conventions, but it is not a beach destination. Room baths are small, compared to other hotels in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Very Disappointed - STAY AWAY”
Reviews.Author: tnpcom
Reviews.Content: Let me start by saying, I am a huge Hilton properties fan. So much, I am a owner in their vacation club. So, when my girlfriends and I decided to go back to San Juan, we selected the Conrad Condado Plaza for the second time. I have to say I was VERY disappointed. When we arrived, we waited in line for 20mins before checking in. We were also surprised to know that there was a $50.00 per day hold required via a major credit card. This is something they forget to tell you when you book at this hotel. So for 5 days, the hotel placed a $250.00 hold on my credit card. I later realized that was the reason why the check in line was so long, people before me was fight over the credit card hold. A lot of people didn't bring major credit cards, just debit. So they were having major problems checking in. Moving on.....When we finally got to our room, the floors were dirty in the main room and bathroom. The curtains was torn the middle and the sitting chair had a huge white stain in the middle, nasty. But, the icing on the cake was the roach I found in the shower. Yes, you hear me, a live roach just chillin in the shower. I call the front desk and I was quickly transferred to housekeeper. IWhy housekeeping, I have no idea. I was told the person who took care of matters like this went home for the night. But, they sent someone help to dispose of the current problem. 15mins later I received a knock at the door, it was a maid with a wet mop and a doorman with trash bags and a roll of paper towels.
