I quickly lead them to the bathroom. The doorman quickly killed the roach and the maid with the mop just smiled. After the roach was died, they proceed to leave in a hurry. I stopped them and asked, "Was this request normal?" He looked at me and smiled and said "Yes". I was shocked! That "yes" made me uneasy through my whole trip. I hate ROACHES!!!! Moving on to the pool............Do not, I repeat....DO NOT order any drinks or food from the pool area. One, they are over priced and nasty in taste. The food was burnt (always) and place on the plate any kind of way and the drinks were sloppy. I sent everything back numerous times. I received mojitios with no rum or club soda or strawberry daiquiris melted. When I returned the drinks for anothers, I received major attitude from the pool bartender. Plus, our pool waiter, Ricardo, was slow and messed up our order contently. It was so bad, I had to walk over several time to place or fix my own orders. The one thing that saved my drink nightmare was Christopher. He was the bartender in the main lobby. He made the best passion fruit mojitio I ever had. Not drinking at the pool sucked, but he made up for it! Overall, one bartender could not save this hotel or my experience. The Conrad name should be stripped from the building. There is no class or luxury going on at this hotel. I am very shocked and disappointed that the Hilton brand continues to allow this hotel to operate in this manner. If my girlfriends and I decided to go back to San Juan, Conrad Condado Plaza will not be an option. If you are reading this, please save your money and time and book some place else.

Reviews.Title: “Not Up To Conrad Standards”
Reviews.Author: johngalt_DC
Reviews.Content: This hotel should not be a Conrad and in no way compares to other Hilton properties under the Conrad flag. This is an old hotel that simply was painted over and given new furniture and a new lobby, but the signs of age are everywhere. Check-in and check-out was very slow, and there is no separate line for Hilton Honors Gold and Diamond. Not a business hotel at all.

Reviews.Title: “Puerto Rico - Conrad San Juan Condado Plaza - I'll Grade This Hotel a Solid B”
Reviews.Author: GPOTTER
Reviews.Content: Booked fantastic deal to the Conrad via CheapCaribbean.com - 4 Nights w/ Airfare from Boston for a total of $1,180 (includes taxes, fees, etc..) w/ guaranteed upgrade to ocean front room. Traveled in late July 2011 (stayed Monday - Friday). Although we normally travel All-inclusive ("AI"), since my wife if pregnant we decided to try this hotel out. Figured that Puerto Rico for a non-AI was the right choice for us this trip as we probably woudn't have gotten our money's worth if we had booked an AI resort in the DR or Jamaica, which we usually frequent for our vacations. The Conrad is about a 12 minute drive to the San Juan airport and cab is exactly $16 plus $1 for each piece of luggage so basically a twenty-dollar bill will get you to hotel (includes tip to cabbie). Hotel is nothing spectacular to look at if you are used to the typically AI resorts in let's say Punta Cana, but you have to realize that this is a hotel, not a resort, that is located in San Juan, a bustling metropolis - not the countryside or jungle. Hotel itself is located direclty on the ocean, which is beautiful. Just so you are aware, the hotel has two distinct buildings, separated by a main street. On one side of the street is the newer Conrad that is on the ocean. This is where you want to stay as this is where the two pools are located (one salt water - 6 ft depth throughout so not for children, one fresh water w/ pool bar, music, volleyball net and waterslide (very fun, even for adults! - for real). On the other side of the street is the older Conrad so no ocean views to be had. This is the hotel that has they gym (not too bad at all) and a small lap pool w/ jacuzzi. This also has a great steak restaurant on the 1st floor, which I highly recommend (great sliders!!). Anyway, The ocean-view side is where we stayed - 7th floor. View from room was fantastic, overlooking the open ocean in all directions from our balcony. Room itself if very nice and modern...you won't be disappointed if you get a room like we had. There is a few restaurants in this part of the hotel for a quick bite....sandwhiches aren't on the cheap side and average around $14. Luch for two ran about $35 w/ tip. Not too bad. If you are looking for cheaper options, there are plenty of avenues for you as this hotel is located in the city w/ plenty of Subways, Pizza Places, etc.....You just have to walk about 5-10 minutes down the street to get to multiple venues and restaurants. We hit up Walgreens the first day to load up on both waters, soda's and snacks for the pool. Found this to be really cost effective as there are refridgerators in each room. Also hit up the local liquor store for a case of Medalla Light (the Puerto Rico version of Bud Light)...not too bad. Spending $23 on a case is a better cost option of buying singles at the pool bar for $3.50/each - so $5 w/ tip. No brainer! We spent a lot of time at the pool w/ the pool bar. Never had a problem getting a seat...pick of the litter as we stayed mid-week. We found this to be much different than an AI resort as the European vacationers tend to wake up at like 3 AM to throw their towel on a prime-time lounge chair to reserve. BTW, there are NO European vacationers in Puerto Rico...so all Americans and locals here. Beach is located on a protected lagoon area.....nothing to brag about here as I think it may even be public? Water was warm and there are a few reefs to snorkle on but I would stay in the pool area as it felt more like vacation to me. The hotel has a 24 hour casino which was a good time. Slot machines do not pay out a damn thang but still fun playing penny and nickle slots. Never saw anyone hit at all and I was there a good amount of time. There are free drinks in the casino (not just alcoholic) - so if you are thirstly during the day, go to the back of the casino and there is a soda fountain w/ Coke/Sprite/Water, etc.....on the house yo! I pulled a few 2 AM runs down there when I was thirsty......no problem. Anyway, for excursions, we didn't really do any this time but we did trek into Old San Juan just to see it. Taxi is $16 to/from and it only is like 2 miles away - probalby too long to walk though due to humidity. Nothing really to brag about there....kind of dirty w/ souvenier shops every other door. I guess there are a couple of old Spanish forts if that is your thing. Ten minutes after walking around and looking at a few cobblestone streets, we were ready to go back to our area, which is much nicer. As for food, I do have to highly recommend one restaurant located not even a 3 minute walk from hotel. Think it's called Ropa Viejo or something like that. Great steak house. Actually, to be honest, one of the best steaks I've ever had - think it the "Skirt Steak w/ Puerto Rico Spices"...second to bottom item on the far right page of menu. Check-check it out..you won't be disappointed.....went well with the Jack & Coke's I was drinking. Well, to sum up my experience, it was a good trip for the amount of time we stayed there - 4 nights. Probably wouldn't have stayed longer here. Have to give a shout out to the hotel's concierge Leah Rossi. She is an absolute professional that strides to make her guests' hotel experience one to remember. I dropped her an email prior to arriving at her hotel and she hooked us up w/ a few hotel vouchers which was much appreciated and served to make our Conrad experience all the more memorable and affordable. Leah, if you by chance read this review, I thank you for your kindness. Well, enjoy your vacation. Never take bad reviews serious as you are the one who utlimately makes your vacation experience what it is. Wish I had more information to provide, but what it comes down to is that for 5 days, I pretty much pooled it, gambled it, slept it and ate it. Happy travels. O'Doyle Rules! San Dimas High School Football Rules! Now, it's time to enter into this parent thing in 3 months......good times. Hope my boy will travel the world like his dad! Greg Potter Salem MA

Reviews.Title: “Nice place”
Reviews.Author: VORLOC
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, located in an exclusive area. Good staff, restaurants and installations.

Reviews.Title: “won't go back (not a beach hotel)”
Reviews.Author: ktatravel
Reviews.Content: My friend & I stayed here for a few day as our mini vacation but did not enjoy the hotel much. The beach is a public beach, really crowded & LOUD on the weekend. The chairs were free for hotel guests but we had to pay $11 a day for the umbrella. The size of the room was good but we could hear doors slammed late into the night, conversations in the hall, street traffic..not very sound proof. Not enough elevators for such a big hotel. The breakfast vouchers are great but you have to get there early like 7:30 - 8:00AM if you don't want to wait 30-40 minutes for a table and then wait another 30min for your eggs. The chambermaid knocked on the door at 9ish & when we asked that she come back, she gave us attitude and never cleaned the room that day. Like the area..walked around on Ashford Ave. Great restaurants nearby like Ropa Vieja and the Perurrican place. Even the diner like place (open 24hrs) near the Walgreens had good food.

Reviews.Title: “Expensive, but nice.”
Reviews.Author: 2NRL
Reviews.Content: I've been to this hotel a few times for business, this last trip I took my family. Here are a few things to know. First the beach is quite small and is not exclusive to the hotel; it is a public beach and can be crowded on the weekends. Also, there is a busy road right next to the beach; the photos cleverly stop before showing the road. However the beach is beautiful and holds a nice variety of small fish and crabs. The kids had a ball finding all the creatures in the water. The pools were also nice and there is a swim-up bar, however, getting the bartenders attention was quite difficult despite the bar not being crowded. The hotel is split into two parts, one with an ocean view, and one with a lagoon view. Having stayed in both sides, I found both equally nice and clean, no issues at all. There are a few very nice restaurants in the hotel; I've eaten at all of them. The food is very good, but expect to pay more than you would think. There is also a very large casino with live entertainment; I'm not a gambler so I did not go into the casino.

Reviews.Title: “Condado Convenience - but that's all”
Reviews.Author: Worldfrog
Reviews.Content: The Condado is the place that my business typically books for their work in downtown San Juan - it's about 15 - 20 minutes from where we work, so it is conveniently located, and in a nice area. From a business perspective, it has the basics - WiFi, copiers, fax machines and the like. It also works well for those of us who work late hours when out of town, since it has room service and multiple restaurants in house, so you can come in after a long day of work and stay at the hotel for the rest of the evening. I thought the room service menu was limited, but all you have to do is go down to the mezzanine to find multiple restaurants. There are a handful of decent restaurants close by, but only a few that I would consider "walking distance". Otherwise, you'll need to get in the car and make a short drive. Similarly, from a sightseeing perspective, the Condado is convenient, if only for the fact that it is not far from old San Juan. However, if you like to mix your business travel with sightseeing, I'd try to get something a little closer to old San Juan, if only for the fact that you can then get out and about directly from the hotel in the evenings. There is a smallish casino on site, where you can spend some time, if that's the sort of thing that interests you. All in all, the Condado is not a bad hotel, it's just not a great hotel. It fits the bill and gives you what you need in a hotel, with a little added convenience. If you want a comfortable bed, a decent room, and not much else, the Condado works just fine. The decor seems a little jarring in the lobby, but most of us don't spend hours/days in the lobby - so, in my opinion, no harm, no foul. As far as business travel goes, no complaints. If I were traveling for pleasure, however, I would be looking enviously at the sandy beaches across the bay at the Caribe Hilton or wishing I were in old San Juan.

Reviews.Title: “horrible customer service”
Reviews.Author: n54335i
Reviews.Content: Need I say more. Very disappointed in the service here. The only good thing about this hotel is the cleaning crew. They kept our bed clean and gave us adequate towels. Everyone else is subpar. Took over 2 hours to check in and get our keys to our room. The food was terrible at Cafe Caribe. If you come at 9 am or later expect at least 30 mins wait in line and another 30 minutes for your breakfast to come. This hotel needs a major restructuring in management. The staffs are under-trained in customer service. Too many bad things to list. I will never come back here.

Reviews.Title: “Fraternity House Environment; won't stay again”
Reviews.Author: Hesitant-Traveler
Reviews.Content: This was a return visit and although I did not post a review the first time, I thought the hotel was nice enough the last time I stayed (the front desk being poorly staffed was my only complaint then). On this visit, there was just one person working the front desk and a line for check in at midnight. It took 15 minutes because no one ever came to help out despite the line. The casino was packed and loud (I saw/heard it from the elevator on the way to my room). I may have just been unlucky in my room assignment, but the room next door and across the hall from me were hosting parties and the screaming both from the rooms and up and down the hall was constant. There seemed to constantly be people coming and going, and my guess was that people were alternating their time between the bar/casino and the rooms I was unfortunate enough to be near. I finally plugged my ears with my Ipod and headphones after being jarred awake several times by the yelling. The room itself was nice - oceanfront with a beautiful view. It was a nice size, with contemporary funishings, a desk and a couch. The bathroom was large with a rain showerhead. A more substantial room door that actually was flush with the ground might have helped with the noise from the hall and the room across. For Hilton Diamond status, I was given a voucher for a continental breakfast, which entitled me to coffee or hot tea (soda or cold tea were not allowed), juice, and toast or a muffin. Seemed a weak perk for elite status. The gentleman sitting next to me at breakfast had a voucher for the All American breakfast (hot) which apparently was part of his room rate, so obviously the same vouchers could be given for elite status, but apparently are not. I have stayed at the Caribe Hilton (all three buildings), the Marriott, and the Ritz. The Hilton is hit or miss depending on which building you get so I was avoiding that with this stay. The Ritz is off the beaten path as I remember, but nice. The Marriott was fine the one time I stayed there, and I will probably return there for my next visit. I won't return to the Conrad for fear that the casino activity and noise (open till 4 am apparently) will again make it's way to where I am trying to sleep.

Reviews.Title: “It's all good here!”
Reviews.Author: GEB577
Reviews.Content: I had heard so many nice things about this hotel from other people who have stayed there that I tried it for myself. I was not disappointed. The rooms are great, the service fantastic, and the views incredible.

Reviews.Title: “I've gotten better service at the DMV, not military friendly”
Reviews.Author: mlbk11
Reviews.Content: My husband and I got stationed here as he was coming straight out of boot camp. Our household goods and vehicle were not due to arrive for a month so we have to stay in a hotel. I'm currently still here for four more days, I've been a "resident" of this hotel since June 3rd. This hotel is not accomodating, they lie and are rude. First problem we had: we did not know our military discount was for a suite, they had us in a small room for two weeks. When we asked for a microwave the lady at the front asked why we chose the smaller room, huh? So she put us in a suite bc weeks without a microwave and the waste of food was getting awful. They put us in a suite without a microwave and said oh, well we are sorry but no microwaves are available and we can't take them out of rooms and put them in yours, still we don't have a microwave. Second, our a/c doesn't work well on 80 it feels like 70, you have to turn it off to get warm then everything collects dew from the moisture and your fruit spoils quickly, oh nothing they can do. Third there is no cheap laundry for long term stay. Fourth I was expecting a package and after telling them they still held the package for three days and luckily my husband went down there and asked and then they handed it over. Fifth: at the cafe here all 6 times they messed up our food order and 3 times overcharged us. Sixth: everytime we had to extend our stay one of the front desk people said oh we can't do this until you check out and my husband said I'll be gone just my wife is here and I have the money then a few hours later we asked someone else and they were like let's take care of it now. Seventh: every week at odd times our keys randomly stop working. Eighth: my husband was underway and I got back to the hotel and the hallway and my room smelt like pot smoke and loud music was next door, my head was throbbing. I called the front desk, they said they'd send security which they never did and this went on all night, at this point we didn't check out bc changing paperwork through the military was hassle. Ninth: the parking garage is for guest and public so when I did get my car the lot was full and I had to park a few blocks away and by myself at night walk in puerto rico. Tenth: when I got parking in the garage my car was broken into AND THE HOTEL SAID THEY AREN'T LIABLE!!!!! My door locks no longer work so I have to climb through my back hatch to unlock the doors in my SUV....lastly three days before we check out the hotel calls and says our credit card is maxed out, they've been running it without our permission when that is the card on hold and we've been paying debit. The card only has a 3,000$ limit. I asked how are you able to decide how to pay my expenses? They said the balance has to be paid every seven days and I said that's funny bc this is the first I'm hearing of this and we've been paying every two to three weeks and she through out their scapegoat of POLICY. They all don't follow the same allusive policy....I cannot wait to get out of this greedy hotel and if one more time they tell me "your husband being in the military doesn't matter we can't wait for him to get back" I'm going to lose it....guard your own coast then conrad!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Horrible service, items stolen,phone didn't work....don't waste your $$!!!”
Reviews.Author: MMO698
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel as a package deal 6 months earlier... We where so excited to vist OUR island.... Well by the time we left we where soooo disappointed with our stay..... From the time we tried to check in to the point of check out ALL we had where issues... From the check in girl(patti) to having to call the manager (carol) and being told that whatever room we were given that we could not complain!!!!!....then all the manager said she could offfer us a $50 credit...REALLY!!!?? Then we get to our room and 5 minutes later house keeping comes and wants to clean the room!!!! Ok so then I had my swimsuit cover up stolen out of the room and a brand new pair of sandals also stolen!!! I was told to do a report which I did and was told by Robert(security guy) and jonpier(manager) that they took this issue really serious and that I would have a resolution...well it has been more than 1 month and I still have NO conclusion...which I have also contacted the general manager mr bustamante and he said he would research it and guess what... NOTHING yet!!! And finally the room phone never worked and there was a fire alarm go off and we had NO way to communicate... We complained about 6 different times and it was not till we checked out that we where told that the line was broken!! I totally would not recommend this hotel and it is such a shame that as native puerto Ricans going back to visit and getting this horrible service is not acceptable!!! NO ones wants to help/return my items that where stolen!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Conrad, got good price on priceline bidding option”
Reviews.Author: mmosley29
Reviews.Content: Really enjoyed the conrad. We got an excellent price on priceline. We bid to stay at a resort and landed at the Conrad. Service was nice. Heard the food at there at the resort isn't spectacular so we never ate there. Our room was always clean, comfy bed, beautiful ocean view, and we did eat a snack near the pool. The location is at the end of the strip, and yes there are some abandoned buildings. I was slightly surprised since I was expecting the major strip to look like miami's south beach but it doesn't it. The hotel is a weathered area but we still didn't seem to mind since everything was just a short walk. Only a 5-10 min walk to the nearby populated beach and eateries. People frequently go running during all times of the day on the strip next to the hotel. The strip was very safe. Saw plenty of people walking at night. Took the bus to Old San Juan in the afternoon. Felt very safe with my husband. Ate at Cafe PR! Excellent choice...try the stuffed eggplant. Ate also at Raices, great rican food here too. If you like to dance check out Latin Grooves on a Friday or Saturday night in Old San Juan. Visit the Fort and the San Juan Museum. Be sure to reserve your rental car online at Enterprise...which is also onsite beside the hotel. Better price when reserved online cause price is super high once you get there. Drove to Camuy to see the CAVES and El Yunque (the rain forest and water fall) is a must if you do nothing else. When also went to the Bio Bay out in Farjardo. It was interesting but not breath-taking. Still glad we saw one of the few bays in the world that glow at night. BE SURE TO BRING A GPS if you venture out. Always felt safe there just use common sense.

Reviews.Title: “Not so good”
Reviews.Author: slvrnkl
Reviews.Content: Having to go to Puerto Rico for business, it seemed like a good idea to add some vacation time to the trip. My wife and I went and decided to stay and the Conrad due to the location and the beach. We were quite surprised at how difficult it is to get around in a car in the area. It was also a shock to pay over $16 per day to park. As a Hilton Honors member we were supposed to get free breakfast. We were taken back when we discovered that we only got a free "continental" breakfast, which was toast and coffee. We were able to apply the $7 breakfast voucher toward a real breakfast, which cost from $10-$14. One night we were awakened at midnight to someone singing as loudly as possible on the balcony below us. Another night we were awakened at 2:00 AM by a party on the balcony beside us and then kept awake the rest of the morning. At 6:30 AM the party host came out of the room with a margarita and apologized for being so loud. The Conrad is a nice resort and has great viiews and a great location. Ashford Avenue had nice shopping and food.

Reviews.Title: “Needs a bit of work, but a solid choice”
Reviews.Author: FAMURattler
Reviews.Content: Overall this is a solid choice for the price. I'd actually originally booked the Hilton Caribe which is across the bay from the Conrad. I was disappointed with the customer service and cleanliness at the Hilton Caribe. So I booked the Conrad, which is about 5 minutes away from the Hilton Caribe and is also a Hilton property. I found the staff at this hotel to be a lot more helpful. One of the managers really scrambled at the last minute to find us a room after we told him about our issues at the Hilton Caribe. This hotel is also less chaotic than the Hilton Caribe. Overall the rooms here are pretty good. The hotel strives to have a hip vibe and features a modern decor. The bathrooms in the rooms are large; there are no tubs, but I never take sit down baths at hotels anyway. My only complaint about the room would be the lack of storage, small safe, are they do show their age a bit. I would say both the Hilton Caribe and Conrad are worn. The Conrad simply does a better job of hiding it's age because of the superior housekeeping staff. You definitely see the signs of wear on the hotel exterior. From an amenities perspective there is a small beach, a pool with a slide, and a small salt water pool. The grounds are not large. If you're looking for big grounds and lots for the kids to do, then stay at the Hilton Caribe (if you can brave the crowds and inferior service). If you want a more laid-back vibe, then the Conrad is a better choice. The Conrad also features a Casino and two tennis courts. We only ate once at the hotel - AND ONCE WAS ENOUGH! We made the mistake of eating a Cafe Caribe. Probably some of the worst food and slowest service I've ever had at a restaurant! To add insult to injury, the food was not cheap. My paella tasted like dishwater and it cost $24. I'm not sure about the other restaurants at the hotel, but definitely don't eat at the Cafe Caribe. The hotel Starbucks was a great resource. Very convenient for beverages and snacks.

Reviews.Title: “Peace of Mind”
Reviews.Author: faith52
Reviews.Content: It was great to be back at the San Juan condado Plaza, this time I brought my cousin. We sat at the pool and relaxed, and I went to the casino at The San Juan Condado Plaza. This place has the most beautiful view of the ocean, that all your troubles disappears. I met a lot people from all over the country, and they were beaming with happiness. How can I forget Rolando, a people's person, who works at Condado Plaza.The staff was professional and Condado Plaza, was very clean. You must visit the Zen spa, before you leave. I will be back. Thank you.

Reviews.Title: “Family friendly. A must stay!”
Reviews.Author: audirocs
Reviews.Content: I just got back from Puerto Rico. Boy was it fun! We stayed at the Conrad and I gotta say, for a old hotel, it was great. It's the first hotel you see once you crossed the bridge into Ashford Street. Yes, you hear creepy noises at night. I went downstairs to ask if there's hauntings in the hotel, sadly no. (LOL) Pros.....Pool open 24 hrs. Aqua Bar happy hour!!!! (David was mad kool) Laundromat on premises. Rooms are spacious. You control your room temperature. Kids will love the pool slide. Cons... BRING YOUR OWN FIRST AID KIT! My son got cut twice running around the pool and it took forever to find a band aid. The Aqua Bar closes early if there's no foot traffic. Elevators were down, especially the pool location. No towels after 7pm. Guests pay for your own parking. Hot Spa didn't work. Overall, it was great besides the band aid and Aqua Bar's early closings. I would most definitely go back! Hands down.

Reviews.Title: “not your typical Conrad”
Reviews.Author: jacnit
Reviews.Content: if you're going to this hotel thinking it has to be fabulous because it's a Conrad..NO...we've stayed in many Conrad's and this one although certainly titled that way does not come close to the typical standards of service, respect,etc..to it's guests. We had ongoing air conditioning problems the moment we stepped into our room that was not addressed until our last day..we did get another room which we were grateful for however, not until our last night..details TOO many to mention here..not good. With the exception of one or two staff members, the staff does what very little they can get by with...promises of a book for the room explaining the layout of the hotel w/restaurant menus took three days to get w/calls made to the front desk daily..it never showed up! All in all, i would say if you're just looking for an ok place and don't care about service then this is your place but if you're wanting an excellent experience and to be treated w/respect and dignity DON'T STAY HERE!

Reviews.Title: “Conrad Puerto Rico- Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: sightseeker29
Reviews.Content: We loved our stay at the Conrad! The ocean view from our room was absolutely breath taking! The hotel was clean and the staff was wonderful. The carpet was a little worn, but not bad and so what? Your living all around poverty and you're going to complain that the carpet is a little worn. Get over it! Enterprise Car rental and Star Bucks are right next door, which is a plus. We rented a car and drove to the Rain Forest and did the Bio Bay excursion on the way home. Loved the Bio Bay experience! Highly recommend it! This is one of the few places that you can experience this phenomenom. I recommend the earlier trip so that you experience both day and night as you kayak. Not for children who don't like the dark. You will get wet and you will need bug repellant, but it is fun and incredible to see! Be sure you know where you are going before you rent a car and set out on your own! There are very few street signs in PR and you will get different directions to the same place everytime you ask! We also drove to Old town and parked in a garage near the cemetary for next to nothing. Another tip- don't get stuck in rush hour traffic downtown! Not fun. Overall, we really enjoyed our stay at the Conrad and in Puerto Rico!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TJB-CJN
Reviews.Content: The hotel workers were great and respectful.Rooms were spotless with good bed and great pillows slept great.Not much of a beach but pools made up for it.Checked us in 4 hours early, upgraded to oceanfront for a small fee.Restaurants within walking distance,and restaurants in complex were good.Food and drinks were higher as some people stated but if you want Mcdonalds food you could probably find one.

Reviews.Title: “San Juan Conrad Condado Plaza is the best!”
Reviews.Author: cc318
Reviews.Content: Since we arrived and Patricia took care of us for our check-in, we began enjoying the 4th of July weekend to the max. Great greeting, great service, great room. A lobby full of energy and enterntainment. Few hotels count on two fo the finest restaurants in their lobby: Pikayo and Varitas. Can not be topped!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome place for Business travel / Vacation”
Reviews.Author: jollybwoy
Reviews.Content: I traveled for business the end of June 2011 and the Conrad was recommended. I was very pleasantly surprised. It is located on the San Juan strip where you just have to park and walk, there is everything you need close by. From the moment I checked in I was provided a very comprehensive but pleasant overview of the facilities by Patricia in addition to directing me to my room. The hotel is pretty large as it spans both sides of the street. The hotel has fine restaurants and the rooms and facilities were very nice. The service was excellent as the staff were very friendly but at the same time very professional. The casinio had a fairly good size crowd especially on Wednesday night. I would definately return to the Conrad for business or Vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Stay somewhere else”
Reviews.Author: sexynana
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in need of renovation. Looks nice when you take a quick glance in the lobby area and casion (a plus). The rooms are small extremely small bathrooms the cleaner crew must have been on vacation while we were there our room didn't get fully cleaned each day it was a hit or miss. The locatin is fabulous close to restaurants which was very good because the food in the hotel was very pricey. There are all types of restaurants within walking distance. The pool area is small and the beach is a public beach. The service was a big disappointment from the front desk on down. No one was friendly or eager to help. We've been places where we were greeted warmly everyday and showed that they were glad we were there and hoped we'd come again when you have good service you WILL RETURN and tell others. I will go to Puerto Rico again but I'd stay at another resort. Be sure to take a trip to Old San Juan. Take the bus it's only .75 (#21 or #53) you can also take either bus to Old San Juan and catch the FREE trolley and visit the Fort. The taxis are 14.00 one way.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome staff”
Reviews.Author: nitzaf
Reviews.Content: Was very happy with the staff and the hotel.. I cannot compliment the staff at the front door enough. My daughter left her purse in a taxi and security actually ran the video tape to get the tag number off the taxi. If you even been to San Juan there are hundreds of taxis. Within the hour we recieved a call from the taxi driver letting us know that he was bringing her purse back. My tip for families is to walk down to Walgreens and buy your beverages plus a plastic cooler and use that throughout the week at the pool or beach. Beverages are very expensive at the hotel. There are some very good resturants outside of the hotel. Our two favorites were Cafe de Angles and Latin Star. For a family of 4 expect to pay an average of $50 to $70. The food was very good. Breakfast at the hotel cost us $60. The pools were open at night but there is really not to much light. Very dark around the hot tub.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay - Can't Wait to Return”
Reviews.Author: namelessinma
Reviews.Content: We had a truly memorable visit to Puerto Rico, which started & ended with excellent service and an outstanding stay at the Conrad Condado. We were celebrating an anniversary and emailed the hotel prior to our stay. They were incredibly responsive and thought of everything - including an upgrade to an ocean view room on the top floor of the hotel, a bottle of champagne and welcome note awaiting us in the room, and a complimentary breakfast upon departure. Leah Rossi was definitely working behind the scenes to make our stay special. Maria & Marisol at the Concierge Desk were also helpful throughout our stay, making suggestions re: activities, helping us navigate public transportation ($.75 to ride the bus to Old San Juan & easy!), booking a snorkel excursion, and advising us on departure tips. Peter, the manager of the Cafe Caribe, is a great guy, and Felix arranged for our departure breakfast. Throughout our stay, staff went out of their way to make sure we were happy and enjoying our time in Puerto Rico. We can't wait to visit again and will definitely book the Conrad in the future! (We were here July 4-8, 2011; the fireworks on the lagoon side of the hotel were better than expected, too!)

Reviews.Title: “Rooms were ok for price, but services were not up to Hilton par...”
Reviews.Author: Travelagg
Reviews.Content: Stayed in a double ocean view - nice view. Balcony was ok...2 chairs that were pretty cheap. Room was tiled, bed comfy,shower big. Drinks at the pool bar were 12 bucks each...and served in a small cup. Typical right? But atmosphere was not great - especially in the evening - as pools weren't all lighted, hot tub was cold and towels were not available. Bar was open to take your money...but other than that, you were on your own. The beach access was on the bay side...and was really small. Better beaches are had in many other hotels. Nice waves hitting the rocks on the ocean side. Parking was $17 a day should you need it. They basically had no help taking care or cleaning the common areas for the guests - unless you were waiting to buy something. In my view, we paid Hilton prices for an older hotel (decorated sorta modern and sorta 70's) but got treated as if we were staying at a motel. I will say the concierge and the bell staff were very helpful and courteous...but the hotel was just not managed well when it came to the details that make your stay worth it. I wouldn't stay here again...there are much better choices for your money.

Reviews.Title: “Reviews were wrong !!!”
Reviews.Author: basshunterdds
Reviews.Content: We went to the Conrad July3-July9. I thought the place was going to be a dump but were they wrong. The elevators worked fine. The exercise room was pretty darn good but it was crowded from about 9AM to 2 PM. Every one in Puerto Rico works out. Resturants are nearby for walking and on the 4th there was a party at the hotel with specials that were great.Our room was cleaned by Betsy and we had fresh sheets every night. The floors were clean and the room smelled clean every day. Management were supervising the floor on several dates. Our room size was just fine. If you wanted larger room rent an apartment. The fire alarm went off on the 5th about 2:30 AM,and they apologized several times for the inconvenience. My brother had stayed at the Caribe Hilton so I was awareof the cab fees which are standard depending on where you stay on the island. Aprint out is available. The food was alittle high but not any higher than food is any where on the island. Prices were pretty even whether you ate in Old San Juan or Isla Verde. One of my better meals was on a roadside and I had a Bahalista and meat pies with stuffed Plantains. finally the service was excellent. Marisol, at the concierge desk, Hooked me up on a Tarpon Trip that was out of this world as I hooked a 100+lb fish. There is a crowd at the desk and all 3-4 fof the concierges were busy. Just wait your turn and don't wait until the last minute. Beware of the rainforest trip. The forest was fine ,the beach was absolutely nasty with flies and garbage every where . . Also if you want a casino, go to Las vegas as this is just a hotel casino option. I will go back again to the Conrad.

Reviews.Title: “nice”
Reviews.Author: CaptainConnecticut
Reviews.Content: Overall a very good hotel. Room was very clean. Housekeeping did a great job daily. Good variety of outside activies with daily planned activities for the whole family. Decent sized beach area (bay water) and 3 pools. 95% of employees were OUTSTANDING!!! Would reccomend for friends visting this area.

Reviews.Title: “Memorable”
Reviews.Author: linatrip052
Reviews.Content: I spent the Memorial Day weekend at the Conrad, and our stay was memorable. From the guest registration desk to the pools and the beach area, everything went well until we left. The staff was friendly and accommodating, and they made us feel important. I will come back!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable stay!”
Reviews.Author: Kristina317
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I visited Puerto Rico for the first time in May and stayed at the Condado Plaza. The location was great- you could walk to the shopping and restaurants and it was a quick cab ride to Old San Juan. Cab rides cost about $15 to get to Old San Juan (flat rate). We took the bus a few times which was also very convenient as it was located right in front of the hotel and it was 75 cents each way to OSJ. The hotel itself was also enjoyable. I really enjoyed the pool area.. a salt water pool, a hot tub and a regular pool with a swim up bar. The service at the pool and swim up bar was great. The also had lots of lounge chairs and hammocks. The beach was nice but if you are looking to be on the beach a lot and don't care about a pool I may look elsewhere as it was small. But it did offer a nice reef for snorkeling and tropical fish to see. Our room was nice. I enjoyed the balcony. The bathroom was tiny so if you care about bathroom size you may want to upgrade to a larger room. Staff was friendly we asked the concierge for things a few times and they were always very helpful. Overall I thought it was a nice place to stay for the money we paid. My biggest complaint was getting to our room which was on the other side of the street took a bit sometimes due to an elevator being broken but it was fixed by the time we left. It seemed like a mix of families and couples, I didn't see large groups of friends that were there but could have been the time of year.

Reviews.Title: “bad location,dirty rooms bad Conrad”
Reviews.Author: lifeisshortOhio
Reviews.Content: The name Conrad use to bring thoughts of luxury to my mind,not anymore.This hotel is located in a rundown part of town with empty buildings next door.Beach is super small and public next to heavy traffic.Pool chairs and hammocks were filthy and music at pool was super loud.High parking fee per day or taxis at $14.00 one way to old San Juan(Waited for public bus twice and it never came after 40 minutes). Party in room next to ours and cigars were allowed in no smoking hotel., 2 roaches crawling in the safe.Room was less than clean.Casino was fun with new machines but not worth staying here.

Reviews.Title: “modern but classic”
Reviews.Author: bhagonwali
Reviews.Content: Being from the East in Mainland USA service is expected to be quick and courteous, here at the Conrad service was sufficient. Omel at the Front desk was friendly, helpful and made our stay 100% better. The hotel is beautiful and clean. I agree with the majority that service at the casino for drinks was not at all adequate. Also the service by the pool was very slow and when I mentioned to the security guard at the beach that their was metal from can on the beach they did nothing about it, so people walking bear feet on the beach could have gotten hurt. Prices at the restaurants were very expensive but food was good. Hot tubs are terrible, the hot tub outside by the beach is colder then the pools, the hottub by the gym was packed with kids (each night we were there- with no security or towels there) and the hottub in the gym could have cooked someone it was too hot to enter. Very disappointing. The gentleman at the concierge was not helpful but concierge supervisor was nice. Overall the hotel was great but do not expect to much from service and you will get more out of your stay.

Reviews.Title: “Patricia was great..”
Reviews.Author: Dilchahtahai443
Reviews.Content: Great place. Patrecia was awesome .great hospitality.. She helped us to extend our checkout time... I'd definitely recommend going back to this place..

Reviews.Title: “Horrible Experience”
Reviews.Author: teena1014
Reviews.Content: What a night last night. It was bad enough that their had to be about 10-15 very loud people in the room next door, but to be woken up at 3:30am by people on my balcony (they had jumped over from theirs) peeking in my window was terrifying! I immediately called security and insisted they come up with the police, but 10 minutes later one guy showed up alone and asked what happened. By that time the people next door were gone. Security was completely inefficient and uncaring. Do not stay at this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “HORRIBLE!”
Reviews.Author: benlofon
Reviews.Content: Save money, time and your vacation and go some where else than this 2 Star Ghetto Motel at a 4 Star price. This is an old run down property with a slap of cheap paint and old carpet smell. The casino waitress was extremely rude and told me that if I wanted a free sandwich, I had to sit down and play. Its ok if I wanted a free sandwich at 1 AM, which I didn't and or offered to pay, but the fact is, I had just stood up from a poker table that I spent $80 dollars in 3 mins. Even though I told her that I had just stood up from a table, she said no and go back and sit down. I complained to the casino, lobby and other staff about this stupid service practice but all I got was rude and unprofessional gestures from an apparent staff of disgruntled minimum wage banana republic employees. The only thing Hilton about this hotel is its name, everything else is like that cheap show like called Paris...

Reviews.Title: “Patricia was great!!”
Reviews.Author: wontdoitagain
Reviews.Content: We are a couple on our honeymoon who booked our trip several months ago. We had moved our wedding up one day, changed the flight accordingly, but forgot to change the hotel reservation. So when we arrived, we were an entire day early. Patricia was able to help us out and helped us book the room at the same rate as the other nights. We let her know we were honeymooning, and she was extremely helpful and provided us with all the accomodations that she could. Yay Patricia!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel and Service.!”
Reviews.Author: citylightva
Reviews.Content: Patricia was extremely friendly at check in and offered a lot of information. My King Corner room in the Laguna Tower on the 10th floor was great with a wrap around balcony and many ocean views. The hotel decor is great and exactly my style!! I will definitely be back at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “THE BEST OF EVERYTHING!”
Reviews.Author: vmsjacksonville
Reviews.Content: I booked the hotel Conrad for my husbands 55th birthday. We had an early flight in and arrived at the hotel around 1:30pm so we had to wait until 4:00 pm. to check-in but was well worth it, I asked for an upgrade and was upgraded to a beautiful 10th floor oceanfront balcony room. The views were amazing. The beds were very comfortable, and the bathroom was large, updated and modern. There are three pools you can relax in, a salt water pool, a swim up bar pool with a cool slide for the kids and a more private pool on the lagoon side of the hotel. Just steps away from the pools is the beach where you can swim and snorkel. I brought my snorkel equipment and spent time snokeling where I saw some amazing fish (just wish I had brought my daughters waterproof camera.). There are two buildings to the Conrad. Across the street there is the Condado lagoon, where you can rent Kayaks and stand-up boards. Also the gym is in this building. The gym is large with updated equipment and everything you need for a great workout. There is also a whirlpool in the gym! The casino has great entertainment at night with a live band to keep you dancing while your gambling. (I'm not much of a gambler but my husband enjoyed the casino). The Condado area is beautiful and upscale and the Conrad is (in my opinion) the best location with views of the ocean, city ,and lagoon. You can walk places to eat in the Condado area (which is a good idea to walk off all the good food you will eat). The bus stop is right in front of the resort and for 75 cents you can go to Old San Juan for some sight-seeing and shopping. When there were issues with our air-conditioner and coffee-pot the maintenance person was there in less than 5 minutes to take care of any problems. The staff were all very friendly and accommodating and made our vacation our best ever. Thank you Conrad Condado!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing views and left relaxed!”
Reviews.Author: Swimjaz
Reviews.Content: We had an amazing time at the Conrad! The hotel has a great resort feel to it from the lavish lobby and lounges, beautiful sunlit rooms, and very helpful staff to the activities offered. We tried both pool areas and greatly enjoyed ourselves, especially with the seating right by the ocean crashing on the rocks. The staff was very attentive and most helpful. Almost everyone in the area speaks English, so no need to be fluent in Spanish to communicate easily. The beach behind the hotel is quite small and more for small children, but we were able to take a 10 min walk and reach a much larger and beautiful beach quite easily. We also did the El Yunque tour with Castillo watersports. Our tour guide was great and the rainforest was definitely worth seeing, especially the waterfall. The shopping near the hotel is convenient as there are various souvenir shops, a subway, and a walgreens. Most of the other shops were very high end though, but still fun to window shop. There are several authentic restaurants nearby including, ropa vieja and San angel. These two offered delicious puerto rican meals. We also tried pikayo in the hotel. Make sure to make reservations and request a table by the window. The food was delicious but very pricey. It made a great night to dress up and have a romantic dinner though. Taxis were very convenient from the hotel and the airport was only a 15 min drive. We paid about 20 dollars each way to the airport. Overall we loved our stay in San Juan and definitely recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect vacation - perfect hotel!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: OMFS1
Reviews.Content: 17-25 June 2011 with wife and 3 children. Two connecting, ocean-view rooms. Front desk folks very professional and helpful; concierge can "fix" any problems/needs; atmosphere is open/airy; rooms with great view and comfortable; excellent food and the right price considering a very expensive city/land prices; pool area/bar and all attendents were alert and happy at all times. I am a 28 year military retiree with considerable experience from Sweden to North Africa, the Middle East and Canada to the Caribbean. Everything considered, The Conrad Condado Plaza and its employees set the standard for me. I will return without fail.

Reviews.Title: “Oh yeah!”
Reviews.Author: ArchibaldTuttle_11
Reviews.Content: Stunning hotel, with fabulous, funky rooms overlooking the crashing waves, gorgeous reception, pools and bars, and private balconies. Location is great in the sense of being equidistant from the places you might want to go, but the 20-minute walk to the Old Town is a bit boring (and you wouldn't want to to it at night). There are loads of taxis though. Basically, this is a fabulous luxury hotel in a fabulous city, so you can't go wrong.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: bake4ugm
Reviews.Content: Stayed 7 days and and enjoyed each day - The food & service at the Cabrie restaurant was top notch each day (Felix the server is great). Casino - Conceige - Parking was very efficient on a daily basis - will return and recommed. Very well situated in San Juan to all areas in Puerto Rico

Reviews.Title: “Great Views!”
Reviews.Author: diesel230
Reviews.Content: Overall this is a great hotel in an excellent location with view to ocean, lagoon with city skyline or just the city is really your pick. My sister in law pick the ocean view and we picked the lagoon with city skyline view. We love our view! As mentioned by other reviewers, the hotel is very nice and chic. Rooms are comfortable and spacious. The hotel offers great amenities and things to do. They have grown up pools, kids pool and a beautiful clear water beach! There is a full size bar in the middle of the of the hotel first floor and at night on the weekends it turns into a nice, chic club and it gets packed! Is really nice. The hotel offer 3 or 4 restaurants, a Starbucks and a decent size casino. We love it it was a great experience and we stay in a lot of hotels throughout the years. Why didn't I give it 5 stars? Well, it's on the pricey side, a bottle of fiji water was $7 and don't forget to turn in your towels in the pool/beach area because they will charge $20 for each towel and the restaurants were at least $30 per dish and parking was $16 for self or $21 for valet. We like to splurge when on vacation but it can quickly add up. You could clearly see some wear and tear in many areas of the building/rooms. When we were standing in our 10th floor balcony we looked down and we could see a corner of a tile missing from an inferior floor balcony. The rooms were clean and decor was contemporary. Overall though, we loved it!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Chic Hotel with Great Location”
Reviews.Author: seetheworldb4ureyes
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a very chic young vibe to it. Nice decor, spacious rooms, and awesome bathroom. The shower in the bathroom was definitely my favorite. Its all see thru glass and huge. In the overall size of the bathroom was decent too. The hotel has a nightclub and a lobby/bar area which plays loud music that some may find disturbing. I found it to be rather exciting. The casino is nice too and sometimes hosts live bands. The pools were nice, had a waterslide which was great for the kids (and adults). There is a swim up bar which could use some updating. The ocean is beautiful here and although we didnt have an ocean view I could imagine it would be worth it. We had lunch and drinks at the pool one day and it was fairly decent. I did experience problems with my door shutting and locking. I read that someone else had the same problem. I wonder if we had the same room? Overall great hotel, perfect location, good service, clean spacious rooms, would definitely recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: shawnbrooks
Reviews.Content: The hotel was wonderful. We loved the decor, service, food, and accomodations. Special thanks to Carla who gave outstanding service. If you go to Puerto Rico this is the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “First Class Hotel and Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: ExecTravel2011
Reviews.Content: We had a business meeting in San Juan (group of 4 well travelled executives) and had no idea where to stay but had a suggestion to stay here from someone located in San Juan. We loved the place and were sad to only stay 3 nights. Such a great location and the staff were so attentive and friendly. We are returning for another meeting at the end of this month and we extended our stay another day just to enjoy the surroundings.

Reviews.Title: “Love this hotel and we'll be back”
Reviews.Author: JESSICA R
Reviews.Content: i love this hotel. I really enjoyed the casino. The breakfast buffet was amazing. The view and location is perfect. Its a cheap cab ride to Old Juan and other site seeing places. The wetbar and the popls are great

Reviews.Title: “Will return”
Reviews.Author: MagVeg
Reviews.Content: The service was excellent. The room was spacious with beautiful bathroom. We got a room with a view of the ocean and a small balcony. Very nice view. The location is near the airport and Old San Juan. Restaurants in the hotel are good but very expensive. The happy hour is very reasonable with excellent service, drinks and free popcorn. The bartender was great. It has two very large pools. The beach is very small and public. The staff is very friendly, responsive and helpful. Liked the size of the room, location, staff, very reasonable rates. Did not like the bed, very lumpy, soft mattress, some of the hotel restaurants are very expensive and food not very good, restaurants walking distance very expensive, you have to take a cab to enjoy area i.e. Old San Juan. I would return as it was a great value.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Honeymoon Destination!”
Reviews.Author: SonyaCaruso
Reviews.Content: We just got back from our honeymoon and we were extremely pleased with our hotel choice. I did a ton of research on Trip Advisor and booked a great deal through CheapCarribean.com for hotel and air. We rented a car (Priceline) which we used almost 300 miles on. This area of PR had the most going on as far as restaurants, bars, shopping and beaches. My only complaint would be the bathrooms. Although they were very modern, they didn't offer alot of privacy. One other note, I like to wake up to a dark room and the curtains did not meet the floor nor close all the way in the middle. The pool had a good vibe and was never so crowded that you couldn't find a seat. They had beachtowels for you that you could check out. The hot tub was never really crowded either. The self parking was very accessible and convenient. Some of the restaurants (walking distance) we tried were at La Concha Hotel- Voga Italian Grill- Excellent Service and Delicious Food! Perurrican- Best ceviche and mofongo! Latin Star- we ate here twice for breakfast for $12/day! Garrachino's - Have to go here since they are the inventor of the Pina Colada. Also, the hotel bar would get pretty happening late at night and they had the best sangria! I would recommend reserving your spots a few days early for the excursions. You can get names and phone numbers of all the companies from one of the PR magazines they have in the hotel room. We did the bioluminescent kayak tour thru Yokahukayaks ($45 pp) and I would recommend the 6PM tour so you can see where you're going! We also drove Las Palmas Resort for horseback riding thru Rancho Bueno Vista. Loquillo kiosks for lunch although they all had the same food. But we ate lunch and had 2 beers for $7! The rainforest was cool too. Plan a whole day for that and you can bring a cooler and have lunch there. It was hot so definitely wear a bathing suit to get in the water and tennis shoes! For our dancing night we took a taxi to Club Brava. Dress to kill and a $20 cover for men. Old San Juan was a great day trip of shopping and bar hopping. After seeing several hotels, this one has the most going on around it and lots of activities to walk to whereas the others had nothing around them. Granted the beach was small and we would drive to other beaches, I like having access to good restaurants and a Walgreens for those last minute items. Also, we bought a styrofoam cooler from Pueblo Grocery store, 3 bottles of liquor, 2 bottles of wine, and some beer and snacks for the hotel room for $100.

Reviews.Title: “Ruined our Honeymoon. Stay away from this horrible hotel.”
Reviews.Author: sugar32
Reviews.Content: This hotel can only be described as a series of errors. First they put us in a room with a broken air conditioner. They then moved us to a room with two beds, on our honeymoon! Next day there was no hot water in all of the hotel. Later that same day we went down to the restaurant to eat and were greeted by staffers having an argument while they were trying to seat us. And the final insult to injury, on the morning of check out, they locked us out of our room saying our card was declined. Well it was declined b/c they had charged us $100s of dollar in erroneous charges! The woman at the front desk tried to make amends by offering us a discount rate on our next visit. Next visit!!! I don't think I'll every visit Puerto Rico again thanks to this hotel!!!!!!! They ruined my honeymoon and that is something that can not be forgiven. Oh almost forgot to mention, the place is dirty. The floors are not vacuumed in the room at all.

Reviews.Title: “We do not stay anywhere else in PR!!”
Reviews.Author: Carolina_7680
Reviews.Content: My sister takes me on a trip to Puerto Rico each year since my high school graduation! We always stay at Condado Plaza. We were blown away on our first trip. The concierge was phenomenal! They set up many excursions for the two of us. I look forward to our trip there this summer!

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected”
Reviews.Author: Sanpum
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 4 nights during a bereavement trip. Our flight arrived at 3 a.m., And although we had to wait at airport for our rental car till 6 a.m., once we got to Conrad, we were in our room at 6:45. We had to travel back and forth between San Juan and Bayamon several times but we were able to use the pool, restaurants and casino while we were actuallyinthe hotel. The staff was friendly and helpful. The food was great. The room was big, roomy and except for a bug which my husband saw in the bathroom, it was great. We got a great package thru Jetblue and found it very reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury on the Isle of Enchantment”
Reviews.Author: marcelomunoz
Reviews.Content: Beautiful. amazing. delicious food. beautiful beach. friendly service. above and beyond. Will DEFINITELY stay here again. We were blown away by this hotel. Things are pricy, but they are everywhere, so oh well!

Reviews.Title: “This is a TERRIBLE hotel”
Reviews.Author: SSS77707
Reviews.Content: This is my first tripadvisor review, but I felt compelled to let others know NOT to stay here under any circumstances. This is an old-looking hotel, in the middle of a very not-nice part of San Juan, but most importantly, I have never experienced such horrible customer service in my life. When we tried to check in, they had us wait for 3 HOURS to get our room, because they had overbooked and the manager said their was nothing they could do about it - and he did not care one bit. Meanwhile, every search engine still showed that they were accepting room reservations. Then, the bell hop "lost" our luggage, and again, not one bit of effort was exerted by the manager to fix the situation. We finally got in a room 3 hours after arriving, and then got our luggage sometime after that. As if that wasn't bad enough, there were loud parties both nights we were there until 2 AM that were so loud there was no way anyone could sleep, and again, no one in management cared. If you are looking for a calm, serene, relaxing getaway, this is NOT IT.

Reviews.Title: “Be prepared to be disappointed”
Reviews.Author: 01dolci
Reviews.Content: Long lines at check in and be prepared to be put in a room other than what you've guaranteed. Lack of caring by hotel manager Jean Pierre. He simply said there was nothing he could do. One excuses he gave was "union housekeepers, nothing I can do". Hotel is nice but the service fell short. The Marriott is a great location and I would suggest staying there where the staff is quick to serve and you feel welcomed rather than you are bothering the staff. While at the desk I also heard other guest complaining as well. Perhaps a change in management would help this hotel operate better and increase guest satisfaction,

Reviews.Title: “More then I anticipated”
Reviews.Author: PAPO026
Reviews.Content: The service was exceptional, the room was like a spa, The location was great, if you don't rent a car, you could still walk and find restaurants and beautiful beaches. Although if you want the full effect of this island, I strongly recommend renting a car. The food is expensive at this hotel, but you could walk a couple of blocks and find a nice diner. What was wonderful about this hotel is that there was a salsa band, and fashion show during the evening.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable time”
Reviews.Author: Taurian34
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at different hotels on the Island in the past and this hotel was nice.. I stayed at the hotel for Memorial Weekend. I had the pleasure of having an ocean front room with a balcony on the 9th floor. The rooms have been completely remodeled. The room was very clean, maid service was good, and I ordered food to my room without any problems. It can be pricey to order room service but all the hotels are pricey when it comes to room service. The Hotel has two pools and an awsome gym that I used. The casino was fun as well the restaurants inside the hotel. I had breakfast there every morning and it was ok. The noodle Bar had an awsome Lo Mein dish that I enjoyed very much. f you don't mind leaving the hotel check out the other restaurants in the area. I know Puerto Rico well, especially the Condado area so I walked around and ate at various restaurants on Ashofrd Avenue during my visit.. There is a nice Cuban restaurant down the street and down by the Raddison Hotel there is a decent Puerto Rican Bar/Restaurant that had a band playing music. I did not rent a car this time so i took the bus into Old San Juan for the day. It;s well worth it for 75 cents. The bus stop is right out in front of the Hotel and I believe it is the number 21 bus to Old San Juan. It drops you off at the bus terminal and then you can walk up the hill to the various restaurants. stores and fort at the top. It can be very hot and humid so carry and drink plenty of water. You take the bus back to the hotel from the bus terminal. My only complaint was that I was unable to check into the hotel until 4pm. I arrived at 2pm and had to wait for a room to be available. I did see a number of people get checked in while I had to wait for a room that was prepaid for. Anyway, I checked my luggage and walked around the property, gambled, and had lunch before checking into the room at 4pm. The hotel was full with travelers and there was a political convention at the hotel while I was there. It was very enjoyable and not noisy outside in front of the hotel. If your looking for more than relaxation you should stay at the Marriott, La Cocha or Raddison Hotel at the other end of Ashford Avenue. Its quite busy during the evening with tourists walking up and down the street in that area as well as vehicle traffic.

Reviews.Title: “FANTASTIC TRIP, HOPE TO RETURN SOME DAY”
Reviews.Author: KathyBridgeview
Reviews.Content: Lodging was excellent. Concierge desk was very helpful. We took four trips and all of them were better than expected. The Condado Noodle Bar was our favorite place to eat in the area. Be sure to visit the two forts in Old San Juan.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it and we will definitely be back!!”
Reviews.Author: atsirk
Reviews.Content: It was one of my best friend's 25th birthday and i was having a difficult time planning it. I happen to live in Puerto Rico and just decided to walk into the Conrad and talk to the concierge to hopefully get some suggestions. They gave me so many ideas from adventure activities to relaxing and just indulging in paradise ideas. They were able to book and reserve for me also. I didnt have to do a thing! I was on a budget, so their last suggestion was to stay at the Conrad because the rooms were very reasonable (especially for the ambiance of the hotel), they had two pool areas, jacuzzis, snorkeling and kayaking the lagoon and so much more! So i did not hesitate to book the room. What a perfect 25th birthday gift! The service was amazing, the rooms were beautiful and the view from our room was amazing. Definitely will be back!

Reviews.Title: “This is not a 4 star, only a small 3 star!”
Reviews.Author: Sabrina5221
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Conrad for 6 nights. This just seems like an old hotel. Outside the covers had holes all through them so when it rained you had to find a spot that didn't drip on you. The carpets need to be replaced, they look like they're from the 70's. Our room door had issues with it shutting, something to do with the lock and handle, we had to always mess with it to make it shut completely. The rooms are a decent size but the bathroom is super tiny. Also, there's not a dresser to put your clothes in, there's a stand that the tv is on that you can put your clothes in but its not really a dresser. I do have to say, the beds were very comfortable and also all the pillows on the bed. The balcony is nice, we had a lagoon view which we thought was beautiful especially at night. We requested two rooms on the same floor but didn't get it, went down the next day to see if they had a couple of rooms on the same floor..nope. The manager came to us and said he'd let us know when one became available, he never did. The staff (other than check in) are all very nice. The house keepers are very very nice and do a good job. Although they said they were full, I had no idea where anyone was. It was very dead and boring. I suppose if you like to be alone, this place is for you. I tend to enjoy being around people. I found a huge dead cockroach at the top of the escalator which made me wonder about other areas. It's not a horrible hotel but, it's not a 4 star by any means, I was disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful - but lacking the usual Conrad level for Diamond Guests”
Reviews.Author: leebloome
Reviews.Content: As a Diamond Hhonors member, I was astounded that they would NOT give us complimentary breakfasts, in spite of my request directly to the manager. All they would give Diamond Hhonors members was "continental breakfast" - ie: toast, juice and coffee. Since they DO NOT have an executive lounge (every Conrad I've stayed at DOES) this refusal to accommodate breakfast was a disappointing surprise. However, Leah Rossi was extraordinarily helpful and accommodating. The property is beautiful, the accommodations were fine, and they did go out of their way to make sure I had an ashtray I could use on the balcony. SMOKERS - BE SURE YOU GET A ROOM WITH A BALCONY!!!!

Reviews.Title: “They stole my Kindle and didn't clean my room and acted like it was my fault!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: SMartin1985
Reviews.Content: The title of the review pretty much sums it up. We arrived at Condado Plaza on a Friday night. After checking in we went up to our room which was a King Superior Room with an Ocean View. The room was very large and spacious with an amazing view and bathroom. However, it took us about 20 minutes to get to the rooms because the elevators were horrid and moved soooooo slow. Had there been stairs, I would have walked up the 7 floors in a heart beat. Anyway, the rooms were nice, very plushly furnished with a great color scheme. The walls are very thin however. I know this because the screaming baby in the room next door was extremely audible and kept me up the first night. All day Saturday my BF and I walked around Old San Juan and did some shopping and eating. Tons of fun. We get back to the room after being gone approximately 8 hours and the room is not serviced. Nothing has been done. Not a single thing. Well, for what I was paying a night - I was not OK with the room being in the same condition as when we left that morning. So i called housekeeping and told them about it. The first words out of the woman's mouth were "Well did you leave the Do Not Disturb sign on the door?!" Uh no - wish I could have. We didn't even have a sign to leave on the door. After complaining to housekeeping they sent someone up with approximately 2 clean towels and some coffee creamer and that was it. I was not pleased but decided to brush it off and try to enjoy the rest of the trip. Everything was fine until I was getting ready to checkout and I realized that my Kindle (e-book reader) was missing as was a camera case for my video camera. I searched all through all of my checked luggage and through every square inch of the room and the items were no where to be found. When I reported this to security they asked if I was sure I checked everywhere and if I had ever taken the items out of the room (NO - don't you think I already thought of this). Finally, their "investigation" was they took down my statement and said they would call me if they find anything. I still havent heard a peep and when I call the hotel to talk to security I either get hung up on or they are "still investigating." I have been staying at Hilton hotels my entire life. This is not the type of treatment I would expect from such an establishment. I will definitely go back to Puerto Rico but will never stay at this hotel ever again.

Reviews.Title: “It was okay................”
Reviews.Author: BrooklynGirlDiva
Reviews.Content: Arriving to the hotel the doorman was pleasant. The lobby is nice. Very cool bar, lounge and nice view of the ocean. The staff was okay. They were not helpful when it came to vouchers. The housekeeping forgot to clean my room one day. The bathroom is very small. The bed is low but cute. The restaurants in the hotel was great. Expensive but the food was good. Bridge going to the other side of the hotel has the smell of musk and mildew. The area has a lot of vacant hotels and does not look like a desirable place to stay. The beach is a "glorified sandbox." It is so small and they have enough nerve to "charge $11" for an umbrella. The hotel is five minutes away from Old San Juan which is great. I like the fact if you walk down a couple of blocks there is a lot of restaurants. This is supposed to be a four star hotel. I would give it a two-half or three.

Reviews.Title: “Resort fee ripoff”
Reviews.Author: Marriott_Devotee
Reviews.Content: While I am "devoted" to the various Marriott brands, I have also been a regular guest of many Hilton (mostly Doubletree and Hampton Inn) properties. My other reviews indicate some great stays at Hilton brands. But would think twice before staying at this particular Hilton hotel. While the room and hotel were generally, very nice (with a few exceptions noted below), the bait-and-switch regarding what was included in their $42.50/nite "resort fee" (the pool, the casino!) make this a property to avoid or at least carefully consider. First, the room(s, plural as several folks from our company stayed here for a meeting): Beds are super comfy; shower is great; pool complex is impressive; and the restaurants deliver good value. Biggest negative was that the blackout curtain in my oceanside room didn't extend to floor, and with no daylight savings time, it gets light early. Also, the hallway was quite loud because I don't think the bottom of the doors meshed well with the carpet. Decor in lobbies is pretty sterile and dated, but there are many features that come with a full-service hotel. All this comes at a cost of course and the somewhat ubiquitous Resort Fee has become an underhanded revenue generator for a lot of hotels. At this property, like most Hilton's, room rates are highly variable based on room choice, discount code (e.g., AAA), date of booking, and whether one chooses one of their special packages. My big complaint, the reason for 3*'s (vs. 5), and the reason why I would never return is the underhanded and incredibly overpriced telephone charges for long distance on top of the resort fee (which includes free local calls and toll-free access from the rooms, and faxes from the business center). Shame on me, for not knowing, much less agreeing to pay $198 for 13 long-distance calls that lasted a total of 57 minutes, but this is 2011 when phone calls are LESS expensive than they were in 1980, right? Remember Puerto Rico is part of the United States, and while one might have to pay a $.69/min roaming charge or $.15/minute on a calling card, there is absolutely no justification for charging $9.60 for a one-minute phone call. We're in a major city not on a cruise ship . . . My bottom-line complaint is that these phone charges were not an effort by a hotel to recover costs, plus a fair profit, for a provided service -- this is a poorly communicated way to gouge their customers. I would suggest others stay clear. {Final disclosure -- after I communicated my disappointment to the hotel, they cut 25% off the phone charges. Resulting in a final charge of $149 for 13 separate phone calls that lasted a total of 57 minutes. Some deal, right?}

Reviews.Title: “Luxury Oceanfront in San Juan”
Reviews.Author: frenchy32034
Reviews.Content: A friend of ours had recommended this hotel and I found good reviews on TripAdvisor so we booked it for our trip and we absolutely agree with the positive recommendations. We took a room with a King on the oceanfront and were delighted with the view and the room. We had a wonderful view of the ocean and the adjacent beach and spent three of our mornings enjoying coffee on our balcony overlooking the shore. The room was decorated in modern chic and utilized space very nicely. The amenities in the room consisted of refrigerator, coffee maker which was also nice. We ate in one of their restaurants which was always open and found both the food and the service to be excellent. THe hotel is accessible to the, beach (right next to the hotel) , airport and to Old San Juan and there is a bus stop right outside the hotel. There was a tour desk that booked any tours we wanted to take with pickup right in the hotel lobby. The hotel staff was courteous and helpful. We did have a problem with some loud graduation celebrants on our floor and we waited for about an hour and when it didn't subside and we called down to the front desk, security was sent up immediately and the noise stopped. It

Reviews.Title: “Lovely”
Reviews.Author: BetsyHS
Reviews.Content: So I'm due in May 31-June 6th. I have visited the Conrad last summer & had an amazing time! The pool and grounds are magnificent ! Im just really worried about the horrible weather ruining my vacation =(

Reviews.Title: “Exquisite rooms, unbeleivable ocean views and incredible service.”
Reviews.Author: Ana_margui
Reviews.Content: Loved it! Great location very near to Old San Juan, beautiful oceanfront rooms and great staff.

Reviews.Title: “Just Perfect”
Reviews.Author: Nerak03
Reviews.Content: I stay at the Conrad for pleasure and have always enjoyed it very much; the salt-water pool is awesome, as well as the tropical fish in their ocean cove. The beach is not large but it is well kept and clean. The service around the hotel is very good and the people nice. Some restaurants can be pricey but very classy and good.

Reviews.Title: “If you are looking for a classey, comfortable, helpful, informative hotel, THIS IS NOT THE PLACE!”
Reviews.Author: melissa4017
Reviews.Content: First, to be fair, we had rain every day (7 days/6 nights) with the exception of 4 mornings we were able to get 2 hours of sun first thing (8-10am). The hotel and surrouding area needs A LOT OF WORK! They claim to be a 4 Â½ start resport, I would give it a 3 Â½ at best and Iâ€™m being VERY generous. THE HOTEL: Had a moldy smell in the carpeted areas, the walls had many wholes, and needs painting. The windows were dirty and looked as if the seals were broken causing a fog. The front desk is not helpful at all. They act like you are putting them out when asking questions. There is no orientation or hand outs of what to do, where to go, list of reccomeded restaurants, ectâ€¦Oh and there is not much of a beach, at all. CLEANING OF ROOMS: There was a MAJOR lack in consistancey. One day the rooms would be partially cleaned, the next they would forget our towels, the next they forgot the soaps. THE LOCATION: Ladies, I did not feel safe!!!! I did not wear ANY jewelry with the exception of two nights that we ate dinner at our Hotel (didnâ€™t have to leave the hotel) as well as not wanting to get dressed up to draw attention to myself because we were warned that it can be unsafe. You have a couple of fine shopping establishments such as Gucci, Luis Vitton and Mont Blonc and next door are abandonded, spray painted scarry hollowed out buildings, I mean scetchy, scarry looking. Also, we receved some references on a few places to walk to, to have lunch and dinner and we had to turn around half way as the location became very unsettleing and scary. THE POSITIVES: The restaurants on the property were EXCELLENT as well as most of the Puertorican food in general (however be prepaired to pay at the resort, but worth it)! Donâ€™t have to go through customs, quick and easy flight home. The rooms were a generous size, the bathroom too small. The pools seemed to be kept well and overall was a clean hotel. The hotel has a clean/decent gym. This is 100% truthful and I hope anyone considering San Juan or this hotel truly rethink it!Best of luck and safe travels!

Reviews.Title: “A great disappointment”
Reviews.Author: worldguypro
Reviews.Content: This hotel was the greatest disappointment I ever experienced. For claiming to be 4-star facility the hotel was not meeting my expectations at all. The first impression was a very crowded and noisy dark Lobby. Also the location at a busy street was not what I expected. I booked a "city view room" which turned out to be a room facing towards the second hotel building on the other side of the street. As I entered the room it was so filled with street noise that I thought the windows were open which they weren't. Two walls were painted in a terrible "loud" red color which to me made a "cheap" impression. Due to the extreme street noise I inquired to get another room to the ocean side. This room was somewhat more quiet but due to the thin window glas the sound of the huge waves crashing at the rocks together with a continuous sound of some kind of ventilation fans created a constant rather loud noise even with closed windows.
