The next surprise was the bed sheet wich was stained be blood or something else. It took housekeeping 1,5 hours to change the sheets. The walls are very thin so I could hear everything my neighbours are doing and from the early morning hours on I stood upright in my bed everytime a door slammed somewhere on the floor. All in all I can say that this hotel is not worthy to call itself a 4-star-hotel at all. I have seen hundreds of hotels in the world but not managed to disappoint me like the Conrad San Juan Condado Plaza

Reviews.Title: “Love it”
Reviews.Author: Lilalen213
Reviews.Content: My husband my son and I . Stay here for 15 days and we love this hotel very chic live the little beach the pool was perfect all the people who works there are so nice they have like 3 door man they work there almost every those guy know how to feel u welcoming so let me tell u the we dint eat at the hotel cuse we think is a lilttle over price for food plus they dint have the much if puertorrican food at the hotel we did eat Ropa Vieja is down the block or we went down to the old San Juan the drinks at the pool they r way to over price too . Think the I notice is they have like little stages on the Lobby I really dint know why cuse only one of the bar was open I never saw any type of movement but it was really nice we have the city view room but we dint see much cuse all u see is the other side of the hotel but when we go back I would stay there again love the place <3

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but WATCH your credit card statement”
Reviews.Author: ajg78
Reviews.Content: Several days after checking out, they charged $90 to my credit card statement. I called twice to find out what the charge was for and they just put me into someone's voicemail (who never returned my calls). I then e-mailed the hotel and the parent company, Hilton, asking for an explanation. No response. I disputed the charge with the credit card company (Bank of America) and they said they could not contact the hotel so we would have to cancel our card and have a new one reissued. I finally called Hilton customer service and they transferred me to the hotel and I was told that apparently a radio was missing from the room and they charged me $90 for it. I quickly explained that this clearly was wrong as I don't even remember seeing a radio, let alone me actually taking it if there was one. To his credit, he was very nice and said he would check with the manager and call me back in a few minutes. A day and a half later and no response. Seems like some sort of scam that preys on people who get off of cruise ships or use Priceline's Name Your Own Price, both of which are what we did. We really were looking forward to going back to Puerto Rico and staying at this hotel....but now, I'd say no thanks.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel & location, pricey dining facilities”
Reviews.Author: lurita_161
Reviews.Content: Really major complaints. Great room and lagoon view. Was on the 10th floor. Hotel was beautiful..small casino...small beach. Didn't find a lot of food options for vegetarian/ vegan...ate at the chinese food place one night..but paid $12 just for 1 plate of vegetable fried rice. Ate mainly in town..lots of options..found a vegan cafe on last day.. Cafe Mam - it was great!! and we spotted a vegetarian cafe about 3 blocks before turning in to that one by accident...trying to turn around and go back to the other one. Would highly recommend Cafe Mam for Vegans/Vegetarians. Upon checkout...had to pay additional "hotel fees" of around $16 a night..plus pay about $17 a day for parking. ..we had a rental car. Which I highly recommend for the area.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect spot for a stay in San Juan”
Reviews.Author: vacationgirlboston
Reviews.Content: We just got home from our stay here and were overall very pleased. A friend of ours recommended we stay either here at the Conrad or at La Cocha. After researching both, the Conrad was more reasonably priced so we thought we'd check it out. First, the location was ideal for us. It's located in popular Condado on Ashford Ave. It's very walkable to restaurants and shopping without taking a taxi which is nice. It's also a very short cab ride to Old San Juan, since it's at the end of Ashford you don't have to sit in traffic in a cab getting to the bridge to get into Old San Juan. It was around $14 via cab to get anywhere in the old city. The Condado beach is right on the property. It's not huge but does the trip, especially considering the location and that you're right in the city. They have a great reef right there and we saw all sorts of fish..very cool. There are chairs, towels and umbrellas for hotel guests to use. The property itself is great. Very clean, modern and fresh. The views are gorgeous with the waves crashing against the rambling rock walls that surround the waterfront of the hotel. The grounds are well manicured with seating at the pool, beach, along the rock walls, and the expansive porch...all alongside the ocean. They even had a few hammocks up that we could relax in for a bit. They have pool side service which we found very nice. They have rentals for beach activities right on-site if you're interested. Our room was great. We had a deluxe ocean room....and the view did not disappoint. Often times "ocean view" rooms are a standard hotel room with a balcony. I loved that the bed actually faced the glass wall/deck. You actually laid in bed and saw all ocean....that's what i'm talking about! The bed was very comfortable and the bathroom was very cool as well......marble top vanity, rimless shower, great toiletries, coffee maker, and fridge. Not sure if our floor was empty or if we got lucky but it was very quiet too. For a hotel with a casino in it we had a lot of privacy. The staff were all very friendly and attentive. They open doors, answer questions and were very helpful. I'd recommend this hotel for those looking for a quiet getaway in the city OR those looking for a wilder trip. It really did offer everything we were looking for. FYI- there's a starbucks right outside if the hotel food is too pricey for you. I think the starbucks actually lets you charge to your hotel room too. Lots of reasonably priced restaurants nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, hip hotel”
Reviews.Author: FordTraveller
Reviews.Content: Very hip and beautiful hotel. I stayed here for a weekend getaway to get some sun and relaxation. This Conrad does not have a large beach area, but does have a beach. Stayed here during the Good Friday./Easter Weekend (casino was closed - govt law maybe? Good to know before you go to PR for this holiday weekend). Rooms are fab-I got an ocean view which was simply stunning. I stayed by the poolside and laid on a hammock for the most part. Limited hammocks but they are location on the ocean front. Quite a few pools. The restaurant and main floors have very modern/beautiful decor (very W hotel like). Very cool looking. The hotel staff is very nice, especially the concierge who is extremely helpful. Make sure that you go for the night kayak when you are in PR!

Reviews.Title: “The people I travel with make the vacation fun.”
Reviews.Author: HeySue
Reviews.Content: One room wasn't available until 8:00PM. Felix Trainee was too cute to be crabby at....but we had been up since 4:00AM the day of arrival so our patience had been tested. Dining service at the pool bar was sporadic. Breakfast in the hotel was very good and enjoyed the waitstaff. The poolside vendor(s) were a great "deal" and we bought some wonderful jewelry.

Reviews.Title: “Nice idea but poor management”
Reviews.Author: caviarandchips25
Reviews.Content: I came here for a conference and was expecting a really nice hotel. Instead when I arrived at my hotel room, I found urine on my seat, the fridge door wouldn't close and the bars on the neon clock didn't all light up so you never knew what time it was. I told the manager the next day and the clock and fridge were fixed. The first morning, the shower was AMAZING. It was really high pressure. The second morning, there was a drip. The third morning it was full on blast again and it sprayed the entire bathroom. I don't think I would stay here again. It's not worth the money. The lobby is nice but somewhat run down. not a great deal.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!! Can't wait to go back!”
Reviews.Author: Funcheyne
Reviews.Content: The lobby was a bit crazy with all the neon and lights, but it added to the whole "new and on vaca experience". The room was comfortable and the city view (lagoon view) was amazing. The hotel is centrally located. The bus to Old San Juan stops just outside, and it is easy to walk to the shops and restaurants down the beach. Though the parking is expensive if you get a rental. Overall an awesome place to stay for a tropical vacation!

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay here! Do not have your corporate event here!”
Reviews.Author: Harold9000
Reviews.Content: The rooms were nice and clean, but everything else suffers. Rooms facing the front of the hotel were very loud, street noise, etc. I could hear everything that happened in the hallways, slamming doors, loud conversations by the cleaning staff and guests. The food was Ok at best, breakfast in the mezzanine level cafe was decent. It took almost two hours to get lunch by the pool one day at Agua Bar. Biggest complaint is the accounting; phantom charges to our rooms, the two hour lunch that was to be paid by a group voucher also charged to the room. Mass confusion by the front desk in explaining and clearing these matters. More errant charges to my credit card after returning home and a complete unwillingness by the management to help us. Worst ever! Oh, did I mention the location sucks too, no beach except a public park (over run by locals on the weekend)

Reviews.Title: “It was much better than we expected.”
Reviews.Author: Millie005
Reviews.Content: We got the ocean view we paid for and it was breath taking. We wanted to see the ocean when we woke up and we did. This trip was far better than our last years' trip to Atlantis, Paradise Island. However, next time we will stay at the Double Tree where the suites have both a fridge and a microwave.

Reviews.Title: “Didn't meet expectations of a 4 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: USAEastCoastGal
Reviews.Content: I booked a hotel for a Tuesday-Saturday stay (as a single girl, with another single girl, for a last minute warm weather getaway) and spent several hours scouring the San Juan area options. We settled on the Conrad because it seemed to be a great location with all of the resort amenities we'd want, wrapped in a beautiful 4 star hotel. The result: we didn't hate it... but we were disapointed and didn't feel that it totally lived up to the pictures or measured up to a 4 star status. Cons: -The beach isn't good. It's small, public and faces a sheltered little body of water between the open sea and the lagoon... and also looks out on an unattractive causeway that leads to Old San Juan. To sit on a real beach with real Atlantic surf, we had to walk down to La Concha hotel a few blocks down on the Condado strip (a great beach, btw, that you can get chairs and umbrellas at and get waited on). -The weekday service at the pools was lacking... no one came around to take drink or food orders and when we went to the bar/grill in the pool area to order up some grub it took a long time to get delivered to our chairs and was cold/melted (and super overpriced, of course). The main pool with the bar was dirty. It was just kind of a ghost town. This all improved over the weekend... but it shouldn't take a Saturday to make the hotel present itself better. -Yes, it was "recently rennovated"... but there's still a very very worn look to a large chunk of the hotel. Not exactly the cleanest and crispest. Worn rugs, walls in need of paint, outdated and/or worn furniture. -Our bedroom and bathroom were SO dark when the sun wasn't out! Not enough lighting at all. And the shower, toilet, sink, closet are in one contained space off of the main room... not ideal for a room that's not being shared by a couple. Pros: -the beds were very comfy and the rooms were modern and clean -all of the rooms have balconies and even if you go for a cheaper lagoon facing room vs. an ocean view room (as we did), it's a nice scene to take in -Being on the Condado strip is ideal... as earlier stated, I just think it's better to be farther down the street, on a real beach and not right next to the causeway. -it covered the basics well enough and was still in a really beautiful spot... just not what we wanted from a $300 a night 4 star joint

Reviews.Title: “Find somewhere else to stay”
Reviews.Author: Chi_jcw
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Conrad prior to boarding out ship for a seven night cruise. My wife and I got married at a Conrad hotel in Chicago, so we expected this resort to live up to those standards. Boy were we wrong. The only good thing I can say about this place is that the concierge gave us a great recommendation. Other than that the food at the hotel is expensive and takes forever, the room wasn't cleaned until late in the afternoon when we wanted to take naps, the bell hops were rude, as were the front desk workers when we tried to get a late checkout. I do not have another recommendation for places to stay, but do not waste your money on the Conrad here in San Juan.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific customer service from the Manager made an impression!”
Reviews.Author: gibbersome
Reviews.Content: We had an initial problem with the room we were first placed in. The internet would not work in the room (though it worked fine in the hallway), so they gave us a different room. To my surprise the manager called the next morning, apologizing us for the inconvenience. She was disappointed that we weren't given a choice of an upgrade when he had to move our things and offered us dining coupons. Then the IT manager at the hotel called us to make sure that the internet in the new room was working fine. This is the kind of service you rarely receive even at 4 or 5-star hotels and we were extremely pleased with our experience. The manager at the Conrad is terrific and really cares about the comfort and happiness of the visitors. Other than that, we really liked our room. The beds are very comfortable and like the reading light right next to each bed. The TV is a little small, but fits well with the decor of the rooms. Our room had a large balcony and a nice view of the lagoon. Though the ocean view rooms are better, I was not disappointed. The bathroom is large and spacious, but there is no lock on the sliding doors. The shower head had ample pressure and the toiletries were from CLEAR by Jean-Jacques. There is a fridge in the bathroom as well as a coffee maker and a closet with lots of space. The internet in the room is free and fast (600 KB/sec and I mean Kilobytes, not Kilobits). The hotel has two pools and a beach protected by a rock wall. Great place to swim and hangout, both for parents and kids. The view over the ocean is also gorgeous. The casino is large (by Puerto Rico hotel standards) and modern. The location is perfect with only a 5-minute drive to Old San Juan. Some negatives... The business center is a bit of a rip-off. Also, self-parking is a bit of a pain. The ticket that you receive when you enter the parking lot has to be validated at the valet desk EVERY time. I hope they institute a better parking system, but this inconvenience was not enough to take away from the overall very positive experience.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing view of the ocean”
Reviews.Author: Kimberlee8211
Reviews.Content: I traveled with my husband and two small children. He was on business but the kids and I were here for fun:) A great hotel, lots of restaurants inside and a Starbucks right in front. Three pools, including a saltwater pool. A very small kiddie pool, but has a fountain spraying in which my son loved. If you're lucky enough to get an ocean view room, it's amazing. The beach for the hotel it to the side, so the views of the ocean are so close. And the sound of the waves crashing is very loud since it hits the rocks. Staff was very friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “THE BEST”
Reviews.Author: Naomita17
Reviews.Content: I absolutely love staying at the Conrad. For the second time this month I stayed here for the weekend. Its a beautiful hotel with comfortable rooms and great location. The staff is very professional, friendly and helpful. I highly recommend the Conrad Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A beautiful hotel and a great value”
Reviews.Author: taev314
Reviews.Content: The first thing I noticed about this hotel was how nicely decorated the lobby and other public areas were. There are interesting chairs, art pieces, aquariums, light fixtures or other decorative elements everywhere. The decor gives the hotel a different, non-cookie cutter vibe that almost makes you forget how large it is. The hotel is really two building across the street from each other, connected by a breezeway. In general the place seemed to be clean and well-maintained; I didnâ€™t experience the elevator issues mentioned by other reviewers. Our room was in the lagoon view building. Overall the room was fine. It was large and clean and the AC, fridge, TV, etc all were in good working order. The bed was comfortable and the linens were good quality. The bathroom door had a frosted glass panel that was easy to see through and didnâ€™t provide much privacy. There was also a nice sized balcony with chairs and a table overlooking the lagoon and the roof of the hotel facilities below. The only thing about the room that I didnâ€™t like was the tile floor; it was cold and seemed to make it a little loud, but definitely cleaner alternative than carpet. The grounds of the hotel were beautiful! There were lots of places to explore and we discovered a new area of the property every day. There are nicely furnished porches and patios all over. Thereâ€™s a lawn overlooking the ocean with hammocks to relax in. The large pool has a swim-up bar and a waterslide with â€œbeachâ€� access just a few steps away. There is also a hot-tub and another pool in this area. All of this is on the â€œbeachâ€� side of the hotel. The lagoon side also had a small pool. A great thing about this hotel was that it has a casino. A real casino, not the kind of casino you might find at a hotel in the Dominican Republic. The sushi bar/Chinese restaurant just outside of the casino had great food and was open very late (until 3 or 4am). Now let me just say this: THIS HOTEL DOES NOT HAVE A REAL BEACH! The hotel is located at the end of the strip of stores, restaurants and hotels in Condado. The property is on the ocean it just doesnâ€™t have a typical beachfront. There are mostly walled off areas that prevent you from going onto the rocks where the property meets the ocean. The sandy area on the property is very, very small and crowded and not really on the ocean (no waves). Itâ€™s worth a walkthrough I guess. The real beach is just a five minute walk from the hotel and it is beautiful! Overall this hotel is a great value, the beauty of the public areas, cleanliness of the room, the price compared to other hotels in Condado combine to make this place a good value. You should go!

Reviews.Title: “Best vacation ever”
Reviews.Author: tmoo6
Reviews.Content: This hotel was situated in the best Location the bus stop right near hotel for 75cents you can take the bus to old San Juan. The vibe and look of this hotel was great . Pool scene and beach excellent. It was a nice area to walk around and find other local places to eat. The hotel the food is very expensive I did eat at the noodle bar it was good. My room was very well kept . I love the bath soaps I ate the best hamburger right beside the beach for $3.50 with a water the Conrad was like over $12 for a hamburger. I did a few tours through the hotel. I would stay in the Conrad again. I think this location was easier than the Caribe Hilton.

Reviews.Title: “Bedbugs”
Reviews.Author: Fyrcanine
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for two nights prior to a cruise. As we were exploring in our rental car after the first night, she noticed a bite mark on her lower leg. We weren't sure what it was but found out that night. We were lying in bed watching TV about 10:00 PM when she spotted a tiny bug scurrying across the sheet. She squashed it with a tissue and proceeded to find six more. The front desk was not answering the phone so she went down to contact them directly. They stated that they would sent the manager of housekeeping right up. 45 minutes later we called housekeeping when no one had showed up yet. A couple of workers, (no signs of management), arrived and were very sympathetic. They removed everything from the bed and cleaned and disinfected it. The next morning we talked to the manager who said he would look into it but offered no apologies or remittance. With fees and taxes, we paid close to $500 for two nights trying to avoid problems like this from lower rated hotels. We will definitely not be returning to this facility.

Reviews.Title: “A good experience, despite booking problems”
Reviews.Author: RobfromKensington
Reviews.Content: We arrived at 10.30pm (after a very long day of travel from the UK) for a one-night stay mid-March before setting out on a cruise the next day. It seems that there was a communication problem between out (UK) travel agent and the hotel, and they had no record of the booking. Nevertheless, the night manager accommodated us in one of the better (sea-front) rooms and we had a very pleasant night and morning. After I had shown the day manager my documentation the issue was sorted by the management (by emails to and from the UK) by early afternoon and we set off for our ship very happily, thanks to the professional and very pleasant way in which the issue was handled. Thank you! P.S. I used to stay at this hotel (on business) about 10 years ago. It was then a bit sleazey (the bar by the casino) but now seems very different and a lot smarter. The garden and pools (which I didn't even know were there when travelling on business!) look really good, but we did not have the time to enjoy them Don't forget to go for the sea front rooms!

Reviews.Title: “Beachside resort with plenty of amenities”
Reviews.Author: NorthEndBos
Reviews.Content: Spent 5 nights at the Conrad on a pleasure trip with partner and friends. The hotel had everything you could want in a vacation spot....3 pools, beach, casino, several restaurants, and bars. There were also plenty of activities for the kids (we don't have any but for those families it's worth mentioning). Overall our experience was very nice. The hotel strives for a modern vibe but there are still some areas that could use better upgrade and/or more polish. The rooms were modern and a good size (we had Lagoon rooms) with the bathroom on the small size. The toiletries provided were nice but the best feature of the bath is the water pressure from the shower head (amazing after a day at the pool and/or beach). The location of the hotel was great for walking through Condado and the lagoon provided a nice slowdown of the strong currents coming off the Altantic. The staff was extremely pleasant and always acknowled you. Dinner at Pigayo was very good (albeit maybe a bit expensive for what you get)--service was impeccable. The only downside overall was the bar staff at Acqua poolside. The waitstaff working the pool area was great but if you went directly to the bar, you were often ignored. Overall I would recommend this hotel. Be sure to check out El Yunque rainforest and Old San Juan for shopping and dinner.

Reviews.Title: “Not a resort, but a nice stay.”
Reviews.Author: rlbrown77
Reviews.Content: We made our first visit to the Caribbean with our two and a half year old son for a spring break get away. We are frequent beach travelers, mostly to the SW Florida coast, but wanted something new this year. We were excited about staying at a Conrad and the value of the "family suite" which was offered. We were excited about the pools and beach and looked forward to a great urban resort vacation. While we were pleased with our choice to chose Puerto Rico for seven nights, we probably wouldn't chose the Conrad again so long as we were traveling with our son. The family suite is really just a glorified Embassy Suites room, with the twin beds in place of the living quarters at an Embassy Suites. The galley kitchen was workable, but had no sink, so you were constantly running into the bathroom while using the kitchen. The bathroom did not have a bath tub. Kind of a big deal for a two and half year old who has never had to shower at bath time. There were was no way to dry our swim suits like in most beach resorts. The family suite is also located in the Lagoon Tower and has a city view. If you've never been to PR, you'll quickly learn that drivers really like their horns. A city view, which is set back only a few feet from a busy city street is therefore quite loud at all times of day with horns and car noise. Casino is small (and the craps table was very quiet on Saturday night). On the positive side: The main pool is great. Our son loved it. He enjoyed the water slide and the fountains. They had two other pools (a salt water pool and a small pool on the Lagoon side) which we didn't use. Towel Service is great, but they are serious about returning towels (they tried to charge us for towels we allegedly didn't return on the first day). The small beach area is small, but provides a great area for a small child to wade in the water without the crashing waves. The ocean floor is very course with shells/rocks, but our son enjoyed it nonetheless. We had a small problem with housekeeping wanting to clean our room during our son's nap time on the first day. We communicated the problem to housekeeping and they were AWESOME the rest of the trip. We had a good meal in the Cafe Caribee the first night. Workout facility was awesome, well cared for and pretty well used, without being crowded. We used every day. Free WiFi was reliable and very strong signal. Valet (though a little pricey) was always punctual and friendly. My wife's major comment was that compared to other "family" resorts, our stay made us feel like we had to do a lot of work to make the stay work for us. Better for business travelers or adult travelers than those with kids.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: big0315
Reviews.Content: This was a great place to stay. We only stayed one night after a cruise and I wish I could have stayed longer. Its right on a busy street with many places to eat and there is some nice places inside the hotel to eat ( and a casino). We had a ocean view room and it was great to hear the waves at night. It is a 20 dollar ride from the airport one way and the bell hops will call a taxi and they will hold your luggage at check in or check out if you have some site seeing to do.

Reviews.Title: “With a little effort it could be an excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: jbrophy
Reviews.Content: Outside of your room and the dining, this hotel is outstanding. The room is poorly maintained for this level of hotel - dirty room, stupid flooring, marred surfaces, and really awful lightening. The floor is ceramic tile throughout the room. We slipped several times after shower or returning in our swimsuits. There is a huge florescent light between the beds that limits your ability to watch TV with it on. When we first arrived the room was very dirty - hair everywhere, hygiene product spills in the bathroom, and one wall has drips of a spilled beverage running down the wall. All food at this hotel is over priced. We got $15 coupons for breakfast at the Cafe Caribe which made it reasonable. The Varita, Steak Tavern recommends men wear slacks - there is no reason to do that and most people were in shorts. The food was flavorless and the waiter was stuck up. Also very expensive for what you get - two adults and a child was $134 and we ate light, The staff, atmosphere, and location are very good. Aqua pool area is very nice - that food is pricey. Waitresses all wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice. Beautiful Ocean Views.”
Reviews.Author: ChitownFoodie
Reviews.Content: We spent five nights at the Conrad and woke up to wonderful ocean views... didn't even have to get out of bed. Our connecting rooms in the oceanside building were large, clean and comfortable for our party of five. The bathrooms were spacious, well stocked and CLEAN. However, the sliding doors do allow for a slight breach of privacy. Breakfast at the Cafe Caribe was delish and there is a fantastic view. Skip the poolside Aqua Bar and Grill for food though. The pools were clean and not overly crowded. We never had problems finding five chaises together. You'll need to go elsewhere for the sprawling white sand beach with turquoise blue water. The beach is small and right off a major thoroughfare but it is protected and clean. The casino is small but there are enough tables and slots for an exciting evening. The hotel is within walking distance to several restaurants and souvenier shops and a liquor and convenience store. It is a short drive to Old San Juan.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel and convenient location.”
Reviews.Author: asu_eyecandy
Reviews.Content: The Conrad was very nice and beautiful. My boyfriend and I stayed 3 nights. We didn't win anything at the casino on the slots although some people were winning at the tables. The food at Cafe Caribe was great although sometimes you have to wait in line (of course you would, everyone loves the ocean view and food). We ate there every morning for breakfast but ate at the local restaurants down the strip for lunch and dinner. Yes there are a couple of abandoned buildings along the strip near the hotel but it isn't the Conrad's fault, how can you fault them for that? Concierge was helpful and our room was clean. Housekeeping kept our towels and toiletries stocked and bed made. Check in didn't take long. I'm not sure why some people experienced check-in problems, maybe because they booked through other agents i.e. orbits, hotels.com, hotwire. I booked directly through condadoplaza.com and received a good vacation package (the same as or maybe a little cheaper than the other sites). I had a lagoon view room in which the lagoon view was beautiful and the lagoon tower was very quiet. The bathrooms are tight (contemporary and nice but small) and the bathroom doors slide open and closed, and the bathrooms have stand in showers which is very practical and you can hear the "business" of anyone who is in the bathroom which shouldn't be a problem if you are with your significant other. We walked the strip a lot to eat at the local restaurants which are very good and cheaper than the hotel restaurants. We walked down to Cartier, Gucci, car rental (because the hotel rental cars were booked), souvenier shops, local restaurants, etc. We felt safe in the area and I even walked down the strip and back to a souvenier shop alone our last morning there and I had no problems. A bus stop is directly in front of the hotel. For 75 cents you can take the bus to Old San Juan and walk around and do whatever you please instead of paying $50 plus for the tour. We visited El Yunque rainforest, Bacardi, and Old San Juan. We didn't get a chance to visit Plaza las Americas and the hotel beach. We rented a car to go to the rainforest 45 minutes away and it was beautiful. If you are a scary or slow driver please do not drive! The locals drive very fast and aggressive. Almost every car we saw had a dent in it except for luxury cars. Keep in mind that all of Puerto Rico doesn't look like a resort, you cannot expect it to. We had no problem with anyone on the whole island speaking and understanding English (we had to stop at Rite Aid after leaving the rainforest-a long way away from the resort areas). My boyfriend even got mistaken for being Puerto Rican a couple of times and a couple of people came up to him speaking Spanish until they noticed that he and I were black and they effortlessly switched over to English. We wish we could have stayed longer because we didn't get to do all the things we wanted to do in Puerto Rico. All in all we had a wonderful trip and felt welcome everywhere we went. We had no problem with our room or room charges at check-out. We are planning another trip to this hotel for Memorial Day weekend 2011 with some of our friends and hopefully we will not experience any problems that others complained of. People if you visit a place please show respect and be courteous and not expect for the workers to kiss your butt. Yes you should expect good service but you are doing yourself a disadvantage by starting off being rude and "uppity" :)

Reviews.Title: “perfect everything”
Reviews.Author: jenesis105
Reviews.Content: We travel for pleasure on average 8-10 times a year which includes San Juan (my birthday, family cruise, long weekends) & we only stay at The Conrad. Its a 5 minute cab ride (14.00) to Old San Juan, a decent breakfast @ Cafe Caribe, Starbucks downstairs, lovely pool and clean grounds, convenient to restaurants, Walgreens, liquor store across the street and The LaConcha Hotel 2 blocks from Conrad (hip, sexy, great vibe at their lobby bar and pool area). Pikayo restaurant is an ABSOLUTE MUST for foodies as well as Marmalade (Beautiful room, wonderful knowlgable waitstaff) We had the 4 course Chef's Tasting which was truly entertaining and imaginative. We're still talking about the white bean soup served in a demitasse cup and the Chef came out several times to inquire about our meal and share some "culinary secrets" with us.The St. Germaine on the corner of Calle De La Cruz is a wonderful respite from the heat and crowds in Old San Juan (their fresh Ginger Margarita is delicious and their rum cake with butter cream amaretto icing is "to die for"!!) and it has a very friendly, funky euro feel. Too bad we didn't have enough time to go back for dinner (next visit definitely) The weather was gorgeous every day (despite Weather channel's predictions). I agree about the small "beach" area and the traffic on the bridge yada yada, however, there' s good snorkeling and warm water off that beach and it has a genuine cultural/local vibe. There's a guy with a Bar-b-que set up offering sausage, hamburgers and chicken shish kabob for sale and the "Icee Man" walking around, ringing his bell selling shaved ice with cherry, lemon or lime syrup. Great stuff! Bottom line on food: MUST GO to (1) Jose Enrique in Santurce. Amazing experience! Their signature dish, Deep Fried Whole snapper is something you will never forget. The presentation alone will put a big smile on your face, coupled with the Chocolate Trio for dessert will make the trip to this neighborhood fantastic eatery well worth the cab ride. Go on a Thursday or Friday night and enjoy the outdoor "party" around the Plaza del Mercado (2) Pikayo (3) Ropa Vieja -order the beef w vegetable soup, shrimp w garlic sauce (you'll need xtra bread :) Martini was a good deal at 10.00 and the Entree portions are enough to share

Reviews.Title: “My Favorite Hotel”
Reviews.Author: hobiecatsailor
Reviews.Content: Last week I stayed at the Conrad San Juan for the 5th time. I love the hotel and its intimate feel. The modern decor is beautiful and the rooms are very clean and nicely decorated with very large windows. I have spent many days and nights here since Nov. 2009 with my most recent stay March 2011. The staff is always friendly and consistent. The hotel in general has very consistent service from the valet to the concierge I have never been disappointed. I always stay in the Ocean Tower and have been lucky enough to stay in room 943 on each visit. It is a corner room with excellent views and a balcony. The bed is very comfortable and I also LOVE the bathroom. I am now staying at the El San Juan Hotel and Casino and I do not like it even half as much as the Conrad.

Reviews.Title: “Dream Vacation”
Reviews.Author: shannasparadise
Reviews.Content: My friends and I had the most amazing experience in San Juan this Spring Break (2011). Beginning from the moment we walked into the Conrad San Juan Condado Plaza, the staff was friendly, helpful, and accommodating the entire trip. Since we had little time to plan before our vacation, we relied on the concierge to direct us in the right direction. Marisol, who works as a concierge, went over and beyond by researching flights and options for a way to get us to the nearby island of Culebra (which I recommend you plan before your trip). She made herself available after hours and even provided me with her personal number just in case I had questions. This meant a lot to me since this was our first time in Puerto Rico. Needless to say, (with the help from the others like Christina and Emmanuel) our week schedule was full from the time we woke up till the time we were ready to sleep in our roomsâ€™ comfy beds. The rooms were modernly decorated with bright orange and red, the bathrooms spacious, strong water pressure, and included all the little extras we needed (iron, blow dryer, etc). Thanks to the staff, we made time for some of the best tours (ex. El Yunque, Snorkeling, Bacardi) the island had to offer as well as eat at some of Puerto Ricoâ€™s most popular restaurants (ex. Raices & Ropa Vieja) for dinner. Since the package we purchased from the hotel included delicious breakfast with a beautiful view at CafÃ© Caribe, we didnâ€™t have to worry about leaving the hotel and then returning to try and make our tour departures. On our last day we finally had an opportunity to relax at our hotel, well besides the tasty passion fruit drinks we enjoyed at Aqua Bar prior to our evenings out every night and the short time we spent at the somewhat disappointing smaller than expected casino (tried not to compare it to Las Vegas). What were we thinking waiting so long? We had a great time by the pool and jacuzzi, Caesar made sure we had everything we needed, and Michael from security helped us complete our experience in San Juan by sharing the history, places we still needed to see, and where we needed to go on our last night on the island. After following his advice, I think we need to come back and soon. We were so tempted to miss our flight but came to our senses and decided to plan another trip for later this year instead. Thank you Conrad San Juan!

Reviews.Title: “Great Resort with a but and value proposition”
Reviews.Author: SWS4PSU___1
Reviews.Content: The Conrad is situated in Condando section of San Juan. It is very easy to get to Old San Juan, which is fantastic. The hotel grounds are very pretty, but tight. The lobby area is trying to be trendy and perfect to hangout and jump on the laptop with the free wifi. The pool on the ocean side was bustling and a bit busy for my taste, however, for that quiet retreat the lagoon pool was just perfect. The only downside to the lagoon bar is that the bar was not open and there was no wait staff. The ocean side pools were serviced by the Aqua Bar and our bartender Dave kept the drinks coming...just be careful he will keep giving them to you and then a BIG BILL...but he was great!! Our room was well appointed if not a little small. We looked out onto the part of the lagoon that extends past the bridge...more on that in a sec...but was very beautiful. The bathroom was basically for one person only unless the other was in the shower, but it was done well. OK now for the but...the beach is really small and sits on the lagoon...this is perfect if you have kids and dont want to worry too much about the waves as they are minimal, however the beach looks out with a noisy bridge on your left(very close) and the Hilton Carribe on the other and the ocean to your right. If a beach vacation is what you seek, look elsewhere. This is not the resort for just the sound of the ocean, the sand between your toes, and the wind in your hair. Not that you dont get that but you also get the honking taxi steps away and the smell of the cars sitting in traffic on the bridge. All in all the hotel is beautiful and I'm fully enjoying my stay. I will update with some pictures. Also, because its the Conrad they think they can charge more, but not up to par with some other up-scale places.

Reviews.Title: “It was a flawless beautiful stay!”
Reviews.Author: WittyKitty73
Reviews.Content: First off, it would not have been difficult to impress my friend and I because I were staying here at a friends and family rate of $109 per night so we were not expecting much... But was AMAZING! I loved the design of the hallways and rooms...so clean, new, modern, and comfortable (with striking colors - must have been designed by a gay man - we LOVED IT!!! I would only stay with an OCEAN VIEW its is glorious...we woke up early and ordered room service (yummy pancakes) and watch the sun rise... The pool is open 24 hours...WHAT?...so cool! so we took a swim at night alone and enjoyed it emmensely. During the day there are giant black hammocks out....i took a 3 hour nap there...AMAZING. The pools and out door hot tub are wonderful (there is one saltwater and one freshwater pool and they were NOT over crowded...and we fully expected them to me. I got a massage on the beach two days in a row, it was refreshing and calming to say the least. There were a lot of people on the beach....but because we had spent 2 weeks in PR and saw many other beachs (Flaminco on Culebra was the best) we were not married to being on the beach...if you are, I would go off the hotel site. The location is prime...very close to the airport and VERY close to Old San Juan (Must see El Morro - its AWESOME) and we went salsa dancing and shopping in old san juan...there were several place at night to hear live music...we loved it! Even if we had to pay $400 a night forn an ocean view in this hotel - it would have been worth it...the staff is friendly and the place is lovely. We also enjoyed hard icecream and sushi up stairs by the casino. Have fun and enjoy! We did!!!

Reviews.Title: “Conrad is in a beautiful location and the staff was really, really nice”
Reviews.Author: KatherineV_11
Reviews.Content: My husband and two twenty-something daughters just spent 4 nights at the Conrad in San Juan. I've never written an online review before, but I wanted to say something about this hotel because the staff was so helpful. The restaurant recommendations were great (especially to Ropa Vieja (spelling?)) for delicious Puerto Rican food down the road, the concierge sorted out a complicated problem with an excursion reservation, and everyone else, even the young guy who staffed the boathouse, was friendly, happy to suggest things to do in Puerto Rico, etc. Also the pools and the overall location are gorgeous. My family snorkeled at the beach right at the hotel and reported that it was great. We are already talking about going back.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, quiet location, but a great staff!”
Reviews.Author: ndkt323
Reviews.Content: I was a solo 30-something female traveler in San Juan for my first time. Priceline.com placed me at Conrad Condado ... after reading others' reviews I was a little nervous about my placement, but I was pleasantly surprised upon arrival. Although I did not receive an ocean-front room, my room was quite nice and the bed was very comfortable. Since it's a small-ish hotel, the pool area isn't terribly busy and you don't have to fight for prime sunning chairs. The pool waitstaff, especially bartender David (who makes the MOST OUTSTANDING drink - you'll have to ask him for the specifics), were the best I've encountered on any trip. The inside barstaff were great too. The only issues I had with the hotel is that it's not very close to any other nightlife and the food was expensive but not good at all. However, I received a few good recommendations for nearby restaurants so I wasn't totally disappointed. All in all, it was a good, safe choice for a single female traveler. My excursions outside the hotel definitely enhanced my visit to San Juan and will make this city a return destination.

Reviews.Title: “A very nice hotel in Condado”
Reviews.Author: XCR1961
Reviews.Content: The Conrad is on the outskirts of Condado but within waking distance to the restaurants and nightlife. The hotel is very modern. Beautiful lobby. Really Nice room. There are a few restaurants on- site. I had dinner in one of the restaurants which was quite good. The hotel has a small beach area. Not really a beach in my opinion. The pool could use a little freshening up and updating. Watch the pool drinks as they can get expensive. My last day there ended up costing me $200 and I don't recall us drinking that much. The room I stayed in was newer and beautiful. I loved the bed and shower. The bed was very comfortable. Good pace to stay in Condado.

Reviews.Title: “Unexpectedly great value for 3 nights before a cruise”
Reviews.Author: For2une
Reviews.Content: We flew in for 3 nights and 2 days stay before the cruise and then planned to visit Ponce in southern Puerto Rico for 4 nights and 3 days after the cruise. The land part of the trip was excellent and very memorable. Puerto Rico is fun, friendly, and a crazy, interesting mix of cultures. Before the cruise we stayed at the Conrad Condado Plaza hotel, within sight of the cruise ship port. This was an excellent location. We got a special price of $109 night on Hotwire and felt this hotel was a great value for the price and amenities. Arriving fairly late, around 9 PM, and the hotel being full we got a special unexpected benefit - although it took a while to find us an available room we got a free upgrade to a suite room, that was one of the largest and nicest we ever stayed in. The hotel pool and grounds were perfect for one of our days hanging out and the much better than average, fully equipped and well furnished fitness center was much appreciated for a good work out on out "hotel" day. The main breakfast eatery in the hotel has very good breakfast deals which we used both days. You can get an American style breakfast for under $10. In the evening there is a Subway sandwich shop, a pizza place, a small mini mart, and several higher priced restaurants withing a few blocks of easy waling - so you are not stuck with what the hotel has to offer. We also rented a car at the on site Enterprise car rental. Great service and prices by the Enterprise desk there. We were very glad we opted for the new Garmin Nuvi GPS. If you donâ€™t know your way around, a GPS is pretty indispensable. In the San Juan area, however, we never could figure out how to get an exact address recognized by the GPA or get the GPs to find several places we wanted, but it did not get lost and saved us a lot of time and trouble. It also seemed it had the proper turns, but wrong street names several places in San Juan and that was not just translation problems - the street names given by the GPS were different but the turn directions were correct. Still it managed to get us around when we would have been totally lost oterhwise. After the cruise the Garmin GPS we used in southern Puerto Rico was pretty accurate on everything, but again we didnâ€™t have much luck getting it to find some specific businesses and addresses. Housekeeping service was hit and miss even though we tipped $5 the first night - we cut that back to $2 and finally $3. Several times I had to track them down to get coffee or things they forgot to put in our room. Overall the service seemed as good as normal and the restaurant service in the hotel for breakfast was very good. I had read about a beach bicycle/walking trail and board walk at Pinones, near San Juan, in the Carolina area that had bicycle rentals. My wife and I like cycling. The GPS helped get us to Pinones and as described, as soon as you cross the bridge and on the down ramp, go right into the first parking lot and business area. Here your will find a building marked COPI that rents some old beater multi gear mountain bikes - good enough to have fun with. We rode for several hours along the trail, seeing beautiful beaches, shoreline and some inland swampy areas loaded with tiny crabs, making a very interesting and nice outing. You will be able to see much more by riding than walking and I recommend you use COPI or keep driving to find some other bike rentals that we saw signs for along the way, but you probably will not find any â€œgreatâ€� bikes. We also had lunch across the street from the COPI building before riding, at a popular hill top place, favored by locals, and good food and prices. After riding we enjoyed drinks at a local beach front bar overlooking the ocean and interesting reef and rock formations. The area seemed mostly used by locals and wasn't busy during a mid-week day. You could also takes towels and have some great beaching, wading or even snorkeling on beaches in that area after parking your car or taking the stuff with you as you bike or walk the trail.

Reviews.Title: “Better Late then Never”
Reviews.Author: Tamari0n
Reviews.Content: kinda late posting my review, but i figured BETTER LATE THAN NEVER!! My boyfriend and i traveled to the Conrad last June and we still talk about our stay there til this day. The resort itself was amazing and very modern, just how we like it. The check-in process was hell but other than that, i have no complaints. Both the bar inside of the lobby and outdoors near the pool were GREAT! I recommend a strawberry daiquiri with Bacardi 151 poolside.... two of those and the job is done!!! lol as far as the casino goes, we both went in lost a few dollars and left... Blowing money in a casino was not our goal for our vacation. Now for the most important part.... the room!!! It was fantastic! It could have been bigger but the large bathroom made up for the smaller bedroom. I thought it was weird that the closet and fridge were in the bathroom but we made it work. The bedding was great, mattress excellent, flat screen yes maam!!! All in all it was a great trip in a decent location. There are other resorts in the area but not really in walking distance like on Isla Verde.. If i could do it all again I would stay in Isla Verde only because other attractions seem to be closer, but i will always compare my vacation accomodations to the Conrad Resort!!! Hope this helps! Buena Suerte

Reviews.Title: “Thank you to Leah Rossi for all her help we really enjoyed our stay”
Reviews.Author: FlipJR
Reviews.Content: We had a room with a view of the ocean with a super comfortable bed and super relaxing environment. We did not care so much of the lobby or ground (to many people and to noise) but the room was an oasis of peace and tranquility. Leah Rossi was super attentive with us to make our first night as a married couple a very special one.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, great views, not a beach resort.”
Reviews.Author: Turn2Racing
Reviews.Content: Very good location, nice clean rooms, comfortable beds, we stayed on the lagoon side and the bathroom was very small, otherwise a very nice place. Great views of the lagoon and city from our 5th floor room.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel-Friendly Staff especially Mr. Jean Pierre Aponte”
Reviews.Author: Glenstal
Reviews.Content: The Conrad San Juan is a fantastic place to stay. I brought my elderly parents and the staff could not have been nicer. I would like to especially mention Mr,Jean Pierre Aponte at the front desk. He was so helpful and made certain our stay was something we will cherish forever. My parents and my room had breathtaking views. The bartender at the pool bar made my father the best planters punch he's ever had.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful, Wonderful, Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: SJH08
Reviews.Content: My Boyfriend and I decided to spend his birthday in San Juan. The Conrad was an excellent choice. We were impressed from the moment we arrived. The staff was very friendly and offered great recommendations. The food was good, not great but were directed to excellence restaurants within walking distance and in Old San Juan. Our room was spacious and the view from the balcony was breathtaking. We we definitely recommend this hotel. We had a wonderful and memorable time.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TarHeelExplorer
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here 10 times (mostly for work). Great hotel - staff was very attentive and the rooms were clean with a great view (if you get an ocean or lagoon view). It can be expensive - but most Hilton/Conrad places are. If you like nightlife, it's at the very end of Condado, so you'll have about a 10 min walk (very safe) or a short cab ride. There are places that are in the middle of Condado if you're looking to be where everything is. Pools are good, food is great (but expensive) and the hotel staff will take good care of you. If you're looking to relax - this is a great spot.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel in the city-center.”
Reviews.Author: Judarell
Reviews.Content: Prior to reviewing the hotel experience I must mention the outstanding service by the employees (as well as ALL of the people we encountered in PR). The Puerto Rican people we encountered were warm, welcoming, sweet people who went above and beyond. That being said, upon arriving by cab to the Conrad I was very sad to see the condition of the neighborhood. Abandoned buildings covered in graffiti,and lots of construction on a very loud street was disappointing. The inside of the hotel was ok.. Retro and modern. Not really my style but still nice. Concierge was excellent. Breakfast at the Cafe Caribe was no good. Eggs were over-cooked and service very slow. Beach was very small but adequate. Construction was visible from the beach and LOUD. I do not recommend eating at the hotel as it is over-priced. We ate sushi at East (v good), and tried the upscale Budatai which was an eclectic and sexy scene but overpriced and food just average. The best food we had was in Loquillo and Fajardo, both a 45 min drive away. The hotel room was comfortable and beds were great. Bathroom looked renovated but the closet and drawers were in there AND shower walls were clear glass, no privacy. I don't know why they designed it that way. I would not stay at this hotel again but would love to return to PR soon!!

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to go back!”
Reviews.Author: Pat20
Reviews.Content: So much to say! First of all--I contacted Leah Rossi before our stay with concerns that I had after reading some reviews here. She was gracious and accommodating and answered all of my questions. We were lucky enough to have an ocean view room in the main hotel building--absolutely beautiful view! As someone wrote here previously, it is in city,so, if that's not your thing, you may not like it. But we loved that--there are some abandoned buildings due to Hurricane Hugo, but we felt totally safe walking around Ashford. As a matter of fact, I have never seen so many people out jogging as I have on Ashford! Now--the people at the hotel--I had read here that customer service was not that great. We had the total opposite experience. The people in that hotel were so friendly!!! The pool and bar service was amazing--the employees there make you feel welcome, they remember your name, and treat you great! Of course, you get what you give! ( I saw some people that were rude to employees, and still the employees were always respectful and courteous). We never waited more than a few minutes to be seated for breakfast, and we had breakfast there four mornings. However, there are places down on Ashford that serve breakfast. We ate at 8 noodle and liked it --Varitas was also very good. But walk down Ashford to Wakiki--food is great and the service is wonderful. The beach at Condado is small, but clean and beautiful for swimming and the fact that you can walk right back up the stairs to the pool area is great. I came back to Boston and snow! So, I can't wait to go back to the Conrad!!

Reviews.Title: “Surprised and unwilling to return”
Reviews.Author: wandafts
Reviews.Content: I stood during aug of 2007 first our rooms werent ready we had 2 room. One of the rooms that we were given was freshly painted, in which my mother gets ashma, so her and my brother had to sleep there for that night. Had only one bed they brought up a blow up mattress which deflated during the night. The next morning they stated to us that we should bring the mattree down so it can be blown up again ha "how are we going to put this mattree inside the elevator"? i asked. Eventually they were given a new room.We did enjoy very much the swimming pool. I see new beautiful pictures now hope that these changes also comes with better customer service. Im not sure if i would recommed ???????

Reviews.Title: “I enjoyed my stay. It was one of my best vacations.”
Reviews.Author: coquirosita
Reviews.Content: Me and my husband have been married for a couple of months now but never got the chance to have a honey moon until now. We chose Puerto Rico for its beauty and the fact that I grew up there. We had the great pleasure of staying at "Conrad San Juan Condado Plaza". I remember visiting the hotel many times when I was younger and walking the streets of the Condado area. It was a treat to go back to the place where I had memories as a child. My husband on the other hand it was a new experience for him as his first time there. We loved every day and every experience. The hotel is at its very best location. It is situated in a corner offering to their guests a private beach where they can relax in. For those that like waves or want to be more immersed in the culture this is the perfect place to stay. There are other beaches at walking distance. Me and my husband personally did beach hopping. We would visit the hotel beach and sometimes the same day go walking to "el escanbron" beach. This beach is only a 15 minute walk and besides being immersed in the culture it has everything. It has lifeguards,showers,restrooms, food, a spot to relax in the water and a spot popular for surfers. From the beach you can view the fort and old san juan, This was only a 15 minute walk from our hotel. On the opposite directions there are also other beaches along with shopping and restaurants. We did not have to rent a car due to the fact that we had every thing within walking distance. If we wanted to go to old san juan or any other surrounding areas it was mostly a 13$ cab fair. The hotel it self has 2 buildings. One facing the ocean and the other facing the lagoon. We stayed in the lagoon side and it was a perfect junior suite. The room was contemporary and comfortable. From one side of the room we can view the ocean and from the other we can view the lagoon. For those that like to do water sports there are many possibilities around the area. You can kayak in the lagoon,wind surfing, surfing, rents jet skis. The hotel was able to give us info on this. There is a beautiful part on the back of the hotel where you can enjoy a great nap in a hamac or just enjoy the sunrise. The hotel has a great staff. Every question we had they answered with a smile. I was very impressed with the cleanliness of the hotel, and how professional all the employees were. For those that enjoy the night life, there is a bar in the hotel along with a little night club. A casino and several restaurants are within the hotel. Also there are other hot spots in old san juan and Isla verde with in 10 minutes of a drive. Overall our stay was great and I would recommend staying there. The food was great, the people were friendly, the room looked like new and in great condition and the experience is like no other.

Reviews.Title: “Awful service/staff..... not the best location”
Reviews.Author: travellerguy32
Reviews.Content: The Conrad itself is a lovely hotel, very modern and definitely trying to be a trendy spot in San Juan. The rooms are nicely appointed, although the cleanliness of the rooms needs much improvement. The rooms/halls tend to be very noisy as the rooms all of tile floors which echos every time someone flushes the high-powered toilets or shuts their guest room door. The beds are comfy. The bathrooms are strange as the shower is in the middle of a large room that is shared with the fridge, open closet and other bathroom appointments. When you walk out the shower you need to be a little careful not to get all of your hanging clothes wet. The service at the hotel is awful. From the bell captain, to the front desk, to housekeeping - everyone seemed bothered here. Attitudes were high. Friendliness non existent. The only staff that seemed to be remotely interested in guests were the pool bar attendants. Other pool staff was totally uninterested.....beach chairs on the playita (little thing they call a beach) were delayed as the attendant was on his personal phone hiding behind the wall. Luggage took over an hour, after 3 calls, to be delivered to the room. The hotel location is in Condado, but at the very end. The hotel seems to be surrounded by vacated old and condemned buildings covered in grafitti. Such a shame. The area is safe, but just doesn't feel like a vacation or resort area. Anything interesting is at least a 10 minute walk away or a cab ride. Isla verde resorts have much more to offer, I feel, as this hotel doesn't have a real beach. The "playita" is blocked by rocks and in the inlet. Nothing compared to the Isla Verde beaches. The hotel does try to make up for this with two large pool areas.

Reviews.Title: “Great family suites! Awful dining options!”
Reviews.Author: arandikc
Reviews.Content: Traveled to the Conrad with my two teen aged sons. We booked a city view "family suite" for our 4 night stay. The room was just what we were looking for! There were two twin beds upon entering the room, lots of storage space, a nice sized bathroom and a another private area with a king size bed. The room was mostly updated with the exception of a 70's ish wall papered wall in the king area. The room was clean and comfortable. There was also a balcony that over looked Ashford Ave and afforded views of the lagoon and street, no street noise with drapes closed. The room was in a bldg. across the street from the main hotel so there was a little walk to the pool and small public beach. Unfortunately, we were not aware that there were water sport facilities on that part of the property until the day we were leaving. It would have been nice if were we were told upon check in. We ate breakfast in the hotel each day as there are no other places in walking distance to the hotel that we could find that served breakfast. Warning! the food is just ok and is very expensive for the quality and the service provided. There was a wait each morning for a table and the service was so poor. In fact one morning the hostess refused to seat us because she had no tables for 3 only large tables available. When I asked her why we could not sit at one of the many empty "big" tables she said if "some larger parties came she would have no place to put them." I told her that made no sense since there was no one waiting and that there were so many empty large tables. She dismissed my comments and walked away. When I complain to the front desk down stairs they immediately called and was given the same run around by the hostess, the desk clerk then called the manager. Needless to say we were seated right away. We had dinner one of the nights at the noodle place at the hotel which was so over priced it was a crime and to boot the food was not even good. We had much better luck dining out of the hotel although most places were a pretty good walk away. The pool at the hotel is very nice, get there early if its busy to find a seat . There are 3 pools. A kiddie pool tucked away near the street, main pool with a slide and pool bar and a sea water pool, which was very nice with views of the ocean. The hot tub was loaded with little children, not very enjoyable for teens and adults for that reason.The beach is small and not really an ocean beach, always seating there. Lots of noise on the beach from passing traffic and bridge construction. If you are looking for a full beach expereince this is not the place for you. I would recommend this hotel for a short stay as there is not much to do there other then the beach and pool. It is a $15.00 cab ride each way to Old San Juan and not much in walking distance to the hotel. A few decent places to eat in walking distance not much else. Area around the hotel is...not very pretty, except for the sea views, safe to walk around, lots of joggers and tourists walking at night. Lots of old bldgs. set for tear down which takes away from the beauty of the area.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, fab facilities loved it!!”
Reviews.Author: nitelitelmeg
Reviews.Content: My mother and i stayed and the Conrad for a week 5th feb to12th Feb 2011. I have to say it was a really nice hotel with exceptionally friendly and hard working staff who were always on the ball and eager to assist in any way they could. The rooms are spacious and the beds are huge and soo comfortable you will find it hard to get out of them in the mornings!! There are loads and loads of comfortable sun loungers, free use of large towels for the pools and beach, an outside area where a massage service is offered overlooking the sea. There is a small but beautiflu beach area with direct access from the side of the main swimming pool and a huge hot tub. The pools and hot tub are kept clean as a whistle. There is a bus stop to the side of the beach just outside the hotel where you can get a ride into old San Juan for about 75 cents and then you can take a free open sided bus which will take you all over the place and you can hop on and off wherever you want to. It is a very quiet hotel with almost no entertainment, there is a casino if thats your thing. The food at the Carebe Cafe was nice but always cold which was a shame. Natalie the waitress in the care was awesome and really sweet, Buggsy the cafe manager was really on the ball and Richard the concerge was also excellent. (a big thank you to you guys) Remember when you pay your bill that it is up to you how much you want to leave as a tip or if you even want to leave a tip at all, the suggested ammount is 15% but ultimatly it is totally up to you what you leave, dont be tricked!! I thoroughly enjoyed my stay at the Conrad and recommend it to everyone, go on treat yourself..... :-)

Reviews.Title: “Decent stay but nothing spectacular...”
Reviews.Author: CleoTravels
Reviews.Content: I believe this hotel is newly renovated and it seems so. The rooms are trendy with a large bathroom and we had a great ocean view. There are two pool areas: the one by the fitness center is much more quiet, private, and smaller. The fitness center is very nice and clean. The restaurants are a little pricey. The breakfast at Cafe Caribe is better than the pool restaurant. Varita is a nice, sit down place but a little pricey as well- fabulous chicken though! Service is acceptable but nothing exceptional. Overall, it was a nice stay but I would not stay here next time. It is not a place you want to hang out. No one goes to the bar and the clientele is mostly families and old people. If you are a young person (single especially), I would stay at La Concha or the El San Juan hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, good location.”
Reviews.Author: ekkokammer
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay at this hotel. Stayed for six nights pre-cruise in a topfloor oceanview room in the main tower. Had nothing but great service at all times. Ate at Pikayo and Varita, both well worth a visit. Ropo Vieja is a nearby resturant we had dinner at twice, Good food. but a bit salty overall. We also went to Old San Juan many times to eat, walk around to explore the town and shop. Old town was a ten minute taxi ride away, if traffic allowed for it. Lots of good resturants in Old San Juan, but Marmelade was not worth the visit. Expensive with great service, but only fair food for the price. There is a small public beach outside the hotel, and pools and jacuzzi on the hotel premises. The larger Condado Beach is a five to ten minute walk away and worth visiting. We contacted Leah Rossi with some request before the stay and she took care of them all. The Check in and check outs were handled smoothly and we had no extra charges added to our bill. Elevator worked at all times, it was never a problem going up to the topfloor. The hotel became a bit more crowded during the weekend due to a conference, but that didnt have any impact on our stay. Was a bit surprised they didnt resupply the toiletries more than twice during our stay, but we didnt run out so it was not a big issue.

Reviews.Title: “Trying too hard to be trendy”
Reviews.Author: VirginiaMom10
Reviews.Content: We had a nice time in San Juan for a quick weekend getaway. The Conrad was nice but felt like it was trying too hard to be trendy and cool, like a NYC nightclub at the beach. We just didn't like the "funky" atmosphere. We had an ocean view room that had a beautiful view with a nice balcony, although the rail was loose which seemed dangerous. Our room was red with black, which seemed odd and dark for a hotel on the beach. Despite our dislike of the decor, it was neat and clean and the bed was comfy. The bathroom was strangely designed with a glass shower in the middle that leaked. The best thing about the room was definitely the ocean view. Overall, the staff were very nice and pleasant. Prices were what you would expect for a resort hotel. The landscaping is nice and pretty, pools were great but the beach was so unimpressive. It was small, like other reviewers have noted, with views of a bridge (with construction going on) and buildings across the inlet. Not great if you are hoping to enjoy a nice beach atmosphere. Tip: Two great restaurants to try (without the little ones): Pamela's in Ocean Park Beach - this was by far our favorite meal in San Juan. The food was phenomenal, service was superb and the location was amazing. We had a candlelight dinner right on the beach, feet in the sand ... ahhh! Panza in Old San Juan - somewhat pricey but interesting and inventive food. We wanted to try everything on the menu! We happened to stumble on this wonderful spot and were pleasantly surprised by the quality of the food, service and ambience.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, but don't pay full-price.”
Reviews.Author: Prreader
Reviews.Content: The lobby was spacious with fun colored decor. Check-in was easy. I was in the same tower as tge lobby, which I recommend. Otherwise, there's a long walk through the Casino to get to your room. Parking was $15/night for guests. The room was very clean and spacious. I wished it had had a fridge however. The glassed-in sshower was cool, although it took about 10 min for the hot water to get going first thing in the morning. The water pressure wasn't great either. The room decor was very modern. It was a very short drive to Old San Juan and there was a Statbucks downstairs and a Chili's within walking distance. The pool was fun with an El Morro sculpture by the kid's water slide. There was also one hot tub. The beach was beautiful and access was easy. Recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Loved San Juan, but NOT the Conrad.”
Reviews.Author: Sha820
Reviews.Content: Just returned from this hotel last night and SO glad to be home. Most of San Juan is beautiful, with warm, wonderful people and beaches to match. But this hotel is none of those things. We actually stayed at two hotels this trip, spending the first night (for free) at the pretentious-but-gorgeous Marriott La Concha down the street. If La Concha is a supermodel, the Conrad is her little sister. I was looking forward to moving to the Conrad, expecting a more down-to-earth experience. I got a little more than I bargained for. Check-in/Check-out: Checking in, we were informed of a 14% "resort fee", to be expected I suppose. Check-in was relatively quick and painless. Check-out was a completely different story. We had a late breakfast before checking out, and when we returned to our rooms at 12:05 (check-out is Noon), our keys had been deactivated. We had to go to the front desk - which for us was down six floors and across the street - and wait in line for 15 minutes to get them reactivated. We were able to check out while we were there, saving us another wait in the huge line (no express check-out at the Conrad), which was a plus. One note, though, CHECK YOUR BILL. We had valet parking added to our total, for 4 nights, and we didn't even have a car. Luckily, I caught the error and it was credited back to us with no fuss. Make sure you go through your bill with them before you leave, just in case. Room: The room was fairly large size, but the bathroom was teeny! So small that I kept banging my elbow on the wall trying to dry off from the shower. The sliding bathroom door didn't close all the way, so there was little privacy. Also, no ventilation fan. There was a balcony, also a good size, but the railing was so loose, we were afraid to go anywhere near it. Our room overlooked the lagoon, with a view of the city. It was nice, but I would recommend asking for something in the main tower with an ocean view. Regarding the housekeeping, it was a bit spotty. Every afternoon, we returned to fewer pillows/towels/whatever. It's like they wanted to impress us the first day with a perfectly appointed room, and then didn't care after. Even the toiletries and face cloths hadn't been replenished 4 days into our vacation. It was really bizarre. I'm sure that if we'd asked, they would have brought more, but why would you need to ask? Neighbourhood: Ok, let me say that this area will not be for everyone. The hotel is surrounded by abandonded hotels and buildings and is next to a bridge that is currently under construction. There are two luxury condos and several restaurants/shops as well. It's an odd mix of the new, the old, the crumbling and the luxurious. We found the juxtaposition of these things kind of charming, but I know some will complain. We had no problem with the locals, they were all very friendly. We were, however, warned not to go out walking late at night. There were a few really charming places to eat down the road: Waikiki Restaurant and Oyster Bar - awesome food and staff. just wonderful! Ropa Vieja Restaurant has great food, Puertorrican/Cuban, though the service is a little cold. Picacho Cafe is a good little coffee shop, friendly. There's also a place called Puerto Peru down by La Concha, about 6 blocks away. Great ceviche, but horrible entrees and awful service. Avoid unless you reallllllly want ceviche, lol. Hotel Staff: Diego, the beach chair handler and the staff of the Cafe Caribe - particularly John - were super nice! Front desk was fine, courteous. Most of the staff were fine, if not a little indifferent, except for the hostess at Verita. A NY couple that was checking out the day we checked in raved about the food there, so we tried - twice - to go. The hostess was incredibly rude the two times we tried to book a table, so we just avoided it. Beach/Pool: Condado Beach (Playa Condadito) is a cute little place, emphasis on the 'little'. It is a very small area. All beaches in PR are public, I'm told, and that's pretty cool. The locals are really friendly, and there were no real problems with space, etc. My complaint is with - surprise - the hotel's policies. The beach chairs are collected at 5pm. Towels are to be returned by 6pm, or else you will be charged. By the way, the pools close at 5pm. Five o 'clock! On the beach, the chairs are free but the umbrellas are $10, $11 if you charge it to your room! Makes me wonder what the 14% resort fee was for. They nickel-and-dime you at every turn in this place. Hotel restaurants: Overpriced, with the exception of Cafe Caribe. $25 for 2 drinks at Aqua?! Avoid the Noodle 8 Bar at all costs. Expensive, oily noodles, cold service...yuck. Have breakfast at Cafe Caribe, overlooking the ocean, but wander out for lunch and/or dinner. You won't be disappointed. Major issues: On our third night, there was a power outage which affected the entire area. To their credit, they had generators running to keep power on in the rooms and to the guest elevators. Unfortunately, this happened at dinnertime, and only one of the hotel restaurants was able to serve, the pricey and rude Verita, and it was packed. We tried to walk down the road to find something open, but no go. Returning to the Conrad, We went back up to our room to wait out the power outage, hoping it would end and we could eat. After a few hours, the generators went off and the power was back on, so we headed to the elevators to head downstairs. That's when we heard the yelling and the banging. People were stuck. On the elevators. And the hotel didn't know until I called. Yeah, ponder that one for a while. So now, it is 1:18 in the morning - 5 hours after this ordeal began - and we are sitting in our room, eating some trail mix that we got for the flight home. Luckily we had a bottle of water, and didn't need to touch the $7 bottle of Fiji. Honestly, if it were not for the astounding natural beauty that is PR, and some awesome experiences we had with local establishments and outings, I would call this whole trip a bust. Bottom line is, these rooms go for $200+ per night. They have to do better than this. They just have to. Stay elsewhere, fellow travelers. By the way, go into Old San Juan and see La Fortaleza. Soooo worth it! There's a free tram with 28 stops, I think, throughout the area. Disfrute!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MARIOMETS
Reviews.Content: This hotel is great I do not know what people are complaining about. The rooms are great,service is friendly and terrific . the pool area and beach area are fine. The beach may be small but its nice and the calm water is great for kids,and you can see beautiful tropical fish in the clear blue water. Any problems with your stay just ask for Leah Rossi she is the best. Also folks remember you are on vacation so take care of the people that are taking care of you so don't be cheap and tip for the great service you are getting.

Reviews.Title: “Find a different hotel when you come to PR, don't stay here”
Reviews.Author: monica061
Reviews.Content: We got this hotel on priceline. It was listed on priceline as a 4 star luxury resort, overall I was really disappointed with the service and quality for our honeymoon stay. The level of cleanliness and amenities were not consistent with a resort. Also, our second night, we awoke earlier in the early morning to hear water dripping through our ventilation system. I contacted the hotel twice and when someone came we were told to turn the fan on and lower the temperature in our room, which we did. The room was so cold and the problem persisted into the next day and then we checked out. The quality of the "beachfront" was terrible, there was no shoreline and it was right next to the highway where construction was going on and we were in fullview of the workers. The hotel room itself as not consistent with a "4 star" rating. Unresponsive staff, overpriced. We found a better place to stay on the second half of our honeymoon.

Reviews.Title: “Had to go for a conference but very disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Buffirish
Reviews.Content: Paid $250 conference rate for ocean view room. Ocean view balcony was barely big enough to walk out onto, although views were beautiful. Upon check in, young lady at the desk finished what was obviously a personal phone call before addressing me - only person in line.
