Room was smaller than expected for rate, and closet is located in bathroom. In room safe, which was necessary due to bringing laptop for conference, was absent. Took multiple phone calls to housekeeping/desk/concierge and ultimately conference director before one was finally installed. Room was fine, but we were on the second floor overlooking an awning with a very large dead rat which contined to decompose throughout our visit despite multiple notifications to hotel staff. Hotel key was deactivated multiple times throughout stay, causing great inconvenience. The area of Condado is all chain restaurants, you have to take a $15 cab ride each way to old san juan. Puerto Rican restaurants close to hotel were overrun with pigeons and cats and of poor quality. Hotel staff overally was indifferent. Drinks were expensive and hard to obtain at all hotel bars. Excursions at the front desk were fun but insanely overpriced, and the desk staff initally told us credit cards were accepted and then demanded cash in the van, causing an inconvenient trip to the ATM. This is coming from a 30 year old seasoned traveler who has spent extensive time for medical and leisure purposes at both urban and rural areas in the Dominican Republic, Mexico, Costa Rica as well as Russia. I am not picky by any means, and I would return to any of these places in a second for twice the price before I would go back to Puerto Rico. The weather is nice, thats all I can really say about Puerto Rico. Youre better off sparing the expense and going to Miami.

Reviews.Title: “not worth it”
Reviews.Author: vtjbrent
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Conrad because of a conference that I thought we would turn into an extended vacation. We paid $250 a night for an ocean view room. There are also a ridiculous amount of taxes. We had a 14% resort fee added per night, maid fees, some other tax for 11%, they all just added up. The hotel was OK. It isn't very close to anything else. There were a couple of decent restaurants i.e. Ropa Vieja within a 5 minute walk, but not much else. Old San Juan is a $12 cab ride, if you get an honest cabbie. The hotel has a little lagoon with a small beach which is nice, especially if you have kids. The rooms have been superficially renovated, but have an underlying oldness to them. The doors of each room leading to the hallway provide no sound barrier to the hall. I could hear every door closing in the entire hallway. The service was also poor for the price you pay here. For $250 a night, I expect better. Our phone didn't work unless it was on speaker phone, we told the front desk about it twice and it never got fixed. We were there a week. Our fridge was caked in ice so that you couldn't move the controls. The shower leaked water all over the bathroom floor. And there are no signs in the hotel anywhere. It was a 30 minute excursion to find the gym. Don't even bother to try to find the rental place. We would ask the concierge and others, and get answers like "in the other building, you can't miss it". On the contrary, they were quite hidden. With no signs. While the view is nice, I wouldn't stay here again. I am confident that, for the money, you can do better in San Juan and around.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful modern rooms, nice pool, not so good location”
Reviews.Author: ChicagoDude69
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Conrad in early Febuary. Won a $100 a night Priceline bid for Mon-Fri stay (weekdays are cheaper) and then upgraded to an ocean view room for $20 more a night. Payed a $45 resort fee as well. This was my third vacation in San Juan, Puerto Rico this winter. The Conrad had the best-looking rooms I've seen in San Juan aside from the DoubleTree Hilton (in San Juan). Modern chic. I was in a room with two Queen-size beds. There wasa huge bathroom (bigger than my bedroom at home). The shower was a large glass box that I thought was cool. Very impressed with the interior of the Conrad overall. Beautiful lobby. Beautiful pools. There was a small refrigerator in the room for storing your own water bottles a Walgreen's is about a 15-20 minute walk down the road). Definitely a 4-star hotel design. The ocean-view room had a balcony with two chairs and a small wooden table. I enjoyed watching the waves come in and break on the rocks, sending up spray. The hotel is on the flight path for private and local planes, so you'll see a lot of single and twin engine aircraft flying over as well as helicopters. The occasional ship floats by as well. The hotel has a small lawn in the back (right before the ocean) with hammocks and beach chairs for people to sun themselves on. On my last day, I tried out the chairs and saw small crabs come over the rocks to eat some of the grass. Neat. The pool area is large and truly resort style. There are bars, a restaurant, and waiters walking around to take your order. There is a booth where you give them your room number and they give you beach towels and let you rent snorkeling gear. There is a small public beach behind the pool area. Maybe 30 people could fit on the beach, and a busy road and an ugly temporary bridge runs right next to it. The water next to the beach is a nice calm lagoon area separated from the ocean by a wall of rocks. It's soothing to watch the waters break on the rocks and calmly seep into the lagoon. The Conrad is not a good beach hotel. I liked the pool for one day, but on the second day I took a taxi to Isla Verdes public beach ($16.50 + tip), which is about a 10-minute trip, where you can truly people watch. You can take the bus there too, which is much cheaper but takes longer. For a good beach-resort experience, I recommend a hotel on Isla Verdes beach (the Intercontinental or El San Juan are examples). The Conrad is mostly about the pool area and nice rooms. It's a bad people-watching hotel, as you're only limited to the people at the hotel. The hotel is in a mediocre location. There are several abandoned hotels (one large one and a few smaller boutiques) around the Conrad. They are neat to look at in an apocalyptic way, as they are completely gutted of everything save for a concrete skeleton and covered in colorful graffiti. I felt completely safe in the area, as there are police all over, and there are many other nice hotels just down the road, as well as many restaurants and stores. Free Wi-Fi was speedy while I was there. Restaurants are expensive. The doormen did a great job of opening doors and hailing cabs, but got smart with me when I asked, "Where by the pool can I get beach towels?" (the booth is somewhat hidden). They responded ("By the pool." And then, "So what's the question?). They seemed to think the question answered itself. I laughed it off, but still. Overall, I enjoyed my stay at the Conrad, as the rooms were clean, the maids did a good job every day of cleaning and supplying towels, and my view was beautiful. Plan on spending money and time away from hotel once you get bored with the pool area.

Reviews.Title: “Poor Service”
Reviews.Author: Becmerv
Reviews.Content: While the Conrad Condado Plaza had many nice amenities, including a beautiful pool and amazing ocean views, the poor service was unacceptable for a hotel of this supposed quality. I was traveling with 2 friends, and we each had separate rooms. When we arrived at the hotel around 3:45 on our first day in Puerto Rico, one of my friends was told that his room was not ready because check-in was at 4pm. When he asked the woman at the front desk what she could do about the situation, she replied "nothing." His room was over $300 per night, including taxes and resort fees, but no attempt was made to accommodate us in any way. We were also traveling on the Puerto Rico Sparkles special package, which included breakfast coupons, a casino voucher and other amenities. When we asked the woman who was checking us in about the free breakfast, she was not familiar with the package and had to ask someone else. Had we not asked, we would not have received our coupons or room discount. The next day, I had plans to go running with my friend in the morning. When he didn't show up at our scheduled meeting time, I went across the street to his room (my cityview room was in a separate building across the street - not convenient to hotel amenities like the pool and restaurants). The lights in the lobby were off, so I asked at the front desk why it was dark. A rude woman told me that there had been an incident on the street and that it was being worked on. As a hotel guest, I believe that I deserved a better explanation as it clearly affected my plans - my friend's alarm did not go off because the power went out - thank goodness I wasn't trying to catch a flight. On our last evening at the Conrad, my friend came back to his room after dinner only to find that it had not been cleaned. When he reported it to the front desk, they could not guarantee that it would be taken care of immediately. He asked how/if we could be compensated for his inconvenience, and we were given a food voucher and late checkout the next day. The staff at this hotel clearly resents tourists - it seems they are in the wrong industry.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful..Definately will be going back to PR e!”
Reviews.Author: dvr615
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I just got back. It was our first time inPuerto Rico. We did alot of research on which hotel would be the best. We did come across the Ritz and El San juan. THey were a little pricey but after seeing where they are located I think we will be staying there next time. Conrad was beautfful. The beach is not great. Very small and rocky. Suggest going on a day trip to Isla Verde beach (about 15 minute drive) One thing we will do next time is rent a car everyday. We rented for one day and it was the best decision ever. The Conrad is nice because it is within walking distance to restaurants, bars and a casino right in the hotel. There is a club inside the hotel as well which we had a blast at (if u like dancing this is a great place) Next time we will be going kayaking and to El Yunique rainforest. Old SAn juan was amazing. Saw the ruins and had great shopping and food.

Reviews.Title: “Needs an onsite spa”
Reviews.Author: NewYorktraveler111_9
Reviews.Content: The room we had was nice, corner suite, overlooked the lagoon, Lagoon Suite. Though the view was nice, I also got to see the construction going on in the next lot. That was not too enticing. The floors are uneven, so becareful when walking to and from your room on the carpet. I saw many people trip. Hotel staff were nice and friendly. But you have to remember that everyone runs on "island" time, meaning that everything is SLOW!! Don't expect your food or anything to come at normal speeds. There is no spa on site, so for those who want a spa treatment and massage, you will have to go elsewhere. The restaurants inside the hotel are pretty pricey. The Starbucks is conveniently located, but be prepared to wait for your drink...they are slow. But all in all, the staff was friendly, there is a nice quiet pool section, away from children and the crowd. There is no beach area really for guests. And the waves are very strong.

Reviews.Title: “Young Hip New York Vibe”
Reviews.Author: butchcat
Reviews.Content: Very mod,lots of white plastic and sixties retro furniture. Outdoor areas leave something to be desired...great views($25 upgrade fee). No swimmable beach but there is a tiny crowded public beach adjacent. Godd location.

Reviews.Title: “Great room...but missing a lot of stuff!!”
Reviews.Author: naush76
Reviews.Content: Our room was fantastic...modern, colorful, spacious and a great view of the ocean. Even though we got the room through priceline, they still gave us free breakfast vouchers for each day we stayed plus $25 of credit for the casino because we are Hilton Gold. My husband and I are in our early 30s and were probably 25-30 years younger that most of the crowd at the hotel. Not too much to do at the hotel, so we usually left the hotel in the evenings and went down to Old San Juan. Adjacent to the nice, large pool area, there is access to the small public beach which is right on the main street- they don't have their own beach! I stayed at the Caribe Hilton down the street on a prior trip and they have a great private beach. They don't have a spa either. They rip you off with the resort fee...we extended our stay by 3 hours and they charged us for the entire day!! They give you vouchers for buy-one-get-one-free mojitos at their pool bar- don't waste your money- they are made from a mix and gross!! The hotel itself is great as well as the service. And for the price we got, we really can't complain. But there are some things that are definitely missing.

Reviews.Title: “Great location. Fresh and modern decor. Hospitable staff. Amazing views.”
Reviews.Author: cas1972
Reviews.Content: Just back from an extended weekend and can't say enough about the Conrad hotel. We are a couple in our late thirties(have kids but travelled without) who like more boutique/modern hotels and this one loved up to our expectations. The hotel was obviously recently renovated and they did a fantastic job creating a cool vibe without being cold and pretentious. There were aspects of it you could tell were not updated or had minimal upgrades but overall it was modern, new, and inviting. The hotel itself has two towers, one on the ocean side and the other on the lagoon side(across street). Definitely worth being on the ocean side as convenience to the lobby and amenities is much easier. There are two main pools and one is salt water and the other has a swim up bar. The larger pool had a small waterslide and volleyball net for kids (which there were not many of). There is also a small public beach with a reef to snorkel out to. Not a great beach by any means but there is something and as another reviewer mentioned it is so worth driving to a local beach to see the beauty. Do not choose this hotel if you are looking for a beachside hotel experience. Location is key here being a 5 minute drive to Old San Juan. We loved that we could easily get to a different restaurant each night without driving far. The in/out valet parking was very convenient and the valet guys were very fast and friendly. The surrounding properties could use some help. It abutts an abandoned building and even a short walk down the street brings more abandonded buildings. There are only a couple places to walk to but overall it is isolated and you need a car (or taxi) to get anywhere. The hotel was quite busy with people of all ages. I noticed there were not many kids but if I were to bring mine I would probably pick a hotel with more amenities for them on a nice beach so I could see why there were not many. So onto service...we had reserved a junior suite. It was a big room overlooking the lagoon and city, had a large comfy sectional couch along a wall of sliding glass doors, and a very spacious bathroom. Although disappointed at first being on the lagoon it was actual very nice and quiet and our room was great. But to our surpise we awoke to a waterfall coming from a ceiling panel in the bathroom. We immediately called the front desk and alerted them and were told that they would need to move us to fix the problem. So we were leaving and were told to see them when we get back about the status of a room so we packed up our bags and put them at the concierge. Upon our return we were told the room was now fine and to go back to it. Funny enough 3 different employees commented on being surprised they were sending us back. So we went back both thinking the same thing was going to happen when the room above us used the jacuzzi again (that was what we were told was the problem). Then we get a call that our room type was overbooked and did we want an upgrade to a spa suite. We considered it until we saw the room that was right across the hall. In my opinion it was a downgrade....no balcony to sit on, no big comfy couch overlooking a great peaceful view, a jacuzzi I didn't want, and a view of the street above loud heating vents. We were offered a decent discount and then told we needed to move because our water leaking problem was really not solved...huh?! So I was not having a downgrade..it wasn't about the cost. It was about having a great experience. So once again we left and were told to come back and they would have another room for us. SO we get back and they show us a top floor 700 SF suite overlooking the ocean....OMG...the room was amazing and I do have to say Victor who was helping us really pulled through and the rest of the staff really did what they could to accomodate us. So after all the somewhat frustrating hoopla they gave us an amazing room that we enjoyed every minute of and the staff was extremely patient and nice the entire time. These things happen with leaks etc so we were in no way upset about it but really glad they came through with providing accomodations that met our expectations. Oh and I did check for bedbugs and saw no sign of them in the rooms we had My only complaint is the lighting in the bathroom is very dim. Could be a little brighter for getting ready but really if that is the only issue I don't really see any.

Reviews.Title: “Here is what you need to know about the Condado Plaza”
Reviews.Author: mrvinotinto
Reviews.Content: 1. It's in a great location - a short drive to Old San Juan (5 minutes) and a short drive to the airport (15 minutes without traffic). Many restaurants nearby or a short cab ride away (again, within 15 minutes). 2. This is a city hotel, in the heart of the city. It's got a good number of facilities for being a city hotel in some prime real estate (great restaurants, a nice spa, nice pools, etc.), near to all the main attractions in San Juan. It's not a resort. There are resorts in Puerto Rico which have more space and more extensive facilities and are more of a destination resort. But they are 45-minutes to an hour outside of San Juan. You will need a car rental and do some heavier driving to get to restaurants and nightlife. It's a trade-off. 3. We reserved a Superior Room with OV and were pleased with our room. It was fresh, modern, comfortable, with a big bathroom. 4. It's a big hotel, so expect many people checking in and out. When we arrived, there was a big group. While the hotel had about 6 employees checking people in, we still had to wait a little bit. I didn't mind, and I could tell that they had enough employees and it was justa matter of being patient for a few minutes. 5. The hotel is in a waterfront location, but the front of the hotel does not have a beach. To the side, there are steps (heavily monitored), to a small public beach. This is by far, not the most amazing beach on the island. Make sure you drive or make arrangements to see one of the real beaches in Puerto Rico. The small beach here is suitable, though, for small children as there are breakers for the waves off-shore. 6. We ate at Varita - It was good! Definitely recommended. The staff was good with kids. The pool-side food service was also quite good. 7. The staff was friendly. No problems there. 8. There is a pool at the spa area that is smaller and more quiet and has a view of the lagoon. The free facilities at the spa were very nice - good jacuzzi and steam room. 9. We rented a car and parked (with in/out privileges) in the lot. It was $15 + tax per night (about $16-17). This is a good price for not having to worry about where to park in this area and we could come and go as we pleased. In conclusion, I think the location and facilities for the location are quite good here. We would stay again. It's not a destination resot, but more of a solid city hotel that allows you to enjoy San Juan.

Reviews.Title: “Caribbean Sea view room - WOW!”
Reviews.Author: SuzanneManhattan
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed a wonderful upgrade at no cost to a Caribbean Sea view room. Other than being on one of the top floors (which we really enjoy), I think we could have reached out and touched the sea! The balcony had a couple of chairs and a small table, and we enjoyed sitting there at night and in the early morning. The room was pleasantly appointed and was kind of artsy - low bed and interesting lights and decor. The bathroom had a fantastic shower that was entirely glass enclosed and did not steam up the mirror over the sink (as so many do)! We ate dinner one night at the hotel's new restaurant which starts with a V, and it was amazing, authentic Puerto Rican cuisine. For breakfasts, we went to the cafe and enjoyed regular American fare with wonderful views of the sea. The casino was enjoyable, but I lost the few dollars I put in the slot machine. The salt water pool was refreshing, and having access to a beach adjacent to the property with lounge chairs provided was a definite plus. We would stay here again! The only opportunity we saw for improvement was at the concierge desk where there was sometimes a line of people waiting (including us).

Reviews.Title: “Overall enjoyable”
Reviews.Author: wetbaloney
Reviews.Content: I can't understand the reviews which fault the staff courtesy or honesty. All of the staff I encountered were very gracious and helpful. When a camera (unbeknownst to us) fell out of a pocket and was left in a hammock, one of the pool attendants took a look at the photos and then came around searching for guests who matched the people in the photos. The ocean view rooms are very attractive and comfortable, if a bit small. I would say that incorporating the closet and bath into one room with sliding doors was not the best design or most efficient use of space, but that is just nitpicking. And yes, they do not have a huge beach -- but it is right there and clean. The water is crystal clear, calm and protected for easy swimming. You can leave your valuables in your room, make use of hotel lounge chairs there, and buy inexpensive pinchos and sodas at a little stand right next to it. Location is a mixed bag -- at the end of Condado, where there are a couple of unattractive buildings abandoned, no doubt due to the housing bubble. Closer to Old San Juan than most other beach hotels though. If you venture a couple of miles east into the Ocean Park area, there are some excellent and inexpensive restaurants (Kasalta and Inka Chicken are two). If that's not your thing, there is no shortage of Subway's, Burger Kings, Starbucks, and Walgreens (:( Lots of pools, but saltwater pool seemed to be filled with fresh water.

Reviews.Title: “BED BUGS”
Reviews.Author: mahlkita
Reviews.Content: We were only here one night, but we got more than we bargained for... We drive up- it's in a crappy neighborhood. We enter lobby- I'm pleasantly surprised to find that it's a modern updated hotel. We get to the room- again pleasantly surprised to find that it's updated, modern style and appears to be clean. This went way down to "terrible" rating, because a few days after we got home, we find that they have given us some unexpected gifts: bed bugs. We find bites on our arms and legs. My husband got it much worse than I did, but we didn't get it as bad as many people do with bed bugs. The room must not have been infested... yet. We literally spent New Years Day at home, turning the house inside out- washing everything, turning the bed upside down, etc. My husband spent the rest of his vacation researching bed bugs- and let me just say that this was an absolute nightmare. And we didn't even get it as bad as many people do. Luckily we have a tempurpedic bed, which is easier to treat. Professional treatment can cost in the thousands, luckily ours only cost $250. Appeared to be a nice hotel- but what a nightmare. and very difficult to get rid of. I would guess that if they haven't shut down and treated the entire hotel- they will have a much larger problem on their hands in future. Bed bugs are a menace. Doesn't matter whether or not you're clean, they hitch hike from host to host. and sometimes treatment doesn't work. Good luck.

Reviews.Title: “Excelent Service, Restaurants and View!”
Reviews.Author: niceguy1969
Reviews.Content: Incredible service! I was in the hotel a few weeks ago and had very good experience. We stayed in a room with ocean view and there is nothing better than waking with the sound of the waves and a beautiful sun. The service is outstanding. Especially Cristina, the concierge that gave us an excelent variety of tours options and Alvaro, the doorman that gave us lots of recomendation on restaurants. He recomended us Pikayo's Cheese Suffle, Varita's Porchatta and the Rissotto of Ropa Vieja. Also ask him about tips of how get to Old San Juan and the Bacardi Factory. The Front desk needs to improve in the check in/ check out process, but in general is not too bad. In conclusion I will be back soon because of the service, the view and the great oportunities that Puerto Rico gives everyone to enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Surprisingly nice, but beware of noise”
Reviews.Author: WEISSBIER
Reviews.Content: Reading prior reviews made me apprehensible about this brief overnight stay. But I was pleasantly surprised. I am staying at the hotel right now, I am at the building on the oceanside, but have a city view room on the top ( 10th ) floor. The hotel seems to be refurbished with a beautiful lobby. The room is very spacious, big enough to dance, with a queen size bed. It is sparsely decorated with only a larger table that displays the flat panel TV, an office type chair and a side chair. The floor is tiled, witha small carpet at the bed, which is nearly pushed to the wall. there are no paintings on the wall. The bathroom is pretty big as well, sliding door entrance. I have good status with Hilton, but was unwilling to pay the regular rate of $ 250.00 per night, so I bid this on Priceline at a third of the price. Maybe that's why I ended up with an ADA room, no bathtub. My beef with the hotel are the thin room walls and the entrance door, which let in all the noise from outside. Even low volume talking is noticeable. Last night there was some loud enough talking that I woke up in the middle of the night. Rooms should be a bit more soundproofed. Regular outside noise is minimal. Self parking was $ 15.00 plus tax. I only slept here, so I cannot comment to the amenities. Location was good and easy to find by rental car from the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Not as glossy as the website”
Reviews.Author: CillaBang
Reviews.Content: This is a place that has had a good workover by a designer. It looks trendy with a cross over between a noughties and mid-century modern. The rooms are nice ( ocean view) but....we had to ask for it to be cleaned again as there were visible hairs on the floor and under the rug was filthy. The pool area is OK, but the service takes ages, order two beers at once so you don't die of thirst. Cappucino at the pool was awful, the waitress was so embarrassed she gave it to us for free. Location? Supposedly a nice area but you will have to walk a bit. New Year's eve event was rip-off and we had our drinks at midnight in the nice restaurant upstairs for a quarter of the price. Management need to get their finger out and make this place happen, the potential is great. The Gym is really good, and the rooms are spacious and well appointed.

Reviews.Title: “good value for $200, but you'd think it was an average Hilton vice a Conrad”
Reviews.Author: Djavaman
Reviews.Content: Its a good value for $200, but you'd think it was an average Hilton vice a Conrad. - We were upgraded the sea-view room with a great view. It was modern, clean, and trendy. No complaints there. - Nice, modern, clean room. I didn't have the leaky shower problem many guests complain about. - Friendly, but lackluster service throughout the hotel. - The pools are clean, fun, and well landscaped. The area won't wow you, but we were happy enough spending a whole day they. - Pool restaurant (Aqua) tasty, but perhaps overpriced. - The trendy lobby looks nice; but isn't quite a destination bar they want to pretend it is. - Breakfast restaurant, very poor. On day one our $15 Hhonors Diamond breakfast vouchers barely covered a cup of coffee and a breakfast burrito that would get bad reviews if sold in a diner for $4.95. The items we tried on other days were better, but still disappointing. Couple the food with slow (but friendly) service, windows you can hardly see through due to condensation, and the ambiance of a high-school cafeteria and you really aren't doing very well. If you are spending money, you'll definitely want to explore other options. - We walked into Old San Juan and back twice. It takes about an hour.

Reviews.Title: “Not a Conrad! Don't be fooled!”
Reviews.Author: Que2you
Reviews.Content: I have been a bit lazy about contributing to TripAdvisor, even though I have grown dependent on it to to make decisions about hotels and new destinations. I was so disappointed with this hotel that I was compelled to type. Let me state for the record that I am a true Marriott girl. However, it was New Year's Eve weekend and the rates at the Marriott Stellaris Hotel were cost prohibitive (even for a Gold/Silver member like me). With that being said, the rate at the wanna-be Conrad was not cheap! (over $300 and PREPAID) There is a systematic failure in the cleaning of these hotel rooms. You could see the build up of dirt and grime all along the edges of the rooms where the mops never touched. Soiled Chase, dust every where, the air filters were caked with crud! Thank God I travel with Clorox wipes! After traveling for 20 hours to get to PR for a cruise, we were too exhausted to complain the first night and ruffed it until the a.m. We promptly had our room changed to one that was a little cleaner. (Very nice staff) Rooms are small. not thoroughly cleaned, and the complex is in need of a renovation. Truly should not be called a Conrad. I have stayed at a few Conrads, with Bangkok being the best and this one is worlds apart. I won't even go into detail about the gutted buildings that flank the property... All of this overshadowed the wonderful breakfast at the restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Great ocean view”
Reviews.Author: bpr81
Reviews.Content: The conrad hilton has many things going for it. Nice rooms, great ocean views ( if you get the rooms facing the ocean, do ask for it), several pools and some nice restaurants. the location itself is not bad, since its only 10 minutes by bus to Old San Juan. The bus stop is right next to the entrance. Also a number of good restaurants are within 5-10 minutes walk towards Condado from the hotel. The breakfast menu was limited but the food was great. I am not a big gambling person, so the casino though small was adequate. I was also able to use the business center and had wifi everywhere inside the hotel. Only downside i guess is the price of room service ( don't order breakfast in bed. better go downstairs to the cafe) Overall a great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great location steps to the beach”
Reviews.Author: Lisa542
Reviews.Content: Overall Satisfied with my stay at the Conrad. The casino is nice and there are plenty of options to eat as well. The pools are very nice and steps to the ocean. Comfortable rooms-spend the extra for an ocean view-It's worth it!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant for a short stay”
Reviews.Author: bhalloo
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the hotel with a family member who had a business conference. It was very pleasant to be there for a few days enjoying the sun, and it was possible to walk to restaurants outside the hotel area. I don't think I would go back, but we did have a nice room, very quiet. We had to walk by the very noisy (and to me, depressing) casino to get to our room, but others might enjoy that. There is one top-level restaurant in the hotel, and one overpriced and mediocre one as well. We found an infinitely superior local restaurant down the block (Ropa Vieja). There is a Starbucks in the hotel as well, and a convenient car rental spot. Only really recommended if you have a meeting here, for location and convenience.

Reviews.Title: “Nice room. Noisy hotel.”
Reviews.Author: JPandJen
Reviews.Content: Off to a bad start when check-in took 40 minutes in line behind a group of screaming teenagers. Room very nice and clean and nice views. Very comfortable. Unfortunately an adjoining room with the same teenagers. Pool so noisy and busy we couldn't stand to be there. Restaurants fairly mediocre other than the pricy one which was excellent. Everything was perfectly clean and nice staff but just not my kind of place. Restaurants fairly mediocre

Reviews.Title: “Average”
Reviews.Author: Chicagogirl2000
Reviews.Content: For the name and price you pay, it is an average hotel. Service was no doubt decent, but still not the best. The beach is a public beach, so keep that in mind as well. Rooms are clean though.

Reviews.Title: “Four-star in every way”
Reviews.Author: twjared
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in January of 2011, and our stay was--at the very least--satisfactory. The Conrad is a nice hotel that fits exactly with what I expected in a 4-star hotel. Things to be aware of: 1. The beach is small-ish (although on par with the others in the area it seems), and shared with the public, but at no point was overcrowded. It has a nice view of the ocean and is protected by rocks in a way that there's not much in the way of waves. Great for those who want to wade or spend the day in water, not so great for those who like playing in the waves. 2. The hotel consists of 2 buildings, across the street from each other, and connected by an indoor elevated "sky bridge". The 2nd building does have a small, nice, quiet pool. But going to/from the lobby and main pool and beach area was a slight hassle and a bit of a trek. 3. Service in the hotel was up to par. Never much of a wait at reception. Courteous and helpful concierge and bell people. The place generally seems crawling with available staff. 4. The hotel is extremely clean and well-kept. Having a proximity between the ocean and a bay could lead to some dampness and mildew smells, but this was NOT the case anywhere in the Conrad. It felt fresh, cool, and clean. That said, we did find a waterbug/roach in the bathroom one day. I expect this is par for the course and possible now and then of any hotel in the tropics, be it 5-star or 1-star. We called housekeeping, who promptly took care of it. 5. I expected more in the way of nightlife/attractions in Condado. There are a few restaurants and quiet bars in the neighborhood, but be warned that it's a $15 cab ride each way if you're heading to Old San Juan. 6. The hotel has 3-4 restaurants, yet unless you are eating by the pool, none of them have outdoor seating. You cannot eat breakfast outside, one of my favorite things to do at a resort. 7. Stay away from Raul at the blackjack tables. He'll take everything you've got.

Reviews.Title: “No power and broken elevator”
Reviews.Author: rxkate
Reviews.Content: We checked into the Conrad and they gave us a room very quickly even though we were there at 8:30 am. We walked through the casino that smelled like a gym/locker room. We then went to our room which was on the other side of the street. Upon arrival the power was out in 3/4 of the sockets. We called the desk and they sent an electrician up quickly. We were told that we would need to switch rooms. I wouldn't have minded if the elevators had not decided to stop working right then which required us to carry our bags down three flights of stairs. Upon arrival the new room had a funny smell, but was fine once we aired it out. From there everything else went smoothly. The pros of this room were the bath amenities and the high water flow shower. The hotel was very trendy looking in the lobby and the rooms. We were able to find restaurants that were reasonably priced fairly close to the hotel and there was an internet cafe about 1/2 mile away.

Reviews.Title: “The place to stay in San Juan!”
Reviews.Author: isabel058
Reviews.Content: Five star!!! I just stayed with my family for five days in January and found the hotel outstanding! The staff is most gracious and helpful. I had read some negative comments but these do not reflect the service we received. I am sure Leah Rossi or Edgardo in the front office would have assisted anyone facing a complaint! This is the place to stay in San Juan!

Reviews.Title: “Nice if you get a great deal and ocean view room!”
Reviews.Author: goodiespan
Reviews.Content: The hotel is ok for a resort hotel. The restaurants and cafe are average to good. The view from ocean view rooms is to die for!! Staff is very nice Pools are average. Very rocky beach not for bathing! Can catch a 75 cent ride to Old San Juan $16 cab from airport

Reviews.Title: “Terrible service!”
Reviews.Author: mcf317
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a week from Dec. 28, 2010 till Jan. 4, 2011. I would never come back to this hotel again and strongly advise people not to stay here. THE BAD: Because of the snow storm in NY, our flight was delayed by 5 hours, which meant we arrived at the hotel at 7pm instead of 2pm. Why is this relevant? Because at 7pm (THREE HOURS after check-out time) we were told that our room wasn't ready because it hadn't been cleaned yet. However, it took 15 minutes to even find this out, because the person "helping" us at the front desk kept answering the phone while he was checking us in and wasn't communicating with us at all. Finally the night manager stepped in and offered to give us another (lesser) room to use while they cleaned our room. And after we complained, he offered us $100 credit to use at one of their restaurants. However, we wound up standing at the front desk for a full hour to work this all out. And during all this waiting, we struck up a conversation with a young woman who had been waiting since 2pm for her room. (i.e. Our situation was not unique...it was happening to others too.) When we finally got to our actual room (9pm!) it was not really clean. The counter-tops had crumbs and coffee stains on them and I was afraid to put anything on them because they looked disgusting. Despite complaining about this EVERY DAY, the counter-tops were never cleaned to our satisfaction. The room was very loud. Violent door slamming happened all through the night. (The bathroom doors slide instead of opening on a hinge, and I guess if you aren't careful the door will slam into the wall if you don't make an effort to stop that from happening.) But we were woken up 2-3x per night, every night, by incessant door slamming. The service at Cafe Caribe was ATROCIOUS! We had free breakfast every day with our package, and after two days I regretted it. The place would be 1/2 to 3/4 full and they'd have a line of people waiting to be seated. And when you asked why it was taking so long they'd say, "we're very busy" despite having many, many empty tables. Waiters and waitresses would walk by your table multiple times without making eye contact when you were clearly ready to order. (On one day, we literally sat for 40 minutes, menus closed and down, before standing up and waving our arms to flag someone down to take our order! And then we got burnt french toast...it was literally black.) Complaints to the manager were received in a professional way, but he clearly had no control of his staff and was unable to fix anything. Although the food was good, I'd avoid this restaurant at all costs. Pikayo, the hotel's "high end" restaurant, also proved to be disappointing. When telling us the specials, the waiter noted that the chocolate souffle needed to be ordered at the same time as the entrees because it took a long time to cook. So we did that. And then waited FORTY FIVE minutes after they cleared our plates for it to arrive because the pastry chef forgot about our order. We were the last ones in the restaurant and they were literally cleaning up before we finally got the dessert. The outdoor cafe is SUPER expensive and they automatically add the tip onto the bill. Service was super slow. And their "happy hour" which supposedly gets you half price drinks did not include the drinks we ordered. (of course!) The hotel hosted a New Year's Eve party that cost $80 per person. If you bought the ticket from the hotel it was $90. (we only got the lower price by accident...) This price gave you admission and "open bar". Well, the open bar consisted of beer, one type of vodka, one type of rum, and one type of whiskey. And the only drinks were what I like to call "something and something". So rum and coke was free. But a mojito (which is complicated to make but only has rum) was full price. Champagne was full price. Wine was full price. Etc. It was a major ripoff. At least the music was good... Finally, the casino is a dump and the waiter/waitress service is a joke. THE GOOD: The food and the service at Varita was excellent. The service issues we encountered were dealt with in a reasonable way. At Pikayo, our dessert and our wine was removed from the bill. At Cafe Caribe, one of our meals was free. (although we'd already paid ahead of time, so that didn't really help) In addition to the $100 food credit we received for not having the room ready, we complained to the Head Manager the next day and he took one night off our bill. That was nice. There is a lot of space to lay out by the pool and the beach, although small, was nice. THE VERDICT: This place has a lot of flaws. They do try to correct their mistakes, but there were just way too many of them in the course of one week for me to think it was just a coincidence. And as such, I can't recommend this place unless you happen to get an incredible deal. Although I only saw their lobbies and their restaurants, the La Concha (very close by), Marriott Stellaris (also close) and the El San Juan (in Isla Verde) were MUCH, MUCH nicer and fancier than the Condado Plaza. If I ever go back to San Juan, I'll stay at one of those places.

Reviews.Title: “Great pool next to great beach”
Reviews.Author: BostonTexans
Reviews.Content: All around a great experience, in line with other Conrads/Hiltons similarly priced. The pool was outstanding, and is where I spent most of my time. There is a small beach next to it which is also very beautiful (though a little more crowded). The bars were hip, nice places to be at night.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel...Crappy beach”
Reviews.Author: BfromChicago
Reviews.Content: This is an absolutely beautiful hotel. It is honest ly just as nice as the pictures look online. The lobby is hip and very tastefuly decorated, as were the rooms. I highly suggest booking an oceanfront room though, as the view from the "city view" rooms is very hit or miss (if you stay in city view, make sure to request a room as high up as possible) The pool area and the grassy Hammock areas near the ocean are also top notch. My only complaint about this place, is that the pics of the beach online are very misleading. The beach is tiny, and backs right up to a busy, congested bridge. Honestly, I did not care for most of the beaches in the San Juan area, so we ended up driving to the east side of the island everyday , where deserted, white sand beaches are plentiful..If you are going to PR for a beach experience, I highly sugest renting a car and driving to Luquillo or Seven Seas every morning..Its only 45min away, but its another world. I do suggest staying in the Condado area though for he luxury hotels, outstanding dining selections, and close prximity to Old San Juan. Bottom line, I highly reccomend Condado Plaza

Reviews.Title: “Top of the line”
Reviews.Author: eternalglass
Reviews.Content: My family and I wanted to do something different for New Year''s Eve. We decided to take two rooms, one for my wife and I and the second for my two daughters - 20 and 18 yrs. old. The hotel was having a party which included live music and a soft rock concert with one of the local bands which was scheduled to start at 1:00 a.m. The ticket included VIP seating and open bar. Check-in is at 4:00 p.m. so we decided to arrive around 5:15 to avoid long lines. As expected the lines were short and check-in went smoothly. The rooms were very nice; looking to the ocean. We had dinner at one of the hotel restaurants - Varita. I should add that the food and service were excellent. The prices were a little high but one must pay for quality. The party started at 10:00 p.m. and we came in around 11:00 p.m. The music was great, service was fine, and several bartenders were at the bar so you didn't have to wait too long for drinks. We had a great time and the band started playing around 1:30 a.m. My wife and I stayed until 4 am. and my daughters continued to have a good time until 6:00 a.m. We had a good night sleep and left the hotel around 11:00 a.m. next day (check out is at noon). Checkout was very easy and smooth. I definitely recommend this hotel. I should add that security was very good and the casino was fine. Alberto RodrÃ­guez-Ramos

Reviews.Title: “not four-star rooms or service”
Reviews.Author: sethdirect
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Condado Dec 28-30 with my girlfriend and we had to switch rooms twice -- the first time because our shower leaked onto the bathroom floor, the second time because they moved us into a room right next to a loud ice machine. The front desk staff only reluctantly agreed to move us. Even in our third room, the paint was peeling on the ceiling and it was a generally shabby room. The carpet connecting the two towers is torn and threadbare. This is not the quality of a four-star resort. If you go expecting a three-star resort, you may be satisfied. The hotel needs to invest in maintenance and renovations. On the other hand, Pikayo, the restaurant in the hotel, is excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Paris versus Conrad”
Reviews.Author: goodwig
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the Conrad Hilton 4-5 times and explored the hotel scene quite thoroughly before rebooking my somewhat frequent 3-5 day respite to Puerto Rico. Though familiar with the Caribe, I always chose the Conrad (formerly, the Westin, etc.) because it was more ideally situated on the Condado strip and, therefore, more accessible by foot to stores, hotels, restaurants, etc. There are virtually no local establishments near the Caribe and a short cab ride would be required unless you are willing to walk across the bridge that separates the hotel from the Condado area. This Xmas I decided to take a chance and start at the Caribe, but with the proviso that I could move the next day if not pleased. The Caribe is huge, sprawling, full of amenities, and a virtual city unto itself. Technically, It has everything you might expect or want from a large resort. However, it lacks intimacy and can feel overwhelming by the impersonal feel of such a megaresort. We moved the next day to the Conrad (after confirming that a oceanfront room with balcony was available) at about the same rate as the Caribe. The Conrad has a more contemporary style with softer overtones, but with similar amenities and more elegant As a seasoned traveler, I expect problems and glitches. But all in all, either hotel will suit your needs as long as you do your homework.

Reviews.Title: “Condado District”
Reviews.Author: Aussietraveller53
Reviews.Content: Remodelled hotel, well positioned. Offers Lagoon view or Ocean view to enjoy the Condado district and restaurants. 2 EXCELLENT restaurants and 3 cafes within the hotel. VERY comfortable queen size beds. 3 pools offered, (activities happen each day at the pool) swim up bar, water slide for children, table tennis, enjoyable eating area beside the pool and small beach. Bus stop immediately outside hotel., old San Juan city is 10-15 minute busride - as we went at Christmas time there was 30/50minute wait for the bus.....but then the service got better after Christmas day. Taxis offered for trips into old San Juan - always 'haggle' with the driver as they charge too much, offer to ride with other passengers for cheaper fare.

Reviews.Title: “Look of the lobby is the only good thing...don't waste your money here...”
Reviews.Author: gautamagg
Reviews.Content: I am writing this review while I am staying at the Conrad Condado. I have been here since December 26th and am supposed to be here until December 31. The hotel presented us to a very plush lobby and we were looking forward to our stay here BUT unfortunately it all stopped there. 1) We booked a CITY VIEW room but on arrival we checked into a room that faces the other tower of the same hotel. I immediately asked for a change and was told that my request would be handled the next day. When I called the next day, I was told the hotel is full. So I walked down at the front desk - to my surprise, the person on the front desk told me, "The view to the other tower is a CITY VIEW" and will not change the room - to that I created a bit of a noise and then a lady claiming to be the "manager" came and said she will change the room for me which she did. I thanked her and was happy....But wait a minute. 2) I moved my stuff to the new room and the wife and I went out for the day. We came back around 10p (Dec 27th) and noticed that our bathroom toilet refilled the tank every 10 minutes and made a loud noise. SInce it was 10p and we were so tired, we decided to ask for a fix the next day and tried to sleep. We were unable to sleep and got up groggy on the 28th (today) and on our way out for the day, told the front desk about the problem and requested to get it fixed before we came back. BUT to my surprise when we came back at 8p the issue persisted. I went down to the FD to inquire and the person had no clue of what was going on and told me that I should go back to the room and she will cal me for an update (this was after waiting 30 mins in line on a FD with only 1 person around 8pm). Since I did not hear back from anyone for 45 mins, I called again and was put on hold for 15mins before someone answered my call - the same woman said she will talk to the manager and put me on hold for another 15mins; at which point I disconnected waiting for so long. Around 945p the manager (so the person claimed) called me saying he will send someone....I am still waiting (its 10p) and I hope someone will show up. Regardless, this experience has left a bad taste and I will never recommend this hotel to to anyone. I don't want to change my room again (which they are now offering, after earlier claiming to be full) and am so tried with the service here...pathetic is an understatement!!! ...Oh wait a minute - the mechanic just came and "FIXED" the issue....NOTTTTT...barely 5 minutes after he left problem continues....so now I really call this a complete sucky experience! To recap - the hotel lobby is good, rooms are good (sans the noise), food is decent (for all of that I will come here again) BUT the service is the worst I have ever experienced - understaffed front desks, long ringing calls to the FD that go an answered and a mostly no so friendly FD staff especially a gentleman whose name I did not read. If you can live in a hotel w/o service this is a good bet else this SUCKS...and I don't demand high service standards and am an easy person to please.... My wife had read some -ve comments on Tripadvisor but since the manager had responded saying contact him and he will fix it, we decided to give it a shot. BAD CALL!!!

Reviews.Title: “Very Disappointed.”
Reviews.Author: kissedpicasso
Reviews.Content: We booked a Ocean View Superior room with a Balcony. What we got was a two foot ledge with railing that looked out over the first floor roof. When complained to front desk, explained that I had booked this room way in advance and had spend about $400.00 for the room and that I didn't feel the room I recieved was the room I booked. Well, after about 30 minutes the young trendy girl at the front desk said there was nothing the managment could do but give me a $25.00 certificate for food or bar drinks. Now more about my room and the hotel. I'm really tired of "trendy hotels" lacking in class and service. My rooms all glass shower leaked all over the floor due to the seal not working any more. The trendy sliding barn style bathrooms doors would not stay on there tract. The open style closet and luggage area is right out side the shower door (yes, in the bathroom) so if anyone needs to get to their belongings while others are using the bathoom.... well, lets just say there is not much privacy. There is no tub. Only one sink (room for two). Only one very small chair in the room. Safe was locked unusable when we got there (had to call for service). You will have to wear a pink bracelet like at a bar when you go to check out the wallmart quality pool towels. Not exactly "superior"... and no ink in the kiosk where you print out boarding passes for airlines. The lobby is very pleasent but I'm really getting tired of Hotels calling themselfs "Luxury" or "Resort" just because they have modern trendy decor that often doesn't work. Nice samply bottles and Marble sinks don't cut it for me... If you are looking for a quiet place to stay I recommend El Convento, If you have children I recommend the Marriot Sellaris (nice big bathtubs with sep. showers) and yes i have stayed in both. I do not recommend the La Concha unless you are looking for ear-numbing music in the lobby and again.... trendy decor that just doesn't work (under 35 crowd) My advice to Conrad.... time for management that cares about the experience of each hotel guest with personal detail to each complaint and each complaint met with respect.

Reviews.Title: “good”
Reviews.Author: Drugo84
Reviews.Content: good service, friendly service desk, shops casino and restaurants insiede or near the hotel

Reviews.Title: “I got mugged but still a good experience overall”
Reviews.Author: TravelEnthusiastYYZ
Reviews.Content: I visited San Juan for the first time from Dec 16 till Dec 21 and stayed at the Conrad Condado Plaza. My reviews covers the good, bad and ugly not only about the hotel but also the city in general. Safety: First, let's get the ugly out of the way. I was mugged at gunpoint at Carolina Beach in the Isla Verde area on Dec 18th and lost $180, my camera and all the pictures that I took at Old San Juan the day before. It happened at a quiet part of the beach but it was 1 pm in the afternoon and there were some people nearby. I have traveled around the world and this was the first time that I have ever got robbed. It may have been an isolated incident. But I strongly advise anyone traveling to San Juan be very careful and always leave passport and valuables at the hotel. Better yet, try not to be too adventurous and stay in the hotel zone. Condado area where Conrad and most other new resorts are located seems safe and there are lots of cops on patrol every day and night. Certain parts of Isla Verde seems shady, particularly the west end of the Carolina Beach where the high rise condos are located. Stay away from that area! Hotel: Conrad has recently gone through a multi-million dollar renovation and it really shows. The lobby is gorgeous and the room is tastefully decorated. The bed is very comfortable too. I was upgraded to an ocean view room and the view was truly spectacular! There are some downsides, however. The "glass box" concept of the shower stall may look good on paper but leakage is a big problem as mentioned in other reviews. Also, the doors are not sound proofed well and I could people talking in their rooms in the hallway. Compared to La Concha down the street, which is the "in" place in San Juan right now, Conrad is a little subdued and low key. But I quite liked Conrad as La Concha seems to be trying too hard with their super trendy lobby bar and courtyard restaurant. If you prefer loud house music and expensive drinks that come with it, La Concha is the place to go. But if you prefer a comfortable and contemporary hotel without too much noise, then pick Conrad. I do agree with some of the reviews on other two drawbacks of this hotel: a) The beach is very small and is open to the public. La Concha does have a better beach. b) The area around Conrad is a bit run down. However, everything nice is within walking distance. Overall, it is great value for the money that I paid on Travelocity. Food: You have to try the local delicacy Mofongo which is mashed plantain stuffed with shredded beef, pork or shrimps. Yummy! Make sure you visit Ropa Vieja just 5 minutes walk from Conrad. The food is amazing and very reasonably priced! For breakfast, you can save a couple of bucks at the Hacienda Don Jose near the hotel but the food is very mediocre and has very small portions. I also ate at Latin Star and Cafe De Angel across from La Concha. Average food and slightly over priced probably because of the location. Cafe Cabri at Conrad provides okay food and convenience. The 8 Noodle Bar is expensive. It cost me $30 to get 10 pieces of sushi. I did not try Varita at the hotel but heard good reviews about the food. Attractions: I'm a world traveler and Old San Juan is one of the most picturesque places I have ever been to. The two forts El Morro and San Christobal are both amazing. Most people only visit El Morro as it is THE landmark. But don't miss San Christobal. It is equally impressive if not more. The views by the ocean are absolutely stunning! The El Yunque Rainforest is about a 40 minutes drive away but it's definitely worth the trip. Make sure you take a hike in the forest and see the La Marina waterfall. You can book a tour to the forest at the hotel for $50 for half day and $75 for full day. Do not spend money on tours to old San Juan and/or the Bacardi factory. Not worth the $50/$75 they charge you! Simply take bus 21 or 53 (bus stop right outside the hotel) to old San Juan (75 cents one trip) and take the ferry to Bacardi (another 50 cents). And it's way more interesting to see the city that way. You get two free drinks at Bacardi! These are just some of the highlights of my trip. I got mugged for the first time in my life. But the scenery, history, culture and food kind of make up for it. If you have any specific questions about the hotel or San Juan in general, please feel free to shoot me an email. Thanks!

Reviews.Title: “Horrible service, not what you expect from the this brand hotel.”
Reviews.Author: JoeBruin1
Reviews.Content: We called the Hotel regarding the type of room that we wanted (we specified a king size bed, which was also the selected bed on Orbitz upon booking). We arrived and the front desk confirmed a king sized bed upon check-in. We come up after spending 10 hours on a red eye flight to find two queen sized beds. (there is a big difference between a king and queen sized bed, but at that point we were too exhausted to care) Later to my surprise, the room and shower was a disabled access and ADA compliant. There were no shower doors to stop the flow of water to the bathroom. It was obvious that the Conrad Condado did not know what they were doing by giving us two queens instead of the king that they CONFIRMED TWICE (three times if you count the Orbitz booking) and giving us a disabled accessible/ADA room that we never requested. This room was was not acceptable since I was constantly slipping on the wet tiles when I got out of the bathroom. I called the front desk to complain and asked change rooms. The person at the front desk said that all rooms in the hotel were like that (which was a lie because eventually we were transferred to a room with a shower door). Later that evening I went down stairs to the front desk and complained about the obvious safety hazard. The front desk person/employee said she could not do anything about it because: (1) I PAID THROUGH ORBITZ AND THUS I GOT THE CHEAPEST ROOM--which would be the Disable Accessible room (complaint with the ADA, but a hazard for an able bodied person); (2) second she claimed that the hotel was booked. With no manager during that evening shift, I decided to return the next day. I came back the next day to speak to a manager. I threatened that the condition in our current room (with no shower doors) was ripe for a lawsuit and they were on notice three times. Eventually, she did change the room to a regular room with shower doors, but it still had two queen sized beds. At this point, not getting injured and not ruining my vacation were higher priorities than getting a room with the same view and same size room and bed. My issues with the Conrad did not stop with the room problems, upon check out (after staying 6 nights)I was again faced with rude service and inattentive employees. I arrive at the front desk a 7:15 am to catch a flight to the US. The only front desk employee was trying to solve a complex transaction with another customer. Rather than attempt to get another employee to help her out or see if my transaction could be solved in a few key strokes (which it could have been since I was only checking out), the employee continued with the transaction; and at one point chatted for 5 minutes with the bell hop in front of me and the previous customer. At that point I asked if there was another employee or a machine that could do a quick check out. What I got a a curt "NO, she was the only one there", with no empathy that their guest was trying to catch a morning flight. The rooms do not make up the horrible service that a guest will receive at the Conrad. The rooms are not spectacular. The rooms are old and there are spots in the bathrooms ceiling where the maintenance staff have painted over spots of mold. I addition the bathrooms are small. I am 5'10" 175lbs. and I can hardly fit in the bathroom. The pool and beach area are not that great. The speck of land that they call a beach is OPEN TO THE GENERAL PUBLIC AND CONSISTS OF A LAGOON NEAR THE AVENIDA ASHFORD BRIDGE. This a major security concern and it does not look all that inviting. Also the pool is open and is accessible from Avenida Ashford; one could just waltz in. Although, there is security, the fact that the pool is open to the street causes concern. Next to the hotel is a GUTTED-OUT hotel filled with graffiti, and an couple of apartments in the same condition as the said hotel. These structures give the Conrad a nice depressed look, but to be fair Avenida Ashford is prime real estate in the city. As a warning to other travelers and people wisely allocating their limited budgets on travel, AVOID THE CONRAD AT ALL COSTS! The hotel is not worth your hard earned money. The service is horrible and the staff needs to be trained in the finer points of customer service, especially for this hotel brand. In addition, regardless of where and what site I book my hotel, I should not be treated as a second class citizen. This is uncalled for and should not be tolerated by the management at the Conrad. This is the worst stay I had at a Hilton brand hotel. I travel 1-2 months a year for pleasure and business, and 70% of the time I stay at a Hilton brand hotel. I can assure you this is by far the worst treatment I ever received. I guess you get what you paid for... at the Conrad Condado, you also get ripped off.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, just don't expect a Conrad”
Reviews.Author: cjfosler
Reviews.Content: Our experience at this hotel is mixed. I couldn't decide between 3 and 4 star. I ended on 4, it doesn't deserve a 3. You shouldn't expect a Conrad, though. We did but should have known better with the great rate we got. Our check-in experience was less than exciting. The man checking us in seemed a bit like he could care less that we were there...Whatever. The rooms are nice. Very cool decor. Excellent view of the ocean. The bed was comfortable. Plenty of space. The whole set up was fine for my husband and I although I would warn non-couples. The bathroom door isn't really a door. It's 2 sliders that meet in the middle, no latch or anything. The shower is a glass one in the middle of the room. This is also where the dresser/closet, coffee pot and safe are. What I'm saying is no privacy. The balconies are wonderful. Enough space for 4 to hang out. Total privacy. You can't see or hear anyone else. Speaking of hearing others, you can hear most of what goes on in the hall from your bed. And the doors slam. We did have a problem with the shower as we have with many glass showers in hotels lately. They leak. Our drain wasn't fast enough so the water leaked out the door. Hotels have errored in installing these. The first time I used the shower I got out and the bathroom was a lake. We called about this twice and never had anyone solve the problem. We would build a dam with towels when we showered so water didn't go all over the bathroom. You'd think the maid would have gotten tired of cleaning up soaking wet towels for 6 days. The beach is bad. Very small. The sand is nice until you get to the water, then it's all rock. We did enjoy the pools. They do serve food and drinks at the pool. Aqua is the bar/restaurant. Good food. Pretty good service. We also ate at Picayo. This is a fine dining restaurant. Prices are high but the atmosphere and food are great. Varita has good food. They call it casual but it's nicer than casual. Service was bad. Not that friendly and very slow. Cafe Caribe is ok food, nothing exciting. Slow service. Even just for drinks. The casino is nothing great at all. Not the exciting casino atmosphere you may be looking for if you like Vegas. There is not 24 hour room service. They close at 10, I think. No mini bar in the room. They lost money on us, we would have used one. Overall, we enjoyed our trip but with the Conrad name we expected more. Had it not been a Conrad we probably wouldn't have noticed as much. Except the shower thing. That was a pain.

Reviews.Title: “Priceless view of the Atlantic Ocean and Condado”
Reviews.Author: albert407
Reviews.Content: Great location to avoid the traffic in Condado and old San Juan. This place is great! All rooms with balconies facing the Atlantic or Condado bay. The rooms facing the city also have a great view. Lobby is very modern, many hotels in Puerto Rico are taking this style in last cople of years. State of the art Gym, HUGE. Great pools, tennis court and Sushi restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place to stay”
Reviews.Author: HoosierTravelers2010
Reviews.Content: This hotel was great. We were celebrating my husbands 60th birthday and received a free upgrade and a chocolate treat was waiting for us when we arrived. The room was very nice and the pools are beautiful. Everyone was so friendly and helpful with any questions we had. We rode the bus (bus stop right outside hotel) to Old San Juan for 0.75 cents. The beach is small but very clean and nice. Many resturants a short walk away. There are some abandon buildings near by. We think this is a great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing service.”
Reviews.Author: Palmasolabay
Reviews.Content: Pensioners, given 10th floor room lagoon side. Lifts out of service first day. Had to walk down 7 floors. No cups provided for tea maker. Requested and supplied 2 glasses. Asked again but none delivered. Went to main desk and asked for 2 cups, gave up after 30 minutes wait. Never did get a cup of tea. Complained on return home to Hilton Group. Received apology from Hotel Manager and thanks for pointing out shortcomings. My advice: service poor! which is a shame but pensioners might want to give this one a miss , there are plenty of hotels that would have dealt with this problem much better. Shame on you Hilton Group.

Reviews.Title: “Do not believe the negative reviews!”
Reviews.Author: oncloud22
Reviews.Content: I was somewhat hesitant to book here after reading some of the reviews on Trip Advisor. I am glad I didn't listen. After spending three nights here, I just can't imagine what anyone has to complain about. I came here with my fiancee to celebrate our engagment. Our flight got in at noon so I emailed Leah Rossi to ask for an early check in. We got to the hotel....there were no lines. Immediately I was greeted by the staff who all congratulated me on my engagement. Our room was ready right away and we got a beautiful Ocean Front room in the tower by the pools. We immediately changed into our swimsuits and headed to the pool. The bar staff there were super nice. Jimmi from Scranton, PA was our favorite! The second day at the hotel we came into our room to find a complimentary bottle of champagne waiting for us. What a beautiful gesture. The rooms were clean, the atmosphere was friendly and the weather was perfect. What can anyone complain about? Seriously. Please do not listen to the negative reviews here. I'm glad I didn't.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing View! The best ever.”
Reviews.Author: UnclePen
Reviews.Content: The Conrad has two towers. I can't speak for the one off of the ocean, but the Ocean View room on the beachfront tower had a panoramic view of the rocky shore that couldn't possible be beat. The tower is very close to the coral reef sheltering the shoreline. The waves crash on the reef and the spray showers all over the lawn of the hotel. The decor of the room is really cool, with a colorful red interior and modern fixtures. The bed faced the ocean and was a super comfortable king-sized bed with luxury linens. We slept with the balcony door open and it was like a dream night of sleeping on the beach. I highly recommend the Conrad, and recommend pushing hard for the Oceanside rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: 2010-Fajardo
Reviews.Content: We got this room online for a super cheap rate. We got the 2nd tower room with ocean view, then we asked for an upgrade and... we got 1st tower ocean view!!! rooms were modern which i really loved! Staff was super nice and helpful each and every day.

Reviews.Title: “Solid value but falls short of "Conrad" brand.”
Reviews.Author: efish724
Reviews.Content: Easily the best hotel for the money in Condado. The hotel is stylish, modern, and attractively priced. The rooms are small-ish and simple (think airport Hilton), but brightly decorated and clean. The service is cold and uninspiring, but did meet all of our needs. The hotel is composed of two towers on opposing sides of the street, which means that amenities (like pools, fitness, restaurants) are split and kind of in-cohesive. The beach is legitimately poor - so if that's what you're interested in, stay elsewhere. The restaurants all have fairly formal dress codes. If you come expecting the lofty expectations the Conrad brand brings to mind, you'll be disappointed, but for the money it is a solid value, especially for short transit stays. If you're looking for a place to log beach/pool time - other hotels (like the Marriott) might be better.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed.”
Reviews.Author: Juls082_10
Reviews.Content: Spent Thanksgiving week at the Conrad prior to our arrival I emailed Leah Rossi regarding our trip and asked for sight seeing information. She was very nice and sent me the information. In addition we were booked for the city view and she informed us that we had and ocean view. We loved it and everyone was very nice. My only compliant was the housekeeping they did the beds and provided clean towels. We had to seek them out to get extra towels. I asked that the clean the floor and vacuum the rugs but they did not. I notice the same spots the whole week we spent there. However, I would consider staying at this hotels once again. My son and boyfriend enjoyed the stay. It's a shame that the poolside bar was not open and being repaired.

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: mileshigh033
Reviews.Content: My wife and I had an excellent stay at the Conrad in San Juan. The ocean view rooms are excellent. We were very pleased with decor. Nice large bathrooms, with a handy small frig in the room. My wife and I loved the little beach connected to the hotel. We found the staff to be friendly and helpful. If you have any concerns or questions get in touch with the concierge, Leah Rossi, she is highly recommended. The Conrad, made our trip extra special. 5 stars

Reviews.Title: “great rooms and close to all that San Juan has to offer!!!”
Reviews.Author: Arakhujel
Reviews.Content: My husband and I decided to take a trip to PR. as this was our first time travelling there to stay at a hotel we wanted to make sure that it was a good trip. We could not have picked a better place to stay. The rooms were clean and very modern. the lobby was clutter free and everyone was extremely helpful. we had booked tickets for the old san juan tour (a must if you are a first timer here) and forgot to print our tickets before the computer room closed. but the front desk clerk was so accommodating, even allowing us to print our tickets from one of the computers in the back office. he saved us!!! pools were great. I love the salt water pool mainly because there was less children there. But thats a personal preference. if you are a beach person this is not the place for you. The beach is very small and its public so just be mindful of what type of person you are. waitstaff was great and nothing was ever an issue. a couple of great restaurants on the strip. go to Ropa Vieja down the block (a little pricey but some of the best and most authentic food we tried). San Juan was a SHORT bus ride away. It was way cheaper than taking a cab to Old San Juan. all in all a great vacation. very relaxing and close to San Juan which is where most of the action is. A couple of my friends stayed here right after our stay and had the same feedback. definitely worth the money!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great ocean front room, lousy service”
Reviews.Author: Cinderrock
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a five day stay. As others have said the hotel is not up to Conrad standards. It is what it is and you need to know that going in. The front desk staff was great, as well as transportation and a few others. The restaurant staff in the Cafe were horrible. Out of five days they brought me the wrong food on three of them. The waiter the last day was good, I actually got a refill on my coffee. The girls working the bar were so slow it was unbelievable. We were wondering if they had any intention of serving us at all, and I had to get up and go to the bar to get our first round. The hotel is trying to be trendy but comes off a little 70's garish. We got a great rate so we overlooked a lot but make sure you check your bill thoroughly before you sign. We had a good time but I don't think we would stay here again, maybe we just aren't that trendy anymore.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful and near it all!”
Reviews.Author: BerryJenJen
Reviews.Content: Modern furnishings, beautiful bathroom, cozy, not huge, but the location and the views are amazing! Excellent service too! They have an incredible casino, great lounge/bar music, fantastic pools! I highly recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay in San Juan”
Reviews.Author: JOC7755
Reviews.Content: After reading so many negative reviews, I felt the hotel deserved a response from a satisfied customer. I stayed three days at the Conrad and thought the hotel was very good. The rooms were very clean and well-appointed (though there was some mold in the bathroom), and the grounds and facilities were very nice. Security was not an issue. But the staff deserves special praise. We arrived several hours prior to check in time, and staff worked hard to get us into our rooms a couple hours early despite also dealing with dozens of cruise ship passengers also requesting early check-in and teams and fans in town for the basketball tournament. While we waited, the concierge kept our luggage in safe keeping. While waiting for our afternoon flight out of San Juan, the concierge again kept our bags so we could spend an extra couple of hours out by the pool. The dining options at the hotel were outstanding. Minor complaint was that wi-fi service was not working when we arrived. Hotel was walking distance from dining and shopping in Condado and a $12 cab ride to Old San Juan.

Reviews.Title: “Really enjoyed our stay!”
Reviews.Author: DBHouston
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Conrad from Fri, 11/12 - Mon, 11/15. I booked the Fall Getaway package so we only paid for two nights instead of three so the value was excellent. Check-in was quick but we got off to a rough start when we got to the room assigned and the bed looked like someone had rolled around in it and it was unmade. We went down to the front desk and was switched immediately to another room. This room had a better view of the city and ocean and we were right next to the pool elevators which were a best kept secret b/c we never had to wait. The room was very modern, comfy bed and I loved the shower stall even though it leaked a little on the floor but no big deal. I can't say much about the hotel food b/c we ate out for lunch and dinner everyday and only ate breakfast at the Caribe Cafe. Breakfast was pretty good every morning and suprisingly affordable. I liked the fact that the cafe overlooked the ocean. Also there's an ice cream parlor at the Caribe Cafe that we frequently visited. There's a nice casino and the outdoor scenery along the Atlantic Ocean when resting in the hammocks is really nice. There is a beach but very small but we don't spend the day relaxing at the beach anyway so no biggie. We didn't even step foot on the beach during our visit. The pools and jacuzzi were nice and we had them all to ourselves at night. There's also laundry facilities which we used after horseback riding on a muddy trail. The only thing I was unpleased with was the $7.50 per 15 minutes you have to pay to use the internet in the business center. With the exception of a few abandoned buildings the area is nice and there are plenty of food choices on the Condado strip. Overall we had a great time and will definitely be back soon!

Reviews.Title: “Breathtaking Views/Upscale DÃ©cor & Very Professional Staff”
Reviews.Author: ExquisitelyRomantic
Reviews.Content: WOW, WHERE DO I BEGIN!!. I chose to visit Puerto Rico for my Anniversary and could not imagine how overwhelmingly exquisite the Conrad San Juan Condado Plaza would be. My room was located on the ocean view side which I would highly recommend. The entire hotel is modern and very elegant. The staff was very attentive as well as informative. Ask your questions and you will receive your answers, itâ€™s that simple. From fine dining to your regular American restaurants there is so much to do for every budget itâ€™s truly your choice. Activities are endless! All you have to do is see the activity coordinator and they will set you up based on your personal preferences. The Conrad San Juan alone has many amenities itself like several restaurants, a personable beach, several pools and several Jacuzzis on both sides of the buildings (just select M in the elevator and walk to the left to access the second half of the Conrad San Juan) You will also find the Casino there where I will hope you run into â€œBuddyâ€� ï�Š we seem to bump into him our entire stay and he too was very informative about the Hotel, its amenities and any other questions we had about the area. He was very professional and always asked us if we were enjoying ourselves and made recommendations. The night life on the weekend was like a ballroom out of a movie. On Friday and Saturday the Conrad truly goes all out with the bar areas located on their main lobby floor. Everyone was dressed elegantly and the atmosphere was again very remarkably put together from the mixture of music to the lighting and modern dÃ©cor throughout the entire area.
