A couple of areas I would like to recommend are also listed below beginning with the BEST breakfast place which is located less than 100 feet from the Conrad. When exiting the hotel just walk to the left and you will see the Ocean Front sign that reads $7.25 for breakfast( which also includes your coffee and orange juice). This place will seat you right at ocean view and has an old rustic look that truly represents the old Latin style. If you continue to walk you will find all your shops and many more restaurants. I have two dinner areas to recommend and one will be the Puerto Peru Restaurant which is in walking distance from the Conrad San Juan I had the filet mignon with chimichurri sauce that was to die for. If you go into the old San Juan, please visit the Latin Roots Restaurant. If you find parking or take a cab, you should definitely just park and walk around because that area is very beautiful. The Latin Roots Restaurant has a trolley that drives around promoting the restaurant which is why I'm suggesting you parkï�Š. You have to ride the trolley because after he takes you to the restaurant the driver will tour around town and explains some of the sites before he takes you back to where he picked you up at. I actually went there for lunch so I didnâ€™t get to experience the night club that I didnâ€™t know they had. When I return to PR -that is definitely on my lists of things to do because the set up they had was for a live band so that alone is a guaranteed good time. I truly can go on for days about my wonderful experience but I would just like to end with a very special thanks to Leah Rossi. Leah Rossi is the Concierge Guest Service Manager who is a great asset to the Conrad San Juan Hotel. She truly represents the establishment as elegantly and professional as it is. Because it was my Anniversary and a surprise to my husband I needed help with putting it all together and she sincerely made my special requests go exactly as planned with a little extra touch of her own. I cannot thank her enough for making it go as smooth and special as it did. I will definitely go there again only next time it will be with my family (canâ€™t be selfish all the time ï�Š). I have to share my experience with them and will recommend the Conrad San Juan to all my friends and all you review readers. 5 Star all the way!

Reviews.Title: “Best In Condado”
Reviews.Author: jlandatty
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel! The decor is outstanding as is the location. I am in Puerto Rico monthly and have stayed at most of the hotels in the area. The Conrad stands out as a clean, quiet outstanding hotel. Forget the petty reviews that say otherwise; take it from a business traveler who has stayed at many hotels in the Condado, Isla Verde area, the Conrad is a quality hotel and deserving of its four star rating.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel, but has potential for more”
Reviews.Author: emg1972
Reviews.Content: I joined my a friend who conducts business in San Juan frequently so this was the hotel his company had been putting him up in. The 8th floor oceanview room with balcony was fantastic. The room was spacious and inviting with warm red tones. The glass shower in the bathroom was unique. Eat at Pikayo...probably one of the best meals I've ever had in my entire life. Just outstanding. Varita is also nice (especially if you're a sports fan as they always have the games on) for a more casual atmosphere. We were dressed to the nines for Pikayo because it was my birthday dinner. The meals and drinks inside the hotel can be pricey, but then again, what resort hotel isn't? The beach was rocky so be careful of sea urchins that live in the rocks, but it's fantastic for snorkeling. Also great for snorkeling is Escambron Beach which is about a 5 minute drive from the Conrad. Housekeeping could pay more attention to making sure the hotel is kept in tip top shape. I walked past a food stain/spot on the carpet in the hallway every day of my 6 day stay. No saying how long it had been there before I saw it, and no telling how long it was there after Ieft. Something like that should have been cleaned up immediately. It's just unsightly. Also, my only real complaint is that this is a non smoking property with smoking limited to very few areas around the property. The pool is not one of these areas and yet when I complained to security about people smoking IN the pool at the pool bar (and sometimes ashing their butts into the water), nothing was really done. They were talked to, but then just lit up again when they thought no one was looking. At one point, I couldn't even go into the pool becase of a group of women smoking like chimneys at the bar. I'm allergic and can't be around it. One of the reasons for choosing a non-smoking property. The bartenders even went so far as to give them ashtrays.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice rooms!”
Reviews.Author: BostonAdGirl
Reviews.Content: My husband and I took a belated honeymoon to Puerto Rico over Labor Day weekend and stayed at the Conrad for 2 nights on our way back from Culebra. I booked this hotel at the recommendation of friends who'd just come back from San Juan and local, Puerto Rican friends. Since I did it through my credit card points program, I didn't have much control over the size and location of the room so I read trip advisor reviews and came across the name and contact information of Leah Rossi, the manager there. I got in touch with her and she was incredibly accommodating and kind with all my requests, even when we almost had to cancel the trip (hurricane Earl!) and she offered to waive all cancellation fees if we did. When we got to the hotel we found out we had a beautiful 10th floor ocean view room with a king sized bed and balcony (I think she upgraded us for free)! Leah even sent up a complimentary bottle of champagne since we'd told her it was our overdue honeymoon, which was just the cherry on top of our awesome-so-far trip! Since we stayed here at the end of a 6 day trip and after spending 4 days burning to a crisp on a gorgeous island, we were mostly interested in relaxing and lounging by a poolside. This hotel was perfect for that - 3 pools, lots of lounge chairs and a bar in the middle of the main pool (albeit an expensive one, but then what hotel bar isn't?). I didn't even bother going onto the tiny beach area though my husband did and said it was too rocky to swim. We ended up spending a lot of our time hanging out by the pools or on our balcony reading and enjoying the breeze and the sound of the waves. I did however, take heed of some important points running through most Trip Advisor reviews: 1. Donâ€™t leave valuables in the room. 2. Have breakfast at Hacienda Don Jose down the street â€“ DELICIOUS, authentic, inexpensive and beautiful beach-front view. 3. the hotel apparently gives out free drink vouchers at check in which we did NOT know to ask for. Another couple staying there gave us theirs since they were leaving before they had been able to use theirs, so ask for them! In all, a great end to a fabulous trip. Thanks Leah, for your extra effort!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel - bad checkout experience”
Reviews.Author: philgaunt
Reviews.Content: The three pools are great. The pool on the sound side is quite private. The other two are by the ocean - one salt water pool and one with kids slide and swim up bar. The hotel is on a corner of an inlet and ocean. There is a neat little hidden spot with two chairs to watch the water splash on the rocks above the small beach on the inlet. NO ocean swimming at the hotel. The snorkeling at the cove is okay. I brought my own snorkel gear. The gym is great with lots of equipment plus a sauna, steam shower and hot tub. The room was clean and with a city view, we still had a good view of the ocean. We were big fans of the Waikiki restaurant down the street. Maid service kept running out of clean glasses and bottled water. Everything was great until we left the hotel - we had a good deal with 100 a night with fourth night free plus 75 credit. When I asked the front desk about the 75 dollar credit, they said it could be applied to the room. When we checked out, I made sure the 75 dollar was applied and was ready to jump in the cab to the airport. The front desk called to say they were removing the 75 credit and we had to spend it on hotel services. Impossible with a plane to catch. I asked for a manager to call my cell phone. Manager did not call. Unprofessional. Very disappointing end to a pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: bdaytrip50
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Condado Plaza the 26th thru 30th and we had a fabulous time. The Hotel location is great. The hotel is beautiful and the outside pool area is spectacular.I read all the reviews before I booked and was a bit nervous, but I used a bit of everybodys feedback and we did quite well. Leah Rossi, the concierge manager was so helpful as was ALL the staff. We ate at the Caribe a couple of times and it was very reasonable and good. We went out every night and it was safer than some of the areas of Boston. The beach at the hotel is not that bad, but if you walk a little ways up the street there are more beaches.Via Appia restaraunt to the left past the La Concha hotel is delicious!! If you are thinking of staying here it is well worth it. The rooms are beautiful and the ocean view is gorgeous.

Reviews.Title: “watch your valuables”
Reviews.Author: leescott31
Reviews.Content: Me, my girlfriend and four friends stayed at the Conrad hotel 10/23/10 - 10/30/10. We all got in on a Sat. morning and meet at the hotel.Our room wasnt ready so we went to the pool bar,as we sat down we both waited 15 min. for someone to even acknowlegde that we were there, this happened throughout the trip.The attendants do not speak unless spoken to. Not all of the workers act this way but most.We got our room and we were meeting friends for dinner so i put my cash($1000.00) and some other belongings in the safe, And i took my card to pay for dinner. The next day the group was going out to do some site seeing and some shopping, so my girlfriend tried to open the safe and it would not open. She tried twice and called me to try and i tried three more times and on the fourth time it finally opened which, was a little funny to me.So i get the money out so we can leave and there is $400.00 dollars missing from the $1000 that i put in the safe. We checked everything and everywhere and no money ,and i didnt use any cash because it was all in 100 dollar bills and i had been using my card sense we got there.I go down to the front desk to let theyoung lady know what happened. She calls Mr. Jesus Mesa. He is supposed to be the head of security at the Conrad. I tell him the whole story and he says that he will get to the bottom of it and he will go get the door code to see who has come in and out of the room, and call his director to get the safe readings.So i said o.k and i did'nt want this to totally ruin my vacation and my friends vacation. I filled out a statement put my cell,address all my info on it. A friend of mine comes over to talk to Mr. Mesa and myself and Mr. Mesa getts very defensive and says that the person that cleaned the room could file a defamation of character suite against me if i'm not telling the truth.Which was very unprofessional on his part because him nor his staff are missing anything. To make a long story short we were planning to be gone the next two days In St.Thomas and some other activities, i didnt hear or see Mr. Jesus Mesa or his supervisor.Mr. Mesa did the bare minimum to help me. All i got was a copy of my statement and two phone call messages left on the room phone saying that they want to schedule a time to come in the room to check. Thats the last time i heard anything from Mr. Jesus Mesa or anybody for that matter. A word of advise to Mr. Jesus,Supervisors and whom ever this may concern,( PEOPLE WHO ARE ON VACATION DON'T STAY IN THIER ROOMS,SO CALL THE CELL PHONE OR LEAVE A WRITTEN NOTE IN THERE ROOM). If they were concerned they would have tried harder to get intouch with me. Plus i gave them promission to do a door and safe reading, but nothing was done. At least make me feel that something is getting done.This whole event could have been handled in a very different and professional way. Mr. Mesa and supervisor whom i still have not seen and the ladies at the front desk did'nt know anything about, they all should retake an investigation and customer service course so that this doesn't happen in the futher.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome experience!”
Reviews.Author: bondgirl0068
Reviews.Content: Travelled with some girlfriends to San Juan, Puerto Rico...we chose the Conrad for it's proximity to Old San Juan and town in general. WOW! First we would all like to thank the incredible staff at the Conrad! A very special thanks to the customer service manager Leah Rossi who made two women feel very special with a personal birthday greeting and champagne in the room...they were blown away! We had oceanview rooms which were incredible. We seriously could not find anything we did not like and we are pretty seasoned travellers. Casino, restaurants, travel and all were a treat from this hotel. I guess one downfall would be the construction you could hear from the lagoon. Thanks for such an incredible experience we will treasure for a long time! ---Definately do the night kayak luminescent trip in Fajardo....you will love it!!!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful location, gorgeous ocean view, convenient but so so”
Reviews.Author: HOTELJOURNALIST
Reviews.Content: I usually make a trip to Puerto Rico when I can. This time I went for a wedding. I booked the room with my family members and paid the same price. When I went to check in with my family, I was the next in line. I asked if I could have the Ocean view room, they said sure for an addiotional $50.00. I paid, then I turned around to see that my Mother did not pay an additional $50.00 when she did not ask for that room at all. I would like to add it was not a very busy time of the year. I was disappointed and the staffers said they could not refund the $50.00. They said if I had an issue I can leave my email for a super visors response, all I recieved was an advertistment e-mail. WOW, they obviously did not take me seriously...but I have to say the view was amazing, just not the staff.

Reviews.Title: “Not impress”
Reviews.Author: bill_hdavis
Reviews.Content: Well we had a pleasant greeting, the lobby look awesome, we had a basic room with a city view, got a free upgrade to a lagoon room, so check in was pleasant. walking in the room I was not impress there was no view of the water because we were on the 3rd floor and all you saw was the roof of the fitness center, the bathroom was tiny but mirror was cool, and it has a glass shower.. the white lamp shades where dirty it smelled wet in the room, the closet area has no door and luggage barely fit.. we called and was put on hold for 15m to ask for an upper level room. we walked bck to the front desk was put in on the 8th floor where the was hair & crumbs on the floor, marble counter top was duty, lamp shades also where dirty in this room, mirror wasn't clean, there was a used coffee bag in the coffee maker when we demand to get the room service, instead of the maid coming and meeting our request, she said the floor clean but just look dirty, we pointed out the hair she used a the lint brush looking type thing you buy from walmart.. we was shocked that she didn't ask us to leave so they can mop.. we left in discuss and just walked around the hotel when we got bck there was a manager there overlooking the housekeeping job. I notice the crumb I didn't bring up to there attention wasn't there so I was pleased... we took a cab to old San Juan which is a 7 minute drive cost $15 take the bus it's 75 cent and runs every half hr. we ate at lupi's the peurto rican burrito was tasteful we found a soup store that had great deals "island basics" we stumble upon a spa that offered $15 20minute foot massage which came with a free cocktail "anam spa & lounge" that was great!!! we had a good time in old San Juan... we took the bus back everyone was friendly.. the island was great I wouldn't stay at the Conrad for what they charging.. but you can check out orozco's restaurant in, condado... it's down the street from Conrad you pass gucci, LV, chanel, and other good spot's. but if you younger and lookung for the action and save a little more money!!!! go to the other side of the island...I stayed at the marriott court yard in isla verde beach, no resort fee, I a paid $114 that's taxes included, there's scooter rental, jet ski, bed lounge that has $20 entree & free drinks up to 2am, eat at metropol food is great but there's plenty of other eating spot's on that side and more bar's and clubs.... there's other hotels in the area but I stayed at the courtyard my last day on the island and it's close to the airport.... as far as the Conrad??? 2 thumbs down sorry just didn't do it for me!! plus the swim up bar @ the pool I ordered 2 strawberry dac's it was $38 and if you don't return the soil towel for what ever reason although you at the hotel pool you will be warn about the $20 fee charge to the room..

Reviews.Title: “A lovely hotel in a decent location”
Reviews.Author: anigurl715
Reviews.Content: We booked our trip via Orbitz.com and we were able to get an amazing deal. The hotel looked great in the pictures and pretty muched lived up to the way it was described. I had read reviews about it being noisy and I will say that at night I did notice how loud the doors were when they were closed. It seemed to echo in our room. HOwever, the bed was so comfy it didn't even bother me!! We stayed in the Ocean tower and had a fantastic view. While laying in bed we could look out over the balcony and see the ocean--it felt like being on a cruise ship. The bathrooms were very clean and trendy. It was a little strange to step out of the shower and have the closet in the bathroom, but because the room was so large it wasn't a nuisance. We took pictures of the bathroom because we liked it so much! We ate at the hotel and while it is expensive, it was a nice alternative for when we were too tired to go out. If you need a break from the heavy Puerto Rican food, there is a Chili's within walking distance! The bus stops right next to the hotel, so you can get to Old San Juan for about 75 cents or something. The beach is a public beach with access right from the busy road. It is more of a lagoon with a beach is still nice. The recommendations given by the concierge were very helpful and the woman working there was incredibly nice. We rented a car to travel to the rain forest and that was worth the money because we had a car for the day to use and getting around was actually pretty easy. I had heard horror stories of traffic but it didn't seem any different from home...although I'm used to New Jersey traffic. Overall, I would recommend going during the week, (we stayed Monday-Friday) if you're looking for a quieter experience. A ton of people were checking in on Friday while we were leaving. Apparently the hotel picks up a lot on the weekend.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Place for the money”
Reviews.Author: maresPittsburghPa
Reviews.Content: I just returned from 4 nights at this hotel. Special thanks to Leah Rossi for helping me with my preference. This hotel is unfairly maligned. It is not a fancy place like the Ritz or La concha,but for $160 per night ocean view, I was pleased. Breakfast at the Cariibe Cafe was very good. We also ate at a mexican restauant at pier#1 with a Marachi band. tried to go on the La Rumba cruise,but it was out of service. We had the 6 foot deep salt water pool to ourselves. No kids in the all deep pool. Several good restaurants to the left when leaving the hotel. Try the Wakiki. $22.00 for seafood Paella. Would come back for sure.

Reviews.Title: “One night Of Misery”
Reviews.Author: Marmotlover
Reviews.Content: We spent the night of September 24th 2010 at this hotel. It was part of the package provided by our cruise company. Almost 24 hours after leaving home in the UK we arrived at the reception of this hotel and booked in to the sound of pulsating music from the bar area. I estimate the noise at about 95db. We were allocated a room on the 10th floor of the annexe building which involved two lift journeys and took 20 minutes. Found that there was no water coming from the shower or taps (not ideal after a 24hour journey) just air! Tried telephoning reception/maintenance - no answer. Walked back to reception to be told that 'there was a problem' and there was nothing they could do about it (return trip took 30 minutes even though I needed to use only one of the lifts without luggage). Ordered a room service meal which arrived promptly but was of very poor quality for $78. Neither of us enjoyed what we had ordered - it was tasteless. Next morning fellow guests confirmed that they also had problems with the water in their bathrooms.; some only got brown water, others complained of insects coming through the taps. We are thankful that we only had one night of this misery.

Reviews.Title: “Came home relaxed”
Reviews.Author: MauiMaui88
Reviews.Content: Went to the Conrad with my mother. The hotel is beautiful on the inside, the front desk workers were very helpful and friendly. Our room was very nice, designed very modern, with a cool bathroom & shower. Water did leak out of the shower, but nothing excessive (as other reviews suggest). There were two pools one with many children, and a smaller one for adults basically. The beach was very nice, an attendant was always there to set up a chair for you. Only downfalls were in the afternoon the beach was flooded with locals who brought frisbees, & beachballs etc, I watched someone get hit lol. The drinks were very good! The night life sucked. The resturaunts in the hotel were good, but me and my mom ventured out, & down the block to a local resturaunt for a taste of real puerto rican cuisine. YUM. & there's a Chilis in walking distance. If you are looking to just relax, in a clean enviornment, great place.

Reviews.Title: “Stay here for the hotel, location and great service! Not the beach!”
Reviews.Author: Tanise
Reviews.Content: The beach is an accessory to the hotel. Its only really there to provide ambiance! So don't expect much on that end however the hotel room 444 or 424 i forget was heavenly! I spend weeks and sometimes months searching for the best hotel and I'm soooo pleased when all my research pays off! This hotel was one of the highlights of our trip! The service was amazing and its about a $12-$15 cab ride to Old San Juan (depending on the driver). The restaurants in the hotel were great especially the noodle place, although rather pricey, delicious none the less. And it stayed open super late. The room was FABULOUS! Seriously I could not have asked for anything more. Very modern and it was so calming falling asleep with the sounds of waves crashing. The ocean view room is the way to go hands down!! And did I mention our shower was all glass ;0) (don't judge me it was my anniversary) And although we didn't use the gym it was top notch. My bodybuilding husband was tempted but I refused to workout or allow anyone around me to workout while on vacation! The pool was nice with several private areas for you to relax. I would have liked to relax in the hammocks but they were taken each time we tried :( but it looked very relaxing from my pool chair! If you have questions about the hotel just call and ask. I made a phone call from Atlanta and Felipe the concierge was awesome!! All of his recommendations made our trip enjoyable. He was nice enough to upgrade our room, suggest a tour to take which by the way was soooo much fun! If you have a full day take the tour with E and B tours. Its worth every penny and a great way to see the city! We went hiking in the rain forest, to a beach and kayaking at night all in one day! You ROCK Felipe!! Thanks again! The one thing i didn't like and it had no effect on my trip was the salt water fish tank in the lobby! Its silly but you guys should really add some color in there because it looks rather grim sitting in your beautiful lobby!

Reviews.Title: “So much service, yet it has more potential”
Reviews.Author: SHIZNIT152345
Reviews.Content: Dear Manager, To tell the truth, the hotel was amazing. Loved its people great service but alot of misshaps that can be fixed with no cost at all.... Let's just recap.... I came in and I was welcome by fine gentlmen who helped me in my every needs.... The most beautyful lobby but what happened to the rug??? and the poor shark??? those tanks are to be full of color and live fishes not a dying shark! but ohh well.... I had some problems with my room because it was'nt ready (what is housekeeping for?)... My room is finally available but to my utterly bad surprise the hallways looked all old and warn out.... and with a small stench.... I'm just saying EXCELENT SERVICE.... poor enviorment.... So after this I notied that when I went to walk outside, man bad lighting.... it was to dark for such beatyful hotel and beautyful avenue... I mean these are small details but hey I caught on them..... SERIOUSLY GREAT FOOD, GREAT LOCATION, GREAT PEOPLE WORKING FOR YOU, but YOU HAVE TO FIX SOME THINGS... AND MAKE SURE HOUSEKEEPING DO THEIR JOB QUICKLY AND CORRECTLY!!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous...”
Reviews.Author: sweetandujar407
Reviews.Content: I stayed @ The Conrad for 5 nights and it was G-R-E-A-T! From check-in to check-check-out (no hidden charges) I had no problems what so ever. The whole staff was friendly and attentive. Yes the pool had twigs and leaves but there was a huge tree over it providing a nice shade. The room was just what we needed....to sleep and then some. We spent our time out and about and came back to a clean tidy room with our bed made everyday. We took a nice nap on the hammock by the ocean so relaxing and left our camera on it and when we came back to look for it someone had turned it in...that was nice. We went to the main bar every night....good drinks. We walked the Condado strip with no problems. Budatai & Raices Restaurant is a MUST! We even walked to Old San Juan...and it was a hike I will add. I had a great time and would go back again and again.....

Reviews.Title: “Don't waste your money!”
Reviews.Author: tinkerbellsc
Reviews.Content: There were several things this hotel could have done better, especially given its rates. Given the price and location, it fell far below my expectations. I will highlight my biggest problem here. My biggest problem was with the rates. I initially reserved my room for 4 nights at AAA rate of $135. About 5 days prior to my arrival, I found out my father would be having urgent surgery and I would have to cut my trip short by one day. I called the hotel to inform them that I needed the room for only 3 nights. Instead of just shortening my reservation the staff member said she would charge me $159 which was the current AAA rate. I explained the situation, and she insisted that I would have to pay a higher fee. To this day this does not make sense to me, but I really had no choice since I was going to a conference and had to leave early. Moreover, when I arrived, the staff almost assigned me to the wrong reservation and was going to put me in a junior suite, then a king ocean view until I pointed out that they have the wrong name. Incidentally, they had planned on charging me $129 for the junior suite had I not pointed this out. Then instead of owning up to their mistake, they put me in a queen double and charged me the $159 rate. BTW: If you are a conference planner, the hotel ran out of breakfast and coffee on two of the three mornings that I was there. I have stayed at many hotels. This one was far below average.

Reviews.Title: “NEVER, EVER stay here”
Reviews.Author: trvlingpadewon
Reviews.Content: This was the worst hotel experience of my life. I was here for business and will never return to this hotel. It started when my room key was deactivated twice. Then I changed rooms and it was filthy with stains of an uncertain source on the walls and cabinets. There was also a missing tv remote. After 3 requests and a day later, I finally recieved the TV remote. The walls were never cleaned, despite personally delivering a letter with my requests to the front desk. The only nice thing about this hotel was the lagoon view. DO NOT stay here if you have to have a "city view." The view is of an abandoned building next door. Their wifi service was sketchy at best, thankfully it was free.

Reviews.Title: “Stolen items”
Reviews.Author: Ylcat1863
Reviews.Content: I have been a faithful customer for several years. The time prior to this trip I had an item stolen. Now, for the second time I have another item that has mysteriously disappeared. I love the location of the hotel but, I will no longer be a guest here due to no longer feeling comfortable leaving anything on my night stand.

Reviews.Title: “Great comfortable hotel!”
Reviews.Author: ILovePR2010
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay very much in this great hotel. I called the hotel and requested for an early check in since we were arriving at about 1:30 and check in was not for another couple of hours. There was no wait when we checked in at all and our room was ready. Everyone that we encountered in the hotel was very nice and showed us great hospitality. In fact everyone in Puerto Rico that we met was super nice and very welcoming. We walked in a store to get a change so we could catch a bus to Old San Juan, and the store keeper wouldn't even take money from us. He said, "This is on us...welcome to our island". That was hard to believe. TTook a cab a few times to Old San Juan and the fare was $12-$15. Twice we took the bus from right outside the hotel to Old San Juan for $0.75/person. Very clean and efficient service. The only drawbacks are (as others mentioned it)....you would have to walk about 10 minutes to go the main beach as the hotel's beach is very small and has the huge rocks on the right side and a very busy bridge on the left. The hotel is located on the end of the Condado district and not centrally located as the other hotels in Condado. But you can walk just 5 minutes and find restaurants and continue to walk another 10-15 minutes and you will find many other restaurants as well. There are some old abandoned buildings in close proximity to the property and I wish they weren't there but it didn't stop me from enjoying my vacation. One night, I could hear people talking on the hallway but the rest of the nights there was no problem. The bathroom is beautifully deocorated but it doesn't have your traditional door that locks. It is two sliding doors that close fine but have gaps on both ends....not too private. For those who enjoy tapas, try TAPAS, a new restaurant that serves some amazing food and Sangrias. Angel (the owner) and Janice (who was our waitress) will take great care of you. There are many restaurants that I would recommend but I can't seem to remember their names right now. Hope this helps.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful lagoon view room!”
Reviews.Author: petvetcookies
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights in August since my sister was getting married and having the reception in this this hotel. We stayed in the lagoon view rooms. The room was well appointed with comfortable beds and tile floors. The bathroom was nice and modern but the shower floor was somewhat moldy (not unusual in PR with the warm and humid weather they have. The room has a small balcony with balcony furniture. This hotel has a casino for the gamblers out there. We did not visit the casino. The grounds are beautiful with several pools, pool bar, salt water pool, hammocks and the like. You will have to take a taxi or bus to go to Old San Juan which is a 10 minute or less drive. We had breakfast in the hotel once since our rate included breakfast. There was a large number of waiters but the service and attention was lacking. We did not use the fitness room but we visited the room and it looked very well appointed. They have a steam sauna, indoor jacuzzi, medicine balls, and many fitness machines that look in very good condition. When we saw the room there was only a cleaning person there. If I return and have to stay in a hotel I am not sure if I would return to this hotel. There are so many hotels to choose from in PR and this one did not WOW me.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: LiGe
Reviews.Content: I found the hotel very nice, no issues at all, nice pools, beach area, staff very polite and pleasant, room ready shortly after we arrived close to check in time. We had a Family Jr Suite which served well when traveling with teens. A couple of minor issues (phone didn't work in room) but nothing worth complaining about. All in all it was a nice hotel and would probably go back.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, but it offers a nightlife/club scene atmosphere.”
Reviews.Author: travel0818
Reviews.Content: The hotel has many positives, but for us, the biggest downside was the atmosphere. Generally, if you stay in San Juan, you'll be in the nightlife/club scene, not the beach scene, especially if you stay in the Condado area. We wanted to a hotel on mainland Puerto Rico, but we wanted the beach scene. We later learned that we should've stayed at Gran Melia in Rio Grande or El Conquistador in Fajardo for a tranquil, beach setting. But I do recommend staying your first night at Conrad Condado Plaza to visit Old San Juan (for restaurants, shopping, and the forts) for your first day, then head onto Gran Melia or El Conquistador. Good things Conrad Condado Plaza has: great views (waves crashing against rocks, ask for 3rd floor ocean view), very comfortable beds, clean rooms, large balconies, large bathrooms, and nice/helpful staff. You can easily rent a car to drive from San Juan to Rio Grande or Fajardo, both Enterprise and Avis are within walking distance from the Conrad, and the drive to those cities from San Juan is only about an hour.

Reviews.Title: “So So Average, the grounds "Beautiful"”
Reviews.Author: Blackreign100
Reviews.Content: I am glad i got this for a steal! This hotel had a dual personality. I booked a city view but was upgraded to a lagoon view w/o a problem! The hotel was ok . The staff was wonderful except the concierge desk but i'll get to that later. I never had a problem with the elevator. I was there when there was a teacher convention going on and waited once. So i don't agree with the other reviews. My room was right by the elevator and the ice machine, and i will say that i didnt hear much of any noise. I too had the water problem. I put a towel half inside and outside the shower and the stoped the leaks. The grounds are beautiful. the pools and the hammock area, The water beating against the rocks!. The gym had very nice machines. I didn have to wait for a machine. I used the elipical rider and there were only 2 of these machines, so that is saying something. The food was subpar. I dont care if you are at a hotel and this is to be expected, NOT! I am not sure what hotel other people stayed in previously but i have stayed at the very nice and very high class places and it is the trend that these hotels have dual hotels to accomodate to the the different patrons so it is very common now to have to seperate hotels that connect. and both hotels had acces to one of the THREE pools there. I knew going about the "resort fee", fine but i thught this fee covered such things as the towels, fitness rooms and internet access. Imagin my suprise that they charge u by the 1/4 hr for access of the computers. Yes you will pay an average of $10-15 for trips in the cabs, but to be honest on how people drove i was happy to fork over the cash. The drivers were informative and very nice.The DJ at the lounge was excellent. I wish this hotel was furher down the strip in the mpre trendy part. Yes it is near an abandon building, but there was a lot of construction going on in this area. But while i was there i saw city workers and business owners cleaning up every morning! I seen police everywhere and security was eerywhere on the hotel lunge including by the entrance to the public beach. I didnt go to the public beach to be honest. Our second day there we went to Playa Flamenco beach , and to tell u the truth once u see this beach how could u go to any other there. The pool was 24hrs and we spent our nights there. I just wish it was more lively there. We went to another hotel down the street to thier lounge, however hands down our hotel had the better music. but we wanted to be around more people. If you are looking for a quiet time this is for you. or If u have a lot of things that you will be doing and u want t come back and relax this is for you. Now on my way checking out. i needed some of Puerto Rico's finest Alcohol shipped, the one lady at the desk was rude. I beleive that this may have been the manager. the Doorman and her assistant was more helpful to our plight than she. My suggestion Brand your lunge area, get the people in. Do something about the showers and try to have more activities on the premises. Yes u have a tennis court, but u have to pay for that ( what does this resort fee really cover) By the way go to the Haceinda for breakfast , for the views and thier breakfast is very decent. All in all i might stay again if the deal was right. would rent a car ONLY to get to the night life. part of the harm was walking around Old San juan. If u are in a car You will miss exactly what yu came there for. All in all Puerto Ricans came off to be very proud people! i enjoyed myself trememdously

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful stay except for a few minor issues”
Reviews.Author: trixiestar84
Reviews.Content: When we arrived at the Conrad at around 3:30 our room was still not ready. Although check-in is at 4, they really should have had the rooms ready alil earlier. They said they would call us when it was ready but never did. We came back a few hours later and it was finally done. However, we were able to leave our bags with the concerige so that we could go out and explore the town or use the pool. The hotel is very modern and beautiful inside and out. The rooms are really nice and roomy and the beds super comfortable. There is an in room safe which was great. The pool areas were amazing and really pretty. There is a big main pool that has a volleyball net, swim up bar, and a waterslide. Then there is a salt water pool and a hot tub. On the other side of the hotel there is yet another pool and hot tub. The only problem with the hot tubs was that they were not very hot, just luke warm. The outside property is goregous, with great views and lots of palm trees. Their beach area is man made. After reading reviews i was skeptical about the beach but it turned out not to be so bad. There is plenty of sand area and the water is very clean and clear. There is also a ton of fish, which makes it a great snorkel spot! The drinks and food in the hotel are overpriced, but I guess thats normal. The casino was small but had every type of game you did. There are resturants and bars in walking distance of the hotel, however the places don't get too busy. Most of the nightlife and good eaterys are found in old san juan. You will need a cab to old san juan, which depending on your driver may cost 10 bucks or so. There are buses for 75 cents but they only come every 45 mins and there is no schedule, so you could be waiting forever. Overall, I am very glad I picked the Conrad and I would certiantly recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel below par, San Juan not a fabulous place to vacation!”
Reviews.Author: MissLisaJM
Reviews.Content: The Conrad was average especially for being a resort and was ranked as top 10 in San Juan. The modern vibe was a bonus along with the in-house restaurant selection and Starbucks in the hotel. My favorite part of the hotel was the hammocks outside overlooking the water, but don't think if you walk down with a cocktail it will be re-filled promptly or at all. Even the "fine dining" place in the hotel, the service was under par. Puerto Rico as a whole is very dirty, overpriced and doesn't know what service is... but expect a tip for everything. If your looking for a US get-a-way, I would highly recommend Hawaii or Florida over PR any day! The surroundings are far more cleaner and hospitality and service are acknowledged.

Reviews.Title: “Don't go to the Conrad, better yet, don't go to Puerto Rico”
Reviews.Author: phillipj727
Reviews.Content: The Conrad hotel was a nightmare from the beginning. The hotel is located in the beautiful "Condado" which is actually a slum. I parked my car in their garage ($15 a day) and then brought my bags inside for check-in. I get to the front desk to get my room key and head off to my room. I booked an Ocean Vista room and they gave me a City View room. I go back downstairs and tell the young man at the desk I was given the wrong room. I found the confirmation email proving i booked for an Ocean Vista room and then they agreed to give me an Ocean Vista room, but it was going to take at least 2 hours because they needed to clean the room. A nice bell-hop came by and asked to help us with our bags. He took our bags and gave us a ticket for our bags once our room is clean. We decided to take a stroll down the street because we had 2 hours to kill while we waited for our room to be clean. The building adjacent to the Conrad is an empty 6 story building with broken windows and doors with graffiti all over it. You will come to find out that Puerto Ricans put graffiti on every building they can find. We walked further down the street just to find more empty buldings with graffiti on them with a restaurant here and there, but pretty much nothing is in the Condado. We walk back to the Conrad after almost 2 hours had expired and our room was still not ready. Our room was not ready until 3 and 1/2 hours later. We finally got our Ocean Vista room with the excellent view of the Atlantic Ocean. When we were in our room we could hear everything that was happening in our neighbor's room from him using the bathroom to his entire conversation on his cell phone. It was like he was in our room! There is absolutely no privacy in your own room unless you whisper. Also, the hotel puts a $50/day charge on your credit card for "incidentals", which they don't tell you about at check-in. The hold is supposed to be released 24-48 hours after checkout, and I have been home for 72 hours now and there is still a hold on my credit card. My best advice is not to go to the Conrad, but if you decide to go: print your confirmation of what you have reserved and purchased, be prepared to speak to staff that doesn't comprehend English very well, and don't leave your bag with the bell-hop because your bags are left unattended for periods of time in the lobby and their is tons of theft in San Juan. You are much better off staying in Isla Verde which is located right behind the airport. It's cleaner, safer, has a beach unlike the condado.

Reviews.Title: “Look elsewhere. Seriously.”
Reviews.Author: greybeard040
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were very disappointed in our stay at the Conrad. We were excited to get away together after having our first child earlier this year...it was kind of a bust. We were expecting luxury accommodations. It'd be a mediocre hotel stay at best. Just know what you're getting into. I've never written a review of a hotel before because I couldn't be bothered...This is an indication of how little we liked the place. What we hated: First of all, the hotel really is two hotels joined by a walkway tube, which is very inconvenient if you are in the building further from the beach (which we were). So when we were on the beach, we had to shlepp through two hotels before getting to our room. Also, there is only one hotel gym for the two buildings. This means possible wait time to use equipment. The elevators are barely functioning. It stopped at every floor, regardless of guests. So we attempted to use the stairs, but that didn't work because the doors to get into each floor (except 1) were locked. Terrible showers...sprayed all over the bathroom floor. The pressure seems that meant for cleaning elephants. We ended up not having enough towels because we had to use them to sop up the water laying on the floor. The beach is very, very tiny and located right next to a traffic-filled bridge...not very relaxing. The constant passing of low-flying airplanes also too away from the experience. There is an oddly placed sushi restaurant adjacent to slots...not within it's own walls. So if you want to enjoy sushi, you have to hear all the slot machine casino noises. There is an additional 14% room charge...for poorly thought out facilities and gaudy art? It wasn't all terrible. There was a really great restaurant called Varita. I don't think we got bed bugs.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury or Service should NOT be associated with this Hotel... Ever”
Reviews.Author: PJDANDREA
Reviews.Content: I'll make this brief as I normally would never use a service like this to report issues, and in fact never have. The service I received at this Hotel was far from luxury, my stay here for clients as well as myself awful. Accommodations that were set up in advance were not taken care of even though paid for. Service at the front desk is awful and accompanied by a UN courteous and rude attitude. Service at the bar both in the lobby and the pool is awful; Thank Youâ€™s and Smiling are non existent. The communication between departments and the staff is awful; one hand does not know what the other is doing. I was astounded by the lack of manners the staff had when speaking with clients, one front desk manager I will quote as saying "it's just too busy for us to keep up" being in the luxury business myself Mr. Bustamante, your problems should NOT be my problems. Phones rang and rangâ€¦ I counted at one point and laughed at amazement because it was just ridiculous. Mr. Bustamante the hotel's GM is impossible to get a hold of and his staff does not even know who he is for that matter. I was embarrassed and actually my last night there I checked out and stayed at the Hilton because I was just completely over the entire stay. Associating this Hotel with anything that has to do with Service is an absurd and actually insulting to a paying client like myself. Truthfully I could have stayed at a holiday in and received better service. Un-professionalism and poorly trained associate are something I can not tolerate I have been in plenty of 100% occupied hotels and never saw what I saw. My hunch is that I am not the only client with this issue talking to other in the hotel I can for a fact tell you I wasnâ€™t

Reviews.Title: “A luxurious getaway, better if you can get a deal on the room rate.”
Reviews.Author: drironwoman
Reviews.Content: We were in San Juan for 10 days, and stayed at three different hotels due to the activities we had planned and other reasons. The Conrad was the third hotel. It was definitely our "splurge" hotel. We got a special summer getaway deal advertised on their website. So the cost of the hotel was not much more on average than the other two places we stayed at. First, I want to address a previous review from a guest who wrote that security was non existent and her/his room was robbed. I was quite concerned and asekd the hotel about their security. Their prompt reply and detailed explanation about the mesaures they have in place assured me that it would be a safe hotel. And it was. This is an upmarket hotel with a casino on the mezzanine floor. We glimpsed it when we breakfasted at the cafe on the first day. We did not frequent the casino as we were not interested. Instead, we focused on the swimming pools (one salt water) and the great beach right by the hotel. All beaches in PR are public beaches. So yes, while hotel guests had free access to the lounge chairs, there were also puerto rican families and other tourists on this quite small beach (compared to Ocean Park). However, it didn't get too crowded. The water is wonderful, very clear with lots of fish and interesting sealife. There is also a "secret cove" area as my sons liked to call it. There is a line of large rocks that help create a lagoon so the water by the hotel/Condado Beach is very calm. Be mindful of the sea urchins by the rocks though. Wear water shoes! Right by the beach, it's sandy in the water, and I didn't see any sea urchins. They seem to be propagating by the millions by the rocks. The room was great. very spacious. I called the hotel and asked if they could arrange an early check in and they did, and put us in an ocean view room. The beds were comfortable. The hotel staff were efficient and friendly. one evening, we had brought back some dessert and wanted some silverware, and room service brought it up without any fuss. The bathroom was spacious! Well lit with ample closet space. There is a safe and a fridge (lots of mini marts around that you can stock late night sodas). We went from our hotel room to the pool without having to pass through the lobby or any of the public areas. There is a self service laundry and a game room on the pool level. There is also a pool bar. We did not eat in any of the restaurants. instead, because of its location, it was very easy to find places to eat within walking distance. We had a car (parking is $15 per day) and used that to find places to eat. bear in mind that cabs cost $15 per trip for short journeys. So if you're planning on going to Fajardo or Humacao, El Yunque etc, you should consider renting a car. They have covered parking. There was always a security guard by the entrance between the public beach and the hotel area. Guests were identified by the usual wristband. The pools are open 24 hours. The grounds are very pleasant. There were hammocks and loungers. It seems to be a popular spot for weddings. For breakfast as part of our package, we were provided with continental breakfast vouchers worth $7 per voucher. These could be redeemed at the cafe caribe or at starbucks. If you took the voucher to starbucks, you got 20% off your order. We opted for starbucks after the first day at Cafe Caribe. Kids just wanted something fast rather than a sit down meal. I can't stress how nice the location is - very lively. Yes, it is right next to a bridge that seems congested a lot (there is a new bridge being built). And you do get a glimpse of the traffic now and then. but I didn't notice the noise from the traffic (and I notice noise! I asked the hotel to have some guests in the hottub settle down when they were a little too loud at 12:30am...). Yes, it is a "big" hotel. It's not a cozy B&B. we do like those, but we wanted to end our vacation with a resort hotel. I'm sure there is a lively nightlife scene around here but by 9pm, after our busy day, we just enjoyed relaxing and enjoying the view of the ocean and the occasional cruise ship on the horizon from the room. We scubaed right off the beach in the next lagoon (next to the Caribe Hilton) and it was an easy 15 minute walk from the Conrad to the park and beach. We were a 15 mins drive from the Bacardi Factory tour (which is FREE by the way! you just have to get there and the tour is FREE! and you get 2 drinks each). We were only an hour and a bit from Monkey Island (kayaked), a 30 minute drive from El Yunque, 10 - 15 mins from Ocean Park (really nice long beach) and about 20-30 mins to Old San Juan. Driving to the airport on Monday morning took 10 minutes. Forstl

Reviews.Title: “Atrocious!!!”
Reviews.Author: Military09
Reviews.Content: Let me start by saying that I've traveled to many places around the world (Military). When we arrived to the hotel, we werenâ€™t even greeted by the front desk or staff. Once we check- in the room, the room was nice, but if you checked around the bed area it wasn't very clean, you can tell that the rug wasnâ€™t vacuumed and the area was dusty. One particular day, we purchased a sandwich not at the hotel, we sat on a table by the pool (remember I'm a paying guest at this hotel) we were told we could not sit there and eat our food if it wasn't purchase at their restaurant. We could eat the food out at the public beach away from the hotel area! For hospitality, I give this hotel and Puerto Rico area a ZERO!! I would not return to PR even if the trip was free!!

Reviews.Title: “Memories of what used to be”
Reviews.Author: deegar1130
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel several times twenty years ago. That was one of the reasons I had booked my trip at this hotel, the memories of the hotel were great. They always had activities for the guests. Thiis was my first time back with my children. I was very dissappointed, most of the employees at the hotel are rude and not helpful. They need a recreation coordinator in the worse way. . I spent a night in the casino in which I thought the black jack dealers were mutes. I spent the majority of my vacation looking for ways of staying out of the hotel as much as I could. I will not be back.

Reviews.Title: “Wish I Stayed Longer!!”
Reviews.Author: JQuest81
Reviews.Content: I stayed 9 days in Puerto Rico: 4 days in Cabo Rojo/Mayaguez, and 4 days in San Juan, 2 in which I spent only 2 nights at the Conrad Hotel and the other in a rental property. Out of the 2 nights I was there, I was able to enjoy the pool, bar, and the gym! The service was great-everyone seemed friendly. It was very relaxing. The hotel itself is very modern...the room was outstanding! I slept very well, and the view of the water was nice as well. The bathrooms were awesome!! I don't see any drawback other staying for only 2 days. If you like the typical resort environment with being around tourists, pool, the beach, bars, and music...this is your place. Oh...parking is like $12-16 a day...not sure the exact amount.

Reviews.Title: “HIGHLY RECOMMENDED”
Reviews.Author: Ddjm
Reviews.Content: After reading reviews on Trip Advisor, we were slightly concerned but were very impressed with the staff and service when we arrived. Nice location, near restaurants. Short 5 min cab to Old San Juan. Pool and beach open 24 hrs. Very friendly staff. Great food in hotel. Don Jose's nearby was great as well. Rooms were nicely updated, clean, and modern. Beds were very comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Modern Hotel - GREAT beds!”
Reviews.Author: JSchroeChicago
Reviews.Content: I spent ages comparing hotels online in San Juan. I am glad I picked the Conrad. Spacious and modern, even though I was there for my 50th I liked the younger vibe. I upgraded my room from a city view to a room with a view of the lagoon very easily and at no extra cost. Staff were helpful for the most part with the exception of one young man who was tending the concierge desk. I felt like I was imposing on his personal phone conversation when asking about info for trips to the rain forest on more than one occasion. I probably should have said something to his supervisor. We ate breakfast at the Caribe cafe and wished we hadn't. The hash brown potatoes were dripping in grease. The coffee was so bitter no amount of cream or anything else would have made it taste better. We did complain about the individual creamers left out in dishes on the tables in the heat and which were all spoiled and curdling the coffee. We were told that that was how they did things in the restaurant, so we got hold of the manager and told him. Next day the creamers were off the tables and in the fridge where they should have been all along. The only saving grace is that from this cafe the view is stunning. The room itself was spacious and I loved the modern decor and colors. The beds are to die for as are the pillows - I felt I was sleeping on a cloud. I was going to crawl on the floor to see if I could see the make of the bed but forgot!. The pool area is really nice but the salt water pool kept getting a build up of gunk around the edge so I went to ask for it to be removed and it was taken care of promptly. The beach is small and there are rocks on the bottom but you can see some nice tropical fish swimming around over them. You can get to Old San Juan for 75 cents on the public bus that stops pretty much outside the hotel. Take change. Cab fare is $15. The bus ride takes 10 to 15 mins only. At night, the hotel is only about 10 mins walk away from shops and restaurants, and while as other reviewers have noted, the area is a bit bombed out, I did not feel unsafe at all. I was told there is a lot of renovation going on around about the hotel. Good restaurants nearby include Ropa Vieja for dinner, Hacienda for lunch or a drink - funky little restaurant with stunning ocean views. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “It was a nice hotel...had great views...”
Reviews.Author: schardonnay
Reviews.Content: It was an average hotel and the price I paid for it was just about right. The rooms were clean and the staff did a great job cleaning everyday. Its far from the rest of Condado but close to Old San Juan. It has no beach but pool area was great. The Aqua pool bar was awesome especially at night. Try the dirty banana! They do need to clean the carpets in lobby and hall and the wall are thin. I literally could hear someone's phone convo. The views are gorgeous. The restaurants are overpriced but if your visiting definitely go out and try the local food. All in all I would go back but I prefer to stay in the heart of Condado.

Reviews.Title: “mixed review after a very enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: yazoo_10
Reviews.Content: My wife took me there as a birthday present. This was the first time that we had been at the property since it changed hands to the Conrad/Hilton from a competing hotel chain, and we had a very good time. Although overall, the hotel staff is excellent, unfortunately, we had an incident with an extremely rude front desk worker by phone. Being the face and voice of the hotel, front-desk personnel can really make a lasting bad impression if they don't treat guests with the required respect and courtesy. The front desk (and the elevators) are horribly overworked at peak hours, which can make for spotty service and other inconveniences. The room that we got, ocean front with a king bed, was very nice other than the blood-red color scheme that they chose for the decor. The balcony is a real treat-- extra spacious with a world-class ocean view. Although we got a good rate for the room itself, food and beverage are extremely expensive for the category of hotel (i.e. luxury hotel prices at a non-luxury property), and the room service menu is the poorest we've ever seen. In its present incarnation, the hotel seems to be catering to a younger, hip, budget-travel clientele, to which my wife and I don't belong. The hotel lacks any kind of space to dance live Latin music, which was one of the great attractions of this property before it changed hands-- big loss there. The pools and beach area are wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “great rooms, but poor service”
Reviews.Author: neglakay
Reviews.Content: Lobby is loud..Concierge service is very bad..Caribe restaurant service is ineficient The rooms are recently and nicely renovated.

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to return! We will difinitely visit the Conrad again and again! Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: jenjen0514
Reviews.Content: Due to the oil spill in the Gulf we looked elsewhere for a summer vacation and that's how we came to visit Puerto Rico for the first time. The Conrad San Juan Condado Plaza exceeded our expectations beyond belief! My husband and I planned our NEXT trip to San Juan before this trip had ended. The check in process was easy and our room was exactly what we had paid for (Superior Ocean View). Nicely decorated. The view from our balcony was breathtaking. The beds were very comfortable. The staff was friendly and helpful. The restaurants are a little pricey but the food is worth every penny. The swim up bar was busy while we were there but worth the wait. The property location is within 5 minute walking distance of an excellent public beach. 5 minute taxi ride to Old San Juan. Located on a nice lagoon area for snorkeling (be sure to take water shoes for kids). Starbucks in lobby area. If staying for a few days I would recommend a $10 taxi ride to grocery store. This is a great way to save a few $$$'s when traveling with a family. Chili's restaurant is within walking distance. The property has security on staff and in a safe area. Our trip was wonderful! We will definitely be back to Puerto Rico in the very near future and there is no question about where we will be staying...the Conrad San Juan Condado Plaza!!!

Reviews.Title: “Plan on spending ALOT of $$$$$ to eat or drink!!!”
Reviews.Author: louis5559
Reviews.Content: I liked this hotel...very friendly staff...very clean and accomodating. The beds were extremely comfortable. The downside...$4.75 for a 10 oz. beer!!!! AND Everything else to eat or drink was outrageously priced. In fact....most of the area was way over priced. We endured jack hammer noise while trying to enjoy the pool....in the rain! Be sure to check the weather before you go. Also had to pay a HOTEL SURCHARGE at checkout!!! $74 for a weeks stay. Horrible abandoned hotels within view...need to be demolished. I used Charlie Rental Car...5 min. walk down Ashford...Good Deal. Also, found parking right next to the hotel for only $3.25 a day. Bottom line...Puerto Rico is a cheap place to visit...BUT...They STICK IT TO THE TOURISTS!!! I don't recommend Puerto Rico...period.

Reviews.Title: “A pleasurable trip but lacked luster to make it overwhelming”
Reviews.Author: W0rldtraveler2012
Reviews.Content: I read reviews about the Conrad and tend to agree with most of them. My expectations were higher than what I received. The lobby needs renovation again if the conceirge desk is a table near the front door. The elevators were slow as molasses. It needs an over haul. The food was reasonable compared to any other restaurant in town. They have no beach front, there is sand in the lagoon but it is a public place and the only place to swim. The rooms were just ok! May have been overpriced for such a room. No tubs in the oceanview rooms. I hope that this hotel is not indigent of the Hilton family because I have another vacation schedule next week at another Hilton. I will fill you in. PS. Buy your liquor before you get to the hotel even if you are gambling!

Reviews.Title: “LOVED IT!!bad reviews almost scared me away!!”
Reviews.Author: Eissac
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel july11-18 and had a great time!!I was a little scared after reading some negative reviews.My room was very clean and maintained daily.I did not have one negative experience with any of the hotel staff,everyone was friendly,I saw a lot of smiling from all employees I encountered.I plan on returning in the near future!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in San Juan!!”
Reviews.Author: missmeghan
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Conrad Condado Plaza for three nights in Sept/Oct '09 surrounding a cruise through the Caribbean (7 islands in 7 days - I do not recommend unless you enjoy feeling exhausted by the end of your trip.) We stayed one night before and two nights after. We got a ridiculous deal by doing Name your Own Price through priceline, so I think the room was about $100 or so a night with all taxes/fees. The location is great, has amazing views of the ocean and it's own beach area. The hotel itself is very modern and beautiful. Both stays we had a lagoon room on the inside tower, the first night our view faced the tower on the ocean but we could see the ocean off to the sides. The room was clean, very nicely decorated and comfortable. The shower pressure was insanely strong, although our first room was missing the seal under the glass door and water ended up everywhere! The second half of our trip we had a room that faced the bay/lagoon. The first room had a really musty smell so I asked to be moved and we promptly were. The second room had the same smell - I suppose just from the ocean and moisture. It definitely didn't deter us from enjoying our stay - after a few minutes we didn't even notice it. This is the only reason I can't rate this place a 5. The pool area is gorgeous. The bar was pretty quiet in the evening, but we made friends with one of the bartenders and we really enjoyed sitting out and listening to the coqui. We used the fitness area and it it was small, but had pretty much anything you might need. The restaurants in the hotel are very good, we ate at Cafe Caribe twice. The breakfast was very good - and the coffee... ohmygoodness - the best coffee ever! We also ate at Eight Noodle Bar but I was too tipsy to remember if it was good. Overall we were extremely happy with our stay at Conrad Condado, we will definitely be going back and wouldn't think of staying anywhere else. Very often I find myself reminiscing about our trip and wishing I could be back at Conrad Condado drinking a cup of the delicious coffee and staring out at the beautiful blue water. Also - A few memorable places outside of the hotel - this little unassuming restaurant called Mojitos in Old San Juan - the most amazing Carne Frita - the most tender delicious pork I have EVER had EVER. =) Budathai - this really cool Spanish/Asian fusion restaurant down the way on Ashford that was recommended to us by the bartender at the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “THE BEST!!”
Reviews.Author: Mackinac371
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have gone to Puerto Rico a number of times. We went to Puerto Rico in June of 2009 and then we went in February 2010 to get get of away from the winter storm coming to New York. I have to say this is a great place to stay, from the front desk all the way to the parking attendants the services are excellent. We always rent a car and go to other places to take in the sites and when we return to our room it wonderful to kick back and enjoy our ocean view. The pool side is great too we love the salt water pool, and the service at pool side is great the servers are very friendly. In February of 2011 we will be staying here again. I can't wait. the best place to stay! About the food all you have to do is to check around and ask the the wonderful people of Puerto Rico where to eat they will be so happy to tell you with directions too!

Reviews.Title: “fun time”
Reviews.Author: c0960
Reviews.Content: checked in to a fabulous room. unfortunately i wanted more space and changed rooms! it was downhill from there. left flowers that i didn't know where for me in first room only for them to be a nice gift for the next guest. was told they would replace with something else. that never happened. second day power went out. after it was restored, elevators weren't working. walked down stairs with other guests only to be trapped in stairwell as fire doors were locked? major safety issue for me. beds were made everyday though linen was never changed. nightstands and bathroom counters were never wiped down. good thing i had my own lysol wipes. i wish there would have been some more activities indoors for when it rained. lobby is beautiful. food was a decent price. varitas was very good. and michelle at check in was very nice. had a massage in the gazebo that was over 30 minnutes late but is was nice. all in all would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth all the extra charges”
Reviews.Author: BLJ-01
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel through Priceline, with taxes / resort fees included. The hotel charged additional taxes per day that were not disclosed upfront. They also charge 21.50 a day for parking so make sure to park down the street in the secure parking lot for 3.25 a day instead. The restaurants were ok, but also over priced for what you receive, There are several nice places to eat in walking distance. Lastly, make sure to lock everything you have of value or not in the safe, House Keeping helps themselves to anything not nailed down. We had locked high dollar valuables in the safe, but the new items we purchased while out sight seeing ( necklaces ) we not locked up and taken while we were out the following day. The country is BEAUTIFUL and full of wonderful people, don't let this hotel deter you from traveling to Puerto Rico and enjoying the wonderful culture it has to offer !

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel Great Time”
Reviews.Author: slanay
Reviews.Content: Before booking my trip I read the reviews on TripAdvisor. Based on the varying reviews I was a little skeptical of booking at the Conrad but decided for the price I would give it a try. Before the trip I contacted Mr. DeJesus to let him know this would be my first trip with my young son. He replied promptly and informed me that if I needed anything to contact him. I didn't need to because everything was just as I wanted it. When we arrived the check-in line was long but somewhat expected for a Friday night. Once we did check-in I was informed that our room was upgraded to an ocean-view room and what a view it was!!! The room was great, loved the bathroom and the view. Although there had been many complaints about the food and drink prices on other reviews, I was pleasantly surprised with the cost of dinner and drinks at the Cafe Caribe and Eight Noodles. However, I did think lunch at Aqua was a little pricey. The pool was great and not overcrowded. Overall, I thought the service at the hotel was great and I would stay there if I visit San Juan again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: PuertoricanTraveler
Reviews.Content: Arrived on Saturday July 3 for a quick weekend vacation and for the 4th of July. Check in took about 15 minutes but it wasnt that big of a bummer, until they told us our room was a king bed room, which we couldnt have since we were a family three. In the end they offered us a Junior Suite but we would have to wait an hour for it, we accepeted and went to the bar area in the loby to watch the Fifa game. The decore is great!! very modern and stylish. When the hour passed we went to our room in the Lagoon Wing which is on the other side of the hotel, connected by a bridge. The room was great, two single beds at the entrance with a flat screen, the hallway with lots of storage, a microwave,coffee maker and of course the bathroom( which was nice, a shower no tub and a nice vanity) and finally the king bed room with yet another flat screen. This final room had acces to a smal balcony overlooking the street, wasnt that bad. the beds are comfortable, very plush pillows not the best for my taste,lol. The next day we went to the pool in the main building which, the two of them were good but packed!, One is only 6f deep and the other one 3ft and has a small waterslide. The beach was packed two, opened to the road, but not bad, nice clean cool water, although u wont get a seat on the pool or beach if youre not early when is very packed. We only went to one of the restaurants, the Cafe Carie which had a great selection of food ala carte or snacks like a quickie ice cream bar. I have to say the hotel is a great stay!! the only bad side is the service when is very packed, we waited an hour in our seat at the pool for a pizza!, but still a great place to go to!!>

Reviews.Title: “Sand, sun, beach and pillows”
Reviews.Author: johnnyraggs31
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed 4 nights at the Conrad Condado plaza before our cruise and we loved it. I checked on Travel Advisor before and heard that some previous visitors had asked for an upgrade ...and got it. So I decide to give it a try .....and it worked. We got upgraded from a city view to the lagoon view no charge. The area is ok, but not old San Juan. There is a abandoned building beside it and a few down the block, but I think it adds to the atmosphere. We felt very safe walking around at night and it didn't feel like we were in the ghetto at all. There are great resturants down the street a few blocks, one with a seaside patio which is something else. We had breakfast in the resturant across from the casino (which has nickle slots and free drinks for those gambling) and the food was good and reasonably priced. We were going to try the bbq resturaunt but there was no one in the place and a small menu, so we left. The rooms are fantastic, if you can deal with a glass shower. Large LCD tv and the most comforatble bed I have ever slept in. The pillows must have been made by angels as they were out of this world. A cab to Old San Juan is cheap and only about a 15 min drive. The beach is nice and you can snorkle for a fair price. The road is beside the beach, plus there was bridge construction, but you hardly noticed it. All in all, we would stay in this hotel again and again without question. Highly recomended!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing time..”
Reviews.Author: yinping
Reviews.Content: Just got back from spending a week at the Conrad and all I have to say that we had an amazing time. I was actually quite scared to stay at this hotel with all the negative comments people were leaving but I experienced none of those. Our room was the best we had Ocean view on the 9th floor it was amazing to wake up in the morning and look out over the atlantic ocean even when you are laying in bed you can see the ocean. All in all a great hotel room and great stay.... p.s the evelators were never slow for me except once on saturday when they were having a prom in the ballroom...

Reviews.Title: “I was robed in my room everything taken!! I have nothing left”
Reviews.Author: sisysmith
Reviews.Content: I was robed everything was taken the hotel does not have enough security, to keep locals out and away from guests. The only thing they left in my room is my clothing.

Reviews.Title: “What a view!!”
Reviews.Author: KayakPatty
Reviews.Content: We had to wait a bit for our room to be ready but it was worth it. What a wonderful view! The window is a floor to ceiling sliding door and is just about the width of the room. The view is of the Atlantic Ocean and, unless you are on the balcony itself, all you see is the water - really great. The room itself is also wonderful comfortable, modern decor, with a very nice bathroom. I was having trouble sleeping - it happened almost every night in PR because I drank too much of the strong Puerto Rican coffee -so I got up and sat on the balcony. It was a wonderful way to see the sunrise. We didn't spend much time at the pool except while waiting for the room and it did seem a bit crowded and loud. We also didn't eat at any of the restaurants so can't say much about them. We had breakfast at this little place down the street and it was great - cheap and a great view.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing!!”
Reviews.Author: beachlovr84
Reviews.Content: Unbelievable experience... I came here with my husband for our honeymoon and could not have picked a better place. I notified Edgardo De Jesus (saw his responses to previous trip advisor posts) about my upcoming visit for my honeymoon and he was wonderful enough to upgrade our room, give us an early check-in, and had a bottle of champage waiting for us in the room. I could write SO much about this place but I'm just going to point out a few highlights and things that people may not have written in other posts. *Rooms were beautiful and very clean- pics on website were accurate. The ocean view room had the most amazing ocean view of any other hotel I looked at- you're literally RIGHT on the ocean. *The entire hotel and hotel grounds were VERY clean and in great condition. *Elevators were always very quick, contrary to MANY other posts. There was only 1 time (saturday night) that the elevators were slow but that's to be expected- there was a wedding and many other things going on at the time. Other than that, they usually came within 15 seconds. *The fitness center was pretty nice and open 24hrs. It had ellipticals and treadmills with TV's, numerous weight machines, sauna, showers, bathrooms, and free weights. *The pools were great and ALL OPEN 24hrs!- there was a jacuzzi, a main pool with swim up bar, a salt water pool, and kiddie pool. I was surprised to find that there was a small waterslide in the main pool since I didn't remember reading anything about that. There's also a public beach right off the pool area- the water is very calm and clear. The beach didn't seem crowded at all on the weekdays. It is right off the road but I didn't mind at all. Towels & chairs were complimentary. *Take a few mins and lay on the hammocks by the ocean - so relaxing!! *All the staff were very friendly. As mentioned before, the maids are great- you can always find them and they're always willing to give extra towels. *My husband and I got the couples massage right next to the beach- it was GREAT. It was $100 for both of us for 1/2 hour... not something I normally do but well worth it for the occassion. *I recommend renting a car unless you're the type that likes to stay at the hotel most of the time. I liked having the flexibility of being able to go wherever and whenever- I've also heard the taxis are expensive and can rip you off. Self-parking was $15/day, but still worth it. I got a rental car on expedia for $125 for the week... so it pays off. *I also recommend staying here for a few days and staying in another area of Puerto Rico for another few days just to get away from the city and get a change of scenery. Although, you may want to save this place for the last part of your trip- it was pretty hard to leave. *Take east island excursion's snorkeling/beachcombing trip to Culebra (small island off the east coast of PR)- unforgettable experience. It's $89 per person- they take you to Carlos Rosario for snorkeling- one of the best snorkeling spots in puerto rico and then they take you to Flamenco Beach which is rated 1 of the top 10 beaches in the world by the travel & discovery channel as well as other publications where you can hang out on the beach, chill on the boat, or do more snorkeling. They also give you free rum drinks (and alcohol-free drinks) the entire time plus a great buffet lunch. I believe they also provide transportation to the marina for like $20 (they're located in Fajardo which is about an hour from San Juan). The crew is great and it's a ton of fun. *Other recommended activities- a trip to old san juan, parasailing in Isla Verde (about 10min drive from the hotel)- AMAZING!!, go to Escambron Beach - a pretty nice calm water public beach just over the bridge on the way to old san juan (way less crowded on the weekdays than the weekends)

Reviews.Title: “A total quality hotel”
Reviews.Author: nmunoz50
Reviews.Content: A group of 292 business colleagues participated in a Workforce summit for one day, and the logistics of the hotel, the service and comfort were excellent. The room had a wonderful view to the Atlantic Ocean, perfect for reaching a cooler head in business decisions. The room rate was very affordable.

Reviews.Title: “This is one hotel that will make your first visit to San Juan that much more wonderful.”
Reviews.Author: Carmella_McSpadden
Reviews.Content: The location is beautiful-there's private beach access and the ocean views are spectacular! There's a beautiful pool with a bar you can sit at while in the water, and there's a castle water slide and dolphin fountains. The lobby and the rest of the hotel are absolutely gorgeous.
