There's a large salt water tank in the main entrance, and there's an escalator going upstairs to the casino and on-site restaurants that has a cascading "bubbles" light. The room was exquisite-the color scheme was something out of a catalog as was the lighting...I wanted it ALL!!! And we all loved the huge spacious shower-glass all around. Highly recommend this to anyone wanting a taste of Puerto Rico. Great location to many of the local sites. Staff very helpful and courteous and hotel was extremely clean.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel... TERRIBLE SERVICE!!!”
Reviews.Author: mdufresne25
Reviews.Content: While the hotel itself was nice, it was definitely not worth the money. We paid extra for the "lagoon view" and we could barely see a tiny patch of blue above the rooftop that was our actual view. Our room was ready over 3 hrs after it was supposed to be, and the check-in person helpfully took my phone number and directed me to the pool... too bad she never called when the room was actually ready. I was ignored at the pool bar for at least 10 minutes before I was able to order a drink. A TINY pina colada for $10! We went upstairs to the restaurant while waiting for the room and had a horrible waiter who couldn't remember what we ordered, didn't bring us our change after paying, and all this after waiting over 30 minutes for a sandwich. There was a wedding in a ball room directly beneath our room that went on until the wee hours of the morning, with extremely loud, booming music. It was a $14 taxi ride to the port, which is only 5 minutes away... so not convenient if you're staying before or after a cruise. Stay at the Old Town Sheraton for around $100 night... do NOT waste your money on this hotel!! This is the only time I have ever left any hotel/restaurant during my extensive travels where I immediately wanted to warn would-be travelers about wasting their money on this particular place. I have never left any bad reviews before, but this place was awful.

Reviews.Title: “Very enjoyable stay at Conrad”
Reviews.Author: Tygar
Reviews.Content: I booked Conrad through a package on US Airways Vacations. My brother and I were there from 28 May-03 June 2010. Honestly, it was a great package and a great property. Iâ€™m a Hilton Honors member, so I am partial toward Hilton properties. Additionally, as a former manager for SwissÃ´tel Chicago, I have high expectations when staying at other properties. Conrad didnâ€™t disappoint me. The rooms were quite clean and Housekeeping was always on the floor to give us additional towels and amenities as we needed them. Also, the Doormen, Concierge, and Front Desk staff were quite friendly, courteous, and helpful with our needs, especially in booking tours and finding places outside the hotel to eat, drink, and shop. There was a lot of traffic in the hotel during this time. I guess it was to be expected over Memorial Day weekend. Still, this didnâ€™t diminish the quality of our stay, nor did we notice any decline in service with regard to the staffâ€™s ability to meet our needs. I think they did a fine job in accommodating everyone: the tourists, special groups, and even high school students (they had a prom almost every night during our stay) on property. They have two pools and a hot tub. The lagoon is okay, but it isnâ€™t a beach. If you are looking for a more active beach, there is one about 5-10 minutes (walking) from the hotel and itâ€™s pretty nice. I was content just hanging by the pool. There is a 24 hour fitness center (accessible by room key.) Itâ€™s not Goldâ€™s Gym, but it has the basics to get the job done. If needed, thereâ€™s an International Fitness further down (15-20 minutes walking) in Condado. Additionally, almost everyone runs outside! For day spa, check out Euforia (about 15-20 minutes, walking) in Condado. Marc is the lead guy there and heâ€™s very friendly and funny. There are a number of places to eat. Starbuckâ€™s is RIGHT OUTISDE the hotel door. This was a nice amenity to have and so convenient! My brother and I also frequented Varita, located in the opposite tower of the hotel. They have an â€œall-day happy hourâ€� that was GREAT, especially to watch the NBA games. (Jesus is one of the bar staff and heâ€™s pretty cool.) However, they are a bit pricy so unless youâ€™re going for drinks, or want to eat close to the hotel, you might want to venture out a little more. Two places to checkout for breakfast: Danniâ€™s and Bar Columbo. Both are VERY reasonable and will give you greater reason to check out the other places of interest in the Condado area. There is also a Subway and a Chiliâ€™s about 15 minutes away (walking.) My advice: donâ€™t rent a car unless you ABSOLUTELY HAVE TO. Parking is expensive and scarce, not to mention, there are ALWAYS traffic jams in Puerto Rico and the Condado area gets congested at various times throughout the day. Probably better to rent a car for a day or so, tour the island, then get rid of the car. Thereâ€™s plenty to see on foot in the Condado area and if need be, take a cab (i.e. to Old San Juan or the Mall.) Even consider riding the bus into the local area (bus is $.75-exact fare only.) Overall, we had a great time and I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay”
Reviews.Author: jksteelman
Reviews.Content: The staff at the Conrad is great. We came to San Juan with some friends and they were able to upgrade our rooms to ocean view and give us connecting rooms. Our friend's room wasn't ready when we arrived so when their room was available the manager hand delivered their room keys with an apology for the wait and vouchers for free drinks...which I felt was very prossional. The pools are great and the beach is fine. If I had to list any complaints it would be: 1) the elevators are as slow as Christmas, and 2) the wireless connection is not the best. However, I think it's worth pointing out that we were on the top floor, so I'm sure this had something to do with both complaints, and for me, it's worth it to have the amazing views that we had from our rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Loved It!!!!”
Reviews.Author: triplov3r
Reviews.Content: I received a voucher for a hotel stay as a gift for listening to a timeshare presentation. We paid a very small amount to upgrade to this hotel. I had read a number of reviews about the property on this website and they were all over the place. Some people loved it, while others had nothing nice to say about it and I was extremely nervous since I had no idea what to expect. The hotel is beautiful. All of the pictures that are on the hotel's site as well as the ones posted here by other vacationers are accurate with one exception. The room does seem a little smaller than what the pictures portray. There were four people in the room and we were very comfortable. So it's not that the room is small, we just built up a different expectation. The setup is a little weird with the coffee maker and fidge in the bathroom but that is easily overlooked because the bathroom is gorgeous. Plus we don't drink coffee. The shower is completely glass so if you are shy, just close the bathroom door. There were so many reviews that indicated that the glass shower was a problem but it wasn't at all. The beds in the room were extremely comfortable and it was hard for me to lie down on it without falling asleep. The hotel is also very clean. My party and I would leave early in the morning and come back later in the afternoon and the cleaning ladies would still be hard at work. I soon realized why. They mop the tile floors every single day! Our room was spotless every single time that we returned and getting extra towels has never been so easy. The beach and pools are great too. I will admit that staff was not always able to answer questions, but if they didn't know, they found someone who did. My only complaint is that the prices in the restaurants were a little high. My cousin and I each had a cheeseburger and fries with a margarita and our total came to $68! Needless to say that we found other places in the area to eat. ANd there are many. If you are looking to do a lot of partying, this may not be the best location for you. However, there was never an issue getting a taxi. They are lined up at the hotel all day and night. This is a more residential area so there aren't many clubs but there are tons of bars and everyone is very nice. Overall, I had a wonderful stay and I would surely stay here again. Great beach, great pools, clean rooms, and friendly staff. What more could you ask for. I would recommend this hotel to others

Reviews.Title: “Would not stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: chrissymTexas
Reviews.Content: My parents and I came to this hotel on May 23rd. When we checked in the staff attendant was not that friendly. We had complimentary breakfast when I booked this trip thru Travelocity and the staff attendant didnâ€™t give us the tickets when we checked in. I had to go back to the front desk after dinner so we could get them. Good thing I did because the breakfast was expensive at their cafe restaurant. My parents and I would have spent $45 each morning on breakfast and it wasn't even that great. The food at the hotel was so so. I would eat somewhere else. When we did get to our rooms they were both unclean. I still had food in the mini fridge and food wrappers in the drawers. The bathroom didn't even look like it was clean. I felt like I was at a motel! I would never expect this from a Hilton hotel. I was very disappointed. The next day I told the front desk how unclean our rooms were. She just said she would let the maid services know. It still was not that much cleaner when I came back later that day. When my parents and I decided to book an excursion thru the hotel, we saw the person who was there at the travel desk. I didn't get his name but he is there during the day. He was rude and not very helpful He seemed like did not like his job and that I was bothering him. I was asking him questions on the Rainforest excursion and all he told me was "there are 3 stops on the trip". .Well two days later after we did the rainforest trip, I went later in the day to the travel desk and there was a lady name Mildred who was very helpful! We were booking another excursion and she gave us full details on it and we also found out on the rainforest trip that we had already done that we actually had three options. My parents and I were a little disappointed because the one we did was not the one we intended to do. The other two were so much better. If the guy earlier was more helpful and nicer we could have booked the one we really wanted to do. I would say in general the staff at the hotel was not friendly. We had one nice waiter at the cafÃ© in the mornings that was very sweet and attentive to us and Mildred was great. Outside the hotel was nice. We liked walking around the hotel. That was about it. I would stay somewhere else. Oh and I was reading about people getting stuck in the elevators, yes we saw that happening while we were there and never saw anyone working on them either. I would take the stairs if you do plan to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful but not worth the cost”
Reviews.Author: mrtimnus
Reviews.Content: I had a bad feeling about this hotel from the beginning when we couldn't find where to park and tried to pull into the drop-off/valet area. We were promptly yelled at by the valet supervisor and when I asked him where we were supposed to park, he just kept telling us to leave. After we pulled back out, we ended up getting caught in traffic and didn't make it back to the hotel for another 30 minutes. We finally found the underground parking area but had to wait another 15 minutes to find a parking spot because it was blocked off by a car being towed. Other than that, the room was beautiful...we had an ocean front room with a balcony that had an amazing view. However, after paying half the price of this room at a bed and breakfast in Rincon and receiving amazing service and a free meal everyday with a room where we could literally walk out our back door onto the beach, I would definitely not recommend staying at a swanky hotel in San Juan.

Reviews.Title: “Location great...food/drinks expensive”
Reviews.Author: RicDic
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a week's stay. We had a lagoon view which I thought was as good if not better than the ocean-view, as I liked the skyline at night. Room was poorly furnished, but bed/pillows were great. Water pressure in the shower was terrible. Elevator's very slow, food and drinks way too expensive. If you want to take the bus into old town, we waited for an hour. Staff seemed friendly enough, and we enjoyed walks up/down Ashford, but all places are too expensive. Forget renting/driving there. Next time, we will stay on the East end of the island which we prefer.

Reviews.Title: “Delightful!”
Reviews.Author: Akeewee
Reviews.Content: We came to Puerto Rico with only 32 hours before we had to get on a ship for a Caribbean cruise. Not having ever visited here before we found this hotel online and crossed our fingers hoping for the best. I would highly recommend this hotel as a place to stay in San Juan and in fact, we cant wait to go back. The staff were friendly and hospitible from the start - we got checked in early AND upgraded to a larger room without having to ask for it. The hotel itself is on the lagoon and literally right on the beach. If you arent enjoying their pool or laying in one of the double hammocks you can take a walk down to the beach and take a dip in the ocean. The decor is tres chic - and the hotel is very boutique like with really interesting areas to sit and have a drink. Its only a 10 minute drive from Old San Juan and about 15 minutes from the cruise terminals (allowing for traffic on the bridge to Condado).

Reviews.Title: “Spendy, wouldn't stay again.”
Reviews.Author: travelchic_13_13
Reviews.Content: First of all I felt that the staff was generally pleasant and willing to help us out. We had some issues with check in and our balance because we booked through a third party site, and found out later at check out that we had yet to pay the 14% resort tax fee... Kind of a bummer. The drinks from the bars are overpriced, and we didn't even check out the restaurants. ** there is an amazing restaurant down the street. Hacienda Don Jose. Great food and even better service. We went back twice and it was one of the highlights of our trip, the view is breathtaking. The beach for the hotel is ok. It isn't bad, generally clean and is sheltered from waves off the ocean so you can go for a nice little swim. The location was ok. I recommend getting out of San Juan if you really want to see puerto rico. The locals are great and this area is a little too touristy to really get into local life.

Reviews.Title: “Hated the area. Beach is TERRIBLE”
Reviews.Author: NickFromBrooklyn
Reviews.Content: The lagoon is a joke. There is construction right next to it, nasty. The hotel is surrounded by rocks which means no ACTUAL beach. Also as soon as I get there they make me pay some extra fees that i was not ready for and I still dont understand what i paid for. The best part about the place was the bed and the bartender. I did not enjoy my stay and will def never come back here.

Reviews.Title: “AWESOME”
Reviews.Author: Williams053
Reviews.Content: The Staff at the hotel was very nice and helpful. The hotel was very clean. The rooms were awesome. The hotel is located in a very good location. I told all my friends about the Conrad. It was an awesome place to stay. The Director of Operations is Jose Padin. Mr. Padin is a very nice man and he is very concerned about the guests that stay at the hotel. Kudos to Mr. Padin.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, service lacking”
Reviews.Author: Bluebonnet99
Reviews.Content: The hotel is trendy/modern, the rooms and bathrooms are upgraded and look great. the pool is okay, the restaurants are eh, their beach is too small but the reason I don't recommend this hotel is the lack of attention from staff. We came to check in and our room wasn't ready for five hours! We kept checking back with hotel staff and were told, "we'll call you" but they never called. Only after complaining to the manager did we get personally escorted to our room at 9pm. To be fair, she gave us a $100 room credit to use, but it was a pain to go through. Throughout our stay the door key cards kept going out. We had to get new ones twice. And they didn't clean our rooms until late. We went to layout by the pool at 9 AM and wanted a drink, but the pool bar doesn't open until 11 AM. Ugh. I think this hotel has positives like nice ocean views, good location to walk around, a starbucks right next door, a good concierge to help you plan excursions....but overall the service attitude is subpar.

Reviews.Title: “A great choice.”
Reviews.Author: JCP2020
Reviews.Content: I've travelled various times to Puerto Rico for business and always stayed at a different hotel looking for that one that I'd like to make "my hotel in Puerto Rico". I found it. Great location, good internal restaurants and above all, their service stands out.

Reviews.Title: “Horrendous”
Reviews.Author: Markiemarkwine
Reviews.Content: ........the beach is a joke, and the pool area is dirty looking. I got stuck in the elevator this morning (5.17) and it took a half hour for the hotel to get someone to get me out. And then when I checked out this morning, to switch hotels after just one night, and told them about the elevator, no one apologized and they could have cared less. ...what is especially disappointing is that this hotel has a high rating on both Concierge.com and tripadvisor.

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms, but inconsistent - and sometimes frustrating - service”
Reviews.Author: travelgirlfromwv
Reviews.Content: Pros: The rooms of this hotel have been updated nicely and were well maintained. We also enjoyed the pool and water slide for the kids. The location was not far from the sites of San Juan, and it was easy to get to from the airport. Cons: Service was inconsistent. We sometimes waited long periods of time (i.e. over 1 hour) for a waiter to come to take our order in a restaurant, while other times proved to be much better. There are also many hidden fees in the final bill - resort charge, maid charge, bell hop charge (if you use one)...etc, so it was more expensive than we had originally planned. Noise in the hallways was loud - I was thankful I had earplugs. Finally, we had problems with our initial check-in. Despite are reservation two months earlier, including downpayment on a room (which still has not been refunded), they gave our room away on the first night and were not the friendliest about their error. They paid to put us up in another hotel for one night, but we had to move back to the Conrad the next day, which was not easy with small children involved. It also took another hour to get checked in at the other hotel, which put us to bed around 1:30 a.m. The upside is we got to stay at the Carribe Hilton that one night, which proved to be much nicer overall - service and hotel grounds are lovely at the Carribe, but the rooms are smaller. If I had to do it again, I would definitely choose the Carribe Hilton over the Conrad.

Reviews.Title: “Overall a fine hotel”
Reviews.Author: yippee1999
Reviews.Content: The lobby and outerlying lobby areas of this hotel are nice. The rooms were 'fine'....nothing special, but not bad either. Our bathroom was quite spacious for a basic hotel room. While our room on the fourth floor faced the ocean, it also overlooked the not-so-attractive roof of another part of the hotel. The outside pool area of this hotel was nice enough. The beach was ok, but certainly not as nice as many other caribbean beaches. At this hotel's strip of 'beach', not only it is quite short, but the views from the beach aren't particularly nice. To your left is traffic leading to a bridge that is currently under construction and across from the beach, and within view, are some other buildings that are under construction.. That said though, it was certainly 'tolerable". The sand was nice enough, and as long as you just want to lie there to feel the breeze, hear the ocean, and feel the sun, this beach will do the trick. One thing I didn't like so much was that hotel guests must pay $11 for the use of a beach umbrella. (Beach chairs and towels however are free.....) Note that there is also no food/beverage service on this beach. If you want anything to eat/drink you must go to the cafe by the pool. As for dining at this hotel, we got pizza one day at the pool cafe. The pizza was just 'ok'. Another day we went for breakfast to the cafe on the Mezzanine level, just opposite the casino. This place was quite bad on a number of levels. First off, the atmosphere if you will, was horrid. Think of your average airport cafeteria and that was what this place felt like. The service was also quite nonchalant. We each ordered pancakes, and it took 45 minutes from the time we placed our order to receive it. The waitress never offered to check on the order or voluntarily update us on why it was taking so long. It was only when we glared at her that she finally offered "your food will be out in a few minutes". When the pancakes did finally come out, the quantity was about three times that of what you'd get normally. As a result, most of our orders went to waste as we could not eat even half of it. The maids, the staff at the front desk, the doormen, etc. all were very polite and professional. I'm not really into casinos, but as far as they go, I'd say this one is probably nothing special. It didn't have that 'buzz' that many other casinos do...it seemed a bit 'depressing'. As for the hotel's fitness center, the equipment they had there was pretty good. They had a wide variety of machines and free weights, and everything seemed to be in good condition. They also had some yoga mats, elastic bands, large balls, etc. Downsides to the fitness center were the fact that the 'steam room' didn't seem to have any steam. While I DID see indications on the wall from where steam would normally come, I never did see the steam come out, NOR did I see any kind of switch to turn the steam on/off. As for the sauna, while it was nice enough, there was no traditional wooden bucket with a spoon to add water to the rocks, anywhere to be seen. The fitness center also has NO locker rooms, so if you do bring a bag with you, you must carry it around with you unless you have no valuables in it and can therefore just leave it somewhere in the fitness center. However, with no locker rooms, this also means that there is no privacy per se. If you need to change your outfit, you must do so in the one bathroom located in the fitness center. This also means a VERY bad setup if you want to shower. There are two showers in common areas in the fitness center, but with no LOCKED doors. Therefore, you are taking a risk if you shower in there, as you must figure out how to shower (in your bathing suit?....totally naked....?) and then how to manage to dry yourself off and then get dressed, all the while having no real privacy since there are no locked doors in the shower or an attached locker room. On my last day there, and after having already checked-out of my room, I ended up showering in the fitness center in my bathing suit. I then had to step out of the shower, pat myself dry, then walk THRU the gym in my bathing suit, and then continue on to the one bathroom there, in order to finish drying and change into my clothes. NOT a great system. The fitness center did have plenty of towels on-hand but no staff person on hand to assist you with anything..... The 'business center' at this place was self-serve. You enter using your room key. They then have individual workstations with a phone and computer, and use of a network printer. To use the computer you must swipe your credit card. (I had to pay about $15 to use the computer for 15 minutes.) There was no staff person on-hand to assist with anything..... As for the location of this hotel, it was 'ok'. In the immediate area, the feeling of the neighborhood is a bit strange....like it is 'in flux'. You'll see a very basic neighborhood restaurant here and there followed by a number of clearly unoccupied/abandoned buildings. Further along the main street heading East I think, things pick up, and you'll see some other nice restaurants and fancy designer shops. (It seems that they tried the 'if you build it they will come' mentality, but that 'they' have yet to come. It seems the current economy has stagnated things resulting in a bit of a depressed feeling along parts of this main street....) One good thing about this area is that it's half-way between Old San Juan and Isla Verde/Carolina, which are two nice areas to check out..... We discovered a really good restaurant that was about a 10-15 minute walk from the hotel called Buddatai. We liked it so much we ate there on three separate occasions. It's upscale pan-asian cuisine.... I should also mention that...I'm not sure if it was the time of year and/or the fact that this hotel was surrounded by water on both sides but...the humidity level in the room was quite strong.....our bedsheets always felt damp...it was THAT humid. If we left the balcony door open for more than say 15 minutes, the floor would actually become SLICK from all the humidity.... As a result, we found sleeping to be very uncomfortable...even with the A/C on, the bed always felt 'damp' ergo rather 'gross'.....

Reviews.Title: “Not Bad Conrad”
Reviews.Author: rsample34
Reviews.Content: Rooms were a bit small, but the lobby, pool, casino, facilities and balcony were all very, very solid. Overall a big thumbs up.

Reviews.Title: “Can't think outside the box”
Reviews.Author: AVasquez01
Reviews.Content: The Conrad Hilton is a nice hotel with really cool decor. A nice place to sleep. However, keep in mind that this is Puerto Rico where service is mediocre at best. Yes, there is some staff at the Conrad that's dynamic, friendly and overall rocks, but in general the service is crappy. I also found the Conrad (as most things in Puerto Rico) to not be worth the money. Cabs, food, golf, everything really, demands a premium in PR, yet, you always seem to end up thinking that you got screwed a little bit. Heck, if I'm gonna get crappy service, I might as well go to the Dominican Republic, where the resorts are just as nice, but at least it's cheap. Also, please don't dare ask for a substitution for anything at the Conrad. I tried to get a pancake instead of the sausage and bacon (I'm vegetarian) that came with my meal - it was impossible, even for the restaurant manager at Cafe Caribe. There's definitely a mindset here and the staff at the Conrad can't seem to get away from that. Next time, I'll go to the Bahamas, Honduras or Belize when headed for the Caribbean.

Reviews.Title: “I Loved Conrad Condado Plaza!!!”
Reviews.Author: yesi23
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Conrad Condado Plaza from April 23 to the 28th. My husband and I had a great time. We reserved a regular king city view which was great but with a little problem wich was the Shower. The shower was liking so the next day i went to the front desk and reported. The girl in the front desk was very plesant and helfull and she was very happy to change us to another room. They moved us one floor up to a JR suit king city view. This room was amazing. It has its own living room with separate bedroom a nice bathroom with no likings. The pool in the laguna tower was awsome it stars in 3ft and it goes to 9ft. The nightlife in the hotel was kind of boring at the beggining but we were lucky to be there the las two nights and be able to be around all the artist that were staying there to attend the Billboards. Oh and let me not forget to mention the casino!!!! The casino was amazing!!! I recommend the Conrad Condado plaza a 100%%% And the best Veal Chop ever is at Cafe Caribe inside the hotel. The waiter that took care of us overther was very nice and professional.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location and nice name do not a nice hotel make”
Reviews.Author: phillipsrhit
Reviews.Content: Unless you get a really cheap deal, this place is really not worth the money. The staff is nice enough but does not follow through on ANYTHING asked. You must bug them every few hours for anything. We asked many times for a crib and finally got one right at bed time. Rooms were not ready until dinner time and they never called once ready. Walls are paper thin here; worst I have ever experienced. I was quite surprised by this. The pools are nice and being next to the beach is a plus. Reasonably priced food is within walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely loved the Conrad San Juan Condado Plaza”
Reviews.Author: dynamiteel
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel 3 nights prior to a cruise and 1 night following the cruise. I was in contact with Jose Padin thru emails prior to our stay who assured me our stay would be enjoyable. He lived up to his word. After checking in which was a breeze, we were given a beautiful jr. suite over looking the lagoon on our first stay and a nice ocean view room on our second stay. The rooms are nicely appointed and large. The shower in the jr. suite is huge. We ate dinner one night at Cafe Caribe and also breakfast one morning. Prices didn't seem unreasonable for a resort. We also ate at Varita which was very good. We spent a lot of relaxing time on the beach which is small but we didn't mind that at all. We also did some gambling at the casino and won a little bit. The hotel staff could not have been more efficient and friendly. We did not experience any problems at this hotel and highly recommend it. I thank all of the reviewers that recommended Hacienda Don Jose restaurant which is within walking distance from the hotel. The food was delicious, give it a try,

Reviews.Title: “Could not be better!”
Reviews.Author: Andriyko
Reviews.Content: After reading many negative reviews on Tripadvisor I was not sure that we made the right choice to spend our short winter vacation at this hotel but our fears turned out to be just that... The hotel's location is great with many good restaurants nearby. if you book an oceanview room you won't regret it as the hotel is right near the ocean, and the views are the best. The property itself is well maintained with nice pools and a small beach. Good choice of restaurants (although service can be slow at the cafe near the pool). Rooms are well appointed and rather spacious. Did not have any problems with noise or wild crowds even though we stayed during the New year's celebrations. If one wanted privacy one could have it. All in all I would come back and I would recommend this very nice hotel to everyone. The hotel houses one of the best restaurants in town - Pikayo. Do have a meal there at least once. The menu is very interesting and the chef does wonders. The sushi place is also recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Loved It!”
Reviews.Author: MrsP85
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for our 5 year anniversary, we loved everything about this hotel! It was very clean, the staff was incredible, and views were to die for! We would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing, beautifully designed, fab views. . . .”
Reviews.Author: Sunny_in_BK
Reviews.Content: After much dithering, I booked my boyfriend and I five nights at the Conrad San Juan Condado Plaza. We were celebrating my birthday and we were both really looking forward to getting out of town. I was nervous because some of the reviews were snippy, but I liked the photos and after talking to manger Jose Padin, we got a pretty good deal on our ocean view room. The place is beautiful. The rooms are simple, well-designed, and have insanely comfortable beds. Our terrace was very private with a great view of the waves crashing below. The beach might be a little small, but there's a large beach just a few blocks away. It wasn't really beach weather when we were here (cloudy and kind of rainy), so it didn't bother us. The pools are beautiful and clean and the service was friendly and efficient. The cleaning staff always did a great job on our room, and the bartenders were helpful and fun. Our plane got in a little early and the hotel was able to accommodate us by letting us check in a little early. I'm kind of a whiner normally, but I don't really have any complaints about this place. We had a great time and would recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Relax and Dream”
Reviews.Author: mara22071
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I had a great time at Conrad. The facility was alwayskeep clean and organized.Only one elevator was working at the time we were there. The people are very friendly. I think the game room should have more space .

Reviews.Title: “Great honeymoon spot/first visit to San Juan!”
Reviews.Author: luna8537
Reviews.Content: My new husband and I just got back from our week stay at this hotel. We had a wonderful time and were really happy with the hotel and its services/staff/amenities! We chose this hotel because of its Condado location and offerings of restaurants, a casino, proximity to things to do and ocean views. Normally when we travel, we choose VRBO properties because of the value and ability to have a kitchen, etc. - but we wanted to have a hotel with amenities for our honeymoon. Condado Plaza was a great choice, and we were not disappointed. The room was really comfortable - the bed and pillows were great! The bathroom had plenty of space. We had an ocean view room, and loved hearing the waves crash below! The only thing we can say is that we do wish there were more restaurants within walking distance - but that is nothing against the hotel. The Starbucks next to the hotel is really nice - we were able to grab coffee/breakfast before our excursions. We found some great restaurants in Old San Juan, and enjoyed the restaurant Veritas at the hotel (good food and service here!). All the staff we encountered - from front desk to bartenders to casino staff - were really nice. Personally, I did not have a problem with the resort fee - there were lots of nice amenities included at the hotel for this fee (ex. free wireless - which I don't often find in higher end hotels). Another thing we liked was that the housekeeping staff seemed very aware of waiting until we had left for the day to bring towels/clean. We did not have the problems that some of the reviewers mentioned - so I would not hesitate staying in this hotel again at all. I would also suggest, as other reviewers have, that Jose Padin (Director of Operations) is very helpful if you have any questions at all! Overall, we spent some time around the hotel (casino, restaurants, etc.) but also went to other parts of the island and San Juan area. We went to the forts, spent a day Tarpon fishing, went to El Yunque/Luquillo Beach, and just walked around Condado. This hotel was a great choice for our trip!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: retailoil
Reviews.Content: Had a great stay here in March. Had a great time, excellent modern rooms with a beach view. Restaurant was good and having starbucks on premises in a big plus.

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms, good service, not so beautiful beach”
Reviews.Author: Ivonne33
Reviews.Content: I went to San Juan on a business trip, the hotel has just had all the rooms remodeled, I think they did a nice job. I enjoyed its location, I think Condado is a fun place to say in SJ. Overall the hotel was very good, however the beach did not meet my expectations, it was pretty small

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Ocean View Terrible Service”
Reviews.Author: Gazebo211
Reviews.Content: Very dissapointed, the room fantastic view was the only good thing about the 4 day stay. staff does not care at all.

Reviews.Title: “Not ideal, but ok.”
Reviews.Author: First_time_in_Venice
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went to this hotel for New Year's Eve. We booked our stay with Hilton points. Being Diamond, we got upgraded to an ocean view room from the main hotel (see important fact below). That was very nice! Check in was very very inefficient. We had had trouble getting to SJ because of the ashes and our luggage got lost, we were hoping to at least be able to get our room quickly. But no, 3 girls were at the reception desk, but preferred to talk to each other instead of helping the people waiting... When we finally were able to check in, we were told that our room would only be ready in a couple of hours. When we finally got our room, there were no towels and no toiletries (got fixed by calling housekeeping) This actually seems to be a problem: on day 2 and 4, toiletries were not replenished and on day 3, no towels again (they didn't leave the dirty ones, no no, they took them but didn't put new ones) When you do get toiletries, the size is pretty big which is nice knowing how much conditionner one needs at the beach. There was no tub, just a big shower (glass). The room has modern furnishing. It has tile floor, which I really really like in warm, beachy places: easy to sweep and clean. Elevators: waow, what a pain! There are 2 located in the middle that are supposed to porvide service for the whole place. Let me tell you, you will wait, you will stop at every level, and they will be packed. There is another one at the end near the pool. Breakfast: Ridiculous! We are Diamond for Hilton and Gold for Marriott, we spend our lives in hotels. Every where we go, we get free breakfast which includes eggs, smoked salmon, yogurt, fruits... including top of the chain hotels in major cities of the world. But not at the SJ Conrad: we got coupons for breakfast for 8 dollars... which get you coffee or tea and just plain toast at the hotel?! That's a joke. The good thing is the coupons work at a *bucks located at the hotel, so we were able to get a decent breakfast, but definitely not at the hotel. We had breakfast at the hotel on our last day: Lobster egg benedict, that was pretty good. Parking: parking is ok. Except that one night, we saw the sign "parking full", so we went to the valet and asked where we can park, he said "accross the street". Ok, we started the car again and saw that the guy slowly walking to the signs and removing it! (but didn't tell us, of course). So, we decided not to try accross the street and try the real parking: it was not even half full! ( we had rented a car to do the rain forest and drive around to other nices beaches with waves) Location: this is neither Old San Juan nor the heart of Condado. You can walk to SJ, but that's a long walk and one might not feel safe all the time (we didn't). You can take the bus, but apparently, the schedule is a joke, expect to wait. Have the exact fare for each passenger, otherwise, you won't be able to get in, and if you waited, that sucks. Beach: there is a small public beach that you can access from the pool area. It's public, but you can get lounge chairs and towels from the hotel. But there are rocks, it's not that great. You can walk to Condado beach, which is much nicer and has waves (but there are some areas with algae) Anothyer very important fact: the Conrad used to be accross the stree (not the sea side), but bought a Radisson (?) to claim ocean view. Both buildings are accross the street and connected via a pedestrian covered bridge. If you are unlucky and get to stay on the wrong side of the street, you will get a nice view of the street (or marina) and enjoy traffic. That might not be what you expected. So we have mixed feelings about this place. It's renovated, looks modern and trendy, but service is not quite there yet. I guess it depends what you are up to: nightlife and restaurants, then, no, stay in the Heart of Condado/ nice beach: choose a resort (but be ready to have an all inclusive package or be ripped off for food and drinks)/ a nice hotel to stay at for just 1 night before a cruise, yes, ok.

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay here in Puerto Rico”
Reviews.Author: arasmc
Reviews.Content: I was told that the Conrad was the upper end of the Hilton line, but if this is the case. I'll never stay at another Hilton Hotel. First of all the room was dirty. In particular the bathroom had previous guests hair/rubber bands from braces as well as tons of dust. The bed wasn't very plush and lumpy. I had 2 random items missing from my room (brush and nightgown) and when I reported it to security, they said they would investigate. When I asked the manager for some kind of a discount on my bill, I was told they were not responsible for items missing from my room. I wasn't even offered a free stay or meal or anything. When I told the manager I would never stay here again, and I would inform all my friends/family about the hotel, she again replied that they were not responsible for items missing out of my room. Never once did she say to me that she was sorry for the inconvenience. This entire conversation happened in the lobby, where other guest heard what was going on and actually left to find another hotel. I found the staff rude for the most part and would not recommend this place. Plus, the beach is on a main road and open to the public. So if you want to snorkel, up have to go under the bridge in the road.

Reviews.Title: “Great Oasis in San Juan”
Reviews.Author: MtHopper
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the hotel on a Friday afternoon, arranging for early check-in. When we arrived, our room was ready as promised. The lobby of the hotel is beautiful, with a great vibe. Our room was on the 9th floor, and overlooked the city. The room was very modern, and very clean. From there, it was off to the pool, where we enjoyed an afternoon of sun and relaxation. I took advantage of a 30-minute massage, which was wonderful after sitting on a plane all morning. The massage took place outside, next to the ocean. Very special. The only thing I would change, if we were to go back, would be to request a room on the ocean side, because the city side is quite noisy. Other than that, it was a perfect stay.

Reviews.Title: “Cool & Sexy On Arrival, But It Get's Old Quick”
Reviews.Author: romadaro
Reviews.Content: It's hard to describe this hotel because it has all the makings of a 5 Star property, but falls short in so many ways. I have just left after spending 10 days-part business and part pleasure-and was fairly pleased. However, during my stay, only one elevator worked the last 5 days, which was a tremendous source of frustration. Plus, in addition to the resort fee, which is supposed to cover internet charges, pool towels, etc., the hotel also tacks on a $1 fee per day for maid service and $7.50 per day for concierge services-which they don't tell you about until you check out! While the $1 a day for the maid was no big deal, I adamantly objected to the $7.50 charge for the concierge because I never used them-even to take my bags out of the car when I arrived. However, I was told by the hotel that this was a mandatory charge assessed because of the "union contract" and they had no authority to adjust it. OK, then tell people when they check in so that you don't have people screaming when they check out. It's a decent property in a great location...BUT BE WARNED about all the fees!

Reviews.Title: “Not a bad hotel, but not luxurious”
Reviews.Author: palehosejoe
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for a week in March. While the lobby is decent looking, it is not impressive. We arrived well after check in time, and not only was a room not ready, (we had to wait nearly an hour) but when we finally arrived at our room, the ceiling was leaking. We called and we were able to receive a different room. The desk apologized and actually brought us the key cards to our room (which I would think would be required). There are many pictures on the website indicating that the rooms have balconies, which while technically true, only those that appear to face the ocean actually have room enough for a chair or two. Our room faced the other tower on the street, and it provided very little opportunity to enjoy. Overall, I think the website needs to be far more truthful regarding the balcony. As far as the room itself, we had a suite, and thought it was very similar to many of the suites at other Hilton hotels. However, the shower head is built for people under 5'7", and there is a lack of a fan in the bathroom, which explains why the paint was peeling near the shower. It appears that the remodel ignored these issues. In addition, we had to request toliet paper on two different days because the maids forgot to restock. How is that possible? And why isn't there a toliet paper holder in this hotel? And if the Condado claims to be a luxiury hotel, why don't they provide robes in the room? The towels are very small, perhaps they think only small children stay there. The food was ok, and the casino, while tauted as one of the best on the island, looked eeriely similar to the casino from the movie Swingers that Mikey and Double Dog go to at the beginning of the movie, including the patrons. Breakfast was decent, but overall the food was nothing spectacular. Overall, I think this hotel is attempting to classify itself in a category this is not merited. We did not receive a discount for the leaking room, perhaps I should have pressed them. I guess in the end, how is it possible that if check in time is 2pm, and we arrive after check in time, the room is not ready? I am not the only reviewer to complain of this reality. If you want to stay here, request a room in the main tower and request one with a real balcony. Others have echoed that the Condado is a dicey neighborhood, and I would disagree. We ate dinner several nights on Ashford and found it to be extremely safe and lively. We also walked to Old San Juan several times (about 2 miles each way, and not only very scenic but safe and well lit). Do not take the cab service, while extremely friendly is an absolute rip-off at $12 before tip.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice....again this year!”
Reviews.Author: dubord207
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here many times and now that Hilton owns the property there have been some nice capital improvements. The pool bar is the place to be and Sterling was an attentive server as always. The restaurant on the water side does a nice job of breakfast and the condado sandwich at the pool bar is a favorite. While the gym is small, it was never busy. Indira at bar opposite the restaurant makes a wonderful martini and has a smile that can light up all of San Juan. Had what might have been a big issue at check-in. I requested a room on the ocean side of the property and the rate I was quoted, $239 was what I expected as these rooms have been completely re-modeled and are very nice, plus we like the balcony facing the water. When we checked in, a "trainee" told us we were in the building across the street with a water view...of the lagoon. NOT! We walked over and the room was not nice at all. The "trainee" then asked me to provide documentation that I booked a room on the ocean! I explained that we were repeat customers and this was an annual trip and I know the property. The argument was cut short by me and her supervisor intervened just in time and gave us a nice room on the fifth floor. The "trainee" has no people skills, just a pretty face and an attitude. After that, our stay was perfect. There are several nice restaurants near the hotel, Ropa and Aijjii. Waikiki is nice for lunch. We'll be back again next March!

Reviews.Title: “8 Days in San Juan”
Reviews.Author: spmcmanus
Reviews.Content: We stayed 7 nights in Condado Plaza hotel, it was a great experience. The views from the hotel were spectacular, the rooms were spacious and well appointed, and the Pools and Lagoon could not be beat.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location, sexy lobby, but average experience”
Reviews.Author: globaltravelbuff
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent two nights at the Conrad in San Juan during a short getaway to Puerto Rico. The Conrad is an old hotel which has been recently renovated. The lobby is quite nice, with a very modern/hip bar. Unfortunately, for the 2 nights we were at the hotel, there wasnt much activity at the bar (there were a couple of people having drinks but definitely not a happening place), which was disappointing. The hotel is conveniently located in Condado, and a short drive to Old San Juan. The hotel has a couple of swimming pools, but I would definitely not recommend this property to anyone seeking a pure beach resort experience. The hotel is on the ocean, but has a very small beach which is actually on the bay with views of buildings in San Juan. The rooms have been updated but are definitely worn (there is white tile in most of the room/bathroom, and the white is definitely looking dirty due to wear/tear). Furthermore, housekeeping does a very average job of cleaning the rooms. For example, we spotted some leftover hair from previous guests when looking around the room/bathroom. Our biggest issue with the property was the thin walls between rooms. We stayed at the property during Spring Break period, and were woken up throughout the night by yells, screams, and knocks by Spring Breakers staying in rooms around us. Definitely not ideal for what we hoped would be a relaxing holiday. Finally, the hotel's staff were not too helpful. While they did give us a complimentary upgrade to an ocean view room, the concierge desk could use some better training. On my first day at the hotel, I asked the concierge for directions to Old San Juan, and he gave a very terse response (as if it was an effort to give directions to a guest). I continued to ask whether they had any recommendations for where to park, and his only response was "here is the map... there are garages for parking." Definitely not the detailed answer with specific suggestions on preferred garages which I was looking for. On the whole, we had a decent stay but would probably not stay at this property again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, beautiful view, great pool - but in a bit of a run down area”
Reviews.Author: EvieDMn
Reviews.Content: The hotel lobby and grounds were very nice! It was odd to see abandoned buildings covered in graffiti just down the street from the hotel though. We booked a Bahia Vista room because the view sounded nice. It was NOT. The view was of a lot of construction and some run down bldgs. There was also food on the floor (including chicken bones). We immediately upgraded to an ocean view room and it was AMAZING! Great room, perfect view, nice bathroom. The food and drinks were very spendy everywhere in the resort (and resort area) - so be prepped for that. The spoiler for us was that there was a fashion show on our last last night (Saturday), and the models and coordinators were in the rooms across from us. They came and went from their room - yelling loudly and slamming their doors - all the way until we had to be up at 3:30 AM Sunday to go to the airport. It was terrible, and no one answered at the front desk or security all night. At 4:30 AM we could still hear the loud music from the disco in our room on the 6th floor. We were comped our upgrade cost for the inconvenience. This was a nice place to stay - once. We also really liked Old San Juan and the rainforest. I recommend a trip to San Juan, but will choose another hotel if I return.

Reviews.Title: “Oceanview rooms are worth every dollar”
Reviews.Author: heyValera
Reviews.Content: You have to stay in one of their oceanview rooms in the Ocean Tower, otherwise you'd miss all the best things. From the top floors you see nothing but the ocean, you can hear nothing but the ocean, your balcony opens up on the beautiful vista (see the attached pictures). The room on the 7th Floor where I stayed was very clean, newly decorated, too red for my taste, but my eyes were on the ocean at all times:) The bathroom is very well designed with glass shower, no bathtub. Safe, refrigerator, coffee maker, iron board - all you'd need. Downstairs you find a gaudy casino, multiple restaurants and Starbucks Coffee. Room service adds 22% gratuity and 7% tax, so it is quite a hefty add-on. I ate at the Noodle Eight, a Chinese restaurant that just happens to sell sushi. Their sashimi portions were extremely small and extremely pricey, as if I were in Tokyo. Avoid.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with phenominal location, although there was a language barrier”
Reviews.Author: MyIndyGurl
Reviews.Content: Beautiful rooms, which are spacious and well appointed. Very modern look and feel. We had a wonderful room with a balcony overlooking the ocean. It was worth the few extra dollars for the view. PRO: lots of options either in the hotel or within walking distance, including numerous restaurants, pools, beaches, and casinos. Great rooms. CONS: Very noisy on the guest floors. Lots of slamming doors and voices all hours of the day and night. Had numerous challenges with service issues due to the language barrier. English was spoken primarily only by the Front Desk/Concierge staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great service, very nice hotel and a nice place to stay if you plan on staying”
Reviews.Author: gingerbird13
Reviews.Content: This was my first trip to Puerto Rico and I did not spend a whole lot of time researching the various areas for hotels. So my happy travelers and I winged it a little when booking our hotel. In the past I've looked here on Tripadvisor, used google maps street view, etc. So here is my one and only problem with the Condado, the location. I was totally surprised that as soon as you walk out of the building, less than a block away to see there are abandoned buildings all around. On a week night walking to the center to where the restaurants are, it does feel a bit creepy. Never unsafe, but creepy nevertheless. On the weekends, people are out everywhere and it was easy to forget what you were walking past the ruins. With that said and put aside, I found the experience at the Condado fantastic. The service was great, Jose Padin, the Director of Operations, answered some questions for me before I arrived, the housekeeping was great (she was in tune with our needs without even having to ask), the pool areas are nice and well kept. I did go to the casino one night. $2 minimum bet on Roulette. Now that's amazing. They also give you $25 worth of match play when you check in. The atmosphere on the weekends in the hotel is very hip and trendy, a cross between an old Rat Pack swinging club with a Miami beach feel. If you are staying here, you must stay facing the ocean or the lagoon (you can see the sunset from this side). I just can't imagine staying here and not staying in one of these rooms. It's beautiful.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Views, Great Service, Good Location”
Reviews.Author: twoluckydogs
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Conrad for eight days and seven nights. Pros: - Ocean view room was spectacular - Jose Padin was a great resource in making our vacation memorable - All of the staff we encountered were very friendly and helpful - Perfect location for us (walking distance to many restaurants, short bus ride to OSJ) - Plenty of relaxing areas to choose from (3 pools, beach, grassy oceanfront area) - Nice workout facility - Casino on-site Cons: - Restaurants within the hotel were pricey - Elevators were slow on the weekends Overall: There are many restaurants within walking distance that have more reasonable prices so we would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Looking to Relax in Puerto Rico? Look no further!”
Reviews.Author: dspny
Reviews.Content: This is our 2nd trip to the Conrad Condado Plaza since January. My wife and I had another wonderful vacation here at the Condado Plaza. We are here on a quick four night stay. Being from NY and just shoveling out from quite a blizzard we knew it was time to thaw out at this wonderful hotel. I will try to paint an accurate portrait of the hotel and the neighborhood so you can come to your own conclusions. Let me say this at the outset for my fellow Northeasterners: If you have not considered Puerto Rico as a fabulous destination in the Caribbean you need to consider this island. We have cruised extensively in the Caribbean stopping at many islands. Puerto Rico has many advantages over the more conventionally thought of islands. First is its size. There are many areas to explore including historic forts, a rain forest, Old San Juan, which you already know about if you have taken a cruise that stopped here, and many other activities to participate in if you are so inclined. You can also just relax and let your cares and worries melt away. Being part of America, T-mobile treats it as if I were home. That alone is a huge advantage for road warriors who do not quite know how to leave their work at home. The hotel also has complimentary wireless that is accessible in the rooms. Still an uncommon amenity. Add in excellent hospitals, professional police and extensive public transportation. The Condado Plaza was built in the early sixties and has changed hands several times since then. From independent owners to large chains it finally found itself owned by Conrad and thus is part of the Hilton family. I have just returned from two + hours swimming in one of the three pools the property boasts. In my case it was the saltwater pool. That was after floating in the lagoon and reading a book in one of the many comfortable deck chairs by the pool. The hotel consists of two buildings connected by an enclosed walkway over Ashford Avenue on the Mezzanine floor, one up from the lobby. The main tower, 10 stories has the lobby, 2 bars, a gift shop, and area for receptions or business meetings and a covered yet open to the air very large â€˜patioâ€™. The dÃ©cor is Caribbean modern with lots of bright colors and glass. There are three views available. Ocean view is just that. As opposed to other hotels this hotel parallels the ocean so the rooms really face the ocean. Unlike hotels we have all seen that are built 90 degrees to the ocean and the ocean view rooms do have a view of the ocean â€“ if you are willing to crane your neck to see it. Not only are the Ocean view rooms truly that, they include a wonderful, large balcony. If you like the roar of the ocean and the smell of the sea this is your hotel. The city view is the view from each building facing the other. If you like to see cars and people walking choose this. It would be my last choice. The lagoon view is good, overlooking a lagoon and beyond that, San Juan. It is quite nice to look at San Juan especially at night. Two of the three pools ( 1 salt water, 1 with a swim up bar) are outside the main tower. The second building has the third pool, a gym and a very powerful medium â€“ large whirlpool tub inside near the gym. Both buildings have heated gentle jacuzzi pools of average size. Do not think swimming pool size here. Normal hot tub size, maybe 10 people. All the pools are clean and attractive. To lay by a pool with Palm trees overhead and the ocean breeze blowing is worth the price of admission alone. The 2nd building also has a nice casino. The rooms, like the lobby are brightly colored with a clean modern look. The beds are comfortable and you will certainly get a restful night of sleep at the Condado Plaza. The bathrooms need to be seen. Glass walled showers. The hallways to the rooms are nicely carpeted and in good shape. Before I wrote this I read some recent reviews. One woman spoke of cracks in tiles in an elevator. Remember this is our 2nd trip here and I did not notice the crack(s) until I read that. They are on the floor in one elevator and are minor. In fact I asked Jose whose was referenced in that review and the hotel has replacement tiles already. It is just a matter of waiting for a slower time to take an elevator out of service for a day. Jose Padin is the director of Operations for the hotel. Quite simply he is as competent a professional as you will find in the hotel business. Jose is the Director of Operations for the Hotel and he is in a word the best. As far as other complaints I read about, mold in the bath room, etc. I have found none of it. I cannot say it does not exist but I am a picky traveler and looked at a few rooms before deciding on the ones we stayed in. Perfectly clean. Neighborhood: Condado had fallen on hard times in the last decade or so, no doubt. However there is a bout of a renaissance occurring. Many of the high rise apartment/condos are new while others look a touch shabby and need work. There are a lot of charming houses in the area as well as the high rises. As the previous reviewer said the sidewalks in areas could use improvement but it is not that big an issue. We feel safe walking to the center of Condado and thoroughly enjoy our walks. There are many restaurants in the area (as well as in the hotel) and some of them have really good food. Location: The Conrad is located to the far west of Condado. This has its good and bad. It does make the hotel a 15 minute walk to the center but there are many interesting establishments along the way from restaurants, shopping, bars, etc. Also, being near the bridge there is less traffic and if you chose to walk to Old San Juan, 45-60 minutes it can be done. All in all, the Condado Plaza is a wonderful, restful, beautiful hotel. You cannot go wrong here.

Reviews.Title: “Ok, but there are better for less money”
Reviews.Author: nikkidad
Reviews.Content: First the good. Nice lobby, wonderful customer service at check in. Our first night, we were awakened by the sound of our neighbors returning to their room at 4 am. Not so bad..., second night however, we were again awakened, and this time the noise did not end. Called security and the noise abated immediately, for a little while. Complained at the desk the next day and were moved to another room, but it took them about 8 hours to do it. The drinks/food at this hotel were quite expensive for the quality. The weather was not cooperating so we ate at Cafe Caribe, Varitas, and Pikayo during our stay. Food at Cafe Caribe was no better than any chain hotel fare. Varitas, the food was ok, not memorable at all. The food at Pikayo, which I was so looking forward to, (Wilo Benet), was disappointing. Housekeeping: First room, wonderful, Second room, not so good. Replaced the coffee and the towels, but no cleaning could be discerned. We had no car with us, but the bus was easy enough to use. Pic ks you up right in front of the hotel. Bring quarters, as the bus only accepts change. Casino is small, but serves its purpose. Beach is terrible. Very small, public, and sits next to the road/bridge. Not so clean. There are better in San Juan. Lots of airport noise. The hotel is directly in the flight path of the local small airport. Not a great place to fall asleep at the pool. I had read reviews of this hotel and one of them said that the hot tub was too hot. I thought that perhaps that was untrue. Well, the hot tub is so HOT that you can barely sit in it. You could make tea with that water. I like my hot tub water hot, but this was extreme. Old San Juan was wonderful. Go to "Le Cafe Puerto Rico". We would have passed up this gem but the concierge recommended it and actually ordered food for his lunch once he thought of it. The food is fantastic, reasonable and the wait staff very friendly. La Bombanerra was also a great place to eat truly authentic Puerto Rican food. Hotel charges 7.50 US for 15 minutes in the business center. In this day and age, that is ridiculous. Overall, it was ok for our first trip to Puerto Rico, but we will find other accomodations for future trips.

Reviews.Title: “Had a GREAT time at this hotel”
Reviews.Author: newflyer
Reviews.Content: The check-in process was smooth even though the gal working at the desk was new, but hey - we were all new at one time or another. When we got to our room it was right near the elevators. I was willing to stay just the one night then switch to a room further down the hall from the elevators but it was never necessary. I only heard some hallway noise one time and that was from the room next door, not actually the hallway (they slammed their door many times in a row at 6:00am for some unknown reason). The folks at the casino were great, although I would have enjoyed winning more than losing. The numerous pools were clean and refreshing. Although there were really huge waves when we were on this trip the small beach adjacent to the property was just fine for a quick swim or dip. We found the restaurant across the street (Puerto Rican Fire Grill) to be fairly expensive for what you got, and the quality of the food to be so-so, but the other meals we had in the hotel restaurants were fine. We had a Vista room on the 6th floor and just loved the view, both morning and night. The hotel was located in an area on the local bus route so we saved a ton of money by taking the bus for 75 cents to Old San Juan and the forts. We walked down the road the hotel was located on and found a few gift shops, a pharmacy, some souvenoir shops and some local restaurants. The only weird thing about the room was the fact that the shower was in the middle of the bathroom and enclosed in glass. This meant that only one of us could shower, use the sink, have access to our clothes, and use the bathroom at a time. I kept my clothing and suitcase in the room on the suitcase stand and my friend kept her clothing in the closet in the bathroom. I guess when they designed the rooms they thought more of a couple vs. 2 friends staying there. But even with this slight disadvantage we would both definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Spot, but Run Down”
Reviews.Author: AKAKandie
Reviews.Content: On the surface, the hotel is amazing. But like much of the San Juan we saw, it's seen its hayday and has now been left to rot. The interior of the hotel is art deco/nouveau, but when you scratch the surface, you see it needs some TLC. The pool area is spacious and looks beautiful, but again, when you scratch the surface, it needs some TLC. The dolphin fountain at the pool is dirty and needs a good scrub. The swim up bar is in need of a fix-up. Our room was amazing, 5th floor, with a stunning view of the ocean. But again is in need of TLC -- the picture headboard was streaked and in need of a clean, there's mold and mildew around the grouting in the shower, the shower door didn't close properly so there was water everywhere and the red walls were chipped. That, said, though, we LOVED this hotel, but not for the price. We paid over $300 for one night and it definitely is not a $300/night hotel anymore. Food and drink prices were also insane...$19 for bacon and eggs. The Condado area, in general, saw its hayday and has now been left to rot. Beautiful art deco buildings, gutted and left to sea salt and grafitti. It's a beautiful spot, though, and I hope that there's renewal of the area some day. All in all, a very chic hotel, but in need of some TLC.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel - good value”
Reviews.Author: tomtravel
Reviews.Content: I just got back from 3 nights at the Conrad and have to say it was a very pleasant experience and would come back again. I was a bit apprehensive staying here after reading some of the reviews here on Tripadvisor, but after staying there...I wondered if those people had stayed at the same hotel I had. First of all...the Ocean view room was really great. I would recommend the extra $35 of so dollars for the upgrade. The view and sound of the ocean made the stay special. The room was very 'cool', clean and comfortable. The bed was one of the most comfortable hotel beds I have slept in years. The towels were very fluffy, and the size of the room was good. There were no issues with cleanliness at all. I also loved the glass shower. Everyone at the hotel was pleasant and helpful. I saw no rudeness exhibited by any hotel employee I encountered, as others on TA had experienced. I liked the location of the hotel, near the end of Condado. We like to walk to restaurants at night, and the location was 1 to 15 minutes to many of the restaurants in the Condado area. There are some abandoned buildings in the area as others have said....but from what I saw, that was the case in a lot of the San Juan area. I did not fell unsafe at all walking. If you are expecting a "Disneyland' everything is perfect kind of atmosphere, then San Juan is probably not for you. San Juan looks to be a city in transition. Not to say there are not beautiful things to see in San Juan, far from it, but it is a real place which I appreciated. (Old San Juan is a real gem) The beach is small as reported, but very nice and the waters calm, compared to the main Condado beach. The two pools were both well maintained and attractive. The cocktail service in the pool area was friendly and efficient. I also appreciated the hammocks on the large grassy area next to the ocean. Very relaxing. If you are expecting the Ritz, you may not like the Conrad. But, you are only paying at least half of what you would at the Ritz. For the money, I feel the Conrad gave us a great vacation. The quality, location, pleasant employees, decor and general feel of the place for less than $250 a night in my book is a good deal, especially compared to other places I have stayed.

Reviews.Title: “Lacking in details”
Reviews.Author: cathym1035
Reviews.Content: Went with my husband, 20 yr old son and 17 yr old son. Yes ,it is next to bridge under construction, and on a runway with a few planes flying by., but the many many beautiful palm trees and crashing water over power these small negatives. I have never seen such beautiful water in puerto rico. Jose does make sure he is around the resort, but that is the only time the staff seems to be helpful. We needed to go to the bar at the pool if we wanted a drink waitress services almost non existed - although there were plenty of the staff staying near the bar - they never left to walk around. . Cups, garbage fruit from drink always around pool area. I did have an issue at the pool. I went to the front desk twice. The second time the girl at the desk told me to address the issue myself!!! I am on vacation and I have to confront people!!! I did see Jose in the pool area and told him my concern. He immediately had a staff member take care of it and get back to me. From what I read I thought the hotel would have a livelier crowd. Entrainment was non existing. No music by the pool and low CD playing music such as Jay Zee -- nothing tropical or latin. They had activities listed each day but I never saw these happen. Nothing happening by the bar. If you take a cab make sure to ask ahead of time what it should cost - If you walk down Ashford watch out for missing sewer and water plate covers! And watch all the cracked sidewalks!! My husband nearly tripped.. Housekeeping never wiped the counters in our room -- never cleaned the glass on the balcony doors - It make you feel as like things weren't totally addressed. The pool bar stools were missing tiles. There are broken tiles in elevators. Little details that make you again feel like they are lacking in details. No water cooler in gym just a water fountain. No purell in gym and gym wipes were empty the whole time I was there. They charge three dollars for a headset in gym .. Again little details that add up. We love condado been there before and will definitely be back, but not here.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Time”
Reviews.Author: Joy9876
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Conrad for a week long vacation and we had an extremely postive experince. Jose Padin went above and beyond to ensure that we had a wonderful time at the Conrad. We stayed in a clean, spacious junior suite overlooking the lagoon. The decor is comtempory and colorful. The bathroom was spacious and sparkling clean .The white towels were fluffy and toiletries were replenished each day. The bed was comfortable and the sheets were clean. We enjoyed relaxing by the pool and lunch at the outdoor cafe. Great restaurants at the hotel but we also enoyed breakfast at Don Jose down the street. The staff was helpful and accomondating. Housekeeping was superior. We will definitely return to the Conrad for another vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Unimpressed..”
Reviews.Author: EnGee1976
Reviews.Content: I will not bore you with more of the same negative feedback as everyone else, but this is certainly not a four star hotel at all. The parking and conceirge staff seem irritated by questions as if someone vising should just KNOW. I would never stay here again, not for $250-$350 per night. Customer service is lapse. In the room, the closet and coffee maker are in the bathroom, mildew in the shower. I also do not believe they wash the bedding after every guest leaves,.. I was just thoroughly turned off.

Reviews.Title: “Modern, trendy hotel right on the outer edge of Condado”
Reviews.Author: kxv2
Reviews.Content: We got a great rate through Hotwire, but had high expectations as it was rated as a 4.5 star resort. I think it lived up to the value we received, but I may have been disappointed if I had paid the full rate. The hotel is actually two buildings with a skyway in between. Seems to be very trendy with one of the best restaurants in the San Juan area and a busy casino area. We had a room with a nice balcony facing the lagoon. The decor was contemporary/modern but we were not fans of the tiny glassed-in shower with poor water pressure. The location is right on the edge of Condado and is about a 10 minute walk past sketchy looking, vacant buildings and parking lots before the more populated area of Condado. There is a tiny estuary beach about a 5 min walk from the hotel - but no expansive beach where you can lounge within a 15 min walk. I believe there were several other resort hotels further west in Condado or in Isla Verde if you want a sun/beach resort.

Reviews.Title: “love conrad”
Reviews.Author: pitoune12
Reviews.Content: this is a beautiful hotel...If you need a taxi just ask for ovi.He is the best,funny,nice ride.Would come back here.Rooms are clean and staff is nice.The pool was also nice.the food is really great.

Reviews.Title: “Um-this is what $350 gets you in San Juan?”
Reviews.Author: oaklandbrownbear
Reviews.Content: Overall it needs an update - not exactly clean or modern Yes, it has 3 pools but 2 are crowded and the other is tiny Better for families than couples The casino is packed at night Shoddy wireless access

Reviews.Title: “Hotel with no Soul”
Reviews.Author: veraandjack
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel pre cruise for one night. After the cruise we returned to this hotel for 6 nights. Rooms are lovely, but really bad idea to put coffee and tea making facilities in the bathroom with the Wardrobe. As for the hotel it looks amazing. Staff are very rude and the selection of restaurants are pityful. After spending a lovely week on a cruise we was then left with having dinner at either the Noodle bar which was on the outskirts of the Casino, the Main Restaurant where we was abused by staff when it wasn't even busy and the food in there is of cafe standards the other restaurant is for loud mouthed businessmen who can't hold their drink. There was also another alternative restaurant across the road but it was in the middle of be re-decorated. It is defihately not for a holiday stay as it is full of people on laptops and mobile phones. There is no entertainment, even if you go out onto the street. What a let down when we only go away once a year, I do blame our holiday company though, for sending us to this hotel that is certainly not meant for holiday makers., It is for weekends and Businessmen.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay at the Conrad San Juan Condado!”
Reviews.Author: Onthego16
Reviews.Content: My sister and I traveled to Puerto Rico to celebrate her 35th birthday. I was using Trip Advisor to select a hotel and was torn based on the polarized reviews for most of the hotels - including the Conrad San Juan Condado. I contacted Jose Padin, the Director of Operations for the hotel to find out if the issues mentioned in the reviews had been resolved. His responsiveness to my concerns was encouraging and we decided to book our reservations there. Now, about the details. The hotel was quite impressive. Great decor and helpful staff. We had an breathtaking oceanview room that was wonderfully decorated and had one of the nicest bathrooms I've seen in a hotel. We ate at a few of the restaurants in the hotel, enjoying Varitas the most. We thought the location of the hotel was pretty ideal. The area does seem to be undergoing rennovation, but it wasn't bothersome. We felt safe walking around the area. There were plenty of restaurants within walking distance that allowed us to try the local cuisine and other alternatives. Get out and try these spots, as they're usually cheaper than the hotel choices (especially for breakfast) and there is more variety. The section of beach by the hotel does leave something to be desired, but take a short trip to Isla Verde for better beaches. The hotel is not too far from Old San Juan - a must see while you're there. We also rented a car from the Enterprise, next to the hotel, and made our way across Puerto Rico to visit Ponce in the south. This was a great trip that was enhanced by our stay at the Conrad San Juan. I would definitely recommend it to family and friends and would stay there again upon another trip!

Reviews.Title: “Average Hotel, certainly not Luxury”
Reviews.Author: Fair-Balanced-Critic
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel pre and post cruise, the pre cruise stay was booked via Hotels.com and the post cruise direct with the hotel. The hotel is an old 770s building but has undergone a decent renovation, quite trendy, the lobby is nice and modern. Pros: - Rooms and common areas are updated and modern - Casino if you like gambling - Views out of the ocean building are nice - The Pakayo restaurant was quite nice although expensive - Fitness center was quite nice and never crowded. Cons: - Very close to a municipal airport - Service was lackluster, even as a Hilton Diamond member - Room could use a better cleaning - Pool and beach area were not impressive, (shared with a public beach and views a bridge under construction - Cafe Caribe was not worth the money - Very slow elevators - Complex is too large - Late check out was screwed up both times, forced to go down to front desk to get new cards, even though it had been confirmed I don't think it was a 5 star hotel, and 4 is pushing it. The area isn't that great and you need to walk or pay an expensive taxi to go places. The La Concha Resort down the street looked far nicer, at least the common areas, i would check out that hotel. I would not stay at this hotel again, I was not impressed with the service.

Reviews.Title: “Won't stay here again”
Reviews.Author: collismom
Reviews.Content: We are experienced travellers with status in Hilton Honors - wanting to stay on points after a cruise - we chose the Conrad Condado based on the information offered by Hilton, sadly we did not check with Trip Advisor first. This hotel many have been nice once and Hilton may still be working on it - but right now it does not live up to Hilton or Conrad Standards - noting that we are not neat freaks - this hotels cleanliness is lacking. The drapes are very dirty - the upholstery throughout needs steam cleaning - the floors need to be cleaned more often. I won't discuss the toilets.
