The beach is under a bridge, very noisy, public and not PR quality. We have stayed at the Intercontinental, the Marriott, The Caribe and other spots - The Conrad does not compare to any of them.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: vanholt
Reviews.Content: Some repeat visitors say the Conrad Condado has deteriorated since Hilton acquired it. Without knowledge of the cause, let me count the ways we were disappointed during our 7-day visit: 25 minutes wait at check-in by a reception clerk who couldn't navigate the computer, punctuated by disappearances and phone calls that did not appear to be in the service of our check-in; bell people who never showed up; a nonworking telephone touch pad for various hotel functions; phone calls to hotel departments that rang off the hook; rude/disinterested hotel staff; room A/C that banged loudly after each cycle; inadequate hotel cleaning, including in the room - mold in shower, stains in toilet and debris around the bed, and in common areas piles of sand that were never vaccumed before being ground into the hallway rug; broken room safe; soiled curtains; broken locks on the room door that required slamming to work and hotel keys that worked intermittently; housekeeping staff that yell to each other in the hallways at all times of day; loud, drinking guests amidst thin walls; clothes closet and coffee maker in the (large) bathroom with a shower that leaks onto and makes for a slippery bathroom floor; mediocre restaurant food expensive even by hotel standards (no refills on coffee!); an in-room hotel pamphlet with defunct telephone numbers; a shared public beach under a bridge busy with traffc and planes flying overhead, with smoking, screaming beach goers and sun umbrellas rented for $ 11; no enforcement of smoking ban in and about the hotel; ran out of face cloths; inconsistent beach/pool towel policies with surly staff. I will give this hotel at least one kudo: in response to our complaints - 7 phone calls later - on the busy Presidents' Day/Valentine's Day weekend, the "on call" manager did finally move us to a nicer, corner view room with only half the earlier noise.

Reviews.Title: “A business traveler's review”
Reviews.Author: Chase71
Reviews.Content: As most my reviews involve long term stays this hotel is like the other "resorts" in San Juan Puerto Rico: nice for a day or so which should suit the tourists escaping from colder climates and throwing money around but not the greatest for a long term stay. But Conrad does deserve some credit and I'll give it some now. The pool/beach area is nice. Multiple pools, jacuzzis, swim up bar, restaurant, hammocks, beach, all along the ocean front. Food/drink wise, like all the other nearby hotels, food and drinks are pricey. Order a few beers at a bar or restaurant with a friend and you'll have a decent tab running pretty quickly. Now lets talk food. The Conrad has three or four restaurants. One a bit upper scale but the others somewhat more reasonable with one exception. The upper scale Piyako's is nice but its too pricey for the experience. Again if you are on a roll through money vacation it wont probably bother you. Another place to mention: their asian based restaurant: called Nine. But that's in name only. As it's not much of a restaurant if atmosphere matters to you. As Nine is simply a sushi like bar and a few tables with chairs alongside the hotel's entire casino. When you sit at Nine you share the ambiance of twenty to thirty slot machines and all the noise the comes from the casino. Nine is VERY expensive and an even worse a bad value. Its extremely overpriced for the quality and menu. Unless you like burning fifty dollar bills stay away from Nine. The only pleasure you may get from it is the smile of the 4-6 Chinese waitresses with the incredible tip you're going to pay her after you see your tab. There's much better options for Japanese food. One very close to the hotel. Back to the hotel. The rooms are nice. The nightly turn up service deserves praise if you don't mind your door being knocked on between 5-7PM. The room's FREE internet service is very good. The separate bathroom with the glass enclosed shower is a nice touch. Complaints: the air conditioning always made the room feel cold whenever it came on regardless of the setting. A c ouple of times over three weeks the faucet water in the room was brown and had a bad odor. I had to run the water for like 15 minutes to get clear water. No in room microwave was disappointing. Lastly the location. On that side of Condado there's just not a lot of dining options. There is a Chilis and another higher end place next to it. A couple of beach front bar/restaurants and one other higher end place but the other side of Condado has much better options, I do not care to drive in San Juan. So walking distance places matter a lot to me after the rental car is parked for the day. In summary the San Juan Conrad is a overall nice place. It has plenty of options and distractions for a short visit. It's business model plays upon tourists that want to have fun and not worry as much about their wallets as they enjoy themselves. But if I had to stay again I'd probably stay on the other side of Condado at the Marriott.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here!”
Reviews.Author: ConnieLongBeach
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Conrad after a caribbean cruise...Celebrity Summit...wonderful cruise and ship! We had to stay here for a meeting. I had read the reviews about the beach and pool but for us, those parts were just fine. There's a lovely grassy area with plenty of loungs and th esnorkeling off shore was pretty good. For us th eproblems were the food..it was dreadful! Ajili Moliji and Rpoa Viejo both a short walk were much better! The rooms are ok but the bathrooms are very, very tiny. The rugs byt he bed were old and full of stains. We stayed for 4 nites and evryday we were told there weren't any clean towels in the afternoon because they were all in the laundry...quite surprising for a hotel of this size. Also, they tack on a porterage fee if you are part of a group even if you don't arrive as a group so you end up tipping twice. The hotel is also lovated in a rather ugly part of town and there's absolutely no where to take a walk. We will never stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Puerto Rico is Breathtaking, Conrad Condado is Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: RaeRae52
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Conrad Condado Feb 11-15, 2010. Looking at the pictures online it looked to be every bit a 4-5 star hotel as advertised. However, I would say it is more like a 3 star hotel, with a 5 star price tag. Our room was decorated nicely, and the bed was pretty comfortable. We had a City Vista room view which was essentially a view of the street below and the other hotel tower. We could see the bay and the the ocean down the street from our balcony, but it definitely wasn't a very great view. With the street right below, our room was very noisy at night. There would be a traffic jam every night from 8pm - 12am and the locals love to blare their radios, which I don't mind except when I am trying to sleep. I'm not a late night person so I like to unwind around 11:00. The lobby of the hotel was nice and the pools were nice. The beach was ok, but I knew that before we went so it wasn't anything unexpected. The hotel advertised a live DJ every Friday and Saturday, but it was actually just a CD that was playing all Spanish music. We never actually saw a live DJ or live Band. So that was disappointing. I would tell anyone who is going to stay here, don't waste your time or money with food or drinks at the hotel. I had one mojito by the pool and it cost $10.50. My husband and I wanted to get some beers from the hotel shop and found that they were $4.99 per bottle and they do not sell them by the six pack. Room service prices were outragous. $19 per person for breakfast that included 2 eggs, choice of meat, potatoes and toast. Coffee was $6 per person. And the hotel provides a bottle of Fiji water in your room for the bargain price of $7. So needless to say we did not eat at the hotel. Wendy's, Subway, Chili's and a bunch of other restaurants are within a 10 minute walk from the hotel. Starbucks is across the street and there is a liquore store right down the street. We ate out and bought pop, beer, water, and snacks for the room. This saved us a couple hundred dollars easily. We did eat at Varita (a restaurant in the hotel) on Valentine's day. It was $90 for 2 people. The entrees come with 1 side, no salad, no bread, no nothing. We had 1 appetizer, 2 entrees, and 2 drinks for $90. The food was good, but overpriced for what you get. We went to Old San Juan which was absolutely beautiful. To see the both fortresses is only $5 per person and just breathtaking. I highly recommend doing this. Also if you plan to do any ziplining or other excursions, do your research before you go. The conceires desk tried to charge $20 more per person for a zip line tour that we wanted to do. We didn't end up doing it because they didn't have anything available for the times we wanted to go. But none-the-less, I had done my research and called the woman out on the overpricing that she was quoting. She didn't have anything to say, she stuttered and stammered for a minute and then tried to sell us on a different tour. Which we did not end up doing. Overall, we had a good trip because we laugh at the small stuff and enjoy our time away from the cold weather. I wouldn't classify this hotel as a total waste because it was visually appealing, but still left much to be desired. It's definitly not worth the amount of money you pay to stay there. I have traveled all over the caribbean and stayed at all-inclusive resorts that there 3-4 times nicer than this hotel and paid the same amount of money. Disappointed in Detroit.

Reviews.Title: “Great view; excellent staff”
Reviews.Author: NC-travel19
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Conrad because our conference was held at the hotel. We had a wonderful stay. A small beach is located just off of the pool side of the hotel-attendants will set up chairs for you for no charge, but there is a small charge for umbrellas. The pools were great, clean and not too crowded. An outdoor cafe, with a limited menu, is located off of the pools, which made for a great breakfast dining experience. Our room was very large with a balcony overlooking the crashing ocean. We could hear the waves breaking at night. The staff was very friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful hotel! Would gladly return again!”
Reviews.Author: jd50005
Reviews.Content: My fiancÃ© and I visited the Conrad San Juan on Feb 12-14 for Valentineâ€™s day weekend and we could not have been more pleased with the facility and the service, especially in light of the lower then stellar Trip Advisor rating of #7 (although it appears the vast majority of the negative reviews which have brought the rating down were posted prior to the renovation which is unfortunate as it clearly should be much higher). I would agree with others in that this is no higher than a 4.0 star hotel as indicated by the Trip Advisor rating. Many of the weekend guests are 1-night only cruise goers departing the next day (either Sat or Sun) so thereâ€™s no real time to fix an issue that someone might have with their room. The Conrad was booked to capacity for the weekend as were other 3 and 4 star hotels which range from $200-$350/night. I am a Hilton Honors member, so generally stay at Hampton Inns and Homewood Suites on business and then use my points for either Embassy Suites or Doubletree hotels along the Florida east coast a couple times a year. We wanted to get away for a long weekend although only just planned it a week in advance and decided to travel to San Juan. The Doubletree was my first choice as it was rated #2 on Trip Advisor, although when I learned they donâ€™t have balconies (a must for my fiancÃ©) I looked elsewhere. The two Caribe Hiltonâ€™s and the Conrad all have balconies but were completely booked so I waited another day and the Conrad opened up. I was a little concerned by the recent negative posts, and so as he suggests, I contacted Jose Padin (Dir of Ops) and he said that any issues noted in past reviews had been resolved and that we should contact him directly on his mobile if we had any problems during our stay so I booked our weekend at the Conrad with full expectation of being satisfied with the decision, and in the end, we clearly were as I had no reason to call him, other than to say thank you! One of the â€œ10 ways you know youâ€™re in Puerto Ricoâ€� is that everyone claps upon the plane touching down at the airport so donâ€™t be surprised when that happens. As this was our first visit to Puerto Rico and I only had the Trip Advisor posts to go on, I wanted to provide a more detailed review of the hotel and area to help others and so did a little more walking around then I perhaps normally would have at a hotel. Timezone - Puerto Rico is on Atlantic Standard Time (AST) and does not employ daylight savings time so from May-Oct is on the same time as the east coast, and 1 hour ahead from Nov-April. Taxi - As noted, taxi rides are relatively expensive for the shorter distances, although if you donâ€™t have a rental car, they really are the best way to travel. The ride from the airport to the hotel is about 10-15 minutes and will run $20 (includes fare, baggage, and tip). The ride to Old San Juan will run about $12 for a 5 minute trip, although can be walked in about 35-40 minutes. Check-In - There were lots of folks checking in around 5pm although with about 8 folks at the front desk, we only waited line about 5 minutes. Hotel â€“ The Conrad is made up of two towers. The Front Desk is located in the lobby of the â€œBeachâ€� tower which has 10 floors and includes the casino and a couple restaurants (CafÃ© Caribe/Gusto Dâ€™Italia, Pikayo) on the Mezzanine level along with the Casino. The CafÃ© Caribe (which doubles as the Gusto Dâ€™Italia at night) offered a great view of the ocean while eating breakfast in the morning. You either get an â€œocean viewâ€� or a â€œcity viewâ€� room (although to actually see the city, rather than the balconies of the Laguna tower rooms, you would want to be on either the 9th or 10th floor as the â€œLagunaâ€� tower is only 8 floors. Better yet, pay the additional $50+ and get an â€œocean viewâ€� room if available as the view is well worth the extra expense. If I couldnâ€™t have gotten an â€œocean viewâ€� room, my next choice would have been a Laguna view as you can see the city skyline at night). The Laguna tower (across the street) is connected to the â€œBeachâ€� tower by an indoor crosswalk on the Mezzanine level that takes you right past the Casino. You either get a â€œLaguna view/city skyline)â€� or â€œstreet viewâ€� (looking at the Beach tower building). It is only a few minute walk from the Laguna elevators to the CafÃ© Caribe or to the Beach tower pool side dining area as well. The Laguna tower houses the Veritas restaurant and gym on the Lobby floor. The two tennis courts, kayak and paddleboat rental (on right side of the building) are both located at the Laguna tower as well. While walking through both towers, at no time did I notice any â€œdamp/mustyâ€� smell as was reported in another post. Room â€“ We walked in to our room about 5pm, the supervisor was just finishing up with her inspection. We stayed in an â€œocean viewâ€� room on the 8th floor which was very clean and gave us a wonderful view of the ocean and nearby Hilton Caribe hotels. As we were celebrating my fiancÃ©â€™s recent graduation from full time graduate school (not having had a vacation for the past 2 years because of her studying on the weekends), Jose Padin was kind enough to have a complementary bottle of wine and two glasses waiting for us in the room. Very nice! Thanks Jose! The waves crashing on the rocks was very soothing, especially at night. I am a very light sleeper and although awoke a couple times by loud folks in the hallway, quickly fell back to sleep in the very comfortable king sized bed. Although I generally turn the fan to ON (vice AUTO) to drum out hallway noise when I stay at hotels, I didnâ€™t bother this time so we could get the full ocean wave effect. There is plenty of space in the room and the L shaped couch is a nice feature (not being night folks we watched the Olympics in the room at night). The balcony is very private and has two chairs and a table for enjoying your morning coffee (which was Puerto Rican and quite good actually). The room was very clean and everything appeared fairly new. The two robes and slippers were nice to stroll around the room in when relaxing. The bathroom is huge and has sliding doors for privacy if someone is in the shower and privacy is needed. The only nits we had with the room was the lack of towel racks (as I prefer to hang up and use the same towels for a short stay rather than getting them laundered every day) as well as the inability for the curtain to fully retract as it blocked the ocean view from the couch. I resolved that by taking a belt and wrapped it around the curtain to pull it back further. Both wired and wireless internet access was available in the room with no issues when using either method. Bus - There is a bus stop in front of the hotel just at the entrance to the beach and for only $0.75 is a good deal IF you have the time to wait or IF you get lucky and happen to get there shortly before the bus arrives. The bus is apparently more reliable on business week days rather than on weekends so remember that should you decide to take the bus. Although the bus is supposed to come every 30 minutes, there is no route information at the bus stop, so you have no clue when it will come next. We initially were going to take the bus to Old San Juan, but after waiting 10 minutes opted to just walk as it was a nice morning. The walk was about 40 minutes, although we walked along the shoreline to get the great view of the water. Although my fiancÃ© wasnâ€™t too excited with the idea, I wanted to experience a bus ride (so we could report back to you folks) so we did take the bus back to the hotel. The bus terminal is located near Pier #3. Although the bus we eventually took was sitting in the terminal (sans driver) the whole time, we waited about 40 minutes for it to depart which then took about 15 minutes to return to the hotel as it goes to the convention center first. Lesson learned: If youâ€™re on vacation and want to spend more time at the hotel rather than in a bus terminal, pony up for the taxi fare. Street â€“ The neighborhood isnâ€™t much to look at (although not really noticeable when walked at night), although there are several souvenir shops and quite a few small and larger sized restaurants within 10-20 min walking distance. We opted to eat dinner at one of the smaller street restaurants for our first night and then ate at the Veritas (inside the hotel) the second night. We felt very safe walking on the street at night as there are lots of people walking around especially from the other hotels further down the street. There is a liquor store about a 10 minute walk from the hotel where we picked up another bottle of wine for the 2nd night. A bit further down was a Walgreens/food store as well. Beach â€“ Although a public beach, this is only accessible by walking as there is no close by parking, so we didnâ€™t really notice any locals on the beach (other then a couple food vendors). The hotel guests are given a colored wrist band when picking up towels to distinguish you from the locals for easy access back to the hotel grounds (a security guard is posted there). There is plenty of room on the beach, although the majority of the hotel guests utilized the pool area both days of our stay. Having to pay $20 for an umbrella and two chairs at hotels along the Florida coast, it was nice that the only cost was $11 for the umbrella for the day, although there is plenty of shade if you donâ€™t want to use an umbrella. There are 30 buried small roughly 3â€™x3â€™ manmade â€œreef modulesâ€� (mostly on the left side of the beach close to the street) where you can generally find colorful Caribbean fish swimming around. We generally bring our own snorkel/fins when we travel to a beach area, although as the hotel equipment is new US Diver gear, were we to do it again, would just pay the $11/hr (snorkel/fins) charge as you can pretty much see all there is to see in about 45 minutes. Pools â€“ There are two pools: (1) freshwater (large) and (1) saltwater (small) at the â€œBeachâ€� tower, with a smaller freshwater pool in the back of the Laguna tower as well. All three were well kept and very clean with no notice of algae buildup. The â€œpool barâ€� was packed both afternoons. There are (4) hammocks that get set up on the lawn area during the day, although were generally occupied most of the time. Expect lounge chairs to be a premium on the weekends. As the majority of adults had a small plastic drink cup, clearly the cost was not an issue. Most noticeable were the buckets of local 10oz Medalla beer ($20/6) around the main pool and pool bar. They go down real easy, especially on a normal San Juan tropical day so be careful. As you exit the â€œBeach towerâ€� the towel/snorkeling gear check out is just off to the right on the ground level. Casino - The best part of the casino is that it (as with the hotel and restaurants in Puerto Rico are smoke free). Although having craps and black jack tables in the center of the casino, the perimeter of the room is made up primarily of penny and nickel slots and although not busy during the day, it is packed with the locals at night. My fiancÃ© had never played the slots before so played a penny slot for about 30 minutes starting with $5 and walking away with $6, unfortunately not scoring the â€œbig winâ€� she had hoped for, although what can you expect from a penny slot? She still had fun. Gym - The gym is open 24 hours/day and is located on the lobby level of the Laguna tower and rivals some â€œstrip mallâ€� center gyms as it includes: (9) unique Life Fitness circuit training machines, (4) treadmills, (2) elliptical runners, (3) stationary bikes, as well as an open area for stretching/yoga with light weight dumbbells and small exercise balls. Business Center â€“ all services are at cost, although there are two airport boarding pass terminals to the right side of the Front Desk where you can print out your boarding pass. Although we had tried using one of them, our airline wouldnâ€™t allow us to print them out for some reason, rather we had to check in at the airport. Activities â€“ As we were only there for the weekend, we opted to just enjoy the beach/pool area as well as walking around Old San Juan. My fiancÃ© found a Segway tour on-line that provided a 2 hour tour from Pier #2 through Old San Juan up to Castillo San Felipe del Morro (a fort designated as a National Historic Site). They provide 3 daily tours, at 9am, 12pm, and 3pm taking up to 11 people at a time for $82/person. Although a bit steep, neither of us had ever been on a Segway before and thought it would be a fun way to experience the city as well as the Segway (which it was!). They were booked, so I left my name with them in case there was a cancellation while we walked around the city that Saturday morning. Jose (the owner) called us back an hour later to join them for the 12pm tour due to a last minute cancellation. There were 10 of us total with 7 of us being 50 to 60 somethingâ€™s. Although a little awkward initially, they give you a chance to get some experience on one while still at the shop. Within 5 minutes, though, youâ€™re steering it like a pro. We split into two groups with a guide in each group. Jose was our guide. It was fun to steer the Segway and fun to see the looks on peopleâ€™s faces as we went through the city, stopping a few minutes at various spots as Jose gave us the local history. We returned to the hotel after our delightful stay in the bus terminal and grabbed our snorkel gear and headed for the beach and some sun bathing. As I indicated previously, there was plenty of room on the beach. Checking Out: Although I generally try to get a late checkout, they were too full to accommodate my request. As everyone else is checking out at the same time though, unless you are on the 10th floor, press the â€œUPâ€� button when heading down to the lobby otherwise, the elevator will bypass your floor, fill up at a higher floor, and be too full when it opens on your floor on the way down. So fill it up BEFORE it gets to the higher floors instead. If you have a later flight, you can check your bags at the concierge desk (although expect a line as everyone else has the same idea). Taxiâ€™s are plentiful (lined up waiting at the Laguna tower) so no real wait time once we decided to depart the hotel. As I hadnâ€™t read any posts about getting to or through the airport security, we opted to return at 12:45pm for our 3:10pm flight, which turned out to be more than enough time as the taxi ride to the airport Sunday afternoon was about 15 minutes, wait at the airline counter was only 10 minutes and security took another 10 minutes. So from hotel to the gate took us about 45 minutes (depending on your airline could be longer as some counters had long wait lines from cruise folks returning home). Seating at the gates is a premium though. Just as the gates were â€œstanding room onlyâ€� when we arrived, so to was it â€œstanding room onlyâ€� when we departed.

Reviews.Title: “Wish we could have stayed longer”
Reviews.Author: screenname000
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for an anniversary celebration. I contacted the Director of Operations via e-mail before the trip (he puts his name & contact info all over this site). He was more than accommodating to us and exceeded our expectations. He gets the concept of customer service, as did the rest of the staff. The room was clean and well maintained. The breakfast service was prompt and courteous. In addition, there is a Starbucks next door and an Enterprise rent-a-car next to that. We also enjoyed some of the local restaurants that were in a safe walking distance. I would not hesitate to return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “hotel is lovely;service is outstanding”
Reviews.Author: 1037wolf
Reviews.Content: Stayed here after our cruise. Were able to check in early and had a lovely minisuite. Very modern and trendy. We are senior citizens, but didn't feel out of place. Conciere service was efficient and friendly, and the front desk was very accomodating for a later check out due to our flight home. Very clean, nice casino and was not afraid to walk around. Will stay here again. They have a lovely breakfast area with beautiful views of the ocean. We liked everything about this hotel. Beautiful pools with lots of room. The only thing is if you are looking to walk for blocks along the beach, the beach area is very small and confined.

Reviews.Title: “Not up to Conrad standards”
Reviews.Author: nikki721
Reviews.Content: I stay at a lot of hotels and this hotel was not up to standards. For sure not for a Conrad. First of all room was suppose to be ready at 4 p.m. had to wait until 5:15 p.m.. When asked front desk about rooms needng to be ready be 4 p.m. she was very rude and said nothing has to be ready until after 4 p.m.. I am a Diamond member and was suppose to have an upgraded room when walking to my room the cleaing staff was sitting in the hallway on the floor resting. Loved to see that. When I walked into my room I slipped on the floor. Noticed they washed the floor but never dried it. Since the cleaning staff was outside my door ask if they could dry it. It seemed the head cleaning lady came and and said they forgot to dry it. She did take care of it. Room was very small and not upgraded. Called down and they said to call tomorrow and they would have a new room for me. Yeah like I want to switch rooms. The view was bad. Looked at garbage of the hotel I think. The walls were very thin and heard loud noises all night. Decide to call the Diamond desk and they switch me to the Hilton. So glad I was able to switch the next day. Hilton was great and the staff was very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous!”
Reviews.Author: jimmadson
Reviews.Content: We were coming back from a cruise on Saturday and our flight was cancelled due to weather. We decided to stay another night in Puerto Rico. Much better than getting stuck in Detroit! I went to Trip Advisor and found this hotel. It wasn't cheap but it was wonderful! The lobby and room were very well decorated. There was a great balcony. The beach and resort area was great. We went snorkeling right off the beach. The water was a little cloudy because the surf was high but we still saw hundreds of colorful fish. The beds were so comfortable I felt like I was drugged when I slept.

Reviews.Title: “customer service A+”
Reviews.Author: weekendgetaway13
Reviews.Content: we arrived 11:00a.m.- the front desk greeted us with a welcome and immediatly gave us a key to our room- though check-in was hours away. We opened the door to a room tht looked exactly as it does on the website. The bed was the most comfortable hotel bed I have EVER slept in! The staff was exceptional! ex: Carlos from housekeeping- day 1 I went to a cart outside my room to ask if I could have a few more coffee packets- he gave them to me with a smile- instead of acting like I was keeping him from doing his job- the next day I went to a cart outside my room -again it was Carlos, he smiled and said "coffee- regular not decaf, right?" he remembered what I wanted and that detail made me feel very welcomed and at home. another example - Michelle, our poolside server, was very accommodationg- to us, and those seated at the pool around us- we ordered breakfast poolside- one morning it must have been 11:30 by the time we ordered and instead of saying "no" and handing us the lunch menu in her hand- she went back to the kitchen to get us the breakfast menu and check with the kitchen to see if it was o.k. to order breakfast. It was! We were there Superbowl Sunday and the hotel went to great lengths to make it special- they set up big screens in the main lobby lounge, the poolside restaurant and one in the back of Varita restaurant- we chose the lobby - it was sponsored by Rums of Puerto Rico and there were raffle tickets if purchasing discounted rum drinks. Many peope won t-shirts, Rum, travel mugs and gift basket- it was fun and festive! I really enjoyed my stay thanks to the customer service skills of the management and staff. I own a small Boutique on the CT shore and people come in this time of year looking for resort wear- when we share Caribbean destination stories- I will recommend Condado Plaza for service and value. I plan to make this long weekend and annual event. I do have one negative about my stay which the hotel has no control over- except the impression on its visitors- we walked Ashford Avenue the first afternoon- leaving the lobby the first thing we saw was the abandoned, graffittied, crumbling building next door, it made me sick to see such a sight- so sad in fact we turned around and went right back to the hotel. A special Thanks to Carlos from housekeeping and Michelle from poolside restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Just okay”
Reviews.Author: CamiOhio
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here a night after a cruise. I was not not overly impressed with this hotel. We had a bay view room, which was adequate. Just to clarify, the hotel has 2 towers on opposite sides of the street. The tower on the bayside seems to be used for conventions. The bed was comfortable and the bathroom was large. The pool area needs refurbished. There are 2 pools, the nicer of the 2 is the "party" pool and not very relaxing. The lobby is very modern and appears to be well kept. Marisol, at the concierge desk, was very helpful. She helped us pick the perfect restaurant for our friend's b-day (Marmalade in Old San Juan). I would stay here again if just for one night, but not an extended stay.

Reviews.Title: “The bed and view was fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: BRWare
Reviews.Content: When first entering the hotel its look is very modern and bright. The staff was very friendly throughout our stay. We never had any problems with our room or service at all. My fiance and I thought the shower and bed were the best amenities at the hotel. One thing I was slightly disappointed with was the size of the beach. They don't really show you how small it is online but it was never a problem. Whenever we were there it was not crowded and the water was great. The staff was very helpful and accommodating. I thought it a little rude to require hotel guests to pay $11 to rent a umbrella on the beach but there were plenty of shaded areas around. I read alot of reviews before I booked this trip and the one thing I can definitely agree on is the high price of dining at the hotel. We didnt count on was how expensive it would be to eat everywhere. Whether in Old San Juan or at the hotel, the prices were all very comparable. It just depends on what you have a taste for. On a whole, I would definitely recommend this hotel to others. It was very quiet, very clean and had spectacular view wherever we looked. We're definitely going back to Puerto Rico in the future but will probably not stay at this hotel only because we want to try it out in Old San Juan the next time around.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful location but need remodeling”
Reviews.Author: Dimka7
Reviews.Content: This hotel is pretty nice from prospect of location. Yet for a reserved in advance $300/night ocean-view room they offered me a laguna-view room, which is cheaper on their own site. Then, after a fight with a manager, they offered a 2nd floor room with ocean-view. But the room was filthy with sperm-stains on a couch and suspicious debris on the floor. (see pics). After another heated argument with administration they changed room to a "handicapped room" with ocean view, but wi-fi didn't working there despite their promise that it is working. I had to go to my previous sperm-stained room and get a cord to connect computer. Room was clean this time, yet there is so many signs of fatigue in the bathroom, floors etc which should not be in a 5 star hotel. I will not stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous time, Fabulous Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: DanyLizFrequentFlyer
Reviews.Content: First of all the previous reviewer was very dramatic. What do you expect them to do change out a mattress in 24 hours..they probably didn't even notice until you pointed it out. And everyone has a bad day..don't blame the concierge for everything. Yes this hotel has a vibrant lobby, but I did not hear it from my room. And it is fun and convenient, you can get dressed up and go down for a couple drinks, then to the casino adjacent. This was a very modern, CLEAN hotel and very fun! I travel once a month, I work for an airline so I'm always somewhere, and this is one of the nicest hotels I have stayed in. Nice, modern, fresh lobby, has a very miami vibe. Great DJ on the weekends. The rooms are modern and clean, comfortable bed (definetly spring for the ocean front room..it makes all the difference!) The view can't be beat, and the waves crashing onto the rocks while you sleep is sure to slip you into a great calming dream :) The staff was totally nice and so helpful. Didn't have a problem with anyone and I stayed for 5 days. The facilities are very nice, great gym, two outdoor hot tubs, and big clean pools. It has a beach on the side which is also a public beach but very safe and clean. Small but lovely, it is on a lagoon which on sunny days is perfect for snorkeling! This is a great base for exploring the island or for before or after a cruise. I had a great time! I have also stayed at the Hilton Caribe across the way and I prefer this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Horrifying- Blood stains in the bed.....seriously.”
Reviews.Author: traveljunkie89
Reviews.Content: I should have read the reviews here before I booked as there is a common theme regarding the cleanliness and lack of service. We arrived late and were told on check in that our ocean front room booked 2 months before was not available. We were put in a room off in a wing that was not connected to the main part of the hotel. The room was unclean and adjoined another room which was something we specifically asked not to happen. Again we were told that there were no other rooms available until the next day. We were exhausted and just wanted our bags from the concierge. We waited 2 hours for our bags and every time we called to complain we were told they were on the way. Once we had our bags we got ready for bed. Upon pulling the covers back we discovered that they had made the bed with fresh sheets over top of a dirty mattress cover. The cover had a big puddle of mentsrual blood on it from a previous guest. DISGUSTING! The more revolting part is that when we called to complain to the manager he didn't care and complained that is was 3am and what did we expect him to do at that hour. The worst experience we have ever had, 3rd world countries have better hotels than this.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, certainly does not deserve the negative reviews. One of the best in Puerto Rico.”
Reviews.Author: original_roadwarrior
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Conrad for a week as I was here with colleagues for business. I have been to PR several times and have stayed at different hotels (last year at the Intercontinental Isla Verde). I was booked as part of a hotel + flight deal on expedia, so I am not sure exactly what we paid for the hotel. The hotel setting is quite beautiful, on the end of a peninsula, opening onto a large, protected bay. Because of this the waves are greatly reduced and this makes it ideal for swimming. As an avid beach person, and swimmer, this is important to me. The beach was great, quiet and quite shallow so good to be able to swim out far without any concerns. Also decent snorkeling, not amazing... It is a large hotel, and there are several nice restaurants that compare well to the local restaurants in price and quality. You can find food for less within close walking distance from the hotel. Like most travelers, we usually do a combination of nice restaurants mixed in with fast food, local cuisine, etc. Great fitness room with very hot steam, seperate sauna. Very nice facility with new machines. good equipment and we trained every day that we were there. The workout area is on par with a good healthclub. The rooms are very nice. We were upgraded on arrival to an ocean view room, which was very nice. We did also see the laguna side rooms, and they are great as well. You can't go wrong as both rooms offered a waterfront view. The bathrooms are a little akward as people have said in other rooms, but it's not really a big deal. Truth is, the bathrooms are very modern and well done from a materials / design perspective. All the amenities are there. The strange part is that they put the closet in with the shower / toilet area, in one large room. So this makes it awkward as we were traveling here for business. But we worked it out, and it really wasn't too big of a deal. The staff are very professional, everyone speaks perfect english, which was nice and helped make interactions easier. We had also had 10 boxes sent to us by ups for our meeting, and all were received no problem and they helped us unpack and load them. Our rooms were cleaned everyday, very thoroughly, which was needed as we always were needing this refresh (lots of towels, linens changed ,, etc). The pool area is great. There is a lot of space so it is easy to find a beautiful spot to chill for the day. There are also hamocks around overlooking the ocean. The pool and beach areas are very close. There are 2 pools, including a salt water pool, a hot tub - there's also a really fun little waterslide that I am not ashamed to admit I actually did a few times. I believe many of the negative reviews are from people that come to PR for one night before a cruise and have unrealistic expectations. I also believe that many people do not post something unless they had a bad experience, and I think this is unfair. I would definitely return to the Conrad, it was a lot of fun.

Reviews.Title: “Fur Coat No Knickers”
Reviews.Author: BowBell
Reviews.Content: Disappointing - I had never stayed at a Conrad before and had high expectations, especially after reading the hotel's website. The hotel turned out to be an over-priced disappointment - it's just the old Wyndham Condado Plaza tarted up and when you scratch beneath the surface, not much has changed. First impressions are good - the lobby and bar area are really cool and trendy with fabulous ambient lounge music - great! As soon as you leave the lobby though, it's really not great. The corridors to the rooms are basically still as they were when the hotel was a Wyndham and to rooms, whilst they have had a refurb are already dated with shabby decor - lots of scuffs on the paintwork. The bathroom is also so small you need to squeeze around the toilet to get into the shower! Only top marks go to the bed, it was one of the most comfortable I have slept in for a long time!

Reviews.Title: “Terrible, terrible, terrible. Do NOT stay here!”
Reviews.Author: NaluWahini
Reviews.Content: I do not understand how this hotel can call itself upscale! The lock on our room did not work, the door on the balcony locked me out on the balcony, the shower leaked water all over the bathroom, the sink backed up, the bathroom allows for no privacy, the concierge service was unhelpful, the staff could not have cared less and on and on and on. I had to call 8 times to get the issues addressed and in the end they STILL did nothing to resolve any of these issues. The room walls were so paper thin we thought the alarm on the blackberry going off in the room next to ours was ours! If you stay on the 3rd floor on Friday or Saturday night, be prepared to not go to sleep until 3 am, as the bars downstairs blare the music so loud you can feel the bass in your bed. Save your money and your vacation. Do NOT stay here. They claim they just spent $75 million re-doing the hotel, but we could not tell what they spent it on. The beach is so tiny and rocky, not at all what the pictures online make it out to be. The awning for the hotel patio has holes in it . Would I recommend this hotel to a friend? NO! I wouldn't even recommend it to an enemy.

Reviews.Title: “I liked the hotel”
Reviews.Author: CTPJ
Reviews.Content: Here's my take on Conrad San Juan Condado Plaza. I went with my family/in laws on a caribbean cruise and decided to stay a couple of nights in San Juan. I booked the reservation on Hilton.com for 3 rooms using the advanced purchase option. I reserved 3 ocean vista rooms for about $224.00 per night, which i thought was very inexpensive. They charged my credit card for only one of the rooms (STRIKE 1) which I caught when I was checking my balance online. I contacted the hotel before I arrived and they charged me for the other two rooms. Got off the cruise ship at 9:00 am January 24 and headed to the hotel. When I checked in only one room was ready (believe me I was grateful, I know standard check in time is 3:00 or 4:00 pm) but all the rooms were in my name. I asked the front desk person if he would like the names of my guests and he just looked at me like, huh? (STRIKE 2) So whatever, we all put our luggage in the one room and went to the pool. Since mine was the only name on the rooms it was awkward getting towels because they ask for your name and room number, and charging drinks/food to room for the same reason. Again whatever, most of the family stayed at the pool, my spouse and I went to the casino. I liked the casino. Checked with the front desk around 3:00 pm and other two rooms were still not ready. Now I have dropped a significant amont of money at the casino and really want to chill in room for a while. I checked again at 4:30 and the guy at the front desk called housekeeping to see if rooms were ready, 20 minutes later he said they were ready. I got the group together and we went to the rooms. Immediately as I walk in I see a dirty towel on the floor. As I look around there is trash everywhere, dirty cups, beer bottles, bed not made, so i call the front desk, no answer. (STRIKE 3) I head back to the front desk, talk to the same guy, he sort of apologizes, and says there are no other available rooms and we would have to wait for housekeeping to clean the room. We headed back up to the room and waited another 20 minutes for housekeeping. So all in all it was about 6:00 pm when the room was ready. So after all that - I actaully liked the room a lot. I liked the contemporary look of the room. I thought the room was pretty spacious. The bathroom was nice. Bed was comfortable. And best of all, the view. The ocean view is AMAZING. It was so relaxing sitting on the large balcony watching the waves crash against the rocks. The pool area is very nice. Two pools - one freshwater, one saltwater. Lots of trees and foliage. Plenty of chairs located by the pools, on the grass, in various areas on the rocks. The beach area is small but nice. The facilities at the hotel are nice. The lobby bar is cool and fun. Japanese restaurant was good as well as room service. Casino was good. I have stayed at the following hotels an San Juan: Ritz Carlton, El San Juan, La Concha, and Marriott. I would put this hotel in the same category...for a lot less money. Here is my summary: The front desk guy really upset me a lot, however, I really liked the hotel. $200 a night is cheap for this kind of hotel. That view from the room was the amazing.

Reviews.Title: “Not what we expected.”
Reviews.Author: jandkmom
Reviews.Content: We traveled to and stayed in this hotel for a wedding. Though the ballroom at the hotel was beautiful, the rest of it left something to be desired. The room was not at all what we expected, mainly because it was much smaller than it was made to seem on the hotel's website. We had three adults and one baby staying in one of the family suites, and we were on top of each other. For a suite, and the price we paid for it, we certainly expected a lot more room. In addition, there wasn't nearly enough room to hang clothes in the closet, and we had to put the crib we requested for the baby in between the two twin beds in one of the rooms. The housekeepers never provided enough complete sets of towels for all of us, despite us asking for them, and the room wasn't as clean as it should have been. The pool area was nice, though the staff threatened to charge $20 per towel if they weren't returned by 7pm, yet the pools and hot tub were open 24 hours. I have never heard of such a thing at any other hotel. If traveling to this area of San Juan, think carefully before spending a lot of money at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Decent Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: oak331
Reviews.Content: Probably deserves a rating of 3.5. The hotel rooms were modern and clean but not very spacious. We had an ocean-view room which gave us a great view of the Atlantic. The pool-area is open 24 hours with 2 pools. The beach area is very small, there's no spa in the hotel, and the restaurants are somewhat pricey. Not your best bet if you are interested in tourist attractions and San Juan nightlife (hotels in Isla Verde are probably better) but there are several good restaurants within walking distance of the hotel. We got our fifth night free by booking through Hotels.com and definitely recommend if you can get a similar package deal.

Reviews.Title: “Good location/Excellent value”
Reviews.Author: steveref
Reviews.Content: Despite reading mixed reviews I was very happy when I was assigned this hotel by Hotwire. I was looking forward to the location, casino and restaurants. I took advantage of the offer extended by Mr. Jose Padin, Director of Operations to tripadvisor readers to contact him with any requests. He accommodated our preference for number of beds and made sure the rooms were ready upon our arrival. He also extended a late check-out on our final day. I liked the location. The area is not congested and we were close to Old San Juan, Isla Verde and the airport. The hotel staff was pleasant and responsive to our requests. The Condado Plaza has one of the largest casinos in San Juan and we rarely had to wait to play blackjack, even at the $5 tables. After going down the street to Hacienda Don Jose for breakfast the first morning we ate the remainder of our breakfasts in the hotel at the Cafe Caribe. For only a few dollars more you get a greater variety of choices, better service and a much nicer ambience. We often came back to the cafe in the late evening for coffee and dessert as they had a large selection of cakes and pies from which to choose. In fact, one evening they reopened for us as we arrived after closing time. The pool area is spacious with an outdoor bar and restaurant; however, the beach is very small.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful get-away and perfect hotel”
Reviews.Author: wackywidow
Reviews.Content: On a cold and gloomy Chicago day in January, my friend and I decided we had to get-away. Utilizing several travel sites, we booked a trip to San Juan and the Conrad Hotel for the following week. However, as the hours of our departure grew closer, we began to worry about the negative comments made on Tripadvisor.com regarding the Conrad. We were pleasantly relieved. The hotel is beautiful. Very modern, trendy. Great looking lobby. Several restaurants in the hotel, including Pikayo, which is very highly recommended (although we only had drinks there). Several bars, great casino (actually came home w/ money!!). and the most breath-taking views. The hotel sits right on the atlantic ocean with beautiful grounds that afford you an opportunity to sit on the many terraces, lounge chairs or hammocks spreadout throughout the grounds and watch the waves of the atlantic crash on the rocks. The pools are lovely. A fresh water pool, salt water pool, hot tub and kiddy pool. Plus the beach and a waterslide. staff was very pleasant and helpful. Rooms were well decorated and clean. Only complaint is the price of the drinks. $10 for a 6oz plastic cup for a pina colada that comes out of a cardboard box.

Reviews.Title: “I loved this hotel”
Reviews.Author: hobiecatsailor
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 5 nights on a business trip to San Juan. It was my first time to Puerto Rico and I was traveling alone. I loved the hotel and my room. I had a corner room with a great view of the ocean and beach/pool area below from one side of the room and a great view of the city from the wall of windows going out to my own private balcony. The hotel staff was friendly and helpful. I used the valet parking each day and it was great. The beach although small was very nice and uncrowded. There is an awesome restaurant within walking distance of the hotel called Ajili mojili which has delicious Puerto Rican food! I also liked the fact that there is a Starbucks at the entrance of the hotel. My room was tastefully decorated and very clean. I also really liked the bathroom. The hotel really does have beautiful views of the ocean! I am going back in March and staying at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Not REALLY a Conrad”
Reviews.Author: ckstocker
Reviews.Content: Not a good place to stay. The escalator wasn't working for several days. The elevator wouldn't stop on the right floors, people were getting off the wrong floor and just taking the stairs to get to the right floor. There was a leak in the casino ceiling, so they put out a blanket to catch the water. The restaurant Names didn't match the menus. We went to the same restaurant twice and got two totally different dishes. The food was terrible and expensive. We spent $40 on breakfast at the cafe by the pool and they served me one egg, one round piece of bacon, one small piece of watermelon, toast, and some sort of orange juice powdered mix. It seemed weird to me that they didn't serve fresh orange juice or even fresh fruit. They served my husband fruit cocktail from a can with his breakfast. We got back from a tour late one night around 11:30 and all the restaurants were closed, except for the 8 Noodle bar, which is a good restaurant. I thought that it was weird that we had to give our room number to borrow an umbrella, which had a completely broken handle and was an advertisement for some insurance company, and we had to give a room number to borrow towels for the pool. When you go to borrow towels, they leave the complete hotel list on the counter. You can visually see every name, room number, and how much they are paying per night. I was shocked to see that most people were paying $119-$150 a night, especially when we were paying $244. ERRRGGGG!! It is so disappointing to know that they are considered a five star hotel just because it is a "Conrad". Usually, the Conrad is impeccable. The final disappointment came at check out. They had said that if we purchased four nights that we would receive a coupon for a free nights stay at any Conrad that we could use the next time we stayed at any Conrad. The coupon read, "Purchase 3 nights and receive 1 nights free stay". So, we have to purchase another 3 nights to receive a free nights stay. And, the 3 nights have to be at full price. The hotel isn't in a good location. It is in between Condado and Old San Juan. The other hotels around it are all closed down and boarded up.

Reviews.Title: “Really too expensive for the rest you can get.”
Reviews.Author: moimemeQuebec
Reviews.Content: Back from a cruise, we've stayed at the hotel for one night, Saturday, 2010, January 16th. The room was large (lagoon tower) enough, clean, a/c quiet and efficient, bath room clean. The main concern are : a) walls too thin, we can hear everything from the corridor and other room, b)door slaming dance, you'll hear a loud noise from any door on the third floor at least when they will be close (once every 15 minutes from 9PM until 4 AM), c) no control at all from the hotel employees on the party on the third floor, saturday night. Is it really a Hilton ?? Did we really pay 200$ for the night ? Saturday we had a breakfast at the Cafe caribe, 4 persons, 2 eggs/meat/toats/coffee, we have waited 35 minutes before someone has welcomed us. Then, 10 minutes later we went to ask to get coffee, very bad service and bad coffee also. We've paid $ 52 ! A lady (short, young) who work at cafe caribe, was really good, did the apologise for everything. That person deserve to manage that restaurant. try another hotel.

Reviews.Title: “No doubt, a great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: judy523
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for one night prior to a cruise. I was impressed with the whole experience from start to finish. There is a lovely little beach, very pretty pools and well maintained grounds. The lobby and main public areas are immaculate and very modern looking. Our room was beautiful with a great view of the ocean from the balcony. The casino was lots of fun, and I won which made it even better. You can't go wrong with this hotel. I have stayed at various other hotels in Puerto Rico and would rate this as one of the very best. The staff is very friendly and helpful, and if you have any questions or concerns contact Jose in guest relations he is the man. Thank you Jose for making our trip a memorable one.

Reviews.Title: “Poorly located and tiny rooms, clean, decent beach”
Reviews.Author: BarbiBooS
Reviews.Content: Rooms-we rented a "family suite" which was really just a regular sized room cut in half with a small sliding glass door in between the rooms,minimal privacy. The room looks deceivingly large in the online pictures. Beds were reasonably comfortable General hotel areas-are nicely decorated. Some areas smell bad. Only one elevator to our room functioned and there were very long waits Beach-was ok, next to a bridge/busy road, so no ambience and loud Pool-was nice, there is a cool kid's slide and pool bar, a separate salt water pool Location-on Ashford avenue, you will still need a cab to Old San Juan which is really beautiful. The hotel is next to an abandoned building covered in grafiti. We felt overall safe walking on the street Service-poor except the valets Restaurants-we did not eat here, except Starbucks in the morning

Reviews.Title: “Really not worth the money”
Reviews.Author: AWandCG
Reviews.Content: This is a horrible casino resort hotel, located at the poor end of Ashford Avenue. The room was damp, rugs were actually wet, so the floor was slippery (and dangerous). Breakfast was mean and poor quality. The pool area was OK. Really don't recommend this hotel though. And they had the cheek to add resort fees on to the bill (so do other hotels there though). Why not just include that in the room rate as it is unavoidable?

Reviews.Title: “Conrad Pool Bar”
Reviews.Author: CindeeK
Reviews.Content: The pool bar at the Conrad was great! Kimberly was our bartender every day and she was so wonderful!! We were at 3 different hotels on the Island and that place and the people (Kimberly) were the BEST!!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice, Relaxing Stay”
Reviews.Author: Virgo1975
Reviews.Content: This was my honeymoon with my husband after being married for 10 years. He does not travel much and neither he nor I had ever been to Puerto Rico. I initally was concerned about the hotel because of the mixed reviews and complaints about the customer service. Well I am happy to report that the staff was great and housekeeping was great too. My husband and I fell in love with Puerto Rico and the hotel stay was good and we would definitley stay here again. We arrived at 6:30 in the morning and had been so concerned that we would have to wait for a room until check in time. Well we got a room right away- and that made us very happy. The area the hotel is at is very touristy and very expensive. Old San Juan is even worse but nice to walk around and see anyways. We were on vacation and knew food can be pricey BUT we can afford it and it's not something we do all the time. I did like that we could walk around the hotel area and there are other resorts and places to eat besides at the hotel. The casino is small and I doubt ever pays out-so it is NOT worth dumping your money at. I loved the local food and eating at the local restaurants. The hotel is right on a beach BUT the area that is safe to go swim at is small and the area is rocky-so be careful. The water is nice and clear enough to go snorkeling. I would suggest bringing your own snorkeling gear instead of renting the stuff from the hotel because again it is soooo expensive. Another thing I suggest is to NOT book tours through the hotel because again they are VERY expensive! I made sure to book before we arrived in Puerto Rico. We used three different tour companies but the best by far was www.kayakingpuertorico.com. We did the rain forrest tour with the bioluminescent bay all in one day. We both loved the rain forrest and thought it was so pretty but if your not into nature and greenery then this might not be something you would enjoy. Also if you do the bioluminescent tour be for warned that you will need mosquito repellent. I was covered in mosquito bites and was MISERABLE! But it was nice kayaking at night and seeing the water glow in the night. Another tour I loved was the trip to Culebra. It was another all day adventure and so pretty. We went snorkeling and then were taken to this pretty beach named Flamenco Beach-very nice. I can go on and on about our trip. Bottom line is that the hotel was nice for what we needed and that was a clean room to sleep in and keep our things. Most of the time we were outdoors enjoying the great weather. I would recommend this hotel and will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, but pricey and the service is so poor!”
Reviews.Author: Ama12
Reviews.Content: I stayed for my destination wedding on the island, I requested ahead a room looking at the beach and few family and fiends stay in the hotel too. First we have to wait more than 30 min to check in, they give me a very small room with "city view" because the hotel room I requested seems to be overbooked. The clerks were hostile all the time. I saw my friends room and all were larger than mine- even with my special request. The room wasn't very clean and the a/c was damaged. The pool area is nice, but we tried to have luch and also we have to wait more than 45 min for 2 sandwiches and they automatically charge a 22% of gratuity if you eat in the pool area- and the food is not worth the wait and neither the money. The drinks are very expensive- almost $10 to 12 each. The club in the Lobby Eternal is very nice, but as everything pricey. There are better options in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Holiday Decompression”
Reviews.Author: Lifelonglibrarian
Reviews.Content: This beautiful hotel is perched above the rocky shore of the ocean. The ocean-side guest rooms offer an eat-on size balcony and a view of the ocean through wall-to-wall glass windows and a door. Sitting on the balcony and listing to the surf is liking being on a cruise ship without the ship. This was a perfect spot to decompress from the rush of the holidays. The attendants all speak English as well as Spanish. The lobby offers many spots to sit and read, as does the back porch. The breakfast menu in the cafe is lacking but adequate. A buffet would be better. This hotel offers luxury accomodations, but the cafe is only a shade better than a bed and breakfast. Within a few blocks of a Chili's, if you miss American fare.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Resort”
Reviews.Author: psj11
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this resort for two nights during the Christmas break. Overall liked the environment, beach area, room, restaurants. The beach and pool area is very nice. Customer service was little poor. We traveled w infant and requested a microwave to warm baby formula, food etc. They did not gave us - they said we do not have a microwave and if you need it pay extra 40 dollars a night. Well, in that price u can buy a microwave! We already paid 300 a night and did not want to pay extra 40. Other than that no issues.

Reviews.Title: “DON'T STAY HERE!”
Reviews.Author: fidds_8
Reviews.Content: What a crappy hotel - we moved to La Concha on second day. Don't believe the glossy pictures on the website. The hotel has had a superficial make-over. The lobby has all this modern furniture and a bar and seating BUT NO ONE IN IT. There is zero negative atmosphere - the pool is a major disappointment - the beach cannot even be called that - the rooms are ok - there is nothing close in the area and next door is what looks like a bombed out building - it is an old Regency Hotel that has been stripped. All that I could have lived with BUT THE SERVICE was beyond bad and no one that worked there seemed to care. We waited 1.5 hours two days in a row to get a cold breakfast that was not consumable. We couldn't even get coffee or water while we waited until we asked a million times. Getting a drink at the pool was spotty at best and the drinks didn't even taste like they had alcohol in them. On at least two occasions, we didn't get our drink order at all - again, no apologies. I had three conversations with reception about checking out early which wasn't a problem - not once did one of the staff bother to ask WHY we were checking out early, when I told them why on check-out, all she could manage was "sorry you feel that way" - not even an apology! This hotel is 2-3 stars AT BEST. Absolutely disgusting - they should be ashamed.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sonja_W4
Reviews.Content: We were here for a college basketball tournament and my kids and I got to stay for free in my boyfriend's room (he works with the basketball team). We had a very nice view of the water and the room was a decent size. The bathroom is nice but most of the storage is in the bathroom and the shower stall is 100% glass. So, if anyone is in there taking a shower, you can't get to anything else in that room. The kids enjoyed the pool and the hammocks. As stated in other reviews, the beach is a public beach and is small. We had a lot of trouble finding the snorkel path and only found one of the artificial reefs of the 16 or so that were there on the path. We bought lunch one day from a food vendor who set up shop on the sidewalk. Good and cheap. Much better deal than the hotel food. The 3 of us ate (with drinks) for about the same price as a hamburger at the poolside grill.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel and Location But Dirty”
Reviews.Author: jlv1634
Reviews.Content: The hotel lobby and general atmosphere was very nice. It also had a very nice Casino. The location was great. A lot of nice restaurants ans shopping within walking distance. It also had a nice little beach just next to the pool. The view of the ocean was great. The only complaint I had was that they did not do a good job of cleaning the rooms. When we checked in the floors in the room and the bathroom had other peoples body hair. It just turned us off.

Reviews.Title: “Checked Out After 45 Minuets!!!”
Reviews.Author: contemporary123
Reviews.Content: First of all when we arrived the hotel it looked totally different online. I know you can't trust pictures but i mean it looked totally different. When we arrived at the check in desk they told us the room wouldn't be ready till four. As we were waiting we decided to check out the hotel. When we were walking around, the lobby was being renovated! Online and when we contacted the hotel to make the reservation they said nothing about it still being renovated! We decided to have lunch at " Aqua Bar ." It took about 25 minuets to get a menu let alone even getting some ones attention. While waiting for a waiter we were on the phone with La Concha which is the hotel down the street were we stayed once before asking if they had any room's left. La Concha had a room available. We left lunch ( remember we still didn't have a menu ) and checked out and went to La Concha. La Concha is far nicer and has much better service. Actually, while we were laying by the pool at La Concha the people sitting next to us checked out too!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with a great staff in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Tober138
Reviews.Content: We had never been to San Juan before but wanted a quick getaway to somewhere warm between Christmas and New Years and this seemed like a perfect choice coming from the States and not having to deal with customs. We narrowed our choice of hotel down to this and the Hilton Caribe (as we wanted to burn some HHonors points for this stay) and selected this one based on the reviews of the two here on Trip Advisor; we could not have been more pleased. We arrived just before 1:00 PM and had planned on having to check our bags with the concierge, changing into something more comfortable and hanging by the pool until our room was ready. However, they had a room ready for us right away. They were unable to upgrade us to an ocean view room, but did give us a suite, which we thought was a nice gesture (especially considering we did not pay for the room); having the extra room was nice, but we did not plan to spend much time in our room to begin with. In general, the room was clean, comfortable and well-appointed, and, as others have mentioned, they have made an effort to give this older hotel a more modern look. Our only improvement to this room would have been a larger balcony; the rooms in this section of the hotel had a smaller balcony which had room to stand, but no room for a few chairs, as some of the other rooms did appear to have. We spent time at both the main pools and the beach, as well as the smaller, more secluded pool in the back of the hotel. Although the public could access the resort area from the main road, the hotel's security staff ensured that non-guests were not taking amenities away from the hotel guests. There was a lot of outdoor space both in the sun and in the shade, which is always a plus for us as I like to get some sun and my girlfriend prefers to be someplace where she won't burn without applying spf 200 every 20 minutes. The only room for improvement by the outdoor areas was that there sometimes seemed to be a lack of towels available by the smaller pool on the lagoon side; something we discussed with other guests as well. Overall, this hotel was a great choice for us - nice rooms and amenities, a very helpful staff (from the maids, to the bartenders to the concierge staff) and in walking distance to some of the restaurants and shops in Condado. The few items where we noticed a bit of "room for improvement" were minor details and in no way detracted from our trip. We plan to go back to San Juan and will likely stay here again when we do. A few notes for future guests: 1 - There is a small market about 5-6 blocks down the street (easy walking distance) if you want to stock up on drinks or snacks for the room without paying the gift shop prices. 2 - If you want a drink inside the hotel, the bartenders at Pikayo are much more generous with their pours compared to the bar on the lobby floor. 3 - For breakfast outside of the hotel (as their cafe did run up a long wait), try Hacienda Don Jose about a block down the street (see my separate review). 4 - Other restaurants we enjoyed within walking distance: Budatai (see separate review) and Waiter's Gastropub (not currently listed on Trip Advisor; I think its brand new).

Reviews.Title: “too much money for too little cleanliness”
Reviews.Author: panneohara
Reviews.Content: I only agreed to pay $250 a night since this was the only hotel I could find for only one night on a return from a cruise. It was tolerable but the floor was dirty, the shower was dirty and leaked. The consierge staff couldn't find my bags and I had to go back and look for them. I expect much more from such an expensive room.

Reviews.Title: “Not too good”
Reviews.Author: Grahamarb
Reviews.Content: We have recently returned from the Conrad in San Juan, PR. The location is fine as are the rooms. The Pikayo restaurant is very, very good. Worth the price. The problem is the unresponsive front desk staff. One night there was a great deal of shouting and door slamming on our floor starting at 10:30pm. We called the operator and were told the problem would be addressed. It was not. At 4:30 am I told the staff I would call the police if nothing was done. At last the unruly guests (adults by the sound of them) quieted down. The next morning we complained to the executive office about the situation. I indicated I had been in Puerto Rico on business two years ago and stayed at the Marriott when the same situation developed. My complaint resulted in removal of one night's charges by the Marriott. No such luck at the Conrad. They took off one-half a night. Inadequate in my view. The main problem is not a refund, it was the unresponsive staff who simply did not care. Further, there are no newspapers available, not even a USA Today. I travel on business and am a Hilton Diamond member. Not to have a newspaper at the front desk is extraordinary, even in these hard times. Finally, there is no bathrobe in the room. Really carrying pennypinching by the hotel to ridiculous levels. I think you should be careful about staying there.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad, not good neither”
Reviews.Author: Two_whiskers
Reviews.Content: We chose Conrad for our 3-day business trip as opposed to our tendency of staying in Old San Juan. Overall, I thought that for 200 per night (incl. taxes) the hotel is a good value. Itâ€™s also very refreshing to stay in the Caribbean hotel which doesnâ€™t sport flowery bed spreads, wicker furniture and window-mount AC. The good things about this hotel: - DÃ©cor, dÃ©cor, dÃ©cor â€¦ Clean lines, new furniture, bold colors â€“ loved this part. Interesting chairs in the lobby. Little things like reading lights for the bed or conveniently located power plugs. - The size of the rooms â€“ very pleasantly surprised. - Bathroom design and set up â€“ again â€“ neat and modern, I actually liked the placement of the closet in the bathroom as well as coffee station. Bathroom cosmetics were also very nice. They should put a makeup mirror, though. - Pikayo restaurant - we had dinner there and overall enjoyed it. I wrote separate review for that. - Starbucks in the building Not so good: - Parking hassles â€“ When getting off the car as we arrived and taking our luggage off the trunk we were greeted with: â€œyou canâ€™t park here; you have to take the car to the basementâ€�. Thatâ€™s a nice warm welcome for the Guest who is checking in, ha? We couldnâ€™t understand the â€œsystemâ€�, neither. On first night we didnâ€™t know we had to â€œvalidateâ€� our parking ticket to be let out of the parking lot which resulted in me running up the stairs in my high hills and dinner outfit to front desk in pouring rain to resolve it. I wish we were explained the process when we were checking in. Front desk person sent me to the bellman to get instructions and told me that parking is being taken care of by an outside company. So what? Itâ€™s still hotel facility, isnâ€™t it? Next day, we validated our ticket but again couldnâ€™t get out of the parking. The security went on telling us something about 10 minutes rule and then finally let us out. We really didnâ€™t come to Puerto Rico to study parking rituals, so it was bothersome. - Maintenance issues in the room: bathroom doors were completely off the hinges, the sink was clogged and filled with water most of the time, hot water wouldnâ€™t kick in for the first 10 minutes of shower (very eco-unfriendly as we had to let the water run until it got hot), the entry door handle had a problem as well and we had to wrestle with it 6-7 times every time we wanted to get into our room. - Wireless internet â€“ first night it didnâ€™t work at all, I was asked by â€œtechnical supportâ€� to go out on the balcony to use it. Ha ha, that was a good one. They did actually improve it for the rest of our stay, I was able to get 2 bars of signal from the far corner in the bed. - Consierge â€“ completely clueless when we called one night to ask for restaurant recommendations. Not only she wasnâ€™t familiar with nearby dining options but she put us on hold twice and never got back to us, so we went online and took our pick. - Business services â€“ I needed to print out 2 pages from my flash drive. We were directed to Business Canter and thenâ€¦ asked to pay $7.50 for the â€œprivilegeâ€� of turning the computer on. That wasnâ€™t even the printing fee which I didnâ€™t mind paying. I am not very familiar with business hotels and must say I was quite shocked to hear that and felt ripped off. My bad, I guess? - Noodle Bar turned out to be a sad little corner tucked in behind the casino. It had an airport joint kind of feel. We wanted to eat there but went to Pikayo instead. - Aquarium in the lobby. There was a small nurse shark in it and the aquarium was TINY. Poor thing didnâ€™t have space at all as the tank was filled with rocks and decorations. Bad, bad, bad. In 2009 I would think hotel management companies are more environmentally conscious. We were running our errands most of the day, so we didnâ€™t spend much time using facilities. We took a peek into the casino which looked nice. We were eating out most of the time and I would definitely recommend Budatai few blocks down from Conrad. Good food and very attentive service. I am going back to San Juan in January but I am not really sold on staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice stay and very good price”
Reviews.Author: TripguyTexas
Reviews.Content: Great hotel. The reviews are pretty much correct. There are 2 buildings. We stayed on the laguna side and it was very quiet. There is a swimming pool, jacuzzi and restaurant. The fitness center is on this side too with a steam room, sauna and indoor jacuzzi. The other side is the main side with the ocean. There are 3 restaurants on that side. We ate at the Caribe and 8 noodle. Food is expensive in the hotel! It is better to walk down the street to eat. There are better local restaurants with better food. The first set of restaurants is about 5 min walk, but further down it can get up to a 15 min walk. There are liquor stores too, because the drinks at the hotel are expensive. Cab rides are expensive! It cost a min of $10 to go anywhere, even 1 block. They don't even turn on the meter. But if you rent a car, they drive crazy. There is a casino on the main side that gets full on the weekends, but we never went. Friday and Saturday at the Marriott down the street is great music and dancing. It's party central. The beach is ok, but very small. It's really in the bay/laguna. There is a bridge next to it, but you don't really notice it or hear any noise. Great time in all. Got a fall escape package to stay 3 nights and get 4 night free with free breakfast included. Check out El Yunque rain forest. La Mina falls is great spot to get in the water. Negatives: Just expensive for food, drinks, souviners. Go down the street.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience & beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: mzimpala04
Reviews.Content: I was at the hotel at the end of November on vacation and had a wonderful expeirence and would definitely recommend this hotel as it has excellent rooms and service and that it is directly located on the ocean with a wonderful view and is centrally located and a short driving distance of Old San Juan and Isle Verde. I will definitely be returning to this hotel in a few weeks. If one choose not to leave the hotel, there are many things that can keep one occupied and entertained.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: tbuncamper
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful hotel in a great neighborhood, it is easy to get around from here to all the great sites. Old San Juan is only 4 mins away!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel!”
Reviews.Author: BrooklynL
Reviews.Content: We just came back from PR where we staid at Conrad Hotel. We couldnâ€™t be more pleased with this hotel and its staff, especially Director of Operations Jose Padin. He promised us to have our room ready for us upon our arrival at noon and for sure he delivered, moreover he sent a bottle of nice red wine to our room later on because of our special celebration!!!! It was great! I would truly recommend this hotel to everyone!

Reviews.Title: “Had a Great Time!”
Reviews.Author: Ohioponycar
Reviews.Content: I'll start off with what made me rate this a four instead of a total five. We stayed in the tower opposite the main hotel and during our entire stay, one of the elevators was broken. We reported this several times to the front desk and each time we were told "we haven't heard about it". It was being fixed when we left on Sunday the 13th. Aside from that, hotel staff was wonderful both at the front desk, the maids, restaurant waiters and bartenders. We stayed for five nights. Joey, the bartender at the pool is someone you have to see and get to know. Makes wonderful drinks and great conversation. We only ate at one of the restaurants, the Cafe Caribe, for breakfast each day, and the food and service were very good (we went elsewhere for lunch and dinner daily). The casino was fun, active all the time and cleaned constantly. The relatively small beach was in good shape and the breakwater does a nice job of keeping the waves managable.
