The pools were great, the main one by the bar (Joey), also has a waterslide that kids and adults will enjoy. This hotel does a lot of conference business but it never intrudes on vacationers. Some holiday parties were in evidence also, again, things ran smoothly with all of that going on. There are some very nice restaurants down the street, we recommend Ropa Vieja and Ajilli Mojilli if you are looking for local food. There is a Subway close by that also has breakfast, a Starbucks in the hotel as well as an Enterprise rental location (which we used and were happy with). Easy to take a bus or taxi into San Juan.

Reviews.Title: “a little slice of heaven”
Reviews.Author: NyLovethebeach
Reviews.Content: First of all, I have to say that Jose Padin(Guest Services) is hands down the best! My husband had to go to San Juan for business and I decided to join him. I emailed Jose prior to booking my flight because I had read the reviews on Trip Advisor and his response is always 'contact me' with any questions so that's what I did. He not only upgraded our rooms but very graciousely allowed us a very late check-out since our flight was delayed 2 hours. The ocean view room was just spectacular, from the decor to the beautiful bathroom! and the views from the balcony were just breathtaking! the grounds are immaculate and the staff - including the maid staff - were second to none. Look no further if you are planning a trip to San Juan - the Conrad is the ONLY place to stay!! my sincerest thanks to Jose for an unforgettable getaway!!

Reviews.Title: “An unexpected Treat”
Reviews.Author: travelbh
Reviews.Content: From a smile at reception, to speedy check in, and a wonderfully modern room, the hotel has the air of a first class resort. Add to that the casino, and some fine restaurants and you have the makings of a terrific place to spend a few days.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel; very modern and amazing service.”
Reviews.Author: topaz309
Reviews.Content: Service was great, after staying at the El San Juan which was a horrible experience the Conrad was a much better option. We would definitely stay there again. The casino was great, restaurants onsite were great and the front desk staff was exceptional.

Reviews.Title: “great pools and beach.”
Reviews.Author: krawner
Reviews.Content: The Conrad Condado is magnificent. The lobby looks chic and trendy. The rooms are spacious. The 4 pools, whirlpool, steam room, and sauna can't be beat. The beach next to Condado (towards the bridge, not the one directly behind it) has great snorkeling and is protected by a double barrier reef to prevent undertow and large waves from sweeping you away. The set-up of the hotel is kind of different because it's 2 hotels across the street from each other, connected by a bridge on the mezzanine level. there's some amenities in one building, and some in the other. there's also a great water slide in the shape of a fort of old san juan. The downside is there's no free internet ($7 for 15 minutes) and the maintenance crew is shoddy. My bathroom sink stopped working and they didn't fix it after I called the hotel lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Best Mojitos and Tastefully Renovated”
Reviews.Author: wwyz
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed here for one night before we left on a cruise. The hotel had obviously been renovated but was chic and colourful. The lobby was beautiful, the room was very tastefully decorated and the view from our balcony over the ocean was great. The bar/restaurant deck looked very inviting, as did the pool and grounds but we were not there long enough to use them. The mojitos in the lobby lounge were excellent! I have noticed that people complain about the damp or dank smells in many hotels - when the humidity is as great as it is there you have to expect a little of that. The room was spotlessly clean and the bathroom was beautiful, although I understand that some people may not have appreciated the somewhat loose sliding doors as a privacy issue. I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great foyer, casino looked glam, but rooms like dank prison cells.....”
Reviews.Author: AmondeYenne
Reviews.Content: Arrived in rain, an old hotel, re-modelled, money spent on public areas. Our room smelt dank. The balcony was useless, the view appalling as a derelict building with graffitti was off to the right and a poverty-stricken block of flats in front of it. The room felt like a prison cell designed by the colour blind - bright primaries that clashed. They'd used some nice materials like marble and granite, but the room design made them useless. Hopeless bathroom with no privacy. It depressed us to be there. We phoned Expedia and they managed to get us moved to the Ritz Carlton, which was expensive but very good. I'd recommend the Conrad to adult gamblers who don't sleep much. Pool small and looked decrepit.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Cinnam0n
Reviews.Content: I am a Hilton Honors member and was able to pay for my entire stay with my points so I essentially stayed for free....so, keep that in mind. The lobby is very modern and chic, check in was fast, easy and the staff are very nice. The hotel is a little dated, but the room is nice, very modern. We had an ocean view on a high level and we looked out to a gorgeous view of the ocean from the bed. The beach is actually a public beach that is in a little bay, the view isn't the best as it looks directly onto a roadway. The pool is wonderful with no shortage of spots to lay out. And while the shore is very rocky --you can't go out on it--it is a gorgeous view. Now to a couple of downsides that would have been BIG downsides if I didn't stay for free. Room service ends at 11:00 pm, which is disappointing since what is the purpose of room service it not the ability to eat at any time of the day. Their are no drink vending machines, so if you need water, you are out of luck. The gift shop is open very limited hours and is insanely expensive. Eight Noodle cafe is open until 4, but is expensive and not all that great. The casino was fun and Pikayo was great for appetizers. The location is odd, its a fair walk from other hotels and restaurants. But, I guess the big question is would I stay there again? yes, i would, even if I had to pay! Oh, one last thing, there is virtually no privacy in the bathroom and wireless internet would not work I had to actually plug in!

Reviews.Title: “Porterage charge randomly added”
Reviews.Author: ozite
Reviews.Content: Watch out for the Conrad San Juan Condado plaza randomly adding a porterage charge in the middle of your stay, even if you didn't use it. No wireless connectivity in my room, had to go to the lobby. Loud street during all times of the day/night. Stay elsewhere if possible.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: pw_fl
Reviews.Content: We stayed in an Ocean Vista room up on the 7th floor. The dÃ©cor is modern. The bathroom is large with a very cool glass shower. The views from our room were spectacular. The grounds are immaculate. The pools are inviting and, while we were there, not overly crowded. The CafÃ© Caribe restaurant was very reasonably priced and offers a terrific view and very responsive service. Some of the things that detracted from our stay were not the hotelâ€™s fault such as the construction and graffiti surrounding them. Others however were. We had arrived at the hotel early (1pm) and check in isnâ€™t until 4pm. We understood this so we got checked in and gave our phone number so as to get a call from the front desk as soon as an Ocean Vista room was available and went out to the pool. Well, at 4pm we still hadnâ€™t received a call and when we went to the front desk, they asked who had originally helped us because they seemed to not know who we were (the original person who helped us was no longer at the desk).. Also we had paid a rate that included breakfast but the front desk never filled out our vouchers for this even though our reservation clearly stated this. We had to ask for them. The only other complaint wasâ€¦ on the 2nd morning our in-room coffee supply hadnâ€™t been replenished and on the 3rd night we came back a rainforest excursion dirty and dirty and wet and looking forward to a shower and there were zero towels left in our room by housekeeping. Honestly though, other than the minor issues highlighted, our stay at the Condado was fantastic, romantic, and relaxing and we would absolutely stay there again. The Conrad is a very beautiful hotel.

Reviews.Title: “This Hotel is ideal for pre cruise stay for ships leaving from the Pan American Pier”
Reviews.Author: bocceboy
Reviews.Content: This hotel is top notch in my book. Don't believe some of the earlier nit picky reviews you may have read. The room is plenty spacious with a great bathroom and great views from the ocean view room that we were upgraded to for our pre cruise stay. The grounds and the pools were beautiful and the beach area was ideal for the small area that the hotel has available to use as a beach. The staff we encountered were all very friendly and helpful. The style of the public areas and rooms is very modern and "cool" and you would enjoy it no matter what your age group and we are in our 50's. We didn't get a chance to eat in the main restaurants but the cafe next to the casino was great for breakfast and the price was reasonable for the food and the view. It is an easy short cab ride to the Pan American pier from where Princess and Royal Caribbean ships leave.

Reviews.Title: “Impressive”
Reviews.Author: flygirl58
Reviews.Content: This hotel was beautiful. Bed was extremely comfortable and we all fell in love with the bathroom. You have to see it for yourself. The staff was extremely helpful and attentive. Be sure to leave a good tip. Location was perfect. 3 miles from airport, 10 minutes (driving) from Old San Juan. Parking is a bit pricey. $16 per day for guests.

Reviews.Title: “Very relaxing night pre-cruise”
Reviews.Author: HIlBil36
Reviews.Content: We checked in to the Conrad on Saturday afternoon before our cruise. The grounds were very inviting and the hotel was modern. We had a nice upgrade to an ocean view room. We decided not to go into Old San Juan, rather to relax at the hotel. We had drinks by at the pool bar. The drinks were a bit pricey, but it was convenient and we were on our first night of vacation. We ate in the casual restaurant and the food was tasty. We took lots of pictures around the hotel. We checked out around 11 the next day and went over to the cruise port. It was a very relaxing night before our cruise. We had a great time and I definitely would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome”
Reviews.Author: alaska_jenn
Reviews.Content: Great bartenders, Security, beach boys, concierge! The beach, water-slide pool, restraunts (Varita's ROCKS!) were great!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel but not a Conrad”
Reviews.Author: WmCT
Reviews.Content: We just got back from a long weekend at the Conrad Condado Plaza. It has just recently, within the last year, become a Conrad. Well, it was a nice hotel, especially for the price; but it is not anywhere near what you'd expect from the name Conrad. If it wasn't called a Conrad, I wouldn't have a single complaint, but I was expecting luxury, and we got Holiday Inn Express. We had a suite, which was much nicer than a normal smallish room. The new restaurant, Varitas, has great Puerto Rican inspired food. Would highly recommend it. The hotel was about 2 miles from downtown, and we walked it every day. Not a bad walk along the ocean. As I said, the hotel, for the price, is a good deal, but it is a little deceiving if you think you're going to a luxury hotel. Other Conrads that I've stayed at were trying to achieve Four Seasons quality. The Condado Plaza is no Conrad!

Reviews.Title: “Conrad Beautiful Hotel in Condado Area”
Reviews.Author: dancingf00l
Reviews.Content: Hotel - front desk very helpful and nice. Manager also very nice. All staff helpful, welcoming and accomodating. Grounds are very pretty. Modern, bright colors. Small bay like beach. Enjoyable. Three pools and jacuzzis overlooking beautiful ocean and lagoon. Restaurants good. Service and food very good. A little expenisve, and a lot of "extra" charges. But nicest hotel in Condado area. Walking distance to some great restauants. Rooms - all renovated and modern. Comfortalbe and clean. Good size. Some with small balcony. Love the colors of the rooms. Gym - really nice gym, jacuzzi, and ammenties. Large hotel with casino.

Reviews.Title: “An amazing stay at a fabulous hotel”
Reviews.Author: hermanuchi
Reviews.Content: The service at the hotel was awesome. They even upgraded us to the ocean view - for free (we originally had a bay view). They were very helpful at the lobby and answered all our questions. They have a nice little private beach area, plus two pools. No complaints about our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, funky and modern.. great price”
Reviews.Author: zoeAtlanta
Reviews.Content: I went with some friends for a weekend getaway. I knew I wanted to stay at a hotel that was centarlized to restaurants and nightlife. I highly reccomend thsi place. I paid $136 a night for a great city/lagoon view room. As you will read, they do charge 25% in resort fees on top of your rate so budget for that. I loved the place. My room was Asian inspired and had a great view of the lagoon. The bathrroms were modern and hip. The lobby is super funky with neon lights and bright colored funriture. I thought it was a tremendous deal for the price and location. Eat at Ropa Vieja, just three blocks from the hotel. FOOD WAS AMAZING!!!!!!!!!! At night, we walked down the Condado district to find an open air party with tents, bars, bands and all the hooplah that makes San Jaun kick. This is a fun town that really caters to the young at heart.

Reviews.Title: “Condado Plaze Puerto Rico”
Reviews.Author: MRHJG
Reviews.Content: My wife and I celebrated her Birthday by traveling to Puerto Rico. We stayed at the Condado Plaza in San Juan. The stay was simply wonderful. The Ocean(Bahyia Vista Room) room had a completely unobstructed view of the ocean which we had the pleasure of enjoying every night with a glass of wine and every morning while sipping Pureto Rican Coffee. The sound of the waves echos all day long as they crash on the rocks. The hotel provided many lounging areas for relaxiation, several bars and fantastic resuraunts. The casino was a lot of fun, you could easly lose a couple of hours in there trying ladyluck. We were lucky enough to win enough each day to pay for all our meals. how fun is that and the drinks were outstanding. They also offer in the casino all the soda and tea you want for free at the self serve stand. I was impressed that they thought enough to even provide a stand near the entrance/exit where you could sanitize your hands. How thoughtful. The room was extremly spacious with a soft comfrotable bed. I felt the pillows were too soft, but my wife found them to be perfect. The bathroom had a glass inclosed standup shower, you could fit maybe four people in it. Didn't try that though. Pleanty of closet and drawer space as well as ample selections to watch on television. The room also was equipped with internet hook-up, not sure if there was a charge for that, we didn't surf the net but we had pleny of waves to surf on if we wanted to. The beach was rather small and not facing the ocean, but once you see the waves, you will understand why it is protecetd by a logoon. If you are not the beach going type, you were able to enjoy the multiple swimming pools that is offered and well stocked with pleanty of chairs. The food was very tastey and a nice variety to choose from. The prices are a little high but remember, you get what you pay for. Service and quality was the order of the day every day at the Conrad. The building was clean and well maintained, and the staff were always available to assist you in any way. We had the distinct pleasure of meeting and conversing with the hotel manager Mr Padine. He had a warm caring and attentive disposition. He provided us much information with regards to other areas of Puerto Rico which included Old San Juan. You have got to go visit Old San Juan if you are a shopper, Old San Juan is the place for you. Plan on spending a long day of shopping in countless stores that have everything you could hope to buy while on vacation. You will be able to find great deals on many of the items while shopping. You could take the short bus ride for .75 cents per person and the last stop at the bus terminal is where you would get off the bus for a shopping experience of a life time. There are many, many eating spots with a viriety of cusines to choose from. Every street, every corner there is something to see and marvel at. The area is rich with many historical buldings and homes that would make any camera person do cartwheels. Just a short walk from the hotel, you are able to find many other places to eat with great prices. We ate breakfast at this really great ocean front resturant everyday and paid nothing more than 25.00 dollars for a full breakfast for two which was more than filling and the flavors were marvelous. You could also find on the same street as the hotel, the typical american fast food spots as well. For the more sophistcated wonderers, there are more upscal resturans to choose from as well. Something for everyone. In conclusion, we would like to let ev eryone know, the Conrad Condado Plaza is worth the trip to Pureto Rico. Happy trails and be safe. Mr. & Mrs Green

Reviews.Title: “Pre-Cruise Hotel”
Reviews.Author: LeeMM1117
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel before leaving on a cruise. I chose this hotel because it was close to the port, but not located at the port. When we arrived at the hotel our first impression was good. The lobby has a very contemporary look. The lady who checked us into the hotel was very nice and made check in a breeze. The room was nice but a little muggy. After we checked into our hotel we decided to walk down the street to find something to eat. The area around the hotel was very run down with a lot of vacant buildings. We walked about a half mile and found Chili's. We stopped to eat there and the service was horrible. We didn't recieve our food for 45 minutes. We walked the area the other way past the hotel and across the bridge and it was still a lot of vacant buildings, not a lot around. If I ever leave out of Puerto Rico again, I will stay at the hotel located at the port.

Reviews.Title: “Could not have ask for better!”
Reviews.Author: BrooklynLynda
Reviews.Content: The Conrad Plaza was beyond belief. If I never left the hotel I would have just been perfectly content with that. It had beautiful room with GREAT accommodations and amenities. There were 3 pools, 2 jacuzzi (one in doors through their gym and one outdoors), they had a sauna, and a first rate gym with new equipments and plenty of room to work out. I could have done cartwheel in there if I wanted to...trust me I was tempted to! They also have several restaurants. We ate at the Varita downstairs when we first arrived and although it was a bit pricey it was worth it. The food was delicious and they had very large portions. I had the turkey BLT and it was HUGE. The size of a baby's head! Speaking of food (I shall return to my review of the hotel in a moment because I am far from done) every meal that we've experience in Puerto Rico was absolutely heavenly. In Old San Juan we had the pleasure of dining at Raices (not expensive with large portions), The Parrot Club (reasonably price with a good size portions) , and here is the big one....(drums rolling....) THE DRAGON FLY. Each and every meal was done to perfection but the meal at Dragon Fly was hands down the most memorable and absolutely delectable. Their desert was entrancing (it's the fried wonton with banana/nut filling). I didn't think it was humanly possible to drool while eating...well... I've shot that theory down that night. Although it was a bit pricey to eat at the Dragon Fly believe me...it was well worth it. Besides...if you're in Puerto Rico, you're probably on a vacation. Treat yourself! Also nearby the hotel was an great 'lil restaurant, La Hacienda with an ocean view front (not expensive at all with large portions). Picture this: waves crashing against the rocks, as the breeze blows through the window and you are in the center of all of that with perfect company (which I was privileged enough to have, thanks Troy!) and a divine meal bestowed in front of you with top notch service. Go to Puerto Rico, and that can be a reality for you. Now that I've made myself hungry back to the review of the Conrad Plaza. They also have a Casino, a hip lounge area, 2 tennis courts, and you can rent a boat and kayak in their lagoon...which our hotel room overlooked. If you want a great, serene view asked to stay in the bahia vista room on the 10th floor. We had a balcony with a perfect view, overlooking the lagoon, the tennis court and one of their pools. Could not have asked for better maid service. They ALWAYS do such a great job cleaning up the bathroom :). We order room service once and it went smoothly as well. Sites to visit: The Fortress in Old San Juan. $3 for entrance fee to see one of the Fortress. A mile away is another fortress that if my memory serves me right is another $2 or $3. My companion and I didn't go to both but we were content with just visiting that one. We also did a hiking and zip-lining tour. Shame on me for not remembering the name of the company but the Concierge Desk in the hotel has their name and number. It was $125 for a half day excursion from 9am to 12:30. It included a 15-20 minutes hike with 10 ziplining course. The last one which is half a mile long. The forest was only 20 minutes away which was perfect in comparison to some of the other companies that provided excursions that was an hour and 45 minutes or even 45 minutes away. The guides were VERY friendly and lots of fun. Now that I've written a novel I hope my review was helpful. Enjoy your trip to Puerto Rico and you best believe that if I was to ever return to Puerto Rico my rear end would be parked outside on the Conrad Plaza's balcony with a cold bottle of beer. Cheers!

Reviews.Title: “"The Best"”
Reviews.Author: ChicagoTroy
Reviews.Content: The hotel has everything you can think of, the staff was outstanding. The location was "perfect" it was just out side of old San Juan, the bus stop is right outside the hotel (75cents) and it drops you off right down town. The traffic was not all stuffed up like alot of hotels that are right in old San Juan. its a 15$ cab ride to the airport, and its got it own beach. Its the only major hotel in the area, so you dont have to deal with crowds. I HIGHLY RECOMMEND THAT YOU STAY HERE......I will again ps.. the nightlife is a blast!

Reviews.Title: “Good for the money”
Reviews.Author: lifeman37
Reviews.Content: Hotel staff very helpful. Was charged $50.00 a day for incidentals but will be put back on card at checkout. Only bad things were the beach, kinda small, and the nightlife stops at 11 ish. Very few places open 24hrs besides walgreens which is a walk away. Taxi's wanted 15.00 when bus only charges .75 cents. Isla Verde is a better area to stay if you want 24hr shops and restaurants like the el san juan or the intercontinental resort. Condado is 10 minutes away from old san juan which is a plus. Book all tours in advance if possible as they are rarely available on short notice. My hotel stay was great, very quiet hotel. Be prepared to spend 25 to 30 dollars per person on meals, that's for each meal unless you eat Mcdonalds or Wendy's.

Reviews.Title: “Great location - reasonable Price”
Reviews.Author: MeIGot2B
Reviews.Content: The hotel was nice, it was right off the beach and very convenient. There were quite a few restaraunts and stores within walking distance. At night the area got really congested with traffic, but it was not unbearable. I was suprised after returning my room after being out all day that my room had not been cleaned. i assumed if I am paying a 14% resort fee, room cleaning should be automatic, but you actually have to put a door hang on the dorr to get it cleaned. And don't drink the bottle of water that is in the room, it will cost you $7!!! for a 1 liter bottle of water. I would stay there again, I got a good price on the room and it was clean and there was plenty beach - can't ask for more! O yeah - bring your own computer, it was $3 for the 1st 15 minutes and $1 for every 15 minutes after that to use the computer and $3 per page to print, I was very disappointed with that, even comfort in offerers a free computer to use in lobby area.

Reviews.Title: “Artistic Hotel! $10 small plastic cup drinks :-(”
Reviews.Author: hleighaz
Reviews.Content: So...to sum this up, the room was great, awesome views and comfortable. Check in quick. I am rating this on the overall experience though. The restaurant would take an hour and a half each morning to serve eggs, toast, bacon. It took a long time, things were forgot (creamer for coffee, forks, etc). Finally, we were there to relax, and were extremely livid when the bill came for the drinks at the pool. $10 a drink Mind you these drinks were in small dixie plastic cups and were weak on the alcohol. Needless to say DO NOT DRINK at the pool.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but not quite the caliber of a Conrad Hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Female_Traveler5689
Reviews.Content: The 2nd week in September I traveled to Puerto Rico for a class held at the Conrad San Juan Condado Plaza. When the bellman brought my bags up, he brought the wrong ones. He returned a few minutes later with the correct bags and laughingly pointed to some water on the floor in my room, beneath a ceiling air conditioner access and said "Don't worry, it's just from the air conditioner." There was enough water dripping that I put down 2 towels and slipped on the wet tile floor during the night. I did leave a note for housekeeping the next day. It was fixed and there were no more problems. I was happy to have that resolved but slightly disappointed that the bellman didn't offer to call housekeeping about it. Despite the A/C unit issue, the room was beautiful and spacious. It was very nicely decorated and the bathroom was huge and gorgeous with dark wood and a clear shower. A recent review poster included 2 very representative pictures of both the room and the bathroom. I was mildly disappointed that with the room I had on the 10th(top) floor, that seemed to be the only floor that didn't have balconies. I faced the city but loved the floor-to-ceiling windows and the view! I found the bed to be comfortable and believe the room to be 5 star! The pool areas were beautiful, clean, offerred plenty of seating and were very well kept. I think the pool area is one of the nicest I've seen at a resort. I was in training during the day but really enjoyed sitting by and getting in the pool in the evening. There was a minor issue one night when someone at the hotel decided that at 7.00PM they had to put the chemicals in the pool with the swim-up poolbar. There were a few people in the pool but we had to get out for a half hour due to that. That was unacceptable and there was no reason that couldn't have been done later or during the night when no one was in the pool. If you're looking for a beach, pay close attention to the pictures of the hotel. There was a small one, yes, but it was right beside a road and I think there was a bus stop right there too. It was so close to the bridge/road that they attach a rope with bouys to one of the pillars of the bridge to rope off a swimming area. I'm not sure what's happenning with the restaurants at the hotel but I was dissappointed. Prior to my trip, the hotel's website advertised a casual Italian restaurant. That had been changed to the CafÃ© Caribe. It was good for breakfast and lunch but just didn't have that upscale feel you'd want for dinner in a Conrad Hotel. There was a Strip House Steakhouse advertised on the in-room hotel guide but when I inquired at the front desk, I was told that was closed. The new rotisserie restaurant just didn't look at all upscale like the Capital Grille in the Indianapolis Conrad Hotel and I heard from someone else staying there that they were not impressed with this new restaurant. The Eight Noodle Bar was good if you like Asian cuisine. I do and enjoyed the sushi. This restaurant does look as advertised on the hotel website but it is no bigger than what you see in the picture. About 20 feet from the sushi bar is the casino. This restaurant almost reminds you of a shopping mall food court in that it is wide open with people walking by as you dine and a full view and the sound of the casino. The common areas of the hotel are very upscale and the meeting room we were in was nice - despite being very warm one day due to the A/C being serviced. Our group was disappointed in the timing of the maintenance but it was resolved the next day and perhaps the hotel didn't have a choice in the timing. I used the fitness center a couple times and found it to be adequately equipped. They could use a little better ventilation, or a couple fans, as it was quite stuffy. I loved the Starbucks that's part of the hotel. It was wonderful and I appreciated very much having that so easily accessible. Next to the Starbucks, however, was an abandoned building with graffiti on it. I know there's probably nothing the hotel can do about this, but I found it to be a negative. In one of the pictures I've attached, you can see the green awnings of Starbucks and the empty building next door. I would probably stay here again if business brings me to this area of Puerto Rico as I think a few things at the hotel may be "in progress." (work being done on one of the closed restaurants, the pool slide was closed for repairs, the demonstration that was at the hotel on the day I left). If I visit for pleasure, I would stay elsewhere to have more access to beaches and fine dining.

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING HOTEL - GREAT LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: Luflorida
Reviews.Content: This hotel is amazing! My husband and I went to San Juan to celebrate our anniversary and after reading some reviews we decided to pick this hotel and we are glad we did. This hotel is located in an awesome area in San Juan, close to everything and a few minutes from Old San Juan. Our expectactions were more than exceeded since the beginning. We had a fast and efficient check-in and they gave us a beautiful ocean view room. The room was absolutely clean and modern as the entire hotel, which is basically decorated in red... the color of love! The staff in this hotel is very friendly and everyone speaks English. The beach and the pools are exquisite... we couldn't ask for anything better than that. The pool bar has great food and great mojitos for a very reasonable price and the beach is kind of exclusive for hotel's guest and we loved that kind of privacy. The restaurants are very nice... The breakfast was so good and the other restaurants inside hotel offer great variety of good. The casino was big and for the first time ever we made some money gambling =) They also have a nice night club on the first floor where the most beautiful people of San Juan can be found. The manager of this hotel is an excellent professional... just by reading the reviews here I realized how concerned he is in keeping his customers satisfied and he is willing to do whatever is necessary to make your stay even more enjoyable. I really appreciate that. We can't wait to go back to San Juan and we are definitelly staying again on this hotel since we had a such great time there and we loved everything about this hotel. Thank you Conrad San Juan Condado Plaza! We hope to come back very soon!

Reviews.Title: “Elegant Accomodation with Many Amenities”
Reviews.Author: NewHampshireCandy
Reviews.Content: The Conrad San Juan Condado Plaza is a fine hotel with many activities to keep you busy (or relaxed) on your visit. There is a casino on the premises and several dining establishments on site. You can enjoy the lagoon or swimming pools or relax in a hammock beside the ocean. Old San Juan is only a short bus/taxi ride away. My room was neat and clean and the housekeeping service was good. Check-in and check-out was friendly and helpful. Though a bit slow, I attributed that to the wonderful laid-back island culture. If I were to visit San Juan again, I would not hesitate to stay at the Conrad San Juan Condado Plaza.

Reviews.Title: “The 411”
Reviews.Author: indyfreelancer03
Reviews.Content: I traveled to Puerto Rico with my wife and have a lot of helpful hints for anyone traveling there. First, check-in went smoothly and we were given our requested ocean view room... which honestly is the only view you should get, otherwise it is a waste of money. The city is a bit ran down and the lagoon side I've heard isn't that great... so just dish out the extra cash and upgrade. We also were told that we had an extra $100 credit to spend in the restaurant/bar/room service, which we were used and were extremely excited about... UNFORTUNATELY... (and this is a big one) they had confused our credit, which we booked through CHEAP CARIBBEAN with ORBITZ. This meant that we had to dish out the extra cash at the end of our trip, which we didn't plan on spending and the staff/management had NO SYMPATHY FOR US EITHER (too bad/so sad)!!! The only restaurant inside the hotel that is worthy of a visit is Eight Noodle... that's if you like sushi!!! If you like Italian... don't go to the hotel restaurant... the taste is very bland...go down the street to Ropa Verde (two blocks down from hotel). All the restaurants in San Juan are down about two blocks from the hotel and are absolutely fantastic and also a better deal. It is safe to go out at night, even though some of the buildings (like next door are abandoned). There are tons of joggers and people constantly out, so feel free to take a stroll in the evening. The bar at the hotel is very nice and wasn't extremely crowded... not sure if this place is for the older crowd, but very ultra modern. Most of the staff is very friendly, even though we had requested a late check out and we were denied. Also, make sure to go to Old San Juan...(take the 75 cent bus down there and back people) it is great for shopping and has excellent deals. We ate at a lovely restaurant in Old San Juan called Sofia's... it has a very romantic setting and we actually had an excellent waitress that gave us helpful hints at places to go in the evening around Old San Juan. Another thing that you must do is the rain forest adventure... (ziplining, repelling, hiking through waterfalls). We went with a group called Ecoquest and they were absolutely nice and served us an authentic Puerto Rican lunch at their house afterwards. Make sure to enjoy the workout room and the swim up bars, they weren't crowded at all. The drinks at the pool were a bit expensive, but this is vacation people, so enjoy it and have a great time!!! Make sure you bring bug spray, since they have a lot of flying biting bugs/NOT BED BUGS, which I read earlier!!! P.S.- Zen Spa is very relaxing and beautiful, if your up to it... call and make a reservation, since they normally are booked (about 3-4 blocks down from the hotel). Also, the casino is small and most people their don't speak English, so don't plan on meeting a lot of interesting people there. P.S.S.- A lot of people on here say that there is no beach when ACTUALLY THERE IS...IT IS HIDDEN BEHIND THE MAIN POOL!!! RIGHT BY THE BUS STOP PEOPLE!!!

Reviews.Title: “not what I expected from a Conrad hotel”
Reviews.Author: darrencantwait
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Conrad Condado Plaza for a long Labor Day weekend. We live in NYC and have traveled many times to Puerto Rico. I have also stayed in the Conrad in Miami and LOVED it! Check-in was a little slow. I was supposed to be able to have an express check-in since I logged in for it on the Hilton Honors website, but didn't see that offered. The room was a decent size and we had a wonderful balcony overlooking the ocean. The pools look great, and there seemed to be ample loungers. I was also impressed to see staff removing towels from loungers after a certain period of time. The beach is definitely NOT the most desirable compared to other San Juan resorts. It is situated on the lagoon next to a congested 2 lane bridge. My main complaints were in service. The elevators were very slow, and only two for the main tower. They were also very small and very crowded. The overall feel is much more family oriented than I expected. I was thinking it would be much more "adult" oriented. Every morning of our stay, a piece of paper was slid under our door around 10am. It basically stated that they were respecting our "do not disturb" sign and would not be cleaning our room. Not only that, but if we wanted cleaned the FOLLOWING day, we needed to call the front desk. I'm sorry, that is NOT the quality of a fine resort. I am there to relax: I don't think sleeping in until 9:30 and then having a cup of coffee and preparing for my day at a leisurely pace is out of line. I have never seen this happen in any other hotel or resort, regardless of number of stars. On check-out day, there was no summary of my account slid under the door (though they did knock, despite the Do Not Disturb sign to see if they could make up our room). The express check out kiosks also would not let me check out. The line to check out was almost out the door. I do not understand why the check-out process needs to be so tedious. I agreed with all of the charges on my account, why must I stand in a long line to verify that? All-in-all, we had a very pleasant stay and we enjoyed ourselves. However, I do not think the resort was up to par with the Conrad brand. I would prefer to stay at the Caribe Hilton on my next stay.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TiffChicago_Illinois
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel for one night prior to boarding our cruise. I'm sorry that we were only able to stay one night. This hotel is absolutely beautiful. The room was beautiful, the pools, the grounds, everything! We visited the outdoor beach bar for dinner and lunch and each time the food was terrific! Oh and the drinks are great too! The beach is small, however, we didn't mind as we were only there for one night. The location is perfect. It's walking distance to shopping, restaurants, etc. and not too far from the cruise dock either. When we go on our next cruise out of Puerto Rico we will definitely stay here again (and hopefully then we can stay longer than just one night!!).

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded Expectations”
Reviews.Author: Melissa712
Reviews.Content: Excellent service - they let us check-in early and check-out late. Room was great, 15 minutes from Old San Juan, and the pool area was fantastic. Not one complaint!

Reviews.Title: “You couldn't do much better than this hotel.”
Reviews.Author: blakcloud
Reviews.Content: I was very pleasantly surprised when I got to this hotel. I was attending a conference here and so I booked where the conference was. The hotel is a lot bigger than I thought and it actually has two towers about eight stories. There is a walkway from one building to the other. The staff are all super friendly, from the front desk to the chambermaids, they always greeted you with a smile and a nice comment. The greetings were genuine, I never got the feeling they were forced because I was the guest. The hotel has everything you would want when visiting San Juan. Besides the casino if you are into gambling, it has three pools. Two are fresh water and one is salt water, plus there is a jacuzzi hot tub. Lots of lounge chairs and it has a bar area in the pool. The hotel also sits beside a nice public beach. It isn't very big but for me it was a great size. The beach is on a lagoon so it is protected from the huge ocean waves that can happen. Again this is my preference. The staff will also get you a lounge chair and umbrella and take it to the beach for you. For the kids there is a water slide and inflatable beach toys to use. The room I stayed at was one of the inside rooms so I didn't get a city or ocean view but I didn't mind this (it was cheaper). But, it did have a balcony and I could see the ocean and beach from there. The room was very clean and very modern. The bed was one of the most comfortable beds that I have ever slept on in a hotel. It also had an in-room safe, LCD television, fridge and high speed wireless internet etc. The hotel backs onto the ocean and the views are spectacular. The grounds are immaculate and the hotel is very clean. There are a few restaurants within this hotel and I ate at all of them. A little pricey but not bad at all. The service is impeccable. What didn't I like, well I am being really picky here, but the television reception is terrible within the whole hotel which is surprising since they have such nice televisions. Second the phone system needs major work. It was almost impossible to phone another room or have someone phone me. The phone would ring once and then silence. It would take numerous tries to connect with other guests in the hotel. Plus when you phone the hotel operator, it would sometimes ring 20 -30 times before they picked up, which to me is unacceptable. Would I stay in this hotel again? In a heartbeat. Two minor quibbles, doesn't negate the excellent features of this hotel. This hotel has it all.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel for couple & families”
Reviews.Author: curioza24
Reviews.Content: I am writing this review in detail because I wish somebody would've taken the time out to do so for me. That way, I would've booked another hotel closer to what my friends and I were looking for. We stayed from a Thursday to a Monday and had a Bahia view room. Hotel in general: Is beautiful! The hotel has a big pool with a water slide and a seperate salt water pool on the other side. Open 24hours!!! There is a pool bar which was nice, however that will come later in this review. The conceirge never picks up the phone and when I asked them about things to do they said they didn't know. The excursion are a rip off. If you want to go to the barcardi factory. Take the bus to old san juan (.75) and the ferry to the factory (1.50). The casino is nice and as long as you are playing you are offered unlimited drinks and good. We needed a cpu to check email and we were told to walk 10 minutes down ashford avenue to an internet cafe. However, when I was walking back to my room I notice a business room with computers. When I asked if I could use them, I was told of course. ($7.50 for every 15 minutes). Go figure the front desk staff would send me somewhere else!!! A great thing is that there is a STARBUCKS attached to the hotel. Try the Mayoca bread with butter!!! Rooms: The rooms were very nice however, if you get a bahia view room make sure you are not staying with 3 girls. The bathroom was super small and the toilet never flushed. We called 3 times to get the toilet fixed, it was frustrated. In the end I told the worker to just teach me how to do it and I'll fix it so I don't have to waste my time calling. The housekeeper on the other side did an awesome job. She always made sure our room was clean and smelled good. She gave us extra towels and even lined up our shoes. Staff: The front desk staff was friendly, but beware, as you will be charged a $200 incidentel fee on your credit card (which they forget to tell you when they ask you for a card). Most of the staff does not live in the area and therefore, do not know where to go to have a good time, so you have to ask random floaters you find around the hotel. The pool staff on the other hand was absolutely RUDE (two guys)! On our first night I asked what time they are open to and the response was "until 9pm however we close when we want. You're lucky we are here now". Not a good response because I am paying to stay here. Also, after 7pm their "girlfriends" would come and all they would do is talk talk talk. Good luck trying to get their attention and get a drink. Drinks are expensive too. They are in small 8oz cups and cost $10. If you are lucky you can get a buy 1 get 1 free mojito coupon for the front desk. Location: The hotel is located en El Condado. There is not much to do around there. If you walk 10 minutes down ashford avenue you can find a walgreens and lots of little shops and restaurants. DO NOT PAY FOR A CAB to get to old San juan. The C53 or B19 bus stop located right in front of the hotel will take you there for .75 cents. Buses are from 9am-9pm. Last bus pick you up at the Old San Juan bus terminal. Do not sit on the benches there are little bugs that crawl on you and bite. Nightlife: Unfortunately there is NO nightlife in the area. The hotel does have a lounge however there is never anyone there. To have a good time I recommend Brava Nightclub located in San Juan Hotel in Isla Verde, also located in Isla Verde is the Wet Club which is also very nice. Old San Juan is also a great place to party, if you catch the last bus you can be there for happy hour. The street named Forteleza is where the main bar strip is. I recommend Blend (for the music) and Tio Danny's (for the cheap drinks). Club lazer is popular in Old San Juan, however, we did not go because we heard many negative things about it. Like illegal use of substances, gang members, and such. Food: The first night we ate at the Aqua Bar in the hotel, HUGE MISTAKE! The food was not great and it was the largest tab we had the whole time we were there. If you are going to eat at the hotel, do the sushi restuarant. Good food, fast service and nice people. I also recommend El Jibarito restuarant located in Old San Juan and The restuarant where they made the 1st pina colada(can't remember the name), its expensive but if you are there a friday or saturday you can reserve a table to see a beautiful flamingo dancing show (free). We also ate in Ajillo Mojillo located 5 minutes down from Ashford avenue. The food was good but again a bit pricey. A 5 minute walk futher down and you will hit another restuarant which has GREAT FOOD and good prices. Lastly, if you are with friends and just finished partying Los Pinos is opened 24 hours. Great food and good prices! Beach: There is no huge beach at the hotel. It is a nice view with all the rocks but if you are a huge beach person I would recommend a hotel in Isle Verde. Old San Juan was beautiful! I recommend you walking into the Haiten boutiques and going to eat icecream at Ben & Jerrys. Traffic is ridiculous! So don't drive there and do not hop on the trolly cause you will NOT get anywhere. I recommend the COACH factory and Guess. Great prices on things you would never dream off in the states. Make sure to wear comfortable shoes because the streets are made of stone and rocks. In order to go to Puerto Rico you have to want to relax as the service is extremely slow and most of the businesses lack etiquette. If I were forced to go to Puerto Rico again, I would only stay at El Conrad if I were to go with family. If I were to go with friends I recommed The Sterllis casino in Isla Verde. If you want to PARTY YOUR LIFE AWAY, stay in San Juan hotel, which is for the "young crowd". If I were to go to Puerto Rico period, I would do a cruise with a stop at Old San Juan because that is where you get the history, art, parties, good food, etc all rolled into one. Safe travel!!!

Reviews.Title: “A+...Great Hotel--5 Stars!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: travelbruin41
Reviews.Content: My parents and I arrived in San Juan Sat. 8/8/09, a day early for a cruise. We arrived at about 8pm and took a taxi from the airport--about a 15 minute drive. $21 for 3 people and 6 bags. Hotel check-in was a breeze. We were inside our room within 15 minutes. We upgraded to a Balcony Ocean View Room. It was AMAZING!!! The views were as advertized on the Conrad website. The room was clean and spacious. The bathroom was elegant when compared to most hotel bathrooms. The beds were comfy-especially after a day of flying. We only stayed one night but the pools and private beach looked very inviting as did the hammocks. The italian restaurant is a must visit. Once again-great staff and the prices are reasonable ($10-15 per plate) for a hotel restaurant. The portions are plentiful and very tasty. The drinks were also superb--definitely not watered down. The view cannot be beat. Such a great place we visited 3 times in less than 24 hours! The hotel was about 10 minutes from Old San Juan shopping and ship piers. We found our own personal taxi/tour guide on the 2nd day. Give him a call--he is awesome--Juan Taxi [--]!!! Taxi fares are decent to Old San Juan and worth it once you see the streets and traffic you would have to navigate if you rent a car. Hotel management is great. They allowed us late check out just so we could visit longer seeing that we had gotten in late the night before. We would definitely stay at the Conrad again and are tempted to go back to San Juan just to visit it for a longer stay. GREAT JOB CONRAD!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: BLACKEIGHT
Reviews.Content: We just returned from Puerto Rico yesterday, stayed at the Conrad Hilton Condado Plaza which was located perfectly between the airport and Old San Juan. Upon check-in, which went really fast....we were upgraded to an Ocean Front room which I highly recommend (thanks Josue) and were out and about in no time. We spent most of our time within the general area....this hotel has many restaraunts, a starbucks next door and more restaraunts down the street. I highly recommend Varita which is on the property and you must try one of their monsterous sandwiches (possibly the best cuban i ever had). The beach area is on the small scale but reasonable....you get more of a private beach feeling and they rent out snorkeling gear which we did on several days. The beach/lagoon area is perfect for snorkeling.... free beach towels to use, chairs, and there is a guy who frequents this beach serving fresh coconuts ..... and another person who BBQ's burgers, hotdogs, and chicken. Free WIFI within the property and pool side. They have several pools, a fun water slide and hammocks all over the property. Price for drinks and food is a little pricey but is up to par with the rest of the island. I highly recommend this hotel and would definately do it again. Thanks again Jose.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!!!”
Reviews.Author: imhaunted321
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for about 6 days on a vacation. I searched this website reading reviews, checked out the hotel location and requested an ocean view room. The pictures are true to form. We had the "red room" with a wonderful balcony on the 8th floor overlooking the ocean and we were so comfortable all the way around. Check in was a breeze and when we entered our room the gracious touches included soft lighting, soothing background from the radio and a chilled bottle of champagne from the manager, Jose Padin. The bathroom was elegant and we had everything we could possibly need. We found the closets small but everything fit perfectly in drawers, etc. The bartenders were friendly in both the lobby and the swim up bar " Hi Javie!!!" and both pools and jacuzzi were never crowded. Very clean and friendly all the way. We frequented Starbucks most mornings but also enjoyed the inroom coffee. We walked to a few local restaurants but we also had a car and visited Old San Juan, lot's of walking on narrow sidewalks, pretty crowded when the cruise ships dock but when they clear out it's a much easier walking excursion with beautiful shops and fair prices. The Italian restaurant was wonderful and reasonably priced with a nice view. The grounds are clean and the hammocks were so relaxing. The small public beach had some great snorkling along the coral reefs and the hotel provides you with whatever you would need. If you have a balcony room, the doors do tend to close loudly and I suggest earplugs if you are bothere by noise when you sleep. The waves crashing, those little tree frogs chirping etc. can be distracting but the beds were so darned comfy who couldn't fall asleep? We visited with my husbands family as he had lived there for many years as a child and they were able to suggest some great restaurants near Isla Verde including The Ceviche House and El Rincon. Strong Peruvian influence in most restaurants and overall I never had a bad meal. The air smells like candy everywhere. Traffic and construction can be intimidating and the street signs are primarily in Spanish so it can be confusing. This was a wonderful trip for us and I would stay at this hotel again anytime. I suggest asking for an ocean view with a balcony and renting a car at the airport. Also learn some Spanish and program your GPS if you are planning to explore the island. We did visit the rain forest and saw a lot of sights but didn't have a lot of time to explore more.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Nice”
Reviews.Author: franksbeans
Reviews.Content: I spent a week here on a business trip recently. I stayed in a room overlooking the lagoon side, and that was fairly pleasant. I would imagine the ocean-side room views would be nicer though. The hotelâ€™s beach isnâ€™t much to look at, but I hear that a quick walk to another hotelâ€™s beach up the road is easy enough. The room was clean and serviceable. Most days after work, I enjoyed sitting out on the patio overlooking the lagoon with a rum and coke and relaxing. The dining options in the hotel are okay, if not expensive. Thereâ€™s plenty of other options within a quick walk, from Subway and Chiliâ€™s, to local places with local flavor. Look out for the taxi going to Old Town from the hotel. Thatâ€™ll run you just under $20 for a 5 minute drive. I walked back from there to the hotel along the coastal drive, and that took me a 45 minutes, but I wouldnâ€™t do that walk at night. Didnâ€™t feel too safeâ€¦

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Site, Staff, and Service. Great for Cruisers!”
Reviews.Author: scbleo
Reviews.Content: This place is 3 miles from the cruise pier. Taxicabs are everywhere - no need to rent a car (more on that later). The pictures on the website are 100% accurate. The hotel was remodeled in a very modern, art deco look. The casino gets busy on the weekends, the lounge is fun and lively latin bands fill the sounds in the main common areas. You will definitely feel like you are in the Caribbean. The details of 2 pools, whirlpool, and very tiny beach is all true. This place is fantastic for safety, convenience, favor, and STAFF! We had a two queen bed facing the ocean in the main building, which was fantastic. Hilton beds were comfortable and offered a restful night's sleep. All was spotless. The views of sunset from our balcony was superb. The ocean waves crashing on the rocks was soothing. The bathroom was comfortable for a short stay, but with one small closet and a couple of drawers, there really is no storage for longer stays. The balcony could use a new paint job. When I was done taking my pics leaning on the balcony, my arms were full of nasty white paint chips. The chairs are rotted and not inviting at all and can definitely be trashed. The true gem to this stie is the staff. They are fabulous! Beginning with Cesar, our bellman, who greeted us when we arrived inbound and when we returned after the cruise, recognized and took time to assist us, again. The front desk staff is friendly, informative, and bilingual professionals. Truly a refreshing group. Loved them for adding the smiles, hellos, and offers to assist us. LOCATION is always important. The Condado looks like it is in the process of being rehabilitated with many hotels torn down, in construction, or out-of-business. Truly a sign of the times. Traffic is intense in all of San Juan and el Condado section is no exception. I suspect that crime is a real high concern. All the stores in the area have doorbells that have to be buzzed in to get inside. Not exactly an appealing welcome for folks to do business. There is no street parking and cars are everywhere, as are the police. Public buses are available but not frequent. Taxicabs RULE! Cab ride to pier was $19 for three of us and six bags. Drivers are friendly, bilingual and since the fares are regulated no need to worry about getting overcharged. The ride to the airport was about 10 miles, takes approximately 15 minutes, if there is no traffic and cost us $24.00 with bags. If you are going out, no luggage, we took the cab to Old San Juan, past the airport area and it only cost $12. All our traveling and cruising was still cheaper and LESS STRESSFUL then having rented a car and trying to figure out where to go, where to park which is quite an adventure, then still having to pay for parking at various parking lots all over the area plus the daily fee at the hotel to park. Another perk with the cabs, they know everything and became our personal guides, historians, and entertainers. Made some really nice new friends. Will definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Experience and value”
Reviews.Author: IGoSomewhere
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Conrad July 31-August 4th. We were beyond satisfied with the experience. The hotel is located a stones throw from the more hectic and noisier part of the city. It is a short bus ride to Old San Juan and has several beautiful pools and the beach sits directly adjacent to the hotel. The rooms are nicely decorated with modern decor. The rooms are clean and housekeeping was quick and responsive. We called for more towels later one evening and no kidding they arrived nearly before we hung up the phone. We were pleasantly suprised to be upgraded to an ocean front room. The view was breathtaking. You want to experience this view from this particular hotel. The hotel is located near many good restaurants and other hotels. There is a Walgreens nearly. The hotel offers a variety of restaurants with a wide selection of food types. We ate at 2 of the restaurants. The food was good. The prices were on par with others in the area. Food is generally fairly expensive in the hotel zone. Reviewers that report food at the hotel is pricey are not sharing that food in general is expensive in the area. We had a room credit, as most guests seem to receive that offset some of the costs. This is a definite plus. Old San Juan is a 15 minute bus ride from the hotel. There is a free trolley in Old San Juan to allow you to experience the town. I highly recommend it. The concierge was very helpful giving directions to many attractions. Let me be clear about what is meant by the concierge. These are not stuffy individuals standing at podiums who appear beyond the reach of most guests. I travel often and the concierge often presents as generally unavailable to the average guests. These staff are available, friendly and very helpful to everyone. We rented a car at the airport (much more affordable than renting a car in town). We visited the rainforest and several beaches and restaurants in nearby cities. The difference in prices for food and other experiences are tremendous. I highly recommend renting a car and exploring the island. The staff was very helpful, accommodating and friendly. Check-in and out was effortless. There was always something interesting going on in the hotel. There is an evening Mojito demonstration each night and a bar. There is something for everyone. You will be pleasantly treated to the beauty and friendliness of the Caribbean when you stay at the Conrad. Some of the complaints by other reviewers appear to come from issues not related to the hotel itself. Restaurants and taxis are relatively expensive in the general area. San Juan is experiencing some development. There are new businesses going up in the area. I will definately be staying again at this location when I return to San Juan. I enjoyed myself and feel that I recieved great service and value. I have no doubt you will too.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice place in o.k. location”
Reviews.Author: EPguy4
Reviews.Content: My wife an I got this place by bidding on Priceline, so needless to say, we paid much less than the advertised rate. We were very please with the Condado Plaza. The Condado has a nice casino, several good pools, a good selection of restaurants and bars on site. The whole place has a very luxurious and fashionable feel to it. As other reviewers have noted, the beach is somewhat lacking, but a short walk (10 minutes or so) down Ashford Ave. will take to you an entrance to a nicer beach. Our room was fairly modest in size, but was very nice, and was very well kept. I noticed several people have made comments about insect bites. I agree with the manager's response. There is absolutely not way those bites happened from bed bugs. The place is much to clean from that. We also experienced a few (not many) insect bites during our time in San Juan, but it was a minor nuisance and no reflection on the Condado Plaza. The location of the hotel is o.k. We found that about a 5 minute walk down Ashford put us within a range of restaurants, bars, and shopping locations from fast food to local dives to very luxurious. We did this more often than we dined at the hotel. It's also about a 5-10 minute cab ride to Old San Juan. We discovered that cab rides are more expensive in San Juan than Chicago. On the other hand, parking is not included at the hotel, so the cost of a rental car adds up too. I would absolutely recommend the Condado Plaza, but you probably ought to check it's location relative to the parts of San Juan that you are most interested in visiting.

Reviews.Title: “Please don't stay here....”
Reviews.Author: smccoywilliams
Reviews.Content: While this hotel looked EXACTLY like it did in the pictures posted, sadly it was not a stay on the positive side. I stayed at the Conrad Condado while in San Juan for my destination wedding. We had 10 rooms in our group and about 28 people including our 9month old son in from various cities. Check-in: Prior to our group's arrival a $700 deposit was sent in advance to the hotel's sales department. Upon check-in this deposit was not credited to our room and sadly our sales rep was "in a meeting" Therefore an additional $1000 PLUS hold was placed on our credit card...WITHOUT knowledge. I was told that the credit card was needed for incidentals. I did check my account soon after and about passed out upon discovery of this error. Yaritza at the front desk was very helpful getting the deposit posted to our room and contacting the bank to get the hold removed ASAP. As a bride to be, this is the LAST thing I wanted to here prior to a wedding. Rooms: The view and look of the rooms were great. However in our bathroom the water was not at all hot. I called to the front desk 3 days in a row to get assistance. The response I was given was "let it run" After 30 minutes, I was more than certain no hot water was coming out of the showerhead. With a 9month old this is beyond unacceptable. How do you bath a baby?? How do you give him formula when my child drinks warm formula?? I had to use another guest in our group's shower to bathe myself and my child. Housekeeping: We had a very nice housekeeper. However for whatever reason the housekeeping department did not have any washcloths. Each day, despite us having double occupancy, we got one (1) washcloth. Wow. Valet charged us for a night that we didn't even have a vehicle...that was the night of our wedding. My 86 year old grandmother was on the verge of getting kicked out of her room because the hotel was "sold out" and due to the errors with the deposit in the beginning the hotel erased her Saturday night stay. After speaking with a front desk clerk, her "solution" was "Sorry we're sold out" Which of course is not an adequate response AT ALL. Another manager actually helped us out and extended her stay for her original last night. The beach is not really that great, Isla Verde is a much better beach location as the area around the Conrad is very rocky. But it is very pretty. There does seem to be much entertainment as on Friday and Saturday there was a dj and it seemed to be "active". I am glad that I was the one to experience these issues and not our guests. While the Conrad is a beautiful hotel I will NEVER stay there or recommend this hotel for anyone looking for a place to stay in San Juan.

Reviews.Title: “Looks can be deceiving....”
Reviews.Author: Songbyrd99
Reviews.Content: My friends and I stayed at the Conrad for four nights. The hotel looks like the pictures, very nice, modern, etc & we got in on the deal where you get the 4th night free & even received a $100 credit to use anywhere in the hotel. Our trip was a blast however.....we will not be staying at this hotel when we go back. #1 - The concierge was very unhelpful and like another review said the tours that the hotel sets up are far overpriced. Most tourist attractions in San Juan are very budget friendly. You'll do far better to rent a car from the Enterprise that is next door to the hotel. The people at Enterprise were actually far more helpful than the concierge with regards to restaurants, attractions & how to get around (which was fairly easy). #2 - The 2nd night/3rd day we realized that we were bitten by bed bugs or something. Luckily there is a Walgreen's down the street where we could get stuff for our bites. We changed rooms which was a little better but when we asked for some kind of help for our trouble one of the managers had a little attitude and seemed very un-surprised & unapologetic about the fact that we were bitten up. (We weren't the only guests bitten up either) #3 - There is no REAL beach attached to the hotel, you have to go up the street towards the Renaissance hotel and enter Condado Beach there. Wasn't too big of a deal considering it was a 7 to 10 minute walk...but The Conrad's website is a little misleading. We had an AWESOME time despite the bed bug bites however, we won't be going back to the Conrad when we return to San Juan!!!

Reviews.Title: “Would definitely stay again”
Reviews.Author: Belleza729
Reviews.Content: My husband and I traveled with our 6 yr old daughter for 8 days. It was a beautiful hotel! The beach was public, however, you could never tell. Yes the beach was small, but it was enjoyable to me and my family, lots of coral off to the side to snorkel and see lots of fish. Plus they give you beach towels to use! The swim up bar was very enjoyable along with the waterslide, bartenders were very very nice and efficient even with loads of people in the pool. Yes drinks were overpriced at the pool, but what do you expect? you are in a pool getting served, the people on here complaining about the prices, you are getting served in a pool!!!! Hotel is conveniently located just right outside of Ol San Juan. We had Ocean View which was well worth the money and our balcony was private. Hotel staff was very friendly and helpful. We did book the snorkeling trip through the hotel, the price was not bad. It was a long ride to Fajardo, but it was worth having the hotel book everything. Highly recommend the snorkeling trip, all you can eat and drink, and it was an awesome time! We went to Old San Juan and took the ferry over to the Bacardi (which is free) it was only $.50 and only a few dollars for taxi to distillery, highly worth it. they give you a free tour and two free drinks. In all, this was a great hotel, construction on the bridge was not even noticed. Airport is close by, but with the music and all you are really not paying attention. highly recommend! we will be coming back to this hotel again!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Infested?”
Reviews.Author: ATL0000
Reviews.Content: My friends and I stayed at the hotel. Everything was going well until all of us woke up with our bodies covered with insect bites. As we walked through the hotel, we also noticed that other guests were covered with the bites as well. This made us think that there was clearly something in the hotel. We spoke with a manager who changed our room. However, we had additional bites the following day. Not to mention, we were itching for the entire trip! It was very uncomfortable!

Reviews.Title: “We had an EXCELLENT time!!”
Reviews.Author: Lulu057
Reviews.Content: The Conrad Condado Plaza was a wonderful hotel. Due to a delayed flight, my husband and I arrived to the hotel at 6:00am. The lady at the front desk was extremely nice and got us checked in right away. We had a suite, but when we arrived, it seemed smaller than I had expected. We were going to be there for 10 days and I wanted to have a little more room. I returned to the front desk to ask if there was any other room available and she switched our room right away to another wonderful suite situated on the end. It had an awesome view of both the lagoon from the living room area and the Atlantic Ocean from the balcony. The room was very spacious!! There was a sectional sofa, coffee table, large flat screen tv and work desk in the living room area. The bathroom was huge with a shower big enough for two people. The king size bed was also very comfy. The room also had a coffee maker, microwave, sink area, and plenty of drawers and closets for your clothes. The hotel itself has 5 or 6 restaurants which were excellent. Contrary to other reviews, the prices were right inline and in some cases, lower than the restaurants within walking distance to the hotel. Every restaurant offered a different fare so there was plenty to choose from. Our personal favorites were Varita's, Gusta d'Italia, and 8 Noodle Bar. Varita's is one of the newer restaurants in the hotel and offers anything from salads and sandwiches to steak. The food is excellent and the service is superb! Be sure to ask for the apple pie alamode. It was the best I have ever had! Gusta d'Italia is an Italian restaurant that is also excellent. The spaghetti and meatballs and lasagna were wonderful. The restaurant has an ocean view and service was spectacular. The restaurant also serves breakfast in the morning - it was wonderful. 8 Noodle Bar is another great choice with Chinese and Japanese cuisine. It is located across from the casino. It is open from 4:00pm to 4:00am and is a great option for late night munching. This was also a great place to eat. The portions here are huge - don't hesitate to share a meal as it is more than enough to do so! There are 3 pools at the hotel with more than enough lounge chairs and pool chairs for everyone. The ecclectic decor and bright colors of the hotel was also very nice. There wasn't alot happening at the hotel however and the bar/lounge located in the lobby appeared closed most of the time. Never fear, however, the poolside bar was lively and the drinks were marvelous - though expensive! There is plenty of hotel parking (16.00 a day), but I wouldn't bother with it. We rented a car for 2 of the 10 days we were there and really didn't need it at all. The bus stop is at the hotel. It costs 75 cents to ride. You must have exact change. The C53 bus (by the beach entry) will take you to Old San Juan. It is the last stop on the route and where everyone gets off. Once you get to Old San Juan, there is lots to see. El Morro, San Cristobal, and lots of museums to name a few. There are also lots of shops and great Puerto Rican restaurants. You must go to Raices (pronounced Ray - eee- ces) for dinner in Old San Juan. The atmosphere there and the food are something to remember. The service was awesome. Across from the Sheraton Hotel and Senor Frogs is the ferry that you can take to the Bacardi Rum Factory. It costs $1.00 per person. When you get to the other side, a $3.00 cab ride will take you right to the factory. Although you don't get to tour the actual factory anymore due to an accident that happened there several years ago, the free tour was alot of fun. We also liked the free drinks you get on the tour. PROS: Wonderful people, beautiful island, and everything within walking distance or public transportation. CONS: The beach is very small and not impressive at all. If you are coming to hang out at the beach, I don't recommend this hotel. However, if you don't mind walking a couple of blocks, Ocean Park beach is very nice. Also, you can take the bus to Isla Verde, which is still within walking distance (several blocks) which is also a wonderful beach. All beaches in Puerto Rico are public, so you are free to go to any beach you want.

Reviews.Title: “good for business travel, maybe not leisure”
Reviews.Author: pairofloafers
Reviews.Content: Stayed here just one night (july 13) for a convention because the primary hotel for the convention, Caribe Hilton, was full the first night of my stay (see separate review for Caribe). My overall impression of Condado Plaza was that it was very nice. Rate after taxes, etc, was apx $180. Things I liked: MY ROOM. Pretty, new, modern, stylish decor with a light airy tropical feel done in mostly white with aqua/green accents. Bathroom was small with only one sink and only a stall, no tub, but all new, clean white marble with nice toilettries, hair dryer, etc. that you would expect. I was initially disappointed to find my room was next to elevator, but did not experience noise from it. Only from loud talking guests in hall (not hotel's fault). LOCATION was pretty good. A number of restaurants of all price ranges nearby, a small grocery, some boutiques and car rental all within walking distance. If I were coming to San Juan for vacation, though, I would stay in Old San Juan in order to see sights and be near more restaurants. Cabs are expensive here. What I would actually do is get the heck out of SJ after a couple days and see other parts of the island via rental car. Reserve ahead, by the way. They were totally out of cars everywhere when we wanted to rent one to go to El Yunque. FOOD. Only had one meal- at hotel pool bar. It was an expensive $16 dollar chicken caesar salad, but I daresay worth it. Very large portion, homemade croutons and dressing and huge chunks of rotisserie chicken. COMMON AREAS/ LOBBY. Hotel entrance is right on street and not attractive, but once you step inside, the lobby is pretty and stylish- except casino, which is a cheesy eyesore. But the casino is off in a separate area of the hotel. Things I did not like: BEACH. Wanted to relax at beach when I first arrived. Took one look at it and went to the pool instead. It is a very small lame public beach with a busy road at one end. The view if you stand on it is mainly of other hotels, not the ocean. Very depressing since I am a beach person. Thankfully the pool area is OK. Not beautiful, but pretty nice. If you crave pretty ocean views, the hotel does have a large pretty furnished terrace at lobby level at the back that would be a nice place to have a cocktail. VIEW from my room was not attractive at all. It was of one of the hotels' structures. This was not a big deal to me, and I did not request a view as I was only there a night, but it would be a different story if it were my vacation. So you should be aware that at least half the rooms would have a similar view.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Place”
Reviews.Author: medinalynn
Reviews.Content: Not knowing anything about this hotel,I judged it on the reviews on Trip Advisor.They all seemed well pleased with this hotel,so we decided to stay here for six nights.Everything met our expectations and would stay here again.We were up graded to a ocean front room,which was great.Feliepe meet us at the lobby door and answered all our questions and gave us a lot of information,he was great.Good location,had no problem taking bus to old San Juan.We have already recommended to a couple who are going next month.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, very clean rooms with beautiful ocean view.”
Reviews.Author: JonVinto
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice hotel for either business or pleasure. Located in the "Condado," about 20 minutes from the airport, where the taxi ride cost us $19. (Taxis charge you a flat fee and add $1 per suitcase). There are many restaurants, parks, and businesses within walking distance. The hotel staff was very friendly and gave us a room on the 6th. floor with a gorgeous view of the ocean. There is another tower where some rooms have view of the lagoon. There is also a casino on the 2nd floor, which we did not use. Food is expensive, but again, this is a first rate hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing service, views, room, the list goes on...”
Reviews.Author: jaradb
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just returned from our honeymoon, which included 7 nights at the Condado Plaza. We had an amazing room (top floor corner with views of the lagoon, San Juan and the ocean) and it wasn't even a suite! Everyone from the front desk, to the concierge, the bell hops, and the guest services manager was over the top nice to us, even when Travelocity bungled our reservation. Varita, the newish restaurant at the hotel was delicious with superb service. It is just as expensive as the other restaurants in the hotel, but a much better value based on portion size and food quality. Although convenient, the buses in front of the hotel are sometimes few and far between. Try sharing a cab to Old San Juan with other hotel guests. Definitely get your free mojito at the bar at 7:30pm with a lesson in how to prepare one. Avoid the outrageously overpriced noodle bar, which is literally on the casino floor and charges $28 for noodle bowls!

Reviews.Title: “Great Choice”
Reviews.Author: Nurps
Reviews.Content: I spent a lot of time researching hotels before selecting the Conrad and was very pleased with my choice. We had no complaints. The staff was friendly and accommodating. In June it is off-season, so it is less crowded everywhere, including restaurants. We had an ocean-front room on the 5th floor with a wonderful balcony. We watched a couple of cruise ships come into the harbor from the room. The room was modern and tasteful, with a giant bathroom, refrigerator, and coffee maker. I would recommend the ocean side or the lagoon view, not the street view. The Italian restaurant was good for dinner, as well as breakfast. The pool is awesome--even has a waterslide and swim-up bar! The other wing of the hotel is across the street and has its own pool, etc. You can pay for a poolside massage, but we didn't spend a lot of time at the hotel to investigate other services. There is a Starbucks next door, a Subway down the street, along with several other reasonable restaurants with great seafood. A longer walk away is a Walgreens, which takes you by Gucci, Coach, and other high-end stores.The Conrad is in an ideal location--the bus stop is outside the front of the hotel. There is also an Enterprise Car Rental next to the hotel. I would recommend renting on-line for a better price, but the service was wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Star (and staff) Struck!:-)”
Reviews.Author: alichiva
Reviews.Content: I knew this was going to start off as a business trip (a national conference was hosted there), but would end up a leisure trip (i made plans to stay a few days after the conference to celebrate my 30th b-day:-). The hotel was awesome enough to let my friends and i stay an additional 3 nights and charged us the conference rate.
