Not only was the staff amazing (especially Mr. Henry Neumann...super nice, helpful and patient--he nicely repeated driving instructions to me...numerous times;-), but the hotel was filled w/ celebrities! George Clooney was filming there (didn't see him, though); ran into two bands in the hallways (Reik from Mexico and La Oreja de Van Gogh from Spain); and one of the nights the Gypsy Kings performed in one of the hotel's bars...hotel guests could go in for FREE! Oh, I was in "la-la-land"...:-) Oh, and and after the Miss Puerto Rico pageant, the after party was in the hotel's bar...yup, it's a pretty popular hotel, my friends and I loved it and would definitely go back--yes, even if we have to pay full price!:-)

Reviews.Title: “THE OCEAN VIEW ROOM WAS AMAZING”
Reviews.Author: lorenpq
Reviews.Content: THANKS FOR JEANPIERRE, LESLIE IN THE FRONT OFFICE (NOT CAROLE), JOEY, STELLING , CHRIS, AND MOST OF ALL YARILKA FOR A WONDEFUL STAY AT THE CONRAD HILTON. 5 DAYS OF WONDERFUL HOSPITALITY..(NO THANKS FOR THE CONCIERGE BUT SHE WAS BUSY FLITTING W/ THE BELL-MAN... We had a geogeous room, cleaned up for us, and so very confortable...(not sure how the other section is but the ocean side is amazing and worth the extra cost... Treated really well and it is worth it to tip! Food at 8 (noodles) and Bar by Pool was great...(expensive but Great). Breakfast at the hotel restaurant was very generous...Enjoy your time and patanage the hotel restaruants a few times...(if staying for a few days)..Nearby a small grill called Waikiki has WONDERUL MAUI MAUI...and a small little oriental (Asian) restaurant next door to Chili's (yes the chain) has wonderful fresh and reasonable Sushi...and Chinese food (mix).. Gambling is always fun- But don't expect much...The bathrooms are wonderful..... Enjoy the extra space that most PR hotels can't give you there... I'm sure there are as nice rooms there, but this hotel has gorgeous views..(no private beaches, but in San Juan, it's not the beaches, it's the culture!) thanks Hotel Conrad!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel very modern and true to pictures”
Reviews.Author: hondajosh
Reviews.Content: I was a bit aprehensive about my hotel selection due to other reviews regarding service. I have stayed in some of the best hotels through out the world and service is a key thing for me. I fortunately found the service at this hotel to be great! We arrived in early evening and was checked in promptly with a very warm and welcoming greeting! We ate at two of the hotels establishments and found their prices reasonable for what it was....a resort restaurant! The hotel lobby is beautiful! The room was awesome, we had an Ocean Vista room on the 7th floor with a breath taking view! (definitely crank up your a/c and leave the balcony door open for the most relaxing and romantic night in bed you can possibly have with the waves crashing below you). The forecast had me worried as it called for thunder and rain all 5 days we were there, luckily we only saw about 20 min of rain total all 5 days with most of the in El Yunque(a def must see). It's a short and nice 45 min drive from hotel. We rented a car but not a must, all though the gps was very difficult to understand as it speaks the names of streets fast and obviously in their spanish name, by day two we got around w/o it. The hotel is convienently located to everything you could want to do and the local restaurants were great! My only complaint about this hotel was the water pressure in the otherwise very awesome shower!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent wedding trip!”
Reviews.Author: kh221903
Reviews.Content: We stayed in January before, during, and after our wedding and were very pleased. Awesome hotel, great service, and nice location - quick walk or taxi to nearby locations. Only downside it can be a bit pricey, plan on eating outside the hotel. Oh, and the super small bathroom, but that tends to vary with the room.

Reviews.Title: “Great Start to a Honeymoon~”
Reviews.Author: Teachertraveling
Reviews.Content: This was the perfect start to our honeymoon. We stayed for 2 nights before getting onto a cruise ship for the rest of our celebration. We checked in early and we were able to get a room shortly there after. The room was clean and nicely decorated. The bathroom was really cool and trendy. We had a bay/ocean view...and we had to walk from the main building through the connecting tunnel over the street-no biggie! The casino was fun to through a little money into on your way out/back in at night. The pool was fun and had a great swim-up bar and restaurant. There is also a saltwater pool which was NOT as crowded as the regular pool. Nice choice of lounge chairs as long as you didn't wait until high noon. We had breakfast at the Italian Restaurant and it was good food for decent hotel prices-I would suggest it! There is a starbucks located in the hotel also for a quick coffee and bite. We did not eat another meal in the hotel but did have drinks and a snack at Strip..which was very good and I would love to have a meal there if we stay again. Overall a good place to stay for a night or two before/after a cruise. It's close enough to Old San Juan and the cruise terminals, but far enough away from the main hustle and bustle!

Reviews.Title: “HORRIBLE!!!!”
Reviews.Author: wildflower31
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel because it was listed on the American Express website as a 4-5 star hotel. And the location is horrible. It is surrounded my abandoned buildings. And forget about the nightlife. The rooms are small and there were dust bunnies under our bed. And our housekeeper did not replace the towels completely. She left 3 towels and 1 washcloth. In addition, the staff is unprofessional. When I checked out the clerk asked "how was you stay?" And I stated horrible and she just looked presented us our bill. No customer service. Do not stay at this hotel...

Reviews.Title: “Mixed Reviews”
Reviews.Author: ad052409
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Condado for our Honeymoon. The tour group we booked through got us an amazing deal, for what we paid everything (even the bad) was worth it. First the good. We stayed on the lagoon side of the Hotel which seemed to be a lot less busy. We were never bothered with noise, even though the walls were paper thin. We had an amazing view from the 7th floor (center.) There were a total of 5 water areas. Two decent size pools, a salt water pool and two jacuzzis. There was a huge Casino in the Hotel and 4 or 5 restaurants. The Hotel was right at the end of the strip just a few miles from old san juan. We had no problems walking around the city or the beach/lagoon area. We stayed in the bahia vista room type. The room was very spacious, and the bathroom bigger than ours at home! The decor was nice, not a typical hotel room and the bed was like sleeping on clouds ( I actually ordered the pillows.) It was kept very clean by room service, and anything we needed from food to combs was delivered within 10 minutes of request. And now for the bad. The Hotel had a sushi bar in it, which we had to walk by to get to our room. The smell was horrible! We didn't have any assistance with our bags coming or going which I found odd since there was always atleast 2 doorsmen. The side of the hotel we stayed on doubled as a banquet room(right near the pool,) and there were a lot of very nice events which took place. The bad side of that, it was awkward to walk by women in beautiful ball gowns in my sarong and bathing suit. The Main jacuzzi was kept way too hot, and we could never get anyone to turn it down. And finally, the cost of items at the hotel were outragous! From the restaurants (although conveinant), the bar (10 bucks a drink) to the water bottles (7 a peice) all seemed very expensive. Either way it was an amazing trip, and I would return.

Reviews.Title: “Girlfriends Getaway @ The Condado”
Reviews.Author: chloe8
Reviews.Content: My friend and I just came back from the Condado Plaza which is now a Conrad Hotel. The interior design is ultra modern, kind of funky. May not be to everyone's taste but was fun for a few days. Staff was nice. Rooms were very clean and we had a great view. Bed was more comfortable than the one I have at home. Wish I could have packed it in my suitcase. Was disappointed that they only did turn down service the first night, also after you use your two free bottles of water, they never give you any more and they did not replenish our coffee until we asked. Just minor things, but they would have been nice. Breakfast in the hotel was fine, but not special. Had lunch at the pool which was very good. I especially recommend the bruschetta with shrimp and avocado. There are two nice big pools, both a good temp. Jacuzzi was nice and warm, too but could use more jets. There is a small beach right off the pool area. Old San Juan is walkable from the hotel which is a plus as taxis are $15 one way. There is a Starbucks at the hotel. I loved that! Several restaurants and a casino, too. It seemed a little more of a convention oriented hotel, but I would still go there for a vacation again. Concierge booked excursions for us. Taxis were plentiful. There is a swim up bar at the pool and a couple bars inside. On weekends they have live entertainment which was nice. FREE wifi in the rooms which we made use of. All-in-all, we were really pleased with our experience at the Condado Plaza and would go back again!

Reviews.Title: “Noisiest Hotel I've Ever Stayed In”
Reviews.Author: galveston_gal
Reviews.Content: We arrived around noon and were pleasantly surprised to find a room ready. There was a long line at check-in, but the operation went swiftly. We found the elevators were packed any time we used them, and finally resorted to using the stairs after a while. We had booked ocean view, and we were very pleased with the view. The room was an average size, but has an unusual set up in the bathroom. The clothes closet and drawers, and dressing area are located right next to the shower. A couple wanting to dress for dinner must use the same area to shower, do your hair, dress, iron your clothes, etc. It was very cramped. I enjoyed the modern decor throughout the hotel and room. What I did not enjoy was the construction of the doors in the hallway. The doors slam very loudly if you do not make an effort to close them quietly, and no one on our floor ever closed anything quietly! We heard slamming doors all hours of the night, girls squealing and yelling all hours of the day and night, gamblers returning loudly cursing their losses at 4:30 a.m. from the casino, children running up and down the hallway at 2:00 a.m. (where were the parents? oh, that was them screaming their heads off!). We enjoyed the beach area and also used the salt water pool. There was a large group of partiers in the larger pool who were singing at the top of their lungs, and encouraging girls standing on their room balconies to show their breasts. And the girls were keeping them happy. Would I ever return to this hotel? No thanks. It's not for us.

Reviews.Title: “The REAL Conrad Hotel: A review for patrons 30 years and older”
Reviews.Author: Nikki_Darling
Reviews.Content: Ok, first let me say, I chose the Conrad based on the recommendatios from Trip Advisor... an rarely do they get it wrong... but this time.. WOW. The Conrad is nonetheless: trendy, pretty, equipped w/ nice rooms, a great party spot and has a lovely pool and ocean view area. BUT if you are over the age of 30 and you are looking for an upscale and leisurely weekend: STAY FAR FAR AWAY. The Conrad is for all intents and purposes: THE Party Hotel! It is LOUD (yes I heard the part from the beach all the way to the 4th floor), it is class less (HOTEL strippers and hookers greeted us when we arrived from the airport), it is tailor made for 20 year olds with not a lot of money but the wish to get into some trouble. I would have PAID To stay elsewhere...because relax was something you can't do at the Conrad. Parties going until 5:00 in the morning, the thumpa thumpa of the music, the constant casino patrons, the endless kids partying all night long. It was painful experience ...now had I still been in college instead of mid 30s I would have LOVED it..but I hated it.. and you will hate it too if you are looking for class or serenity.

Reviews.Title: “FANTASTIC CHOICE!”
Reviews.Author: bluejeangirl
Reviews.Content: We originally had booked The Marriott and then cancelled and chose this hotel based on a write-up in Caribbean Travel Magazine. I normally don't go really base my own opinion on a review, but for some reason this one grabbed my attention and I am extremely happy that I went with my gut feeling. This hotel is a MUST stay while visiting San Juan. The photos on this webiste and their own are spot on. We stayed for an overnight after our Princess cruise to take in San Juan and kept the theme of our trip with an Ocean view room. Talk about a room with a view...simply breathtaking! The room was extremely spacious - it was like being in a suite. The hotel is spotless, staff is extremely friendly and accomodating. We had a 5:30PM flight out the next day and we were able to extend our check-out time until 3PM and hang out by the pool for most of the day. We also got the rate with breakfast which I highly recommend if it remains available You get a coupon per person valued at $15. I ordered pancakes, got the usual 3 and only was able to eat 1 - they were HUGE so the portions are quite generous to say the least. It is an American style breakfast. Short cab ride to Old San Juan which is beautiful and offers a nice variety of shopping. You can also take the bus for 75 cents and it runs every half hour. 2 pools - one is a salt water pool and the other is fresh water with a poolside bar; very cool. Condado Beach is just steps away so you have the best of all worlds with your choices in sunning and swimming. You can even snorkel in Condado Beach. We would highly recommend this hotel for your stay in San Juan. We wished we had extended our vacation to stay longer in Puerto Rico. We will definitely be back to see the many sites we missed and of course relax. Our only choice of where we will stay is at The Condado .

Reviews.Title: “Great, Beautiful, Relaxing, Great Service, and great Ammenities”
Reviews.Author: talleyam
Reviews.Content: I had a great time here. The room and the pictures were exactly as they appeared on the website. I had the ocean front view room here and you could literally spit into the water from your balcony, not that I did. They even had a salt water pool as well as a pool with a bar in it. Each hotel here on this strip had it's own separate beach. The bartender Spencer was great. All the people here and the service was great. Ashford ave. had all the great stores if you like to shop, as far as LV, Cartier, Salvador Fer., etc, and a great night life. The resort here was great, and I would go back a million times.

Reviews.Title: “Spectacular Hotel with a few small drawbacks”
Reviews.Author: RonboNJ
Reviews.Content: I am sitting here in my room at the Condado Plaza the morning of my departure writing this review. My friends and I arrived a day early into San Juan to board a cruise out of the Pan Am pier. Originally we booked the Sheraton thinking the ship was going to dock across the street, but when we found out it was docking across the water instead, we decided to find a hotel that was a little closer. With the help of this site, I checked out reviews for the SHERATON and the CONDADO PLAZA and actually found the latter to be more highly rated by travelers. So, we booked the Condado Plaza and hoped for the best. Like everyone else I wasn't overly pleased that a lean was put on my credit card or that there were all these extra charges (taxes and other fees) that were being added to the bill, but miraculously, we were able to snag an ocean view room at about the same cost as a standard room at the Sheraton. Upon arriving at the Condado we were greeted by a porter who took our luggage and then brought it up to the room, despite the fact we got a call saying that there was a mixup with which room it originally went to. That caused us to wait about 45 minutes for our luggage to arrive after check-in. Ceasar is the luggage porter and he was especially nice. The rooms itself are pretty impressive. Very modern dÃ©cor with one of the most imaginative bathroom layouts I have ever seen. My friends were ecstatic when they walked in the room and saw how beautiful it was. Then, they looked at the ocean view off their balcony and were convinced they were in one of the most wonderful hotels they have ever been in. After reading all the reviews I knew that this hotel was not going to be perfect. Fortunately our complaints were only minor. Firstly, after walking Old San Juan and having dinner in town, we decided to come back around 7pm to use the hot tub by the pool. We were thrilled that it was empty, but once getting into the tub we were upset to find that the water was lukewarm. Even though a sign by the tub stated the water gets no hotter than 102 degrees, we were soaking in water that was about 80 degrees. Thing is, once it gets dark, there is no hotel staff walking around the pool so there was nobody around to ask to turn the heat up. Also, there is no water pressure in the shower. You have this beautiful cubical glass shower, but once turned on, you have to deal with low water pressure. On the plus side, there was an array of lotions and body wash as well as a coffee maker (with coffee) in the room. I woke up this morning at 5am quite hungry and wanted to go to Starbucks which I heard was attached to the hotel. I was told at the front desk that Starbucks doesn't open till 7am. Meanwhile, there is NO vending machines anywhere in the hotel so I have no idea what someone would do if they needed bottled beverages or just something to snack on. The bed was extremely comfortable. With the balcony door open, I drifted off to la-la land to the sound of the crashing waves below me. It was wonderful. Just be aware that if you keep the balcony open at night the air conditioning turns off. This is to be expected. Internet WiFi was my major concern, and I am happy to report that it is working quite well in my 8th floor ocean view room. Very speedy access. Elevator, as reported, is very slow. Be prepared to wait during rush hours. Check-in was a tad slow as there seems to be an influx of people and only two clerks at the desk, but nothing to really complain about. Have not yet attempted to check out, but as reported, it doesn't seem you can do it from the room so we have given ourselves 30 minutes this morning to do it from the lobby just in case there is a line. On the plus side, this hotel is beautiful. By far, I would not hesitate to come back here next year. I just think the hotel needs to be more on top of the little things like maintaing the hot tub temperature, working on in-room checkout and perhaps providing a means for people to get snacks outside of restaurant hours. Overall, a highly satisfying experience and a great way to start off our week vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel and Ideal Locale”
Reviews.Author: YadiDadi
Reviews.Content: I was in San Juan for business in 2/2008. My wife came along with me on this trip. We were deciding between the Sheraton Old San Juan, Hilton Caribe, and this hotel. We were very satisfied with our selection. The location of the hotel is ideal. You're near old San Juan (~$15 cab ride one-way), but you're not in it, so you avoid the noise, crowds, and traffic. Also, the Condado area is really nice. In the opposite directon from old San Juan, there is shopping and some pretty good restaurants. The hotel grounds are really nice. You're right on the sea. The pool is right by the beach. The beach is small, open to public, and really not worth spending time at, in my opinion. The rooms were very nice, especially the bathrooms. The one bizarre thing about the hotel was we heard the speaker (i.e. for emergency announcements) crackling during the night. The hotel sent maintenance up to fix it while we were out. When we came back, it was still making the same noises. It was loud enough and annoying enough that I had a hard time sleeping. We complained at the front desk and they moved us to an ocean view room (we had previously been in a lagoon view room). Interestingly enough, the speaker was doing the same thing in this room. It was nice to get a free upgrade, but the noise was less than ideal. That is the only negative thing I would say about the hotel. The casino is pretty small, but if you're there to gamble, it will suffice. We aren't big gamblers and having the casino there did not bother us. If you have a car, make a trip to El Yunque rain forest. We had not been to a rain forest that did not require a guide. This one does not. You're free to hike on your own and there are some breathtaking views. Luquillo beach is not far from El Yunque. The concierge suggested we go here. Pretty amazing beach. Post card worthy, I would say. Restaurants that I'd recommend: -Cafe Puerto Rico (Old San Juan) - Puerto Rican food. Best "local" food we had while in San Juan. -Agua Viva (Old San Juan) - Seafood. -Ajili Mojili (Condado) - Puerto Rican food within walking distance of hotel. Recommended by concierge.

Reviews.Title: “Great spot!”
Reviews.Author: JKMAN
Reviews.Content: Great location for its proximity to Old San Juan. Lots of nice restaurants and shops close by. The beach is small but nice and sheltered. Very nice pool area with swim-up bar. The casino was fun. We had a beautiful ocean view - we enjoyed listening to the waves crashing on the rocks. Overall a great experience. We stayed 2 nights.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: LezLeewpg
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Conado Plaza after a cruise for 2 days.Loved it!! Great view, large spotless room,bathroom to die for with fridge and coffee supplies,Close to everything,Grounds are beautiful with 2 pools,small water slide for kids,hot tub+++.Stayed 1 night at Diamond Palace horrible,dirty,old ,never again!!

Reviews.Title: “Clean, vast and colorful escape”
Reviews.Author: amyMinneapolis
Reviews.Content: The Condado hotel is large, has plenty of people there to help you, and is very security conscious. My daughter (teen) and I stayed there, enjoyed the great outdoor pools, tantalizing view of the city via the lagoon building, and the ease of hopping a bus to Old San Juan when we felt like it. The vast verandas for guests are peaceful getaways - to read, enjoy the ocean waves crashing over the rocks, or have some coffee. I can't say enough about their sheets/linens - bedding - gorgeous and inviting. Great color choices. We'd go back in a heartbeat! Amy Nymark

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel in Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Marleee
Reviews.Content: Convenient location close enough to OSJ. Spacious room with very comfortable bed and beautiful bathroom. The staff was very polite and helpful. The pool area is nice, the public beach by the hotel is crowed in the weekends but empty on week days. There's a bus stop right there that will take you to OSJ for 75 cents. We didn't eat at the hotel. There's "Ropa Vieja" restaurant that serves great affordable food a block away from the hotel. Next is La Estancia restaurant where you can have breakfast with an ocean view. If you keep walking in Ashford Ave you'll find boutique stores and La Concha Hotel. Next to the hotel are Starbucks and Enterprise Car Rental. There's a few buildings in the area that are being remodeled. Saturday night you'll see some activity in the hotel and good ambiance in the bar and casino. We had a room with ocean view in the 9th floor and it was totally worth it, the view is amazing, you can seat in the balcony an enjoy the sound of the waves. We enjoyed our stay in this hotel very much!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel -- Expensive Dinning!!!”
Reviews.Author: ACNYC
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a good hotel with the modern decor. The dinning in and around the Hotel is just out of this world in price.

Reviews.Title: “didn't want to leave the Conrad or San Juan”
Reviews.Author: violingurl
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I just returned from vacationing in San Juan and staying at the Conrad Hotel. We chose the Conrad after reading reviews on Trip Advisor and talking to a friend of a friend who lives in PR. We were deciding between the El Convento Hotel, the El San Juan and the Conrad and in the end we were (and still are) very happy that we chose the Conrad. The Conrad was in a great location for us in that we could walk down the street to great restaurants, Walgreens (for Aloe, bottled water and snacks), the hotel was only a short cab ride from downtown Old San Juan and it has beautiful pools and is right next to the lagoon. We had an oceanfront room and were thrilled to be able to wake up each morning our stay and go out on our balcony and enjoy the ocean views and the fresh air. Additionally, we really enjoyed the casino and ate at 2 out of the 3 restaurants at the hotel which were just fantastic as well. The service was superb and every question we had about our stay, travel advice, restaurants, Old San Juan, etc was answered in a friendly manner and with a smile. I personally think that the Conrad is a great place for families with children and everyone in between who want to relax, have a little bit of fun and enjoy some great service. If you are looking for a huge party then this is probably not your place as this hotel seemed to me to be for the more low key crowd. Overall, we thoroughly enjoyed our stay at the Conrad and definitely hope to stay there again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, IF YOU ARE SMART and Know what you want”
Reviews.Author: goodwig
Reviews.Content: I have been to San Juan 1/2 times and stayed at the Condado 4 times in the past 10 years (changed ovnership several times and is now a Hilton property). All the reviewers are correct . It depends on what you want and, if you are smart, you will find this hotel to be an excellent choice if you want a location that affords you the benefits of being able to walk along Ashford Avenue to other hotels, restaurants, stores, etc., along with oceanfront that has spectacular views from both your room (that is, IF you negotiate for a proper room. At night with the sliding glass door open, you can listen to the waves wash up on the shore) and the public grounds. In fact, it fronts the ocean and also faces the lagoon to the south, which gives you access to a nice public beach which is adjacent to the hotel property. I am a very fussy (and frequent) traveler, and money is no factor, so I choose the Condada over all other hotels in San Juan because it has the best combination of amenities that I want while on vacation. By the way, the Caribe Hilton is directly across the lagoon from the Condado (and a l0 minute walk across the beach). It, too, is very nice, but like all hotels, if you don't express your strong preference for a good room, you will end up facing a parking lot or a construction site !

Reviews.Title: “I would definately go back to this hotel”
Reviews.Author: terrigirl
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 6 days, 3 for business and 3 for pleasure, I had a great ocean view room on the 10th floor. When we checked at night the staff at the front desk were so friendly and helpful..The room was clean and had a frig and a microwave, so we were able to go to the grocery store down the street and stock up on drinks and snacks. We ate breakfast in the restaurant every morning and all the staff was delightful and the food was good. We had drinks and lunch by the pool and that was a bit pricey. I wish they had one pool heated as the water was cold. We took a bus for $.75 downtown to Old San Juan, the 21 or 53, it was fun. The bus stops running at 9 so we really had to rush one night. The town closes early. If you get down there go eat at Reises, the food is pure Puerto Rican and superb. If you want to go to the Bacardi Rum Factory take the bus and walk to the Ferry, it cost $.50 to take the Ferry one way. When you get off you have to take a cab over and back to the Ferry. We were lucky while we were there Johnny Depp was filming his new movie "The Rum Diary", so we met him got his autograph and photos. We went there twice to see him. He stopped filming at 6 p.m.. He will be there until June, if anyone is going back there. You can't miss it, it's the street behind the Hard Rock Cafe. We had great weather the whole time we were there, hot with a breeze all the time. Everything is walking distance, so don't waste all that money renting a car. You can rent one at the hotel for the day you need it. The cab fare from the airport to the hotel was $17.00. There is also a restaurant across from the hotel Verita, that has excellant Puerto Rican food.

Reviews.Title: “Agree with "Lackluster"”
Reviews.Author: jnb2375
Reviews.Content: I have never been to Puerto Rico before and if I had it to do over, I would stay in Old San Juan. The ocean is really unswimable, so while it is pretty, it is not an available activity. Old San Juan had a lot going on, tons of restaurant choices, history, etc. The hotel is nice, but not 4 or 5 star. No turn down service, no extras. Decor was stylish and modern. The bathrooms were ridiculous. The doors slid closed with an inch or so gap on either side; zero privacy in the bathroom. The walls were very thin. We could hear every time the toilet flushed in the next room. Hall noises also come through loud and clear. Prices for food at the hotel are very, very high. The beach connected to the hotel is small and public. There are several abandoned buildings around the hotel, including next door. The pool overlooks bridge construction. The room was fairly clean, but there were old glass marks on the bathroom counter. The business center charges $7.50 for 15 minutes of computer time. Went to Waikiki for dinner one night as recommended by staff. Beautiful view, but there was a LIVE worm in my salad! To make matters worse, the owner did not come out to apologize and only the salad was taken off the bill. Once we insisted, 20% was taken off. Boat trip booked through East Wind Excursions was worth it, as was segway tour booked through Venture Out Puerto Rico. ATV tour booked through Venture Out was canceled by the company 15 minutes before designated pick-up time. La Placita has a great restaurant with no name. It looks like a little white house. The owner wants to be known by word of mouth. A word of caution- have someone call you a cab, they do not generally go to La Placita.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay when exploring Puerto Rico”
Reviews.Author: DCmetrodogmom
Reviews.Content: My husband I landed at the Conrad Condado Plaza through Hotwire. After reading TripAdvisor reviews, I was nervous about what we would encounter, but the hotel was great. The location and amenities were wonderful, and we did not face erroneous charges (although we knew going in that most resorts charge "resort fees"). Highlights 1. Rooms: The rooms are beautiful and very clean. We got upgraded from a "bahia vista" room to an ocean view room on the 10th floor. The Condado Plaza's location is exquisitely beautiful. We brought lunch to our balcony several times so we could watch the waves break below us. 2. Location: Condado proved to be a good base for exploring Puerto Rico. There are tons of restaurants and shops just down Ave Ashford, and Old San Juan is just a short bus ride away. 3. Amenities: The pools are not heated, but there are 3 of them, and there are 2 wonderful hot tubs. We spent a lot of time relaxing at the resort, lounging on the chairs and reading. The fitness center is also great. We also enjoyed lots of towels from the towel hut. 4. Reliable wi-fi is included for free in the resort fee. Lowlights: 1. The beach chairs are free, but umbrellas are $11. We didn't opt for the umbrella since we didn't plan to stay at the beach all day. 2. We didn't bring our tennis racquets because the hotel offered some, but we didn't know the rental fee was $15/pop. 3. Front desk check-in staff: The woman who checked us in seemed overly distracted by the busy Saturday crowd and wasn't very helpful. She didn't give us a map of the property or the weekly activities' guide. 4. The pools can be chilly. Other tips: 1. Take the bus: We're from Washington, DC, and we dislike bus riding in general, but several of the Condado Plaza staff encouraged us to take the bus (21 or 53) to Old San Juan. We are so glad we did. The bus is clean, full of tourists, and only $.75 per trip. We saved nearly $50 in cab fare! 2. Restaurants nearby that we liked: Mike and Charley's Pizza (good for lunch); Cielito Lindo (Mexican food on Magdalena); Chili's (for some American comfort food) 3. Walgreens is down the street. We bought soda and snacks and put them in our room fridge. 4. If you want to visit El Yunque, you can rent a car from the rental shop in the hotel. We paid $60 (including insurance), and had a great time exploring El Yunque and Luquillo on our own.

Reviews.Title: “Love this place!”
Reviews.Author: teegee2
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent 5 wonderful days in this great hotel! The hotel reminded us of one of Miami's chic hotels. The rooms a very nice - clean - staff is very friendly and helpful. Nice little beach! Plenty of good places to eat near the hotel! Great location - no need for a car!! Can't wait to go back!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Simply the Best”
Reviews.Author: atlmumyof3
Reviews.Content: My husband and I took a trip to Puerto Rico and stayed at the Condado and it was FANTASTIC. From the time we arrived to the time we left we were treated like royalty. I was very skeptical about the hotel because some of the reviews that I read on Trip Advisor indicated that some guest had trouble with their final bill .......NOT ME! My husband and I especially enjoyed the swim up pool bar (Carlos, Sterling and Joey were great) and the casino was beautiful (Edgar was extremely entertaining). The view from our room (oceanview 10th floor) was absolutely breathtaking! I look forward to going back to Puerto Rico!

Reviews.Title: “Fun Hotel...Great Pool and views”
Reviews.Author: cosmicorbit
Reviews.Content: Loved staying at this hotel. Beautiful common spaces (lobby, pool), and great views on the water. Wished it had been on a better beach, but this particular beach was interesting because lots of sea creatures on the rocks. Pool area was great with a fun waterslide, cool saltwater pool. Room could have been a little cleaners- some stains on ottoman, some crumbs and things outside of room when we arrived, showerhead a little moldy. However, really not that bad and again - great views. We had the cheap (well, not really) view, of San Juan, but still beautiful. Hotel restaurants are pretty good and some of the Casino staff really funny. Lady at the front desk was kind of rude when we arrived, but didn't bother us too much. Valets getting us cabs were also funny, and bartenders nice. I guess I would say that most of staff were nice and friendly, while some were a little rude. Great fitness center - well stocked with equipment and towels.

Reviews.Title: “Great room clean safe environment would recomend it to anyone”
Reviews.Author: drysdy
Reviews.Content: We arrived Feb 28th. I was moved from the Sheraton Old San Juan but the couple we where traveling with were not. The hotel staff called the Sheraton and had the other reservation canceled and booked our friends in at the same rate that we were given at the Sheraton. the room across the road and past the Casino was clean and the bed was the most comfortable hotel bed that we had ever slept on. The food prices at the Italian Restaurant although high were still cheaper than eating at the Keg. there was a private event going on around the pool but as a hotel guest you where allowed to attend. The music was loud but died down around 1130 and moved inside. Breakfast in the hotel restaurant was great and the staff where great when we wanted to store our luggage as we were not going to the dock until after 3. I found the price of a drink around the pool really on the high side so we only had one. As for the beach to the other people who have complained about it "READ THE SIGN" it is run by the parks and recreation department of the city of San Juan and not the hotel. the hotel has security to make sure only guests come back from the beach to the hotel. The causeway is under construction but the hotel cannot control that. thanks.

Reviews.Title: “Really Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: aabbrown
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at the Condado Plaza we were there the first week in February for 6 days we had our Annual Mid-winter Church conference and it worked really well. The rooms are new spacious and the hotel is very modern upscale and clean. The food was good but very pricey. There are some better options nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the view”
Reviews.Author: hebnerdo
Reviews.Content: We were at the condado for a meeting...a large meeting...and the staff provided very nicely for all of us. The food was always very good and everyone connected with the hotel was friendly and very helpful. Just one suggestion....when you reserve a room, ask for the ocean view. If you are in the lagoon towers, your views are not that great. The location is very good with many restaurants in walking distance. You can also take a bus that is right outside the hotel to Old Town. There are many pools and there is a small beach nearby. Good choice for a hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience!”
Reviews.Author: dcla1951
Reviews.Content: We stayed in an Ocean Vista room, using our AARP discount, for one night prior to our cruise. We just LOVED this hotel, and are making plans to go back there next year and stay for a week. We ate in one of the hotel restaurants and had a fabulous meal ($50 for two). We played in the casino and ended up winning more than losing. Another plus. The grounds are beautiful. We only wish we had time to enjoy the beach and the pools. We had a balcony in our room, and the smell of that warm ocean air was heavenly. The room was completely modern, and sparkling clean. It was quiet, and the beds were OH so comfortable! The staff were friendly, professional. and very helpful. The location was perfect; it lies between the airport and the pier. Depending on traffic, about 10-15 minutes to the pier or airport. There was construction going on across the street, but it did not bother us at all. We cannot wait to return to this fabulous, classy hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Condado Beach The Best Hotel Ever!”
Reviews.Author: tj69662094
Reviews.Content: We went to the Condado Beach on May of 2008 because my father was being honored by the Puerto Rican government as well as Hilary and Bill Clinton. We stayed in the 8th floor, which is where government visitors stay at. Despite the fact that us and the Clintons were the only people in floor 8 those days, and the hassles incurred by secret service (who were friendly to us, btw) we enjoyed our stay like crazy! I mean, here I was, on my plain white tank top and blue shorts, walking on the lobby eating ice, and nobody cared. The big pool is the best you can enjoy in the world, there is a slide, and you can slide on it, swim all the way to the pool bar or just go under these showers they have too. The rooms are very clean, in fact, they have high end soap and toileteries you can use. Be careful with the Fiji water bottle, through, they charge you 7 dollars for drinking it! There are many clubs and restaurants nearby, and the private beach is just a few steps from the hotel. Plane spotters will also enjoy this location: one can see jets landing at SJU from many of the rooms, and also, when at the beach you have an excellent look at the propellers taking off from San Juan's other airport, Isla Grande, just across the street. The hotel is very close to San Juan's main attractions. There is a casino at the hotel. Anoher thing, do not miss the walking bridge that connects this hotel to another one, specially at night!

Reviews.Title: “Great Room, Teriffic View, Great Staff!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for one night prior to our cruise. Having read numerous reviews on this site I wasn't sure what to expect but I can assure you our stay wonderful! We were fortunate enough to have an oceanview room on the 8th floor. The room was spacious and bed extremely comfortable. The balcony overlooking the crashing waves of the ocean provided an extremely relaxing place to unwind after our flight. We had both dinner and breakfast in the Italian Restaurant. Both food and service were great. Opposite the restaurant was the hotels casino, which was clean and never overcrowded. A truly fun environment. Having read many reviews on this site, I also noticed that Mr. Henry Neumann, the Guest Relations Manager of the hotel took time out to respond to many of the reviews of this hotel expressing concern for some of the problems guests experienced during their stay, so I made sure to find him and say hello when we arrived. He is truly a gentleman and offered to do whatever he could to make sure our stay was pleasant. We had no need for his assistance, but I was glad to know that he was there if needed. If you are going to cruise out of San Juan, the pier is a 5 minute cab ride from the hotel. I highly recommend you stay here. You won't be dissapointed.

Reviews.Title: “Condado Review”
Reviews.Author: Sromag
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed at the Condado. It was nice. Rooms were nice. Clean, recently updated. Had a few different pool options. One pool is by itself and very quite. Other pools by the Bar & Ocean a bit more lively. Had good service by the pool could order food or drinks. Many choices (salad, pizza, burgers, sandwiches, wraps, etc.) A bit pricey but it seemed like everything in this area of San Juan was pricey. Had a great view of Ocean, beutiful scenery and the lagoon was surrounded by rocks. Very picturesque. Casino was nice, plenty of free drinks and was open 24 hours. Would not consider this a vacation resort but more of an urban resort.

Reviews.Title: “Incredibly disappointing”
Reviews.Author: JimmyJava
Reviews.Content: We had a lot of heightened expectations going into this trip (from tripadvisor, other recommendations, etc), and this hotel fell very short of not only those, but also the things one might take for granted at any hotel. For example, this is a beach resort. One might think they could spend all their time on the beach. We went on to the beach around 4PM on Saturday, and were told that we couldn't have a lounge chair because "the beach is closed". We could stay on the beach, but what's the point? It's a 100-foot wide artificial beach on a lagoon, overlooking a construction-bound causeway. Forget about catching any waves. And if you happen to hit the beach before closing time, expect to pay $11 if you want to rent an umbrella for the day. And the service was terrible and overpriced. We understand from our travels that in most places the waitstaff take a long time, but we were consistently left waiting 20-30 minutes at a time for drinks. It's difficult to maintain a decent buzz when you keep sobering up between drinks. One also begins to resent paying $9 for a rum and coke when it comes in a dixie cup. Apparently they couldn't spring for glass. The rent-a-cop down by the pool doesn't appreciate you bringing your own bathroom glasses down with you either. I wonder if he's trained in CPR, because I saw no lifeguards. Speaking of which, the bar closes at 9. What kind of bar closes at 9? We go hiking in the rain forest and trekking about town and all we want is some greasy chicken wings, or a quesadilla, or mozzarella sticks (you know, gourmet food with the price to match), and the bar is closed right about the time it should be opening. If I could have reached behind the bar and poured myself rum and coke all night, I still would have felt ripped off. The rooms were beautiful, and we had a fantastic view. However, the floors are covered in slick white tile. Several times this past weekend I slipped, and were it not for my cat-like instincts, I would have cracked my head. It's almost as if the cleaning staff is spraying the floor with pam, even the balcony. I spent time drying it with a bathroom towel and it was buttered up again after housekeeping came through. If you expect any kind of humidity or moistness during your trip to San Juan, bring some gorilla snot for your feet. The last thing I'd like to say is that we were convinced to stay on Ashford because of the many reviews that told us not to stay in Old San Juan. If you do not want to see any culture, colonial architecture, museums, or fine food during your trip, and would rather stumble down Ashford past condemned hotels, empty lots, construction crews, and burger kings, then that is your choice. The bottom line is, you will not want to stay inside the hotel, but there is nothing in this town that will draw you out of it. If you have the money to burn, go gamble, that's why they want you here anyway.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel with a Modern Design”
Reviews.Author: ChrisMike624
Reviews.Content: This hotel was in a great little area of San Juan. It was nicely redone and the rooms are spacious and nicely appointed with contemporary furniture and decor. Loved the bathroom! Lobby was a bit small, but nicely done. Could use some better food options. The "family" Italian restaurants has life-sized statues of David, which is butt-naked. Hardly what I would want my little kids seeing. All in all, great views, clean, large rooms, and very hip. Would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but...”
Reviews.Author: Cali78
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel over the New Year's holiday for a wedding. Overall, the hotel is nice. It has been recently renovated with modern decor, has great ocean views (if you are on that side) and a good location. However, I felt the hotel was superficially luxurious without a lot of substance. A few things I noticed... - The rooms lack functionality. They have a nice corner sofa, however it results in there not being anywhere out of the way to put your baggage. The closet is in the bathroom (open next to the shower), not a problem unless you have dress clothes that shouldn't get wet, then there isn't anywhere else to hang them. There also isn't any place to hang bathing suits to dry. - The pools are just ok. The primary pool is off to one side (near the beach), and is fairly small without much of an ocean view. Perhaps I got spoiled by the Caribe Hilton across the way which has beautiful pools overlooking the ocean. The Condado Plaza does have a water slide and swim up bar. - Beach is public, which does allow the potential for experiencing a bit of local flavor, but is directly under/next to the bridge. There's a lot of traffic, pretty much all of the time. - High fees and incorrect charges. Yes, resort fees are standard, but I like to see that I'm getting something for it (mini drinks by the pool, etc). As noted by some other reviewers, we had some incorrect charges - for already validated parking and something else I don't recall. All in all, the hotel is nice, just not quite as luxurious as I was expecting. In the future, given the choice, I'd probably stay somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “The biggest rip-off Hotel I've ever stayed at”
Reviews.Author: travellingall
Reviews.Content: My first impressions of this hotel were great. The decor was contemporary, great location next to the ocean and the staff seemed warm albeit quite slow (this is part of the Caribbean charm I think). The room was fine - not the best room I've stayed at in a five star resort, but it was acceptable. Dissappointing factor being no milk or sugar for the coffee / tea they supplied. And they only gave us two teabags for an 8 night stay. The staff overall were friendly and professional and could not fault them at all. The resort facilities were not really resort facilities; but general hotel facilties. No extra activities are offered and the pool is like any other pool you might see at a 3 or 4 star hotel. The main gripe came at the end of the stay when asked for our bill we were advised on the bill that there would be an additional 30% tax. This was advised in the confirmation in very small writing at the bottom of our email confirmation and the total price on the confirmation email didn't show the additional fees. The additional fees included resort tax (approx. $60 per day) of which the Condado Plaza advised that this was to pay for the casino being open 24 hours a day and the unmanned gym being open 24 hours per day???? I didn't use either! There was also an additional occupancy tax and general other taxes. We complained to the Manager who didn't seem to be too bothered by our budget being hit $1000 more than we had anticipated. I find this extremely deceptive and would definately not recommend this hotel. I've stayed at hundreds of hotels and resorts and this has to be the worst value for money I've ever stayed at. I would NEVER stay at the condado plaza resort and would suggest that if you do happen to stay here find out what the total rate is plus the tax and the resort fees are before you book. As you can imagine this left a nasty taste in my mouth and a bad overall impression of Puerto Rico.

Reviews.Title: “Everything I could dream of! and more!!”
Reviews.Author: rico48099
Reviews.Content: I have been staying at the Condado Plaza every January since 1986 for minmim 10 days (back in the 80's) to currently at least 2 weeks, upwards to 3 - 3 and a half weeks. I used to stay on the 10th floor (formerly known as the Plaza Club Suites) where I was always treated with respect and pampered liike the royalty I think I am (ha!) *(i'm really nobody) I have been thru just about every hotel on the island (worth reviewing anyway) and will definitle say this Hotel has always been my favorite. The location, right on the strip (ashford ave) overlooking old san juan is about the closest to nirvana one could imagine. The one thing that deters from ANY hotel, or vacation is the surrounding idiot travelers who think they they "deserve" special treatment - remember travelers, YOU are visiting, and have no reason to belittle or disrespect anyone. I recall one year a group of (idiot) younger folk (i can call them "kids",) who were at the hotel representing hotels.com, and obviously out of their element - definitely NOT the average person who would spend the extra $$ to stay in the plaza club acting like kids, and I thought "what a shame" that their comments would then be used to categorize this Hotel on sites as this. Bottom line - you're gonna get what you pay for - if you're miserale in your hometown with a lousy marriage, Puerto Rico aint gonna change it. I LOve Puerto Rico, the People, The history, the bacalaitos! :) Hi Evelyn! Miss you!!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable stay.”
Reviews.Author: SouthWedger
Reviews.Content: I've read several of the reviews and wonder what kind of room they had booked. Bathroom in the ocean view rooms are appropriate sized as was the rest of the hotel room. The entire ocean side wall was glass and balcony; very nice. The room was contemporary which is not my taste but great fun for a vacation stay. The view from the balcony (9th floor) was fantastic. The Lobby and Casino: A+. Clean, fun and no smoking allowed. Won $150 bucks! The first time ever I've won! The Restaurants: C+. I wasn't excited with the selection. The Italian restaurant seemed the best choice but the marinara sauce was weak. I looked for a room service menu but not kept in room and couldn't access menu on hotel tv. It seemed too difficult to bother with. Best bet: walk down Ashford St 100 feet to the Mexican Hacienda. The food was fantastic and awesome view. The Beach and Pools: B+. Shared beach with public and really enjoyed it. It seemed great to share the space and interact with locals. Beach is large enough for need and several other public beaches are within very easy walk down Ashford St. All beaches are mostly sand. Pools are private and very well maintained. The Sites: DON'T TAKE A CAB. Outside hotel is Bus Stop (PARADA) and take B21 bus into Old San Juan. cost is 75 cents and very safe. See El Yunque Rainforest, All of Old San Juan, local beaches The Housekeeping Cleaners: A+ Enough said, be sure to tip. The Housekeeping managers: C-. I called 3x for a light bulb replacement in the bathroom and to get a lighting panel fixed on light fixed on side of bed. Next day a mismatched light bulb showed up when i asked house cleaner directly and no one ever came by to fix light panel. Is this a big deal? No, but its not the problems, its the response to the problem that people remember. I prepare to leave feeling that although the Condado Hotel and Casino has what it takes to be 4-5 stars I wonder if they are committed to providing that level of service. The Bars: B-. Friendly staff but as long as bar drinks are $9 for a simple vodka tonic, people should buy liquor and mixers at the nearby corner store and save possibly a couple hundred dollars. Seriously, it's worth doing. The Bill: B+. Check your bill as I had extra fees to remove regarding valet parking when no one visited and I didn't have a car. Overall cost was ok as I travel alot and adjusted quickly. I would return since i know the ins and outs of the hotel and what and what not to pay for.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: kevip
Reviews.Content: Loved the hotel.. nice, clean.. Casino was cheap to gamble.. 5 dollar mins for blackjack and other table games.. and Roulette only 2 dollar.. even for outside bets.. Hotel room was big, nice balcony with very nice city view.. 9th floor..#907 no need for the ocean view rooms as this room overlooked downtown San Juan and the small bay.. bathroom was very large, nice shower in the middle, plenty of space for all our clothes and everything else.. coffee maker, fridge, safe.. ice machine just outside our room.. I really have no complaints at all besides the costs.. inroom movies were a bit pricey at 15 dollars a piece.. we ate at the hotel a couple of times.. the Italian restaurant was not bad and the steak house was excellent.. but a bit pricey.. parking for overnight at the hotel was 15 a day so not bad.. hotel has small beach which is not to bad.. went to several beaches outside San Juan and they werent any better than the small private beach at the hotel... Hotel is non smoking property so if you smoke you have to leave and go outside or smoke from your balcony.. no smoking in the Casino.. no complaints with this and I am a smoker.. Anyway hotel is very modern.. very close to south beach type hotel.. there is a deserted building next door to the hotel.. not sure why.. but didnt distract from the area.. hotel is on the rich area on a strip with pricey shops and overpriced restuarants.. Old San Juan is about a 10 minute drive across the bay.. so hotel is in a pretty good location.. a bit tricky to get there from the airport as our directions were terrible but after a day of driving around we figured out all the streets, its real helpful if you know spanish.. all street signs are in spanish and most people speak spanish, unless you are in the resort or tourist areas.. where most also speak english, not a problem for us as I speak spanish but if you dont.. you might want to study a bit before your trip to PR.. one thing I underestimated about PR is the size of the island.. its huge.. so plan your day trips wisely as it can take hours of driving to get places.. its at least an hours drive to the ferry station for the other islands.. all in all I would stay in this hotel again.. the pics of their web site are pretty accurate of the rooms and amenties.. We only visited the east part of the island and Vieques island for one day so looking forward to another trip there and seeing the west and south side and Culebra.. plan for a night or two if you want to go to the other islands.. a quick day trip that we did was not worth it.. you need more time than a day trip.. also no motorcycle rentals on Vieques as for some reason its not available anymore.. I think something about insurance or some accident there so it was discountinued when we were there.. the taxis at the ferry station arent really good as they really only want to take you to one close beach.. so staying a night or two there is better so you can go to better beaches.. Esperanza beach is not that great which is where the taxis want to take you... Other than that.. I recommend this hotel.. nice comfy beds.. free internet.. hope this helps if your thinking of staying here..

Reviews.Title: “Not a good experience overall”
Reviews.Author: tp77
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel in December 2008 for one night. Pros: Contemporary looking inside, nice pool area Cons: - Bathrooms are tiny!! To open the shower door you have to step outside the bathroom or to sit on the toilet. - "Resort fee", which is quite steep, included the use of chairs on the beach but you have to pay extra to use umbrellas. Ridiculous. - There was a private party right under our windows. When we checked in we were assured that the party won't last all night. They meant it, it only lasted until 2 AM. We traveled with an infant, so loud music until 2 AM was NO fun for us. The only thing that the hotel manager did for us is he asked the musicians to tone it down, which did not help much. - Internet (included in the "resort fee") did not work in our room or in the room of my parents. We were given keys to two other empty rooms on our floor, but it didn't work there either. Using internet in the business center came at an extra cost and it took a long time to find an employee who could help us at the business center. Overall, for a "luxury hotel" (as they call themselves) this was a pretty bad experience. Will never stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Great view”
Reviews.Author: insOma
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a lot more contemporary on the inside that it looks from the street. There's an awesome reef aquarium in the front lobby, and my check in was quick and easy. I wasn't expecting an ocean view room, so I was pleasantly surprised to walk into my room on the 9th floor and see the ocean. My room had a nice balcony with a couple chairs and a table, and on my last night I left the patio door open and loved the sound of the waves breaking as I went to sleep. The room was a little small, and the furniture is more hip than practical, but there was a decent flat screen TV and the bed was comfortable enough. I didn't do more than pass by the casino, but it looked popular enough, and the bar downstairs was decent and opens onto a big patio overlooking the ocean. The Starbucks right outside was useful in the mornings.

Reviews.Title: “Condado really nice”
Reviews.Author: goldbond
Reviews.Content: My husband and I traveled to Puerto Rico on December 8th and it was great the people at the Condado Casino Plaza Resort Hotel was absolutely wonderful and friendly.The hotel food and shopping is over priced but thats the way it is.Be sure to travel down to Old San Juan you will have a ball.Any and everything is there.Shopping restaurants site seeing and definately make sure you go to the CORNE Port Royal cholatier Vanessa Cathy wer absolutely fabulous. The hotel was clean the pools were nice the gym was ok the beach was breath taking. We stayed in the Ocean View room gorgeous. We will definately be going back as a family.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: MUSTANG SALLY02
Reviews.Content: Stayed at theCondado Plaza Hotel & Casino, for the week of Dec. 5th. 2008 Have been there two times before. This time we were there to celebrate our Anniversary. The Hotel, has undergone alot of changes.. but afew things were overlooked. Our room was lovely, and they upgraded us to a full ocean view. While the view was great, the food at the Hotel, was very expensive. The portions were small, and left us, wondering if the portions were for "children", instead of adults. Breakfast was good.. but averaged approximately $35.00 ( including the tip) A drink at the pool, ran $8.50 to $9.00 each.. There was no extras.. and everything, had a high price. I must admit.. the service was very good. The staff were very friendly. The outside area's need alot of improvement.. like the jacuzzi, with only 1 jet working.. The tiles around the pool, are showing alot of wear. The grounds, are kept in prestine condition, and the workers are at it.. all day long, and it shows. There are little to no activites, to motivate the crowd.. They don't announce anything that may be going on. You have to check at the Towel Hut.. to see if anyhting is going on. That's if.. the newsletter is printed and ready to be distrubted. We would NOT return to the Condado Plaza in the future, unless there are CHANGES made. It's expensive, and we felt.. we did not get our monies worth. We would like to give a "special" HELLO, to Michelle, the waitress at the Pool Bar.. She was wonderful, and very attentive, to our needs. And, also, Jose Gonzalez, the Security Manager, who helped us clear up an issue with one of the security guards. Our problem, was resolved.. quickly, and with professionlism. Maybe.. in time, if all the changes are made, this Hotel, will be a 4 star.. but at the moment.. it's NOT.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden costs...BEWARE!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: majole1107
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Condado Plaza in October 2008, as part of a conference. The hotel was lovely. The location fantastic. The front desk staff very friendly and helpful - some of the concierge staff, less so. House-keeping was good - although a maid entered my room while I was sleeping at just after 7.00am...and didn't apologize. Rooms were very nice. Internet connection was frustrating and inconsistent. In fact, everything was pretty good...only one serious concern. BEWARE the hidden charges!!! The housekeeping, taxes, gratuity, etc are all stated before I arrived, so I knew I was in for that. The charge that took me by surprise was...from check in, they held an ADDITIONAL US$100 per day (!!!!) in case of goodness knows what! This was not mentioned, or explained at any point during my stay. I stayed for over a week, just after the Global Financial Crisis hit - so my domestic currency (I'm not from the US) was taking a battering. As such, this additional charge amounted to almost $1,500.00 (in my local currency). They put a hold on this amount, which maxed out my credit card - because they also had a hold on my regular room costs. So, while I thought I had plenty of credit available, all of a sudden I didn't. This also happened to a colleague who was also attending the conference and staying in another room. In fact, if she hadn't enquired about this, then neither of us would've known about this use of our money. I travel quite extensively and have NEVER had this kind of charge added to a room EVER! It appears to be a very dodgy practice - especially considering there is NO mini-bar in the room. So goodness knows what they expect the US$100/day is to cover!!!! Apart from this, it's a good hotel and a good place to stay....but I'm not sure I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Amiable Stay at Condado Plaza”
Reviews.Author: Sapper123
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Condado Plaza for four nights in early Dec 2008. We had a large room with a nice, unobstructed view of the lagoon. Unlike other reviews, I found the reception/front desk friendly and professional. Did not eat at any of the hotel's restaurants, but there are many. Pools are nice, but the beach area is small and, upon entering the water, rather rocky. The water is calm though since you are more in a lagoon rather than the Atlantic. There are also some bridge repairs taking place adjacent to the beach and if they are driving piles for the bridge's foundation, then it can be noisy. Close to Old San Juan and other hotels/boutiques (Cartier, Gucci) on the Condado strip. Housekeeping was efficient, but not necessarily all encompasing. Bellman service was also polite and quick, but missed little things (i.e. placing luggage on luggage stand). Efficiency wise, if you self park, you have to validate the parking ticket everytime you go out. Wish they would just provide you with a special ticket that allows you to come and go as you please without having to waste time validating a ticket. Also, be aware of resort fees, island taxes, and city taxes. They will likely make up about 25-30% of your final bill.

Reviews.Title: “Simply the best”
Reviews.Author: Saamson
Reviews.Content: As I write this, I am sitting in my ocean front room at this wonderful hotel on Nov 21, 2008. I just want to let everyone know that this hotel is the best hotel I have ever stayed at. The rooms are exceptionally clean and decorated with a beautiful modern decor. The bathroom has to be one of the nicest bathrooms I have ever seen anywhere, let alone a hotel room. There is a shower right in the middle of the bathroom that is all encased in a glass enclosure which is a set up I will be copying in my own master bathroom. Even the toiletries that are provided are of top notch quality and comparable to any expensive brand name. And to boot, the cleaning service takes the time to clean your room thoroughly and carefully place items that are out of place back to where they should be. Simply put, you must see the room for yourself to really get an appreciation of the focus on detail that was put into the decoration and set up of the entire room. As for the rest hotel, it just keeps getting better. In the lobby level there is a bar that just isn't a simple old bar. It's comparable to some of the nicest bars/clubs that I've seen over in South Beach. The bartender that was on duty that night (monday) was a guy named Lance who was everything you would like to see in a resort bartender; funny, knowledgeable of the area and other vacation spots in the world, and his personality simply just made our night. I believe he said he was just getting back in to bar tending and working just one night that week. If I were the manager of that bar, I would hire him on a permanent basis in a heartbeat. And if you don't want to be inside and listen to the music that is playing, there is an expansive covered porch area facing the ocean where you have the freedom to walk around and sit wherever you please. Now for the pool area...There are 2 different pools. One huge 3 foot deep pool that wraps around the building with lights that change colors during the evening, and full bar that serves the pool with wait staff that will bring you your drink or food right to you with the nicest similes and personality in the world, and to boot has a volleyball net and a very slick water slide that my wife seemed to taken a loving too. The food is very reasonably priced and very good. Then there is a 6 foot deep salt water pool !!! As for the beach, it is somewhat of a lagoon set up that is protected by large rocks roughly 400 feet away from the beach so that the waves aren't too hard to handle and anyone (including my wife who can't swim) can enjoy the ocean water safely. Going back to the wait staff, we ordered food by the pool and asked them if it would be ok to eat the food by our chairs on the beach. They smiled and said not only can you eat there we will bring the food out to you. I was floored. And again, it gets better. We looked over to a gazebo by the right side of the beach and saw a guy standing there with what looked like a massage station. My wife and I walked over and asked the gentleman what we did, and he said he was a massage therapist. Well when we heard that, we absolutely had to take advantage of that. My wife went first and then me 2nd. Just think to yourself... You're getting a massage from a professional, under a gazebo over looking the ocean, with the sounds of the Caribbean all around you. It just doesn't get any better than that. Once we went back into the ocean we ran into a few other people who were also from NJ. Everyone one of them were also impressed with the place and had perma smiles on their faces. The experience just keeps getting better and better. I can't comment on the Casino because I don't gamble, but if the casino is anything like the rest of the hotel it just has to be another enjoyable part of the place. All in all I have to say that if you're looking forward to booking a trip to Puerto Rico, you must stay at the Condado. The Ritz, La Concha and Condado Plaza are the 3 gems of San Juan. The people who left negative reviews about this place have to be the types of people who complain no matter where they go even if they stay at the Waldorf in NYC because there is no way a hotel can do any better that what Condado has done for my wife, me and my friends this past week. The Condado and it's staff have given us memories that will certainly last us a lifetime. If you have any further questions about my simply remarkable experience in San Juan and my stay at the Condado, please feel free to email me at saamson@gmail.com. I will more that glad to help you with your trip.

Reviews.Title: “Some highs, some lows”
Reviews.Author: GordonPsy
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Condado as part of a conference. First the good parts: it is a handsome hotel and very close to a bus stop for cheap access to Viejo San Juan. The staff was generally accomodating, and housekeeping was the most efficient I have ever encountered. Now the lows: the price quoted doesn't include a 14% "resort fee," a porterage fee (as if you wouldn't tip the bellman!), a maid fee (as if you wouldn't tip), and, naturally, various taxes. The resort fee, in particular, is a way to hide the true cost of the rooms. Ours was nicely remodeled, although the bathroom was very small, and our room was especially noisy. Food at the pool area was very high priced, even for a resort, as were drink prices. The wireless internet access was intermittent and frustrating. All in all, I have to admit I was disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “First Impresion at Front Desk was the Worst”
Reviews.Author: jrdrig
Reviews.Content: On November 8, 2008 we arrived to the Condado Plaza around 6:15PM. My friend began the check-in process for a niece who is a soprano who needed to stay in a quiet place that night. Then my friend introduced herself to the front desk person who was assisting the guests at the moment. The gentleman at the front desk started the usual check-in procedure. After he finished the process and charged my friend's credit card he surprinsingly told us that the room was not ready yet (check-in time is 4:00PM). Also for our surprise the gentleman at the front desk could not provide us any alternatives at that moment neither the other front desk lady who was listening to our conversation. After my friend demanded to talk with the front desk manager, the gentleman disappeared from the front desk. When the manager show up, she was the person who assisted my friend and upgraded the room to a junior suite. I should say that we are local professionals who usually use certain hotels in Puerto Rico for business partners who comes from the states. We have noted that when it comes to service to local tourists, the Condado Plaza has another rule for treating us. It is a kind of a "gentle-cynical-roughness" that from our perception does not contribute to a pleasant stay. Condado Plaza should improve the lack of proactiveness from the front desk personnel because it was and it will be the cause for incidents like ours. None of the front desk persons said anything about not having the room ready nor they provided any alternatives. They were just there like two inactive bodies occupying a tridimensional space. We would also like to recommend Condado Plaza to radically change their anti-local tourism policy. This is not good during these recession days. The hotel has been beatifully renewed. However, all that beauty was not enough to change the way we felt after the incident. From our side we will not recommend this hotel to our business partners. We do not want our business partners to take the incorrect impression of Puerto Rico just by staying at the Condado Plaza.

Reviews.Title: “I'd give the Condado a C+”
Reviews.Author: Sigs11
Reviews.Content: I recently returned from a 3-day stay at the Condado with my girlfriend & another couple. The hotel itself is nice, clean, and stylish. I'll start with the overall Positives, and then I will give you the Negatives... Positives: - the room itself was very nice and large. The ocean view has a GREAT view... you wake up in your bed and you are looking right out onto the water. The room was stylish and had a unique look to it. The color scheme, the shower, etc.... all very unique. - The room was cleaned in a timely fashion. - Room service was solid. The breakfast was good, came on time, and was not too expensive. - The balcony in the room looking over the water was great. - The pool / hot tub area is beautiful, and fairly large. I never felt like I was struggling to get a lounge chair. The hammocks are a nice touch. - The outdoor restaurant was pretty good. Nice location, good food. - The restaurants in the hotel are very good, especially the Strip House Steakhouse. It is very pricey (similar to New York City prices) but it is worth it. The food is excellent, the service is superb, and the overall atmosphere is great. We had a table overlooking the ocean which was a nice touch. If you want to spend $200 on a romantic dinner for two, I'd recommend the Strip House. The Italian restaurant on the mezzanine level is good too. We had breakfast and lunch there and the food is very good and reasonably priced. - The casino had $2 minimums for roulette... always a good thing. - The bar/lounge areas are lively, energetic, and fun. Negatives: - There are literally like 3 elevators in the entire hotel. We found ourselves waiting 5-10 minutes for a hotel at times. Not fun, especially being an impatient New Yorker. - There is minimal service at the Front Desk, which makes for long lines and more impatience on my part - Service overall was rude. The bellhop that greeted us and took our luggage to our room was very nice and very friendly. However, the employees working the front desk, casino and pool area are very rude. - Communication between the hotel and guests stinks... for example, we were looking for the Tony Roma restaurant in the hotel for about 15 minutes until we asked an employee and realized that it no longer existed. The same thing happened when we were looking to buy gelato. They have a big sign out near the pool area that says "Gelato". When we went over to buy some, we could not find it. It was not until we asked an employee that we were told there was no gelato. Just overall disappointing... - The biggest disappointment of all was the "beach" area. I have been to some beautiful beaches in Puerto Rico, but this is not one of them. The beach is small, dirty, and the view is one that looks onto the nearby highway and construction sites. Not very relaxing at all, and VERY disappointing. I don't want to be sitting on a beach with a Corona and looking out onto a busy highway and construction site. Condado needs to do something to change the atmosphere there or just eliminate the beach all together. It was just plain ugly. - The casino was disappointing. Despite the low table minimums, the dealers were rude, and the games were questionable. While playing roulette, there were roughly TEN instances where the ball left the roulette wheel completely... and another 4 or 5 instances where the ball rolled along the edge of the numbers for 45 - 60 seconds before finally falling into a number. I've played roulette in many casinos and I've never seen the equipment THAT disfunctional or suspicious. The dealers didn't act like this was anything out of the ordinary. Either get some new equipment or get your staff to be a little more customer service oriented. Who wants to gamble when it seems like you're possibly being cheated out of a fair chance to win????? Not to suggest that the casino was rigging the games, because I am sure they were not... but when I left the casino after two hours I just had a bad taste in my mouth. Overall the Condado was a nice hotel with some good and some bad. Although I loved the room, the restaurants, and the pool area, I don't think I would stay there again unless there were some major upgrades to the hotel & staff.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful location in need of customer relations 101”
Reviews.Author: SJrocks
Reviews.Content: The hotel has outstanding outside facilities and a magnificent view. However, from the time I walked in, I missed the classic look it used to have before the so called remodeling. I agree a 100% with the person who spoke about "the locals" at the Casino. It used to be a very formal and elegant place. Now it is a hang out for the elderly and the lonely. I totally dislike the informal atmosphere and found it amazing that in today's economy, the majority of the people playing were women and elderly. It depressed me to walk through it. The "remodeling" has given the hotel a cheap look. The rooms are large and nice, but they need maintenance badly. Doors to the balcony do not lock or open easily; there is no electricity in some outlets, the phones do not work and by the way we also delt with the elevator problem-the back elevator was out of service twice for the 5 days and 4 nights we were there. The concierge desk is the biggest joke of the whole place. The guys who open the door for guest hide behind it pretending to be polishing luggage cars, while the ladies chat on the phone. We approached it several times and none stop talking or hang up to help us, one even threw her cell phone under the table! I also agree that the information and knowledge changed depending on who was there. Transportation is a pain, hard to get, expensive for a short distance to Old San Juan and I believe it should be a service to the guest. The italian restaurant indeed had great food and good portions, lousy service. The guys all looked tired or mad to be there?!?! Only Mr. Neumann, Jesus in security and Iris at the gift shop made me/us feel welcome and provided us with great-outstanding customer service. Again, I agree with what I read, if you only want a great bed to rest and the ocean and pools to enjoy the sun and sound of the waves daily-then this is it; but if you appreciate service and a desire to help the tourist so you go back, forget it! No perks, no coupons, no hotel transportation to and from airport and no transportation to Old San Juan at all-ridiculous and poor PR for the hotel. Guest relations manager needs to sell his hotel better and train staff to be corteous and NEVER argue or questioned a guest.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay at the Condado Plaza”
Reviews.Author: mosquitomagnet
Reviews.Content: We were at the Condado Plaza from October 22-26th. We really enjoyed our stay. We had a mini-suite on the lagoon side with a partial ocean view across the street. The room was clean and had everything you could ask for. We appreciated the big refrigerator. The fitness center is very nice and we made good use of it. The pool on the lagoon side was closed during our stay. They were filming a George Clooney movie. Others saw him but we did not. Rats!
