We usually sat by the big pool with the slide and spent time on the beach. The beach isn't very big but it is nice and the water is calm due to big rocks which were put there to break the big waves. There are many restaurants within walking distance on Ashford Ave. If you're out and about after dark watch your step! There are many "holes" and curbs that are easy to trip over. I rolled my ankle on a small curb and fell. Now I have a large abraision on my leg as a souvenier. We rented a car from Dollar. I was excited that I found a good deal and apparently so did many other people. The agency is off the airport property so we took a shuttle and then there was a long line to get the car. It took us over an hour to pick up the car. In hindsight we would not rent a car again unless we plan to spend the majority of the trip outside of San Juan. Driving is a challenge in San Juan since the roads/highways are not clearly marked. We saw a lot more of the city than we planned to. We drove to El Yungue and enjoyed hiking some of the trails. We did get lost on the way but eventually found it. The weather was perfect and the people were very friendly. We would go back to PR to explore the rest of the island.

Reviews.Title: “Overall enjoyable stay at the hotel”
Reviews.Author: aescott
Reviews.Content: This was my second extended stay (5-7 days) at the Condado Plaza. The hotel has completed the renovations that I encountered during my first stay. I had no problem checking in since it was close to the 4pm check in time. My room overlooked the bay which was nice since I did not have to look at the traffic down below. The hotel staff was attentive to my needs and requests. Upon checking in, I noted that 2 light bulbs were missing. They sent someone up within 10 minutes after reporting it to the front desk. However, the iron was missing and after waiting 30 minutes for an iron to come up, I had to leave without pressing my shirt. While I was out, they did leave an iron for me. I was on government business so I was able to get a government rate. If you are traveling on official government business, I would recommend contacting the Puerto Rican Tourism Board to obtain authorization for the tax exemption. The hotel provided me the contact information so be sure to ask them. They included a food voucher equal to $7.00 which could be used in any of the hotel restaurants. I recommend having the breakfast in the Gusto Di Italia at least once. The portions are huge and filling. After the first day, I decided to eat a lighter breakfast during my stay. To work off the calories from the big meal, I hit the gym. While many hotels say they have a "fitness center" which could be an old treadmill and stationary bike, the Condado is one of the best I've seen at a hotel. The equipment includes about 5 treadmills (LifeFitness) that includes an individual TV on each treadmill, a couple of bikes and some weights. There are also 2 sauna rooms and plenty of towels. There is a pool on both sides of the hotel. The only drawbacks that I found so far would be the noise. I stayed on the 5th floor and could hear music up until 10-11 pm. I could also hear my next door neighbors several times. It wasn't annoying, but it shows that the walls are thin. The bathroom was nice, but kind of cramped when getting in and out of the shower. The main issue that I had and which I read many negative comments on would be the elevators. More often than not there was only one elevator working. My concern would be if there was a fire and the guests would have to evacuate. One of the exits only goes down to the 3rd floor which you would have to exit and go to the other end of the corridor to get to the Mezzanine or Lobby floor. Overall, I would recommend this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Stylish Stay in Puerto Rico”
Reviews.Author: carleegirl74
Reviews.Content: I was invited to Puerto Rico to stay (for free!) at Condado Plaza with a friend who was there for work. My opinion of the place may be a bit biased since I didn't have to pay... but it was an exceptionally nice hotel. It definitely has a Puerto Rican flair. Our room was clean and comfortable, but nothing extraordinary. The shower had GREAT water pressure, and was nice and hot. Very important on a vacation, I think. The casino was a decent size, though we didn't really gamble while we were there (too many places to go in PR!). I will say our afternoon in the pool area was really nice. They have a small beach near the pool area, that is a public beach, so there were a few locals milling around, but it was not unsafe or anything. The locals we met in PR were all fantastic. The pool area has 2 pools, a saltwater pool and a chlorine pool with a pool bar and water slide. The Pina Coladas were mind blowing. I personally think the Condado is a nice hotel, and a good location if traveling to PR for business or for fun. Kids might get bored after a day or two.

Reviews.Title: “very rude”
Reviews.Author: TexasLongtime
Reviews.Content: San Juan is a busy City, We were their at the condado For 20 days, the room was nice, but, everything is very Costly, Also we had are truck broken into, The secure garage is not very secure, it happen twice . garage manager was very rude The beach is actually a public beach Very dangerous at night, Very expensive, If your looking for The single ife this is your hotel, Rooms are nice, everything . Bring lots of money if you are going to Stay here,

Reviews.Title: “Hidden Fees, Not As Clean As I Imagined”
Reviews.Author: jpd21
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel with my family for 4 nights, when we got there...one of the bedsheets had a blood stain on it...and you would figure for the price they charge they would be on top of that. They notified us of the ridiculous fee of 5 dollars per person per night on top of the fact that we had already paid for our stay there. The remote control did not work..the t.v. had poor reception, the decor of the room was nice but i was not too happy that the closet was inside the bathroom where i was to hang my clothes it defineatly needed more closet space...the pool and the view was nice...the parking fee was ridiculous $16 dollars per night. We wound up spending money that we should of spend enjoying our trip in p.r....overall its better to stay elsewhere

Reviews.Title: “I'll be back, again and again...”
Reviews.Author: BlueWhirl
Reviews.Content: Kudos to the interior designer for this hotel. I'm charmed everywhere I go. Love the vibrant passion-red theme of my city-view room (which being on the 10th floor has floor-to-ceiling window instead of a balcony). Love the glass shower and spacious bathroom. The numerous pools are more than adequate. The 24 hour gym has functional new equipment. The location is also great. There's free buses to old San Juan. 10 mins walk to Condado beach. There also an Enterprise car rental on site.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: Eve76
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed four nights at the Condado Plaza, and we had a great time. The hotel is beautiful for a boutique hotel and nicely renovated. We stayed at an Ocean Vista with a beautiful ocean view. The staff is very friendly, rooms are clean, and the pools nice and big. We did most of our dining outside of the hotel, but did try the sushi place and the hotel's pool bar. Both good, but the pool bar a bit overpriced, especially the drinks at $10 each. The hotel is walking distance to many restaurants, and Gucci/Dior etc. shopping. Old San Juan is a 5 min. cab ride, but definitely too far to walk. There is a city bus that runs free, but after waiting once for one for 40 min. we gave up and ended up taking a cab. Cab runs $15. Old San Juan is beautiful and definitely worth seeing. We felt very safe everywhere we went. It seems that the Police is stationed on every corner everywhere. Overall, we had a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel with TONS OF HIDDEN Fees”
Reviews.Author: amitw
Reviews.Content: Just returned for a short trip to Puerto Rico. Its a nice hotel with a very good location. There is a tiny beach which is in front of the lagoon. I booked my stay through the hotel website which said a $50 REsort credit. I have contacted Customer Service which by the way is Super Slow to respond. Not seen the Credit yet. Also, there are a lot of Hidden Charges. There is a Casino on the 2nd floor of the hotel which is really small and frankly would "Just Qualify" for a casino. There are two swimming pools in the two towers; I took the Lagoon view which was not really worth it. If you want to stay here, take the Ocean View which is the most expensive; otherwise its not worth staying here. BEWARE: The hotel charges a lot of Hidden Fees; besides the Taxes there are some Hotel Charges which they charge you for the Internet; which did not work; there is a Business Center where you can use the Internet. The Fine Print says that you have access to the Business Center; some fees may apply. Basically this means that you can sit in the Business Center but have to pay for everything that you do there. Its about $10 or so for first 5 mins of Internet (Did I mention that they already charge you for the Internet in the Hotel Charges Section- which does not work?) The overall hotel charges come to about 31% of the actual room rate. I think this was a little outrageous. Also, Room Service is horrible. I called for a meal; they never even bothered to show up for 1 hr and 20 mins; after which we basically left the room. The good things about this place is: Pool; Tiny Beach, location of the place. You pay for everything else including parking $22/day, Internet.

Reviews.Title: “Stylish hotel/resort but a little far from everything”
Reviews.Author: whereswaugh
Reviews.Content: The Condado Plaza Hotel is very stylish and the photos on Expedia and from reviewers on this site are for the most part accurate depictions of what you get. Our room was spacious and we had a view of the bay from a corner window. The bathroom was huge and although we stayed only one night we felt that this room would be plenty comfortable for a longer stay. There are several pools and a beach area that was very nice as well as private spots available for rent. The only negatives are: Location - if you do not have your own car it is a $15 taxi ride each way into Old San Juan...a drive that took less that 10 minutes and seemed overpriced to us. There is a bus stop outside the property but since we were there on a Sunday the hotel staff told us the schedule of buses was unpredictable. We could only find 2 restaurants outside of the hotel in walking distance - a Mexican restaurant and a Cuban/Puerto Rican restaurant that was only open for dinner. Food at both were OK and generally pricey for what we got. If there were other choices available outside of the hotel in walking distance the conceirge staff was unaware of them or unwilling to give us additional information. Concierge/Tour Booking - very disorganized!!! Different person with different information every time we went to the desk. We were first told that the tours they book are the same price as if we were to book directly on our own, but when we booked with another person we were charged a higher price. I don't mind that the hotel makes their commission for providing a booking service, but everyone working that desk should be able to explain that to customers. We had plenty of time to try and do it on our own had we known we were going to be charged a higher fee, but by the time the tour actually got booked it was too late for us to do any arrangements of our own.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, service, so-so...”
Reviews.Author: love2traveltogether
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently returned from a 2 night stay at the Condado Plaza Hotel and Casino. We stayed at the hotel prior to our cruise. I have been going to Puerto Rico all of my life (37 years) and it is my favorite place in the world. We had visited San Juan last year and stayed at the Caribe Hilton. When we were visiting last year we went by the Condado Plaza Hotel and Casino and had seen all of the renovations. We knew we were going to come back in 2008 and noted it as a place to stay. Upon our arrival we were met with a very long line for check in. There was actually only 1 person at the check in desk upon our arrival but slowly more people started to help out. We waited about 20 minutes and then we were assisted. We were told that the only ocean view rooms that were available had 2 Queen beds as opposed to the 1 King bed we had requested. We said it was o.k. and were given our key to room #842. The room was perfect. The renovations of both the lobby and the rooms are great. We had a great balcony with a perfect view of the ocean. The bathroom was really nice and everything was very clean. The beds were also very comfortable and after our first night we both noted what a great, restful sleep we had. We visited the casino and had a good time. Ate breakfast both mornings at the Gusto D'Italia Restaurant. The food was very good and plentiful, the service not so great. The waiter was not overly friendly and we had to ask for things more than once. We had ice cream in the Gusto D'Italia one night and the ice cream attendant was very nice. The bar was also very nice and they make a great Pina Colada. The beach area is very small and was quite shaded so we opted to sit by the rock wall on the side of the hotel. It was extremely peaceful and the sound of the waves was wonderful. The elevators, I have to say, were very quick. I had read on several reviews about how slow they were but we did not find this to be a problem. Our biggest complaint was when we called down to the desk and asked for 2 more towels and 2 wash cloths as they had not been replenished by the room attendant the day before. What they brought us was 1 towel and when my husband explained that we needed 1 more towel and 2 wash cloths was told they would be coming right away. After an hour had passed, and they still had not arrived, my husband called the front desk and was told that they are very busy and were not sure when they could get them to us. This for us was a big turn off as a hotel of this caliber should have stocked the towels in the room to begin with and then they should have definitely brought us what we requested but then to be told they are too busy, that was not right. Fortunately this was our only complaint and hope to visit the Condado Plaza Hotel and Casino again in the very near future. All in all, we would highly recommend a stay at the Condado Plaza Hotel and Casino.

Reviews.Title: “Great Rooms”
Reviews.Author: RubenV76
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 4 days in September for my 11yr Anniversary and I was amazed at the transformation of the hotel. The hotel management named Henry Neuman not only was he friendly and attentive he was extremely professional and very handsome. This gentleman made sure my entire stay was comfortable and relaxing and never has an hotel employee made my stay this welcoming. I have to thank Condado Plaza for the great experience and for making it a memorable one so far of the 4yrs I have come to visit their hotel every year.

Reviews.Title: “Magnificent Property Marred by Terrible Service”
Reviews.Author: KipNYC
Reviews.Content: Every physical aspect of the Condado is visually fresh and aesthetically pleasing. The lobby, room (city view), pool area and even casino are all a joy. The cubicle shower is a curious (i.e., fun) experience (door leaks a bit though). Balconies are always nice. The three pools (fresh water, salt water, hot tub) are all in great shape, and who isn't tempted by the swim-up bar? No-password wi-fi not only in the rooms but throughout the property. Unfortunately, the act of actually staying at the resort becomes a task rather than an experience. Here's the rundown: --For most of my stay only one of the three elevators was operating (this is the second hotel in a row where I've seen this -- trying to cut electricity costs?). A ten-story property cannot have only one working elevator; it's simply not an option. --The tour desk is an absolute disaster. They only book their own tours (the Condado is part of a local chain). My tour for the first day was rained out, and the lady who tried to reschedule couldn't confirm what was being offered when and assured me that someone would get back to me by 9PM (for a tour at 8AM the next morning). Sure enough, the next morning nobody knew anything about anything. Bottom line: In three full days they couldn't schedule a single tour for me. If you can make alternative arrangements (Gray Line, etc.) do so. --My last full day I returned to my room about 1PM after swimming. There was only one housekeeper on the entire floor, and she was sitting in a room watching television! I came back at 4:40PM and my room STILL wasn't made. I had stuff to do and told them not to bother. --Ordered a Heineken at the pool, and then watched for ten minutes while the waitress chit-chatted with the bartender. Got up and left. --Had a casino dealer more interested in the baseball game on the screen rather than actually dealing. Very annoying. (On a side note, a lot of local trash gamble in the Condado's casino. Don't expect a "Vegas business convention" atmosphere.) My guess is that the bigger chains skim off the best staff and the Condado has to settle for second-tier employees. Bottom Line: If you're a low-maintenance, laid-back sort of traveler (and this is a beach resort, after all), then the Condado will probably do you just fine. But if good service is an important part of your vacation experience, then be sure to explore other options. One last point: Be sure to book directly through the hotel (their website is easy to Google). They have several packages that might not show up on Expedia or Travelocity. In my case it was the "Fourth Night Free" deal.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful and Convenient”
Reviews.Author: coethiel
Reviews.Content: The rooms were great with a great view. They were very stylish and clean. Stupid, but the shampoo and conditioner were actually something I liked using. The staff was helpful and pleasant. The bars, pools, restaurants were good. Be warned the prices were off the chart... I recommend going into Old San Juan to eat or drink anything. The Condado is right on the buss line to Old San Juan. The casino was not crowded and you could always get a machine or a table. The bar was was hip and had a young and beautiful crowd. There were always chairs and space around the pool. The price for our stay was very reasonable; we paid about $111 a night after getting the 4th night free I plan to return.

Reviews.Title: “Not all it's cracked up to be”
Reviews.Author: kathymtiru
Reviews.Content: Let me start by saying it is a beautiful resort on a wonderous island. However, when we got there we noticed quite a few things. The check in was obscenely long. When we finally got to the room which as supposed to be the family suite we were literally on top of eachother it was so small. This was reluctantly remedied by Henry, the manger on duty the next day. I was then given a key to a room that was not programed to my new room. There were insufficient supplies in the room for it being a family suite and all. The hotel employees, with the exception of Sammy at the AquaGrill lack customer service skills something terrible. My rental car was damaged in the underground hotel parking lot where there are no security cameras. My thought was that someone had to have been inebriated and backed in to it without a care in the world. There are hidden costs for everything. Although you pay a resort tax this doesn't include use of the tennis court without an additional fee nor does it include the $5 pp/per night, regardless of age, room fee to name few. We never mind spending the money. After all, we are on vacation. It's when it is by surprise and with an attitude that even us NY'ers wouldn't dream of excercising that it becomes discouraging.

Reviews.Title: “A Bit Overrated.”
Reviews.Author: Mmerose
Reviews.Content: Rooms, lobby and hotel were attractive, but we had several problems, such as our room not being ready for an hour and a half past check-in time. Also, our balcony had a huge electric cable swinging free across one corner of it which didn't exactly make for a pristine ocean view. Both of the bathroom's electrical outlets did not work, so I had to dry my hair in the bedroom, plus the shower exuded a strong septic smell every time it was used. The final straw, though, was the horribly leaky shower that released a stream of water across the bathroom floor each time one of us showered. This leak caused my husband to fall, which then led to us changing rooms. Good points: the pool, overall cleanliness, and the pool bar.

Reviews.Title: “"An Extremely Disappointing Experience"”
Reviews.Author: NY1PR2007
Reviews.Content: Where do I beging? First let me just say that originally I had booked a reservation to stay at this hotel for 9 days instead of the two days that I lasted with my family at this hotel.The original comfirmed reservation was to have taken place from Friday August 15 to Sunday August 24,2008 Back in May this year I was considering going back to Puerto Rico for a longer stay than the 6 days I stood at the San Juan Marriott Resort and Stellaris Casino in the Condado area last year in October. We had such a great time specially at the Marriott that I wrote a beautiful review about the Hotel here on Tripadvisor and in the review I had stated that if we will ever go back to Puerto Rico this will be the hotel that we will go back to. I made a decision back in May this year to at least try another hotel just to see how good other hotels may fair against the Marriott. That is why after reading so many reviews about the Condado Plaza Hotel and Casino(some good ones and some bad ones) I felt that the good ones were more than enough to make me want to stay at this Hotel. !HUGE MISTAKE! When I made the reservation through the hotel's website and obtaining my confirmation #, right away I placed a call to the Hotel directly from NY just to make sure that everything was as schedule specially confirming my request of an Ocean Vista Room, High Floor and most of all a room with "TWO BEDS" since I was traveling with my lovely girlfriend and my adorable 12 year old daughter. After talking to an agent from the hotel she assured me that everything will be as scheduled. She told me that upon my arrival to the Hotel there will be an Ocean Vista Room High Floor with TWO Beds waiting for us. Not only did I called on the day of the reservation but I also called on June and this time I spoke to Gabriel who assured me that everything was fine with the reservation an that I will be getting a room just as I have requested with two beds,high floor and facing the ocean. I placed another called the first week of August to make sure once again that all was as schedule with my reservation and thn again I spoke to another agent from the hotel who again told me that everything is ready and that my room "exactly as I have requested it" will be waiting for me upon my arrival. Upon our arrival at the Hotel on Friday August 15 with my rented car from Hertz I was just about to get into the Hotel entrance when we realized that it was been blocked by a barrier with a police officer standing in front of it. The police officer came to the car an told me that I could not get it but I explained to her that I was a guest at the hotel and that I had just arrived from NY and I was going to check in into the hotel. She told me to wait a second and she went to talk to another officer where at one point they started some sort of an argument because they wanted to decide who was going to move the barrier so I can get into the hotel. After letting my drive into the hotel I came to the Valet Parking area where I had to wait for at least 20 minutes before anyone can come to help us with the luggage or even take the car. Finally a guy from the valet parking came in and asked me if I was checking in and I told him yes and also mentioned to him that I will need a bellman to bring our luggage to the room to which he replied that he did not know where the bellman was. At this point I just said to him just park the car for me and we will carry our on luggage into the hotel. When the doors from the hotel opened we could not believe what we were seeing. There was so many people in the lobby drinking an partying and the music was so loud that we were trying to get thru the people and at some point we had to yelled "EXCUSE ME" so they could move so we can make it to the front desk to check in. We finally made it to the front desk and were greeted by Fernando to whom I had to speak out loud so he can hear me because of the loud music being played in the lobby. I gave him my name and told him that I had a reservation for a High Floor, Ocean Vista Room with two double beds. I could tell right away that something was wrong immediately because of the expression on his face. He said to me that I did have an Ocean Vista Room on the 9th floor but only 1 bed. With everything that has been going on so far since we arrived at the hotel I started to get a little upset but chose to be a little diplomatic about it and told Fernando that I have been calling the hotel every month since I made the reservation to make sure everything was as schedule an that the most important thing was having two beds and that everytime I called I was assured that I will get a room with two beds. He said that they only had a room with only one bed. I asked him why a hotel with over 500 rooms and with a comfirmed reservation that was made almost three months ago can provide me me with what I asked for to which he replied that "all the hotel does guarantee is an Ocean Vista room but not the specific amount of beds" I said to him how do you expect the three of us to sleep on the same bed when I am almost 6'2. He said that he could send me an "air mattress" to our room at least for the night and that I can speak to the manager in the morning so he can change out room to one with two beds. At his point was almost 9pm and we were so tired and hungry that I agreed to take the room with the air mattress and wait until the next day to be transfer to another room with two beds. I asked him why the hotel so so crowded and he told me that the Hotel had booked a Local Political Convention and that is why the hotel was so packed. He said to leave the luggage by the front desk and that he will have a bellman take them upstairs. I took my room keys and asked him to tell me where the elevators where so I can go up to my room and when he pointed the elevators to me I could not believe what I saw. There was a line so long to take the elevators that I knew it was going to take us a while just to get in them. After waiting for about 15 minutes waiting for an elevator since everytime they came to the lobby they were full to capacity from people going up an down I asked him if there was another way to get to the room he told me that there was another elevator in the back towards the pool that not too many people know about. When we got to this elevator there was also a lot of people but not as much as the main/front elevators so this time we only waited for around 5 minutes to get in. We arrived to room # 912 and found the room to be clean with one bed and an "L shaped "sofa in front of the TV. The bellman showed up around 20 minutes later with our luggage an I asked him if he knew where was our "air mattress. He said not to worry about it because it will be brought up to our room and we did not need to be there since houskeeping has the key to the room. We decided to go out the hotel to get something to eat and we felt that by the time we came back the "air mattress" will be in the room. This time on the way down we had to take th stairs because when we wen to the elevator area in our floor there was a lot of people waiting for the elevators. We came back to the room around almost 11:00pm and when we got ot the room there was no air mattress to be found, I called the front desk for at least 5 minutes before anyone came to answer the phone. This is not an exaggeration. This is a fact. Finally when I got someone to anwer they promise that they will send and air mattress right away. This was at 11:10PM and we all went to sleep around 1 am and still no air mattress. In had to sleep in the L shaped sofa that was in the room so my Daughter and girlfriend can sleep in th bed. This was very uncomfortable because I am almost 6'2 and I wanted my daughter an girlfriend to get a good night sleep since we have been up since 5am that day because our 9AM flight was canceled by JetBlue and we had to booked another flight thru American Airlines just to make it to Puerto Rico. While sleeping we kept waking up because our room was right across the ice making machine which at that time it became a "hang out place" for the drinking guests of the Political Convention that was taken place at the hotel and these people were talking so loud and and laughing right the front of our room to early hours in the morning. All I remember was that the last time I heard people talking was around 3:00am but I was so tired that I kept sleeping. The following day Saturday August 16th I was downstairs at 8 am so I can speak to the front desk manager Mr. Jean Pierre Aponte.I explained to him my situation to which he was really very apologetic and he told me that he will do whatever he could to get me a room with two beds. I gave him my cell phone number to call me because we had plans to go to the Old San Juan during the day. Mr. Aponte called me aroun 2pm but did not have good news for me. He could not find a room with two beds and most of all he did not even have an "air mattress" to offer me. He told me that he will take $25 off my bill for every day that I did not have an air mattress. I told Mr. Aponte that this is not what I wanted but I will have to think what I was going to do. We came back to the hotel around 5pm to find out the same old story . Over packed lobby with people holding drinks,extremely loud live music and a line of people waiting for elevators. We went to the back of the lobby to use elevator near the pool which it was not as busy as the main ones an to our surprise the elevator was out of service. We decided to go up the stairs because it was going to take a while if we were going to wait for the elevators. It took us a little longer because my daughter as a problem with one of her knees and it takes her a while to go up stairs. We made it to our room and decided to just change an relax at the pool. "HUGE MISTAKE" When we arrived at the pool , the pool was so packed with the guest and friends of the Political Convention that there was no chairs available at all. We decided to go to the beach instead and when we went to get the chairs by the beach they were all tied up with ropes. We asked why? and they told us that the beach chairs can only be used until 6pm. Guess what? I looked at the time and it was 6:10pm! Our luck" Well we had no choice but to sit on the sand and do the best we could. While seating on the beach I looked at my daughters face and I saw how sad she was. She was also in pain because her knee started to hurt because of the climbing thru the stairs to our room. It was at this point that I decided that I had enough of the Condado Plaza Hotel. I told my girlfriend, packed the suitcases because we are checking out of this lousy hotel and we are going to the Marriott. I walked to the San Juan Marriott Hotel and right away they found me a room with 2 beds. It was costing me over $500 more that the Condado Plaza Hotel but guess what? It was worth it. I returned to the Condado an had to carried part of our luggage downstairs because we waited for 25 minutes in the room and when I called the front desk (which I had to call 3 times before anyone answer the phone) I was told that it was taking longer than expected because they only had 1 bellman working that night. Can you believe that a Hotel such as big as this one had 1 Bellman working on a Saturday night. When I got to the lobby I happen to find Fernando the same guy that checked us in and I told him that we were checking out. I explained to him why and he understood. He was also really apologetic and he said to wait a minute that he was going to talk to management to make sure I will not get charge for the night because check out time was 1pm and it was almost 8 pm when I was checking out. He came back and told us that I will not be charge for the night. They also took of $25 dollars for the two days I did not have the so call an hard to find "air mattress". I thank him very much for all his help and left the hotel to go th Marriott. I have to say that the staff that we came across at the Condado Plaza Hotel was very nice to us. From Mr. Jean Pierre Aponte(front desk manager) to Yaritza and Fernando at the front desk as well as Kaira Velez. They were all very helpfull and apologetic to our situation and I know thy tried to do the best they could under the circumtances. They all agreed that they will not prepare for the magnitude of this Political Convention. I spoke to many of the staff from the Parking Attendant to the bellman and of course the front desk. I can see how stressed out they were. It seem to me that the guests at this Political Covention brought into the hotel all their friends an relatives from the Island and they took over this Hotel and did whatever they felt like it. We saw a lot of young people cursing and running up and down the stairs with open beer cans in their hands and also in the floors. There was no way for anyone of the guests that were not part of this Political Convention like us to relax and enjoy the comfort that this hotel should be capable of offering their guests. This was a complete chaos. This is exactly the best way to described the how this hotel looked the almost 2 days that we stood there. Will I come back to this hotel? Not in the near future. Will I recommend this hotel? Not for a long while! My advice!!! Please make sure that if you have a comfirmed reservation with a specific request at this hotel make sure that it is available and guarantee before checking in because you will be in the same situation my family and I was. My Best Regards, Carlos Reyes Queens, New York.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Vacation Spot”
Reviews.Author: enkent
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I decided that we needed a vacation, so we booked a 6 night stay in San Juan, Puerto Rico. He and his family have been there before, and he recommended that we stay at the Condado Plaza Hotel & Casino. So we booked our round trip tickets (which were just under $450.00 for the two of us!) for San Juan through Delta and headed out on the morning of Aug. 5. I actually read tons of reviews about the hotel before we left, and there seemed to be more positives than negatives, so I wasn't worried at all about the trip. My boyfriend was there before they renovated the entire hotel, so he was amazed at how different it looked. I work for Starwood Hotels & Resorts, here in Atlanta, so I know a little about the hospitality industry. The main lobby was very colorful and vibrant, much like the whole city of San Juan. The front desk agents were very courteous and pleasant. The guy eyed us right away, and we were taken care of quickly. Check-in wasn't until 4pm, but we got there at 2:30. I informed the reservation agent when we booked our stay that we were going to be there early, and she definitely made a note of that because it took us about 5 minutes to get our room key as soon as we walked in the hotel! I thought that was awesome. We got the Bahia Vista room, which was located in the other tower. We got a little of each view-bay, ocean, city-which was nice. The bed was so soft! The floor was all tile, which made it great. They had a flat screen tv, and a mini fridge in the room. We loved the glass shower doors and the bathroom door was cool. You had to slide the entire door to open/close it. Housekeeping was awesome. Our room was cleaned everyday, around the same time in the morning because we always had plans to go out, and by the time we would get back, the room was spotless. The bathroom amenities were always refreshed and we always had clean towels. In-Room Dining was quick. Although I did have a few connection/waiting problems on the phone. It really wasn't a big deal, but I don't like to be put on hold for more than a minute and a half. But I'm sure it wasn't their fault. The main thing I enjoyed was being on the balcony, watching cars below and people riding their bikes. It was beautiful at night, too, with the city lights and the sound of the waves crashing. We went down to the pool as soon as we got there on the first day. The servers were really cool. They have 4 pools at the hotel, with a jacuzzi. They were all nice. We also gambled a little while we were there. Their casino was relatively big, and the dealers were really friendly. Everyone that worked there was always smiling and greeting us, which made our stay even more great. We ate at their Italian restaurant one night, and their food was delicious. The server was also very pleasant to speak with. Most of the time, we just bought food at the local grocery store, and stocked up our mini fridge, or ate at the local restaurants in town because the food was cheaper, but still yummy! The concierge team was very nice. They gave us directions to certain places, gave us restaurants to try, and other information we needed to get by. They were always willing to help in every way they could. It wasn't hard trying to get a taxi there. They were all really nice, too. Overall, our stay at the Condado Plaza Hotel & Casino was amazing. We are making plans to come back again soon! Maybe the end of this year or the beginning of next.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel, perfect staff, perfect location!”
Reviews.Author: izmarriednow
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very posh, and the views of the bay are outstanding. The rooms are beautiful, however the city vista room we booked a little smaller in size than we imagined. The amenities are great! Casino, Restaurants, Bars, Gift Shop, Swim up bar, access to the bay. A definite return trip is in order my husband and I! We only experienced two things that we did not like. The first is very minor: The shower is freestanding and the lack of curtain causes a leak of water onto the floor. Easily remedied with an extra floor mat. The second is that the front desk reps are only utilized for checking in and out. Every other service is handled by the concierge. That is fine, however there is at most 3 people at that desk at a time and during certain times of the day you may have a considerable wait time to speak with a concierge, which can be rather inconvenient when you need something simple and there are 5 people at the check in desk just standing around. All in all, we will definitely return to Puerto Rico, and the Condado Plaza Hotel and Casino, will be top on our list of places to stay! Take full advantage of the incredible Concierge service! Take advantage of happy hour at the poolside bar. If you are looking for restaurants outside the hotel, there are several in the Condado area in walking distance from the hotel. Definitely Ropa Vieja Grill very close to hotel. Take all the tours the concierge recommends except the Bacardi tour. You can take the cab and ferry to the distillery for less than half (the tour itself is free) than the excursion companies are offering.

Reviews.Title: “Look Carefully at Other Condado area Hotels”
Reviews.Author: DobbinsFamily
Reviews.Content: My wife, 14 year old daughter and I stayed for two nights. Because American Airlines loses an inordinate amount of luggage on flights into San Juan (nearly 50 people on our plane alone), we showed up at nearly midnight. We were told our room was ready but after hearing a very loud private party off of the lobby, my wife wisely asked if our room was anywhere near it. Yes, they said, it is directly one floor above. The young man at the desk cheerfully offered to move us across the street for the night, from our "Ocean View" room to the more expensive "Laguna Family Suites" at no additional charge. The hotel is large enough that it is located on both sides of the street. Our original side was the ocean side while the more expensive suites were not. We have three complaints about the room, one of which also affected the other room. First, I offered to sleep in the living room which contained two twin beds since I get up early. The sheets smelled of mildew but by that time I was just happy to have a bed. Secondly, we were told we would get some complimentary toothbrushes, etc. to clean up as American Airlines no longer provides them when your luggage is lost. The complimentary toiletries showed up over an hour later, after one o'clock in the morning. The second set (!) showed up at three with the security officer. Thirdly, the view from our room was ghastly, (photo provided) viewing the hotel entrance directly ahead and aN entirely vacant and boarded up 15 or so story hotel complete with graffiti and sans doors or windows. Quite a letdown from an "Ocean View" room- especially for hundreds of dollars per night! The last complaint I have against the room; actually both rooms, is that the bathroom doors slide squeekingly along tracks much like a mirrored wardrobe in your bedroom. There are no bottom tracks however, and as the door is wood frame with frosted glass on the inside, it allows shadowy views and a variety of sounds best left to the imagination of the reader. You had better know your companion very well, indeed, for if you don't, you will certainly know much more than you may have wanted to about their bathroom "habits." No sounds are spared as the door wobbles partiallly open at the bottom under the air flow of the air conditioning (which was excellent, by the way). The next day we finally moved into our promised room, albeit late for an unexplained reason, since we had checked availabililty before we left back to go to the airport on our vacation to search for our errant luggage and were told the room was ready already. Well, it wasn't and we trudged back to the old room until the room we booked was finally made ready. Except for the aforementioned squeeky, semi-trackless door, the room was fine. I would have called the room "semi' ocean view however, as we saw as much rooftop and side of the hotel as we did ocean. The only other complaint concerns the laundry room. My wife seems to do so much laundry all the time it must make her very happy to do it! Nevertheless, three of the four washers were out of order and as she finished the second load of laundry she said she think the last of the four dryers broke. On the positive side, the people were nice, it was reasonably clean, and had great air conditioning. We travel the Caribbean each summer and realize the value of good air. We did have an evening walk down the street, and although many storefronts were empty, we did find a nice Puerto Rican restaurant that offered very good local fare at a reasonable price. My wife and daughter did not feel ill at ease about walking back to the hotel about three blocks as I ordered the food to go. Within walking distance was a Subway sandwich shop and a Chili's but little else. One does have to remember, though, that although a possession of the U.S., Puerto Rico and most of the Caribbean remain third world countries in respect to accommodations. Oh, and we have also discovered there are airlines out there with third world service with delayed flights because of "service problem" and lost and delayed luggage which cry for mercy as they continue to lose money. They have as much of my sympathy as they had for our plight. Seriously, though. We were told by hotel concierge staff, taxi drivers, and cruise personnel that to avoid most of the late and broken plane issues as well as the high incidence of lost baggage to allow at least one extra day travel time each way in and out of San Juan Airport! We did and are we happy we did!

Reviews.Title: “Not what I expected,would not stay here again”
Reviews.Author: TexasMalamute
Reviews.Content: I do not usually take the time nor feel compelled to write a review after a stay at a hotel but this time I do. This was my second time to visit Puerto Rico and I felt I had done my research about which hotels we might want to stay in as we wanted to stay in the Metro area. I had read a lot of the reviews on the Condado Hotel and felt there were more good ones than bad. I should have paid more attention to the bad ones. At least they fit our experience more than the good ones. We arrived on Sunday around 10:30 p.m. and I expected check in to go quickly as we had reservations and it was late in the evening. The hotel lobby looked as it had online in the photos. We had reserved a room with a private balcony overlooking the Atlantic with a king size bed. The room we were assigned had two double beds. So, down the slow elevators and back to the front desk where we had to wait to have this corrected. There were three people working the front desk, two of them were busy and the third one was staring at a computer screen and never looked up or asked us or anyone else if we needed help. So, we waited for the person that had originally helped us. The room assignment was corrected and we went back up to the new room. It was correct this time. The room also appeared as it had online but was not as clean as I had expected. The shower in the bathroom had mildew on the ceiling and the floor did not look vacuumed. The room also had a musty smell. There does not appear to be a ventilation fan in the bathroom. There was moisture on the window looking out to the balcony because of the humidity and you could see where some previous occupant of the room had written [--] You. You would think housekeeping could wipe the outside of the window between room occupants. The room seemed to be cleaned better after the first night. Note to traveler: make sure you put the â€œClean This Roomâ€� sign on your door when you leave your room in the morning. The other thing with housekeeping, which seemed to be the only friendly staff, was that they only put one wash cloth in the room everyday. There were two of us staying in the room and everyday I had to ask for another wash cloth. Back to the first 5 minutes in the room. We proceeded to get settled in the room and the power went out in the hotel. We were now standing in a dark room with just the glow through the window illuminating the room. I donâ€™t really blame this on the hotel but it was one of the first of many annoying things to come. After about 15 minutes of on again off again episodes and one scary moment of being stuck in the elevator for a brief moment power was restored. The pool area is ok but I have been to several that make this really rank. The pool is opened 24 hours but make sure you bring a towel from the room if you go down in the evenings or you will not have a towel They say they provide towels at the pool but the towel shack closes around 6:00 p.m. One night I had gone down to use the hot tub and lay by the pool and enjoy the moonlight and the sounds of the ocean and felt stalked by a security guard which kept looking and walking around me as if I didnâ€™t belong there. I almost confronted him and asked him to stop but decided to let it go. If you are going to have drinks at the pool bar be prepared to pay around $20 for two basic cocktails. Note to traveler: go to the store down the block and buy some rum, a bottle of coke and some plastic glasses and take your drink to the pool. Not one time did a waitress or waiter come over to ask if we needed a drink or anything. Another afternoon we had walked out to the pool area, set our things down and proceeded to the lagoon (beach) area to put our feet in the water and on the way back in we were stopped and asked to see the key card to our room to prove that we were hotel guest while other people just filed on by. Iâ€™m glad I had it in my swim suit pocket! I am 51 years old, clean cut and well dressed and had just walked out to the pool area from the hotel 5 minutes prior to this and he didnâ€™t say â€œIâ€™m sorryâ€� or explain why he was asking. Yes, I was insulted!!! After that we really didnâ€™t make use of the pool area. If you want to go to the beach go to Escambron, down the road towards Old San Juan, or Carolina beach in Isla Verde. Both are part of the Blue Flag program. If you go to El Yungue stop by Luquillo beach on your way back. We rented a car from Budget which is in the tower across the street also part of the Condado Hotel. The Budget Rental people were great. We got the car we wanted and quickly. We were able to return it at the airport which is what we wanted to do. Note to traveler: if you rent a car be prepared for the parking situation at the Condado. You have to take a ticket out of the machine to get in the parking garage, pray you can find a parking spot and then when you are ready to go out again you have to take it to the valet desk which is located outside in front of the hotel, write your room number, your name and sign it, hand it to a valet and get it validated and then go get your car out of the garage. You must do this every time you come and go which is very annoying! They do not explain this system well and sometimes it went smoothly and other times the person behind the parking desk acted like they didnâ€™t know what was going on and would tell you something completely different from what you had been doing. They tell you that in the end you will be charged a flat rate of $15.00 a day but this system does not instill confidence. We saw several people as confused as we were with the whole parking process. Also, just because you are a hotel guest does not mean you are guaranteed a parking space. There is an area designated for hotel guest but no one monitors who parks in these spots. If you come and go 3 to 4 times a day there are times you will return to the garage to see the â€œGarage Fullâ€� sign and have no option but to park down the street in a public lot or valet park at the hotel. We had no option but to valet park one time and when we came to get the car they didnâ€™t know where it was at first. Plus the valet parking rate is much more expensive. Note to traveler: if you have been out to a beach other than the one at the hotel there is no alternate elevator to your room you will have to go through the lobby. During the week with business men, etc. this can seem uncomfortable. We did not spend any time in the Casino as that is not our thing and we did not eat at the Strip House as we have one where we live. We did eat at the Italian restaurant which was not good. If you like Italian food donâ€™t get it here. You also can get breakfast in this same space in the morning and we ate breakfast twice and it was fine. If you like coffee, request the Puerto Rican coffee otherwise they bring regular coffee. We did try the bar but after no wait person came to take our order we went up to the bar to order and the bartender just continued to talk to someone and ignored us even after saying â€œcan we get a drink?â€� We gave up at that point. Another annoying thing at this hotel is the doors to the rooms. It is impossible to close them without a loud slam and I mean loud. So, early mornings and late evenings you are aware of the comings and goings of other guests while you are sleeping or relaxing in your own room. In general, I felt the staff was rude and unaccommodating. I think this is more of a business and convention hotel than a vacationing one. Based on our experience I was expecting check out to be an unpleasant experience and to our surprise it wasnâ€™t. We were in a long line waiting to get to the front desk when a very nice, official looking hotel representative asked if anyone was checking out and we indicated we were. He assisted us and even showed us where we could print our boarding passes for our flight home. This was the first time I felt we received the kind of service I had expected the 5 nights we stayed considering the quality and rating this hotel has or professes to have. Friday morning there was a political figure in town in addition to the people arriving at the hotel for the weekend and it really seemed like hotel staff had a wake up call. They even started to say â€œthank youâ€�. I know we were staying at this hotel during the â€œoff seasonâ€� but service is service. The second day of our trip we decided to salvage our vacation mood by lowering our expectations and proceeded to have a good vacation. I feel if we had stayed somewhere else we might have had a great vacation. I would not stay here again. Next time we will stay at one of the Isla Verde hotels or one of the resort hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Could have been a disaster, but...”
Reviews.Author: 2scompany3sacrowd
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 3 night stay at the Condado Plaza Hotel and Casino. Check-in was quick. Our first room was worn (peeling paint, damaged door to balcony, etc.) and the room had a major problem with the climate control. It felt as if you were outside - extreme humidity. We called for repair and were told it would take 15 minutes, after 40 we called again and they switched our room. This is where the potential disaster ended. We were upgraded to Ocean Front (in another tower - THIS IS A MUST, if you are booking; only stay in the Ocean Front tower, the other tower is NOT GOOD.) The rest of our Hotel experience was great. The room was very nice and clean, bed and sheets were nice/comfy. Loved the contemporary feel. The view great! The grounds at the hotel also were very nice. The main pool was well kept. The pool bar made strong drinks but wow $12 for one drink, laughable. Take your own. Must try out the slide, too fun. Cold towels were provided as well as umbrella, etc. Good time. We only ate at the Italian restaurant for breakfast one day and it was normal priced, just fine with good service. This hotel made the trip to PR much better than it could have been.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: riding_rockets
Reviews.Content: Were there from 7/31 to 8/9 , 2008 with two boyz, 5&8. Loved it. Have been to San Juan several times and stay at the Marriott Resort but didn't miss it this time. There are two buildings, one facing a lagoon, has one pool, gym, the other is ocean front, a pool with a slide, a salt water pool and the beach. Very calm beach which is public as are most in Puerto Rico. Italian restaurant overlooking ocean great for breakfast, try there 2 by 2 brkfst and you'll never need lunch. Staff is extremely nice, especially Bernice who is a hostess at the Italian place. Great steak at the Strip restauraunt. The pool side bar is great, again very nice staff, good food menu. Pretty clean place, we were in a ocean front room, very big room, unique bathroom with a shower within a glass square with toilet and sink to one side and drawers and closet on other. Wi fi is iffy, stay at higher levels to use. Starbucks is next door and you can charge everything to your room. There is a Puerto Rican/Mexican restaurant a few feet away on Ashford next door to another amazing place Waikiki. Make sure you go to the back of Waikiki out the door to be literally experience a drink or dinner overlooking the waves. Best place to be!!! Their beer is 2.50 which is cheapest next to going to the corner store which is close to Max and Charlie's pizza. They have the best pizza ever as everything is fresh. Sit at their bar to enjoy a sip while your food is being prepared. There are so many hotels and outdoor bars along Ashford, perfect in the evening. All in all a very good experience, guest manager is Jean Pierre who is very helpful. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Weird smell, weird door-Not what I expected”
Reviews.Author: kmiloMd
Reviews.Content: Booked directly w/the hotel, not given all the information on the phone as far as the deposit situation ($85/per night deposit) so at check in I was charged an additonal $350 that noone mentioned, glad I had it to spare up front. Our room, smaller then expected and smelled like mold and mildew. The ceilings in our room, have mold and mildew on them. I complained of the smell and mold, we were given a machine that looked like an old time radio that "sucked out odor". It worked, but they took the machine away, so the room was fresh for only 1 or 2 days. The beach here is a joke, one side is over run with rocks, and the other side has a beach that's equivilent to a pool. No waves at all, plus it's right on the street so there are plenty of locals around to throw there trash and cigarettes on "the beach". If you're looking for a good beach with waves and such, stay further down. Also, the bathroom in the room is small and the door is weird. it slides and is frosted, which is nice and modern, but when you're inside on the toliet, you can see the front door and into the room near the desk. That means that someone coming in the front door or is near the desk can see you too. Also, any smell (good or bad) in the bathroom, will enter the room, b/c the door has intentioanl gaps in it. Weird. Staff nice, friendly and prompt but wouldn't stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mamagata
Reviews.Content: This was the second time we stayed at the Condado Plaza. We were there 2 1/2 years ago and preferred it then to its new, modern look, but there's no going back. As other reviewers stated, the bathroom is a bit odd, encompassing the closet, refrigerator, safe, and coffee maker. With all of this, they omitted the laundry line that is frequently found over tubs; there is NO tub and there was nowhere to hang a dripping bathingsuit. The Italian restaurant, Gusto di Italia, was very reasonable & good for a hotel restaurant. They serve breakfast, lunch, and dinner. The service is friendly and the view of the ocean makes dining there very pleasant. The other restaurant, Strips, is VERY over-priced. Around $37 for just a steak and $10 for a baked potato. You'd have to be crazy to eat there! Down the block are other dining options. La Hacienda is OK for breakfast. Ropa Vieja was very good 2 1/2 years ago, but we didn't enjoy our dinner this time. The prices have gone up, the portions are very small and the service is indifferent. Surprisingly, it's a very popular place. Forget Chili's across the street. It's very noisy, crowded, and pedestrian, Ajili Mojili is good if you like Puerto Rican food.

Reviews.Title: “Very Accomadating”
Reviews.Author: nycvegas
Reviews.Content: Spent 4 days from 7/25-29 and had a great time. Beach and pool area are very clean. There's a chinese restaurants on first floor that serves great food. The restaurants around the area are good, theres a Chili's down the block. But beware that there are many taxes that inflate your bill. There was an issue with the on site laundry room. Several washers and dryer were off line. When front desk staff (Yaritza) was informed they resolved issues by having my wet clothes dryed,pressed and boxed free of charge. Thank you. I had an awesome time and would return with out hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Stay!!”
Reviews.Author: travelbug323
Reviews.Content: We had an excellent experience at the Condado Plaza. Our room was in the Ocean Tower. The roop was very well decorated, modern art deco. The bathroom was very large and spacious. Casino was lots of fun. Staff was great! Had breakfast once in the hotel; it was decent. The pool and small beach area was a lot of fun. I especially enjoyed the bar/lounge in the evening. IT was a nice atmosphere with DJ playing music. Had a fantastic experience and will definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay, wonderful staff”
Reviews.Author: sparky5715
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the hotel at 12pm, Eveyln at check in was very helpful but advised that only a room with a king size bed was available. We had booked a double room so we went to leave our bags and explore the hotel. Henry Newmann was at the bag check and immediately found us a room and got our keys. Who could ask for more? I had contacted Henry regarding the hotel using his email address found in other reviews on this site. He had offered me and upgrade from a city vista room to an ocean view during our correspondence and WHAT A VIEW! The refrigerator didn't work, it was found to have a faulty outlet and fixed immediately. Service and food at the Italian resturant was excellent (Carolynn at breakfast was full of information and was a treasure). The gym has exceptional equiptment . Old San Juan was a $15 cab ride away. There were plenty of chairs near the pool and we all won at the casino. Who could ask for more? I would stay again in a heartbeat. All that I expected and much, much more!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay despite some snafu's”
Reviews.Author: bdbmommy
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a wonderful vacation and our first time in Puerto Rico. After initially booking at the Gran Melia in PR I read some negative reviews on tripadvisor and switched to the Condado Plaza. I can't emphasize how happy I am that I did. We arrived on Monday morning and checked right in without a wait. There was a problem with the first room we were given. The sliding door to the balcony had been left open and the bathroom was infested with mosquitos. Once we brought this to managements attention we were immdiately given another comparable room without hesitation. Every staff member we encountered throughout our stay was effiicient, friendly and polite. The head of guest relations Henry Neuman was very present and approachable. Javier was my favorite porter at the door. Any negative seeming issues we had were quickly dealt with including a leak in our room on our last night there. I also had a mishap with a dryer in the small laundry room on the premises that ate my quarters. It was so nice to be able to wash my clothes and not pack up a suitcase full of sand that a dryer that ate my quarters was a small price to pay for the convenience of not having to go off the grounds to do laundry. I would echo other reviewers sentiments that the food by the pool was very pricey and of mediocre quality. After one lunch there (we were too tired upon arrival to go forraging outside the hotel for a meal) we did not eat at the hotel at all. Having a Starbucks on the grounds helped get the day started with ease and we ate off the grounds for the rest of the day during our stay. During the week the action at the pool was manageable and it was not difficult to find an empty chair. Our ten year old son had a blast on the water slide and made friends while waiting on line. We had Diana as our server for poolside drinks and she was lovely and available without being overbearing. Like other reviewers I observed that there were people at the pool who did not seem to be guests of the hotel. When entire families show up at a resort pool in street clothing it does seem a bit suspect and I saw that more than once during the week. However once the weekend hit and the hotel was at what seemed to be capacity they began issuing wrist bands with the towels. The lagoon beach is small but had some fun snorkeling. We saw squid, octopus, puffer fish, trumpet fish and numerous other colorful tropical fish.I would suggest if you like to snorkel bring your own gear. This is a resort and they charge resort prices for gear rental. Yes, as mentioned in other reviews the elevators are slow. It seems as though there just aren't enough elevators for the amount of people the hotel can hold. During the week it really wasn't a problem but when the hotel filled up on the weekend with conventions and weddings it became more noticeable. Most people just took it in stride. The rooms were kept very clean. I would call the decor tropical West Elm. My one complaint about the rooms would be that the walls were a bit on the thin side. We got around mostly by cab after one attempt to go local and take the bus that resulted in a wait that was over an hour. If you like surfer communities go to Ocean Park beach and go to Pinky's or Top Hamburger for lunch. Everywhere we went in Puerto Rico the service was friendly and a refreshing change of pace. The absolute highlight of our vacation was the restaurant Marmalade in Old San Juan. Due to my line of work I have eaten food prepared by all the best chefs in the country including Batali, Flay, Morimoto, et al. and the food and service at Marmalade was by far the best I have ever experienced. They were completely unfazed by our bringing a ten year old in with us and did everything they could to accomodate his picky habits and make us comfortable. The whole experience was so outstanding we went back a second night without him. If you go to Marmalade ask to sit in Bernice's section. She undertands the concept of sublime service. All in all a wonderful vacation and I absolutely would not hesitate to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Nice, clean, expensive”
Reviews.Author: shemedic
Reviews.Content: Beautiful curbside appeal, check in was a breeze, the room was not on the ocean side so the view looks a little like Brooklyn but the room was very nice...the bathroom is also the closet, coffee station, fridge and safe...so that takes a little getting used to, also it has in wall sliders without locks..so if you have kids, they might take advantage of the big gap in the closed door where if you are trying, the view is enough to poke fun....the room is spotless, and tastefully decorated..nice TV..no problem with that. The beach is small but alright if you have small children or like to snorkel near the reef..it's fine. The pools are spacious and have a lot of room to relax...lots of kids and I'm not sure if all the people there are hotel guests. Now, DON'T buy food here...don't get me wrong, it's very tasty, but ...for my young daughter and myself to have lunch (2 sandwiches, 2 drinks..no alcohol...and a small appetizer...60 bucks) And from then on, we left the hotel for all meals. There are a lot of places on the street the hotel is on with reasonable prices and good food. The people are very nice and friendly. But, if you go too far down the street at night, it gets a tad seedy..all in all, I'd stay here again, it's a nice place to relax after a long day of navigating...but very expensive if you pay beyond just the room...

Reviews.Title: “ok stay”
Reviews.Author: TALLEYS
Reviews.Content: 6/28/08 got there and our rooms were not together as we had been assured they would be. the lady that checked us in didn't care. just didn't want to bother it seemed. said we could wait until after four and see if any rooms were left. a couple of hours. we didn't but when we got to our rooms there was a loud buzzing from the ac or something so we asked someone else to move us and she moved us to the same floor just a couple of doors apart which was fine. so why couldn't the first one do it???? when we came back after our cruise we had to wait hours for our room. other people got theirs and one couple in our group got theirs but we just got pushed to the back burner. she said she would call housekeeping and speed it up but she didn't she just went on checking other people in and out. i watched her. it was clean and pretty but i guess i would try somewhere else next time. elevators are small and so slow. rent a car but not from the concierge. go to the rainforest it is great.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Fantastic!!!”
Reviews.Author: ladyj415
Reviews.Content: I just came back from Puerto Rico this past weekend after spending the entire week at the Condado Plaza Hotel and Casino. It was outstanding! We spent a little more money and got the ocean view in the Ocean Tower (the tower with the casino). I would recommend to anyone to spend the extra money to get this view. Waking up in the morning and going to sleep at night to this view is amazing. After a night of losing some money in the casino, we would come back into the room and go out onto the balcony and listen to the waves crashing. When we first arrived, we were greeted by the workers right away who offered to help us to our room. Check in went smoothly and soon enough we were going up to our room (Room 924) The room we had was beautiful. As soon as you walked in, you saw the bathroom with sliding doors. Yes, the bathroom does not lock. But honestly, it's not a big deal. I mean if you see the doors closed then obviously someone is using it. So there weren't any issues there. I know one review said that you could see through the opened portions of the sliding door. You really can't see that much. But think about who you're going with. I was with my boyfriend. We weren't peaking in on each other when we were in the bathroom. I also know that one review said that the sink drains slow. It is kinda slow, but also not a big deal. Nothing overflowed. The only way I can see it overflowing is if you put the faucets on full blast. I don't feel a need to do that. The closet and mini fridge were in the bathroom as well which was a little weird but got used to it. The bathroom is a very large bathroom. After the bathroom, you were in the living area. There was a very comfortable bed, with big fluffy pillows, a nice couch, a little coffee table, a desk with a flat screen TV, and plenty of lights. Finally, there was the balcony which had a little table with 2 chairs, and awesome view of the Atlantic Ocean. The hotel itself is very modern and brightly lit with different colors, and had a beautiful fishtank. There were 3 pools (one pool was only 3 1/2 feet but had a swim up bar and a waterslide for the kids, there was a salt water pool that had water filtered in from the Atlantic, there was a lap pool to swim laps, finally there was a jacuzzi). There were always activites for kids and adults to take part in, occasionally they would give out popsicles at the pool. I never had to fight for a lounge chair. The beach is a little small, but it was nice. It was sort of in its own inlet. The most important part is that the water was clean! They do have there own fitness center and I have to say it looked very nice. All the latest cardio and weight machines were in there and you need to use your room key to get in so it's ONLY for hotel guests. The casino was quite large for the casinos in Puerto Rico. I've never been to Las Vegas and I'm sure the casinos in Vegas are better but Vegas is known for their casinos. The Condado casino was very nicely kept, nice people working there and very helpful. They had everything you could want: slot machines, roullette, baccarat, blackjack, 3 card poker, and texas hold 'em. There might even be more that I don't rememeber. We booked a day trip to El Yunque rainforest through the hotel. They also had other really interesting excursions that you could do. The San Juan Public Transportation is very convenient. There is a bus stop located right outside the beach area which takes you to Old San Juan (it's only .75 cents each way and runs until 9 p.m.) We never ate in the Striphouse restaurant in the hotel. We're from NYC and we figured we could always go to a steak house in NYC. So we opted for authentic restaurants most nights. The hotel is located on Ashford Avenue, which is a huge strip with many hotels and restaurants, and many hotels that are being built or added on to. We felt very safe at night walking on Ashford Avenue. Most mornings for breakfast we either ate at the Italian restaurant in the hotel (nice size portions but a little pricey - the pancakes were bigger then my head) or we walked down the block to Hacienda Don Jose (really good food, good price, amazing view). We tried a new place for dinner each night ( Ajili Mojili, Ikakos, Cafe Angel, Ropa Vieja). Our favorite restaurant was Ropa Vieja. Service was outstanding and food was out of this world! I highly recommend this place. Before we knew it, the week was over and we DID NOT want to go home. We will definitely be coming back in the future! It was just a fun, amazing, yet relaxing trip!! There was not one negative thing we could come up with about this hotel! Outstanding!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: GShrop
Reviews.Content: The Condado was an excellent hotel. I would recommend the hotel and stay there again. I originally had the city view and upgraded to an ocean view. It was worth it, if you love the breeze and view of the ocean. The hotel staff was wonderful, not only with things in the hotel but with information about the city. The hotel has a nice swimming pool area (2 pools) and a nice little beach. The beach is not that big but much larger beaches are in walking distance. The hotel casino is small compared to the hotels in Vegas, but for the guest staying at the hotel and others visiting it is more than big enough. Although they play music every night, if you want to go dancing you will have to probably leave the hotel and find another location. Overall I would stay there again with no hesitation. It is a beautiful hotel and the staff is great.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!!!”
Reviews.Author: marvia
Reviews.Content: Just returned from our first trip ever to Puerto Rico and we loved every minute of it. The hotel is beautiful, impeccably clean and we couldn't have asked for better staff. From Johnathan at the Front Desk to Joey at the Pool Bar and Cristina and Yaritza at the Concierge's desk. Everyone was cordial, friendly, helpful, and never hesitated to take the extra step to make our stay more enjoyable. There is a salt water pool, (6' deep all around); a regular pool, accessable to the bar (4' deep at its deepest), and a hot tub.... All great!!! The hotel is located within walking distance of several restaurants. Our favorites were Ropa Vieja and Waikiki. They've got great prices and great food. When we return, we will definitely stay at the Condado again. Recommend you stay in the Ocean Tower, rather than the Lagoon Tower as pools and Casino are in the Ocean Tower.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel with Minor Problems”
Reviews.Author: mosleyk
Reviews.Content: DON'T BOOK THROUGH EXPEDIA- WILL PROVIDE YOU WITH A MIGRAINE, AN ILLEGAL CONNECTION AND CANCELLED FLIGHTS. THANKS BUT NO THANKS. First of all, this Hotel is absolutely beautiful inside with a touch of class and chicness to it. Very impressed by the view from the 8th floor Atlantic View Ocean Vista (which i highly recommend). The first room that we had was on the 9th floor -had minor problems. The electricity was not working- had to have someone come and reconnect it under the side table, very dusty and floor still had hair from previous guests, sink was stopped up and would not drain, elevators are extremely slow and very time consuming. You would probably spend most of your time at the elevators. After all of my complaining- I spoke with Edjardo which was very nice and accomodating to switch us to the 9th Ocean Vista which was clean and beautiful. View is absolutely breathtaking. Bar at the pool is great, however is closes to darn early 9pm to be exact. Love the satrbucks in walking distance!!!! Please guys dont be fooled- RENT A CAR! you would not be able to go anywhere fast waiting on the bus. Excursions are a ripoff. Elyunkie(sp) Rainforest is an experience that you will NEVER forget and your legs will not either. Drive and go to the viewing at the center 35-45minutes away. You can do it for 55 dollars cheaper than paying someone to drive you and then you have to walk and find the way by yourself anyway. Oh yeah- Parking is a trip-16 a day..RIDICUL... email me and i will discuss parking with you...finley33@yahoo.com....overall the trip was great... feel free to email me if you have any questions and I would be glad to email you back. luv2travelallof thetime.

Reviews.Title: “A bit of paradise on earth...”
Reviews.Author: RobbieGonzalez
Reviews.Content: Hi everybody, we really want to share our experience during our stay in Condado Plaza, it was simply amazing, it was our first time in PR and it was our honeymoon, and we fell in love with the hotel, and of course with such a beautiful country as Puerto Rico, the staff was great, and we want to thank Ferdinand, front desk, he was really great to us, excellent service, great guy; if you are planning on going to Puerto Rico, make sure you stay in Condado Plaza, something we know for sure is that we will, we can't wait to go back. Also, you have to make sure you eat pizza in Gusto de Italia, and try Rican food in the great restaurants near the hotel, we are sure it is the best location in the whole Island, something like Malibu in CA, or Miami Beach in Florida :D; the hotel is great, gorgeous rooms, great environment, I don't know if there were any construction going on, because we were never bothered by anything. Great Hotel, Great Honeymoon, Great Place.....Simply Wonderfull Thanks Ferdinand, Thanks Hotel Staff, Thanks Condado Plaza.....Thanks Puerto Rico

Reviews.Title: “Better than Expected”
Reviews.Author: jean8
Reviews.Content: I just came back (last night) from a wonderful 5-night stay at the Condado. We were upgraded to an ocean-front room, without asking. The views were to die for, and the room we had was absolutely beautiful! We arrived early, too early for check-in, and killed time by strolling down Ashford Avenue to Hacienda Don Jose for lunch. When our room was ready, I was shocked to learn that our bags had been brought up already. I immediately chased down the bellhop to give him a tip. Talk about the opposite of pushy! We loved the Italian restaurant on the mezzanine, had both breakfasts and dinners there - also stopped by for ice cream in the afternoon. Prompt, friendly service. The food at the freshwater pool was so delicious! The best crispy wings (buffalo wings) I had ever tasted! And the Strip House restaurant was probably the best restaurant I've eaten in, in my life! The concierge was so helpful with everything. We booked one tour through them, and it was delightful! I used the fitness room each morning. I'm looking forward to returning!

Reviews.Title: “Overall good with minor cosmetic flaws”
Reviews.Author: DavidMiami_FL
Reviews.Content: As the title states, it was an overall good stay. I stayed in the Condado Plaza on Memorial Day Weekend. Just to state the facts, I am a very well travelled individual and rarely complain to management (I just don't go the place anymore), I was also most of the time out and about. Also, Hillary Clinton was staying in this hotel on that weekend, so there was a lot of security around. Stayed a(group of 5) on the main ocean tower on a (2) city view room. Pros: 1. Beautiful Hotel, newly remodeled rooms with all the amenities. 2. Lobby very contemporary, and grounds impeccable. No complaints, except elevators were too tiny for such big buildings (2 towers), therefore were slow or were packed and had to wait two or three times for it (if there's space go in, even if it's going up). 3. Great big bathrooms, although there were no doors to close (sideways, gap between door and wall). So, technically anyone could see through the double door. No problem in our case. Cons: It might have just been my room?? 1. Some minor issues during my stay such as remote for the LCD screen tv did not work properly (could not regulate volume). 2. The curtain and blackout shades could not be closed since the stick to move it side to side was broken (stuck) and thrown in the terrace (housekeeper should be aware and report those things). 3.
