The door that lead to the terrace would slam shut since the top part of the door (don't know how it's called, mechanism to close slowly) was broken. I could see that the Lagoon Tower had new doors and windows that the city view ocean tower did not remodeled. 4. The other room's mini-fridge was not cooling. Other minor problems, such as water splashing out to the floor from the shower, are true. Did eat at the Japanese place (great service and food), had breakfast at Gusto di Italia (great service and food), and the Strip House (excellent). In other words, restaurants were excellent, as well as the pool area, lobby, grounds, etc. Did get a great rate by booking directly from their website (4 nights for the price of 3 special). I will try the Reach Resort in Key West for the July 4th weekend. Will let you know. Would I go again?? I don't know!! I think I would rather try the Renaissance or go to the Marriott in San Juan.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel and Good Location”
Reviews.Author: PBLiving
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night at the Condado Plaza Hotel . We were catching a flight the next day to the BVI's and decided to stay overnight at this hotel. We stayed in an ocean view king room. Here is a synopsis Good: Rooms are nice and have been remodeled. Large balcony (if not on 2nd floor) Modern Hotel and easy to get around Fitness Center was great Location, close to Old Town and Airport OK: Pools were just Ok and a little crowded with kids screaming Not So Good: Drink and food prices (bring your own drinks) Beach, not much of one Casino, if you are used to Vegas, this will be a disappointment, but it is supposed to be the nicest casino in PR Check in was unorganized, no real line and people were cutting Elevators are really slow, so be prepared to take the stairs Overall I think this was a nice, modern hotel. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Luxurious and Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: BonitaRebel
Reviews.Content: The Condado Plaza is a very modern and beautiful hotel to stay in. They have restaurants, bars, dancing, live salsa, and great pools. We became huge fans of the pool area. They have a sea water pool that is amazing. The staff were so helpful and our rooms were very modern, comfortable and clean. I'd go back there anytime.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ryuenau
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful time staying at the Condado Plaze Hotel. I would agree with the other reviewers in that the hotel has a very trendy, young, modern and comfortable feel. The pictures definitely dont do it justice. The restaurants were very good at the Condado. We had dinner in the italian restaurant and the food was excellent. There is also steak house (The Strip) and a starbucks coffee on the lower level. The hotel has a great pool thats open 24 hrs and lots of seating. The beach to the left is somewhat small and a little rough, but we still enjoyed it very much. For those who like to have a change of scenary, we spent all of our pool time at the Condado, a little time at the smaller Condado beach and most of our beach time about .25 mile east of Condado to the bigger beach (which is very easy to get to). My wife and I like to walk and roam around so we actually checked out the other nearby hotels. From our brief comparison of the beach, pool and aesthetics of each hotel along the strip, I would definitely suggest either the Condado, La Concha or the Marriott. All three had great atmospheres, great pool areas and nice beach areas (specifically La Concha and Marriott). The only cons I had about the Condado were 1) the long lines during check in; 2) we stayed in the City Vista which was a really nice room but had a small bathroom. I would definitely recommend the Condado Plaza. I hope this was somewhat insightful.

Reviews.Title: “The incredible Condado Plaza Hotel”
Reviews.Author: kiss104dj
Reviews.Content: This was one of the best hotel experiences I've ever had. The staff was friendly. The room was clean and the service was great. The room had a very modern feel which was right up my alley. The food in the hotel was a pricey but everything I had at the grill by the pool was great and the service at the the grill was excellent. I stayed at this hotel because of Tripadvisor.com and I'm very happy with my decision. If you're looking for a hotel to relax with excellent amenities you should give the Condado Plaza a try.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced, room was great, overall just OK.”
Reviews.Author: amyi
Reviews.Content: The hotel decor is very pretty, and at night they usually had loud music playing. It was extremely crowded most nights and they had a bunch of various conferences and meetings there. It seems to be a big place for locals to meet. My biggest complaint is the cost of everything here. We aren't cheap people. But $50 for breakfast downstairs - and a very average one at that - is ridiculous. In-room PPV movies ranged from $12.99 to $24.99. $24.99 for a movie. Seriously. Also, they charged $16 per day for parking. I have never been to a hotel that charges their own guests for parking. The mistake we made was not doing enough research about the beach area here, and we love the beach, so we were pretty disappointed. The beach at Condado Plaza is tiny and always crowded, so expect to drive elsewhere for a decent beach experience. Loquillo Beach, about 45 minutes away, is very pretty. Unless you don't want the hassle of driving yourself (which I can't really blame you for, since traffic is horrible here) don't book trips through the hotel, because they are twice what you would pay if you book them on your own. Traffic is hideous. Always allow an extra hour or more to get where you're going. The highlight of our trip was El Yunque, about one hour from Condado. Getting there is a bit of an adventure but once there, it's very easy to navigate. Do not miss La Mina Falls - it's amazing! And bring a swimsuit, so you can splash around in the falls. At km 11.3 there is a small restaurant called "Yuquiyu Delights" -- the food is AWESOME! Especially the fried green plantain, One of the best meals we had. Old San Juan was another highlight. Fort San Cristobal is incredible. We purchased a ton of local rum and coffee at the SuperMax - coffee was $4 a pound! We were happy to finally find something at a decent price. Haha. I would absolutely return to Puerto Rico, but would probably break up the trip a bit. I would stay somewhere closer to a nice beach because we love to snorkel and swim. Then, I would spend a couple of days closer to El Yunque. I would be happy to answer any questions about San Juan or El Yunque. Feel free to email me at amybrannan@gmail.com.

Reviews.Title: “Two thumbs up!”
Reviews.Author: BluRodeofan
Reviews.Content: I read many of the recent Tripadvisor reviews about this hotel and we were a little apprehensive because of the wide range of comments (from great to terrible). Our experience was wonderful. The staff was very friendly and helpful. Luggage handlers were curteous. The room was awesome! Elevators worked flawlessly (some reviews complained about this). We only stayed one night (prior to departing on cruise) but have no complaints except for breakfast in the hotel restaurant. We were seated away from the windows looking out over the waterfront and then the wait staff forgot about us. Food was very good. I would not hesitate to stay at the Condado again!

Reviews.Title: “Condado is a great, clean, new fun hotel with nice pools!”
Reviews.Author: kirstenl
Reviews.Content: This hotel was great! My husband and I didn't really know what to expect (we drove up to SJ after 3 days in Guanica). The hotel is totally new and modern, our room faced the ocean and was clean and beautiful. So you're good to go with the hotel. Things to know... - There is a "beach" on the property but it's like a little lagoon. I wouldn't go to San Juan for the beaches anyway, but the hotel has several really nice pools - Condado is a nice area, cabs to old San Juan, etc can get pricey. We didn't realize it's about $12-15 one way to get to old San Juan! Cheaper than parking though - The hotel was great about holding our things while we toured after we checked out, and if we were staying longer there are cool bars there as well...and a georgeous huge deck that would have been a great place for cocktails if we weren't sunburned and tired!!! Overall great, clean, affordable, more than you'd expect for the $$ and well worth it!

Reviews.Title: “Definately Recommend”
Reviews.Author: ATC08
Reviews.Content: Nicely renovated hotel, three great pools to choose from. My tip would be to check the hotel sites specials, we were American Express cardholders so we got a free upgrade, 75$ resort credit, & complimentary bottle of wine. I would recommend a little restaurant right down the street called Hacienda, we got breakfast there almost every morning for like 7 bucks a person & it was really good food with an excellent view!

Reviews.Title: “Condado Plaza is fabulous”
Reviews.Author: Cruisecrazy_8
Reviews.Content: I was a little hesitant about the hotel after reading several reviews but decided it was only 1 night pre-cruise. I'm happy to report that I found this hotel to be a first class establishment. We checked in the middle of the afternoon and so my request for an upgrade was no problem. Instead of a city view we were oceanfront. The staff at the front desk were always very nice and helpful. Our room was spacious, very modern with a huge bathroom all recently renovated. The pool area was beautiful and large enough that it didn't feel crowded..This was a great way to begin our vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Goos looking place, terrible service!”
Reviews.Author: AivinM
Reviews.Content: Just came back from this vacation wishing that the service of this hotel would've been as nice at the grounds. I have to say that i was impressed with the change of this hotel. It is absolutely beautiful. The problems start when you do your check in. We had booked a room for 5 days, when we got there they had it for 3. When my husband asked to get the 2 extra days he mentioned the special that they had, stay 4 nights and the 5th one is free, the girl said that we cannot have it because our reservation was for 3 days. My husband explained to her again that we wanted to stay 5 days not 3 and that we like to get the special but the girl at front desk didn't even tried to get the special she just said no that we can't have it. Got to the room and it was comfortable and well decorated. We had what they called a family suite. Two twin beds for the kids, separated from our side of the bed room. Also we had the coffee machine and the microwave. Everything was nice and clean. The pool on the Ocean tower is really nice and has a cool slide that kids and adults enjoy. The valet was another little problem. Our car was never there when we got to the valet. We always had to wait, not even if we called 20 minutes ahead of time. No opening the doors for me or the kids. Not even because we gave them good tips, and i say good because we are not cheap people! One night we ordered room service, just desserts and coffee and it took them an hour and 20 minutes to deliver the food. By the time they came me and the kids were half asleep. The night before our check out they forgot to clean our rooms. I came to take a shower and found the room exactly the same way we left it. Had to go to the room next door were a housekeeping lady was getting a room ready for check in to ask her for towels. She gladly helped me even though our room was not part of her job and she also made the report. An hour later or so the housekeeping supervisor called asking when was a good time for us to have the room cleaned. I asked for a couple of ours because me and my family were trying to get ready to go out to dinner. Well a house keeping lady came right away even though I told them that I needed some time to get my boys showered and ready and my husband needed to do the same. She kept coming back every 20 minutes because she needed to go to dinner and wanted to clean our room before taking her break. Well she cleaned our room while we were getting ready. At the end of our stay when my husband went to do the check out they asked him how was our stay to which he answered "It left a lot to say", she didn't even bother to asked what went wrong. Just gave him the receipt. Now one thing I do have to say the bartenders at the pool bar are the best. Joey, David, Sterling and the girls(they were all different every day) are the best the hotel have. With smiling faces all the time and their service is above and beyond. To all of them" Job well done". My husband and I go on vacation and stay at hotels at least 3 times a year. From the Ritz, to EL Conquistador, Marriott to Holiday Inn, La Quinta...etc. And by far this has been the worst service we've had. So if you don't mind this issues, go ahead book your vacation. The rest of the island is beautiful with great places to go and excellent cuisine.

Reviews.Title: “Joey, Another Teq-ini Please”
Reviews.Author: megalicious22
Reviews.Content: I just got back from a long weekend trip with some girlfriends and I can't imagine having a better time than we had. The Condado Plaza had a lot to do with that. The lobby is beautiful, the staff is so friendly & helpful. We arrived early & had no problem with the early check in. They gave us two beautiful rooms right next to each other. We were on the lagoon side, so we did get a roof view of the building below, but if you just lifted your chin a little higher you could only see the great view of the city. After we unpacked, we hit the pool. I couldn't ask for a nicer pool area. The staff was attentive, but busy, so it was a little slow, but hey, we were on island time. The drinks were a little pricer, but they were pricey everywhere. I challenge you to find a cheap good place to get a drink with a pool side view in San Juan. The staff was extremely attentive. Our bathroom door was squeaky so we alerted the concierge on our way back from breakfast & the maintenance man beat us to the room. He also changed some light bulbs and we were good to go. Do not miss the swim up bar. And when you're there ask for Joey. He was so much fun & made our last few hours at the hotel a blast. We almost missed our flight because we were having such a good time.

Reviews.Title: “was nice”
Reviews.Author: beach_mom_leesburg
Reviews.Content: the hotel was nice, it was in various stages of renovations, although no current construction was going on, the pool area was very nice with a water slide for the kids & a swim up bar...the beach area is very small and close to a main road, the view was beautiful, the fitness room was adequately supplied with equipment, the staff was courteous, it seemed the food & drinks were very expensive but maybe it is this way anywhere in san juan?

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay”
Reviews.Author: lfaust2Atlanta_GA
Reviews.Content: I had stayed at Condado Plaza about 5 years ago, on business. We decided to return for vacation, since I heard about the renovations. All in all, I think they did a great job. The only complaint I have is that it takes forever to check-in and out. It seems they should have more front desk reps on duty, especially on the weekends. Also, the showers didn't seem to be designed with much thought. The door opens right into the "closet" area, and ours also leaked a bit. In general, we enjoyed our stay. We had an ocean view king room. It was very quiet at night, since we were on one of the higher floors. Room was clean and comfortable. We only had a couple meals in the hotel (breakfast), since the prices were pretty expensive. But, the concierge was very helpful in helping us find places to eat. The location is great. Easy to walk around Condado and very close to Old San Juan. There is also an Enterprise car rental office on-site, which is very convenient if you want to explore the island.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Grounds but has Accounting Problems”
Reviews.Author: Wyomingirl
Reviews.Content: Booked the room back in October 2007 continued to follow the rate and when it dropped called and asked for an adjustment. My credit card was then billed for the full amount again. Took two more calls to get this resolved. At check in, one night post cruise, the lobby was an unorganized mess. Waited in one line only to be told that we should have been in another line, took 15-20 minutes just to get to the front desk to check in. Once we got to our room it was nothing like the red and black room pictured on the website, but hey we're on vacation so we went with the flow. The room was in the Laguna Tower on the 7th floor and it did have a nice view with a balcony. Later decided to have some drinks and appetizers down at the Aqua Grill and watch the rainstorm. The service was outstanding around the pool area and the views incredible. After a few Pina Colada decided to call it a day since we had a early flight. Next morning went down to check out and here is where things started going south again. The bar charge was incorrect and so they took a copy of the receipt and said I would be credited the amount of difference. Well here it is 2 days after check out and my credit card has been double billed again for the incorrect bar charges. After calling once again to accounting I am trying to get this cleared up. This hotel has potential with beautiful grounds and a nice location but because of the accounting hassles I just couldn't recommend them unlike the Holiday Inn Express that we stayed in pre-cruise (See my review on them).

Reviews.Title: “very nice”
Reviews.Author: april20
Reviews.Content: I read all the reviews before I left and I was expecting terrible service and very pricey... I did not... I thought the service was very good... it was slow but everything is slow below Maryland compared to New Jersey. The service at the pool was not great but it was not that big of a deal. The service and food in the Italian restaurant was very good. I thought everyone was nice and accommodating. The concierge desk was not the friendliest but they did help us when we asked. The front desk did upgrade us to an ocean view room when we asked.. I don't think I would have enjoyed myself as much if we were on the city side... The town is not all that nice but we did manage to find some good restaurants to eat at â€¦ although I would not walk around by myself there. all in all, we had a very nice time.

Reviews.Title: “Try and stay away from this one”
Reviews.Author: taby6407
Reviews.Content: This hotel is under construction. Some one should have told them to fix the elevators first. My husband and I were going up to the 10th floor on the pool side elevator ,when it got stuck for 30 mins between the 9th and 10th floor. The elevator as bouncing up and down, I really thought the cable was going to snap and we would shurly die. we pressed the panic butten several times and the people would hang upon us. we rang the bell...nothing. I was relly upset by then. luckly my husband was their to calm me down. he got up and some how pulled open the doors and pushed me out. my husband was pretty mad so we went down the stairs to the lobby and asked for the manager and they gave us the securety manager. We said we were leaving and all they said was for us to fill out an accedent report. my husband said their better be a gm here by the time we get back down with our stuff. luckly when we came back the night manager was their and they told us they would comp everyting. we went to another hotel and calmed down. the next day we went back to get a recept. All they did was comp one night and the cheepest night at that. we are getting a lawyer to help us with this one.

Reviews.Title: “Skip Condado and San Juan”
Reviews.Author: tctravels
Reviews.Content: If you're looking for beaches skip San Juan and head for somewhere else. This hotel is still under renovations - exterior painting on balconies and generally all exterior surfaces. Although the rooms are very nice and clean the extras they charge for and prices in general are very high. As it seems with other reviews I to fell victim to an extra $10.00 per day in taxes that I am having my travel agent investigate. I paid $50.00 per nite extra for an oceanview room only to see painting scaffolding outside my balcony for the weekend. $50.00 to look at and hear ropes slap against the building - yeah that was an upgrade. The pools and pool areas are nice and well maintained however the beach seems and afterthought. The pool area is non-smoking at least to anyone other than spanish speaking guests - they just ignore the policy. Forget about drinks and food at the pool area - you'd think this was a Four Seasons (price wise) - NOT. This was my first and last venture to other than an all-inclusive hotel. I usually stay at Iberostar Hotels and will definitely not stray in the future. If you want the best bang for your buck - investigate Iberostar Hotels in Mexico - they are much better than this property or area.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: Kbell_Boston
Reviews.Content: The Condado Plaza Hotel and Casino is an absolutely fantastic place! It's hip, funky, and stylish with also a very practical twist. The rooms are fairly priced and I found them to be clean, nicely sized, and well maintained. There were also two nice pools (one even had seats at the bar) and the other one was of salt water which I found to be unique. It seems like the over-haul has worked and they are really trying to live up to high standards. The staff is incredibly caring and I found them to be quite conscientious about their guests. Yes, there was a small wait for check-in, but no more than 10 minutes and once you were helped things went smoothly and efficiently. The concierge was very helpful with trips, and they have a great assortment. I highly recommend the Catamaran snorkeling trip. It was fun, the people were great (leading the tour) and worth it! The beach at the hotel is fantastic because it's protected and very easy to swim and snorkel there. I also found the location to be convenient to Old San Juan. A cab ride is very easy. Overall, I was sad to leave and would definitely recommend this hotel for one who is seeking relaxation, rest, and just a mellow time in Puerto Rico.

Reviews.Title: “It was fun”
Reviews.Author: kpdzineChicago_Il
Reviews.Content: This is the first time I have stayed here since the renovations. It really looks nice. I love the location. Pool and beach was fun. The drinks in the lobby bar are really expensive and the service was horrible. Worst bartender I have ever met. The rest of the staff was incredible. The whole place has gotten very pricey but someone has to pay for the new look. All in all it is a nice place.

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommended!”
Reviews.Author: fiestajack
Reviews.Content: We were extremely pleased with our experience at the Condado Plaza Hotel & Resort. The front desk clerk was exceedingly friendly and upgraded our room with out us asking. Check-in was fast. Our room was beautiful, spacious and spotless. Everywhere we went, the staff greeted us and offered assistance. The pools were beautiful and clean. The beach was nice, but since it's a public beach, it's hard for the hotel to keep it clean. The restaurants are nice, but expensive. (Tony Romas is no longer there.) We were a quick walk from great restaurants. The concierge helped us make tour plans to the rainforest, restaurant reservations, recommendations to another beach, and tips on where to purchase aloe vera for a sunburn. We would highly recommend this hotel to our family and friends. As you read the reviews of hotels on this site, please keep in mind that some people will always complain. We consider ourselves experienced travelers and this hotel far exceeded our expectations.

Reviews.Title: “The good and the bad”
Reviews.Author: yessam1277
Reviews.Content: Having to spend 2 nights in San Juan for a convention, without much research I reserved at the Condado Plaza as it was the Hotel of choice on the Trade show website. I arrive the Hotel around 6hpm, with 2 people in the front desk and only one person in front of me, it took me about 30 minutes to check in. I get to my room without knowing what to expect and to my surprise the room was VERY nice looking. Big, spacious, with an L sofa and a flat screen TV. Very comfortable bed. As for the Bathroom, it is also very big since the closet, safe and mini bar is in the bathroom. However there is no Bathtub. The showerhead is very powerful with hot water with no problem. As I am writing this, Im still in the room checking out tomorrow morning. As I forgot my deodorant, I went to the store in the lobby to get one, I was told it is closed even though it was 9h45 and they supposedly close at 10h. An employee did his best to let me in and get what I wanted, but I guess the manager told him not to . The good thing is that I called housekkeping, and the brought me a small speedstick for free. Now, as Im waiting for a Turkey Club sandwich I ordered 1h30 minutes ago, which they told me would take "45 minutes or less", I just got a call saying it'll be there in 10 minutes or so. All in all, I would stay there again only because I feel comfortable in the room and thats the most important aspect for me in a Hotel. Still it would not be my first choice, because It's really expensive from the hotel rate to room service.

Reviews.Title: “Condado Plaza was decent”
Reviews.Author: Sdfarrior
Reviews.Content: My husband, daughter and myself stayed at the Condado Plaza for five days. I really liked the slick modern look of the hotel lobby as well as the room. Our check in was quick and uneventful, we arrived at 1:00 pm and was immediately accommodated with an early check in. Our room was located on the 5th floor with a bay view which was a bit disappointing because of adjacent roofs a bit in the line of vision. A room on a higher floor would have been better. The room was clean and housekeeping did a great job. I will note that the bathroom was really small but as my thrifty husband said "it's a bathroom, who cares". All the staff we came into to contact with was pleasant and helpful. The pool area was very nice, my daughter loved it. The service at the pool could have been a tad faster. The beach was extremely small (the smallest I have ever seen) and unimpressive. In addition the beach was open to the public. We rented a car and experienced no problems with parking. My husband thought the fitness center had good up to date equipment. Overall the Condado Plaza was not a luxury resort but simply a good moderate price hotel in a great location. It is what it is. I recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value..Enjoyed Stay”
Reviews.Author: drewcorey
Reviews.Content: First of all let me preface this by saying you can put 10 people in a room and get 10 different opinions. We recently stayed at the Condado Plaza and have to say we were very satisfied with the overall property based upon our daily room rate. We stayed when they were running a special of stay 3 nights and get the 4th free. So, the average room rate came out to be around $150.00 per night. I see a lot of people complaining about additional charges beyond the room rate. These are statutory charges that are imposed by Puerto Rico....so it dosen't matter where you stay you are paying the charges. Some hotels might include these in the rate so you have to inquire prior to booking. The staff was very courteous and friendly and seemed to want to help whenever they could. The property and the rooms where clean and recently renovated. You read all these reviews about people who are complaining about the property. Well realize your not staying at the El San Juan Hotel, Intercontintenal, etc...where you are paying $350.-500. per night. And to be honest with you I don't know how much better they would have been. The hotel is located in an accessible part of town where you are not locked into eating at the hotel. There a places within walking distance from the hotel. A great place we ate at was Ropa Vieja. We also got upgraded to an ocean view for no charge that was absolutely beautiful. The previous review complained about the ocean being closed. We were there at the same time and the the surf was extremely dangerous and you wouldn't have wanted to go near the water. Is it the hotels fault? Casino is small but more than adequate. Pool was very nice...fresh and saltwater...swim up bar....small public beach in a bay area not right on the ocean. Night life in the hotel was quiet even though it lent itself to a South Beach environment. But actually liked it being quiet. If I was young might have been an issue. Manager Mr. Neuman was great and very accomodating. Would come back again.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Gsgrepas
Reviews.Content: The hotel is beautiful! The service was great. The rooms are very clean. I find it hard to believe some of the negative reviews below. As for the additional $5 a day fee, the hotel clearly states that an additional fee will be added per person, maybe some of you should read the fine print. My only issue was the parking. I suggest a better parking system. Maybe there should only be one ticket issued and stamped for the duration of the guest stay and when the guest goes in and out of the hotel they should not have to continue to get a ticket and have it stamped, it should just be a one time thing for the inconvenience to the guest. other then the parking I give the hotel an A+ and we will go each and every time we are in the beautiful island we would definitely recommend this hotel to our friends and family!

Reviews.Title: “Extremely Disappointed.”
Reviews.Author: greeneyes24
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I just recently came back from San Juan, Puerto Rico. We arrived at the Condado Plaza and it looked amazing, the lobby was beautiful just like the pictures. The hotel has a very nice miami feel to it. It took forever to get to our room because there was only one elevator working in the lobby so everyone had to cram into this tiny elevator. We finally checked into our room right away and the room was very nice and spacious. The only thing is that our balcony was flooded with water, because they failed to tell us that they were doing construction on the outside of the building. We had to go to the lobby and ask for another room. We then went to look at another room which had the same problem. Finally after looking at 2 different rooms we found one that didnt have a flooded balcony and went directly to the pools. The pools were very nice, but the beach is so disappointing very small and there is rocks and shells all over so you feel like you are walking on glass. The beach is public so anyone can go there and even stray dogs were running around. We ordered food at the restuarant by the pool, we had a hamburger and fries and chicken fingers and fries and two drinks the bill came out to $67.00. You have to pay $2.50 extra for slices of cheese. On the second day, after spending the day by the pool my boyfriend and I went to our room to relax a bit, upon entering the room we discovered that there was two men on the balcony painting. They were there for about 15 minutes and then when we went to the balcony and we realized that the balcony was flooded again and the construction workers had left big pieces of paint chips on the floor. We then went to the front desk and complained again, they gave us a resort credit for our inconvenience At this point we were a little fed up, we payed extra money for an ocean view and we couldnt really enjoy it. On the third day we so unhappy because we encountered the same problem once again , we decided to check out and check into another hotel in Isla Verde. If you ever decide to go to San Juan, this hotel is nice, but dont go there unless you are sure that they are completely done with their construction. When I made the reservation they told me that they were done with construction, which was not the truth. The area around the hotel can be a little boring, and the beach is very disappointing. If you are a beach person this is not the place to for you. Try to stay in Isla Verde the beach there is amazing and the hotels are so much nicer.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Beeper67
Reviews.Content: Hotel was great - perfect location. Rooms were wonderful, bed was so comfortable I had a hard time getting up in the morning. Looked just like the web site. We ate at the hotel the first morning and then ventured out to the local restaurants - much more reasonable prices. Pool was nice - two separate pools one that more for kids and one for adults. Wait staff on had for cocktails poolside. All staff polite and accommodating - we thoroughly enjoyed our stay and will come back.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and Location.”
Reviews.Author: DRman
Reviews.Content: Check In- A breeze we where up graded to a suite on the lagoon side. Room-Beautiful expect a little far from main hotel but we decided not to change,bed was great ,balcony small ,no wet bar but there is a fridge just went to store and stocked up.The bathroom and the room was in great shape everything was very clean alot of closet space and safe. Hotel-Like I said we where on the lagoon side and everything happens on the other side,the lobby and the hotel are decorated Art deco style and very Beautiful. Pools and Beach-Two pools at main hotel one salt water which is 6 feet deep and cold the other is regular pool water with bar and slide very nice.Beach is small but on the lagoon so very still no waves which is great because the Hotel beachs are so rough ,I never would try to swim there. Bar and Food-Only ate and drank at the pool bar and cafe very good but way over priced not even South Beach prices. A beer local 6 dollars and Rum mixed drink 10 Dollars. Old San Juan -Went twice once by Taxi and by car rental , is beautiful but lacks turistic directin. Yunque Rain Forest-Went by rent a car that we rented from Enterprice in the lagoon side lobby-The waterfall are amazing but a lot of walking and climbing.Now on are way down from the forest at Km 6 we stopped at great small Resturant with typical PR food it was the best food of the whole trip. Check out-Was the only Bad experince we had that did upset me a lot,as we were asking for the taxi leaving the hotel for airport I was running a little behind( 1:20 pm plane leaves at 2:55pm) a Doorman had about 7 people or party's waiting and calling one taxi at a time so he could make the tip ask him nicly if he could hurry as I needed to be airport and time was getting tight and his repley that should not have not waited so long to come to get a taxi.This doorman made me forget what a wonderful time we had at the condado Plaza.

Reviews.Title: “Swanky, Colorful, Great Pool and Restaurants”
Reviews.Author: Beaurex212
Reviews.Content: Gorgeous hotel that clearly has made an effort to make San Juan an alternative to South Beach. Swanky lobby, colorful bar (Eternal Lounge) and spacious, comfortable rooms with great lighting made for a pleasant stay. Had breakfast daily at Gusto D'Italia and snacks from poolside bar; from what my travel companions tell me, Striphouse was also worth a visit. Only issue I had with property, which just went through a major renovation, was the trek from front desk to my room, which was in another tower. So up the stairs, past the casino, across skybride and up to my room I went, with my suitcase. Not fun. My bathroom was also emiting a funny odor at one point during my stay and it was the first thing I'd notice when I walked in. Other than that, great property that is working out minor kinks. Highly recommend...it's on a great strip (Ashford Avenue) which is close to some of San Juan's best dining (Budatai, Ajili Mojili, South Beach) Pool area was gorgeous and jacuzzi delightful.

Reviews.Title: “Nice to look at but that is about it...”
Reviews.Author: TravelWiseBoston
Reviews.Content: Le me first state the few good aspects of this property: It is very modern and looks like something out of a movie or magazine, the bar tender we had on our first night was awesome and that is about it. We ended up spending about a hundred dollars in additional fees at check out as other people have stated which is ridiculous but if my experience was better I wouldn't have minded as much. We stayed in a suite which had a pleasant view of the road which was not what we asked for or book and for about $500 a night is totally unacceptable. Our suite was rather small but I could live with that because it was attractive and clean. Our hot water did not work when we went to shower to go out for our last night in San Juan. We called down to the desk and were told we would get a call back immediately. We waited over an hour then called again and were given an attitude finally a couple hours later as we were leaving a maintenance man was sent up after we already took cold showers which was hard to communicate he spoke no English. The beach isn't much of a beach and on our second to last day we were told the waves were too rough we could not use chairs and they didn't want people on the beach. Not to mention it is a very tiny public beach!! The final straw for me though was the fact they were filming what I was told was a movie in the hotel one day and we were told we couldn't use the elevators or escalator!! When I complained to the concierge I was told that I was falsely informed. I think if they were going to have all this going on and we4 were being blocked out of certain places I should have been informed of this when I called before I booked. I was left with a feeling of being ripped off and would not ever recommend this property to anyone. I am debating contacting the better business bureau about this resort.

Reviews.Title: “Not as Expected...Poor Service”
Reviews.Author: nitajaybee
Reviews.Content: Very unhappy with the additional hidden charges and hotel fees. I was quoted 4 different charges during my stay with a final charge of over $100.00 more than quoted on the website. Please be aware of additional charges of $5.00 per night per person in each room. I travelled with my daughter, a child, and was charged the additional person per room fee along with extra taxes, etc. I even talked with hotel management about my charges days prior to checkout, received a total cost but during checkout, the desk clerk stated that the manager left out some additional fees, therefore, I was charged even more for the room. I was very dissatisfied with this hotel and its staff entirely. The renovation of the Condado was not done very well.Our hotel room was not too clean. We had a bug crawling on the floor in our room on the first night. The rug in our room was heavily soiled. No towels were provided. Had to meet housekeeping in the halls during the morning rounds just to receive towels. However, the Condado Hotel is in a convenient location, close to the airport and city transportation buses but lots of construction is being done in the area. I loved the lagoon balcony view from our room. I would have prefered to stay in Old San Juan or the Holiday Inn where the service is much better and the rooms are much cleaner but the rooms were all booked. Parking at this hotel is an addtitonal $16.00 per day for guests but it's provided for free at the Holiday Inn. I would have appreciated at least an apology from the hotel staff for making our visit to San Juan so unpleasant. I will not stay at the Condado again no matter how many free night they offer. Hotel staff was not helpful. Need to provide better customer service and cleaner rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Lack of service kills it as my go to place in PR”
Reviews.Author: vicchickBrooklyn
Reviews.Content: It's the lack of service that kills this place. Everything else is pretty great. The place looks sharp. Kudos to whoever designed the renovation - it's sultry and chic. The location is great. The price is reasonable. But the service... They kick you out of your beach chairs to stack them up at 5:00 when there are still plenty of people enjoying them. The beach is crap but it would still be okay if they serviced it. We waited an hour for our drinks the 1st day. After waiting an hour the 2nd day, we went up to the bar to get them ourselves only to find out the orders were never placed. This is where the service starts to really rank. I made a comment that the drinks really should be on the house at this point and was told to go speak to the manager which we did. He didn't apologize and he didn't comp us either. He asked us where we were sitting on the beach which led us to believe he would follow up with a round on the house. Nada. This ticked me off so I mentioned it at checkout. The woman at the desk called over and was told he would do nothing for us. I could've probably swallowed that if he'd have schmoozed out some kind of apology but we didn't even get that. The desk clerk suggested I complain on the online survey which I did and received ABSOLUTELY NO ACKNOWLEDGEMENT. You can not claim to pride yourself on customer service if you do not even respond to a specific complaint. There is too much competition to be that lacking in customer courtesy and it's really too bad because I would have made this my go to place in Puerto Rico.

Reviews.Title: “Met my expectations”
Reviews.Author: jnwhi
Reviews.Content: I just returned from our 4 night stay. Overall the hotel was very nice and clean. The bathrooms were very large, as well as the rooms. We were upgraded to from a city view room to an ocean view for no charge. This was nice and views were breathtaking. The outside terrace, off the lobby lounge, was very relaxing and had great views as well. The pool was great with plenty of chairs. The poolside service was great. I see that prior reviews stated the drinks are expensive. To me the drinks seemed to be the same price as any beachfront hotel with pool side service. The lobby lounge was packed at night and really fun. There were many photo shoots going on during my stay, it was interesting to see. I was a disappointed with the restaurants on site. Many were not opened during parts of the day and the lobby lounge did not serve food. There should have been more food outlets for a hotel of this size. The Italian restaurant had great breakfast and ice cream. The beach was small, but that did not bother me because I am a pool person. If you usually stay at Marriott, Hilton, etc, this hotel is totally different in terms of convenience and hands on service. Other than at the pool service, none of the staff offered assistance prior to asking. Part of the reason I choose this hotel was because of the location and the ability to walk to restaurants. However, none of the restaurants within walking distance were appetizing. We went out to the Marriott one night for dinner and dancing, and it seemed a little nicer. All in all, this hotel met my expectations and I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “condado Plaza Loks Chic!!!”
Reviews.Author: malenky
Reviews.Content: The renovation is spectacular and very chic. From the lobby, to the rooms, to the restaurants, to the pools, and outside grounds, this place sparkles! Checking in was a breeze but we came in at 3 AM. We were upgraded to the ocean side building (thanks to Henry E. Neumann!!!!) and there were 2 pools, one even had salt water, which is more enjoyable than chlorine and a Jacuzzi. The pool area is unbelievable; the young man got our towels and our chairs ready after we asked him to get us set up in the shade. There is great water slide and a nice swim up bar in one pool with the best service with a smile. There are a few private secluded areas that looked very romantic, and there was a tent set up for massages by the sea. Although the beach is public, there was security and it was safe. The beach area is small and overlooks a bridge over Condado lagoon, but it's nice enough. The beach is in the bay that pretty much guarantees no waves but the ocean is a bit rocky. One of the greatest things to do is to grab one of the many hammocks and just relax under the palm trees. We had lunches by the pool every day and the service was good for a simple lunch fare. The view from the room was breathtaking and the sounds of the crashing waves against the sea wall were so soothing. Everything was new and the bathroom was huge, and had plenty of storage for clothes. The bathroom was enormous, and yes, contained the closet, the mini bar, and the coffee maker. It seems a bit odd! In the Italian restaurant where breakfast is served, the staff was slow and sometimes inattentive. Breakfast portions are huge!

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: ViniRossi
Reviews.Content: After a disappointing start (room overlooking renovations), we enjoyed a wonderful stay as a result of the corrective action taken by staff. The hotel is in the 'beach area' but also one of those closest to old San Juan so the ability to swap between one area and the other was excellent. The further up the beach you go, the further away from the old town you are. And on a busy night going to dinner in the old town with standstill traffic, that makes a big difference. Would definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible service, dirty rooms, tiny bathrooms”
Reviews.Author: Alfonsouno
Reviews.Content: Our room had pubic hair throughout the room. The bathroom is tiny, no bathtub. Balcony was beautiful, but views of other balconies that have not been kept up. Customer service screwed our reservation twice. Customer service was not willing to do anything to correct our stay. We were willing to stay for 10 days but canceled our last five days for poor service and looking for a better hotel. I wouldn't stay here again if they gave us the rooms. Stay down the street at the Marriot or Hilton, not HERE!!!!

Reviews.Title: “A little disappointed”
Reviews.Author: reichspot
Reviews.Content: When our travel agent gave us the information about the Condado, we were excited. It met all our needs- a casino and a beach. However, we were disappointed. The beach is small and crowded with kids from the area and the casino was small too. (I did win though, so I'm not complaining too loudly.) The hotel was being renovated when we arrived, which we didn't know when we booked. The room was nice and clean. In the evening, there was only one restaurant open. We had asked for an upscale hotel, and this did not meet my expectations. The view out the back of the hotel is beautiful- with rocks and surf. The immediate area didn't have much to offer. The beach was a big deal to me, so I probably wouldn't return. I was looking foward to something prettier, larger and less public. The hotel does have many convenient day trips from the lobby, which was great. We went to the rain forest, snorkeling, Old San Juan and the rum factory and had a really nice time.

Reviews.Title: “Not very professional..”
Reviews.Author: Jla81
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Condado Plaza for some nights in February. The hotel looks nice from the first glance, but most of the renovations seem to be on the surface, windows and balconies in the rooms are showing their age and are dirty. Service at the hotel was quite poor. We had issues with the safe in our room and those issues could not be fixed. We called to the front desk about this, but first we had to hold on the phone for 15 minutes and then the connection broke and the same started all over again. Finally we got another room but it had the same problem with the safe, it could not be used! We called front desk again and again we were put on hold. When we got hold of them, help was promised, but it never arrived. We were fed up of using our holiday and time for this. In the italian restaurant where breakfast is served the staff was slow and rude. We were in a hurry so asked for the check twice and it took 20 minutes to arrive! We decided not to tip so much as we felt the service was not worth it, upon which the waiter said: 'Maybe next time you should tip me more'. Unbelievable. Checking out took 30 minutes, there were 4 agents and a huge queue, but only 2 of the agents checked guests out. The hotel itself seems to think it is a world-class hotel, but as seasoned travellers we certainly do not think so. If the service issues would be solved, then this could be a nice hotel, as the location is great.

Reviews.Title: “just fine”
Reviews.Author: latte4me
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a night before our cruise and upgraded to an oceanfront room. It appears to have been recently remodeled and was very clean. Ordered room service twice; both times it came promptly and was delicious, although somewhat expensive (but that's how it usually goes at these resorts...) I'd definitely stay there again - the only drawback was the lack of staff at the front desk, which made checking out a time-consuming process. Otherwise, it was fine.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed Thoughts”
Reviews.Author: BXTRAVELER1
Reviews.Content: When I arrived at the Condado, I was initially very excited as I pulled up in my rental car. From the outside, I felt like I was going to be staying at a top notch hotel with impecable service. While my overall stay was pleasant, I had mixed feelings about the hotel. PROS: It is definitely in the best location. Situated at the end of the Condado strip within walking distance of shopping, cafes, rest. and other hotels while just steps from the bridge to old san juan where you can find the best nightlife in the carribean. The pool area is very relaxing. You have many options. You can sit in a shaded area on a lounge chair along the larger pool, or roast in the sun by the smaller pool. Or, for a perfect, relaxing nap you can chill on one of the hammocks strung between palm trees on the main lawn overlooking the ocean. The overall atmosphere down by the pool is amazing and sure to wipe away any stress you came down with. What makes it even better is the outstanding pool staff of waitresses and bartenders. They were so friendly, fast and personable that I was compelled to leave a very generous tip. However, the pricing of the food made me choke!!! $13.00 for a turkey wrap..Even in NY we do not have prices like that. The cleaning staff do a great job as well and are friendly. CONS: As great as the hotel appears to look from the outside, I could not believe how they overlook small details that really ruined my initial impression of the hotel. For example, the window in my room was so filthy and dingy that I could barely get a clear view. My room also had many marks and scrapes on the walls. I also noticed paint peeling from the outside of the hotel near the balconies. For a hotel that just underwent major renovations, I don't see how they can allow these very visable eyesores to exist; especially since it would not take much effort to fix. That makes me wonder how much they do care about customer service and appearance. If they want to classify themselves as a "luxury hotel", you cannot have these conditions. Also, when I checked in, I had to wait for 10 min. while the clerk was on the phone. And, he was not friendly at all. When I asked him about late check out, he gave me an attitude. Not the right thing to do to a first time guest. I was also a little dispointed with the beach. Having paid the $$, I would expect to have a little more privacy on the beach. They seem to allow all the locals to use the beach which got very crowded and noisy. If I wanted to go to a public beach, I could have stayed at a much cheaper hotel in downtown San Juan and walked to a beach. Overall, I did enjoy my stay. But as a frequent carribean traveler, you get more critical of the little details that make a big difference. With the exception of my "check in clerk", the staff was very professional and accomodating. I did get the late check out without much resistance and the girl who checked me out explained the bill in great detail and even found a mistake from the parking garage...THANK YOU!!! I would stay here again just because of the location of the hotel and the outstanding pool and lounge area. But please, rethink about allowing the beach to be open to the public and take care of those little eyesores. They can really bring the appearance down and make the hotel look sloppy and dirty. I will be back!!

Reviews.Title: “Perhaps things are better now...”
Reviews.Author: Banks3
Reviews.Content: I don't know where this will end up on the list of reviews, but I stayed for one night during a lay over in San Juan in February of 2007. Although it would appear that the renovations that plagued visitors at the time ended sometime in the fall of 2007, my experience was in an already-renovated room. My impression was that the renovations were mostly cosmetic in my room and you could see the true age of the hotel just beneath the freshly stuccoed paint and behind the wall panel lights. The bathrooms were stunning, but the platform beds were an odd touch and I couldn't help wondering if the interior designer was entirely sane. I couldn't get in-room internet access to save my life. On the other hand, the view from the patio was breathtaking. I will say this: in 2007, they were really trying.

Reviews.Title: “Would definitely stay there again”
Reviews.Author: natron06
Reviews.Content: - Nicely furnished and clean rooms - Friendly staff - Couple decent, fairly priced restaurants within the hotel - Well kept pool area that looks out on the ocean - Good selection of restaurants within walking distance (you should definitely check out Ajili Mojili if you stay anywhere in Condado) - Close proximity to Old San Juan - short bus ride for the adventurous My wife and I had a positive experience here and I would definitely recommend to friends/family.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service”
Reviews.Author: ItalianTravelerLargo
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Condado Plaza Hotel and Casino for 8 days in which we were treated very well. All the employees we had contact with were very hospitable and friendly. We booked a tour to the rainforst through the hotel. The van was on time, picking us up in front of the hotel. Our driver was very friendly and knowledgable of the rainforst and the surrounding area. I am looking forward to going back to Puerto Rico and will stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice resort”
Reviews.Author: Rhodie12
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Condado for a week in January. The room was recently renovated and especially nice, since we faced the ocean. The staff was always helpful. The hotel has three nice pools, including one with salt water. It also has a real, well equipped fitness center. Location is good with lots of restaurants within walking distance. Great place and not expensive!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel for Pre-cruise”
Reviews.Author: lvs2cruz
Reviews.Content: Stayed one day pre-cruise and can't say enough nice things about the hotel and staff. We got in to San Juan around 1 PM and were able to check in early to a large room in the renovated main tower. My sister stayed in the part of the hotel across the street via a walkway and her room was nice, but her bathroom was about one fourth the size. Our room had a city view, but we could see the cruise ship docked from our balcony. The lobby area was gorgeous -- very clean and moderrn, and even had a huge fish tank to watch if waiting for a taxi. The bathroom was really huge and spotless. The front desk guys were helpful with directions. Starbucks adjoins the hotel. Make a left as you go out the front door and there are many restaurants, shops, etc. Pool area was clean and had lots of available lounge chairs. This was just a very pleasant hotel stay. Would recomend and stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic experience!!!”
Reviews.Author: bal2278
Reviews.Content: Wow!! I can't say enough great things about our experience at the Condado Plaza. We went this past weekend for a pre-celebration of my 30th birthday and found the experience to be extremely enjoyable. First off, the decor of the hotel and our room were pretty impressive and chic. However, even before seeing either, our great time all began with outstanding service from Henry Neumann - if you have the opportunity to meet him, please do - he's the best and very knowledgeable, helpful, you name it! He answered all of my questions and concerns prior to coming and even gave us a complimentary upgrade to the ocean view room. Thank gosh! The view and the sounds of the ocean can't be beat. We loved the staff at the pool - Sterling, Joey, Juan (trivia king) - they were all wonderful, accomodating and made our pooltime a ton of fun. My boyfriend is a big gambler and he had a great time in the casino too. I read a recent review of the Italian restaurant's service - I must agree that was probably the only downfall of the entire place - it took over 35 minutes to get our breakfast. BUT, I guess we didn't mind so much b/c we just enjoyed the view and being on vacation, we weren't in a rush to go anywhere! Oh! And with regards to the steakhouse, please note that you'll pay a pretty penny for drinks. I think we stopped in for 2 glasses of wine and it cost us about $40! However, there are so many great restaurants, shops, etc. right next to the hotel and down the street, so there honestly is never a lack of anything to do, see, etc. In fact, we had a tough time trying to pinpoint where we should eat next! Also, everywhere we went, the people of Puerto Rico/Condado/Old San Juan were so incredibly gracious and hospitable. We'd go back in a heartbeat and when we do, we wouldn't consider staying anywhere else. Thank you for the wonderful stay! :)

Reviews.Title: “Skeptical but pleasantly suprised!”
Reviews.Author: dsmulligan
Reviews.Content: I think most of the reviews I read were written before the renovations so I was a little apprehensive about staying here. But I was pleasantly surprised by this hotel. The days prior to my stay, I was at the Sheraton in Old San Juan for business. Then I switched to the Condado because it had a nicer pool, a beach area and it was less expensive. -The hotel lobby and rooms are very trendy, brand new and beautiful. - The beach area is small and overlooks a highway, but it's nice enough. I wouldn't suggest going to this hotel if you are a beach person rather than a pool person. The pool area is wonderful and clean. -The staff is, overall, pleasant. They spoke better english at this hotel than at the Sheraton Old San Juan. -Beautiful gym, business center and other communal areas. -Don't bet on using the free wireless internet in the rooms. It is sh*t. -The hotel restaurants were OK (I would suggest walking down the road a little to more quaint and authentic restaurants). First day, I went to the Italian restaurant upstairs for a sandwich which was OK - next night went to StripHouse, the steak restaurant. It was a nice meal, although the steak was not cooked the way I wanted. StripHouse was very pricey considering the quality and service. -While it seemed like most of the construction was done, there were some areas that still have construction ongoing, specifically outside. The Laguna Tower, where I stayed, seemed to be finished. It was beautiful. -Casino is OK. It's what you would expect of a small hotel casino in San Juan. It's on Vegas or even Atlantic City... Overall, good stay! I would suggest staying here!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Nice Location, Good Food, Fabulous Pool”
Reviews.Author: danielleinqueens
Reviews.Content: First off allow me to say I work in a 5 Diamond hotel in NYC, I have high expectations. I read many reviews; several complaints and was some what confused on what hotel to stay at. Well this property was beautiful, the view was great, the staff was friendly; everyone was nice from Cesar the bellman to the waitresses by the pool. They have a Starbucks in the lobby which made my day. The pool area was perfect and equipped with a water slide. All the pictures on the hotel web site are true to life. That is how the hotel looks. We ate at both places...the italian place was ok. It is commercial italian, decent food and the gentleman (soft spoken, maybe Hatian) that serves the bread went above and beyond. The other place The Strip house was fabulous, GET THE CASINO CLAMS-if you cant afford to eat there atleast get the clams they were the best i've had in my life. Our room resembled the ocean view picture on the web site and I felt like we were sleeping on the ocean. There are hammocks to rest on, a fabulous bar area that is very modern and a small beach. This is 15 minutes or so outside of San Juan, my boyfriend and I are impatient so we took a 12.00 taxi most of the time, but you can take a 75 cent bus that is located outside the front door.

Reviews.Title: “swanky expensive”
Reviews.Author: GetawayNewJersey
Reviews.Content: The lobby area and our room had a very retro swanky feel. The pool side was great and shaded with many palm trees. However, the pool water was cold and service was very sssllloooowwww. Get your food & drink yourself. I felt with the high price of the hotel it would be more tailored to their guests. Maybe I'm spoiled I've stayed at the Ritz before.

Reviews.Title: “The Worst Front Desk Service - KAIRA and the other woman”
Reviews.Author: Cherol
Reviews.Content: I just called to try to ask a simple question to the Front Desk and the first time they left me on hold for 13 minutes, until I obviously hang-up, the second time they transferred me to their central reservations when I did not even wanted to make a reservation (they totally ignored my question) and the third time, CAN YOU BELIEVE THAT THEY PUT ME ON HOLD AGAIN for 5 minutes, until I hang up again. This is extremely ridiculous, people. I am getting married next winter in PR and I was considering this hotel to book about 50 rooms for all my guests that are coming from the US, but forget about it. I dont doubt that the facilities are wonderful, but Mr. Manager, you definitely need to work on your staff, specially that Kaira and the other girl behind the front desk tonight. I prefer for my guest to stay at a more humble place and get the treatment they deserve, after all the $ they are paying.

Reviews.Title: “Resort staff GREAT, Italian staff not so much!!”
Reviews.Author: elliotgang
Reviews.Content: I would also like to comment on the Italian restaurant-Gusto D'Italia at the Condado, which I discovered after speaking with the hotel front desk about the service we received (er, didn't receive) is independently owned/operated from the Resort, it was the absolute worst service and food I have ever had!! S-L-O-W doesn't even begin to describe it and the manager on duty actually argued with us about why we had not even received our drinks after 20 minutes and another family came right in and sat down and were served right away and that was just one of the 3 days we went there for brkfst! UNBELIEVABLE!! We resorted to finding other dining outside the resort, we HIGHLY recommend The Hacienda right down the street from the Condado for breakfast/lun/din, great seaside affordable dining experience, their coffee was awesome too! The rest of our stay was awesome, the hotel was beautifully decorated, very chic! One of the many highlights of our stay at the Condado, we had our 15 yr old son with us, was the staff at the Aqua Bar, Sterling, David and Joey (Eyes). These guys were the greatest, Sterling makes a mojito to die for, my son really made fast friends of these three, he looked fwd to each day going down to the pool and chatting with them, if you go tell them the Elliot's from Indiana say HI!. Wish the beach was bigger but still a great location for being close to a ton of things to do and see, El Yonque (caribbean rainforest) is a must see and El Morro in Old San Juan was amazing as well! WE LOVED PUERTO RICO!!!! I can't wait to go back and yes we would definitely stay at the Condado again!! Elliot's - Indiana

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful. Stylish. New Renovated Hotel”
Reviews.Author: NycPhoto5
Reviews.Content: Stayed at The Condado in November for a 5 night Stay. Even though the hotel was under construction ( lobby & Pool Area ) This Hotel was Top Notch. With the look of a W Hotel & a much lower Price. We had a wonderful stay. The room was Excellent, Clean, New, Modern, Huge Bathrooms & Balcony. The maid service & support staff where Amazing. Even though the Condado area itself is all under construction and a bit rundown. This hotel provides a wonderful mirage to mask it all. The Pool, Beach, Gym & Casino gave us all the entertainment needed for a weekend getaway. This will be the ONLY Hotel we stay at when visiting PR again.

Reviews.Title: “Very much improved from 3 years ago!”
Reviews.Author: richmarl10
Reviews.Content: We stood at the Condado 3 years ago, and decided to go back. The hotel is newly redone, and quite beautiful. We like the fact that it is in the city and we can try all the wonderful restaurants nearby. The rooms are all redone and very clean. I don't however like the fact that the refrigator and coffee maker are in the bathroom. The bathroom is very large and spotless! The bathroom doors need LOCKS, (no locks on the doors). The beach is very, very small, that is the biggest downfall for this hotel, you have no privacy at all. The lagoon is wonderful if you don't like waves, and also clean. The staff is very friendly and helpful, we would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “A Mixed Reaction”
Reviews.Author: sleds
Reviews.Content: We arrived on New Years Day in the evening. We left our cab and walked into an empty lobby. We were told to take the elevator, walk past the casino, over a skywalk to the other building where we were told we would find the hotel's desk. The desk turned out to be a banquet table in a hall. It was not an aspicious start. Once we checked in, we were assigned a room and had to walk back over the skywalk, past the casino to the elevator, hauling our carry-ons and coats. My husband says you only have one chance to make a good impression and this hotel blew it! We had a remodeled room, one with the closet in the bathroom, which seemed unusual. Our room itself was beautiful with a great view. But putting one's clothes in the same area as the shower seems very odd. We ate at the sushi bar and at the Italian cafe and were pleased with the food and service. After the first evening we rarely saw people in the halls or cafes. It was difficult to feel that we were at a nice resort -- there was absolutley no resort feel to the place. Walking time and again into the empty first floor lobby was just not pleasant! Our major gripe was with the Concierge. We called and asked for restaurant recommendations. We were told that ____ (home of the Pina Colada) was great! We went and were served food which appeared to us to have been cooked much earlier in the day. The next day we called the Concierge again and asked for further recommendations. We were given the name of the same place. Trying to get something different we asked the Concierge for another suggestion. We were told she was busy at the moment and would call us back. She never did, although we waited. So, we went to Marmalade in Old Town San Juan and were delighted. The call back from the Concierge never came, but we didn't care. We went to Marmalade the next night too! All in all, I didn't think that this hotel gives good value for the money. And this is the first time I have ever given a hotel a less than glowing recommendation on this forum.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing vacation”
Reviews.Author: luv2fly123
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for a week in January, and although the first day wasn't great, the remainder of our stay went well. When we checked in we were given a room with a broken balcony door; when I called I was offered to have maintenance come and "take a look" at it. I told them to provide me with another room and then they can send a maintenace person to fix that room, as I am not on vacation to sit and wait for a door to be fixed. I was given another room right away. Upon entering the new room, I went onto the balcony to see the view, only to find that my "city view" room was a view of a building next door under construction with a man hanging on a rope painting, and dirt splattered all over the balcony . In addition, there were only 3 tiny drawers to unpack clothing etc. , and they were located in the bathroom as was the mini fridge and coffee maker! Yes, you read right! The bathroom and closet and mini fridge are all in 1 room behind a sliding door. (I can't imagine why one would need to have their shower/toilet in the same vicinity as their coffee maker and clothing?) I placed another call to the front desk and was told there weren't any other rooms available . I asked to speak to the manager and the manager told me the same, she said that she would call me back later in the day if anything came up. I waited for her call and got no call. I called back and was told they do not know where that manager was and she would call me back. I again got no call back and when I called back once again, a wonderful and very helpful man named David explained that he would review the situation and call me back. He indeed called me back (after explaining to him that if he didn't I'd seek another hotel to stay at) and was given an excellent room! We had a view of the bay and city and actually had a closet that wasn't located in the bathroom! As for the restaurants- the "strip house" has a magnificant atmosphere, as does the Italian restaurant. Food and service is average but the decor is pleasant. The rest of our stay was great and as long as you are looking for a relaxing vacation this hotel will meet your needs.

Reviews.Title: “Lively fun on the strip”
Reviews.Author: olde_tyme_style
Reviews.Content: I actually stayed at this property almost 4 years ago. I had stayed once before in 2002. The hotel and central location to surrounding areas was so great that I decided to return. The room had water views of the bay and the ocean as well as the hotel strip and was in a high rise tower with a balcony. The room was clean, comfortable and the bathroom was nicely done. The hotel is beachfront with lounge chairs on the ocean side and has a salt water pool and freshwater pool on the ocean side. The pools were well kept, but a little crowded with guests. Nothing bad though. There are many lounge chairs near the pool and on the ocean side of the property as well as scattered hammocks to catch the ocean breeze. There are also some nice hidden places to take tropical background pictures. On the bay side there is a great pool. Not many guests realize this pool is there and therefore, it is not crowded no matter when you take a dip. The poolside also has lounge chairs and is uncrowded. There is also a nice jacuzzi near this pool. You will most likely have it to yourself. At night you can sit in the jacuzzi and listen to the coquis in the background. There is also a watersports pavilion (I think it's privately owned) at the bayside if you walk down the drive along side of the hotel. I rented a kayak. The employee took my room number to charge the rental to my room but the best part was I was never charged. I also noticed other non-motorized rentals, I particularly remember aqua cycles. You get to use the entire bay and even toward the ocean, if you dare. The casino is large and fun and is always happening at night. There are a lot of games to choose from and many people playing, creating a nice atmosphere. The hotel has various on site restaurants. The buffet was my favorite for breakfast. There was hot and cold varieties. Try it at least once. There is an amazing ocean view through the wall of windows. The ocean spray even sometimes hits the window. The location can't be beaten. Steps from the main hotel is the bus into Old San Juan. It stops running about 10 or 11, but a cab ride back later is reasonable. The hotel is also on the Condado hotel strip - great for food, fun, shopping, casino hopping, bars. There is even a small public beach on the ocean side if you walk down a ways. The conciege can set you up with fun excursions to explore the rainforest or a nighttime kayaking expedition (transportation provided) from the ocean in Farjado through a channel into a bioluminescent bay. It was such a unique experience I will never forget (wear a bathing suit, you can hop in for a swim and watch the water light up flurescent blue as you move) I would certainly return in the future if I had the opportunity.

Reviews.Title: “relaxed and unbothered”
Reviews.Author: goodbyegirl
Reviews.Content: Had done research thru trip advisor and was anxious about choice. that was put to rest upon arrival. while there is some construction still taking place the staff makes up for any minor construction matters still left to handle. the cleaning staff on the fifth floor was magnificient. recommend you book ocean tower. the strip house was pricey but worth every penny (food snob that I am) the sushi was wonderful and for what you are paying the italian restaurant is adequate. the decor inside and the pool outside very soothing from the hot 84 degree sun. the food in the pool area was quite surprisingly good. I would definitely stay again and would recommend. A short walk away is Ropa Vieja(?SP) native restaurant. The food was magnificent and so was the service. Sit back have a glass of sangria and let your troubles pass you by. Vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: hondacrvguy
Reviews.Content: We just got back from an excellent stay at the Condado Plaza! When the lady and I were trying to find a nice hotel in San Juan, I came across their website. From the pictures, it looked beautiful - which it was! I then read review upon this website and came across Henry Neumann and he ensured us that we would have a great stay - and they delivered. The room was beautiful! We had an ocean view room. The pictures on their website really do show the actual product! Most of the staff we came across was nice, some need a lesson in hospitality. We ate at the italian restaurant - while the portions were great, the food was just so-so. They were putting the finishing touches on the swim-up bar, which was a nice touch. The staff poolside made sure we always had a drink in hand. Beware though - Drinks are VERY, VERY expensive! Beach is small, but does the touch. Overall, we had an excellent stay! If San Juan is ever in out travel plans, we'll stay here again in a heart beat!

Reviews.Title: “Okay stay”
Reviews.Author: SSSNES
Reviews.Content: Overall the stay was nice and the place fun. I was traveling with a cousin for a girls getaway. The pools were great, the food at the pool not great and very pricey. The drinks were good. The beach was fine, just expect small and not the typical resort beach. My cousin said the massage she had poolside was the best she had ever had. Upon check in (which took a really long time due to a huge group arriving at the same time) we were greeted by someone who obviously wished she had called in sick that day. We had reserved a room with two beds and was told our room only had one double bed. We were told there were no other rooms and no cots. Good thing we are small and like each other because we were bunking together. Our key did not work once we finally made it to our room having waiting for the one working elevator for a really long time. SOOO we had to go back and wait in another really long line to get a working key. No apology what so ever from the staff at check in. In fact we were treated like we were putting her out for being in the line again! When we stayed (12/06) there was a lot of construction and they started really early in the morning. The room was always clean and the bathroom really nice. The cab drivers out front were always very helpful, polite and efficient. I would stay again IF the construction were complete.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommend - Nicely upgraded rooms”
Reviews.Author: TravellerfromPhilly
Reviews.Content: Really a beautiful place to stay. Rooms pictured on their web site matched the room we stayed in. The hotel has been recently remodeled. I don't know what the rooms looked liked before but I can tell you that my room was really nice. The bathroom was the highlight - glass walls on 3 sides! We paid for a city view room but were automatically upgraded to an ocean view. It always helps to ask politely to see if there any upgrades available! The occupancy rate was also 52% at the time which also might have been helpful. We ate in the family restaurant for breakfast - reasonable prices-excellent service. Pool and beach areas were well maintained. If I ever go to PR again, I'll stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Very Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: SPARNewYork
Reviews.Content: The Condado Plaza is a high rise motel with upscale prices. We stayed for a week from Christmas to New Year's Eve and were very disappointed. Staff were friendly and responsive. We should know because we had to ask for so many problems to be corrected such as: banging air conditioner, flickering lights, coffee and shampoo in room not replaced, room never vacuumed, etc. We gave up on asking for the filthy windows to be cleaned. The Italian restaurant had the slowest service, waiters with attitude and several meals were sent back because they were inedible (mealy pancakes and a cold, dried out hamburger). The $10 hot dog at the pool was a joke and the extra $5 for a few french fries was and insult. By the way, a note to the poolside cook, fish and chips does not mean fish and potato chips! This place just does not get it. Try the Marriott or La Concha just down the street. They are both hip, beautiful and even a few dollars less expensive.

Reviews.Title: “A little disapointing”
Reviews.Author: MissyGalway
Reviews.Content: We stayed here after a 6 night cruise, it looked lovely in the brochure. It was a bit dissapointing, the rooms are a nice size but a little grubby. The staff were ok some were nice but we found the check in staff a little rude and snappy. They had a selection of restaurants but they were quiet expensive. It is in a nice location but away from the old town and you need a taxi to access most areas. For the price its an average hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic family vacation!!!!”
Reviews.Author: nina517
Reviews.Content: Our title summarizes it all--we had a fantastic time at the Condado Plaza. Henry Neumann was the only person who could guarantee us adjoining rooms. We called a couple of other hotels in the general area who said they could have 2 rooms, but couldn't guarantee adjoining. Traveling with 3 small children, it was de rigueur for us to have this. Henry was great, and set us up in two fabulous rooms. Everything was new, shiny, clean, perfect!! The pool was clean and very nice. The poolside service from Sterling was exceptional. The elevator from the lobby level down tot he pool level was out of order during our stay, but the very attentive pool staff was always there to give me a hand with my 1-year old daughter's stroller down the stairs. The beach was great and the service was attentive and friendly. We were blessed with perfect weather despite nothing but rain for the three weeks prior. The Gusto d'Italia restaurant was a great option for our first evening dinner. It was family friendly, the food was hot, well presented, portions were appropriate, and they served our kids quickly (we'd had a long day of travel and quick, hot and good was what we needed!).
