I can't remember the name of the waitress who helped us, but she was outstanding and my 7-year old is still talking about her! Unfortunately I can't recommend them for breakfast--it was pretty bad, but that's not the hotel's doing, as they are unrelated to the hotel. That said, it's a huge convenience to have this restaurant there. The Strip House is open!! We didn't dine here, but it certainly looked like it would be a lot of fun and a great meal. The Starbucks right at the hotel is very convenient. My husband ran out for yogurt, fruit, fantastic coffee and delicious spinach empanadas and quesitos in the mornings. Yum! Sure, there's still some construction to be wrapped up, and the place looks a little sparse, BUT it is going to be absolutely spectacular. The decor is minimalist and modernist, with a rich color palette. Very tasteful and elegant. The room decor is in keeping with this same design, and everything flows very smoothly together. The music piping through the speakers is Vegas cool around the lobby bar area. This is going to be a rockin' happening place when it's all done!! Our entire experience at the Condado Plaza was really amazing. We were thrilled with how friendly, attentive and helpful the entire staff was--from the housekeeping folks to the upper management. We are already anticipating our next family vacation to Puerto Rico and will definitely include the Condado Plaza in our plans. A big thanks to everyone who made our stay so unbelievably wonderful!!

Reviews.Title: “The Condado is So-So”
Reviews.Author: Peepsluv
Reviews.Content: Overall our stay was pleasant at this hotel. However, there were little things that made the stay at the Condado less than ideal. This is a fine place to drop your bags and go but I would not recommend it for couples wanting to snuggle and lounge. First, The Good: The great thing about the Condado is that it is half way between Isla Verde and Old San Juan so if you are interested in visiting those places, this may be the best location. The tiny beach attached to the hotel was perfect and the natural rock formations were a buffer to the strong waves that crash in making it an enjoyable place to swim. But watch your feet on the volcanic rocks that lurk at the bottom! The staff at the hotel was very friendly and attentive. The pool areas are open 24hrs so we were in the hot tub in the wee hours and were checked on and brought fresh towels by the security staff. Very nice! The drinks served by the pool were strong and tasty and we kept them flowing!! There are two towers. We chose to stay on the Bay side as construction is still happening on the Beach side. The Bay was beautiful to look at and that side of the hotel is very quiet. The other stuff: This is not the place to go for a romantic get away. The rooms are nothing special. There were visible cracks, water leak marks and broken moulding in the bathroom. The outside is still under construction. Months ago when we were booking the trip we were told that construction would be done before we arrived and we read about it being torn apart in reviews back in June. The trek to the main hotel which houses the casino and restaurants and has access to the main pool and beach areas, reminded me of being in the farthest ends of a Vegas resort. Having to take two elevator rides and walking down halls and across a bridge to get to the main hotel isn't ideal. Especially when one of the elevators was not working the whole time we were there. The food by the pool leaves much to be desired. I would recommend walking up the street and grabbing some local food or even a sandwich from Subway (yes, Subway is better than the pool food). If gambling is your thing, this casino is tiny. I would save my chips and head to El San Juan Hotel and Casino in Isla Verde. The Condado area as a whole seems to be in a state of rejuvenation. I'm sure the fact that we were there during low season had something to do with it. Although there are ritzy shops like Gucci and Cartier on the strip, there isn't much else going on. A few local restaurants but lots of construction which takes away from the overall landscape. Isla Verde would be a better place to stay if you want to lounge by the beach or Old San Juan if beach access is not as important to you.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty room”
Reviews.Author: NewJerseyIraida
Reviews.Content: I stood at this hotel while it was underconstruction. My room had a beautiful view to the water, but the room was DIRTY and the check in was horrible. First I checked in around 5pm and they gave me the wrong key when I went down stairs they reprogramed my key to someone elses room. I had to go back down stairs and reprogram the key to the correct room. Once inside I found that several things were missing from the room, like coffee pot, hair dryer. also I found food in the fridge belonging to the previous guest. Also the TV had three channels only and when I called they said they can not do anything about it for several days because they hae not gotten to my floor to program the TVs. To make things worse I found black hair in the bad and in the bathroom floor. mind you I have brown hair. I called house keeping and they send some one to clean the room after three hour. The hotel claimed they were booked and were not able to change my room. Once the house keeping lady arrived she noticed the refridge was disconnected, and two of the three lamps were missing light bulbs. I had stood at this hotel when it was the wyndham and had a no problems.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: tee-em
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in a number of hotels in the world and the Condado Plaza has the most unique rooms we have seen. Don't let the exterior of the hotel fool you. Guest check-in is on the second floor Mezzanine level and connects by overland bridge to the casino and rest of the hotel. Major renovations are still being done on the Mezzanine floor but there is a great Italian Restaurant on that level. We arrived late and they were happy to serve us at 12:00 midnight (It is open till 1:00 am on weekends although the guest services book says it closes at midnight. We had been upgraded by Mr. Neuman to an ocean view room and it was beautiful. The view to the ocean and to old San Juan from not only the balcony but also the windows on two sides of the room is spectacular. You can't beat the sound of the waves on the beach immediately underneath your room. The rooms themselves are brightly decorated in a contemporary style with a very comfortable pillow top king bed, an ultra modern L shaped couch, marble working table, and flat screen tv. The bathroom is huge with a completely glassed in shower and double sliding glass and wood doors. Contrary to what I had read in previous (all older) reviews, the staff we very professional and friendly. We would like to specifically thank Mr. Neuman for his speedy personal response to all the questions and concerns we had before booking. No canned response here like in many of the large chains (if you can even find someone to contact). He had advised us that the hotel had undertaken major initiates in staff training and it shows. We can hardly wait until the renovations are totally finished so we can return to this beautiful property.

Reviews.Title: “Henry's The Best!!”
Reviews.Author: skhirt43
Reviews.Content: We didn't get the chance to stay at the Condado due to an airline snafu but the customer service we received from Mr. Henry Neumann needs to be acknowledged. He gave us exceptional service from the time of our booking right through our cancellation. We will definitely stay here in the future if we are going to be in San Juan. Thank you, Henry, for everything! :)

Reviews.Title: “Don't Even Consider Staying Anywhere Else !!!!!”
Reviews.Author: BroncoBill
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 nights Oct. 2 & 3. Check in was a breeze at 1:45pm. The ocean-view room was immaculately clean, with refrig. safe, hairdryer, coffeemaker, and upscale selection of shampoos and lotions. The bathroom was very large, marble and mahogany with glass shower. The view from the balcony of room 716 was totally awesome---overlooking the ocean and Old San Juan. ALL of the elevators are working in the hotel, and yes, there is some renovation going on in some areas, but they are being done in such a way that you don't really notice---no inconvenience whatsoever. The pool areas are spotlessly clean, and very well staffed. The main pool area has food service available and beach assess, with a swim-up bar. The entire staff at this hotel is one of the best I have ever encountered. Whatever you need is available, fast, and always with a smile. Joey at the pool bar is a great source of information on the area, and a fun guy. Makes you feel right at home. Guest Services printed out my boarding pass the morning of departure, complimentary, which saved me some time at the airport. The ONLY bad thing-----I had to leave, but will be back !!!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent experience at the Condado Plaza”
Reviews.Author: beckster94
Reviews.Content: We spent several days at the Condado Plaza recently. I have the highest praise for their entire staff and the service we experienced! Even though the hotel is in the midst of renovation, we were not inconvenienced in any way. Our large room had a beautiful view of the lagoon. The location is so convenient - walking distance to good restaurants and a short cab ride to Old San Juan. On my last day, I was in the business center printing our boarding passes, and left my cell phone by the printer. The staff found it promptly. When I called from the airport, they immediately dispatched someone to deliver it to me curbside. This was an extra service they didn't have to provide and was much appreciated. We will definitely stay at the Condado Plaza again on future trips to Puerto Rico.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and service, noisy construction mess”
Reviews.Author: lujain
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Condado Plaza for 6 nights in late September 2007. We were in a lagoon view room in the lagoon tower. The hotel offers easy access to Old San Juan. There is only a small beach near the hotel. There is a lot of construction going on in that area, both inside the hotel and outside as well. The rooms have been completed, but they are still working on the lobby in the ocean tower. The construction area (the lobby, the walkway to the casino, and the casino) was a mess. Also, there was a jackhammer drilling in the casino during working hours. The room was nicely decorated with green and blue hues. The view of the lagoon was gorgeous. The bed was comfortable, and there was a flat screen HDTV. My husband complained that the TV was not set up properly (something about people's faces being improperly squished), and the content was not in HD. My husband says there was no way to adjust the aspect ratio on the TV (whatever that means). The glass shower in the bathroom leaked. Also, the sliding door to the bathroom did not offer a lot of privacy. The 2 guest elevators in the lagoon tower were down about half of the time. We used the service elevator at those times. Dining options in the hotel are limited. We tried Tony Roma's, where the food was sub-par. We ate breakfast at the Italian restaurant. My vegie omelette had an entire bell pepper chopped into it. The pancakes were gigantic and heavy, not light and fluffy. The fruit cup included canned fruit. We had better luck with more basic items, like oatmeal, poached eggs, and toast. We had room service a few times. Service was good and the chocolate cake was yummy. We took full advantage of a $300 resort credit offered by the hotel. We used it for parking for our rental car, dining, and in-room movies. There is a large selection of in-room movies. The hotel offers some nice touches, like fresh flowers in the common areas. The renovated gym looked pretty nice. However, I would not recommend staying at this hotel until the construction is completed (supposedly in late November 2007). With the unsightly mess and the noise, the hotel does not offer a restful, peaceful environment that I would want on a vacation. I would probably go with the Caribe Hilton or the Marriott instead.

Reviews.Title: “Paradise in PR”
Reviews.Author: peachfuzz23
Reviews.Content: Before I left for Puerto Rico I read many of the recent reviews and was weary of what to expect because of the mixed opinions. I'm glad to say my boyfriend and I had a wonderful stay at the Condado Plaza. From the reviews and the hotel website I was aware of the ongoing construction, however I contacted Henry Neumman and he assured us that he had booked us in a room away from the construction and we sholudn't be bothered. Honestly, I hardly even noticed that there was any construction going on at all unless I was walking to the Casino through the skywalk. The pools at the Condado Plaza are so relaxing and beautiful, not to mention clean. My boyfriend and I seemed to especially like the lap pool which was away from the other pools and seemed more private. We ordered room service twice and the service was so fast! Not to mention the food was great. The Casino was excellent, until we lost all of our 600 dollars that we had won. (not the hotels fault) We tried the Italian restaurant at the hotel. We especially liked the Calamari for an appetizer and the Lobster Pasta as an entree. I actually happened to bump into Henry several times. He gave us great advice on things like where to go for dinner or where the nightlife is. All of the concierge staff was extremely helpful and seemed like they genuinely wanted everyone to have a great time in PR, as I'm glad to say we did. I would definitely recommend the Condado Plaza for anybody planning a trip to PR. It's a close walk to a beautiful beach, has some great restaurants nearby, the service is great, and the rooms are breathtakingly beautiful due to their recent renovations! OH YEAH! I almost forgot. Everybody was complaining about the broken elevator. It has been FIXED! There are 2 working elevators and they are FAST! :) Thank you Condado Plaza Hotel & Casino! We had a wonderful time.

Reviews.Title: “Great time at Condado Plaza”
Reviews.Author: terps94
Reviews.Content: We had a 7 night stay at the Condado Plaza for our 10th anniversary in August 2007. After a lot of research, I chose the hotel based on location and price. I knew it was undergoing renovations (as is every hotel in the Caribbean in the summer off-season) but I e-mailed the hotel management before our visit and was assured that the renovations wouldn't affect our stay. We had to ask for help locating the check-in desk because it was not right where you enter the building, but up one level. Check in was quick and easy. We had booked a city vista room, but received a complimentary upgrade to an ocean vista room in the Ocean Tower. The room was great - the view, the decor, the bathroom, all of it. It was unlike any typical Marriott, Hilton, Holiday Inn, etc. but really unique. To get to our room, we came in through the Laguna Tower, walked up the one flight of stairs (never even thought about using the elevator that others have commented on for one flight), walked across the tunnel between the two buildings, and took the elevator up. Both elevators and the pool elevator in the Ocean Tower were always working and there was never a delay of any kind. We went in the casino once for about 20 minutes. It was busy at times, but never packed, and it looked like it could easily accomodate the guests. The pools were beautiful and scenic. Again, they were never really packed and there were never any problems getting a chair or anything. The bar at the pool was nice. The beach is small and also public, as is every beach in San Juan - even the Marriott and such have to let the public on, we learned. However, the staff would bring chairs for you if you wanted and the beach was plenty big enough for the people using it. The water was clear, calm, and warm. Having a taxi stand at the hotel was convenient for getting around. Prices are set so you know you're not getting scammed. The bus stop is also right at the hotel and easy to get into Old San Juan for 75 cents. There are lots of good Puerto Rican and other restaurants within a 5-10 block walk down Ashford Avenue. It was a nice stroll in the evening to find a restaurant if we weren't in Old San Juan. We never ate at the restaurants in the hotel because we'd rather experience the local flavors. Overall, our experience with the hotel, the staff, and the amenities was great. When the renovations are complete, it will be even nicer, but we had no complaints. Mr. Neumann and his staff (especially Jean Pierre, who went out of his way to find a tour for us when the one we signed up for wound up being full) were wonderful and we would recommend the Condado Plaza to others.

Reviews.Title: “Great place love it !!!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: sugapple
Reviews.Content: Yes the room could have been a little bigger and the bed a little more higher, but over all my stay there was great !!!!!! the staff was friendy. The hotel and the room was clean just one problem was the elevator. There was just one elevator working for everyone except if you use the elevator by the pool which you would have to be passing by the guys doing renovations on the hotel. The hotel is nice I even fell in love with the bathroom(cool shower :-). Over all it's in a great location it is walking distance to stores, subway, natural flavor (for people who don't eat meat or eat anything with dairy in there food), dunkin dounut's, wendy's and walgreen's. I would surely stay at the Condado Plaza Hotel & Casino again, again and again.......... Julie S. from St.Croix U.S.V.I

Reviews.Title: “loved evelyn”
Reviews.Author: oppatton
Reviews.Content: I really thought this hotel was great! Yes, there was construction going on, but I couldn't really hear it and it didn't really bother me during my stay. We had some initial problems with our room -- bed was queen size instead of king, phone didn't work -- but they switched our room and gave us a hotel cell phone to use for any necessary calls. Evelyn at the front desk seems like she works 24/7, and she has great customer service. She made sure our stay was terrific. The pools were beautiful, the connecting beach had great areas for snorkeling, the views of the surrounding areas from the 10th floor were amazing, and the casino was a lot of fun... the italian restaurant within the hotel was mediocre, as was the quality of room service food, but it didn't ruin my experience. I would definitely recommend this hotel to others.

Reviews.Title: “False advertising and lies!!! But good location and nice rooms.”
Reviews.Author: MissDREAM4
Reviews.Content: This was our first time visiting San Juan, Puerto Rico. Booked our room online via their website and called the hotel 4-5 times personally to ask specific questions about our reservations and ammenities of the hotel. The people who answered the calls were very nice and promised we get the type of room we asked for (two double beds non-smoking). Their website talks about a cafe and lounge. Not once did the staff let us know that there cafe was CLOSED due to renovations and that there was NO lounge, live music, or club in the hotel. We opted to stay here due to the special promotion they had via their website which saved us a couple hundred bucks. After a very long flight over to San Juan and upon arriving to the hotel we found ourselves at what was the temporary check-in area. Only one person at the desk and upon checking in the guy told us that there were no rooms available that we reserved and that we would have to take a single king bed with an inflatable bed instead for the night. That was not satisfactory to us so we demanded something better. He went to the back and suddenly a room with a double bed became available. There was no apology and he said that reservations are only a preference and not gauranteed!!! They had only one elevator working the whole time. The other one was out of order. I do not understand why they did not fix this problem. The wait was long for the elevator and it got very crammed. The hotel staff also used this very same elevator as well which explains why it would get very crammed. The elevator problem should have been a top priority to fix asap. We were giving a room with the view of the lagoon which was very nice. Nicely renovated room. Comfy beds and pillows. The ac worked nicely but had trouble trying to fix the temp on the panel that got stuck. The bathroom had very nice fixtures and the shower worked great. The cleaning people were always very nice. We wanted to watch a movie. Called downstairs and they informed us that our tv was not hooked up to be able to watch the movie of our choice. It was a bummer. We ordered room service once and it was a super rip off, outrageous! The girl who took our order was very rude and to top it off our bill came out to around $70 for three people!!! Upon asking for an explanation it was simply said that "the price is what the computer makes it to come out to." That was the last and only time we ordered room service. The Italian restaurant had the nicest staff. Very friendly and very helpful. The dinner dishes were great and tasted like the pasta was just freshly made! It took a bit longer than expected for the food to come to our table but well worth the wait. Tony Roma's was just alright. Jose was the best server there. He gave us tips about the town and it helped a ton. Long wait for food there too and they told us that they were out of hamburger buns for our orders. Starbucks across the ways was perfect for our breakfast needs. Even saw a famous Spanish soap opera actor in there! The location of the hotel is right in the middle. We hopped onto the bus to catch a ride to Old San Juan (only cost 75 cents each way) and the bus stop was right in front of the hotel. Also got onto the same bus to get to Plaza Las Americas, the gigantic mall in Hato Rey. Saved a lot of money that way than taking a cab everywhere. Very very convenient as far as location goes with the hotel. Convenience store across the street came in handy as well as the BIG souvenir shop down the street. Subway down on Ashford for a cheap dinner was nice too. They had all kinds of nice little bar/restaurants on the water and also the fancier more expensive restaurants too like Ropa Vieja (Cuban) and Ajili Mojili (Puerto Rican I'm guessing). They also had a big Chili's on Ashford too. I am glad that I didn't stay in Isla Verde, too far off from everything but the airport. To get to the pool we had to cross the overpath, pass the casino, pass the Italian restaurant, walk through the cold, paint smelling pathway and take the elevator down. The elevator didn't work at times so we had to take the stars and instead of it going down to the Pool, it would go all the way up to the 10th floor and come back to the pool area. Very odd how the elevators work in the hotel. Must get that fixed!!! The pools were very nice and open all the time. They had one main pool and also a saltwater pool which seemed like a nice added touch. They need more lighting for the pool area at nighttime. Could barely see anything in the pool area at night which could be very dangerous for the kids. The jacuzzi was big and always available. Happy hour had cheaply priced drinks at the pool bar which was nice. David the bartender made great drinks, but needed more help during happy hour which got very busy. They blocked off the entrance to beach in the evening time which seemed strange, but there was access another way it seems. They are currently doing contruction on the other side of the street which would be the location of the cafe and the main lobby of the hotel. The man at the front desk claimed that ALL of their rooms have been renovated which seemed to be true. Hopefully in a year all the contruction will be done and everything will be working properly and open. If not other hotels down the street would be an option for sure next time! PUERTO RICO is absolutely beautiful and can't wait to come back again!!!

Reviews.Title: “Alert”
Reviews.Author: Jeanbitsie
Reviews.Content: At one time this was the nicest hotel in the Condado area but during the late 90s became seedy. Heard about the renovations at this property and decided to try them again. The rooms are pretty to the eye - but are very small (smaller that than the pre-renovated rooms). The beds are platform so they are very low. There is no dining table and only one chair for the counter that serves as holder of flat screen tv, and pc hook up - this makes it a little difficult to order room service for two. Most of all the bathrooms are extremely small and not so private. With sliding doors that have about a 2 to 3 inch opening on each side. And don't bring alot of clothing - closet is barely able to accommodate clothing for one modest person. The service was excellent and personnel promptly responded to requests. Renovations are now being done to the lobby so most of the restaurants are closed and no night time entertainment was offered at all.

Reviews.Title: “Overall good experience”
Reviews.Author: MDDay
Reviews.Content: After reading reviews I almost changed my hotel, but in the end, The Condado Plaza was a good experience for me. Yes, it is under construction, but so is all of San Juan. I was very inmpressed with the friendly staff. After my first breakfast, the waiter recognized me every morning,as well as my waitress at the pool restaurant. I highly recommend the lobster benedict and the catch of the day at the pool restaurant was the best meal I had in San Juan. I had no problems with my room, great view, very clean and stylish. All the rooms are finished and I think it will be a beautiful hotel when renovations are. If you are out during the day as I was, the construction will not affect you. It just that the public areas are not very pretty at this time. If this will be your only trip to San Juan, you might want to stay somewhere else, but the location was great. Other hotels, like the Ritz, etc. were very far from all the action. I liked that The Condado is in walking distance to many restaurants, clubs and shoppping and a short cab ride to old San Juan.

Reviews.Title: “Good for swimmers, nice rooms, but remodelling noise”
Reviews.Author: testy016
Reviews.Content: I was staying for a conference so had a $162 night single. The staff was excellent, courteous and professional. Except for the pool bartender, who complained if you gave him a tough drink to make! But he was definitely the exception. The bell staff was especially helpful. If you like to swim this is a great place. They have four pools that are designed to give something to everyone. One is 6ft for adults, another is 3ft for kids and has a slide and volleyball net. One major problem is the poolside bar is in the kiddie pool! So you get splashed by kids while trying to have a drink. Another problem with the bar is it closes at 9pm (the poolside restaurant closes at 7pm!). There is also a relaxing lagoon pool and a nice jacuzzi. So it was easy to relax at night. Security was always around, yet would stay out of the way. Oh yeah, they have a small but nice sandy beach and all pools are open 24/7. The are renovating so it is VERY noisy after 9am. Get a top floor if you can and it probably would be bearable. But then you have to deal with the slowest elevators in the history of mankind. It can easily take 15 minutes before it arrives. Then it will randomly stop at empty floors on its way down. The rooms are awesome! Very well designed, stylish, roomy with terrific bathrooms and showers. Wireless Internet is free, but it was down often. That could be because of the conference attendees overwhelming it. The location is okay. It's easy to get to places and there are plenty of touristy bars, restaurants and shops within walking distance. Oh yeah, the gym has been renovated too and has modern equipment, a jacuzzi and sauna (which was broken when I was there). Overall I really enjoyed the place. The noise was the only killer thing and that will go away then renovations are done (it looked like they had a lot to do, my guess is about a year from now).

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the price”
Reviews.Author: majid436
Reviews.Content: The hotel was too expensive for what it had to offer. The beach was small and enclosed by rock formations that made it feel like a little lake. The water in the beach didn't seem that clean cuz waves rarely came through there to refresh the area. The construction going on in the lobby and casino area also removed the elegance it had. In fact the most impressive thing they had was this large fish tank, but I only stared at it for 5 minutes. Another plus was the concierge and their staff. Overall very cooperative and willing people work there. And another plus is their oceanside view but it's not worth an extra $100/night relative to other rates you could get. But there is no reason to pay that much for Hotel Condado when you can get something for around $100/night, rent a car and drive to some amazing beaches. If you have questions about which beach to go to, email me at majid436@gmail.com. Overall don't go there unless u don't care about paying too much for things.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Customer Service Ever!”
Reviews.Author: DottieMae72
Reviews.Content: Upon arrival there was so much confusion. The taxi driver could not even find the entrance to the hotel, due to the ongoing construction. Once we arrived at the "make shift" lobby, it took almost an hour to check in and the woman checking us in (I will spare her and not mention her name) was RUDE and we felt like we were on an assembly line. We got to our room and there was no balcony, we DID book a room with 2 double beds and a balcony. Half an hour later, we were sent to another room....had a balcony, but only 1 king sized bed. Waited another half and hour and FINALLY we had the right room. The rooms are really pretty and the view was amazing! The elevators are broken, the AC was as loud as a thunderstorm and there is only one way to get to both towers because the construction is not finished. I could go on......but I want to remember my trip to San Juan as a pleasant and beautiful experience. All in all, HORRIBLE customer service, too much confusion, casino smells like mildew, pool is filthy............BUT SAN JUAN IS BEAUTIFUL AND I CAN'T WAIT TO GO BACK.....but...I think we will try another hotel next time!! Get it together CONDADO PLAZA!

Reviews.Title: “Great upgrade”
Reviews.Author: cgbm73
Reviews.Content: I was excited about Condado Plaza and then I became a little nervous after reading the reviews here. I promptly contacted the Guest Services Manager and asked him about the construction. He responded right back that he upgraded us to a room away from the construction. Our room was great! The hotel does have a lot of construction and basically only one elevator, working which was annoying but everything else was really great. The staff at the pool were so helpful and really nice! We had a great time, thanks!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Rooms, Many Inconveniences”
Reviews.Author: Songbird18
Reviews.Content: We paid about $300/night for our honeymoon stay at this hotel, so we were expecting complete excellency. Although the actual room was beautiful, the poor service and inconveniences that we had were worse than those I've received at hotels for 1/5 of the price! Positives- 1) very nice pool and relaxing poolside chairs, 2) gorgeous, stylish rooms and bathroom, 3)balcony had nice view, 4) bed was extremely comfortable Negatives- 1) waited hours to check-in, 2) room key did not work, 3) NO washcloths available in the entire hotel, 4) game room could not be used because token machines were broken, 5) poolside eatery is extremely expensive for fast food-type entrees, 6) poor service In-Depth Coverage on the Negatives 1) requested early check-in since our cruise ship arrived back in San Juan at 7AM, however we had to wait until almost 4PM before we got a room 2) room key did not work-- after waiting several hours to check in our room and heading upstairs to finally relax, we realized our key did not work so we had to go back downstairs to get the problem fixed 3) there were NO washcloths in our room-- we requested them by phone twice and after waiting nearly half an hour, my husband had to go downstairs to request them in person so we would not be late to the airport, there were NONE in the whole hotel so we had to use LONG hand towels 4) token machines in the game room were broken-- we wanted to play some games while we waited for hours to check in, but we couldn't use our quarters in the games and the token machines did not work, so the entire game room was unable to be used 5) food at the poolside eatery is extremely expensive (for burgers, hotdogs, etc.)-- we paid about the same amount we pay at T.G.I Friday's or Ruby Tuesday for a hamburger, fries, and drink 6) we tipped the man dressed in hotel staff attire who removed our luggage from the taxi and showed us where it would be housed safely; when another staff member told us he would bring our luggage up later, my husband made mention that he though (NAME) would be assisting us, the staff member said (NAME) was "just a bellboy" and asked if (NAME) told us he was going to bring our luggage up and how much we had tipped him because we weren't required to tip bellboys but we had to tip room servers; he then approached (Name) and after saying something to him in Spanish, (Name) gave the staff member the tip we had given him-- how tacky!

Reviews.Title: “"Absolutely Amazing"”
Reviews.Author: Eric M
Reviews.Content: Just got back from my 4th of July getaway to San Juan and I stayed at the Condado Plaza Hotel. A decision I didn't regret. It is the low season, and I got an amazing rate of $99 plus all taxes and fees. (note that the taxes and fees are pretty hight. Puerto Rico has a 9% tax for hotels without a casino and 11% on hotels with casino. Also the Hotel charges a "Resort Fee" of a whopping 14% of the rate per day.) The location has its pros and cons. On the western end of the Condado, there is no real beach. There is a small beach that is public right outside the hotel. It's not a bad little beach, but not as nice as other beaches east. On the plus side, you can walk to anything in the Condado. and for Old San Juan or Isla Verde, there are always a lineup of taxis outside day and night. A better option is the bus. The B21 line runs right past the hotel. This line runs from Old San Juan to the Plaza Las Americas mall, so it's easy access to both of these areas. To get to Isla Verde, take a taxi or a 15 minute or so walk to Ponce de Leon avenue and catch the A5 bus to Isla Verde. Remember all bus service stops around 9pm. They are renovating the hotel. Most of it is done, but the lobby and common areas in the main building are still being worked on. You have to enter and at the Lagoon Building across the street where the front desk is temporarily located and take the walkway to the main building's 2nd floor to access the casino, restaurants, and rooms. The rooms are absolutely enormous. I got a room on the 10th floor with the view of the lagoon, Miramar, and the mountains, and it is a gorgeous view. The rooms on the ocean view side of the hotel have balconies and are much more pricey. The room had a sofa and living room area, and a king size bed. the bathroom was equally gigantic, with a glass walk in shower stall right in the center of the bathroom. The shower stall could easily fit 3 people in it with room to spare! In the separate dressing area of the bathroom was the closet and drawers, with iron and board, and a small counter with coffeemaker and a refrigerator underneath. The other side of the bathroom had a huge marble counter with sink and hairdryer. Every amenity imaginable was in this room. Internet connection, plasma screen tv, huge marble desk, down bedding and comforters, and the enormous window that took up the whole wall giving a beautiful view of the highrises of Miramar and the mountains in the distance. Service is fantastic in this hotel! Everyone is very friendly and bends over backwards to help you. The casino is pretty nice too. One of the larger casinos in Puerto Rico, this still is nothing in size compared to the casinos of Vegas. There are about a dozen or so table games, and the rest is slots.However, what it lacks in size it makes up for with quick friendly drink service, friendly dealers, a smoke-free environment, and much lower minimum bets than in the high-end casinos in Vegas. Since there is not a huge, beautiful beach on premises, this hotel goes out of their way to make their pool area and gardens as nice as possible. There are 2 pools in the main building, and beautiful gardens with hammocks overlooking the ocean. Pool service is quick and friendly. Food is not bad at all but the restaurants and drinks are really overpriced. Eat elsewhere if you can. Overall, this hotel is best described as a 5 star hotel in a 3 star location. No you are not in Isla Verde, but you are in a convenient area, the rooms are luxurious, and the service here is truly first class.

Reviews.Title: “Puerto Rico is wonderful; the condado is ok”
Reviews.Author: pr0706
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went to Puerto Rico for our honeymoon. We loved our time in Puerto Rico. We found the people to be incredibly helpful, the sights were great, and the food was wonderful. We were pleased with our room at the condado and we appreciated the help we were given in activity and tour planning. We were a little bummed that the hotel did not really have a beach and that the (closest beach within walking distance) is frequented by sharks and thus not safe. We would definitely go back to Puerto Rico but we would probably stay somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Overall, happy but would probably not visit again”
Reviews.Author: Tee1025
Reviews.Content: For the most part, I was happy with my stay in this hotel. But there were some things that were quite annoying. First, there is construction going on at the hotel which begins quite early and is disruptive (I didn't relish getting up at 6:30 a.m. while on vacation) and there was only one functioning elevator in the lobby and the pool elevator - both of which are extremely slow. Also, it didn't matter what you would ask the front desk they would constantly refer you to the concierge (I'm not sure who the daytime female is but she's fantastic). Also, as the hotel is a bit away from activity of any sort it would be nice if the hotel either had some sort of in-house entertainment, like live music or DJ on the beach, or offered shuttles someplace like the mall or OSJ. There were a few restaurants nearby that had bars but they were always empty (as was most of this side of Ashford Ave.) so keep in mind its pretty quiet around Condado Plaza. The Italian restaurant in the hotel was a disappointment. The food was awful, I was there twice for dinner and once for breakfast and the breakfast burrito was the only passable food I had there. Starbucks was typical Starbucks which was fine if you wanted a beverage but the foodstuffs they sold didn't seem to move much at all and I had my doubts how fresh they were. Tony Roma's was a nice option with good service and decent food. The beach at the Condado was public, which I hadn't been aware of beforehand, but still pleasant, though I enjoyed my time in the hammocks (which were a great surprise) or lounging by one of the three pools better. Overall, I enjoyed my visit but unfortunately I'd probably think twice before staying at the Condado Plaza again.

Reviews.Title: “Condado Plaza - Mixed review”
Reviews.Author: Spartiken
Reviews.Content: We found the Condado Plaza Hotel and Casino to be a mixture of good and bad. Good: The staff members were generally very helpful and accomodating and concierge staff was always willing to help. Hotel management was willing to accomodate a room change and upgrade at no additional charge. The pools and tennis courts are beautiful. The hotel will provide rackets and balls for no charge. Not so good: The hotel was under quite a bit of remodeling, and the jackhammers were our 7AM wake up call every morning. Jackhammers also made it difficult to enjoy the pool. The beach is really a public beach with a lagoon of sorts, overrun with local teenagers. Although furnishings and materials are top-notch, workmanship in the hotel is marginal. We were in two rooms, and both had huge gaps in the bathroom door frames which made privacy impossible. The food and service at the hotel restaurants was mixed at best, and expensive. A drink, chicken wings, and an ice-cream bar at the pool was $50! Getting washcloths took additional calls to housekeeping almost daily, despite leaving notes and big tips! Very small and hot exercise area.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Rooms; Service not so good”
Reviews.Author: Rslickeee
Reviews.Content: My companion and I have just returned from a 7 night stay at Condado Beach Hotel and Casino in San Juan, PR. The hotel is undergoing some renovation, but the work had minimal impact on our stay. The room was as described on the website. We were in one of the "red" rooms in the ocean tower. It had a view of the lagoon, and of the city of San Juan. The room was beautiful - very modern, the bed really comfortable, with high quality linens. The bathroom was large, with a glassed in shower. Room also had flat screen tv, coffee maker, iron, and safe. The balcony was large and came with 2 chairs and a small table. The housekeeping staff was very accommodating and kept the room immaculate. The only minor problems were that we had to ask for washcloths, and from the hotel photos, it looked like there were supposed to be bath robes, but there were none. No big deal. Ok, that's the good. Now the bad. We found the hotel staff to be not very accommodating, and most of the time acted as though it was a bother for them to be asked anything. This happened time and time again, from the bell staff to the front desk, concierge, pool and casino staff. Here is one example: the hotel has guest laundry; the change machine was not working. It was close to the pool, so I went to the pool bar to get change. NO! To the front desk. NO! To the casino - yes but not very happily. Four outlets before I could get a dollar's worth of quarters!! Also, everything in PR is extremely expensive. Drinks and food at the pool are ridiculously priced, and here again, the staff very mediocre. Tip: one of the best and cheapest things on the menu are the empanadillas. All in all, we found Puerto Rico to be not a very hospitable place. The past 2 vacations have been spent in Mexico, and the difference is amazing. In MX, we were made to feel like people were genuinely happy to see us, the prices were always reasonable, and food always good. My advice: skip PR altogether and go to Rivera Maya. Oh, and one last thing. We are not complaining or picky people, but our experience in PR was not a great one. I hope yours is better.

Reviews.Title: “Condado a good choice for young travelers”
Reviews.Author: ceb3124
Reviews.Content: The Condado Plaza had amazing beautiful rooms (in the Ocean Wing) with Huge Fluffy beds. And the balcony views are nice too, but the surf can get a little loud at night. The construction was obvious, but did not impact our stay in any way. One complaint- there seems to Always be a line at the front desk. The elevators went down our last day there, but i'm sure it was a freak thing. The beach and many pools are nice, but food/drinks at the swim up bar can be costly. Overall, I recommend this hotel to anyone looking to be really active and social. From the pools to the beach to the casino, the Condado is a pretty nifty place!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful and swanky, but expensive and they nickle and dime you”
Reviews.Author: granite_girl
Reviews.Content: This is a gorgeous hotel in a great location. The rooms are so awesome. Very modern and attractive. Super comfortable beds, very cool glass wall showers, good lighting, all just really nice to walk into after a long day of travel or work or beach slothing. The lobby is beautiful too. The pools are very nice and with a view of the ocean. I only ate breakfast there but it was great. Cons: Very expensive. I had a special rate and it was like $175. Yes, it was high season. But still! And they nickel and dime you here. Yes, they have parking but it'll cost you $10/day. Yes there is breakfast but you have to pay for it. Yes you can use the internet but you have to pay for it. You'd think for $175+ you could get a little something thrown in! Also, the bar is in the casino, which wasn't my thing. For me, after a long trip and I get checked in, I want to go sit at a relatively mellow bar, have a drink and unwind. Loud clanging casino sounds was not what I had in mind. Maybe they had another bar open earlier in the evening - I don't know, but the casino bar was not so great. The bartender was nice though.

Reviews.Title: “Stylish -n-Modern”
Reviews.Author: brownfro
Reviews.Content: Such a beautiful hotel and modern room, after spending 4 nights here, I wished I had booked a week! The staff was great, and the interior design made you feel like it were in a HIP Hotel. Yes there was renovations going on however looking on the bright side, this hotel offered 2 swimming pools, a beach near by and a hot tub in which I soaked to un-wine. It also had a big blue sun chairs to lay back to catch some sun or enjoy the shade if reading a book or listening to music. A casino located inside the hotel if you wanted to try your luck which I lost $20 but all in good fun. There was free refreshments and finger food. My only complaint, the phone bill when placing LOCAL calls, quite expensive! However the staff credited the bill as goodwill so I'll definitely be returning! My friends and I had the City Vista, let the pictures speak for themselves!

Reviews.Title: “It's about perspective. . . draw your own conclusions!”
Reviews.Author: readytoseetheworld
Reviews.Content: We booked our vacation as our 14th anniversary trip from May 19, 2007 through May 24, 2007. We were not disappointed, at all!! Yes, the hotel is being renovated/remodeled. We had an ocean view room, which the view was breathtaking. It was the first time in our lives where we did not know the language. Yet, everyone we met was quite gracious and spoke English. Midway through our trip, my husband began to converse in Spanish. I felt like the third wheel. Thank you Ines at the Concierge Desk as well as the Staff who made our trip ABSOLUTELY THE BEST. The elevator in the main lobby was slow as it was the most used. Shhhh, we've got a secret. . . take the elevator by the pool. Problem solved! The pool was clean and towels were available on a daily basis, which came in handy when we went on our excursions. We wasted money buying insect repellant. We didn't have any complaints about the noise because we booked three excursions at the hotel (thanks, Richard). By the time we returned to the hotel, we were on our way to eat or stroll down Ashford Avenue. On Sunday, we booked the Rainforest/Luquillo Beach Tour. Our tour guide, Antonio, was awesome! Thanks, Antonio. My husband, too, is a history buff, which made the conversation interesting along the way. The trail at the Rainforest wasn't arduous. If you book the full Rainforest (El Yungue) Tour, it may be a different story. On Monday, we booked the Catamaran Tour. Our driver, Julio, was very accommodating and awesome! It was our first time snorkeling. Yes, you, too, can learn to snorkel in 10 minutes. The coral reefs were breathtaking. We purchased an underwater camera and our photos were stunning. On Tuesday, we booked the Old San Juan/Bacardi Tour and Antonio was our guide. Yes, you could tour on your own, but why? We would not have heard the rich history of a very proud people, who made many contributions to the world. We felt quite safe during the night. It is good common sense to make sure you are aware of your surroundings. We took a taxi everywhere, which was reasonable. We were on vacation. On a daily basis, we deal with congested traffic and we wanted to relax and enjoy the scenery. By far, the absolute best place to eat was Mike and Charlie's Pizza and Subs on Ashford Avenue. You won't be disappointed. The food at Senor Frog's was good and filling. We tried the mofongo and the fruit shake at Cafe de Angel. Let's just say that it was an experience (too bland for our tastes). We enjoyed the conversation and food at La Danza Restaurant in Old San Juan. They have good rum punches, too. At $2.00 per drink, you won't be disappointed. We would come again, again . . . For those who have booked a reservation at this hotel, I hope your experience is as good as ours!! You have to see, do, and truly be AMAZED!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Rooms, Lousy Service, Lots of Noise”
Reviews.Author: DCMundo
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 5 nights to attend a work convention, so had no choice on hotels. I was dreading my arrival after reading so many bad reviews on here. I was somewhat relieved when I got to my room and found a newly renovated and decorated room with two big comfy beds, a huge bathroom with glass shower, and a nice balcony. Biggest problems: maid service is lackluster and late (one day they never cleaned our room even though we were out of the room with the "Please Clean Room" sign on the door for six hours), only one elevator was operating, and there is a LOT of jack-hammering and drilling noise throughout the hotel due to their renovations.

Reviews.Title: “Great city hotel”
Reviews.Author: VAgirly
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Condado Plaza from April 23-29, and overall had a great experience. Be prepared though..it is definitely a city hotel, and if you are looking for a quiet secluded getaway, stay outside San Juan. This is also a big conference hotel, and I would say not a particularly romantic getaway, but overall very nice. I thought they did a great job renovating the rooms; a bit of an Asian flair instead of your typical caribbean theme, very comfy beds (no wierd smell on our pillows), huge bathroom and about a 3x3x3 foot glass shower with amazing water pressure. The shower "leak" was not a leak, per se, but water seeps out between the door hinge. Not a problem..just put a towel down. We had no problems with a/c, or the safe. The only problem we had with the room was that we were in the ocean tower facing the street, on the 9th floor. Construction on the other building did not bother us at all, but the traffic could be heard even with the door closed. In fact, cars driving by were so noisy at 11:30 on Sat. night we had to close our door to go to sleep. I would spring for the ocean view so you can hear the waves instead of the traffic! The concierge's were both VERY helpful, recommended some great restaurants, and got us set up with a rental car just down the street which we took to El Yunque and Bacardi. I definitely recommend renting a car for this rather than doing the tours. Also, wear your swim suit and towel to El Yunque..you can swim in the waterfall! The beach was not as bad as some say..it was pretty empty except for one day when a bus load of small kids came by for about 1/2 hour. We just headed up to the pool, which was very nice. The beach is on the lagoon, so there are no waves to ride, and there is a bridge with a fair amount of traffic right next to the beach. It wasn't that bad, but if you want to walk for miles on a secluded beach, this was not the place. Other than the beach, the location of the hotel was great. Old San Juan was about a 35 minute walk, or there is local bus stop right next to the beach. If you walk down the block there are MANY great local restaurants...our favorite was ROPA VIEJA, a Cuban/Puerto Rican place that was always crowded just a little ways down from the hotel. The Italian restaurant at the hotel was good, and so was the pool restaurant. Personally, I thought the drinks at the pool bar were expensive and did not have very much alcohol in them. Here's a great tip....there is a little convenience store just next to the hotel. We got a jug of Bacardi at the distillery, and stocked up on mixers at the store and made our own drinks!! We also tended to grab breakfast either at that store or at Starbucks next to the lobby (very convenient). Oh, and be warned, its hard to find decaf coffee down there! Overall, I thought this was a great hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Would Definately Return to the Condado Plaza”
Reviews.Author: Wahlumgirl
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Condado April 26-May 2 (just got back and still feel like we're on vacation). I, too, read a few negative reviews initially but was impressed about the hotel's concern for these reviews and just had a good feeling about it...so I took a chance and booked the room anyway. We loved it! First of all, we had reserved a City Vista room, and since they are doing renovations on that tower of the hotel, they just decided (before we even arrived) to give us an ocean front room. The view was absolutely stunning...as was the room itself. It was EXACTLY how it looks online...minimalist but very nicely appointed...and the bed was super comfortable. The bathroom was huge, and although there was no tub, there was a see-through shower big enough for two (make sure you get in before you turn the shower on or it WILL leak on the floor). It had a refrigerator and a safe, both of which came in very handy. The employees were all very attentive and made us feel at home...from the bar to the front desk to the restaurants...they were all very professional and truly seemed to enjoy their jobs. Ok, so what were the issues we had? Our room had just been completed not long before and our phone was not hooked up yet...when I mentioned this to the front desk they immediately wanted to move us to another room, but since my husband and I had our cell phones we opted not to. And, one of the elevators was out of service for a couple of days. Two more things...if you're looking for a huge beach to people-watch on, this hotel may not be for you. Because Condado is on the Atlantic side of the island, the water is rough and the hotel's beach lies against a lagoon on the west side of the hotel. It's a small beach, but very quaint, and more than roomy enough, I thought. And, there is a 24 hour Subway about 500 feet from the hotel in case you get super late-night munchies. Trust me, that comes in handy. (-: Had a great time and would DEFINATELY stay there next trip!

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: piercefire
Reviews.Content: I had read all the reviews of the Condado Plaza Hotel and Casino after we booked so I was prepared for the worst. We stayed April 21-27 and I don't know if we got lucky or what but we didn't have the problems other people had. My sister stayed in a separate room and had the same opinion. Rooms: The remodeled rooms were very nice, the glass shower did not leak at all although we did hear of others who had trouble, the safe did not work but the housekeeping manager who happened to be out in the hall had someone there within 5 minutes to reset it for us. Beds and pillows were comfortable, big towels, hairdryer, refrigerator, private balconies. Construction was going on across the way on the other tower but it was not that bothersome. We were in the ocean tower facing the other tower which was still not bad because you could still see the lagoon, and part of the beach, and the bridge, and all the lights at night. Restaurants: They had four open at the time. Everything at their Italian restaurant was good - breakfast, the desserts, drinks. And we also ate a few times at the pool restaurant and were pleased with both the food and service. Drinks and food, while higher that what you would pay "at home", were no more expensive than what you would pay in any other resort. One of the guys at the Starbucks makes the best caramel lattes I've ever had - my sister sister could smell it all the way across the elevator. We did not eat at the Tony Roma's because we can get that at home and spent most of our time looking for local food. Pool/Beach: We never saw more than maybe 20 people at the public beach so it wasn't crowded but we preferred the pool area as our son went up and down the waterslide literally for hours on end, plus there's the convenience of having food and drink right there if you're planning on spending the whole day at the pool. General: We never had any issues with the elevators as others have mentioned. All of the employees were very friendly and helpful. There's an arcade for the kids, and ice cream at the Italian restaurant, huge fish tank in the lobby, at least two cash machines Very family-friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: NyLcav
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Condado on April 2-April6 2007. Our room wasnt ready so we went down to the pool area to eat lunch and they had no more ketchup. We werent told of a leisure time tour going on and if I had known I wouldnt of stayed there. My family was ignored and we were told that the beach chairs we wanted to sit on were reserved for the tour meanwhile we walked by and passed over 40 chairs that had towels,magazines,water bottles, frisbees and pool toys for the tour guests. We were told we could go the end of the pool area where there wasnt any table or umbrella for us. Meanwhile they had a whole pool exclusively for them. The best was a staff member came over to my kids and handed them a flyer to come to the pool area that night to watch a dive in movie at 8: 30 we went down to be told it was private. How do you think my kids felt? The experince of feeling ignored and mistreated is very unpleasant. I wouldnt recommend this hotel. When we checked out the woman didnt seem to care when I told her of our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: monte123
Reviews.Content: Went to Puerto Rico on vacation in March 2007. We were very pleased with the layout and redecorating of the room we stayed in. The first room we went to did not have a working safe & were moved to another room after asking to be moved (worse view) and then finally to the same type of room (city vista) with a nice view of the ocean (LOVED THIS). The elevators usually had at least one not working at all times (and were very slow) and the staff sent us all over the place (on site) when we looked for a restaurant that was open at 9PM. The shower leaked all over the floor daily & we did tell staff about this. They did not offer any compensation for the inconveniences, however, even though we made them aware of it. They were nice but the place we stayed before (in Rio Grande, the Westin), the staff had been MUCH, MUCH more accomodating and courteous. What we liked about the place were the room renovations (very contemporary), swim up bar (although VERY expensive & prices varied for the same drink from day to day), snorkeling (inexpensive), easy access to the $.75 shuttle to Old San Juan, great views, casino (I won a little). Given the other hotels in the area that weren't as nice nor with the same view, if I were going here again, I would stay here again; however, it's not likely.

Reviews.Title: “Beware of "Renovated" Rooms”
Reviews.Author: TravelerMD
Reviews.Content: Although this hotel appears to be improving, I would strongly recommend you not stay until ALL of the renovations are complete and the kinks are worked out of the system. I was there for 3 nights, and every night we had a problem with our room. The air conditioning was broken and we had the choice of either freezing to death or sweating. On top of that, when it did work, about every 30 minutes there was a terrible rattling sound that came from the air conditioner. Engineering came to our room every night and said this was "normal." Our toilet also stopped working at various points, since apparently they shut off the water without telling the guests! The final kicker was that we went to open our terrace door only to discover that it had never been attached to the wall!! Someone literally just placed the door in the frame and prayed nobody would try and open it! This property seems like it has the potential to be nice, but right now I would stay away. I will say that the staff did the best that they could (switching our rooms multiple times), but they have been dealt a bad deck of cards and can't be expected to fix construction defects.

Reviews.Title: “Great Vacation”
Reviews.Author: kara030902
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Condado March 7-11. I had read all the negative reviews AFTER we had already booked, so I was prepared for a crappy hotel. I was WRONG. The room was AWESOME! It was beautifully decorated. The bathroom was the BEST hotel bathroom I had ever been in. I told EVERYONE about the glass shower! The bathroom was also HUGE. We really liked the in-room safe, and the refrigerator. The view was awesome. The only real 'bad' thing about the hotel was that apparently the main elevator doesn't go to the 2nd floor, where our room was. The one elevator that DID go there was broke, so we had to use the service elevator the whole time we were there. The location is great. There were plenty of stores and restaurants in walking distance. The staff was all friendly and helpful. This is a great place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “Condado Plaza Must Read Review!”
Reviews.Author: PatRat,Original
Reviews.Content: ROOM: We got much more than we expected. We did not book an Ocean View room but got upgraded on check in. (Tip: Sweet talk goes a long way when checking in.) This made our stay here fantastic but I think we would have been very disappointed if we did not get ocean view. The hotel has 2 separate towers and they have been under a long remodeling period. One tower is right on the ocean and the rooms are completely remodeled. This is where we stayed. I stay in a lot of hotel rooms and this room was great. Very private balcony over the ocean, great beds, great AC, modern bathroom with romantic shower, & large flat screen TV. CAUTION: The problem with this tower is if you don't get ocean view and are on the other side you are looking at the 7 day per week construction of the other tower. The tower under construction is directly across the street and that is why I say we would have been very disappointed if we did not get Ocean View. Even when the other tower is 100% done I would not want to look at other peoples balcony's for the money charged at this hotel. Now the other side of that tower over looks the bay with the city behind it. That would be my second choice. It also looked like the top floors of the construction tower were done so staying there might have some unwanted noise. HOTEL STAFF: Before going to PR many others told us most wait staff was not helpful or friendly. We found the complete opposite to be true. All the hotel staff were great and we met friendly staff where ever we went in the hotel. HOTEL POOL: The pool area was great with both salt water and fresh water pools but the 105 degree hot tub was too much for most people. Many complained and each time and staff said they were going to look into it but 4 days later the hot tub was still 105. Drinks in the hotel and by the pool are very, very expensive. Many people had sticker shock after the first round. Every drink has 15% added on also. Next door to the hotel is a small store that sells beer, wine, liquor and a little of everything else at good prices. Even the bartender told us to stock up next door and use plastic cups by the pool. After the first day we never bought a drink in the hotel. HOTEL FOOD: Again very, very expensive but many other places are in the area. A couple of doors down from the hotel is a great Mexican restaurant that offers breakfast and lunch specials that are very cheap and great food. Also there is a 24 hour Subway close by for when you come back to the hotel at 2am and you are starving. Also MIRO is a few blocks from the hotel and food is 5 star seafood. Do not miss MIRO while staying here. OTHER: Cabs run 24 hours per day and the prices are all pre-set to most places. Old San Juan is about 5 miles away and we loved it. Very safe after you get to know it. My wife shopped all day by herself while I worked. Oh and local police are everywhere all the time. Every couple of blocks are more police. Always felt safe. Old San Juan has some great places to eat. Some expensive and some not. Don't expect the speed of service you would in a large US city but much more friendly. Bathrooms are not very good in most places by not a problem for my wife and I. We love the local culture. Dinning in OSJ is not like dining in Manhattan, NY. Don't expect it and you won't complain. If you expect it, don't go. Take your time and enjoy the night. Hotel had large casino but we did not go into it. We don't gamble. Next to the hotel is Charlie's Car rental. Only one who had cars available and the hotel will arrange for you. Very good cars at cheap rates and you can drop off by the airport if you want. Rent a car for the day and head out to the rain forest. PR has a bad rush hour in the morning and also evening so head out early if it's a weekday. There is no real beach by this hotel. It is very small and crowded on the weekend but if you walk a couple of blocks down there is a longer beach by the other hotels. There are also 2 other large beaches within a cab ride. Isle Verde beach was our favorite close to the airport. All in all a very great experience.

Reviews.Title: “Condado Plaza Hotel and Casino”
Reviews.Author: opiel
Reviews.Content: This was our second time staying at this resort hotel in San Juan. We stayed last year for 2 nights before our cruise and this year we stayed 3 nights before and 1 night afterwards. The guest rooms are all being updated and renovated. We were in a renovated "red" room. Very large, modern and clean. Definitely upscale. The grounds of this resort hotel are beautiful - right on the ocean with the water crashing on the waves. There are 2 pools, one with a swim up bar and 2 whirlpools. There is also a sand beach right off of the property. All of the San Juan hotels have gone non-smoking. Currently there is an outside terrace that smokers can use with ash trays provided. The "only" downside of this property is the price of their alcoholic beverages. Our room was not ready at check in so we thought we would go to the outside bar for a drink. A pina coloda and a specialty island drink came to a small fee of $26.00. Overall experience was excellent!

Reviews.Title: “Nice property that is on its way up.”
Reviews.Author: KWTravel
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this property from March 22-March 25, 2007. The property is stil under renovations. We were giving the best available room at the Internet rate and thus spent the first night in the Lagoon Wing. The decor was really nice in the room - yellows, blues and greens. From the balcony, you could see the water. However, the room only had a stand up shower and thus the bathroom was a little clastrophobic for me. At 10 pm on the first night, we get this note saying that the water will be turned off teh next day from 9am to 4:30 p.m. So, whatever plans we might have had to lounge around in the room late or whatever - we suddenly had to nix. The water didn't come back on at 4:30. It didn't come back on at 6:30. That means no toliet, no water, no shower after about 3 hours of that - that was enough. I couldn't believe the hotel put us over there in the first place if they knew that was going to happen. We were finally switched to the Ocean WIng - which looks exactly like the picture on the hotel Web site. The room was much bigger and nicer. The property itself was very nice. It is in a great location that is walking distance to great restaurants - ROPA VIEJA is about three blocks down and highy recommended. There are also nice restaurants on the property - complete with an ice cream parlor. Included in the resort fee is LIVE ENTERTAINMENT via the Casino Lounge every night at that was very nice as well. Kind of a cruise ship atmosphere . The pool was lovely and included a salt water pool, regular pool and jacuzzi. There are nice lounge chairs and hammocks all around. The beach was indeed on the property and a public beach, but it was still nice. All in all, we enjoyed our stay at this property. Shopping is nearby and the BUS 21 will take you to Old San Juan for $0.75.

Reviews.Title: “Pre and Post Cruise Stay”
Reviews.Author: Cruze-lover
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Condado Plaza on 3/9, prior to a Southern Carribbean Cruise. The stay on 3/9 was best, had a room overlooking the ocean. The view was awesome. The room was nice, but the tile floors are cold and very noisy (especially during maid service next door and above). Make sure you get an "armband" to use the pool, the security guard was way overzealous. We walked out without one (we were not using the pool, just sightseeing) and were harrassed going to the "private beach". Our stay on the back end was not quite as nice. We got there about 11am after we got off the boat. Major line to check in, they took our luggage, but we were told to come back at 11:30 to check in. We went to the Concierge at 11:30 (line still out the door for check in) and was told we should not have been told that, come back at 4. After checking at 4, we got a room on the street side (even though ocean was request). It was extremely noisy and to make matters worse, after coming in at 2am from Old Town, the whole room smelled of cigarette smoke. Even though it was a non-smoking floor, someone next door or above was smoking. We waited on hold for 30mins to talk to the front desk, and we were moved about 2:30am to the "last" room. Still on the street side but much quieter has it was higher up. Woke up very early to the maids cleaning other rooms (see above) and doors slamming. This hotel is not for light sleepers, however the location, ocean side rooms and pool area is great.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient and relaxing”
Reviews.Author: whuntw
Reviews.Content: A great location in the Condado area to be close to restaurants and amenities in that area of San Juan. Good bus service to and from Old San Juan, as well as other areas in the city. Hotel pool area, both fresh and salt water pools, and access to a protected public beach area on the lagoon. The water is calm and pleasant for swimming. Even though the beach is fairly small and is public, the controlled access to and from the hotel pools and lounge area is very convenient. Lounge and food service for lunch is located in the pool/lounge area. Hotel amenities are good. Staff is pleasant and helpful. The prices are not out of line with what is expected in comparable facilities. There are two buildings to the hotel, seaside, and lagoon side. The lagoon side rooms with a view of San Juan city are pleasant, though they primarily face south so you have afternoon sun on your balcony. (I did not see rooms in either building which faced the street between the two building, but I expect they would be less favorable than the rooms facing the seaside or lagoonside.) The hotel was undergoing interior renovation while we were there, and even though we had to walk through common areas being refurbished, the workers were pleasant and accommodating . We would select the Condado Plaza Hotel again when we wished to stay in San Juan.

Reviews.Title: “February break”
Reviews.Author: travelmere
Reviews.Content: The previous negative review has prompted me to respond. My college age daughter and I planned a short visit to Puerto Rico for her well deserved February break . We chose the Condado for its proximity to the airport and the fact that we would not need to rent a car, and, the price was right. Also, we took a nonstop flight from Boston and we were basking in the sun in no time at all. First, always do your research before you choose a hotel. Yes, the beach is public, and very small, however, it's not a surprise if one actually pays attention to the information provided by the hotel and tripadvisor. Before we left, we emailed the hotel to ask for a renovated room. It was lovely, clean and quiet, looking out over the ocean. I researched a couple of restaurants and checked with the professional and helpful concierge, Jean Pierre who would either agree or suggest another choice that my daughter might prefer. He would make the reservation and when we appeared at his desk, he would escort us to a taxi and give the driver the address. Delirio's, Dragonfly and Pikayo were all different and delicious. For breakfast, walk down the street and sip your tea or coffe at Hacienda Don Jose, where you can have eggs, toast, and OJ for around $5.00 or simply order tea and toast and read. It's a tiny neighborhood cafe where the windows open up over the ocean. (TripAdvisor idea, of course).. The Condado is really trying to please....and by the way, there is construction all over San Juan...a necessary part of keeping the city revitalized and beautiful. And, always take some time to do your travel research...it's so easy .

Reviews.Title: “Do no go here”
Reviews.Author: NancyWoburn
Reviews.Content: There are several better places to stay in San Juan. If you are going on vacation, this is not the place to go. This is more for a business convention. My travel agent told me that this hotel would be completely renovated when we got there. The hotel was not even close to being completely renovated.When we arrived I felt like I was in Iraq. There was a crane right outside my bedroom that went up and down the entire side of the building. The room was dirty. They finally moved us the next day to the building that was renovated. However, there was work being done upstairs and all I could hear was jackhammering all afternoon. My travel agent also told me that this hotel had a better beach than the Caribe Hilton. The beach in fact was a public beach and every afternoon busloads of school kids were dropped off. The casino was very dingy. The power went out three different times when I tried to use my hair dryer, and every day I had to get my room key reprogrammed. This was a terrible vacation experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location; Wait until construction is over.”
Reviews.Author: krosas
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Condado Plaza for 3 nights pre cruise. The location couldn't have been better. It was close to Everything!! We were Very hesitant to stay here due to some of the reviews we read and with all of the remodeling taking place. I called three times before our arrival to make sure the stories were all the same; construction only took place between 9am â€“ 6pm, and there was an empty floor left between the occupied floors and the construction floors. When we checked in, the staff was pleasant; the man who checked us in was young and didnâ€™t have a lot of information on the sites around us, but was able to refer us to the concierge desk. We had a long day of travel and decided to call it a night and meet up with the concierge the next day. We headed across the bridge to our room. We were met with construction. It was ok though; everything was blocked off as it should be and looked relatively safe. We got to our room, it was what we expected, a room in major need of renovation, but it was clean and seemed well put together. That night, we were awoken several times to things dropping outside the hotel. At 2am I went out on our balcony only to find construction workers dropping heavy items down to the first floor to load in dumpsters. The noise continued for most of the night. So much for only doing construction between 9am and 6pm! We spoke with a lady at the front desk the next morning who told us to check in around 6pm and she would move us to the newly renovated tower; for the same government rate! We were thrilled and surprised. A lot of the reviews state how rude and not helpful the staff are; we were pleasantly surprised! The newly renovated room was outstanding. They really have done a nice remodel to the new rooms. Areas of concern: The concierge desk needs major help. We wanted to book the biolumiscent bay trip and nobody could tell us how/when to do it. We were told that there probably werenâ€™t enough people going so we couldnâ€™t go. We asked if this was confirmed, and the guy just kept telling us, donâ€™t plan on going. We went over to the Hilton Cribe (across the bridge) to have a drink and ran into their travel desk/concierge. I guess that is why they are at the Hilton, over the top nice and they were able to book our tour for us. We found the folks at the concierge desk at the Condo Plaza seemed more interested in each others plans for the night than actually helping the hotel guests. Restaurants: Please, if you do not have a certain restaurant within your hotel, Take Down the Sign!!! The only restaurants within the hotel are an Italian restaurant and Tony Romaâ€™s although everything around the hotel shows they have four restaurants!! The restaurants leave something to be desired. We tried them both, and I think we would have rather starved. There are other great options right across the bridge or in the Condo area outside the hotel and to the left. Overall, once all the renovation was complete, we may consider coming back if the rate was reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: BCintron40
Reviews.Content: We left El Conquistador in Fajardo for some much needed freedom to see the outside world. Our fear was several years ago I would not have recommended this place, but we took a chance. The hotel is under construction and the rooms are BEAUTIFUL!! We stayed from 2/14 till 2/17. Need to ask for a renovated room. There is construction going on across the street, but nothing to complain about and it didn't disturb us in the least. In fact, it entertained my 3 year old. Tons of restaurants and shops throughout this strip and not only is the food GREAT the prices are awesome. $6.00 for a full breakfast or El Angel where you get a full puerto rican dinner for as little as $12.00. Only problem is since it is under construction there were slight problems with the electricity, but they actually gave us a credit of $100.00 for this inconvenience. Regardless, my family and I can't wait to go back!! I just wish I could have gone to the casino located on the Mezzanine level. Seemed like one big party every night :::sigh:::::

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: NYCobalt
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for a long weekend. We had an ocean view room with beautiful views! Room looked exactly like the pictures on the website. Staff was courteous and helpful. The beach was small, but never crowded. There were two pools: one that was really shallow but had a swim-up bar and slide for kids and another, salt-water pool that was deeper, probably 6-8 ft or so. The hotel is not very far from Old San Juan. My husband and I went into that area quite often. It was a quick and easy drive. We also rented a car and had no trouble in the self-park lot underneath the hotel. Parking was $15/night which we thought was pretty reasonable.
