I did, however, have some concerns: - the hotel restaurants were horrible (the poolside restaurant was decent) and do not reflect the upscale feel of the hotel generally; you would do better to eat at one of the fabulous restaurants in Condado (all walkable), Old San Juan or at the nearby Caribe Hilton - the concierge desk could use some work; it would be helpful if the concierge had menus for the area restaurants available and had printed directions to some of the popular tourist spots like El Yunque, Bacardi Factory, etc. - the smoking; I can understand why smoking would be allowable in the casino and in the lounge, but at the pool, at the swim-up bar, in the lobby, etc. Not only is it nasty but again, it does not match the upscale feel that the hotel is trying to create Overall, though, I would still recommend Condado Plaza. The hotel is still renovating and I think that it will be an even better place to stay next season!

Reviews.Title: “loved it all the way!!!”
Reviews.Author: hottieblondie
Reviews.Content: it was Febuary 1-5. i went for a gymnastics meet. the only bad thing was when we had got there they said checkout time was at 4:00 but we had to wait until after 6:00 to finally get a room key. there were others in line waiting also. since there were lots of girls coming from other places they accidently over booked and all the hotels on the island were all booked. once we got a key we went up stairs and our room was gorgeous... we loved our stay so much we are going back next year and were staying at the same place. our bathroom was huge and very very nice. the beds were very comfortable and so were the pillows. our view was of the ocean and it was magnificant. the waves broke on the rocks and i got very good pictures. the staff were very nice and helpful. also the room had a coffee maker a refrigarator and a flat screen tv that was very nice. the pools were also very nice one of them has a slide that we had tons of fun on. we also went on a trip to the rainforest and went snorkeling. the people who booked it for us were very nice and helpful. i recommend this hotel for anyone with a family and looking for a nice relaxed getaway(vacation)... have fun i know i did!

Reviews.Title: “Overall, a Pleasant Stay”
Reviews.Author: DameKane
Reviews.Content: It looks as if everyone posting before me has covered just about everything that needs to be said about this hotel. We were in the newly-renovated tower on the ocean side. The room as well as the bathroom was spacious and clean with lots of natural light during the day. Our room was cleaned most days by 10:00 a.m. (we were there six nights). Also, there were plenty of fluffy, white towels and nice toiletries every day. I can't say for sure, but I think the sheets and pillowcases were changed at least once during our stay (maybe more). They were spotless. The pool area is attractive, spacious and well layed out. Unfortunately, the first three days landscape workers were trimming the bushes and trees and then grinding them in a truck nearby the pool area. Kudos to the front desk staff, especially those working the Concierge Desk. They responded to our pesky daily inquiries with professionalism and good humor. I have to say though that the hotel union workers demonstration at 6:00 a.m. was scary being woken out of a dead sleep. We don't speak Spanish, and had no idea what was going on in front of the hotel with police sirens and some guy going on and on with a loud bullhorn. We nicely complained to management, but we weren't as lucky as the previous poster...all we got was two complimentary breakfasts for two days = $28.00. Management seems to be doing a fine job of keeping the day-to-day operations of this hotel running smoothly while still accommodating their guests during this transition period. Only time will tell if their efforts will be rewarded.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, will be better when renovations complete”
Reviews.Author: mcmarya
Reviews.Content: Our Puerto Rican adventure began with a 2 night stay in San Juan at the Condado Plaza hotel. The Condado Plaza used to be part of the Wyndham chain of hotels but is now part of Luxury Resorts and Hotels. Ongoing renovations definitely detract from the luxury hotel aspirations the hotel has as the sounds of construction can be heard from 8:30 a.m. until 5 p.m., especially on the Lagoon side where our room was located. Also, there was no running water from 9:30 a.m. until 3:30 p.m. every day. As my husband was in San Juan as a government contractor staying at government rate, we got one of the City view rooms which are the more traditional rooms pictured on the internet. But, other than the daytime lack of water and construction noise, we had no complaints. The room was very large with a comfortable King sized bed, a sleep sofa, TV and VCR, keyed safe, small refrigerator, mini-bar, table and chairs, large Jacuzzi tub (the jets no longer work), ironing board and iron, balcony with table and chairs, coffee maker, and high-end toiletry articles. If you use the link to determine the hotel location you will be misledâ€”999 Ashford Ave. is 2 or 3 blocks east toward the airport. The Condado Plaza is located just before Ashford Ave. crosses the Condado lagoon near its opening to the sea, next to a small public beach. The beach allows you to swim, even snorkel somewhere other than a pool as there is no beach on the ocean directly behind the hotel. In fact, this may be the only place in the immediate San Juan area where you can snorkel and see a few fish--nothing great but better than nothing. There are 3 pools to choose from, a lap pool behind the Laguna side, and on the ocean side a salt water pool and a pool with swim-up bar, volleyball net, and water slide. Hot tubs are located in both pool locations and also inside the fitness centers. Towels are available at both locations and also snorkeling gear at the main pool (donâ€™t know if there is a charge as we had our own) and wristbands are used. The fitness center on the Laguna side has been updated and includes stationary bikes (recumbent and regular), stair stepper, elliptical machine, treadmills, and various weight machines and free weights. In addition to the hot tub, there is a steam room and direct access to the outdoor pool. Behind the pool are 2 tennis courts and a dock on the Condado Lagoon. I did not see the Ocean side fitness center but it is probably even nicer. A resort fee of 14% is charged to your bill to cover these amenities. As is usual in San Juan, there is a large Casino, probably open 24 hours a day. Many of the hotel restaurants have not opened for business as the renovations are not complete. I believe that the very mixed reviews for this hotel are a result of the ongoing renovations. The rooms that have been finished look really nice. But the Laguna side of the property is a construction site during the day which definitely detracts from the luxury hotel image the Condado Plaza is trying to cultivate. Probably as a result of the ongoing construction, prices are lower than other hotels right now so the hotel is a good value. It is in a wonderful location, fairly close to Old San Juan, but also plenty of restaurants nearby. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great time at the Condado”
Reviews.Author: melone925
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Condado Plaza Hotel and Casino from 1/25-1/31/07. The hotel is under renovation but remained fairly quiet. The poolside elevators were closed which was a little inconvient. We also had an issue with our room keys twice where we had to go back down to the front desk to have new ones made which was annoying. We had an ocean view room and the room was recently renovated and clean. The bed however, was very uncomfortable leaving us with many restless nights as well as overall soreness each morning. The pools were nice and staff very friendly. Be prepared to spend alot of money to eat at the resort. The first day we had 2 turkey wraps, shared an order of fries one frozen drink and a beer and total with tip came to $66 dollars. The other restaurants in the hotel were closed with the exception of the italian restaurant where the service was much to be desired. There are many restaurants within walking distance that are good and much much cheaper. If you are looking for a nice moderately priced place for dinner you must try Ropa Veija right down the street, The food and service were superb and by far the best meals we had on the island. The location of this hotel is great only 10-15minutes from Old San Juan. TIP: take the bus the bus stop is right outside of the hotel and its only 75cents each way versus 12 each way for a taxi. As far as the beach goes it was okay. Its a public beach and is small and a little rocky. Overall we had a great time and you cant beat the price. I would probably return to this hotel again but would also keep an open mind about other hotels in the area as well.

Reviews.Title: “Looks like hotel is on its way up again.”
Reviews.Author: MyAdvice
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Condado Plaza twice; once in 2000 for four days and once overnight in October 2006. The Condado has its own small (rocky) beach, a decent pool and is within walking distance of many places to eat. It is hard for me to get excited talking about my October 2006 visit as I was disappointed that this place was not the same place it had been in 2000. In 2000 this place had the feel of a five star resort. In 2006 it had the feel of a three diamond hotel. The good news is that the price was fairly cheap (for San Juan) and the hotel represented good value for the money. The hotel is remodeling, so I expect the condition to improve a great deal. Hopefully the hotel will remain a good value for the money even after the remodelling.

Reviews.Title: “Spectacular View!”
Reviews.Author: HasTheTravelBug
Reviews.Content: My husband and I took our best friend to San Juan for a long weekend to relax and get away from our corporate lives. We had a BLAST! Check-in was a breeze.... We arrived at 4:30pm on a Friday and waited about two minutes for the next front desk agent, David. David was super polite and helpful, and our room was ready. We were given yummy cracker/cookies with guava flavoring (a nice touch!) and headed to our room on the 8th floor. We stayed in room number 818 and had an EXTRAORDINARY ocean-front room. We were right on the water and absolutely loved the room. We had a remodeled two-bed room and found everything in working order (we used the safe with no problems, the telephone worked just fine, and made tea and coffee each morning). Our room was comfortable, clean and stylish. We ate at the Italian restaurant our first night and had a beautiful table right by the window and enjoyed the sunset. Our waiter was so attentive and good to us; we felt spoiled! The food was okay..... My husband's chicken dish was better than my lasagna. The wine was very reasonably priced. It was a nice way to start our weekend! We had some cocktails at the casino lounge, and the drinks were a bit pricey. However, you are at a resort property, and it wasn't more expensive than anything in New York or a high-end bar in Las Vegas. We didn't have good luck at the casino, but had a nice time anyway! There is a little gift shop on the first floor that sells all kinds of stuff.... We wanted to have a few beers and spent $5 for each bottle (we joked about the $30 six-pack!). The woman at the register told us they are not part of the hotel, so they charge pretty high rates for beverages. The next day we discovered some local convenience stores with much more affordable prices! Our room was cleaned each day after we left, and everyone we encountered at the property was polite. We were very well taken care of! We walked through Condado (take a left after you exit the front doors) and sat in a lovely park one afternoon. Old San Juan is a lot of fun and we enjoyed the little restaurants. We had a great weekend and would recommend the Condado Plaza to anyone looking for a larger resort and the amenities that come with this type of property (pools, casino, room service, etc.). Many thanks to the staff who made us feel so welcome!

Reviews.Title: “ghetto fabulous”
Reviews.Author: sealevel000
Reviews.Content: We experienced many problems at this hotel including: A non-working phone A safe that was not secured to the wall No internet access Poor elevator access A protest by the hotels union at 6 AM A fire alarm at 5 AM the next morning And the continental breskfast was very bad. Also other guest had to deal much worse problems including flooded rooms and lost reservations. It's no wonder a major chain dropped their brand from this hotel. The pool area was nice but the beach was a very small public beach. The ocean view rooms which had a nice view. Also the renovated rooms (make sure you ask for a renovated room in the OCEAN WING) did look pretty, but it did not make up for the many problems we experienced on our trip. I would not stay at this hotel again under any circumstances.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Room - Fabulous Location”
Reviews.Author: NBaker
Reviews.Content: Condado Plaza Hotel was a fantastic place to stay during my recent trip to Puerto Rico. I was there visiting a friend who was on business travel. I would definitely suggest this hotel to friends and colleagues that plan on visiting San Juan. The rooms were beautiful and housekeeping did a great job of maintaining the cleanliness during the week that I was there. The pool area was also beautiful and well maintained. The location is also great, it is very close to Old San Juan, within a short taxi ride or 45 minute walk. It is also very close to many great local restaurants. I would go running every morning and the area both around Condado and the surrounding neighborhoods are very clean and well kept and everything is beauiful. Visiting from Minnesota during the winter, the weather was more than amazing! I understand and saw that they are undergoing many renovations, but it is easy to see that it will be an even better place to stay when they are finished with construction. They did a fairly good job of keeping a lot of the construction out of immediate viewing and also well marked. Condado Plaza Hotel is not the only place undergoing renovations in Puerto Rico, there is construction everywhere, as it is a growing area and San Juan, Puerto Rico, as a city, is constantly undergoing construction/renovations. One suggestion that I would make is to the travel desk/excursion information/area. I did take a morning tour to El Yunque rainforest and was not very impressed with the travel guide or the quality of the tour. I am not sure if the hotel has a contract with certain guides, but the tour of the actual rainforest was very quick, with a long stop at one of the little souvenir/snack places on the way back, where the majority of the time was spent. I thought there would be more hiking and viewing of the rainforest, so I was disappointed. A suggestion would be to have an anonymous evaluation after the tours to help enhance this area. I was not sure the main difference between the travel desk and the concierge desk, but another suggestion would be to have a more focused travel and excursion desk, as the majority of guests at the hotel are tourists and tourists look for readily available information. Customer service was also pretty good, you could tell that they were a little understaffed and busy during the time I was there, but everyone was very friendly and willing to help. Again, overall, the hotel was great, San Juan is a fabulous and fun city and there is a lot to do within San Juan and the surrounding areas. When I return to San Juan, I would definitely consider staying at Condado Plaza. Gracias.NMB

Reviews.Title: “Good and Bad”
Reviews.Author: heltel
Reviews.Content: I decided to stay here in spite of all the bad reviews. Live and learn. My trip started out disastrously, as my laptop's screen was smashed when it fell off the rental car bus shelf. The lady at the business center at the Condado was spectacular. She found me a monitor and cable, called me when they were ready, and the next day I was back in business! I have never been treated so well. I was willing to overlook my flaky broken alarm clock (I didn't need it, the truck that came to move the big ugly construction dumpster from the front of the hotel came every day at 6am, like clockwork) and the broken cordless phone. Then disaster struck. I came back after work. No internet, neither tv worked either, apparently the construction guys had severed all ties. I called for help several times. Three hours later, an "engineer" arrived who could not fix anything. The woman at the desk was not surprised, showed no sympathy, and did not care in the least when I told her I would be checking out a day early to go to the Hampton Inn. Beautiful property, horribly mismanaged or unmanageable. Probably why Wyndham bugged out of there.

Reviews.Title: “I love the hotel!!!!!!!, New rooms awesome!!!”
Reviews.Author: womanatwork
Reviews.Content: I love the hotel, the new rooms are breathtaking, excellent staff, specially front desk and concierge, pool food is good, but too expensive, excellent ocean view i really loved!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Better every trip”
Reviews.Author: t134
Reviews.Content: Just back from our trip to the Condado plaza. This was our third trip this year. The hotel has made improvements in all phases of the operation.The oceanvista rooms are very nicely decorated, the staff are very helpfull, and the casino is the best in San Juan. Keep up the good work and thanks for a wonderfull stay. We will return soon.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - Potential for a Great Place”
Reviews.Author: scottandrew75
Reviews.Content: We checked in to the Condado Plaza for an extended weekend last January. This property was probably, at one time, a great place. Unfortunately the upkeep and customer service were both lacking. It is nice to see, with response to recent reviews, that these issues are being addressed. The location for this hotel is perfect for day and night fun. The "beach" at the hotel is hardly a beach... but only a 10 minute walk down the street is a nice beach to lay out and swim at. Our first room was ocean front on a high floor with a great view. Unfortunately (after a night of being out dancing and drinking) we were woke up bright and early to hammering and construction. It was impossible to tell where it was coming from. After about a half hour of this noise we called the front desk. They said they would look into it... 15 minutes later there was no response. A second call still received no response to the problem. Finally after walking down to the front desk we were offered a non ocean front room to spend the rest of the morning in. Since (upon asking) we were told that this construction would go on every morning, we told them a new ocean front room would be needed. The new room was supposed to be ready at one at which point we were told 2... finally around 4:00 after still not being ready and losing our patience with the problem, a room became available. It is wonderful that they are doing (much needed) renovations to the property. It was felt that they knew the construction would be going on and gave us the room hoping we would be up bright and early and not notice... Since this was a chance they took (at our expense) they should have been more responsive instead of giving us the feeling they were brushing us off. Hopefully the new customer service training will improve this. With all that said, I would consider staying here again after construction is complete. The Condado Plaza really does have the potential of being a great place (which I am sure it was at one time).

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for at the Condado”
Reviews.Author: stevilboy
Reviews.Content: My wife, nine year old daughter, seven year old son and I just spent four nights at the Candado plaza (we are from NJ). The room was cheap and the pool was fantastic. We are pretty seasoned island travelors and we did have a great time. However we are on the adventerous side and did our research beforehand and knew what we were getting into. The owners are fighting to maintain and renovate a giant Resort and they are losing the fight. This place needs big corporate Hotel money to survive. You could count on something breaking down. For us it was the main pool (which was a big bummer) but they fixed it and I tracked the fix from talking directly to the pool repair company (hotel/no straight answer). They needed a pump and of course the hotel didn't have an extra one or backup system. The main pool is THE attraction and if it ain't working just pack the kids up and move on. One of two elevators was off and on the whole stay and that made for long waits. I'm just warning the people who think they are staying at the El San Juan or something like Mandalay Bay. It ain't that at all. However there are great restaurants down the street that are stand alone operations with competive pricing and great quality. You can also just walk to Old San Juan and get some culture. The Beach at the Condado is a public thing on a questionable lagoon. But hey! Hundred bucks a night, great pool w/ a big slide that kept the kids going all day long. Clean rooms, great views, safe area, museums, forts, swim up bar, in room frig, bodega 100 feet away. Did I mention the pool? Hurry and get there before it falls in to the Ocean. We had fun and it was a very friendly place. Flip flops and your favorite button downs will do. You will find mostly locals at the dining establishments down the streets which is encouraging and they dress very well, however you might feel ridiculous with the official Bermuda uniform on if you know what I mean. Bottomline: Worth my money and vacation time.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Front desk service, left in tears”
Reviews.Author: M2685
Reviews.Content: The room and hotel was very nice, when I first walked in the room I loved the ocean view with balcony, although there was a butter knife and fork on one of the beds. Front desk personnel had the "I don't care will no t help you attitude" it was very dissapointing and fustrating disputing erroneous room charge that took half and hour to resolve upon check out finally left the hotel in tears. The pool was mostly empty no water in it for the most part of the 4 days I stayed there. And the only day there was water in the pool the pool personnel was not friendly at all they did not offer any towels while they were standing at the towel booth just staring at you, It felt very unwelcoming went to the room to get towels. The parking is too expensive and seems to be overcrowded with cars from people who don't even stay at the hotel just there fot the casino. For the price you pay to stay at the hotel and the bad customer service parking should be free. Loved the room and hotel itself , . Coffee maker did not work in room took a day or 2 to replace after several calls. Maids were nice. Would stay there again if they had friendlier competent people working there, staff that deal with concerns/complaints seemed disorganized or not properly trained. Had a hold on my credit card for days after checking out, which was told was to come off within hours, I made reservation with credit card paid cash upon check out.

Reviews.Title: “A Bad Start to a Good Ending”
Reviews.Author: TwistedInNYC
Reviews.Content: Okay...1st....We were guaranteed an early check-in because our flight arrived at 10:30 am...That didn't happen until about 3: 30 pm.....Then they put us on a side where all construction was going on.....The bellman advised us that we might hear some noise...I am an early riser especially when I am vacationing, but if I wanted to sleep 1 morning, I didn't want to hear construction going on....(That was for room # 1)...(Room # 2)....At about 4:15 pm, they switched us to the other side of the hotel which was fine...needless to say the room had an aroma of good provolone cheese(the taste is good but smells rotten...lol)..Housekeeping said they would spray the room, but that wouldn't work being that I had a 9 yr old with bad allergies and asthma with us....(Room # 3)....Roughly Roughly 4:45 pm....We were exhausted from being at the airport from 4:30 am...a nap would have been nice...That didn't happen either....We were told to wait in the room until they found another...(Room # 4).......Finally, after I was complaining and very irate...They gave me an upgrade free of charge...The room was very nice, no smell, and there was room to walk around...So bottom line is that they did do the right thing, but over all I wouldn't recommend the hotel....Eating is off the wall...A breakfast buffet is $21 pp, beer by poolside is between $5 & $7 per beer, frozen drinks are about $8 with barely a taste of rum...I haven't been in PR in about 10-11 years and now I figured out the reason...I don't see myself going back anytime soon. Regards, Twisted IN NYC

Reviews.Title: “Reformed Opinion!”
Reviews.Author: Isis10
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Condado Plaza before, and I absolutely hated everything about it. It was humid, smelled mildewy, everything the other reviewers complained about. This time, I got bumped from the Inter-Continental and I ended up having to stay at the Condado Plaza. Well, needless to say, I was very annoyed. But when I walked into my room, I was pleasantly surprised! We had a small, but comfortable room, and though they were willing to upgrade, we stayed put because we had already unpacked. The staff was helpful, friendly and courteous. I can't say enough about the housekeeping staff, they were awesome! Now the food in the hotel is terrible! BUT it's Puerto Rico... get out and enjoy some of the local restaurants and the delicious food in Condado and Old San Juan. Okay, the pool needs to be cleaned... but everything else... FANTASTIC! And when they finish this renovation in December... I will be BACK!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Experience-don't let these bad reviews ruin your vacation!”
Reviews.Author: shlee10
Reviews.Content: First of all, lets just say that San Juan is beautiful! My boyfriend and I just got back from a weeks stay at the Condado. I had been reading all of these reviews up unitl my trip and was becoming more and more concerned that this hotel was going to be just awful and dissapointing. This just goes to show that you can not believe everything you read. Yes, the Condado hotel along with the Condado area is all under construction-but you are very rarely affected by this. We had booked the bahia vista (lagoon view) room and right now they are doing construction on the Ocean tower so we did not hear any noise or get disturbed. When I entered my room, I wasn't exactly pleased-the room was small and not what I expected, but we called the front desk and they nicely upgraded us to a city vista sweet on the top floor for no extra charge. This was spacious andc loveley-no complaints. We did eat once in the hotel and the food does suck-there are so many restaurants down the street and in old san juan that are much better and not at all inconvienent to get to. The pools at the Condado are wonderful and the grounds are breathtaking. The pool bar actually makes the best frozen drinks that I had In San Juan. They have a great fitnes room if you like to workout and a really nice steam and sauna room which is usually very private. The concierge was always helpful with answering our questions about buses, restaurants, and activities. Vacation is what you make of it-if you want to complain then you will surely find things about the Condado Hotel to complain about, but if you relax and enjoy what is offered I'm sure you will be pleased. If there is a problem just ask them nicely to fix it-i'm sure they will try to accomodate you! I would go back-the location is great!

Reviews.Title: “Okay, not fantastic, would not choose as my vacation location”
Reviews.Author: SDAtlanta
Reviews.Content: I was staying at the Condado because of a work-related conference so, of course, the location was okay by me! San Juan is definitely better than the office in Georgia! But, my husband and I also spent two vacation days at the Condado after the conference. I would not choose it as my vacation spot if I was going to San Juan. The hotel is pricey because it's a "resort" with a casino (there is a resort tax in addition to local tax) and the area is definitely for business travelers and tourists. The room was fine (bedroom area with a living room area) -- view not good but that's only because the conference attendees did not get ocean-front. No beach really -- unless you like the beach created next to the lagoon. Pools are nice but they can be noisy with all the children playing during the day. However, you can relax in areas away from the pool. Interior hallways of hotel look old and they are in the process of doing some renovating. Not a fancy casino -- just a small one made mostly of slot machines. Note: The hotel has two buildings. One directly on the ocean and another across the street. If you get in the one across the street, ask for a room that overlooks the lagoon/bay. Otherwise, you are looking at the back of the building that is on the ocean front. If you take taxis, get a rate from the driver and doorman at hotel before getting in to ensure you get the "right" rate. Many restaturants in walking distance but the area doesn't feel like "Puerto Rico". You need to go to Old San Juan or out of San Juan for that.

Reviews.Title: “very disappointed”
Reviews.Author: boysrus3
Reviews.Content: Very disappointing trip. My family of 4 had booked a double bed room and was very surprised to find they gave us a king room. What was more surprising was the response of "I don't care" by the not so friendly man at the front desk. Obviously this hotel does not have any customer service classes for its employees. We were never given another room and had to make do with what we had. We also received a note under our door one day saying we would not have hot water that day. The service was definitely lacking. The people were very unfriendly and could care less that you were spending hundreds of dollars at their hotel. The pool was nice and that was about it. I strongly suggest you look for another hotel. I would never go back here.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy But Nice”
Reviews.Author: mika71
Reviews.Content: My Aunt and myself checked in on 07/14/06 and was given a view of the parking garage. I called the the front desk and we were moved to the ocean front of the hotel(much better. We unaware of the remodeling of the Hotel so the latest we slept every morning was 8am. The construction workers were lined up and ready to start every Morning at 9am sharp!!!!! On two occasions they turned the water off so you could not take a shower between the hours of 9am and 4pm. This was unacceptable for 229.00 a night. I called the manager and she comped us for two nights and changed our daily rate to 179.00. Overall, I would stay here again, the POOL was lovely and the presence of the security guards were on TIME!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “OK, but a bit shabby”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Our family stayed at the Condado Plaza for a wedding, so we got the base group rate of $140, plus hotel & resort taxes for a total of $175 for an ocean-side view. The room was a decent size with a huge walk-in closet, dressing area, small refrigerator, bathroom and balcony. The hotel's undergoing renovation, as is much of the Condado area, so our furnishings were a little tattered and worn. The pools are nice, but beach access is very limited. The water is calm here, which is nice for small children, but not good for those looking to ride the waves or take long walks on the beach. Avoid the pricey and standard-fare hotel restaurants and walk over to the Cafe del Angel for delicious and well-priced Puerto Rican dishes, such as mofongo (mashed and fried plantains) with fish or shrimp. There's also good sushi across the street from the hotel. For a treat, there's a nice ice cream parlor in the hotel's mezzanine across from the casino. Parking is an extra $15/night, but you can rent a car from Charlie's down the street and pay only $5/night to park nearby. Taxis are expensive, but the Condado Plaza is closer to Old San Juan than the hotels in Isla Verde, though it's a trade-off, since the beaches are better there. Next time I'd stay in Old San Juan or Isla Verde as the Condado area currently does not have much to offer.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Experience”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: During my vacation in San Juan , PR . I'v had picked EL Condado Plaza & Casino, upon my check-in i had to wait like 45 min on line, but it was ok, could been that a busy weekend. As a Night Manager for a BW Sovereign Hotel , El Condado Plaza & Casino Hotel was excellent , Friendly front desk staff, pool area was beautifull hot tubs as well, I loved the casino open 24 hours and love during the weekend i stayed the had live bands porforming, nice Salsa Music and Merengue to keep guest more accommadating . For a hotel so big the had a small private beach to gather in the night. But i was a little surprised that they charge for the internet hi-speed access. other hotel dont charge. The only experience that i had was when i check-in and while i un-packed my cloth i notice the cieling in the closet was about to calpse, but i approached the front desk, and as a Manager for a hotel my self reguested to speak to a Manager, doing it the professional way , and told him what was going on with my room. A very nice gentalmen , introduce him self and he totally appologies and he told me that he was going to up-grade my room to a City View Suite in was lovely. And valet parking was a little too high $25.00 per night but the staff in valet parking as well the bellman very professional all of them. Plus they have a big tunal that take you to other sight and to the casino lovely, And i will defenitly go bad to enjoy the Carribbean again , and stay at the El Condado Plaza & casino Hotel

Reviews.Title: “The Honest Truth & Nothing But”
Reviews.Author: apirateslife4me
Reviews.Content: Dates June 1-6, 2006: (My third stay at this hotel) Upon arrival, I asked & received an upgrade from city view to an ocean front room. Front desk was very accomodating at all times. As for the condition of the hotel; renovations are underway. It is tired & definitely needs updating, but it is far from terrible. Bathroom needed cleaning when I checked in & it was taken care of promptly. The pool area is nice, but also showing signs of wear, as is the yard area. Don't stay here for the beach, it is very small, but it is a beach. However considering the price paid; the Condado Plaza is fine. My room was furnished nicely. (Actual furniture is showing wear) However, good TV & movie selection, refrigerator, safe, balcony, coffee maker & internet access in-room for a fee. There is a bus stop & public information area nearby the pool area. (Only .75 vs. $12 cab ride to town) No public internet when business center is closed on weekends. There are convenience stores, a Subway, Chilis, & several nice restaurants all within walking distance. Ate dinner @ the Italian restaurant in the hotel, service, food & price were good! (Unless you are looking for Subway's three for $10). Coffee shop in front of hotel. Casino was typical of Casino's, crowded, smokey, & noisey. Concierge was not very helpful on any shift. I think they were into the "big bucks"; not in helping me find a bus schedule. I visited many hotels in the Condado area, ALL are in need of updating, as is the whole Condado area. The Marriott seemed to be in the best shape w/ a Great bar, nice store, pastry shop w/public internet access, all in the Lobby area. There was entertainment, dancing & a nice casino area. I think I would stay in one of the more remote areas of PR on my next trip. The downside of renovations: A construction lift was assembled right outside my balcony & ran from 8 AM until 7 PM. The day before I checked out, they slipped letters under doors offering to relocate anyone who was inconvenienced. However It was a little late for me. When checking out I very politely asked for a manager (s) & showed them video of the view & noise. They were very apologetic & asked if they could remove my "room charges" (dinners, movies, etc) since I had prepaid. I was more than happy with the arrangement. The hotel is far from terrible & I have refused to stay in some hotels. Rooms & facilities are comparable to a nice Holiday Inn. Definitely not a 4-star resort, but I didn't pay a 4-star ocean front price either. Not the Beverly Wilshire or Waldorf AstoriaI &I have stayed in both. I suggest that in making any requests or complaints be respectful & you will get better results, than the reviews I have read.

Reviews.Title: “Hell of an experience”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed for the third time in (1) one year at the then (Windham Condado Plaza) for one week for our honeymoon. The second day of our stay we were without water to shower due to plubming problems in hour room., We left without taking a morning shower to return hours later. The front desk advised us "Our plubming was fixed" The next morning my wife and I jumped in the shower luckly, she stepped out first. I proceeded to shut the water when all but the hot scortching water came out "full-forced on to my chest" I flew out the shower on to my wife's feet catching more of the hot water on my back. The water was so hot that the smoke alarm went off and an evacuation of the floor was conducted. As the security was standing in the bathroom attempting to shut the water off (without success) the maintenence person showed up and to everyone's emazement he said and I quote" I worked on the knob yesterday but the Hotel did not have the proper piece that goes there so put the knob piece back on without the part that goes in it". A report was made by security and both my wife and I reported the incident to the manager Evelyn cancel or ( Concepcion) to again be emazed to have lost the Ocean view and be sent to the Lagoon view and no help arrived to help us move our belongings. Again, The manager and security knew of my discomfurt and witnessed my redness on both my back and frontal chest area. As a busyness owner I did not persue legal action because mistakes do happen, however, my wife Kathyleen is planning our first Anniversary in August, 2006, and would like to go back for the fourth time (4) time to stay at the Condado Plaza because we actually enjoyed everything else about this Hotel; how do I continue to spent thousands dollars staying at this hotel to possibly have ourAnniversary ruined? Jose and Kathleen mercado Fairfield connecticut For your record of our stay: Feb, April and August 2005 ., Kathleen Valadares & Jose Mercado, 446 Sturges road Fairfield, CT 06824.

Reviews.Title: “Don't be afraid to stay here”
Reviews.Author: reeree13
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Condado for 4 nights this May. I was a little concerned because of negative posts however we were very pleased. We had 2 adjoining rooms with an ocean view. The view was spectacular. The rooms were very large and clean. The coffee maker was very convenient and the refridgerator was great for cold drinks. I left a note and tip the first morning asking for extra toelws and they left more than needed. The beach was clean and I personally saw them cleaning it one morning. Our check in was quick and we filled out bill left under our door and left it at front desk so there was NO wait to check out. The concierge was very knowledgeable and got us a rental car for a day, booked the guys golf and got us reservations at Ramiro's, they were great. Saty in an ocean view room and I think you'll be pleased. We paid $225. per night per room with all taxes included, that was an AAA rate that I got by calling the hotel directly.I would stay there again!!

Reviews.Title: “bad reviews had us worried”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My sister and I returned from Puerto Rico last weekend after staying for five nights at the Condada. We had read alot of negative reviews. Since our experience there was positive, I felt the need to share that. Our room was ready on check in even though it was only 11 and checkin wasnt officially till 3. The room we booked online is what we got. There was no mini bar in the room which was OK since some reviews said they were charged for it without using it. The room was very clean, has a large walk in closet and a safe for valuables. Although the carpeting in hallways looks a bit worn, it apppeared clean, no bad odor, and who spends time in the hallway anyway? Everyone employed there was friendly and helpful to us from the conceierge to housekeeping and including staff in the several restaurants. Walking down Ashford ave proved to be quite safe day and night..even at 3 in the morning after checking out the night life . The pool areas are very clean..drinks a little pricey..about 7 dollars. The beach which many wrote and said was so filthy was not bad..if you ever went to the beach in Atlantic City I would say its worse. Room service food is good but expensive. We ventured out for most meals but did eat at Tony Romas..excellent salads if you arent into ribs. We went into Old san Juan and found a great place for lobster. The casino is small in comparison to anything like Atlantic city or Vegas. The pool elevator was out of service the first day which made for a long walk..7 floors, but was fixed the next day.You can use your TV for checking out of the hotel..otherwise, you may stand in line for awhile.I dont reccommend you be in a hurry if you venture down the street a bit for the 575 breakfast..the view may be great, but service is slow. With everything there, i think culturally the natives are more laid back than Americans...so relax, take your time . Buy your alcohol at the san Juan airport. Also there is a little grocery store less than a block from the hotel for lunchmeats, bread etc to save a little money.

Reviews.Title: “Nice value”
Reviews.Author: yoopergrl
Reviews.Content: For the money we spent, this was not too bad a deal: $141 per night for the weekend (mid-may) and $129 per night weekday. For the price, we received comfortable rooms with balconies, very nice views, refrigerators in the rooms, and friendly service. The rooms are spacious enough, and if you are lucky enough to get on the 9th floor, as we were, you may find phenomenal views of the city. The first time we stayed, we didn't have washclothes or a coffee pot in our room, and we had to call the front desk twice to get them, but other than that, this was a nice stay. I also recommend the "family" restaurant on the Mezzazzine that's open late.. Our waiter, Carlos, from Guatamala, was wonderfully nice and well-travelled. Next time I will probably stay in Old San Juan, because the area is more fun and interesting, whereas the Condado area is much more touristy and reminiscent of suburbia America, with its chain restaurants and lack of historical architecture or distinguishing historical elements.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value, Good rooms, overpriced food”
Reviews.Author: amadeusfmg
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 3 day stay at the Condado Plaza Hotel. It is an older hotel that has been upgraded many times. Our room was very clean, everybody was ultra nice and helpful, and theiair conditioning was the best hotel unit I have ever seen (after 50 years of extensive travels). The bathroom was small by todays standards but very nice with old style marble tiles and new plumbingand a fa shower. the room was m'ore value per dollar than i have seen elsewhere. OK, so the views ore not so spectacular, but for the price, ... My wfe tried the beach and was disappointed, but the pools were fine. If you want a good beach you can try any of the public beachs or pay #100 a night moreat a beach front hotel. Our primary gripe was that the food costs were a bit outlandish. The breakfast buffet, which is pretty good, but not outstanding was $21.95 per, plus.. That's 50 bucks for breakfast!! No way. But, with some advice from the concierge staff, we found a buncn of good restaurants a 2 minute walk from the hotel. For breakfast try Jose's Hacienda. Right on the water, literally, and full breakfasts for less than $6. For dinner, therre are 2 great places. the best known is Ajili Mojili. Great PR and Caribean food, expensive and worth every penny. Across the street and next to jose's is Ropa Veija, cuban PR. Fantastic place, doesn't advertise and fills up every night by 7:30. get there before that or be prepared to wait in the bar (Which is Ok, because they make a fabulous fresh Mohito).We ate there sveral times and each was better than the last, great food, good service and good wines. One last commenton the hotel. the casino has penny and nickel slots. Which unlike Vegas, pay lousy. We put 2 bucks into each type and the TOTAL return was twelve cents) In otherwords a 3% return and unb scrip not in coins, not the 95% that Vegas advertises. Also, the casino allows smoking, and reeks from it. overall, we liked our stay and would return, rooms and service better than expected.

Reviews.Title: “A Little Run Down, but ok”
Reviews.Author: ChiefVacationOfficer
Reviews.Content: Positives: It's in a good location, near a small beach, which is decent for snorkeling in the lagoon. The pool area is nice (2 pools, 2 hot tubs) and would be great for kids, as there is a slide. The service was friendly and the bed was comfy, although our favorite hotel restuarant, , Max's, was a little expensive. There were also good restaurant options (Ropa Vieja down the street is fantastic!) Negatives: The hotel is big-time worn down, at least the side that we were on (opposite of casino and main building). The rugs were coming up at the seams, the closet door kept falling off, and the bathroom was tiny. Oh yeah, and the rail on the balcony was unsteady! To add insult to injury, they play Richard Marx muzak on a loop in the lobby! We were on the "city" side, in one of the less expensive rooms. The other side may have been nicer. I wasn't impressed with the condition of the room and felt that it was very worn-down. There are a lot of new hotels going up in this area, and if the Condado wants to stay competitive, they'll definitely have to step it up a notch.

Reviews.Title: “Good Overall”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I just came back from spring break in PR. Six friends and I stayed at the Condado. I want to give an extra special rating to the staff at the Condado. I left my laptop in the lobby when we checkied and went out all day and didn't notice it was gone until late that night. I live in NY so I was sure it was gone. However, when I went to the front desk later that night, it was waiting there for me. Plus the front desk had been searching for me all day, but of course I was out enjoying PR! However, like many of the reviews, I noticed some things that could be approved in regards to housekeeping. My comforter was stained and was the bed skirt. However, when I asked for new linens and comforter they were replaced immediately. Overall our stay was fine. To readers, considering the Condado if you're interested in staying at a moderately priced hotel, then you're in the right place. Its safe and close to everything. Its not five star, but you're also not paying for five star quality. My best advice is to adjust your expectations and be realistic about what you're willing to spend. .

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded expectations!”
Reviews.Author: Cleo083
Reviews.Content: Despite some recent reviews which praised the hotel, I still went there with some dread, wondering if I would be saddled with a dirty room, etc. I must say that we were very pleased overall and had a great vacation. We chose the Condado Plaza because the rest of the hotels closer to the airport had negative reviews about the noise level of the planes flying throughout the day. The hotel occupies two buildings on either side of Ashford Avenue, which are connected by a walk-way from the casino. The main building (the one with the lobby) is towards the ocean and the building opposite is towards the lagoon. I asked to be shown two rooms and got to see the City Vista rooms in both buildings. The room in the main building was definitely run-down, with very old carpeting and worn out furniture. I prayed that the second room would be better and it was! I can only surmise that the people who wrote unhappy reviews got to stay in the City Vista rooms in tne main building. FYI, all City Vista rooms face the opposite buliding and from some, you can get a glimpse of the sea. Like some reviews mentioned, the concierges are not very helpful and are standoffish, but not rude. One gave me false information once - I had asked how much a taxi cost to go to Old San Juan and he said I did not need a taxi and could just walk the distance as it was right around the corner and about a 5-10 minute walk. It was lucky I asked the bellman for specific directions, because it turned out that it was a 5-10 minute RIDE in the taxi! The Condado beach is a public one and can be accessed by walking through the hotel, past the pools, or by the road. There is a person there to help you with the chairs. If you are a guest of the hotel, you do not need to pay the $4.00 to rent chairs. There are locals, at the beach, but for me, that was a great part of the charm. Puerto Ricans like to vacation with their families and it was wonderful to hear a new language, even if I did not understand it!. The beach is small and you cannot walk anywhere as there are rocks that form a barrier. On the bright side this is exactly what makes it safe for children to swim in those waters and there are fish that fish that my daughter chased around. Because of the rocks, the sand is not fine and you can get a scratch or two if not careful. It didn't bother me and we all went barefoot. The pools were on the smaller side and it was difficult to get chairs around the pool if you got there late. But the water-slide was great fun and the size of the pool was not an issue for me. The baby-pool is more like a fountain, but I was happy to have my little one wading in it, while watching my elder one at the water-slide. Old San Juan is to the right of the hotel. To the left of the hotel a nice walk, with some interesting shops, restaurants and convenient stores. A mile or so down to the left, is a nice, lively area with lots of people and restaurants. That is where the Radisson and the Marriott are located. Eating out is very expensive. We tried to find cheaper places to eat in, but the price in most places are fairly comparable. Since there is no sales tax on the island (good thing if you want to buy something from the Cartier, Dior close by), I suspect, restaurants make up for it. We were thankful to have Subway round the corner from the hotel and stocked up on snacks, orange juice and milk. Maid service was regular and a couple of requests we had were met promptly. When we interrupted the service however (we came for a quick change, when the maid was cleaning the room) it never got finished. Check-in and check-out were fast and efficient. Sure the Ritz is better, but I would have spent $350 a night there, as opposed to $150 a night at the Condado plaza. I would definitely stay at the Condado Plaza again, if we were to come back to the San-Juan area of P.R. It's proximity to Old San Juan (a $12 taxi-ride each way), but removed from the hustle bustle of the same, is very attractive. We went there every evening to eat and even tried this place called La Bombonera (unadvertised by tourist guides) which is a great little place with inexpensive and ethnic food; it also had some great pastries. There is a bus-stop to the left of the hotel, a minute's walk, where you can take a bus to the old city for a mere 75 cents and save yourself a nice bundle if you had the time. I took it twice and the bus drops you off at the pier in Old San Juan. Puerto Rico is a lovely place and we will definitely be back to the island again. It is thanks to my fellow tripadvisors that I got information that was useful and if anyone has any question, please feel free to write to me at cleocap@hotmail.com Happy trails!

Reviews.Title: “Not nearly as bad as they say!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a 5 night, 6 day stay at the Condado Plaza with 2 of my girlfriends and must say that this place was more than I expected given the mostly negative reviews on this site! We booked a room through the hotel's website (which ironically, still states that it's associated with the Wyndham chain) and were able to get a city view room at the rate of $195 per night with the AAA discount. Upon arrival, however, we inquired about the availability of ocean view rooms and were given a free upgrade to a room with a nice balcony on the 8th floor. No hassling required! I definitely recommend asking upon check-in....worst case scenario is that they say no and you're stuck with a view of the lagoon. Though I must say that it is quite nice to sip your morning coffee on the balcony while watching and listening to the waves crash on the rocks. Overall, the room was average. We were 3 girls in the room with plenty of luggage in tow, so the enormous walk-in closet came in extremely handy. There was also a bar with not one, but two fridges in it, which we used to store a couple of bottles of wine that we bought from the convenience store next door. The bathroom was also average, though our tub did have the tendency to clog. We called housekeeping on the second day and they immediately sent up a repair man who fixed the problem. Service was below average. Although housekeeping was very pleasant and responed immediately to extra towel, extra pillow, and extra hair-dryer requests, the other other hotel staff was not very helpful nor very friendly. The concierge staff was quite rude, and though they did make a few dinner reservations in Old San Juan for us, they did so somewhat reluctantly. The young lady at the tour desk was extremely haughty and relatively uninformed regarding the various trips they had to offer. In addition, the staff in the various restaurants spoke limited English and were not very attentive. The pool and beach area were also below average. There were plenty of chairs and a nice poolside bar, though the pools themselves were extremely small and had a lot of debris in them. We walked onto the "beach" one day to check it out and immediately walked off. Although the water was warm and seemed clear, the sand was kind of dirty and had a lot of locals on it. Definitely no privacy or sense of calm. Of note, access to the hotel from this public beach is guarded by hotel security, who require that you show either your room key or the wrist band that they give out at the towel stand. Security also patrolled the pool area regularly and promptly removed people who were not patrons of the hotel. The food at the pool bar is extremely expensive! A salad there is $18...the same exact salad at the Italian restaurant on the Mezzanine level is $4.95. Definitely worth the short trip upstairs. We spent most of our pool/beach days at the Caribe Hilton which is right across the lagoon and is accessible via a short walk across the bridge. Our friend gave us his Hilton Honors card, so we were able to walk right into the hotel, get towels, use the facilities, etc. The pool and beach area is 100 times nicer at the Caribe Hilton than at the Condado Plaza, but at a rate of $400 a night, I think our strategy was better! The Caribe Hilton also has a very nice spa (1 hour massages in the $120-150 range) and a beautiful Pan Asian restaurant called the Lemongrass Grill. Definitely on the expensive side ($25-30 per entree), but the food and the ambiance seemed well worth it (I personally don't know how much our bill came to since our friend knows the owner, who came over and sat with us for the majority of the meal and then waived the bill!!!) The Caribe Hilton also has a Starbucks in its lobby, which we visited quite frequently! In terms of other restaurants in the Condado area, there is a nice Cuban/Puerto Rican restaurant called Ropa Vieja that's about a 3 minute walk from the Hotel. Very large portions and very reasonably priced (Our bill with appetizers and wine came to about $65 in total). I also recommend checking out Calle Fortaleza in Old San Juan which has a ton of really good restaurants. Lastly, the gym at the hotel was pretty nice...4 treadmills, 4 stationary bikes, and a whole slew of weight machines and free weights. There's a sign on the door that says a $7 fee will be automatically charged to your account once you swipe your hotel room key to get in, but no such charges showed up on our bill upon check-out. There is, however, a standard $48 per night resort fee/resort tax that is automatically charged to your account, so beware that you actually need to add on about $50 to the rate they initially quote you. Overall, the hotel superceded my expectations, though after staying at the Ritz Carlton on a previous trip to Puerto Rico and seeing the Caribe Hilton, I doubt I'd go back. Hope this was helpful!

Reviews.Title: “Just got back today!!”
Reviews.Author: Deltagurl
Reviews.Content: Truly not a bad hotel. Given all of the seasonal weather that the Caribbean experiences, I did not expect Ritz Carlton service nor amenities. Upon my arrival on 4/3, my reservation was lost in the system. So I had to wait for an hour to get checked in. I was apologized to and upgraded to an ocean view from city view. The hotel was not full so, it would have been unoccupied anyway. However, I am thankful. The rooms are a bit out of date and reminded me of the Holiday Inns we stayed at many years ago as kids. The decor was modern. The bathroom was slightly larger than 3 lavatories on an aircraft. If I leaned too far I would probably fall out of the shower and onto the toilet or floor. It would be nice at renovation if they gave less room to the huge walk in closet and more bathroom space. The staff was quite pleasant. Our first night/into day 2 resulted in a mix up with housekeeping. We didn't have our room serviced since they waited so long to clean our room. They brought up towels and promptly took care of us the next day. We did have low pressure to our sink faucet, but they immediately made necessary repairs. Beach is not great but will do. Lots of debris and coarse sand. The pool is okay, yet a good cleaning or fresh paint from staining would be nice. The hot tub was fab. The kids loved the slide. The one thing that I did miss was the hotel in room guide on what the hotel itself had to offer. I am assuming since their ownership is changing they've removed the marketing material. Also the cable went in and out and often switched to channel 02 all by itself. That was aggravating. And Channel 33 (the hotel channel) had digital pixels which required you mentally putting the picture together. We ate breakfast one morning at Max's. Horrible. Kids ate free, but after leaving Vegas with the $10.95 buffet and paying $21.00 per person for this was bad. Bad eggs. Omelette chef needs some major help. Churrascos a little tough. Our waiter Rafael was great. Go out of the hotel and walk across the street to the Sizzler for lunch. They've got an all you can eat buffet. Get there about 1030A, cause the locals really show up for lunch. Also walk around the Condado area (go left leaving the hotel). It is a nice after dinner walk. Besides we discoverd Subway, Baskin Robbins/Dunkin Donuts, Wendys, Walgreens, Banco Popular (ATM machine on site). Also upscale shopping at Christian Dior, Cartier, Louis Vuitton, and Salvatore Ferragamo. Also the B21 bus takes you to Plaza las Americas (the mall). It was raining the day we went to Sizzler and the guy charged us $10 to go across the street. WALK! What a waste. He made me use my known Spanish. We had paid $12 to go to Old San Juan the day before. Oh while in OSJ, make sure you eat at Cafe Puerto Rico and order mofongos de mariscos (seafood). Excelente!!

Reviews.Title: “Not as bad as some make it sound”
Reviews.Author: sarahlg33
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for part of our stay during our honeymoon in January. It was not nearly as bad as some made it out to be, but it certainly isn't a 5-star hotel. I would agree to not pay too much for the room. We had a decent room with a balcony and view of the lagoon, perfectly fine for the $200 we paid a night. Based on what I've seen of other hotel prices in SJ, it's a decent enough value. Definately take the bus to Old SJ, but be warned that it does not stick to a schedule - or at least that my husband or I could figure out. One day we only waited 10 minutes, the next over an hour (we kept telling ourselves the minute we left, it would come...). Definately walk down the way further into the Condado area. There are some good restaurants and it is a nice walk. Overall, I don't think I would stay here again. I'd like to try another hotel first. However, should I not have luck with the next hotel, I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Expensive so watch out”
Reviews.Author: Mikey72
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Condado Plaza for two separate nights. The first time I was in the building on the lagoon side, with a beautiful view over the water. As earlier reviews state, this building is dated and not nearly as nice as the ocean-front building. The ocean-front rooms are very nice, modern, larger, and with a refrigerator and walk-in closet. The view was amazing from my 7th floor balcony. These rooms are also about twice as expensive. You have to watch your spending on food and drinks. The breakfast buffet is now $21, and you'll pay at least $10 if you order a la carte. There are a number of restaurants within a 10 minute walk so I suggest taking a stroll and checking them out. The rooms have high-speed internet, but you'll pay a surcharge of $15/day to use it. Once connected it worked fine. I had no issues with hotel staff, and check-in and check-out were easy. I walked by the casino but didn't linger because I don't like smokey areas. The Condado Beach area is OK, but if you want a beautiful long white sandy beach I would stay elsewhere. The area is convenient to Old San Juan, about a $12 taxi ride away. There are lots of hotels in San Juan, so next time I will try someplace different.

Reviews.Title: “One word - unpleasant”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We were extremely disappointed in this hotel and some of the staff left us feeling utterly unwelcome. We will never return to this hotel nor would I advise anyone else to ever stay at it. It was extremely expensive - over $45 for 1 hamburger, 1 turkey club sandwich and 2 sodas at the poolside cabana. The 'beach' was tiny, crowded and right next to a major bridge thoroughway - local children literally were jumping off the bridge and into the beach area for fun. The poolside bartenders were downright rude and a 10 oz can of beer will cost you $5. The hotel itself is quite a bit past its prime and in need of a serious update. The only good thing I have to say about this hotel is that the front desk staff and room attendants were all very pleasant and accomodating. Too bad the rest of the staff made our visit so very unpleasant - the difference between a great hotel and a terrible hotel is not how much it costs you, but the quality of it's staff. Apparently the Condado Plaza Hotel and Casino isn't aware of this.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Awful!! No Beach!”
Reviews.Author: rachiefish
Reviews.Content: A friend and I booked a package deal through Jet Blue that included this hotel. We knew not to expect the Ritz, but were so disgusted by this hotel that we did not even spend the night here. To begin with, the hotel does not have "white sand beaches," despite that exact description on the website. There is a "lagoon," which is a dirty, miniscule sliver of land which also contains a children's swingset. You cannot swim in the ocean from this hotel. We were expecting a beach hotel and were shocked to find that there was no beach. Second of all, when we arrived at the hotel at approximately 5 pm, the only place we could find to eat was at Tony Romas, which is across the street. The staff was rude and completely dismissive. When I asked about the reported 7 restaurants that the hotel advertises, the nasty staff member looked at me as if I were insane and then said that each of the restaurants I asked about "was not there." When I pointed to the sign that advertized these restaurants, the staff just shrugged. This was not a language barrier issue, as I asked in both English and Spanish. Though there were no other customer's at the concierge's desk, the concierge did not acknowledge me (despite the fact that we made eye contact) until I actually shouted "excuse me" several times. When I asked about the beach, the concierge rudely directed me to the internet kiosk. When I pressed him further, he said that the Marriott had a beach and suggested that it was a 5-10 minute walk away. As I promptly switched to the Marriott, I can assure you that it was a 5-10 minute taxi drive--not within walking distance unless you felt like taking a hike. Lastly, the room was disgusting. Though it was a non-smoking room, there were cigarette burns on the furniture, the furniture was cracked, old and dirty and the room itself was small. The bathroom was miniscule. Though the dirty hotel directory (and yes, I do mean dirty--there were recent food stains on the pages) stated that there was a mini-bar, when I asked the desk about the lack of a mini-bar, they told me that they had discontinued mini-bar service. The hotel itself was seedy and run-down. To put it simply, we did not feel safe there. My friend and I realized quickly that we did wish to stay at the hotel and began frantically calling local hotels to find somewhere else to stay. Though we only made LOCAL calls from the room, apparently local to the hotel means in-hotel only (despite what it said on the phone). Calls to the nearby Marriott (ie: within the same area and local calling code) wound up costing $50, though it was a small price to pay to get out of that dump. Do not stay here! It is overpriced and terrible! Their website is a complete misrepresentation. Do not be fooled.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible for the Price (even without it!)”
Reviews.Author: trvlmnky
Reviews.Content: First of all, do not be fooled by the description of a "white sand beach." This hotel is NOT on the beach. The hotel is on the ocean, and a strip of huge rocks separate the two. There is a very small square of beach, on a lagoon, and next to the main road, which really doesn't qualify as white sand. It had a jungle gym on it and it was not very clean. If you are going to PR for the beach, go elsewhere. Second, do not be fooled by the description of seven terrific restaurants. I never saw all seven, and the ones I did see were lined up back to back like a food court. Additionally, the staff seemed to think Tony Roma's accross the street was the best dining option. Third, the room was in awful shape. There was no mini-bar (and no working mini-fridge for drinks). The furniture was chipped and scratched and the curtains and window dresssings were dirty. The room (even with a/c on) was humid. Finally, the conceirge was rude - and the rest of the staff was just plain unhelpful. They struggled to recommend restaurants, bars, etc (beyond Tony Roma's of course!). Overall, this was a huge disappointment. If it had been half the price then maybe (maybe) it woudl have been worth it. However, even then I would have wished I was just on the beach in an inexpensive bungalow in Rincon.

Reviews.Title: “Awful Check-in Experience”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We booked a four-night reservation at least one month in advance through Wyndam. We got to the hotel early to check-in and the check-in clerk told us they did not have a room for us for the first night. We had a confirmation and reservation number with us. At first, the only option they gave us was to shuttle us to the Holiday Inn for one night (even though we paid for the Condado Hotel rate). After arguing with them for 30 minutes, they finally gave us a Murphy room - with a tiny double bed that pulls out of the wall - this was not what we had reserved and paid for. Apparently their Associate Director of Sales (Pier M. LeCompte) was responsible for making the decision to bump off our reservation to accomodate a Sales Convention that was scheduled for the same weekend. I called Ms. LeCompte and her answer to why the sales party was given preferential treatment was 'We are in the hotel business. This is what we do.' She was completely unhelpful and had a real snooty attitude. Adding more insult to injury, as we were continually being told they were sold out, at least 10 parties arrived after us being able to check-in without a problem. Somehow we chosen to be the unlucky victims. We got to the hotel early after a long flight and were hoping to be able to enjoy some sun that afternoon. Instead, we spent 45 minutes checking in. I would not recommend this hotel to anyone. Check-in service is awful. If you do have reservations at this hotel, I recommend that you call in advance to confirm.

Reviews.Title: “a nice vacation spot - not luxurious”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel as a package with an airline. I was very nervous upon reading some of the other reviews but was pretty happy with our experience. First of all it was 5 minutes from the airport and $20 - the cabs in PR are outrageuos (and we're from NY!). Check in was a breeze - 5 minutes and they had our room ready at noon (we expected to have to wait till 4) The room was very clean, we had a beautiful ocean view on the top floor. The maid was great - came every night and replaced the towels we used to shower with before dinner. Then came back later on to see if we needed anything else. The hotel is on the older side, the room was a little dated. But it was very clean. We loved the huge walk in closet - it kept our clothes out of the way and gave us a place other than the bathroom to change (we had kids with us) Our major disappointment was the beach. We are beach people and one of the reasons I booked this place was for the beach. The photos on all the websites do it much more justice than it deserves - the beach is right on the highway - loud trucks and cars racing by, not the serene beach experience we were looking for. Also - it's a lagoon - not the ocean. It is very rocky - filled with sharp rocks that slice your feet and hands...wear water shoes. Also it is a public beach, not just for hotel guests. We mostly stayed by the pools which were clean. My son loved the water slide and towels were readily available. As with most resorts, you have to come claim your seats early in the morning to get the best location. We ate breakfast in the hotel - Max's restaurant - for $15 you got a nice buffet - all you can eat. homemade waffles and omelets....very good. We didn't try the other restaurants but ventured down the street and into old san juan and had some great meals. We did have lunch one day at the pool restaurant which was horrible and over priced. The hotel staff was weak. They really didn't seem to care, unlike other places we've been where the staff is very attentive (and looking for tips) the staff here seemed like they couldn't be bothered. The swim up bar at the pool had one, sometimes two bartenders - you had to wait forever to be served (weak $8 drinks or a $3 soda that was about 3 oz soda and 5 oz ice)....there were always lines at the bar -- no waiters walking around while you were at your lounge chairs taking drink orders. The restaurant at the pool had HORRIBLE service - one afternoon I ordered lunch, waited one hour and was told my order was never put in, because they were busy. It was Presidents week and I'm sure the hotel was full - but ADD MORE STAFF!!! We're not big lunch eaters so after a big breakfast, all we really needed was a snack mid-day and then dinner....After dinner one night we got a case of soda (you could also get beer) from a local store and put it in our room refrigerator. We also picked up some snacks and brought soda and snacks down to the pool in the afternoon. I'd stay here again if I wanted a quick getaway and got another good deal.

Reviews.Title: “Nice getaway place”
Reviews.Author: Agent011
Reviews.Content: My wife and me just recently came back from a 7-night vacation. We have to say that Condado Plaza is a great hotel for a three star rating. Check-in was pretty quick and we didn't wait for the room at all. We asked for a possible free upgrade but the lady was unbreakable. She offered oceanview room for additional $40 per night. We declined. Our room was on the 9th floor. Hotel has 10 floors altogether and the top two floors are Executive level. Room was big with pullout sofabed and high speed internet modem. Comparing to other islands in the Caribbean, hotel food was not so expensive but was not worth money paid. Along Ashford Avenue, there are a lot of restaurants and fast food places that offer much more delicious meals. We usually had breakfast at Hacienda Don Jose which is like 2 minute walk from the hotel. It offers breakfast specials for $5.75. Right next door, there is Waikiki Restaurant & Bar that is a bit more expensive but steaks there are great. Both restaurants offer magnificent oceanview. On the other hand, staff of Condado Plaza did not look very knowledgeable about their own hotel. For example, one of the staff didn't even know where the third pool is. Also, do not leave your chairs unattended for too long. We left towels once to reserve spot and went for lunch. When we came back after an hour, the towels were gone. Hotel beach was clean and nice. If you love to play tennis, you may take advantage of this. They charge you $10 for reservation and $5 more for racquet and balls rental. So, if you bring your own eqipment, you may even play for free. Both courts are lighted. Nightly entertainment was boring. There was a live band playing right next to the casino. Unless you stood close to them, you couldn't hear them play. Marriot Hotel has live band playing every night from Wednesday to Sunday. It's just a 15 minute walk from Condado Plaza. Overall, we had a great time and we are satisfied what we got for our money.

Reviews.Title: “Condado was OK”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I just got back from a 5-night stay at Condado Plaza in San Juan Puerto Rico. I felt the need to come on here and write about my stay to clarify some things. When I booked this hotel, I came on here and read some of the reviews and they were awful. I came in to the hotel trying to keep an open mind. The hotel honestly was average... I am a clean freak so there was nothing dirty about this hotel like some people have said in these reviews. The cleaning ladies were very nice and did a great job. The rooms were very clean as well as the bathrooms. The service however was definitely poor. I had to wait about 3 hours for my room to be ready and it took about an hour to check in to the hotel itself. The casino .. I would not recommend playing blackjack or slot machines.. I never saw anything hit. I play poker a lot (usually No Limit here in the US) and found that Puerto Rico only offers 5-10 Limit !! So I tried it out and it's a totally different game..but I made $600 on the trip playing this .. If you are a poker fanatic, take a drive over to Intercontinental to play..there are better players. As for the cuisine, I didn't eat in the hotel....the hotel's food was extremely overpriced! All you have to do to get some FANTASTIC food is walk about 5 minutes down the street from the hotel... and there are 2 great restuarants I went to called "ROPA VIEJA" and "AJILI MOJILI" They are excellent..also down that road is a Louis Vuitton store, a Cartier store and other nice shops... which made me happy :) Overall, It was a good stay.. nothing was dirty about the rooms or the pool area like previous reviews had said. It's just a place to stay and it definitely mett my expectations.

Reviews.Title: “You must read this entire review!!!”
Reviews.Author: DiamondsNewJersey
Reviews.Content: Just got back last week. Spent a week at Condado. Upon arrival front desk upgraded my husband and I from city view to ocean view for no extra price, just because they had the availability. What a treat that was. Service was very good all around. Beautiful pool area. However, beach was tiny and hotel in in great need of renovation. Last day my cell phone was stolen from my bag at pool(everything else was still in bag). Last night after enjoying the hot tub and pool one last time when standing and drying off, I noticed a large rat scurrying right by the pool. THANK GOD I SAW THIS ON THE LAST NIGHT!!! P.S. Beware of Cristobel Fort in Old San Juan. Within 5 minutes we saw an old man smoking crack out of a beer bottle and 3 guys shooting up with heroine in this area. SAD SAD SAD

Reviews.Title: “Well worth it”
Reviews.Author: cocanat
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just got back from a week in Puerto Rico (Nov. 3-10) and stayed at the Condado Plaza Hotel and we thought it was a great hotel. Since I think these reviews should start out with a short bio on the author, my wife and I are in our mid-50s, very middle class. We take a couple of travel vacations a year, and have become fairly skilled at finding the best accomodations for the money. The Condado Plaza seemed to be the best value, so we booked it, even though some of the reviewers have been brutal to this hotel. We booked a city view room and were pleased to find that all the city view rooms have a nice view of the ocean/lagoon/Old San Juan from the balcony. It wasn't as great as the ocean view, but we saved about $50 a day by booking the city view room. Facilities: The restaurants seemed to be nice, but the only one we ate in was Tony Roma's. If you like Tony Roma's in other locations (and we do), you'll like this one just fine. We generally just have one meal a day, and we discovered a half dozen very nice restaurants less than a quarter mile walk down Ashford Avenue. The two pools next to the beach at the hotel are beautiful, and one has a swim-up bar. There is a large hot tub in the pool area. The beach area is modest in size, but it's the calmest point in the Condado area. Note, if you're staying on the Condado at any place other than the Condado Plaza, you'll just be able to watch the ocean, not swim in it. If a great beach is what you are looking for, then stay in one of the hotels in the Isla Verde area. The beach there will satisfy anyone, but you'll be paying a lot more to stay out there. Casino...we went to several in San Juan, and the one at the Condado Plaza was the busiest. They have a Texas Hold-em Table going from about 6PM until the game breaks up, usually about 3AM. Just believe me when I tell you that you can make enough money here to pay for your trip if you are a skilled player. Overall, the casino was extremely satisfactory, with a good live band playing adjacent to it.
