In general, you must understand that the Condado Plaza is about 40 years old, built just after Castro took over in Cuba in order to fill the need for a classy Caribbean resort. The overall facility is excellent, just dated. The electric and plumbing worked just fine. The room was ample, the furniture was nice. The bathroom was modest, as in all the older hotels, but the closet was the best one I've ever had in all my travels. There is a safe in the room, and our unit had two small refrigerators. I found the poor reviews of this hotel to be either ridiculous, or from people who stayed at the wrong hotel in the first place. If you have a large budget, plan to spend the entire trip in your hotel, want the newest facility and the most dazzling beach, then book the InterContinental, the El San Juan, or the Ritz-Carlton. But if you're getting a nice price break, I think you'll enjoy the Condado Plaza Hotel. We liked Puerto Rico and plan to return in a couple of years. We will probably stay at the Condado Plaza again.

Reviews.Title: “Save yourself!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I just returned from this hotel on Monday November 14th after staying for the weekend, let me state the problems: 1. Arrived at 11am in order to take advantage of the full day, The really snooty and curt Check in clerk told us the check in time was at 3pm! eventhough their checkout is at 12noon! 3 hours to clean a room? 2. Their drinks are way overpriced for the cheap Bacardi rum they put in all of their drinks...a PiÃ±a Colada=$8...So much $$ when you have the Bacardi Factory within mininutes away? Highway robbery! 3.Cabs are the only way to get around, the police does not let in "regular" cabs into the Hotel areas in order to make you pay approximately $12 for a 8 minute ride...they all have meters but dont use it, cuz it would only cost you like $4 instead... 4. Food is overpriced...Cheeseburger; not gourmet, regular=$13 Breakfast..2 eggs, bacon, harsh browns=$14...unbelieable 5. Last but not least....a room tax and tariff per person per night that they dont tell you about till they slip the bill under the door before you leave! around $17.95 per person per night...on top of what you pay to stay there! ***Fun people, dont bother, Great nightlife for a tourist is non existent!*** Spend your $$ elsewhere

Reviews.Title: “Simple Mediocrity.”
Reviews.Author: mumufreemovies
Reviews.Content: I stayed mid November 2005 in Room 620 (facing the Ocean). I love Wyndham hotels and while Wyndham's own website lists this property as a Wyndham, it is not. Thus, I did not get the Wyndham perks like free WiFi, free unlimited domestic U.S. calls, a welcome snack upon arrival. Prior to arriving at the hotel, I even faxed a letter to the hotel confirming my reservation. Not surprisingly, while my letter was addressed to Wyndham Condado, the hotel never bothered to call and alert me of the hotel name change. Furthermore, everything in the room still has the Wyndham name on it. I thought that was funny. And, it if matters to some guests, the use of the hotel gym will incur you an additional daily charge. The hotel check-in clerk initially told me "you don't have a deluxe room". When I showed her the confirmation print-out showing my reservation to be a "deluxe room" the clerk said nothing further. In fact, I found the clerk's attitude to be quite curt. In this business, attitude is everything and I give the check-in clerk very low marks. She apparently got annoyed when I wanted to know how much was the additional charge to get a room with an upgraded view. The floors where the guests rooms are have visibly worn hallway carpeting. The guest room itself was decent and spacious. Nothing spectacular. The walk-in closet was a nice surprise but the small bathroom was slightly disappointing. If you spend under $100 a nite it's fair. Anything over $125 per night is not a great deal at all (there is a hotel tax and a resort tax, totaling about 22% of the bill). At the end of the stay the hotel gave me a bill for the entire room even though my stay was prepaid through a package deak. Another minor inconvenience. Overall, it was a nice stay, nothing spectacular and certainly nothing extraordinary. By the way, if you are in the Condado area I cannot recommend eating Japanese food at Hamasaki. Severely over-priced but horrendously bad food.

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay here”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with a group of people. 1 person's ceiling of their bathroom fell in! Other's had to move rooms as they were dirty or musty. Everything was overpriced, pina colada with no rum $8!!!! Service terrible, then on check out they charged us a maid gratuity, and bell man gratuity!!!! Absolutely terrible place.

Reviews.Title: “Check in at 6 pm?”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We arrived at 11:00am and was told we couldn't get a room until 3:00pm. So, we decided to do some exploring around the city. We got back by 4 and were told we had to wait until 6, even though we were promised a room. When we spoke to the manager, she made it clear how little she cared and said we could "purchase" a drink while we waited. It would seem after that, it would cost them maybe $1.00 a drink to keep their customers happy, but no, the horrible manager refused even that. When we were checking out, they tacked on a "resort" charge of $15.00per day. The price of the bloody place was inflated as it was and we were never informed about the "resort tax". Overall, a very poor experience. Bad service, awful food (don't bother with the restuarants) and a joke of a "private beach."

Reviews.Title: “Forget the Wyndham Condado!”
Reviews.Author: crdaus
Reviews.Content: This hotel was terrible. As soon as I checked in I was looking for a an alternative place to stay (which I managed to arrange after two nights). The hotel had a run down feel to it and displayed a lack of maintenance with one elevator broken, several gym machines not working, dirty carpets in the reception areas, etc. There was also a very damp smell everywhere. Its location is also not very good, being at the extreme end of Ashford Avenue where all the re-construction is underway. At least I wasn't penalised for truncating my stay.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My friends and I stayed at the Wyndham Condado Plaza Hotel July 22-31. It was soo much fun!! At first when we arrived and we requested early check-in and the room was not ready yet. They had told us it would be ready in an hour. We explored the grounds which was BEAUTIFUL and returned within an hour. They then told use that our room was still not ready. We where getting very fustrated and the kept apoligyzing and gve us each 2 free drink vouchers. About a half hour later we go our room and it was beautiful. It was clean and cozy. The staff was very nice and catered to your every need. If you are traveling with children this is a grat place to stay. We where 3 young girls (22 and up) but still had alot of fun. They cater to every age and the party never stops!!! We loved it so much we are going back again in the Spring!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great fun at Wyndham!”
Reviews.Author: Lovinbabe
Reviews.Content: My family and i stayed at the Wyndham for only 2 days but we had loads of fun, centered in the heart of Condado near local shops. Only around 20 mins to the airport and 10 mins to the cruise port. 24hour taxis available from the hotel. 3 swimming pools and fun regular activities by the pool every day including volley ball, karaoke, trivias etc. Even a pool bar! Lots of sunbeds so not hard to find. Indoor restaurant and large very colourful casino. If you're short on money there is a 'Subway' down the road for food ;-) Very friendly staff and attractive looking hotel. Have fun!

Reviews.Title: “A Great Time”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and i spent 10 days in the Wyndham Hotel in San Juan celebrating our 2nd anniversary . We were very skepical from reading reviews of past clients experiences . Thank god we went with an open mind . Every thing was perfect . The staff made us feel very welcomed and answered all our questions and needs . We stayed in the lagoon hotel on the 10th floor . All though the beach hotel was in front of us , the view was great . We could see the ocean and lagoon on both sides . Its true the resturants in the hotel are expensive but that was easily remedied . On Asford Avenue in walking distance you can find latin cusine resturants . Plus a WENDYS , PIZZA HUT , DUNKIN DONUTS . SUBWAY , WALGREENS and plenty bodegas and souviner stores . Take advantage of the fridge in the room . We took a walk to the store and loaded up on cold cuts . bread , snacks . water and soda for late nite snacks and something to eat while we were at the beach . The beach is small but plenty of room for everybody . Very family oriented . The water was warm and crystal clear . We never missed a day at the beach and pool . The tour desk is in the main lobby . You gotta take advantage of the tours . We went to the rainforest , old San Juan , THE BACARDI FACTORY TOUR , and last but not least , we took a snorkling tour on a 50ft sail boat . What a party boat that was . If you decide to go snorkling ask for the boat named " THE TRAVELER " . The tour guides were very knowlegable . The casino is no Vegas but then what can you compare Vegas too . All in all , we can't wait to go back . REMEMBER KEEP AN OPEN MIND

Reviews.Title: “Needs some updating”
Reviews.Author: tkwhite
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay. Hotel was clean. However, while the hotel is nice it by no means is luxurious. If you are looking for a â€œresort feelâ€� try the Wyndham El San Juan (beautiful in comparison). The Wyndham Condado has a few pitfalls and is clearly in need of some TLC. It is an older hotel that is in need of a some updating/improvements and general maintenance. The main pool had several missing/cracked tiles, the carpet on our floor (7) was ancient â€“ very faded and worn. The salt water pool needed an overhaul. The lobby had marble tile floors with glass mosaic tiles in one area that had missing pieces. One of three phones in our room did not work. Bathrooms needed updating too. The beach is small, on a main road, and not nearly as nice as some of the beaches in PR. On the plus side breakfast buffet was good at the restaurant in the mezzanine. Staff was gracious, helpful and accommodating. If you stay there go to Ropa Vieja for dinner it is wonderful and just down the street.

Reviews.Title: “Awful!”
Reviews.Author: anav
Reviews.Content: I am a Wyndham By request member. I booked an ocean front deluxe room. Check in was quick and we were guarenteed late check out. When we arrived to the room we were horrified. It was dingy old and smelly to the point I was nauseated. The furniture was from the 60s, the ceiling was stained and falling down. There was a balcony where I spent the next 7 hours the time it took the hotel to change the room. Our next room was without a balcony...not what I paid for. After making a quick round of the hotel area pool beach etc we decided not to stay. After all the fuss the hotel comped us the night and we checked out the next morning. I spent a week in PR, 4 days at the Conquistador, 1 night at the Condado and 2 at the Holiday Inn. I must say the Wyndham Condado has some arrogance calling itself a 4 star hotel. I'd give it 1.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Wyndham Condado from 6-30 to 7-11. It was a wonderful stay. The staff was very attentive and helpful. The rooms were ample and had a huge closet, which could fit a twin size bed if needed. We were on the 7th floor ocean side. The building by the lagoon had ceiling fans, our side did not. This was not needed since the air conditioning was very good. At night I would make the room very cold and then prop the balcony door opened so that we could listen to the ocean throughout the night. It was a great way to sleep. We had a hard time trying to find a car rental from the places nearby, so the concierge immedialtely called a dealership that would rent cars. We got a better deal then what Avis and L&M were offering. L&M require that you show proof of car insurance if you choose not to take their ins. Of course we did not have our cards with us. Besides their rates were outrageous. The staff were always helpful when it came to giving us directions. They were always ready to open the doors and take luggage. The building is old, so expect some things to be a little runned down. Many people have complained about that the carpeting is old. If People are concerned about carpeting then go somewhere else. This should be the least of your concerns while on vacation. So what if the carpeting is old. You go on vacation to enjoy the sights, the pool and to eat. Not to look at carpeting! The elevators at times were slow, so don't try taking the elevator during checkout time, that is when they are slow, but otherwise they were fine. The pool area was very nice. People complain about too many kids in the pool, but what can you expect, the pool is 3.8ft deep, of course all the small kids are going to be there. It seems to me that these people just don't understand that families go on vacation too, so there are going to be kids. If they they do not want to see so many kids then go to an adult only resort. Leave the rest for those of us who have children. We got to swim in the pool at anytime. Sometimes we were out there until 2am. You simply had to bring your own towels. Staying at the hotel was Rosalyn Sanchez (rush hour) and Shannon Elizabeth (american pie). They seemed to enjoy the hotel also. Some people complain that this is not a 4 star hotel. For the price $(140) it was a very nice hotel. If you want 4 Star then you have to be willling to pay $300 or $400 a night. Some people who checked in after the 4th of July got ratges at $90. I don't know about you but I would rather spend my money on other things than to shell out $5000 just for a hotel. If you want 4 star then go the Ritz or Intercontinental. The area is under a lot of construction. You have to realize that the Condado area was built in the 1960's. So yes, the area is looking a little outdated. But they are working on that. They are currently rehabbing two hotels along the strip. These will be beautiful when completed. Don't expect it to look like Las Vegas, this is an old island and they sre suceptible to hurricanes and wear and tear from the ocean. During the 70's this was a very happening place, and when all of the construction is completed it will be like that again. I think it is still very happeing, on Fri and Sat evenings all of Ashford Ave. is filled with people going out to have a good time. Plenty of outdoor Cafes offering music and drinks. It is very lively and beautiful at night. You don't have to stay in the hotel, it is very safe with plenty of police all around. We never ate at the hotel. I knew the food would be expensive. Instead we would go walking down Ashford Ave. There are plenty of places to choose from. If you don't mind paying a lot for Puerto Rican food then go to Ajili Mojili, or Ropa Vieja. Puerto Rican food is not expensive, so we chose not to eat there. Instead we went to Cafe Angel and the Godfather 3. Their prices were much more reasonable and authentic. In Old San Juan go to El Jibarito on Calle Sol. Excellent food and prices. Yerba Buena has a cuban group that plays excellent music on Fridays nights. They give the audience instruments so that they can participate in the music. I loved the music. There is dancing also if you choose to. This is a Cuban rest. I went for the music and the drinking, so I didn't eat there. My sister did and she loved the food. I have plenty of pictures if you would like to see them then just email me I will send them to you.

Reviews.Title: “I liked this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I had a great time at this hotel. I stayed for 2 nights at the Marriott for business but moved the Wyndham Condado the last 2 nights because they were cheaper. I was very happy with the deluxe room (same online AAA booking price as a standard room) that I had because it was more than I needed and it was nicer and more spacious then the room that I had at the Marriott. My room had the bedroom as well as living room, and the bathroom was off the short hallway that joined the two other rooms. There was also a TV in each room, separate climate control for the 2 rooms, internet, 3 phones, mini-fridge, safe, minibar, ceiling fan, standard coffee maker, hair dryer, iron/ironing board in room. The room was clean and well furnished with potted plants, and the sofa in the living room was a sofa bed...and I never caught a whiff of cigarette smoke on my floor or in my room. My view was of the Ocean Side building of the hotel across the street, but past that I could also see the ocean and to the left the lagoon. On the flipside, some other people who were on the trip with me also got a room at the Wyndham Condado, but they were in the other wing of the hotel Ocean Side. Their room was a standard and didn't look as nice- ample space but all the furniture just looked older. Their ice machine didn't work and they complained about the parking and how no one offered to help them with their bags right away. This may explain the mixed reviews that this hotel has gotten. Other things about this hotel: -Pool area on the Ocean Side has a swim-up bar, a water slide, several pools (including saltwater one), hot tub, loads of lounge chairs, hammocks, and is literally separated from the beach by 3 steps. The beach area that adjoins it is small but not too crowded even the 4th of July weekend I was there, was relatively clean (Wyndham staff cleans the area abutting the resort), and there is a wave break that stills the water to a gentle lapping...fish swim right up to your feet in the clear water. -Live Latin music on the small stage near the casino every night I was there...you can dance if you want to. -A lively casino atmosphere and plenty of restaurants in the hotel to choose from. -The lobby has an aquarium the length of a wall, huge mosaics of mermaids, and colorful blown glass light fixtures in the lobby and on the Mezzanine level. -Gusto di Italia- food was okay and prices comparable to Olive Garden, but the service was fantastic. The waiters were very attentive and super nice. Skip Coqui Shack by the pool. The food was not worth, even the $6-something for the breakfast buffet- there are so many other better, cheaper options on Ashford. Other recommendations: Take the bus for 25 cents instead of a cab for $12-$14 each way to Old San Juan or Isla verde. Eat at the Parrot Club in Old San Juan (~$23/entree but worth it). Speak Spanish if you can just because it's a great chance to practice and people are so nice, no one will make fun of you. You can always fall back on English since everyone speaks that too. Also expect: Tropical heat/humidity, crazy driving, music everywhere and police cars that always flash their lights (but not their sirens) even when they aren't trying to pull someone over. This is just the way things are on the island.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad at all....actually quite nice.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a family vacation and stayed at this hotel the first week in July. I was a bit skeptical from reading all the negative reviews but I must say I was NOT disappointed. Check in was painless although the lobby seemed a bit crowded the entire week we were there. We were upgraded to an ocean view room at no extra cost which was great. We had our "By Request" goodies in our room when we arrived. Our mini bar however was completely empty the whole time but we didn't even mention it because we bought our own goodies at the Walgreens so we did not sweat that "small stuff". We absolutely LOVED the pools. My kids (12 and 3) both had a blast there. The beach is tiny but during the week was not crowded and it was fine. The restaurants however are extremely expensive....$10.00 for a hamburger....ridiculous..okay so you get fries with it....still too expensive. I wasn't thrilled about the local restaurants nearby either. I was looking for more authentic Puerto Rican food which I wasn't impressed by what they consider Authentic....especially Ajili Mojoli. We were NOT impressed by the food there at all and the waiter was not the friendliest either. I think he might have been annoyed by my 3 year old son. If you have preschoolers or toddlers, don't go here to eat!! I regret it after we were seated and looking at the menu but didn't want to walk out especially since it was raining out. I hated that we had to travel so far (Old San Juan was the closest we found) for some good ol' Alcapurias, Rellenos de papa, Bacalaitos, Pionones, Molsillas or Pasteles. That's the kind of food we were looking for. One thing I enjoyed almost everywhere I went was the coffee. Even at Subways they had some good old Puerto Rican coffee. The best was the little Mexican place with the $5.75 breakfast. I forgot the name of it but it's right next to Waikiki. You sit overlooking the ocean waves hitting the rocks and enjoy good breakfast and EXCELLENT coffee! Anyway I digress....the Wyndham was a good spot. I called about our TV twice and both times had someone at our door in 10 minutes. At check out, there were some discrepancies with our bill but those were taken care of immediately. Overall we had an absolutely great time in Puerto Rico and I'm looking forward to going again. For a good price (under $150 per night) I'd definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Not a 4-Star Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Wyndham Condado from July 2 - July 9. This hotel is definitely NOT a 4-Star hotel. The rooms were clean, but the carpet needs replacing. The larger pool with the bar in it is full of kids and only 3 feet deep. YUCK! We spent our time in the salt water poole which was 6 feet deep. Both the salt water poole and the jacuzzi need work, broken tiles, rusting etc. We got the AARP rate so I guess itg was adequate for what we paid but I would not stay there again. If your room is in the front of the hotel it is extremely noisy due to street noise. We also felt that the air conditioning the rooms could have been cooler. The store in the hotel as well as the food is OUTRAGEOUSLY PRICED!!!!!! $8.00 for a hot dog! If you want to go to Bacardi or Old San Juan or the Plaza de Americas - take the bus B21 it's only 25 cents!!!!!! The people in PR were very friendly and helpful. Hope this helps someone.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Condado with my boyfriend for 4 nights 5 days. Check in was disasterous! Check in time is 3pm at the hotel and by 4:45 we were finally in our room! The staff was so rude! I witnessed a Front Desk Clerk threaten a customer to be thrown out all because he did not want her to wait on him because of the was she had been treated other customers!! I spent 5 days walking on eggshells afraid to say something that might 'upset' the staff! The rooms were ok but are in need of an update. We had curtains with stains and holes on them. The only good thing about this vacation was the day we left!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “great stay and nice time”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently returned from the Wyndham Condado last week, June 5-10th. We had an absolute fabulous stay at this hotel. Below are several tips on getting the most for your $$ while on vacation. Upon arrival in San Juan we took a 10 minute taxi ride from the airport to the hotel for $12 total. The hotel is in the tourist zone so the taxis have increasing fees for various zones (this is zone 3 and not bad for the money). I should also note the taxis have a minimum charge of $3/person. When we arrived at the hotel we checked in with our Wyndham By Request # (signup for this program online before your trip as it definitely has its advantages). Although we book our trip through Expedia -in which the program doesn't apply to online bookings (only through travel agents, Wyndham reservations or tour companies) - we were still upgraded to an oceanfront room free of charge and complimentary soda and snacks were placed in our room the next day by housekeeping (part of your preferences w/the program). The room is nice and spacious - parlor, walk-in closet w/safe, bathroom, queen bed w/sofa sleeper and balcony. There's a beautiful view of the ocean. The pools had a steady flow of people during the day; however, the pool bar was always empty. A lot of the guests, as well as my husband, took luxury in relaxing in the lagoon right outside the main pool. The beach advertised in the photos is a very small public beach (all beaches in Puerto Rico are public and access is open to all). During the week it was not very crowded and there's plenty of fish swimming up to you - so feel free to snorkel. The grounds are well manicured and very secure. The hotel restaurants are EXTREMELY, EXTREMELY expensive. However, this is easily remedied by venturing outside the hotel. To the left and about 1 block â€“ 1 mile away there are several restaurants which you can find good deals (Waikiki, Chilis, Subway, Wendys, Pizza Hut), and for authentic Puerto Rican food (Ropa Vega, Ajoli Mojoli, CafÃ© De Angel). We also ate dinner at Tony Romas which wasn't very expensive (spent about $50). There is a Walgreens (near the Marriott) and Liquor Store down this strip to get snacks, pop and water to store in the small in-room refrigerator. The hotel charges $7 for one bottle of beer but youâ€™re better off paying $10.99 for a six pack at the store. The casino is nice and has a steady stream of customers. However, neither my husband nor I are gamblers so we didnâ€™t venture much in this realm. Another interesting tip if youâ€™re going into Old San Juan just take Bus 21 and pay .25Â¢ for the 10-15 minute ride. It runs about every 30 minutes and stops right outside the hotel. A good place to eat is Barrachina â€œHome of the Pina Coladaâ€� on Fortaleza St. They'll give you a small sample of their world famous pina colada. As for excursions, the El Yunque tour ($45) is well worth the money as a guide drives you and other couples along the coast east to Fajardo. Youâ€™ll see a lot more of the island and learn some good historical information along the way. The Bacardi Rum Tour is overpriced and can be done for much cheaper. Again, take Bus 21 (.25Â¢) to Old San Juan then go to Pier #2 to take the Ferry (.50Â¢) to Cantaneo. Once there pay $3/person for the taxi to the Bacardi distillery which is free to enter plus each person gets two free drink tickets. In total we paid $15 roundtrip for the both of us. While at the plant youâ€™ll have to chance to purchase rum and lots of it at a really cheap price (except Bacardi 151 it wonâ€™t be allowed on the plane). ALL IN ALL, WE REALLY ENJOYED OUR TRIP, THE HOTEL AND PUERTO RICO. I HOPE THESE TIPS HELP WITH YOUR VACATION PLANNING AS I KNOW TRIPADVISOR DID WHEN WE PLANNED OURS.

Reviews.Title: “WONDERFUL”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just returned and wanted anyone who is interested in reviews to know that this hotel was wonderful. The service exceeded all expectations. The pool was wonferful, the beach was great, the people were wonderful and very helpful. San Juan is a must see. Lots to do. Hotel staff is very accommodating.

Reviews.Title: “Surprise Surprise”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We weren't sure what to expect, particularly of the staff or the room. But after a much delayed flight, the people at the front desk were incredibly helpful... Definitely sign up for Wyndham by Request--we got upgraded to a room overlooking the ocean, with a beautiful view, wine, cheese, fruit when we arrived, plus easy late check out. The restaurants are expensive, but a short walk away are some amazing restaurants--good values like Ropa Vieja--and a 25 cent bus ride away is Old San Juan or Isla Verde (go to Mi Casita). I would definitely recommend this, although there is no beach, you can lie by the pool and look out onto the ocean. Its the next best thing.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad, not great”
Reviews.Author: Cheesehead1
Reviews.Content: The Condado area and the Wyndham Condado Plaza are a little tired and past their prime, but the location is convenient for business or tourism. Service was nothing special but not terrible. This hotel is not up to mainland Wyndham standards, true for all PR hotels I've stayed in. The restaurant has an excellent view of the ocean with waves crashing in, but there is no beach facing the ocean (rocks). The food in the restaurant was passable, but overpriced (as for most of San Juan), and the service was nothing special. There is a lot of construction as the PR government demolished the old convention center, replaced with a nice park and boardwalk, and is restoring two hotels, including La Concha (should have demolished it & started over). There is a huge new convention center being built across the bay from OSJ on an old military base. I stayed 3 nights at the Condado Plaza for a business trip. 19th floor room was OK and had a nice balcony and an enormous walk in closet. The hotel is on the end of the Condado hotel zone within view of Old San Juan and the fortress. There is a tiny beach area on one end of the hotel overlooking the bridge between Condado and Old San Juan (also under construction), and a decent pool area with fresh and salt water pools. Photo is taken from pool area. There are a number of restaurants and shops in walking distance, and a short cab ride to Old San Juan and the cruise port. I did not use the casino but it was cramped, crowded, smoky and tacky with an obnoxiously loud, bad salsa band. The beaches for most of the hotels on Condado are narrow, and not safe after dark. If you go toward the beach after dark, cops in body armor will shoo you back to the street. Ashford Avenue is safe and heavily patrolled, but the side streets are not recommended at night, and there is a large, dangerous public housing project between Condado and the freeway. If you are looking for beach action, stay in the Isla Verde area or at one of the all-inclusive resorts with private beaches. Old San Juan is much improved over the last 5 years and well worth touring, as is the fortress.

Reviews.Title: “Great ending to my vacation”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I had stayed at this location after a Carnival Cruise. I was pleasantly surprised. The staff was friendly and professional. My room was 5th floor ocean view, perhaps an upgrade for being a Wydham By Request guest. I arrived early and was told my room was not ready but after explaining I was alone she put me in this room. I found the room to be very spacious, the most room I have ever had at any hotel I have stayed in. The water pressure was also excellent! I had walked towards the city center (I think) and took many photos of the park and other points of interest. The hotel is within walking distance to some local restaurants and chains ones as well. Some shopping in the area but I had been doing enough of that on the cruise. The pool area was very nice and the hammocks were sheer bliss, the perfect relaxing place in my eyes. I can not comment on the casino as I do not gamble but there are many hotels to choose from in PR that offer this. I went to one of the bars outside of the casino where they had a live salsa band. I would definitely stay here in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Very mediocre”
Reviews.Author: KarenL
Reviews.Content: Stayed here last Sunday. Very tired rooms and hotel common areas. Casino pretty worn and the Lobby bathrooms were filthy! It is also not in the greatest area for Tourists...Police cars crusing by every 5 minutes. Super Puerto Rican Restaurant within walking distance but that's about the only plus!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: kr1st1n
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights after returning to San Juan from a recent cruise. This strip of Condado Beach (Ashford Ave) has tons of restaurants and shops easily within walking distance. There is also a city bus that stops right out front that will bring you to Old San Juan for only 25 cents. This was our first time at a Wyndham and at the advice of one of the reviewers on this board, I signed up for the "Wyndham by Request" membership (free) before booking. We ended up with a great room in the main building with Coronas, cheese and crackers waiting for us in the room when we checked in (you select this on-line when you sign up). There is another bldg directly across the street, connected by an enclosed walkway - their rooms either face the main bldg or the bay and it looked like they had their own pool as well - There was basically water wherever you looked. From what I could tell, all of the rooms had great balconies which was nice. The hotel has several restaurants (we didn't try any) and a coffee shop. The pool area is really nice - there is a main pool w/swim-up bar, water slide, volleyball, etc and then there's a separate salt-water pool over to the side. The hotel overlooks the ocean and the bay with a small beach area on one side. The bottom is mostly rock & coral so water shoes would be needed - there also were tons of snorkelers. The casino was good size and VERY busy when we were there. They had all games even 2 tables of Texas Hold 'Em. Parking at the hotel was $10/day and the lot is very conveniently located. There's a small convenience store right next door for bottled water, snacks, etc as the gift shop was a little pricey. We enjoyed our stay here very much and will look for more Wyndhams in the future. I might add that I got this room using some credit card points so I'm not sure what it would have actually cost. I read one reviewer quote around $129/night. It would certainly be well worth that.

Reviews.Title: “Nice resort, but problems at the front desk”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Wyndham Condado from April 16-23 (Spring Break) with 37 of my high school students. The actual resort is nice - pools, grounds, jacuzzis, rooms, lobby, etc. The beach area is TINY, but still nice. My kids snorkeled and saw brightly colored fish, squid and even barracuda. Food at the pool restaurant was good and fairly priced! ($11 for cheeseburger plate) The rooms were spacious, but gently worn. This hotel is nothing like the Wyndham El Conquistador in Fajardo, but it still is nice! The oceanfront rooms are MUCH NICER than the other ones! Ask for an oceanfront room at the end of the hall. I had 344 and it was lovely! We ate dinner at Max's Grill one evening and the food was delicious. The presentation was beautiful and the salmon and scallops were to die for! ($25) Another evening we ate next door at Ropa Vieja ($18). It was very good, too. My three disappointments were that EVERY DAY, several of our room keys didn't work, one day my door wouldn't lock when I closed it and also the front desk checked another couple into my daughter's room at 1 AM when she was in bed. Imagine someone walking into your room like that! The hotel is on Ashford Avenue, which is very safe. We did day tours and this hotel's location was excellent ! Don't believe all the garbage you read from the poor reviews. It isn't a five star hotel, but the price you pay isn't for a five star!

Reviews.Title: “Good for the price”
Reviews.Author: mmc95
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Condado at the end of April and it was perfect for what we needed. We had a room overlooking the ocean, which was very nice. (the first night our room overlooked the street and it was incredibly noisy) We didn't spend much time at the hotel itself, btu when we were there it was a pleasant experience. The bus was ideally located outside the hotel so we traveled to Old San Juan. We also spent one evening in the Isla Verde section (eat at Metropol - food is great and cheap). The hotel booked a tour to the rainforest for us and we stopped at Luquillo Beach after. Both were very ncie. We only spent one day by the pool and on the beach. The pool area is very nice with chairs near the water and although the beach is incredibly small and near the road, it seemed that only hotel guests were using it and the water was very calm and clear. Because of all the rocks near the beach, I was able to see lots of fish without snorkling gear (although you can rent it from the hotel for $6, it is very rocky) Ajili Mojili was good but even less expensive and better was Rioja Vehia (sp?) closer to the Condado and on the same side of the street. The food at the hotel is a little pricey and not worth it except for lunch by the pool. But the fruity rum drinks by the pool are great. Overall the hotel was in a perfect location and was exactly what we needed for the price that we paid.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay”
Reviews.Author: mws813
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the the Wyndham for a 1 night after an 11 day cruise and really liked the place. The rooms were very clean and nice, great location, and they had a very nice large casino! There are also several restaurant choices in the hotel and there is a couple more dining choices down the street. We ate at Chili's and it was one of the best Chili's I have ever ate at. Our waiter Saul was the best waiter we have ever had in PR. I would recommend this hotel, especially to people coming and going on cruises!

Reviews.Title: “Very enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just got back from beautiful Puerto Rico where we had a great time staying at the Wyndham Condado for our anniversary. We stayed the week of April 18-22. I was a little worried about what I might encounter there from the previous reviews, but was very happy to discover that this place was very nice and clean. Check-in took only 5 minutes. We paid for a "City View" and were given one of the best rooms on the 9th floor in the Lagoon Towers. We had a corner room (#981) with a fantastic view of the pool, lagoon and ocean! We also had a wrap-around balcony which we enjoyed having our cocktails on. Everyone working there was very personable and attentive to our needs. One afternoon it rained almost the whole day so we rented a movie in our room which we couldn't get to work. Within minutes of calling the front desk, they sent someone up to fix it. Very impressed by the response time. The prices for drinks were a bit pricey so we found a liquor store just down the block and bought our own wine and beer and kept it in the room's refrigerator. We also ate at Hacienda Don Jose which is right on the ocean (right down the block from the hotel). Breakfast is only $5.75 for coffee, juice, eggs, bacon or pancakes. The bus (line B21) into Old San Juan stops right in front of the hotel and cost only .25 cents. Old San Juan is beautiful and a must see. They have live entertainment in the Casino Lounge which we enjoyed before going out to dinner every night. We hope you enjoy your stay in Puerto Rico as much as we did.

Reviews.Title: “Wyndham Condado”
Reviews.Author: brisner2000
Reviews.Content: Just returned from 8 days in the British Virgin Islands and decided to explore Puerto Rico on the way back. We stayed 3 nights at the Wyndham Condado, April 1, 2 and 3, 2005. We'd heard some awful reviews, but our friends had booked the hotel for 1 night and we just decided to extend the stay and remain at the Wyndham Condado. We loved it and Puerto Rico both!......We registered with Wyndham by Request as suggested in advance. Check in took 5 minutes maximum. We had a room over looking the bay across the street. The room was clean and spacious. Nice view of the bay with a small patio. Room had a coffe maker and tea always kept stocked each day. Wyndham by Request left beer, fruit and cheese and water in our room on day 2. My boyfriend is a picky eater....so when he finds a restaurant he likes, it's hard to get him anywhere else....as a result we ate dinner each night in the Italian Restaurant located in the hotel. Food was great (we always had one of the specials, Mahi-mahi or medallions of beef with pasta on the side) and a glass of wine, all very good. Dinner ran about $75 per night for both of us. Breakfast at the hotel is expensive. About $30 for your basic eggs, bacon, toast breakfast. There is an extensive buffet for about $18 per person. The casino is small (of course we go to Las Vegas quite a bit, so there's no comparison), too many nickel slots. Our friend sat at one of the black-jack tables and complained about it taking 45 minutes to get a drink. ....My complaint: Most machines require a hand-pay for any jackpots over $50.00 - $100.00 and on 3 occassions I sat for more than 45 minutes each time waiting to get paid. Things to do: We took a cab to see the forts and explore Old San Juan on foot the first day. Our cab driver took us to Fort (Cristobal?) and we began exploring this fort first, great veiws Old San Juan and the wall extending all the way to the 2nd fort (El Morro?). Beautiful walk along the coast connects the 2 forts with vendors selling things on the stroll from one to the next. So many kids flying kites when you arrive at El Morro - a beautiful sight!.....Then, we had "Frommers Puerto Rico" and it contains a map and walking tour of Old San Juan that really helps you to know what the buildings are that you're seeing, (highly recommended). One thing it doesn't mention that you must do, (told to us by our cab driver), when you stop at the Old Church, proceed directly across the street and walk down to the bottom of the hill to see the only remaining gate to the city built by the Spanish. (there were originally 6 gates). Another beautiful spot. 2nd day booked a tour right from the hotel, the Rio Muy Caves and Arecibo Observatory. Caves were amzing. Took about 1 1/2 hours from the hotel by van. You travel in a tram down to the cave entrance (it's massive!) and you go on a walking tour with a guide for a bit over an hour). Not much to see at Arecibo, but it is an amazing sight if you remember the movie "Contact" with Jodie Foster - it's there! - There's a room with lots of scientific interactive things to do, but we enjoyed it. Back to the hotel and we enjoyed the salsa music and watched the great dancers right in the hotel that night!.... So, people were so friendly everywhere we went, we loved it...enjoy

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel- Good location”
Reviews.Author: TravellerFairfax
Reviews.Content: We just came back from SJU Tuesday. We were there for 4 days. Check in was smooth. Took about 10 mins. They could not find the reservation Room was across the hotel ( Lagoon Towers). Nice Room with a balcony. Definetely take higher floors. Traffic noise can be disturbing. Even on 8th floor, we did get some noise Resturants are expensive and not worth it. Walk one block to Oceanfront for Breakfast. Nice location, Ocean View Lunch is also good. Many walk to Subway next door. Take .25 Cent ride to Old San Juan, avoid Taxi 10 $. Only problem is that Bus runs till 9 PM. Do the Old Walking trip and El Morro Trip. Did the Rainforest Tour ( 40 $/pp). Small Beach, Not worth it. Take a cab to Isle Verde, Housekeeping was good. Called for some items, Were delivered in 10 mins. called back to confirm it.

Reviews.Title: “Was Pleasantly Surprised”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just returned after a 5 day stay (Easter week) at the Hotel. Before my departure to PR, I read all the reviews on this hotel and was actually thinking about cancelling my reservations at the Wyndham Condado and staying elsewhere. However, I was pleasantly surprised. Our check-in was quick and the staff was courteous. Our room was not ready upon check-in and was told to return in about 1 hour. One hour later the room was ready and it was an ocean view room with a balcony. An upgrade from what I had paid for. Rooms are old but clean. I found restaurants in the hotel to be expensive. Definitely walk down the street and go to Ropa Vieja for authentic PR food. The mexican restaurant is great for breakfast and dinner and Wakiki next to the mexican restaurant is good also. Sit in the back and enjoy the ocean view. Good food and inexpensive compared to the hotel. The beach is nothing to talk about but we took a cab ride to Ocean Park Beach and it was beautiful. Wide clean beach and beautiful, wavy ocean. I do have a comment about the beach at the Wyndham and that is the guy who brings you your lounge chair. Talk about rude!! Pool area is nice, plenty of lounge chairs. If you want a drink, you are better off going to the bar yourself. Not enough waiters. We took the $.25 bus ride to Old San Juan. Nice shops, restaurants and visited El Morro. Nice day but plan on lots of walking, wear sneakers. Walk down Ashford to Walgreens and stock up on water, lotion, etc. Everything in and near the hotel is expensive. Lots of police presence so I always felt safe. All in all, we had a wonderful time and would return.

Reviews.Title: “Don't expect special treatment on your honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: CarribeanTrvler
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for the first three nights of our honeymoon. They promised us an ocen view room, which we did not receive. Even after explaining to the front desk it was our wedding night. They gave us a crappy room across from the elevator which was noisy all night long. We only had a lagoon view, which is not very caribbean. The a/c is mixed with smoke and people are in and out all night due to the casino. Even if you have a nonsmoking room you will always smell smoke. The lobby won't let you wear your swimsuit and the restaurants are overpriced and rude. Our toliet broke and we kept calling and requesting a repair, it flushed every minute! Made it hard to sleep. Finally, my husband got so mad he had to fix it himself in the middle of the night, good thing he is an engineer, since he didn't have any tools. The restaurant with the ocean view was so cold and over air conditioned we left once we were seated because it was uncomfortable. We ate at the recommended Puertican restaurant down the rode and it was yummy, but I got food poisioning I think from the water. Everything is way overpriced. I couldn't believe it. Would rather have been in St. Thomas or Hawaii or Mexico. I would recommend staying in Old San Juan, everyone who stayed there seemed to have a better time. The location of this hotel is bad. There are no activities the hotel is pretty dead, people are rude and we did not feel like it was our honeymoon at all. We were happy when we got on the cruise ship and got treated nice, it was like our honeymoon began after we left. The streets are dirty traffic is bad and the hotels surrounding this place are ripped to shreds from a hurricaine. I would try somewhere else. There isn't much to do, and if you are looking for a Puerto Rican experience you will be disappointed when you see Tony Roma's across the street.

Reviews.Title: “Not too shabby”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent 5 nights at the Condado at the end of February 2005. I had previously read reviews on this website, and found them to be quite accurate. Definitely join Wyndham by Request (takes a few minutes online). I did and we were able to get a room upgrade from one facing the bay to an ocean view...definitely much nicer and wonderful to listen to the ocean at night. If you are looking for a beach resort, this is not the place for you. The beach is a tiny public area right next to a small bridge and not even worth going to. The pool area is very nice, though, and overlooks the sea. We were not impressed with the food at the pool grille. Service was slow and the food was disappointing, the hamburgers were inedible. Drinks were good, but there weren't enough waiters circulating the pool area and we usually had to go to the bar to get them. We ate in the Italian restaurant, and the food was good and very reasonably priced. We had breakfast in the Oceanfront place right next to the hotel, which was about $5 for a full b'fast and a lovely view of the sea. Also right outside of the hotel, Ropa Vieja was a great spot for an authentic and delicious dinner. In Old San Juan, we had dinner at Dragonfly, a trendy Asian-Spanish fusion place. It was very overpriced for tiny portions (ie. $24 for 6 scallops) and we were still hungry after leaving, but the atmosphere was enjoyable. If you need something in the hotel, service is very slow. There was no hairdryer in my room and I had to call 3 times and wait 50 minutes for someone to bring one up. Overall, I would say this is a mid-range hotel, not for a discriminating traveler, but a nice break from the cold New York winter.

Reviews.Title: “Average Hotel - Above Average Rates”
Reviews.Author: Cheef45
Reviews.Content: I just returned from Puerto Rico. I wanted a quick getaway for me and my family. I chose the Wyndham Condado for the fact that the online photos of the place and description were very nice. Also for the fact that it had the most affordable rate for the busy week we traveled (Holy WeeK 3/21/05). My first impression was good. After we caught a cab from the taxi stand directly outside the airport we headed straight for the Wyndham which was a 10 minute drive. The hotel was decent and located in a seemingly busy area "Condado". There are two different buildings with a clear tunnel connecting the two buildings. The side where we stayed was called the Lagoon and I am not sure what the other building was called. Check in was also decent although our room wasnt quite ready do to the early check in. Lucklly I had family already staying at the hotel at time of check in. I went up to see my other family's room. I have to be honest and say that i was NOT impressed at all. I thought the photos were a bit misleading. The rooms seemed to be old and dingy in appearance such as carpeting and furniture. Maybe it had to do with the building we were in but who knows. The room had a separate sitting area couch, TV, etc. The mini bar was unstocked even though it was mentioned that there is a mini bar in the room which will be replenished daily. There was a little balcony outside with a view of the streets below, a portion of the ocean, and the other building. MY room however was more like a suite i dont understand why because we both paid the same rate. The room was much better than that of my other family's. Much more roomier, and a much bigger balcony WITH a table and two chairs. Even though the building and rooms seemed old, there were good points. The bed was nice, the pillows were great, the bathrooms were clean and the shower is superb. The water pressure or the shower head was almost a massaging type of feeling. Very nice. SOmething you'd have to experience to understand. Our room was cleaned every day with bed made and towels, toiletries replenished daily. I didnt interact with much of the staff there but the staff hailing the cabs and greeting you were very friendly. The pool area is also nice. The view from out there was great. The scenery looked very nice. You can see the water crashing against the rocks right in front of you. This area is to the side of the pool where hammocks and long chairs were set up. The pool is on the other side of the building but you can easily commute through the tunnel. The beach is really nothing to talk about. I believe it is public so anyone can go there. But there is security at the entrace between the "beach" and the hotel property to limit entrance by non-hotel guests. Its very small and not very tempting. If you want to enjoy the PR beach then this place isnt recommended. This area is more of the city. I havent seen any reviews on the casino in this place. From first glance it doenst seem very big. but it is a really good size with a lot of machines and tables. When you actually enter and walk around you get the feel of the size. Again, everything seemed old though. The machines were old, the carpeting looked old. But they do pay. We had luck on the slots! I cant comment on the restaurants there. We ate out at the restaurants down the block from the hotel. I wanted Puerto Rican food. You HAVE to sample the local restaurants! Ever had Puerto Rican coffee? There is a Tony Roma's in the lobby of the Lagoon bldg. The service was great. I also noticed a japanese place but there were hardly anyone there. To sum everything up...I had a great time in Puerto Rico, loved the food and was content with the hotel. If you want a fabulous beach resort I wouldnt recommend it here. IF you wanted to come out have fun, enjoy more things outside the hotel and tour then this place should be taken into consideration, although I would have expected a nicer place for the money. Speaking of touring I recommend renting a car for a few nights, get a map and ask the staff for directions. The hotel tour prices were crazy and it only included basically going to and from different locations. I found every where very easily - We did the rainforest (great), Old San Juan (nice), and Belz outlet shopping (also nice). I hope this helps! Enjoy....

Reviews.Title: “Know What You Want”
Reviews.Author: cinnman45
Reviews.Content: Just returned last night from 5 great PR days. The hotel itself is OK, neither upscale, not too shabby. It is definitely dated---built before good sound proofing. First night got in late and got a poor 4th floor room that was terrible for noise. First thing in am got the staff to move us to 9th floor which was wonderful, but still too much noise from the hallway or other rooms at times. (Trying to post a lagoon view pic). Small but clean room with good daily service. The Casino is noisy, the music at the bar area is too loud (no, we're not too old, we actually enjoyed the music sitting in the area ACROSS the street thru the tunnel connecting the two hotels). The tiny dance area is alongside the busy hallway and directly across from the noisy casino. The waitress at the bar was great and the rum punch hit the spot. Tried to eat one evening at Max's Grill across from the Casino, but after being seated by a plesant hostess and waiting more than 15 solid minutes watching waiters wander around us in a not very busy enviroment but not one inquired about anything ---got up and left. No poolside or oceanside breakfast, so we walked a block each day and sat by the window with the waves beating below us for breakfast. Skip Tony Romas---really depressing. The pool area was very good, not crowded and my wife had a massage every morning by the ocean--never a problem getting a lounge chair and enjoyed the sun each morning. The beach is adequate for a quick look, but nothing to write home about (compare it with the Isla Verde pic). I would NOT take the family here. This was a last minute birthday getaway for the wife. For two lovers, it fit the bill pretty good---not too crowded, easy cab into old San Juan at night for excellent dinners and music, great seeing the Condado being revitalized and felt safe walking between the bridge area down past Starbucks across from the Marriott. Went to lunch one day at Isla Verde Wyndham just to see the difference---would be the place to take a family and enjoy more the traditional beach environment--it was crowded and a lot of tourists, but a very nice beach area. If you're looking for sunbathing, hanging out by the pool, and finding your own romance, then this is adequate---that is a place to sleep and return to after exploring. If they post, pics of pool area, breakfast spot, beach (and Isla Verde beach to compare).

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, though not luxury”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had an enjoyable 4-night stay at the Wyndham Condado Plaza Hotel in March 2005. While the hotel is definitely showing signs of age and has a skimpy excuse of a beach, we did find the 3 pools and the tour group services at the hotel convenient and fun. We stayed in the cityview room at the adjoining Laguna Towers Building, which had a balcony that offered a glimpse of the ocean. The location was somewhat noisy at night, so I'd recommend the oceanview (if you can upgrade to this). Join as a Wyndham By Request member prior to your trip, and you'll receive some complimentary welcome snacks and drinks in your room. We liked the Condado area, as Ashford Avenue has a decent selection of dining options outside of the hotel restaurants. The B21 bus into Old San Juan stops right outside the hotel and costs only 25-cents to ride. It was convenient and only a 7-10 minute ride (far cheaper than the $10 cab ride we took the first day). As for sightseeing suggestions -- buy a kite at the local Walgreens up the street from the hotel and go fly it on the oceanside grounds at El Morro; you'll feel like a kid again. Also, getting to the Barcardi Rum Factory for a tour is easy via 50-cent ferry and cab ride from Pier 2 in Old San Juan -- no need for a fancy tour service. The Wyndham Condado Plaza Hotel worked out fine, but don't equate the usually luxury-sized prices of the rooms with an actual luxury hotel. It's a solid choice, for the right price.

Reviews.Title: “Bien”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I can say that the room and room view were very nice! The pool area was great!!! We did not eat there. The skyway connecting the casino to the hotel was cool. The hotel and casino area needs new carpet. Needs it now. It is in a good location. The beach area was very nice. My wife and I had a very good time there.

Reviews.Title: “not so good”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: this hotel is not so good, the location is awful, it is sandwiched on the road and there is just a tiny beach. our room faced the street and was very loud. the pool is OK but i've seen much better. the hotel has no happening spots - no disco, no lobby bar. the food was sooooo overpriced and one meal i had was so disgusting that i could not eat it. hotels down the road in isle verde are a much better choice.

Reviews.Title: “great stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: we saw some negitive reviews and started to worry. to this day i can't figure out how anyone could not like this place. we got a free up grade over looking the ocean. the people where great and eager to help you. the rooms were excellent and very clean. the beach was small but very nice and the pool was wonderful. we would return in a minute.

Reviews.Title: “An honest review with helpful hints!!”
Reviews.Author: Whispy3
Reviews.Content: Just returned from the Wyndham Condado, March 9-13 and it definately served the purpose. We wanted a few days away from the cold and the snow, someplace that was close and had hot sunny days. The hotel is only 15 minutes from the airport, no problem getting a taxi at the airport. We are Wyndham By Request members and when we checked in they upgraded us to a junior suite, we originally just asked for a standard King. To be honest, we ended up seeing what a standard King room looked like and the set up of the room was nicer since we didn't use the front room with the table and chairs. The bathrooms are not designed well at all. Only one person can use it at a time. Now for some helpful hints... Try not to get a city (street) view room. The noise was not bad on Wednesday and Thursday night, but Friday and Saturday night were VERY noisy. Don't be afraid to walk into the town, (NOT OLD SAN JUAN), but the town where these hotels are. The street is Ashford avenue and we walked one evening for about a mile or so past the Marriott and it was VERY nice and SAFE. Lots of restaurants and plenty of police watching out. There is a Walgreens down that way and if you go one of your first days there, buy some bottled water there, only 99 cents compared to $2.00-$3.00 at the hotel. Don't eat at the Italian restaurant at the hotel. Definately venture out and experience the local places, excellent food. If you walk down near the Marriott the restaurants are busy and looked great, from Danny's Pizza to typical Puertorican cuisine. If you want to play tennis, as we did, make sure you play before 10:00AM. We played every morning, with no problem getting a court. There are two courts with lights, we never tried playing late in the day, but the heat in the morning is intense. The main pool area is GREAT, lots of chairs, a separate salt water pool, hammocks and lots of fun. Nothing nicer than sitting at the pool enjoying some food and drinks. Oh and speaking of food at the pool.... There is a Subway less than a block away and SOOOOO many people would go there and get some subs and return to the pool for lunch. The prices for food at the hotel are high. If you want a treat after dinner, the Ice Cream Parlor in the hotel is delicious!! Take a brownie sundae back to the room and enjoy!!

Reviews.Title: “Like a paradise”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: we had come from Norway on vaccation, and there they said they had booked us a nice hotell: San Juan Beach hotel, and that we thought was terrible, we were able to get our 4 last days at Wyndham after we did our cruise. Both me and my boyfriend and our two kids enjoy everything with your hospitality, the room , the view, the pools, the facilities . We had a vaccation in paradise thanks to you all at wyndham.. love from Norway..

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Hotel”
Reviews.Author: mguest
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Wyndham Condado Plaza for one night as a result of a American Airlines' flight delay that stranded us in San Juan. Although it was close to 12 midnight when we arrived at the hotel, the check in process was friendly and efficient. Upon our request for a non smoking, king size bed room, we were given a very nice corner room on the 8th floor in the hotel's "Laguna Plaza" tower. The room was large, comfortable, and clean. The room included a nice work desk with Aero chair, wrap around balcony, and the bathroom was stocked with Golden Door Spa toiletries and a coffee maker. Room service for late night dining, albeit quite limited, was fine; room service for breakfast was fine as well and both took more than 30 minutes to be delivered. Additionally, it was Saturday night and both the casino and music venues were going full force but the hotel has good sound proofing. For frazzled and tired travellers, the Wyndham Condado gave us a pleasant place to rest.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly satisfactory”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We had overall positive impressions on the hotel, but I think it all turns on how much you paid for your room. At $129 a night, with an ocean view, we thought it was a very good deal and were very happy with the amentities. Positives: Great views with nice balconies on the ocean-facing side. Very nice pool complex with lots of comfortable chairs, hammocks and a truly fabulous waterslide for kids (and the young at heart). Also, the service was friendly and hotel is very conveniently located (close to airport, old san juan and neighboring Ocean Park-- the nicest beach area around.) The 24 hour restaurant and casino are nice amenities. However, the place is not perfect and not quite up to the claimed four star ratings The rooms are a little bit worn. If there is a problem with your room, the service is-- again-- friendly, but SLOW. And the other negative is that, while the ocean views are nice, there is not much of a beach there. However, a easy 5 minute cab ride to Ocean Park, will bring you to WIDE, CLEAN expanses of lovely sandy beaches. (Try the area right in front of the Hostelria del Mar). So-- we had a nice time and were perfectly content; its simply a question of whether you feel are getting a good value for your money. We wouldn't have been satisfied with our experience if we were paying $200 or more.

Reviews.Title: “Glad I didnt listen to all the bad rap”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: After spending a week at the Wyndham, I was pleasantly surprised. The hotel was quite clean, and the room was a good size, even for 2 adults and 2 teenagers. We did not encounter any security issues-in fact there was a good police presence at the pool area. The lack of a proper beach was not an issue at all as the pool area was large and very nice, with chairs always available. Any concerns we had were met by the staff, such as additional towels for the room. I would most definitely book another stay at this hotel and ignore all the bad press it has received.

Reviews.Title: “WONDERFUL”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This was a very pleasant vacation and we will most likely return again the location is very beneficial if your a shopper .. the bus that passes by about every 15-30 min takes you straight to La Plaza Las Americas the mall which has 500-600 (if not more) stores and 3 movie theaters the bus takes you there for 25 cents each way ... NO TAX .. the only thing is the "private beach" that is attached to the hotel its very very small and has cigarette buds everywhere but that is my only complaint ..spacious rooms 2 refrigerators very large closet enough for 6 people to fit comfortably too... i dont see why they were so big but it wasn't much of a dislike, it was just the question .. why so big..

Reviews.Title: “It was just fine!”
Reviews.Author: Travelcac
Reviews.Content: We just came back from staying at this hotel as a 1 night stay before our cruise. After reading some of the reviews, I did not know what I was in for! It was just wonderful. We got upgraded to an oceanfront balcony room. I found the hotel staff very accomodating. I would probably rate this hotel as a 3 1/2 to 4 rating out of 5. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Not great, not bad”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I read a lot of reviews about the Wyndham Condado and was a little nervous based on the bad reviews. Overall, it's not bad. The rooms were fine (We stayed on the Plaza Club level) and the pool area was very nice. The beach is small, but fine if all you want to do is lay out on a beach. Yes, the main road is on the other side of the wall, but you really couldn't tell when you were by the pool. Our check in was fine - they really wanted us to be happy with our room choice. The only negative was the food and the service. The restaurants were average and the food just OK. Very expensive for the quality. The wait staff is not in a hurry to do anything. (Didn't bring water, had the orders wrong here and there.) It's a casual island and it may just be our "get it done now" mentality that we get aggravated with. Not sure. The tours in Fajardo were great. Do a catamaran/snorkel trip and the Bioluminecense Bay tour. It's a nice experience.

Reviews.Title: “Wyndham Condado Fair at Best”
Reviews.Author: MaureenMetuchen_NJ
Reviews.Content: My husband, daughter and I stayed at the Wyndham Condado, along with my sister and her family the first week of February 2005. We all thought it was fair, at best. We both checked in on different days (her on a Tuesday, us on a Thursday) ... and both thought it to be painfully slow. I happen to be a Wyndham by Request member, and it really didn't even matter. The person checking us in barely said hello and did't offer much information. The rooms are fair as well ... there was no carafe for the coffee maker; the in-room movie didn't work and when we called about this, we were told to expect an "engineer" to come to our room, but that never happened, and then we had to wrestle to get the $12.99 charge taken off our bill when we checked out. My sister said someone tried to "enter her room" late at night twice during her stay. Lucky for her a dead bolt is on the door ... their room happened to be on the 7th floor, close to the elevator so perhaps someone held the elevator while someone tried to break into her room. She complained to the hotel security but was given no real insurance that this wouldn't happen again. Pool is lovely and location is great, but all in all, I think that $229 a night is a lot to pay for these types of "inconveniences" if that is what you would call them.

Reviews.Title: “Better Than I Expected”
Reviews.Author: BigAlFromDaBronx
Reviews.Content: After reading some of the reviews, I frantically tried to get another reservation elsewhere, but without success. So I expected the worse. The hotel is in a major city. Ashford Avenue is a major throughfare in the area. So of course the hotel is located on a street. So is any major hotel in any major city. The hotel is located at the tip of a penisula, with the Atlantic ocean forming the northern border of the hotel. We had a lovely room with a balcony and a very comfortable king size bed overlooking the lagoon. This was a southern exposure, so the balcony was engulfed in the sunshine all day. It was a great location to get to the Pan American cruise terminal, as Ashford Avenue becomes a causeway which leads to the terminal. The hotel was in excellent condition cosmetically, and very clean. The casino was lively with free entertainment along side the Casino. Drinks were priced on the high side, but very well prepared. There was a very reasonably priced Tony Roma's restaurant on the premises, as well as a very good ice cream shop. I am puzzled about the security issues raised in other reviews as the hotel was crowded, people were walking on the streets at night, and the room had its own individual safe. If the El San Juan and the Intercontinental are 4 stars, then this is a 3.5 in comparison. If you consider those 5 star hotels, then this was a 4 star hotel. I stayed at all three, and there is absolutely nothing wrong with this hotel, and I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “We were impressed”
Reviews.Author: rjjj_r
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Wyndham Condado from Jan 16 to Jan 19 '05. The hotel was in a good location compared to other hotels in the area. There are actually to buildings, on each side of ashford. We were in the building on the ocean side. The hotel was very close to old san juan. We walked to el morro from it. Was a very nice scenic walk. Our room was large. It had a nice balcony, sitting area, and a smaller room to put our suitcased in, and hang our clothes. We had two fridges, coffee maker, iron, and board. We were on the fifth floor, we had a corner room, where on our balcony, we had a partial view of the lagoon, and could see the pool and beach from the side of it. And there was a window as well overlooking the ocean. We never ate at the hotel because it was quite pricey. 11.50 for bacon and eggs is crazy, but just a quick 3 minute walk, and there is a cute little sea side restaurant that had bacon and eggs, coffee and orange juice for 5.50. There are loads of resaurants around, expensive one'd, cheap ones... We booked our tours at the hotel and they were quite good, and not bad in price. The hotel let us leave our luggage at the conceirge after checking out so we could go on one last tour before we had to go home. The pool area is beautiful. Never had a problem finding a place to lay down. There were lots of chairs. Over all, we did have a great stay there, and would stay there again if we go back..

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Weekend, wish we had more extra days to stay!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I cant beleive the bad reviews! What are these people talking about! I just came back from Condado, was there for Martin Luther King Weekend. I got so scared reading these reviews, I thought i was going to be "smelling paint" and seeing "rennovations" but I guess these so called rennovations are over because the hotel is beautiful! We were on the 8th floor with a pretty big room, bigger than we thought. I thought we were going to one of the middle to lower Wyndhams, after all we didnt care about luxury, it was only a weekend. But it was far more high class than I paid for and needed! I am 22 and my fiance is 25 and we are from New York. Believe me, it was more high class than necessary! I dont know what is more beautiful- Puerto Rico or its people! They are so nice, they just want you to be happy. They are very hospitable. There are three pools, and we didnt even have time to go to the salt water because the beach is right there! so warm inside even if it is a little windy. It is small but nice and sandy. I dont know why some people wrote there are rocks. The casino was perfect size. The dealers nice people- even gave us tips while playing! We suggest a few nights out in Isla Verde only 10 minutes away. And the horse back riding on the beach was well worth it, although expedia def. has better package prices. We regret no time for snorkeling, you should get that from expedia beforehand too. Take a walk down the Avenue and eat the Waikiki for lunch. You can go to Miro restaurant for seafood dinner 4 minutes away with a cab. You have like 25 choices of places to eat! Make reservations at Ropa Vieja or Miro. If you are very high maintenance and want to pay double, stay at the Wyndham Isla Verde. You should def. go out to dinner and club there one night, the Wyndham Condado employees will even suggest it. P.R. is beautiful and you can have both romatic time and fun time. Condado is more affordable with more down to earth people, and close to Isla Verde.

Reviews.Title: “You get much less than you pay for at this property, they might even take more $$ than they deserve!”
Reviews.Author: lsvillekyguy
Reviews.Content: Scheduling business in San Juan, I booked four nights at the Wyndham Condado Plaza (normally I stay at a resort in Dorado but wanted to stay closer to Old San Juan this time). Upon arrival I was upgraded to an ocean view at no extra charge which turned out to be the only truely positive aspect of my stay. My first visual impression of the property was that of a run-down resort in much need of renovation. Once reaching the room, that impression was solidified. The grounds, indoor and outdoor guest areas were much of the same, especially lacking in simple cleanliness (including the casino, main pool, outdoor bar & restaurant). The salt water pool and hot tub were closed. The small beach resembled the resort in it's lack of upkeep, abundance of trash and to reiterate one other review . . . it is practically part of the adjacent road. One of the evenings I dined in the main restaurant across from the casino, while the meal was not unsatisfactory (with the exception of being seated next to a walled column with more food stuck on it than what was plated), the service was. On another evening I ordered a Chicken Caesar Salad from room service, when it finally did arrive, the chicken had obviously been cooked hours earlier and was unfit to eat. Now to the real infractions, on my third day there Tropical Storm Jean hit. There was absolutely no notification to guests in any manner before, during or after the storm. For myself, a single traveler, any hotel response would have been appreciated and in my opinion necessary, a hotel's guests and their safety should have been the number one priority. The hotel made the mistake of boarding up fire exits which opened up to outside alcoves & enclosed stairways above the pool, unfortunately should there have been a fire at any location down any floor's west corridor, the only safe passage would have been to jump off of a balcony into 75+ mph winds! Oddly enough, the front doors to the resort where open and the hotel staff were allowing visitors to stand outside in the motor lobby while rather large debris blew right in front of them. On the same day, I was told by the restaurant manager that they had run out of food and due to the electricity outage could not cook anything else. I was lucky I'd had some carry on food & water from the plane trip especially as the mini-bar/refrigerator did not work adequately. Please keep in mind I could not leave the property, the hotel was my only source for food and beverage! The housekeeping staff put bags consisting of a bar of soap and a towel on our doors daily during the storm operation. Although no occupied rooms were cleaned, all vacant ones were to accommodate new guests!?! On what would have been my final evening there, I inquired regarding extending my stay as my flight had been canceled, they were quick to accomodate which I do thank them for. Unfortunately, I'd not slept well for the previous two stormy days and the hotel was operating under limited power so the air conditioning in the rooms was not working. The next morning I overheard another guest saying that Old San Juan was back up with full power so I inquired at the front desk if there was another Wyndham I could transfer to and be more comfortable. The young lady verified that the other Wyndham hotel was fully operational and said I was welcome to go to the other property. She also verified there would be no fees for early departure as I was relocating to another Wyndham for the sake of comfort and was leaving on my original departure day. I did so immediately (which happened to be shortly after check out time) and found an absolutely beautiful hotel, (Wyndham Old San Juan), a wonderfully clean and fresh guestroom, and immediately had a four course luncheon that was simply superb! To finish my story, the Wyndham Condado charged me for the last night in which I transferred to the other hotel. I have contacted everyone from the resort's credit manager, my credit card company, as well as Wyndham's Corporate Guest Staff regarding the double billing and have never received any contact. I've traveled back to San Juan since September (I go an average of three times a year) and stayed again at the hotel in Old San Juan I enjoyed that last evening ... ironically it's now an upscale Sheraton! Not surprising!

Reviews.Title: “Condado Nightmare”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We checked in and checked right out. The beach and pool are in the middle of a city street, literally, so it is no wonder there are theft issues. Anyone can walk right onto the public beach, which is 20 feet wide at best with city traffic beeping and rumbling along. The pool is a stone's throw from the sidewalk so again anyone can walk right up to the pool. Something about a security guard at the pool makes one feel less like they are on vacation and more like they are in a carribean prison. Worse yet, they did not even have the room we were promised. We ended up at El Conquistidor and had a lovely vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Not great but not too bad either”
Reviews.Author: lynfo16
Reviews.Content: We just returned from 6 nights during Christmas week 2004 at the Wyndam Condado Plaza in PR. I joined "Wyndam by Request" online before I got there so I was able to upgrade to a room with an ocean view (vs. the lagoon side which I had read on Trip Advisor wasn't as nice) we slept soundly each night listening to the ocean waves. The room was adequate and had a refrigerator too. We were very disappointed to learn that the tennis courts were not available to use, and we spent an hour in our tennis clothes before someone could tell us the story. We were told we could play at the Marriot about 1 mile walk -- but they didn't offer us a ride. Who wants to walk in the heat, play tennis and walk back?
