There were other minor glitches -- we were overcharged for drinks during happy hour, overcharged for parking, got the wrong food at one of the restaurants and surprisingly the manager didn't offer us anything at that hotel eatery ( I should have complained louder), and waited an hour (yes an hour!) for shampoo and conditioner one day. I called Housekeeping 3 times. Lastly, the concierge promised to make us dinner reservations at a local restaurant, but when the restaurant was booked, never contacted us so we were stuck. However, we got the eatery early and had no problem. The concierge was able to book us on a private trip to the Caves when we asked, but never cancelled the driver, after we cancelled the trip because we decided it was too far to travel from San Juan. He woke us up on the day we were supposed to go. I complained about the glitches to the front desk, and we got a free dinner at one of the restaurants, and on the last day, we got $60 off our final bill for our inconveniences. So they tried. Sounds awful? But really, the pool and hot tub were great and the poolside staff was attentive. There was a guy, Angel, who runs games for the kids and is very energetic and fun. My 12 year old LOVED the water slide and must have gone down it 100 times. For breakfast, there are two cheaper places ($5 for full breakfast) 1 minute walk west of the hotel if you want to save some money. I would go back to this hotel if I had to, but I will probably stay at another part of PR, just to get closer to other sights outside of Old San Juan.

Reviews.Title: “Neither horrible nor wonderful”
Reviews.Author: barney01
Reviews.Content: I have to say, after reading all the horrible reviews about this hotel, I was VERY trepidatious about staying here. I read such comments as, "crowded, smoky lobby," "rude, unhelpful staff," "dirty rooms with mildewed carpet," etc. However, after being at the hotel for about 3 hours, my husband and I agreed that this was definitely a nice hotel, and we could not understand why there were so many negative reviews. The hotel is in the process of renovating, and if you go in understanding that, you're already ahead of the game. Our room was beautiful and had a great oceanfront balcony. (We may have stayed in one of the rooms that had already been renovated, but I'm not sure.) In any event, I have no complaints about the room. When I travel, all I really ask is that my hotel room is clean, reasonably nice, and receives daily attention from the housekeeping staff. All of these requirements were met with no problem. I am by no means a "hotel snob," as I have stayed in plenty of budget- and moderately-priced hotels in my lifetime. However, I've also had a 10-day stay on the club level of the Ritz-Carlton San Juan, so my hotel stays have pretty much run the gamut. This hotel is certainly not the R-C, but it's not the complete opposite either. I've stayed in plenty of Wyndhams, and this hotel is on par with the rest of them. It IS an older hotel, but it IS nice, and it IS being renovated. I would stay there again with no hesitation. A couple of negatives, though. First, the beach is probably the smallest public beach I've ever been to. The hotel does indeed front the ocean, but the beach access is on the side of the hotel, and it is Condado Public Beach. It is a tiny beach with no waves. Basically, the beach is at the very beginning of the Condado Lagoon. It's very rocky, so if you want to get out in the water, bring water shoes. A lot of people in our group enjoyed snorkeling, though, because the waters were calmer than the ocean. I prefer waves and a larger beach, so that's why this was a negative for me. Also, drinks and food are unbelievably expensive in the Condado area, including at the hotel. My husband ordered a Medalla Light (local beer) from the hotel's swim-up bar. It came in a 10 oz. can (not 12 oz.) and was $7.00, which we thought was outrageous. If you stay here, just be prepared to shell out the dough if you eat or drink anywhere in the area. I had also read bad reviews about the pool area. Personally, I thought it was a very nice area, and there were lots of secluded spots to read, take a nap, etc. There's a saltwater pool, a freshwater pool, and a large jacuzzi. We enjoyed the pool area and have no complaints. I know everyone has a different experience when they stay at a hotel, and everyone has their own expectations, requirements, etc. I'm just writing this review because I had a pretty good experience, and I don't want others to be misled by all the bad reviews on here. One further note ... We were traveling with a group of around 80 people, and I've still not heard any complaints about their rooms or their hotel experience. Their experiences and opinions seemed to parallel ours.

Reviews.Title: “beatiful casino--horrible ROOMS--BEWARE!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I visited the website for this hotel and decided to give it a try-- too bad I didn't know about trip advisor back then! The casino and the enire hotel was very nicely decorated--but the rooms were NASTY!! The carpet was old and green and smelled like it was 100 years old. The beds were old, furniture was old, bathroom, bathtub old, it was just yucky.. Maybe I am a clean-freak--but I am a paying customer and I wanted my hotel room to be nice and clean. Would never go back there!! Also, their front desk service is very slow. The restaurants inside the hotel are nothing special and quite $$$. I had a wonderful time in Puerto Rico by trying to stay away from our hotel as much as possible. Hope this helps

Reviews.Title: “This hotel works.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: First a few tips. The Bacardi tour was a waste unless you really need to know how Bacardi got started. I went to the club Babylon, located in Wyndham El San Juan and it was a decent club but more so filled with young people. I was told it caters to 18 and up on Fri, and 23 and up on Sat. I must say the lobby (people, singles) in the El San Juan Wyndham was more my speed but I couldnâ€™t afford $250 a night this time. Also do your bookings for a rental car online. I walked to Avis and was told they only had cars for $49 a day. However, I had already booked a reservation online while I was in the internet cafÃ© next to walgreens. The car was $33 a day. The concierge couldnâ€™t even find me a good rate, so I did what I normally do, book it myself. The hotel charges $10 a day for parking with in and out priviledges. My feelings are mixed. My first room was pretty nice and with an awesome view, although I am a bit afraid of water and I am a hotel snob. As another person said, I also saw some tiny, tiny bugs. Only two though, lol. Unfortunately I had to switch rooms because someone called my room and said some sexual things. Scared me to death. They switched me to a room that took four attempts to get in. Apparently the lock wasnâ€™t working that well. When I got in the room, I was not happy. The balcony door wouldnâ€™t lock; no CD player and things just didnâ€™t look up to par. So I went back down and complain, this time raising my American voice. I was switched to another room that was pretty nice but the hot water wasnâ€™t hot, and it was running as if it was trying to wash a baby (very slow). I complained the next day and the manager said she would send up an engineer. Correct me if I am wrong but that means, they would walk in with dirty shoes right? When I mentioned this she looked at me like I was crazy. Da hell I want them coming in a room I am staying in with dirty shoes after my room was clean. If they are engineers, they are working and usually get their shoes dirty. You know they wouldnâ€™t have sense to vacuum again or per request. So I gave up because I saw a bad situation turning to a worse one, so I dealt with the slow, cold water. The bellboys and concierge guys were very friendly and answered all 100 questions I had (lol). I noticed the maids didnâ€™t change the bed sheets. I knew for a fact I left hair in the bed (combing my hair in bed) and it was still there after they cleaned the room. I made sure all my belongings were in my suitcase. I donâ€™t take my things out at any hotel. One of the elevators keep getting stuck on 4, as another person said. I guess they havenâ€™t figured out what to do yet (sarcasm). I would stay at this hotel again if I want to stay in this area because overall I was pretty comfortable despite the things that happened. The hotel for the most part was clean and so was my room and it had a very large closet and a comfortable bed. I also got two wake up calls, which was cool. I also got some wine, cheese and crackers, because I am a Wyndham By Request member. I actually forgot about this and got it the second day.

Reviews.Title: “Don't count this place out!”
Reviews.Author: sunlily
Reviews.Content: This was my 7th trip to Puerto Rico and I wanted to stay in Condado. The hotel is in desperate need of renovations that of course they were doing during my stay. The staff was friendly and the front desk gave us an upgrade just by asking. The housekeeping staff on the other hand was a disaster. The pools were nice and it's right on a public beach which was immaculate. Great location, you can walk to anything you need or take a 10 minute cab ride to Old San Juan or Isla Verde.

Reviews.Title: “AWESOME TIME!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Wowwww...i can't believe this place has such bad reviews! We just returned from a wonderful vaccation in PR. We had originally booked at the San Juan Marriott Resort & Stellaris Casino after reading the amazing reviews, but that place was a nightmare. The lobby was so smoky and loud it was unbearable. The poeple were rude, it was overcrowded and it was not child friendly at all. Our tub wasnt draining, the room smelled very musty and gave us allergies and they never offered us any upgrades but moved us to a similar room and were very rude. The next day we mpved to this Wyndham and LOVED IT!!! The poeple were very friendly and it wa sa beautiful place. The pools are wonderful, the casino is to the side and its spread out so it never feels over crowded. They have 3 pools and two hot tubs and beautiful hammocks to relax in right by the water. I napped there with my baby and it was the most beautiful sight. They have plenty of restaurants in the hotel and also close by. We had a great time and will definitely retrn!!

Reviews.Title: “Theft by the Condado Resort Pool”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I just read "Theft at the Condado" and finally felt I needed to weigh in on this and also post a review. I was robbed by the resort pool despite the cameras, security bracelet, and numerous security guards. The managment told me they NEVER had thefts, however, they also would not reveal anything on the security tapes and prevented the police from investigating. The police were only allowed in the lobby. The theft was poorly handled and I was made to feel responsible!! Our vacation was ruined. However, in all fairness when I attempted to leave I was offered a transfer to any other Wyndham and got my second choice "the Conquistador" which was absolutely magnificent and a true "resort".

Reviews.Title: “Poor service, poor value”
Reviews.Author: idratherbetraveling
Reviews.Content: The location on the water is beautiful, not much of a beach, though. Our room's furniture was beat-up, the bathroom light fixtures were falling off the wall, and there were tiny black bugs everywhere. The service was VERY poor and the food and drinks were TERRIBLY expensive for what you received. The hotel felt very overcrowded. For a wonderful dinner within walking distance, try Ropa Vieja and Ajili Mojili (excellent Puerto Rican food).

Reviews.Title: “Wyndham Condado Plaza Hotel & Casino”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Hotel was OK for one night before we boarded our ship. Would not stay for any longer. The hotel needs a good cleaning where you check in, odd odors. We stayed in the lagoon side of the hotel. The elevators got stuck on the 4th floor at times because of a short circuit. The 3 (three) phones in the room, the only one that worked was the one in the bathroom. The desk phone and the night stand phone never worked. VERY POOR MAINTENANCE STAFF that would not listen to anyone. At checkout time they had one girl checking out everyone and one girl checking people in. NOTE: Can't have people checking in, if rooms are not available. Taxi cost is $10.00 to Old San Juan, The Ship Pier. Plenty of Taxis. Better Place To Stay is the Wyndham Old San Juan - walking distance to Old San Juan, Senior Frog's, Carnival Pier.

Reviews.Title: “What a FANTASTIC Resort !!!!”
Reviews.Author: Gary85018
Reviews.Content: I stayed here on October 9th 2004, Before my cruise. WOW i was so Suprised. I Loved it !!!!, and i must admit im Very picky. The staff was Fantastic The food was Great The casino Fun The rooms Wow Id reccommed this resort to anyone , it was wonderul, pool private beach and all.

Reviews.Title: “I'm glad I didn't listen to the negative reviews.”
Reviews.Author: METOOCH
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a week long stay at the Wyndham Condado Plaza and I must say how much I enjoyed the experience. I had read some reviews on this site prior to going and had become extremely discouraged with my hotel choice and was expecting the worse based on what I had read. Luckily I was very pleasantly surprised with what I found. I found the staff to be extremely helpful and not rude at all. It could have something to do with the fact that I treated them like "people" and not my "servants". I found the beach to be adequate and larger than the impression I had gotten from previous reviews I read. The hotel pools were nice too. I liked the fact that they were open 24 hours however no one seemed to use them after dark and I did not want to be there alone after dark so I did not get to use the pools at night. I loved the hammicks and spent more time there dozing and listening to the crash of the ocean against the rocks than I did in the pools. Even though I was on a tour package the hotel still upgraded my room to a jr. suite which I absolutely loved. I ended up with an ocean view however I think the original city view I was supposed to have would have been nice too because it would have overlooked the marina. I have found in my previous travels that you get what you give and since I am always nice I get nice in return. I would not hesitate to stay here again and I would definitely recommend it to others as a place to stay. I did not get a chance to do all the hotel had to offer because I wanted to get away from the hotel and experience some of the city however I would not have had a problem spending my entire time at the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “cuidado condado”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: el sucko!!! the Regency was probably built (and last cleaned 20 years ago).way too pricey, should be $40 a night not $110 (OFF SEASON) the whole section of condado is under construction and there is no access to the beach... stay in isla verde if you want a true slice of san juan. the staff at the Plaza Casino couldn't be more rude. Unless you are playing high stakes poker, you can't even get a watered down draft beer whilest you pump $ into this little rundown waste of an evening. my advice... find a cute little place in old san juan for dinner and pina coladas!

Reviews.Title: “Id rather stay at a Motel Six”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: 4 star? hahahaa. I have seen better motel sixes. Our room wasnt too bad but alot of the room fixtures were in disrepair or rusty, not indicative of a 4 star hotel. The carpet STUNK. The staff was not very helpful, least of which were the casino staff. Our encounters with people in the general area minus the bellhops left me with a distaste for Puerto Rico. They were very rude and almost condescending. Maybe looking very "gringo" had everything to do with it. I'm not sure. I will not visit again unless my cruise ship ports there. Spend the few extra dollars and stay at the Caribe Hilton. Worth it.

Reviews.Title: “They couldn't pay me to stay there again!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I am compelled to relate what a poor experience I had at the Wyndham Condado in Puerto Rico. We came in off of Princess Cruises around noon on Sunday. We waited almost an entire hour in line to be told that there would be no room ready until three p.m. There was a gentleman handing out rum punch to the people in line. I think this was an attempt to appease an angry crowd, but they would have been better off having this gentleman working behind the counter. They told us we could hang out at the pool area until 3 p.m. when a room would be ready. While we were at the pool, my boyfriend visited the restroom only to discover a sink full of vomit. At 3 p.m. we waited in line another twenty minutes to finally get a room on the 9th floor of the tower which smelled much like cat urine. There were obviously much needed renovations in progress. We visited the casino, where we couldn't even get on the roulette table. There were crowds of people surrounding the two open tables, and yet between the six dealers mulling around behind the tables, they still didn't open up either of the two other tables. We were charged $6 for a Coors Light at the casino bar, and when inquiring as to the exorbitant price, the bartender sarcastically said, "Welcome to Condado." I actually booked this room through Hotwire, and was told that what I paid included taxes. But upon check out, found that we were charged an additional $18 in taxes and tariffs. I was extremely disappointed in the condition of the hotel and our floor and the service I received from staff. Although I am not a "By Request" member, I spent several weeks at the Wyndham in Los Angeles, which was by far superior in quality and service. Should I ever know anyone misfortunate enough to visit Puerto Rico, The Wyndham Condado will not be my recommendation.

Reviews.Title: “Wyndam Condado Plaza”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 5 day, four night stay at the Wyndham Condado Plaza and thought we would write a quick review. The hotel was ok... just ok. It wasn't terrible, but definitely not a 4 star hotel. The room was nice; we had an oceanview which was the best part of staying there. The rooms do need a carpet upgrade but that's pretty typical of ocean front hotels. Not too bad but stained in some areas and you can tell it has been there a while. The maid service was excellent though. The restaurants looked nice, a little pricy but since we wanted to experience the culture and not Tony Romas like we have here in Ohio, we ventured out to eat. There is a nice coffee shop outside though by the valet parking that has muffins and danish for 2$ each. Nice value for breakfast when combined with the free coffee in the rooms. The Casino was nothing to write home about. They advertise it as the best in PR but we walked to the Raddison and even the Diamond Palace Hotel and found better games and machines that worked. It was a 20 minute walk and we had fun people watching while we were walking, if you like that sort of thing. The tables at Wyndam are mainly BlackJack, no Let it Ride or 3 Card Poker like they advertise so don't expect it. Also, many of their machines don't take bills and honestly, they were tight as a drum. We had more luck down the street. Even though the casinos down the street were better, if you are going on a gambling vacation, stick to Vegas, you'll win more and be able to play longer on your bankroll. The pools were nice and not crowded. We're not really into the beach scene so the fact that the beach was small and not directly on the ocean (it was located on an inlet with not many waves or anything except street people trying to sell you coconuts!) we didn't mind. If you are there for just a few nights during a cruise or something, I suppose this hotel is doable, but if you want to really experience a fine hotel and the culture, stay at the Marriott or Raddison down the street. Final note: We went to the Bahamas last year and read reviews on here saying the people of the island are rude to tourists. Not true! They were all pleasant and helpful. We read the same thing about Puerto Rico and thought nothing of it until we arrived. I got the feeling they are tired of the tourists. Not quite as friendly even when you go overboard to be nice to them. We won't be going back so I guess they don't have to worry!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: From the advice of a friend I decided I wanted to stay at the Wyndham Condado Hotel. Once I booked the room for a week stay, I decided to reads some reviews on it. I was really discouraged once I started to read the reviews. Even though there were only a couple of negative responses, more good then bad, I still was very doubtful. But once I checked in, I was very surprised. First off, the bus stop is right in front of the hotel, which was very convenient for us because we did a lot of traveling back and forth to old San Juan (mind you the bus ride is only a quarter). The lobby of the hotel was lovely, and the real surprise was when we checked out the room, the room was standard, but the ocean view was amazing. I feel in love right away. The private balconies were great, it felt like no one else was around. The pool elevator was perfect for going straight from you floor to the pool area, in just your bathing suit. On the other hand, the beach behind the hotel should not even be listed as one of the hotel's features because it is so tiny, but the pools make up for that. One of the pools has a slide which was listed on the hotel's features.I figured it was a straight down, boring, short slide, no, the slide was the best part of the pool, it was constructed so when your going down you don't see anyone else or when your getting close to the pool, thereâ€™s a couple of turns. There were a lot of kids on it, but I tried it out and it was great. Highly recommended for adults, especially the swim up bar!!!!!!There is the condado beach, for people who want to go swimming in the ocean, which is only a couple of blocks away. I went everyday, it was a very nice short walk. One thing I have to tell you is to stay away from one of the restaurants in the hotel, Max's grill. $20 for a plate of food. Don't even bother eating there, unless if you have that kind of money. Right next door is an Italian restaurant where they have good food for a decent price. Overall I was very satisfied with the hotel, so satisfied that I'm staying there again next year. Donâ€™t listen to the negative comments like I did. Some people are just too high maintenance and are expecting Trump Towers or something like the ritz, you get what you paid for, and I got what I paid for and more. See it for yourself, instead of reading the reviews, it's worth a weekend stay.

Reviews.Title: “Whndham Condado : Definitely not worth it !”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I am not sure how someone can rate this hotel 4 stars since it only qualifies as a 2 star hotel in my book. My wife and I checked in at this hotel and was disappointed at our room. The floor carpeting was old and wall paintings are about to peel off. The lightning fixtures are broken and has rust stains all over it. Service was good but this is expected on big hotels. Beach was ho-hum and I did not even bother go swimming in it. Rocks does not add scenery as what the previous writer says (no offense). I recommend to stay away from this hotel and go to VIEQUES at Wyndham Resort Martineau. They have the best beaches we have seen that can be compared to Mauii or Fiji. And the resort is really a 5 star with a wonderful swimmable beach. Wyndham Condado needs a makeover really bad.

Reviews.Title: “Didn't want to leave!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: In a nutshell the hotel was more than we expected. We purchased a package through travelocity for a 5 night stay at the Wyndham. We did our research, read the reviews, saw the pictures blah, blah. Nothing really matters until you're actually there. The most breathtaking views, the friendliest people, the warmest beach water, and the cleanest room. Everything was comfortable and easily accessible. A standard room was more than enough for a couple, but with so much to do and see in PR, why stay in you're room. The entire staff was friendly and helpfull especially the concierge. The 3 pools were beautiful, the beach small but cute and clean with an amazing view. If you get a room with a view of the lagoon, don't be dissapointed, it's just as nice as the beach. Get to know the strip (Ashford Ave.) before spending $40 on room service breakfast (unless you want to, more power to you! ) There's a local hole in the wall with the best food for super cheap, a couple blocks away. Ask questions, it will make your trip more worthwhile! We're already planning our next trip and looking forward to staying at the Wyndham once more.

Reviews.Title: “So pleased”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just returned from five days at the Wyndham Condado Plaza in San Juan and were very pleased with it. We had a spotless room with a great dressing room and the view was great. The staff were pleasant and most helpful, true the food prices were steep, but within a few blocks was wonderful food at more reasonable prices. The swimming pools were also excellent and the beach okay. There was live music at night. We will stay there again. Bettye Horton

Reviews.Title: “Terrific Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I would recommend this hotel to anyone because the hotel is a great place to stay. I can,t believe that people gave this hotel bad reviews. I checked in really quick and I checked out through my Tv in my room, so checking in and out was really easy. The room was clean and spacious and the air conditioner was icy cold. The beds were clean and very pleasant to sleep in. The staff was great and very friendly and quick to help you with any request you had. The pool was absoloutely fantanstic, it had a swim up bar and a slide which the kids really enjoyed. the beach was small but I really did not mind because I had a rental car and everything was so close, so buy a Puerto Rico map because it will really help a lot and major attactions are less than an hour away. The Casino in the hotel is great with live music and dancing. The food in the hotel is expensive but they have so many restaurants around the hotel for fair prices, Don' t forget to visit Old San Juan, El Morro, all this is about 15 minutes away and the bus takes you there for a quarter if you don't have a car.There is also an arcade in the hotel to keep your kids busy and more activities aroun the pool. I really loved this hotel and would always stay there when I go to Puerto Rico.

Reviews.Title: “Hey tourists, this is a good place to stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I was terrified after reading the previous reviews. However, pleasantly surprised at all the smiles I received upon check in and during my stay. The staff is very friendly--but you must be respectful and friendly as well. Puerto Ricans do not respond well to egotistical behavior. Hotel is beautiful and is being remodeled. I did not mind the fresh paint scent in some areas. BEWARE OF THE HIGH FOOD PRICES AT THIS HOTEL. Do not eat here unless you are very wealthy. Go outside your hotel to Ashford Ave (to the left of the front entrance of the main building). You will find great breakfasts for less than $6.00 and ocean view. For dinner, again, try the local restaurants like Ropa Vieja and Ajili Mojili. They are expensive, but the food is sooo much better than Max's Grill. BEWARE Pina Coladas at the hotel are from instant mixes (YUCK). Ask for the real thing--coconut milk and pineapple juice. Do Ride the bus to Old San Juan and be ready for homeless folks to ask for money. Say NO and walk away. If you stop they will follow you and annoy you. They are not dangerous. There is a lot of security in the area. Join Wyndham by Request for the best rooms available and walk about ten minutes to the nearest beach, which is condado beach. A bit rough for little ones, but great for boogy boards. You can purchase boogy boards at Walgreens, just across the street. The beach at the hotel has many Sea Orchens (did I spell this right) and can be a nuisance. Not a good place to swim--snorkeling for adults is okay. Overall---a more than good experience. This hotel is a great place to stay. Casino open 24 hours and live music until 2 am. Go ahead and book your room, and have a great time. I sure did!

Reviews.Title: “Don't listen to the bad reviews of this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I'm not sure what everyone is complaining about related to this hotel -- don't have a second thought about staying at the Wyndham Condado Plaza! We were almost swayed not to stay there due to the negative comments on Trip Advisor, but the deal we got through Priceline was too good to pass up. Every moment of our stay there (July 23-28, 2004) was amazing. We arrived about 12 hours later than expected due to flight delays, and our luggage was lost. The hotel staff made check-in a breeze, and housekeeping provided us with necessary toiletries immediately to replace what we were without. We were blown away by our room -- despite the fact that we booked through a discounter, we had THE BEST room in the entire hotel. We were placed on the 10th floor Plaza Club. Our enormous room had a couch and armchair, desk, Aeron chair, mini-fridge, TV armoire, dimmer lights, a king-sized bed, a walk-in closet for our luggage (once it arrived!), and a gleaming bathroom. The view of the Condado Lagoon from our room was spectacular. The location of the Wyndham Condado Plaza is ideal -- Condado is a safe and pretty neighborhood. There are lots of restaurants right on Ashford (the street the hotel is on) and there's on-site parking underneath the hotel with a very affordable daily rate. You have easy access to Old San Juan (a short taxi ride away), Luiz Munoz Marin Airport is less than a half-hour trip, and it's a quick drive to major highways if you're renting a car to get to other parts of the island. The hotel has two pools -- a salt pool and a chlorine pool with a swim-up cabana bar. It's literally 100 feet to the beach from the hotel, which is right on the Condado Lagoon -- we went snorkeling on the reef right in front of the hotel! There are excellent restaurants right in the hotel (the Italian place on the mezzanine level was our favorite), and we loved the room service -- the food quality was excellent and it arrived quickly. The hotel staff were helpful and super nice. In short, we would stay there again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Hole in the Wall”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: After a great cruise on Princess, we wanted to relax in San Juan for 3 days. We arrived at the Condado and found that it was over booked. There were people there with confirmation #'s from the previous day waiting on rooms. After waiting in the Lobby for 8 hours and fighting with management we finally got in our "Premium Room". What a hole. Cigrettes crushed out in the walls. Mold everywhere. Nasty. The pool area was filthy. Im sure that 15 years ago the place was nice. Do not subject your family to this hotel. Not to mention that the locals were rude to the tourists and 17 people were murdered in the 3 days there.Our cab driver told us the drug lords were fighting over turf. The people of San Juan have alot to learn about how they treat the tourists that spend $ in their city. The Wyndam Condado is a run down, dirty, hotel with a great view.

Reviews.Title: “Honymooners beware”
Reviews.Author: 2roamer
Reviews.Content: My daughter and son-in-law are spending their honymoon on a cruise and have booked extra nights at the Condada plaza in San Juan (13th - 17th July). They pre booked Wyndam-by-request. I telephoned the hotel from the UK to ask if they could stay in the same room throughout their stay, I was told that the hotel were "not in the habit of asking their guests to move rooms in the middle of their stay". I have however, just received a telephone call from my daughter to say that just before going on a pre booked trip they were told to pack and change to a room on another floor and that they would be charged for breakfast from now on. They asked if they could stay in the room where they were and were told no. What sort of company treats a honeymoon couple in this way after travelling all that way? They stayed at 2 different hotels in the UK before flying out and were treated with respect and decency, the way I would expect any good hotel to treat their paying guests. I have telephoned the cruise line and will write to them asking them not to use this hotel in the future. I would suggest to the management of the Wyndam group to give some intensive training to their staff in how to treat people like human beings, after all if it were not for the paying guest they would all be out of a job. Pamela Madison, Rayleigh Essex Great Britain

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel with great ocean view, but no beach to speak of!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a recent weeklong trip to Puerto Rico( June 19-26th) and was apprehensive about our stay at the hotel because of the reviews. We found some truth to what we read... The conceirge's desk at the hotel is very indifferent and of little assistance beyond some local maps. You would be better off with a Frommer's guide in hand like we did! There is no beach at this hotel...I repeat there is No Beach at this hotel worth setting foot on-it's tiny(so much so I thought it was the lagoon area) and dirty with jagged rocks all along. If you want to stay somewhere with an actual beach as you and I know it then stay at the Caribe Hilton (beautiful, private beach). However, the Ocean view rooms at the hotel are spacious with a walk-in closet and beautiful, breathtaking views. Be sure to Join Wyndham-By-Request so that you can get your upgrade. The hotel pools (3) were some of the best around, we especially enjoyed the saltwater pool. The restaurants in the hotel are very $$$ so eat at restaurants located a short walk from the hotel like Ajili Mojili (delicious, authentic Puerto Rican food) and Ropa Vieja. Go to Old San Juan by taxi and eat at the Parrot Club. You'll love the food and lively atmosphere. El Yunque is a must-see and wear your swimsuit under your clothes to experience the lovely waterfalls. Enjoy the live music at the hotel, especially on weekends. Upon checkout, look at your bill very carefully! They overbilled us for 2 restaurants that we never ate at, but it was later corrected and apologies were made. Overall, the hotel was nice, but lacking in its locale to the beach and in its not so helpful and competent staff.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible hotel! Don't stay here!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went on a Southern Caribbean cruise on our honeymoon. Upon returning to San Juan, we stayed one more evening at a hotel. We were horrified at the Wyndham Condado. Let me preface this by saying that we are not super picky people. We probably vacation once a year, and are willing to sacrifice some service for a lower price. We've seen some not so great hotels. However, nothing we've seen will top how terrible the Wyndham Condado is! First of all, we arrived on a Sunday afternoon. We were not anticipating any large crowds. I waited in line for nearly 2 hours to check in! NO joke!!! There was a huge line. It took the incompetant staff at least 15 minutes to check in each reservation. When I finally arrived up there, I asked if there was a problem. In a not so nice voice, the woman replied, "No, it's always like this on Sunday's". I got no apology, no explanation, nothing. I had just waited 2 hours in line!!! I would've just cancelled my reservation, but we had prepaid it on Priceline. We checked into our rooms, which were musty and very dirty. The carpets were very old, and the sheets were dirty. I attempted to call for a wake up call, and none of the phones in the room worked. I would be damned if I was going to go wait in line another 2 hours to ask for a different room. Then, we proceeded to hear the couple next door have 'relations'. It was so loud it was as if it was in our own room. While I understand that this can happen at any hotel, these walls were exceptionally thin. We ate lunch and dinner at the hotel (an Italian place and Max's). The food was adequate, at best. Checking out the next morning was just as much of a disaster. The 'tv' check out didn't work, the line to check out was huge. I ended up just leaving my keys and walking out. I would NOT stay here again if they paid me. Prior to our cruise we had stayed at the Intercontinental and had a much better experience.

Reviews.Title: “Average- but depends on your outlook”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Puerto Rico, and it was wonderful! But I have to say, we had some doubts about the hotel. The front desk and concierge staff is indifferent and sometimes rude. It is almost like they are doing YOU a favor by giving you their undivided apathy. We weren't disgruntled though, having been forewarned in reading the trip advisor reviews. We joined ByRequest and I highly recommend it because we got upgraded to an ocean view room. It has a huge walk in closet and a breath-taking view. The beach there is small, yes, but the water is still beautiful! I highly recommend the tours- especially the Bioluminescent Bay! Don't book it through the hotel, though- it will be cheaper if you book it directly through the tour company like Castillo tours. (They might even give you a discount if you ask.) And take the bus to Old San Juan- it's only 25 cents each way. Despite an average hotel- the trip is really what you make of it. We had an absolutely wonderful experience in Puerto Rico.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Management Team!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The staff at this hotel is absolutely wonderful. I charged two rooms on my credit card and I was charged three times. Naturally I was angry, so when I called the hotel I was screaming at the top of my lungs. The person I spoke with (Thor), was so patient and apologetic. Even though I was screaming at him like he was my personal servant, he was never rude. As many times as I screamed, is as many times as he said I'm sorry. I must say that his attitude really suprised me and I finally calmed down. Their account manager Yolanda called my Bank immediately and everything was resolved within a few hours. There was a misunderstanding regarding the breakfast that came with the package. I spoke with the manager Miguel and he immediately resolved everything in the nicest and most professional manner. As I'm writing this review my brother and cousin are at the hotel right now with their girlfriends and they love the hotel. Prior to their arrival I had a lot of interaction with other hotel staff members and they were wonderful also especially Naderis. Whenever I called, I never got one rude person. As hotel guest sometimes we can be a little impatient and I think if we apprach people in a nice manner we can get better service. It worked for me. I've been to Puerto Rico before and I've stayed at the Marriott and Intercontinental. I can't wait until my next Puerto Rico trip because I'm definitely staying at the Wyndham Condado.

Reviews.Title: “Wyndham Condado Plaza”
Reviews.Author: mosquitomagnet
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Condado Plaza for 5 nights, May 19-24. Had a Jr. Suite on the Lagoon side. The room was fine. The maids kept it clean. The bathroom was on the small side. There is a very small dirty beach by the hotel, don't bother. The pool area is ok, too many kids screaming and playing. Did not eat at any of the hotel restaurants. Preferred to eat in Old San Juan or at one of the many restaurants on Ashford Avenue. If you want a nice beach be sure to stay at one of the hotels on Isla Verde. Service at the hotel is bad. Never got our By Request amenity even after calling and asking for it 3 times. The front desk staff was very indifferent . Be aware that there is a $7.00 charge each time you use the fitness center. Even with all the negatives I would stay here again if the rate was reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “Good rate? Then stay here!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I felt much like those skeptical about staying at the Condado Plaza prior to my trip. I was already a guest of Wyndham by request and upon arrival was quickly upgraded to an ocean view. I got a pretty good room rate through Liberty Travel, so I was very pleased. I never ate at the hotel restaurant, but the BBQ by the pool was superb! The pools were great, I was just upset that the fabulous pool slide shut down at 5pm (I'm a kid at heart). The hotel was very quiet Mon-Thurs. and they got busy, but not roudy over the weekend. I do agree with some who said the pool staff was very weak, as though we were doing them a favor by buying a drink, running a tab or getting a towel! The concierge also knew nothing about tours, etc. But whatever, I am resourcefull and had a great time. I would definitely stay again, just won't get too animated about the hired help. If you get good rates stay here, just don't pay outrageous prices and expect to be compensated with service because you won't

Reviews.Title: “Too Expensive”
Reviews.Author: jacobian
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 5 days and 4 nights. I arrived with trepidation because of the previous reviews that I read about this hotel. I was pleasantly surprised by the friendly bellmen/porters, they were the most welcoming and helpful in comparison to the concierge, and the reception desk. I was given a double instead of a king and after getting that resolved I was placed in a room which was cleaner than expected, although the bathtub had not been properly cleaned. The cleaning staff was really friendly, too. The following day, the person who cleaned the room did a thorough job on that bathtub. I couldn't understand why the perimeter of the bath wasn't cleaned properly. The air conditioner in my room was horrible and blew out cool extremely humid air and made me feel sick. I turned it off and opened the door to the glorious view of the ocean and the fantastic breeze. I like the way my room was furnished, I loved the bed linens, especially the feather pillows and felt comfortable and secure. The safe did not have a key and I never got one for my stay, so I wasn't happy about that. The check out lines were ridiculously long and the front desk process took way too much time. I thought that the process was absurd. This hotel is huge and it needs to have more check-in/out staff to accommodate the mass influx/exit of guests. As long as you are checking in/out off schedule, you are okay, which was my case. I arrived at 11:50a.m. and I checked out at 2:00 pm. I wasn't impressed with the reception desk staff who were aloof, as were the people who gave you towels at the pool and the wait staff in the high-end restaurant. The wait staff where the buffet was served were wonderful, though. I wasn't impressed with the beach at all. It had trash and debris all over the sand and it was absolutely tiny. I will be going back to beautiful Puerto Rico, but I will be staying at another hotel. I would not recommend this hotel to anyone, as it is way too expensive for all the problems that it has.

Reviews.Title: “El Condado Plaza Hotel (be careful with your belongings)”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at El Condado Plaza from March 24-27. the place is ok. outside is beutiful but we enden up missing some items from our room (2 perfumes to be exact) The hotel just about 1wk ago credit our credit card for the amount of the items but is just going thru the aggravation. Really, put your items away, even the ones you wouldn't think anyone would be interested in. Otherwise, good experience.

Reviews.Title: “Warning: do not stay at this hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: You know youâ€™re staying at a luxery hotel when the hotel sign is missing a letter or two. If your idea of a Caribbean resort is a second-rate hotel situated in â€œBig Digâ€� like surroundings within walking distance to nothing but Chilliâ€™s and vacant hotels than this is the place for you. If you despise the beach and prefer a shady 50 foot gravel pit that claims to be a beach you will love the Wyndham Condado. If the gravel pit is not your thing perhaps you might enjoy a game of Bingo by the cold pool or soak in the one cloudy germ â€“ridden jacuzzi. (Just donâ€™t expect a towel or a chair at the beach after 4:00) You could also dine one of several mediocre restaurants, enjoy an over-priced artery clogging breakfast or gamble beside local seniors and career gamblers staying at the hotel for free. However, with such a lovely view of cranes, a bridge under construction, and the pounding sound of Jack hammers you may never want to leave your room. Just keep in mind youâ€™ll have to stock your own mini bar. In all seriousness, this hotel might be Ok for families or older folks but if youâ€™re looking to enjoy the beach or nightlife youâ€™re much better off at the Intercontinental or the the Wyndam El San Juan in Isla Verde. And whatever you do donâ€™t go to Puerto Rico in May when it rains everyday.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and price”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on my honeymoon and was pleasantly surprised. Paid only $75/night and had a $150.night hotel. They gave us a room with a full balcony and view. 5 minutes to Old San Juan. Great restaurants on the property, 2 pools and no one ever using the gym or tennis courts. The ocean side offers great views. Loved it!

Reviews.Title: “What to Expect”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel from May 10-14th, 2004. The most important thing to note about this hotel is that the website, etc. is incredibly misleading. Here is the deal. Yes, technically, this hotel is on the "beach"...but not really. The area in front of it is 100% rocky, so there is no place to lay out, swim, etc. There hotel is next to and has a gate to a sandy area that is sort of a beach(filled with butts, and bottles, considering it is where the locals go), but is actually a 100% waveless alcove off from the coast area. Therefore, If you want to sit in the sun and jump in the ocean, this is not the place to do it. Go to a hotel in Isla Verde(like the IC), or further down in Condado, like the Marriott. Also, thought the Wyndham is in Condado, it is right at the edge, so its about a 15 min walk to all the upscale shops and resturants..the ones nearby stink (Tony Roma's and Chilis). The swim up bar and pools however, were quite nice.

Reviews.Title: “Notl like it was”
Reviews.Author: Milt07
Reviews.Content: This was the second time that I stayed at The Condado Plaza and quite frankly, it seems to be a shell of its former self. The hotel is still lovely, but it is beginning to show its age. The marble floors in the lobby are showing spots of heavy wear and tear. The huge aquarium is a nice touch, but the spacing of the nite club proximity is too close to the telephones. I was trying to make a phone call, and I couldn't hear. I arrived at the hotel on April 29, 2004 around 12:00 p.m. and my room was not ready. I belong to the Wyndham by Request and had requested an oceanview room. I did not get into my room until 3:15 p.m. after several trips to the front desk. They did offer to upgrade me to the Plaza level, however, there were no more oceanview suites. They did offer to put me on the lagoon side, but I opted for the full breakfast buffet vouchers instead. The plaza level comes with a deluxe continental breakfast, but it is not better than the buffet especially for someone with a healthy appetite like myself. The room was nice with a oceanview that was incredible. I could see cruise ships at night on the horizon and parasailing and jetskiing during the day. The breeze never ceased and I slept with the balcony door open every night.The bathroom amenities were more than you ask for. The only problem with the bathroom was when you took a shower, it took a long timefor the water to leave the tub. I did not want to go thru the hassle of asking for another room as I fell in love with the view, so I just imagined I had my feet in the water at the beach. This was a minor problem and did not affect my trip. Speaking of the beach, they have a small one on the side of the hotel, but it is a public beach and the take advantage of it. There is a path to the beach from the gorgeous pool area with security stationed at the entrance to keep anyone who is not a guest from entering the property unless they are with you of course. They have three pools at the hotel, one on the lagoon side and two on the main side. The saltwater pool is 6ft deep , the regular pool is approx 4ft deep with a volleyball net , water slide, and swim up bar. There is a jacuzzi which is nice. All the pools are open 24 hours, so enjoy! The jacuzzi gets a little busy late at night as the weather has cooled off a bit. In the midst of the pools is Las Palmas, a restaurant with reasonably priced snacks and lite meals. It is open and has nice breezes blowing all the time. The swim up bar closes at 12:00 am. There is a separate pool elevator available to guests that they prefer you use from the evening on as they have a certain atmosphere they try to maintain. No swimsuits in the lobby at night. They would prefer use wear slacks for men and appropiate evening wear for the ladies. They are not stuffy but want you dress a little bit at night ( not formal ). The hotel has six restaurants from a deli to a onsite Tony Roma's. The buffet is served at Max's and is not cheap, I had vouchers so I really could not tell you how much it was, but I did hear my friends say between 10 and 15. There is a nice place a few doors down from the hotel that has a great breakfast special for $5.50. The hotel concierge has all the info on the tours which range from 30 - 100.00 . My advice to you is rent a car for at least one day across the street at Charlies and do Puerto Rico your way. Also, I noticed a faint smell of mildew on the hallway carpets which seems to be a problem with a lot of hotels in the carribean. I wish they all had tiles. These are minor things and should not stop you from staying at the Condado.

Reviews.Title: “Great time at Wyndham Condado (April 2004)”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I went to San Juan, PR for the first time. I spent a week at the Wyndham Condado Plaza....it was absolutely wonderful. The service was top quality! My room had a view with a balcony overlooking the atlantic ocean. The food was great there! I traveled all around the Island and visited many places including the country sides. I plan on returning in December 2004 after I return from South Africa.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Beautiful Ocean view”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This Wyndham is about 15 minutes from the airport and 10 minutes from San Juan. (Great Location). As we drove over the bridge to get to the hotel, my first thought was...I'm not going to like this place. It was on a busy street and the beach (lagoon area) was small and visable from the main road. But that thought didn;t last long. Once I steped outside of the Wyndham, the ocean view was beautiful. The grounds were very well maintained and the hotel and accomadations were great. (be sure to request a room on the ocean side, the lagoon view is quite a walk from everything) The hotel has about 6 different restaurants and a casino. They also have a disco at night. (lots to do). Its location is great because you can walk down the street and go to some great ethnic restaurants which are reasonably priced. There also is a salt water pool, freshwater, and swim up bar. Also a very big hot tub! We met people from all over the world...a very diversified group, all very friendly. The lagoon is a protected one, which means they have shark nets so you don;t have to worry about that. We went in Nov of 03....the water temp was perfect in the lagoon and it was crystal clear. I really liked Puerto Rico, because there was lots to do. The only problem we had was check in. The hotel said that their system was down and no one could check in. They didn;t get this mess fixed until after 3:30. A very long time to wait to get settled especially with a 7am flight. We had been up since 4:30. If you have this problem be persistant, stay in the lobby area and wait....it turned out to be first come first serve...so the people who went to the bar with a free drink voucher they handed out...missed out once the rooms became available. Overall a great place....would go back again.....! Hope you find a wonderful place to stay and hope this review was helpful to you. If you have any questions, feel free to email me.

Reviews.Title: “Wyndham Condado is A, OK.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Wyndham for 5 nights during Easter week. We got a cheap rate from Priceline. I was a little worried after reading some negative reviews. I must say that we enjoyed our stay thoroughly. The room was spacious and faced the Atlantic. The workers were very friendly and helpful. The property was clean and beautiful. It's true that the beach is small but that is not Wyndham's fault. It is a public Condado beach. The pools were clean and nice. Even the casino was great! I don't understand why anyone would give this hotel a poor review. I would definitely return to the Wyndham Condado hotel and casino.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay with Children”
Reviews.Author: queenofeverything
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel after our cruise (04-04-04). It is close to the cruise ships and Old San Juan. A taxi fare is about $10.00 for 4 people to Old San Juan. The pools look just like the pictures shown and in great condition. This hotel was pleasantly nice and far better than what I thought or what I had read. The rooms were clean as was the bedding. They also double sheet the bed (top sheet, blanket, top sheet) which we usually request, and all were very clean. They have a great selection of places to eat, even for children. There is a wide variety of activities offered as well. The beach is actually a small inlet off of the ocean and is public. Again, this is good if you have children and don't want to worry about them in the surf, etc. Our son (11 yrs old) actually did a little snorkeling and enjoyed it. At the back of the hotel is a sea wall with the rocks in all. We ate breakfast outside on the patio with a beautiful view of the waves crashing into the rocks, palm trees, etc. It was very nice. They also have a casino which was very busy. The staff there are very pleasant and helpful. We had a situation where the bellman dropped a box of duty free liquor we had purchased on our cruise however besides being extremely apologetic, he and the manager drove all over town to replace the bottles that broke. They really made every attempt to correct the situation. I would recommend this hotel especially to families. We would enjoyed our short stay and would definetly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “We were happy with our stay here...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Condado for 4 nights, before going to Fajardo. The hotel room was pleasant, though a little dated. The room had 2 double beds, and huge walk-in closet. My daughter was sick for 2 days, and my son decided to sleep in the closet - and it was plenty big enough to do so. We had joined Wyndham By Request, so we were upgraded to an ocean-view room (beautiful view!) and given beer, water and cheese & crackers upon our arrival. The pools were beautiful, and not very crowded. No worry about getting a chair. Because I read the reviews here, I was not expecting much of a beach. The beach is small, but is actually nicer than I had anticipated. It is right next to the pool area, so you can go back and forth easily and without leaving the property. We did venture out into town to eat a few times, which I would recommend. Ropa Viejo was a nice restaurant with local flair. The mojitos here are the best we had on the islands. The ceviche was terrific too. Also, go the the restaurant next door El Wakkiki for breakfast. $5 for eggs, pancakes or huevos rancheros (with homemade guac & salsa!) and overlooks the ocean. The best meal we had here was at Ramiro's. It is pricey, but no more so than eating at the hotel. The food was FANTASTIC!! We are food/wine people, and are very picky. This restaurant was one of the best anywhere, and the service was terrific. Definitely worth the trip! As for food at the hotel, stay away from Max's, except maybe for lunch. The spanish restaurant was pretty good, we sat next to the fish tank and the food was decent. As far as trips go, don't do the tour of Old San Juan. You are better off just taking a cab into the city (about $10) and walking around. Great little shops, good restaurants & night life. The fort is great, and huge! If you go on the tour they only give you 1/2 hour to see the fort, which is not nearly enough. Overall, we really enjoyed our time in San Juan and the Wyndham Condado was a good choice for us.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel...just forget the beach part of it”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 5 night stay at the Condado Plaza. It sits at the entrance to the Condado area, so the beach that is there really should not even be mentioned, since it is public and small. To the hotel's credit, they really don't promote it and the concierge staff recommended better ones like Ocean Park and Isla Verde. So if you don't mind walking, cabbing, or driving a short distance, then there is no problem. Other than that, the hotel was fine. I find the constant crashing of the waves upon the rocks to be perpetual relaxation-but that's just me. The pool areas are good and the promenade area was roomy. Didn't eat there because hotel restaurants are not my thing and there are good places right near there like Ropa Vieja and Ramiro's. The area down at the Marriott has cool clubs like Moorings and it's a $10 cab ride to Old San Juan, which is terrific. Honestly, if being on the beach is the main thing, then try the Marriott or the hotels in Isla Verde. If not, the Wyndham is fine.

Reviews.Title: “Why so Overpriced”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: For $200 per night (non ocean front but oceanview web rate) this place was overpriced. The rooms were nice but ordinary and rather old. There is only access to a small pubic beach partially bordered by the road in and out of Dorado. And you can eat wonderful $6 breakfasts about a block away at two oceanoverlooking restaurants. Nice pool area however. The best thing about Puerto Rico is old san Juan. Great for photos.
